Reviews.Title: “Fun & great for the kids!”
Reviews.Author: plosage
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Old Faithful Club, which was well worth it. The continental breakfast and snacks were a hit! The staff was excellent; the accommodations were great. The lodge is close to the Magic Kingdom and there is boat service to and from, as well as tram service. The lobby is expansive and impressive. I can't imagine many kids not loving the resort. Make reservations as early as possible for wherever you plan to eat in Disney, including lodge restaurants, or you will be dealing with very early or very late dining times. The rooms were as expected. I didn't think the rooms dated; rather it reminded me of a lodge at a US National park. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay/very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kimberlygreiner
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to stay here in the last 7 years. Our stay was for 5 days in January 2012. Since my last stay 5 years ago, they use carpet freshener and cleaners with heavy scents in the rooms and I am allergic to heavy scents. The head household manager was kind enough to let me look at several rooms and find one that didn't have a heavy scent. They also used natural cleaners to clean the room during my stay. Room was clean and we had a nice view of the courtyard. Front desk was very helpful with a flower delivery I had- they even made sure the orchid bouquet stayed fresh in their refrigerator in the back room. Several Disney people with different jobs each day greeted us and some even remembered our name. Boat service was great. We always rent a car there- as it is easier to get around to every place other than the Magic Kingdom. I would not recommend the bus service- from MANY people I have spoken with over the years there at various hotels we have stayed. This is the only hotel we stay in that doesn't have the monorail service on property. The Wilderness Lodge offers many family friendly activities that my children love. This place is high recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ScottCarolina
Reviews.Content: This time around we stayed at a suite again, but this time did the Old Faithful Club. There is a limited selection of food for each part of the day - breakfast, lunch, snack, dinner, dessert, but we enjoyed the selection. The staff will always grab what you need if it is not present - juices, coke, beer, etc. We enjoyed the extras, and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous deluxe resort”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell39
Reviews.Content: We arrived back yesterday after a 5night stay at the Wilderness Lodge, before our trip i did a lot of research using tripadvisor, though we have stayed at many disney resorts this was our first time at the WL. I knew the location would be fab, but i was concerned about the dated rooms from resding the reeviews.However as we entered to checkin in all that went away, the lobby is just fantastic, talk about the WOW factor! On checking in we found we had been upgraded from our booked woods view room to a courtyard room, we had a great view of the pool and bay lake, which gave us a great view of the electrical parade that Disney does for the MK resorts. The noise from the pool during the day can be loud especially with the music from the daily pool parties for the kids. The rooms are a little tired, but ours was clean, with new thick white towels, beds were clean and comfy too. We timed the visit in a busy period with spring break so the wait times were long for rides, and now living in the Caribbean we found the evenings a bit chilly too. The pool area was nice, but busy and the pool not that large, so unlike Saratoga Springs where we stay each September, there wasnt really any quiet pools to escape the noise and crowds, though they do have another pool by the villas. There also seems to be a lot of visiitors from the Fort Wilderness coming over as the resorts are connected using the pools even though there are notices that the pool is for lodge guests only, though not sure if this is policed but it needs to be. The food was good at Roaring fork, the quick service restaurant and also we had breakfast at Whispering Canyon, which was good too, we would stay as this resort again for a week without hesitation though we have booked into Yacht Club for break in July, which we booked before leaving for te trip, we are looking to come back here at Christmas....

Reviews.Title: “A Great Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: Yoheadden
Reviews.Content: We researched this lodge online before we booked our vacation, but it didn't get us ready for the grand lobby. All we could say was wow! It makes you feel like you left Florida and were somewhere in the Pafic northwest. The restaraunts there were great and I would recomend them to someone who isn't even staying at the lodge. The only negative is that they give you too much food. They have beautiful lanterns along the outside walkways that are iluminated at night and they even glow as if they have candles in them. The attention to detail was also appreciated. Our bedposts had cute animals on them that looked as if they were carved out of wood. They have a guyser that goes off every hour. They even offer toasting marshmallows on the beach where they show Disney movies at night. We like to stay at different resorts on our trips to Disney, but this one is going to be hard to stay away from.

Reviews.Title: “Can I live here?”
Reviews.Author: rocketman2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Club Level at the Wilderness Lodge and it was perfect. No one in my family of five wanted to leave or had any complaints. Next time we stay here, we will not get park tickets at all so we can spend all our time at the Wilderness Lodge! Disney World may be the "happiest place on Earth" but Wilderness Lodge is the capital!

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck in deluxe resorts”
Reviews.Author: allhandsondecker
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best value of all the deluxe hotels on the WDW grounds. Of course, all the hotels on site are wonderful.....this one is reminiscent of the western US. You can look at the fireplace and see all the layers of stone just like at the grand canyon. Disney never disappoints!!! In my opinion this is the best bang for your buck if you want to stay at a deluxe resort but don't want to get hit that hard in the wallet. It's close to everything....in fact we just booked our 3rd stay there for next spring :)

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway at WDW”
Reviews.Author: TexasRonA
Reviews.Content: This place is phenomenal! If you're looking for something off the beaten path at WDW, this is the place to stay. Even though you're only minutes away from the Magic Kingdom, it feels like you're in a real Paciffic Northwest environment lodge. We had a room with a comfortable queen size bed, and bunk beds for our kids! The rooms were spacious and clean and housekeeping did a great job of keeping everything that way and refreshing our towels and soap everyday. The bathroom area made it easy for all four of us to get ready in the mornings with the shower and toilet area having a door, and two sinks in an area of their own. The balcony was nice, even if the view wasn't the best, but it did surprise us one night when we returned to our room just in time to see the fireworks at Magic Kingdom. Well, part of the fireworks. We could see a few of the higher launched bigger fireworks, but still it was a neat little bonus. Only one minor issue that I would advise for others staying here is in regards to transportation. Disney does a great job moving people across the WDW resort with their busses, monorails and boats. However, this resort, because of its location, can make travel times to the parks a little longer than others. We never waited for a bus or boat, more than 15 minutes, but one of the busses we were on made multiple other stops before our final destination which added time to the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: daffodilbloom
Reviews.Content: I planned our trip for months and months, as this was our children's first trip to Disney. I read many reviews of the Lodge and will concede that the rooms are a bit dark. But, does anyone stay in their room at Disney except to sleep? I thought the Lodge was fabulous. I am a very picky traveler...love my high thread count sheets at home and my little luxuries and really enjoyed my stay. We slept wonderfully and the Lodge offers a lovely and relaxing respite from the crazy, long days of walking through the parks. The food was quite good, even Roaring Forks, the quick service dining option offers healthy options for meals, which you do not see too often throughout the parks. I would definitely book the Lodge again, as the service was wonderful. A bit of kindness and thanks goes a long way with the staff. I always tip our housekeeping while traveling, and we arrived each day to find fun towel animals. They really do go above and beyond with the servicing of the rooms. the Lodge is so tastefully done, and really is a different feel from the other hotels in the park. We enjoyed a meal at the Grand Floridian, and it is a lovely property, but I might still choose the Lodge, as it is just so restful and lovely. It all comes down to personal taste, but for one who is choosy and somewhat hard to please, I was thrilled with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: rogersowerby
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to have enjoyed this place with our son and his children. The magic is best enjoyed with little ones. The hotel was beautifully decorated, the rooms were small but perfect and the restaurants were great.My family loved it so much that they purchased membership in the vacation club.We looforward to many more cacations there

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: buckeye627
Reviews.Content: Arrived Sunday, Mar. 4 with my wife, daughter and her friend, both 18 at 10am and met right away by bell services who unloaded the car and took the cart inside while I parked car. When I got inside my wife was standing there with our check in package and room keys! It does help to do on line check in as they have everything ready. We had reserved standard view room and when we opened door we were pleasantly surprised to have a courtyard view. The room was big enough for the 4 of us and you really don't spend a lot of time in the room anyway. The pool area is very nice with plenty of seating. Service everywhere was first class and everyone always had a smile. On our last evening our daughter got sick and I took her to the urgent care the morning of our last day and my wife went to front desk to explain and see what to do with luggage when we had to check out and Heather at front desk extended check out for us till 1 so we could get back from urgent care and get ready to head home. We were very appreciative of the caring and service we received during our stay. Also our room was 5031 and when you leave the room the elevators were right there and took you just outside Roaring Forks and the pool area, which was very nice to be that close. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with our choice.”
Reviews.Author: Jenbrain
Reviews.Content: This review is skewed by the fact that we were stunningly given a complimentary upgrade to the presidential suite - Yellowstone suite. And it's the nicest place this family has ever called a temporary home. It included club privileges which was basically free snacks and very lite meals all day. We loved the location in the park. We ate at the whispering canyon cafe twice for dinner and it was very fun - particularly if you have younger kids...with "pony races" around the room and raucous service. My son loved the water slide. The only downsides: really, really substandard TV stations. And for parents with young kids with time in the room in the evenings - it was really grim. Also the wifi is incredibly weak. So surfing wasn't an option either. Sigh. I guess we got some reading done. But boat service to the magic kingdom was great and the kids got a kick out of the evening light parade on the lake. It's themed but not overly so -- you do get a bit of a break from the mouse.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in Disneyworld”
Reviews.Author: joandore
Reviews.Content: Went to WDW with my husband, daughter, son-in-law and two grandkids 7 and 4. We asked for and received two connecting rooms which was fabulous. Both had small fridge which was helpful. I thought the self service restaurant was really good( Roaring Fork). The salads and sandwiches were so yummy. Liked the boat ride to MK. Pool and pool activities were fun - hotel grounds were really pretty and the lobby looked just like Old Faithful Lodge in Yellowstone. They have a lot of activities at the hotel like a parade at night and crafts in the afternoon. I really enjoyed this hotel - of course this is Disney so you pay a lot of money and you aren't going to get luxury but the grandkids could care less and that is why we go. By the way -another highlight was the pirates league make up session

Reviews.Title: “Trip was great”
Reviews.Author: butsey
Reviews.Content: Went to meet daughter husband and the love of my life my grandson they were already there so I was greeted with a yell across the Huge lobby and a great big hug from my grandson. The hotel was top notch great service and the beds were so comfortable, we were close to the Magic Kingdom and visited as much as we could in the days we were there. I loved all the restaurants we visited and could not get over how clean everything was. The family has grown now and they are getting ready for another visit this year so if you are thinking of Disney World I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Magic? Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dale J
Reviews.Content: Before selecting the Wilderness Lodge, I did alot of research into this and other Disney Properties. Since this would be our first trip to Disneyworld, I wanted to ensure that we received the same magical experiences that we receive at California's Disneyland Properties. From the moment we arrived, we were met by a less than enthusiastic staff from the bell hop to the front counter person named "Jenna". It seemed that the staff were tired and did not want to be there. Even though there was only one person ahead of me when I checked in, I waited over 20 minutes before I was able to be waved over to start the check in process. This was bothersome because I saw a half dozen "Cast Members" standing around not doing anything. Because I'm so use to the magic and attentiveness of California Disneyland, my expectations were for Disneyworld to be the same if not higher. In addition to the poor reception and first impressions, our room was dirty, with potato chips found on the floor, an iron not put away, a defective ironing board were just some of the issues with our $400 a night "upgraded" room. The walls to the room were so thin, we could hear everything our neighbors were doing. Some of the reviews of the Wilderness noted the rooms were dated. After having been there for a week, I entirely concur. The magic simply was not felt nor did we ever feel it staying at the Wilderness Lodge. With that, our first trip to Disneyworld proved to be memorable but in a negative sense. In my opinion, it appears at least with respect to the Wilderness Lodge, the business and customer service culture is a stark contrast to the better managed and well run Disneyland hotels in California. I will, however, end on a good note. The transportation system throughout Disneyworld and the other attractions was effiicient. I've never written a review before but I felt so compelled and disappointed with our vacation at the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: TonyQ
Reviews.Content: The Disney Wilderness Lodge Hotel is located on Bay Lake, which it shares with the Contemporary Resort and Fort Wilderness Resort. It is a 10 minute or so boat ride from the entrance to Magic Kingdom. The hotel has a western wilderness theme and is built around a 7 storey wooden atrium which has Reception, Mercantile Centre and the Whispering Canyon Cafe, and leads onto the outdoor pools. Rooms overlook the grounds including Bay Lake, the pools and woodland; they are standard rectangular rooms â€“ one side has wardrobe space and refrigerator, a chest of drawers with large screen TV, table and 2 chairs; the other side has the bathroom/shower and toilet, a separate sink section and 2 Queen sized beds. The rooms are also very much wood in appearance and had a tendency to be dark, but a small balcony is available. There were no additional comfortable lounge chairs, and the sink taps were not easily accessed under the shelf; however free wi-fi access is provided. Given that this is a Disney Hotel, the rooms are not designed to spend too much time in. Reception and Concierge service were prompt and efficient; the Whispering Canyon Cafe is worth trying out for its service style and quality of food; the Roaring Fork offered quick service and snacks (related to the Disney Dining Plan) but essentially the same fare each day, and there is a limit to the number of breakfast platters of egg, bacon, potato, biscuit and cold pancakes that you can endure. Good link to the Magic Kingdom by boat, and by WDW transportation to the other parks; buses were quite regular and we never waited more than 10-15 minutes either at the Hotel or a Park to get on a bus. Overall, worth staying there if the Magic Kingdom is your main focus.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: TallTaste
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the WL for over ten years and have yet to have a bad experience. Everything about this resort is excellent, from the restaurants to the pool area. It is a great place for adults to enjoy some Disney magic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Danielle L
Reviews.Content: We are so glad we decided to stay at the Disney Resorts and chose the Wilderness Lodge. The room was beautiful and well maintained as well as the grounds. We had breakfast one morning at the Whispering Canyon restaurant which was really good and fun. Most days we just grabbed food from the Roaring Forks which was quick and convenient. The transportation to and from the parks was nice and the wait wasn't too long for the boats or buses.

Reviews.Title: “Like visiting the North West Regions”
Reviews.Author: Lauri K
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the conceirge level of the Wilderness Lodge Resort. The Disney Magical Express quickly picked me up at Orlando Airport and within an half an hour, I was at my resort. This was my first time staying at a Disney location and did not know what to expect. I was greeted by several cast members of the Wilderness Lodge as soon as I got off the bus who took me directly into the lobby. The friendly lady, showed me the lobby and various areas that I may be interested in during my stay...at that point, she took me up to the 7th floor (conceirge level) of the resort. I met up with a great guy name, Mike, who told me "that the only thing I have to worry about is going to the parks and everything else will be taken care of." Mike showed me the comp area for the guests and then showed me certain areas around the 7th floor that I may be interested...then, he allowed me to do an early check-in...mind you my flight came in at 9am and check-in is 3pm...He graciously said that a room was ready for me and I was able to check in early...wow what a treat to be able to settle in early! The room (7108) was beautiful...top floor...small...enough for two adults and two small children... it peared over the Wilderness Lodge Villas and the woodlands ...What I truly loved was to be able to leave my patio door open all night long as we slept to get the fresh air of the great night...very quiet and peaceful. The boats were not available on the night we wanted to visit the Magic Kingdom because of the weather; however, on the last day, I was able to take a quiet boat ride by myself and enjoy the relaxing tranqulity of the lake around me. I would say the last day was my favorite because it actually reminded me that I was in New England at a ski lodge...I know this is not supposed to represent New England...however; after my friends left to travel back home and I was waiting for the Magical Express to pick me up... I walked around the property alone. It was a cold (Florida standards 60 degrees) light mist rain and very cloudy...I actually looked out my patio and saw a woodpecker making all that noise...(I thought it was fake, because of the Disney effects,) but this was real. I decided to take a walk since I had some time to kill before the transportation to the airport. I walked along the pool area, the rising guyser and the beautiful streams... the mist of the chilling rain and the rising smoke coming from the chimney of the Tarpoon Bar made it all so special. No one was around and it seemed like I had the whole place to myself.... ...very nice white sand beach, hot tubs to relax after the long walk around the theme park and shopping...and moreover; the Artist Point restaurant is fantastic...we has the oyster cerviche appertizer and the salmon and veal chop as an entree...wonderful and melt in your mouth!!! In essence, my other conceirge was Kevin (who had a great sense of humor) and was excellent with providing top notch service, while we were there, made our weekend vacation fantastic! . The Wildneress Lodge is an overall beautiful entity to stay...I recommend the conceirge level on the 7th floor...because the service is outstanding...and the overall stay, will hopefully make many memories for many more people to visit this outstanding resort. I hope this helps with the many decisions you may have to make regarding the Disney Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: chittyjc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the wilderness lodge to find a dirty room-dirty towels and hair in the bathroom (no cute towel animals as pictured). we were told to move to a new room with no luggage assistance or compensation for our trouble. The rooms are small and outdated. Our shower nor our coffee maker worked properly. On a positive note, loved the family activities and the friendly pool and recreation staff. For a deluxe resort, it does not measure up!

Reviews.Title: “Travelagent Review!”
Reviews.Author: Mia0722
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge February 2012. Driving up the Lodge is similar to driving up to a majestic lodge out West! It is impressive, for us, even more impressive than The Grand Floridian. But, this is our style, rustic. The welcome as we drove up, and each time we returned in the evening was, "Welcome Home!" The lobby, exquisitely crafted, and the detail to a true lodge, including a great fireplace! The public areas, the pool area, the lake setting, and pier out to the ferry, just fantastic! Loved the Cafe for breakfast, and late dinner, food was delicious, and great healthy choices... The staff and service, all get top rating! The rooms, basic, a place to sleep, nothing luxurious or special, bedding and linens, again, basic. My recommendation, as a traveler, as travel agent, if you are not going to use the facilities, and don't need the fantastic setting, stay at a moderate property, the rooms are about the same! But, if you are planning on relaxing part of the time (which I recommend if you have a week - we only had 3 days), stay here, it is a great place to spend your leisurely time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The NO help Disney front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Steven H
Reviews.Content: Sitting in the main lobby my daughter left her school homework on a table while she ran to the store off the lobby. A cleaning person picked it up while cleaning. We asked the front desk staff if they could help us locate the cleaning person. They said there was no way of knowing who it was, and made no attempt to call that dept manager and possibly help find that person. My daughter had of been working on that homework for some time and is now quite upset about not having her homework for her teacher. Not what you would call the famed Disney expereince.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing wilderness escape after a fun filled day!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelli S
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to stay at The Wilderness lodge!!! Being lake home owners this is right up our alley!!! Yes the guest rooms are small but very nice! This is an excellent hotel for a family with small children because you are a boat ride away form the Magic Kingdom where you will spend most of your time. The resort itself is very clean and the service is top notch!!! We had bending very close to our room. The quick serve restaurant was very good and both table service restaurants were good as well!!! We love the rustic feel of the lodge!! It was very neat to see people just lounging in the lobby daily by the massive fire place the pool was heated so you can swim year round!!!!! We had a standard view room & to our surprise we could view the entire firework show at the Magic Kingdom from our window the one night we were in early!!! A GREAT SURPRISE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Guest rooms small...maybe too small for families with kids over ten?”
Reviews.Author: twryan72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for three nights in February 2012. The resort is very nice and clean. The boat ride to Magic Kingdom is a great perk. Nice pool area. Very relaxing. I would stay again. However, the guest rooms are very small. Much smaller than an average Holiday Inn-type room. It was fine for my family because our kids are small (five and eight years old), but I think if they were older I would pick somewhere else. Way too small for parents with teenagers. You'd be stepping on top of each other.

Reviews.Title: “Such a serene and beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: revival75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge in late January 2012. It is a quiet time of year and we were fortunate enough to receive an unsolicited upgrade to a room overlooking the pool, geyser and bay. It was such a beautiful view and really added to our stay. We got to see the electrical water pageant at night and had the soothing sound of the outdoor spring during the evening. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was so helpful. The lobby is breathtaking. Transportation to the parks is very convenient. The health club is a nice addition. The snack bar is convenient and has great oatmeal in the morning! I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: seano21401
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to the Magic Kingdom, this is a fantastic place to stay. We went in blindly choosing this resort and we were pleasantly surprised. It is a short boat ride to the Kingdom. A bit further from Epcot, Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios. They have a nice cafe for a quick breakfast and even a store to buy beer (at a handsome price). Rooms come with a fridge (to store your beer). The thing that amazed me...it was quiet. You walk into the hotel and see a giant atrium. I thought this place is going to be loud...and boy was I wrong - didn't hear a sound. Nice pool for the kids and there was a bar with a TV near it - so the kids swam and I watched the big game. The staff was super friendly and helpful, too. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: goody2shoes
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at The Wilderness Lodge for two nights, January 30 and 31, 2012. We had dined at Whispering Canyon before and knew we wanted to stay here someday, so when this trip came up we decided to splurge and stay here. (We usually stay at the moderates and had just had a great stay at Caribbean Beach- We also have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside, French Quarter, The Polynesian and POP) I am surprised to say that Wilderness Lodge has been my favortie!! I had really high expectations, and it was even better than I thought it would be. Here is what I liked: I liked when we stepped out of magical Express we were greeted and escorted to the check in. We asked for a Woods view room and received it... before check in time! Our room had a view of the castle! I loved the balcony and overlooking the pond and all the trees. It was quiet, and relaxing. The Pool - It was plenty big that you never felt on top of eachother. I loved the double jacuzzi's in the pool area and the pool facing the lagoon and also the lodge- the brook that went into the pool. Agh, I can't expalin or say enough about it. So nice! The waterslide was perfect for my boys ages 4 and 7! I loved the boat to Contemporary and Magic Kingdom. What a way to feel relaxed after a day in the Magic Kingdom!! Or going to dinner at the Contemporary and getting there by boat- so nice! The atmosphere of this hotel was so comfortable- relaxing- romantic- peaceful. I just loved it. I loved the big porch with the teak chairs overlooking the courtyard. I loved the walk way to the boat. The fireplace in the lobby with the rocking chairs. The rockers in front of the brook that goes outside.... AMAZING place! I loved sitting in the jacuzzi and hearing the music from the Electric Water Pageant and going out to the beach to watch it with my boys.... I love the look of Artist Point and want to try it on my next trip! I loved the dimmer switch on the lights in the room- it was great as a nightlight and made my kids feel very comfortable in a strange hotel room! I LOVED that we didnt need to walk outside to get our morning coffee! Having everything in one building/lodge was really nice! The only thing I can even think of as a negative is the size of Roaring Fork - the counter service and its limited selections. When we go we usually love to eat at all the resorts and have the deluxe dining plan so it wasn't an issue for us at all. If you had the quick service plan and planned on eating most of your meals there, then I could see how some would not like that! We will be going back to The Wilderness Lodge. In fact, next year we will be celebrating our 10th anniversary and will be in Disney for a week and had planned to try out Beach Club but we decided that Wilderness Lodge is where we want to spend our 10th Anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “quaint, cozy and rustic. wilderness lodge is one of disney's best!”
Reviews.Author: genevieve1976
Reviews.Content: This was me and my wife's first time staying at the Wilderness Lodge and it will be quite difficult to stay anywhere else on subsequent visits to WDW. We had a 4 night stay coinciding with Marathon weekend and we were seeking a relaxed, luxurious atmosphere.The grand lobby is beautiful and sets the tone for the rest of your stay at the WL. Check in process was easy, our room as available much earlier than we expected. Amenities were charming and rustic but modern. Flat screen tv, a mini fridge and in-room coffee makers were welcome additions. We had room 5238 with a woods view and it made for a lovely, relaxing view. The pool area was wonderful- at once bustling with children playing and music throughout the area but also relaxing due to the layout, proximity to the lake, hidden nooks and wooded surroundings. We had an outstanding meal at Artist Point and great cocktails at both the Territory Lounge and poolside Trout Pass bar. Quick service meals at Roaring Forks were above average - especially their fresh salads. Staff everywhere on property were personable and easygoing. Transportation was a breeze, the boat to the Magic Kingdom got us there in 10 minutes, an absolute delight. Make sure to grab a blanket and sit on the beach to catch a glimpse of Wishes as well as the classic Elecrtical Water Pageant nightly. We also rented a sea raycer and had a great, albeit short time on Bay Lake. I am a Disney veteran, having visisted WDW more than a dozen times and this is one of the Disney greats - casual resort elegance, minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Main Street USA.

Reviews.Title: “" ENJOYED OUR STAY AT WILDERNESS LODGE"”
Reviews.Author: Frank R
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the lodge. We really enjoyed the pool side bar. The bartender "Kendra" was great. She helped point us to all the good attractions and was just so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay at Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Sandra Z
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd year visiting Disney World..This is by far our favorite hotel. The setting was beautiful and peaceful. The staff asked us several times how we were enjoying our stay and seeing if there was anything we needed. Our room was clean and extremely comfortable. The pool area was very pretty and clean. We took the tour explaining the construction of the Lodge and loved hearing all the details.My daughter was fascinated by all the native american Indian artifacts and took several photos to show friends at home. The restaurant was wonderful and pricing was no different than the other Disney restaurants on property. Disney is not cheap and visitors should know this when they visit. Loved the convenience of the boat ride to get back and forth from the Magic Kingdom. We also loved coming back to cute towel animals everyday !! Will definitely stay at Wilderness Lodge on our return visits..Thanks Disney !

Reviews.Title: “I wanna live here!”
Reviews.Author: lizzyshakuntala
Reviews.Content: Although the Wilderness Lodge had been our first choice of all the Walt Disney World resorts, all the complains and bad reviews about the poor transport going to/from the Wilderness Lodge had us hesitant to book our stay there... but we thought what the heck and went on with our initial decision to book a room. I'm so glad we went along with it because the 5 days we were there we never encountered any poor transport service going to/from the resort! Not even once! Love the lush landscaping and the gorgeous theme executed here! We got a courtyard room with a beautiful view of the lake and the Villas' courtyard with a free dining plan! Loved the package! The Wilderness Lodge is definitely 1 of my 2 favorite Disney resorts, the other one being Port Orleans Riverside. Can't wait to take my kids here!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs better service for a deluxe resort”
Reviews.Author: bbertstan
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from Jan 21st to Jan 26th 2012. The Lodge is very nice with lots of fun things to do. Our children really liked the water parade, beach and pools. The crew at quick service dinning were quick and friendly. The service at Wispering Canyon Cafe was far below average, with 13 min wait after seating to have drink order taken, to lax service after food was delivered to table. A call to Canyon Cafe manager brought no response. The trips to Disney Parks and Downtown Disney were done trough boat and bus, this time of year were, quick and not over crouded. Check in was quick and friendly. Housekeeping was bad. We found candy wrappers,hairs,and plastic wrap in the bed our first night. NO BEDBUGS. There was also an oder like a locker room. they came out remade the beds and shampooed the carpet the next day. The house keeping left our door proped open with the security bar on another day. We came back to a open door and hoped our belongings were still ours. A call to house keeping brought out a manager that came into the room said "looks like averything good" we never heard from him again. This is a Disney Deluxe Resort not a Motel 6 I really expected better service from housekeeping and managment. We were given a 150.00 credit. That spends like water in Disney, but it was something.

Reviews.Title: “Great feel, average room, poor location”
Reviews.Author: btravels20
Reviews.Content: This hotel does a good job of transporting you to the mountains. Everything from the lobby to the grounds makes you feel isolated in the woods. However the access to the other parks makes you feel isolated from the rest of Disney. Boat transportation to the Magic Kingdom, The Contemporary Hotel and the Fort Wilderness Campground, is very good. But if you try to go anywhere else, budget an hour at least to get where you are going. Disney fails at bus transportation form the Wilderness Lodge. If the Magic kingdom is your only destination this hotel is great, but if not, stay at another place. The price is worth it if it comes in a Disney Parks package, but don't pay otu of pocket to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Average.... Unless you like fake logs....”
Reviews.Author: Stephen J
Reviews.Content: Apart from the fabulous little boat trip over to the Magic Kingdom, the Wilderness Lodge is not the best located of the Disney properties. The free transport to the other parks can take forever to arrive and it takes ages to get to the Parks. Every thing is big in the Lodge, apart from the rooms, which feel about half the size of other disney resorts. The huge entry lobby is well, huge, and little else. The family restaurant in the hotel is vastly overpriced. More than usual for Disney. The hotel staff know their stuff, but are the least personable of any disney property I have stayed in. The pool is busy, and fun, but looked like it needed a good clean out when we were there. If you like small log cabins, and logs in general, you may love it here. I will not be going back, as there are so many better disney properties for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay at the Wilderness Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: woodchucker
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and it is a favorite. The lobby is very impressive, the staff go out of their way to help you in any way they can. For the first time (this was our fourth stay here) we were initially given a room that we did not like at all... at the absolute end of one of the wings of the Lodge, in a room that was theoretically facing the lake but was on the first floor and was surrounded by vegetation such that not only was there no view at all, but very little light from the outside was visible (so the room was super dark). Very disappointing, but a trip back to the front desk ended with us getting a great room at the very end of the other wing but on the fourth floor so that we had a fantastic view of the lake. Roaring Forks has some nice breakfast options (even some relatively healthy ones!); it was nice to take our breakfasts outside and eat by the pool with the friendly (or should I say hungry?) ducks. We loved being able to take the boat to the Magic Kingdom, it's the most fun way to get there. Never had to wait too long for it, either. All in all, another great stay!

Reviews.Title: “My personal favorite”
Reviews.Author: emmi58
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the lodge for 3 nights this past week. While the weather was perfect, so was the lodge. The employees are so cheerful and the atmosphere so true to the north woods. I never stop loving a stay here. The rooms are on the small side and expensive, but they are clean and only a small part of a much larger themed concept experience. This week was split between a beautiful 2 bed condo/resort and here and i must say I prefer the electricity and energy on Disney properties. MG

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but don't expect 'Deluxe'.”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoHueb
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge is perhaps the most affordable Deluxe Resort in the WDW complex. If you forget the denomination Deluxe and don't create high expectations about this hotel, I'm sure you'll love it. Rooms are cozy, with a small balcony, from which I was even able to watch the fireworks ate Magic Kingdom. (It was a woods view room). Bathrooms are tiny. A nice surprise was to find out that the hotel now offers free internet to guests. Location is great. Quick boat ride from the MK and with easy bus transportation to other parks. It is situated in a very secluded spot in Bay Lake with creates a certain feeling of intimacy. I really enjoyed my stay at the Wilderness Lodge, but, once again, do not expect any Deluxe service or amenities if you are used to real 5 star comfort. Get into the Disney spirit (including being overcharged for everything), and have fun! :)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation close to the action of Disney”
Reviews.Author: fortitudeX4
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying "on property" at Disney World and were we pleased with our choice. The resort was decorated for the holidays with a magnificent tree in the centre of the lobby. As a note...we were at the Wilderness Lodge over the New Year and the decorations came down overnight on the 3rd/4th of January. I'm glad we were there to see all the decorations...they were magnificent both inside and out. The lodge is not too large and there are many public areas that are intimate and relaxing. The pool area - both at the main lodge and at the villas were lovely and restful. Guests of the lodge and villas may utilize all facilities. The beach area was nice although you cannot go into the water. The boat rentals were fun to use...my son went out on a Sea Racer (he is 12) and the rest of us went out on a Boston Whaler. It was a lot of fun. We didn't have time to take out the bikes - but if we stay here again...we would definitely do that to take advantage of the trail system. As we do enjoy making some of our own meals, as a family, we would probably prefer to stay in the Villas. More space and kitchen facilities - but nicely connected to the Lodge by a covered walkway. Access to both the boat transportation and buses to other resorts and parks was quick and easy. The bus transportation tended to stop at the Grand Floridian en route to wherever we were going - so we didn't experience a lot of delays. I would say our longest trip was from the Lodge to Downtown Disney. We loved taking the boat over the Magic Kingdom...except on the really chilly mornings! We took advantage of the Magic Express from the airport and it was seamless. We checked in our baggage all the way through to the resort. We requested an early check-in that was accommodated (we had an early a.m. arrival - 10:30 a.m.) and when we checked in at the resort - around 11:30, we were able to drop off our carry on items in our room, then headed over to the Grand Floridian for lunch. When we returned, our checked bags were in our room. What fantastic service! The return trip to the airport was just as well managed as we dropped our bags off with the porter at the Lodge, and picked them up at our home airport upon our arrival. Disney does it right! What a great trip and we looked forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Terrible bus service!!”
Reviews.Author: aawfamily
Reviews.Content: We love the Wilderness Lodge but the bus service is terrible!! We have visited Disney World for the last 7 years staying @ Pop Century (1) Caribbean (2) Polynesian (1) & Wilderness Lodge the last three years. Unfortunately, the bus service @ the Lodge, a deluxe hotel, was the worse & did not improve year to year. Our last stay was the most frustrating as far as transportation goes! We spent 10 days @ the Lodge & waited daily for over 35 minutes for parks. I will share two of the longest waits. The first was the biggest dissappointment because it was to the MK. We waited for 38 minutes for a bus to the MK.....a 2 minute bus ride!! Why?? Even with the stop to GF it should never take 38 minutes. We, along with another family, complained to the WL & the bus showed up about 5 minutes later. This was not an isolated experience but instead a daily occurrence. The MK bus was never less then 20 minutes & again the bus ride takes 2 minutes. They also have a boat ride to the MK but often we started our day before the first boat was due to arrive. Second, was the bus to Typnoon Lagoon. Allow @ least an hour for this trip both ways. The problem with this bus is it goes to the GF, Fort Wilderness, Downtown Disney & then to Typhoon Lagoon. You add all that to a 30 minute wait for the bus & it's not a magical start to your day!! We love the beauty of the WL & of course the convenience but they need to really improve the bus service! Although we love staying on property we are thinking of staying off property @ the Hilton & driving to the parks to save time & frustration! We would be giving up the experience but we stay & pay for the deluxe for convenience. You take that away & we can get a better overall resort off property without the frustration of loosing hours waiting for a bus!! It's not fun to start or finish the day waiting waiting waiting!! I hope they improve but after three years I don't have much faith! If you choose the WL be prepared for long bus waits to each park & know going in that this is a problem. Allow an extra hour each way & hope for the best!!

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Disney Resort :)”
Reviews.Author: DisneyGirlUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge with my boyfriend for Halloween in Oct 2011. We had been here once before and decided to come back because of it's cosy feel and short distance from the magic kingdom. When we arrived from UK we had a few problems at check-in because our travel company had not applied our tickets and dining plan to our reservations. The staff at the Wilderness Lodge could not have been more helpful. Because of the time difference they would not be able to correct the mistake till the next day and said they would do this first thing tomorrow and said we should charge any food to our card and they would take it off our dining plan the next day. They even sent the manager, Benett to reassure us that everything would be sorted and he was extremely helpful and friendly as were all the staff. Sure enough when I went to the lobby at 8am the next morning everything was sorted and our dining plan sorted, I was very impressed. Our room was cleaned every day to a high standard and despite being a adult couple I still loved coming back to a new towel animal in our room. The roaring fork was great, and we were allowed to get food and bring it back to our room. However, after 10 days we did a bit bored of burgers and chicken nuggets but still great for a quick bite. The pool was very quiet during our stay and I loved relaxing in the hot tub and having fun in the pool. Being an adult couple we didn't get involved in the children's party by the pool but it looked like fun. The only comment on the pool is that it didn't seem overly clean first time we went in, however we put this down to it being an outside pool and leaves would envitably sneak in and it was the late afternoon. But when we went in the next morning it was still filled with leaves or dirt which kind of put me off. It did get better through the stay though. We had no problems with transportation as the buses were always only 10mins wait. However, we begun to find that the bus to the Magic Kingdom was faster than the boat because it was less busy but not as nice as sailing across the lake. Overall, I love this resort and the staff are so amazing. Love the lodge feel and sitting by the fire in the evening and reviewing our photos and videos from the day. I recommend this resort to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: poppingupdaisies
Reviews.Content: The kids and I loved staying this year and I have rebooked another trip. I love this place, and if u can do the club level, do it. Very nice, the extras are appreciated

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby, okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: MegBlue
Reviews.Content: Visited in Nov, 2011. The lobby and theming of this hotel is impeccable. We did not get the opportunity to dine at Whispering Canyon. It was convenient to have roaring forks on site, though we were not overly impressed with the food or dining area. The pool is nice, though not too big and the waterslide was not available when we were swimming. My boys loved exploring the immense lobby and tracking the animals paw prints. The rooms were nothing great, standard motel fare ... in terms of cleanliness it appeared okay to us, except for one long black hair (not ours!) which was on the shower wall for 2 days. The best part about this hotel is getting to see the electric pagent at night (be warned, its a bit loud) and the boat to the magic kingdom. It was so great to take that boat back from the magic kingdom while hundreds of people waited for buses / monorail. Transportation to the other parks was okay, generally under 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel the photos on the websites dont give it justice”
Reviews.Author: lizzie_chitty
Reviews.Content: I visited Disney's Wilderness Lodge in August/September 2011 and it was amazing. At first looking at the pictures online I wasn't too sure at first. The main reason i had my doubts was the fact at dinner they have games for the kids and if you dont join in it was said they get funny with you. Well that is not the case at all!! As i went with my two sisters and my brother in-law ages 26-33 they didnt place within the games therefore not having kids round us running around like mad and the staff were brilliant still getting you involved but not with the kids which was great. The whispering cannon restaurant is amazing the staff are soo funny and you have to take their mannerism with a pinch of salt as its whole part of the act. The food there is mouth watering and the buffet for breakfast is a must try and they bring the buffett to you so if your funny about sharing food with strangers you dont have to worry at all as they cook to order. The rooms were comfortable and access to all the parks are excellent as you only have to share a bus with the grand floridan so you dont have loads of bus stops before you get to your hotel. if your coming from the UK the dinning plan is a HUGE MUST. Its value for money is excellent at first its a bit confusing on what you can have etc but once you get the hang of it the amount of food you get is excellent. But BOOK the table in UK online before you go out there as everyone on a dining plan books ahead and therefore getting a table can be hard. One thing i must say that everyone if they can do it you must its excellent. You MUST have a meal at the grand floridan "Narcoossee's" restaurant during the Magic Kingdoms Firework display is really good as you get to see everything and have a fantastic meal at the same time. I had an amazing time and the hotel is highly recommended and I will definatley be going again 100%

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service makes for a great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Savanna M
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here at the end of August 2011. It was myself, my husband and our 3 year old daughter. My first time returning in about 10 years and first time for them! We had originally book the Coronado Springs but decided to switch hotels about a month before going. We booked everything through Disney, flight, food, tickets and transportation to and from airport. When we arrived at Orlando International, we found the Disney transportation center very easily and had to wait about 5 minutes until we were able to get our seats on the bus. The bags were automatically sent to the hotel (which was nice). We were the 1st to get to our hotel (seeing as there were only 2 other families on the bus) we walked into the lobby and began our check in process when the bus driver came running up to us with our stroller which we had forgotten in the undercarriage. So nice of him!! The staff at the desk were extremely helpful, we were originally given a room on the 6th floor but my husband had recently hurt his back so we asked for a ground level room and they upgraded us to a woods view at no charge! The room was right near the boat dock and a short walk to the quick service restaurant and the pool. The boat transportation was the best! I loved not having to wait very long and enjoying the relaxing ride being able to look at the other hotels you pass on the way! We always timed out the boat ride making sure not to leave right after the fireworks finished or right when the park was about to open. I would like to say on a personal note we encountered a very nice cast member named Olga working at the pin shop. She was the nicest lady! We decided to get our first pins and lanyard from her and she even gave us a few pins of her own! I won't forget the wonderful service we encountered while we were there! We will definitely be making a trip back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: thebellcaptain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Wilderness Lodge from December 3rd through the 17th. Great time to stay, as the Christmas celebrations around Disney World are in full swing, but without the tremendous crowds. We had booked the hotel in January of 2011, in order to lock in a good price and to guarantee our room. We completed on-line check-in ten days before we arrived, which made check-in a breeze. The cast members working the front desk were extremely pleasant, and answered all of our questions regarding transportation and room availability (we arrived at the Lodge at 7AM, well ahead of the 4PM check-in time). We were assigned a room on the fifth floor, overlooking the swimming pool by the Villas. I would recommend the fourth or fifth floors in either of the wings, as the sounds from the lobby and the Whispering Canyon Cafe will not carry that far. Food at the Roaring Fork, which is their quick service restaurant, was very good. Breakfast platters were always tasty. Hamburgers were pretty good. I wouldn't recommend the pizza, as they were just so-so. Service was excellent. Room service is very expensive, but the delivery and presentation was fantastic - food was still hot, and the ice cream was still frozen. We ate at Artist Point, which has fork-tender Filet Mignon and excellent Bison steaks. The drinks are not watered down, and with a full-service bar they can mix any drink you desire. Artist Point is very expensive, and I wouldn't recommend it for families with small children, but I highly recommend it for couples looking for a romantic evening. Housekeeping was fantastic! Mimi, our housekeeper, always kept our room neat and tidy. On our second day onward, we would always leave a note listing what we needed restocked, be it soap or toilet paper, plus a couple of dollars as a way of saying thank you for all the hard work. Every day we came "home" from the parks to find a different kind of towel animal, plus little chocolates, plus all the toiletries restocked in a nice and neat fashion. The few times we ran into Mimi in the halls, we always thanked her for all her hard work. I cannot stress enough how far a little kindness and a few dollars can go to ensure a clean room with little special surprises like the towel animals. We tried out the pool. Cold, but not too cold. Because it was a relatively quiet time in the resort, there were only a handful of other people in the pool, which made it very pleasant. The hot tubs were oh so nice! Warm without being hot, and they offer a great view of the artificial geyser the hotel has, which goes off every hour on the hour during the day. Boat transportation to the Magic Kingdom, Fort Wilderness, and the Contemporary Resort were pleasant and quick, with boats arriving every ten minutes or so. Bus transportation, on the other hand, does leave a lot to be desired. I agree with other reviewers in this regard - you often have to wait 30 minutes or more for the bus to arrive, and then have to travel to other resort hotels to pick up other passengers before finally arriving at your destination. Plan accordingly! The Christmas decorations were gorgeous, as well as subtle. You had to get up close to the main tree to really see the detail of the ornaments, which reflect the hotel's theme of a National Park Lodge. If you have the time, I would recommend the free guided tour of the hotel that is offered at 9AM from Wednesday through Sunday. Ask for Ranger Jack; he's very knowledgeable about the construction of the hotel, as well as the hotels that the Wilderness Lodge is based on. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Disney World, but be prepared: it is quite expensive - but well worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation !”
Reviews.Author: Shanzylee
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first week of the New Year. Every thing was perfect. The lobby is huge and inviting. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The boat ride to magic kingdom was so convenient. We had a courtyard room on the 5th floor. It was not overly huge but just fine for as much as we were in it. It was clean and housekeeping did a good job. The pool area was beautiful. Our kids had a blast with the pool and waterside. I would definitely not think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great public spaces, so so rooms”
Reviews.Author: jdog99
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness lodge is a beautiful place to see. From the moment you drive into the resort it feels like you were transported to a woodland lodge in the west. The exterior of the resort and the lobby make you think you are staying in a 5 star resort. The lobby is quite an impressive site with floor to ceiling windows, fireplace and exposed log architecture. That is where it ends, once you get to the room it feels like you are staying a Holiday Inn with wilderness themed furnishings. The room was pretty small even by basic hotel standards. It was a good thing we were not in our room except to get ready and sleep. Although sleeping was not all that easy either. During the evening and morning when we were in the room we could hear all of the toilets flushing on the floors above us. At times you could hear the flushing of toilets 10 times a minute. Not the most pleasant noise while trying to get some rest. We only ate at the resort for breakfast at the quick service location and what a joke that was especially when it got busier. The food ordering area was very small with no organization what so ever and then once you got your food and that stress was over you had to struggle to find a table to sit at. In my opinion the quick service location is way too small for the size of the resort. The real benefit of staying at this resort is the proximity to the Magic Kingdom. It was just a short boat ride away and you could even see the fireworks from the room. All the other parks and attractions were a 15-30 minute bus ride with multiple stops. If I could give two separate ratings, one for the public spaces and one for the rooms I would give the public spaces 5 stars and the rooms 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan M
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay for our trip to Disney. Front desk staff was helpful, and our kids loved the pool and other distractions (night boat parade, the geyser, marshmallow roast). Tips: do the on-line check-in, take the boat to Magical Kingdom, make reservations if eating dinner at one of the resorts restaurants (or you'll be waiting forever), rent a bicycle and ride to Wilderness Campground to ride the horses (for little kids only). Bus rides to theme parks and DT Disney are a little long, but better than driving your own vehicle. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: kyrambler
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge is as much a part of the Disney magic for us (maybe more even) than the theme parks...the place is just beautiful and happy and fun. The lobby and amenities are full of that Disney specialness (rooms not so much -- they're fine, just you know, slightly cramped hotel rooms). The boat launch from WL to the Magic Kingdom is absolutely perfect. We stayed here on our first visit, and pretty much the first thing we did was take the boat to MK. That moment when we rounded the little isle in the middle of the lake, and the kids saw the castle for the first time -- well, it was the moment I realized "magical" wasn't just Disney's marketing buzz phrase. Little jaws dropped. The food is great too, from the quick serve place with atmospheric outdoor seating to Whispering Canyon to Artists Point to room service. We love it and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and extremely nice!”
Reviews.Author: Brett1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wilderness Lodge and it was a great experience. We went just before Christmas and it was decorated beautifully. The main lobby area is very impressive. It's gigantic! We stayed in one of the regular rooms with two beds and it was plenty of room for the me and my wife and two small kids (2 and 9). The pool and hot tub area was really nice, but my favorite part of staying here was the ferry over to the Magic Kingdom. So easy with the little ones and a fun way to get back and forth. I would highly recommend you stay here. I personally don't choose the top of the line rooms since we spend so little time actually in the room. At Disney, I've found it usually best to get the cheapest room at the nicest hotel you can afford. That way you get the benefits of staying at a better place (transportation is key and much better at the Deluxe Resorts) and the restaurants/shopping are better. Also, if you are going to Disney and are trying to decide between staying in a Disney hotel or off the property. I'll tell you that it's much easier to get around if you are in a Disney resort and you get to take advantage of extra magic hours, which are extended hours only for those staying onsite. Those vary day to day so plan your park-going accordingly. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Wilderness Lodge, but good any time...”
Reviews.Author: bph19
Reviews.Content: We are Disney Vacation Club members so we have stayed here before and it is never better than at Christmas. It is homey, welcoming and very Christmasy. There is a huge tree in the lobby like the other Disney resorts but somehow this is more personal and like home. The villas are much quieter because there is not the restaurant noise. We read by the fire one afternoon at the villa lobby and it was very peaceful. Anyone can wander over there, but most do not. This is also a great place when the weather is more pool friendly. Hot tub is good and by Old Faithful. There has easy boat access to Magic Kingdom, Contemporary, Polynesian, Grand Floridian and the campground for Hoop De Do Revue. If you want to get to any of these places, this is centrally located. If you want to to to Epcot or Hollywood Studios, it is better to stay closer to those resort, like Boardwalk or Beach Club. If you want a break from the Disney experience, there is a nice path to the campground that you can walk, jog or bike. We really like it here because of the rustic decor. The rooms are nice and roomy. Balconies are overlooking woods, pool, lake or dare I say the parking lot? The snack bar is Ok to good. Artists Point is very pricey but excellent. We aren't really crazy about the Whispering Canyon theme so didn't go there this time. You have to be in a somewhat loud and crazy mood to like this. (read up on this).

Reviews.Title: “The lobby is GORGEOUS but for over 300$ a night, I expect duvets--- not worn out blankets and dingy bedspreads in the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Flynyc
Reviews.Content: The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Disney has their hand in your wallet at every turn, so it's at least nice for their employees to have smiles for you as they overcharge for everything. As I walked into the lobby, I was blown away. It really is impressive. The decor is tasteful and rustic inspired. No detail has been overlooked. For example, even the rail to hold onto in the elevator has a beaver on either end so that it looks like they are holding a log up for you to grip...the location of this hotel is nice. It's quiet and you don't have the massive crowds always trotting through the lobby like at some of the other hotels. Transportation to the different properties is provided by bus and boat. It's convenient and quick. However, I was shocked to see the actual rooms. The decor was cute, but dingy. The bathroom just looked old, the shower had mineral build up and it was dark. The most shocking were the bed coverings. It has been a very long time since I've encountered dirty old bedspreads instead of laundered duvet covers on a bed in a hotel. I had to pull the sheet over the top edge to cover it as much as I could while I tried to lie completely still to keep from touching it. Not a very relaxing way to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenery”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlNe
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Wilderness Lodge...lovely setting. Disney's theming details are outstanding at this hotel. If you didn't see Palm trees, you'd be sure to think you were in western USA mountains/wilderness. Loved the look & feel of the main lobby: soaring totems, the whole giant log-look is wonderful. Spectacular multi-story fireplace, babbling brook in the lobby: gorgeous. The pool is also national-park-themed, with "steam" and mountain-stream scenery. Nice pool bar, with TVs set to sports channels (which was great for us since our room was not ready and college team was playing the afternoon we checked in!) Staff was cheerful & helpful...we ate at Whispering Canyon twice (breakfast & lunch...enjoyed the meal and the "antics" were not too intrusive for adult couples...kids there looked like they were having a good time with the pony races, singing, etc.) Nice gift shop, adequate quick-service restaurant on-site (very crowded in the area where you order & get beverages, though. Plenty of seating in & out in the area.) Boat service to the Magic Kingdom was wonderful...relaxing way to get to & from the park. Now the down-side: rooms and public areas of the hotel definitely need some TLC & updating. Carpet showing wear, walls dinged-up, etc. Room (including bathroom & bedding) was clean, just looks like time to refurbish all.) We had a courtyard view--our balcony faced the main pool & also could see the lake. We would probably return at some point...it is a beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge - THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie L
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge over Thanksgiving of 2011, and have stayed there many times before. Christmas is the most beautiful time for the Wilderness Lodge, although it's spectacular all year long. The Christmas decorations are just perfect and make the lobby feel so warm and inviting. After a long day at the parks, we would end each night sitting in the lobby and reading - enjoying the lovely 4-story fireplace! It really is a great lobby and property, and the rooms have always been clean and fairly spacious. We asked for a room overlooking the pool, so our view was great. We've also had a view overlooking the woods which is also nice. The Wilderness Lodge has a boat available to take you to the Magic Kingdom (10 minute ride), and buses to take you to any of the other parks. There are a few short trails to hike and bikes to rent. As a runner, I also like the 1 mile path to the Fort Wilderness Lodge... it's safe and there's plenty of great deer watching. They walk right up to you! The Whispering Canyon is a great spot for lunch and they have a fun, interactive dinner for kids. Dinner is a family style meal - great food (BBQ, corn, beans, etc). We've also stayed at Yacht and Beach, and The Polynesian. They're both lovely, but The Wilderness Lodge gets my vote every time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TOGETHER_WE_TRAVEL35
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I prefer the Grand Foridian, or the poly due to quicker transport and nicer rooms, but this hotel is not bad. The pros: -Lovely Christmas decorations including a huge tree for great photos -Good customer service on arrival - greeted at the door and walked to a check in desk. Nice touch. -Good customer relations throughout the stay. Always a hello, happy anniversary, or have a nice day when passing -Great customer service at all restaurants and food outlets - unlike Coronado Springs resort -Whispering canyon was a nice experience, with good food, although it can be noisey if your room is near it. -Pool area is very pretty with lots of photo spots -Boat service to magic kingdom -Good Disney Shop selling disney gifts and bottled drinks -Nice quick service restaurant with a good selection of food Great bicycle hire service with a lovely route through the woods. You may even be lucky enough to see some wildlife. -Lovely themed bar near main lobby for evening drinks and snacks Very nice King beds (upon request). Cons: -Can be noisey if room is near main reception or whispering Canyon Cafe -Boats to Magic Kingdom are regular and good, but to Contemporary they can be hit and miss. -Buses were the worst at any Disney Resort we have stayed at. on several occasions we waited up to 40 minutes for buses from parks like Blizzard beach. -Rooms are a little dim, and each individual light has to be switched off one at a time. No main on/off switch -Rooms can be noisey if you get an adjoining room, but even if not you can always either hear poolside children, or even with a woods view room the constant honking of the boat horns at 7am to 2am is a real pain. Can the boats Please stop honking every 7 minutes??? -Our room was next to a public balcony and we were disturbed regularly by noisey guests taking in the view and woken at 9am one morning by a violinist outside our room playing for a wedding of a couple getting married on the balcony next door to our room. Whilst that would have been lovely to some guests, we were not given any prior warning and were disturbed of a much needed lie in after a late night at the parks -No food in the hotel after 11pm.How can a hotel this price not have food after 11pm if you have had a late night out and have been too busy to eat at normal times? -Our room overlooked a public balcony as mentioned where people kept smoking. It was not a designated smoking area and every time we complained we were told security would sort it, but they never ever did. It was not only dangerous and stopping us from enjoying our balcony, but also made our rooms smell every day of smoke. I complained 6 seperate times. Once 3 men were smoking cigars which took an hour to smoke, and thats why I know security never came as they had time to finish smoking them. -Internet wifi in rooms was a nice idea, but a nightmare. For our 9 day stay it was drop off after 30 seconds at most. It was completely unuseable from your room. There is no longer an option of a cable connection. You had to go to the main lobby to get a solid wifi connection. I asked for help resolving this and the IT technition said it was because too many people were using guest wifi in the rooms. This was all day and night though. We were in room 4075 by the way. -Chairs in lobby area are quite uncomfortable and there are no quiet areas to sit and read in this hotel due to the lobby being so noisey from the whispering canyon cafe. -The beach is nice, but tiny. Lovely to sit on when quiet, but Absolutely tiny and used by the hotels childrens club which meant dodging footballs all afternoon. -The so called quiet pool is not quiet and gets no sun so is pretty pointless. -The main pool plays very loud music from a huge speaker all day long. - First deluxe resort I have stayed in that doesnt offer a turndown service on an evening. Overall I would stay again as it was a lovely stay, although very expensive, but the transport needs to improve, and also some of the other cons.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: alexcharles2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 8 year old daughter to the Wilderness Lodge. In typical Disney style, the rooms were immaculate and wonderful. Anything we asked for was immediately taken care of. The room service was wonderful and the accommodations, more than I would have ever expected for a family vacation. Highly recommend this hotel. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Kylee L
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights on my honeymoon at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. It is categorized as a "deluxe" hotel from Disney. I found it to be the most affordable of the deluxe hotels, and also the coziest. The detail in the hotel and the rooms are immaculate. I had a room by the pool, and it was pretty noisy, but not unbearable. The location is further from the Disney magic than most of the hotels, but that's one of the reason why I chose it. The staff were very nice, and I think I may have held up the line for check in when I gushed to the front desk about my Disney Wedding experience! Overall a great place to stay, and a very beautiful and peaceful accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot go wrong with this place.”
Reviews.Author: RodDesnomieRegina
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Wilderness Lodge over Christmas. Our stay was great. The hotel was fully decked out for the holiday season. However, what really impressed uscwas the staff - super helpful and friendly. The hotel is big, so expect a bit of a hike to get to your room. The theme is unique and very well done. The rooms, however, are a bit small. Thankfully we are just a group of three, so it was not an issue for us. The hotel pool was nice, as was the fully stocked gym facility. The restaurants were good too, but after a while the heavy foods lost their appeal. We did not have to wait long for any of our busses, and no trip lasted more than 30 mins. Plus, the boat option to Magic Kingdom was a very nice touch. We also made use of the boat rental the resort offers. It was a great way to spend an afternoon. I would recommend this hotel to families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Always magic at the kingdom”
Reviews.Author: Texasdomer
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness lodge is a wonderful place to stay. The lobby is incredible. Character meet and greets in the lobby. Quick service meal area is great. Always easy to get something to eat without waiting for a table. The kids has a great time at the pool. Afternoon games for the kids poolside. Marshmallow roasting every night on the beach. Even had a movie every evening on the beach for the kids. The decor is incredible. Hard to believe you are not really out in a cabin somewhere. As is the case throughout Disney, the staff is amazing. Nothing they won't try to do for you. We were there the week before Christmas and it was a game each day we came back from the park to find what the housekeeping staff had left in the room. One day it was star ornaments hanging from the mirrors. One day is was a Christmas tree, complete with ornaments, made out of towels. It was great to be able to travel to Magic Kingdom by ferry boat or bus. Buses to all the other parks only make one stop before getting you to the park. On the bus rides home, we were always the first stop. The rooms aren't huge but hopefully, you're only there to crash at the end of a busy day. The Wilderness Lodge is a wonderful place to stay and enjoy the magic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: cbrandt1209
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a bunkbed room for 11 nights in September and absolutely loved it. The staff here is amazing, and we even got to be flag family one morning and goto the roof to help raise the flags. Artists Point was the best restaurant we ate at during our stay, and the food and service was phenomenal. The pools and hot tubs were also great, and the quiet pool was a nice change when the main pool with the slide got too crazy. The boat service to the contemporary and magic kingdom were also wonderful. If/when we return to Disney, this will be the resort we return to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: devfam19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wilderness Lodge for five nights in mid December. We enjoyed our stay overall. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The pool was fun and our children enjoyed the actvities and water slide. Wilderness lodge has a pretty setting and it is a fun place to stay. Because it was the holidays there were a few special events (including surprise entertainment in the lobby on a couple of evenings) which were great. Transportation was excellent. The boat to Magic Kingdom is very fast and the buses always seemed to be waiting when we needed them. Occasionally we stopped at Fort Wilderness or the Grand Floridian along the way, but not always. The many fireplaces are also a nice touch. The negatives for us included the wear and tear on the rooms - ours was very worn - and the noise from the rowdy Wispering Canyon. Because the hotel restaurant is open to the lobby there is not the relaxed feeling you get from other locations. If your room is close to the lobby you will hear a fair amount of noise from below. Also, our room was not cleaned one day (however, the tip was taken). We transferred to Wilderness Lodge after spending several nights at Animal Kingdom Lodge. We ranked AK above this resort in almost all categories (restaurants, service, room quality, mousekeeping, activities, pool), transportation was slightly better at Wilderness Lodge, given its proximity to Magic Kingdom, however transportation at Animal Kingdom Lodge was not a problem at all and was almost always very reasonable. We had no major complaints about Wilderness Lodge, we just didn't like it as much as our other accomodations. If proximity to Magic Kingdom and other Magic Kingdom resorts is important to you, then it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: katvdm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 14 nights in September 2011. When we checked in we were given a room in the one place I had specifically requested we not be due to our baby - above the whispering canyon. Luckily, there was one room left in the exact spot we wanted and had requested - a woods view room, overlooking the otter pond. Although I was made to feel like I was being a nuisance when I asked for the change, which was a bit frustrating for the amount of money we were paying to stay there for that long. Especially because the room we had requested was available, i did not understand why they hadn't allocated it to us instead of one we asked to not have. Anyways, we were ended up in room 3018, and had a fantastic gap in the trees which allowed us to see the magic kingdom fireworks from our balcony. Awesome! We found the resort to be beautiful, although after 14 nights the room did get a little on the small side for 2 adults and 3 kids (ages 8, 4 and 18 months). The roaring forks had some great food and we ate there often - get the adult chicken nuggets instead of the kids, the meat is much better. The surrey bikes were heaps of fun, and the pool was awesome. The boat to the MK was great, although did get busy at peak times. Sometimes the buses seemed a bit out of synch - for example, HS would have early morning EMH, but there would be no buses for 20 minutes but you would see 3 for Epcot. That got a bit annoying, but the buses did not take too long to get places once you were on them. Just to mention, the laundry was a good size too and we never had any problems getting a washer or dryer, although you needed 2 cycles of the dryer to get the clothes dry. All in all we had a really enjoyable stay, and would definitely stay at the WL again, but maybe in the Villas, which look beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, exceptional property”
Reviews.Author: mdv76
Reviews.Content: We were there the week before Christmas so the lodge was decorated beautiful for christmas. The lobby is breathtaking with the huge tree. The pools were very well heated so we were able to swim when it was 75 outside. The boats to the contemporary, ft.wilderness & magic kingdom are so convenient and enjoyable.
