The rooms were just average hotel rooms. However, we had a perfect view of the fireworks out of our woods view room which was a huge bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Just Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: Just Wonderful!This is a beautiful hotel and the lobby is breathtaking. The rooms are a little smaller than the Polynesian but are nice, comfortable and mouse keeping is awesome. I encourage you to try this lodge and all the restaurants. You're only a quick boat ride to the Magic Kingdom. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Wilderness Lodge - Especially at Christmas”
Reviews.Author: lindas0809
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11/27-12/3 and had a great trip. We had last stayed here on our last trip in 2009 on the club level and I was worried that staying non club would be a let down. It was not. We had a great wood view room where we could see MK fireworks at night. The room was clean and our housekeeper was great leaving us towel animals each day. We love the atmosphere of WL. It's restful and relaxing after long days at the park. The holiday decorations were wonderful - we got some lovely family portraits in front of the Christmas tree. We had a chance to eat at all 3 dining options at the lodge. Roaring Forks (the Quick Serve), Whispering Canyon Cafe(casual table service) and Artist Point (Signature dining) and enjoyed them all. We took the boat to MK and buses elsewhere and found no issues with waiting. We made it a point to check out the other deluxe resorts on this trip, but they all seemed too big for us. I think we are Wilderness Lodgers for life.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay when at Disney.”
Reviews.Author: Todd M
Reviews.Content: When visiting Walt Disney World, the vacationer has a myriad of avenues when it comes to hotel accommodations. One can save a ton of money by staying off property. However, the downside is constant use of oneâ€™s own vehicle to get back and forth from the parks. Also included is the additional expense of more gas consumed, and parking fees. Another option is to stay at one of the lower-cost hotels on Disney property. This allows the tourist to leave their car parked, and the cost of theme park vehicle parking is bypassed. The downside of this is that it may cost a bit more to stay on Disney property, and the only form of mass transit for these types of Disney resorts are buses. Lastly, is the most expensive but time-saving and least stressful way to stay at Disney; a hotel around Bay Lake. I have camped at Disneyâ€™s Fort Wilderness most of my life. The boats and buses made it easy to get around. The first time I stayed in a Disney hotel was the Port Orleans, Riverfront. It was a nice hotel, but the lack of buses made wait times a maddening experience. For the holidays, my wife and I decided to do it up, and go all out. We got a great Florida resident rate for Disney's Wilderness Lodge, so we booked it. PROS: Location: I love any Disney property that overlooks Bay Lake. It was quiet and the property is beautiful. Transportation: With buses and boats at our disposal, we rarely had to wait to get where we were going. We opted for the boats, because I prefer them, and there always seemed to be a boat on the way. The ease of transportation made our stay at WL totally worth the price. Resort: This place has to be one of the nicest hotels on Disney property. It has an outdoors feel of Fort Wilderness, but the elegance of the other resorts on Bay Lake. Room: Our room was set up quite nicely with details and furnishings only Disney could afford to pull off. The bathroom was roomy and had plenty of good water pressure. Water temperature was also on point, and the room was clean. The bed was soft, and we had plenty of pillows. Safe: The safe is a small key type, and securely held all my valuables. Balcony: Our balcony was nice and overlooked a small pond. Restaurants: We ate at Roaring Fork, and Whispering Canyon. They offered nice items. WC is a funny place to eat because the servers yell and carry on. CONS: -Our room was across the way from the boat thoroughfare. We were awoken daily at 7am with Disney boat horns as the vessels would approach the WL dock. -Our room was next to the elevator. At night, it was noisy with all the guests getting in and out of the elevator. -The room is lit with 4 lamps that are arranged with two over each bed. There is no master on/off switch. Each bed post has a switch for its lamp. This means that one has to switch on 4 switches to adequately light the room. -The main lobby looks impressive, but we stayed off of one of the wings towards Bay Lake. I wouldâ€™ve liked to stay in the central lobby area. Beyond the trivial, this is a great place to see Disney. Yes, you may spend a little more money, but the time saved in not waiting for a stinky bus is well worth it. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Check in UNCOOL.”
Reviews.Author: Bluechipper
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, have stayed with family 3 times. My son 8, loves the pool, and the proximity to the Magic Kinndom saves countless time. I booked a discounted Bunk Bed room months in advance, and when I checked in, no bunk beds. She told me I could get that room if I paid more. When I then demanded to talk to the manager, he told me he could not find a bunk bed room for me. Then why did she offer it if I paid more. They asked me If I had written confirmation of my reservation. I had the number but not the actual print out. I put up a HUGE stink, and to not ruin my family vacation, agree with the manager that I would pay the extra, and when I got home and got the print out, he would refund the difference. He actually did during our stay. Save the reservation and bring the actually copy. Maybe seasoned travelers know this, I've learned my lesson.

Reviews.Title: “As good as Disney gets!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugfromva
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge Resort is Disney at it's best. You are quickly and completely engulfed in a complete experience while staying here. Seriously - all of your senses are indulged and given the royal treatment. From the amazing lobby and picturesque waterfalls & pool to the flickering lanterns and little animal prints left in the the stone walks, this is a resort that will actually compete with your attention - and that's saying a lot when you have the parks calling. My family has tried many of Disney's resorts and we have yet to top our experience here. The rooms are great, all three restaurants (a romantic fine dining spot, a fun family sit-down, and a quick service counter spot) are perfect for what they aim at, the pool area is relaxing and very unique. Although not on the monorail line, transportation is a breeze. A boat can be caught to the nearby Magic Kingdom and easily accessible buses that you everywhere else. Did I mention all the details? Do yourself a favor and do take the time to really soak it all up. This is too amazing of a place to just rush in and out of.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: christinarn2000
Reviews.Content: Came in from Texas excited about staying at Disney! We have been to Disney in the past and stayed off property. Overall the hotel was beautiful and the service was excellent! The room was a HUGE disappointment. It was dark, dated, and dirty. I felt like I was staying at a motel on the side of the road. The air conditioning was damp and aggravated my allergies and ended up at the ER with a bad sinus infection. We checked out early because I got sick. We decided not to let this mess up our family vacation and anniversary trip and found a hotel across from downtown Disney for under a hundred dollars a night with CLEAN and NEW rooms. I have stayed at many hotels and this was sure a great disappointment. If you are going to charge four star diamond prices the rooms need to reflect this. This will be our last time to a Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay while visiting Disney World.”
Reviews.Author: lovetochill10
Reviews.Content: We have visited Disney World many times and have stayed at a wide variety of places. The Wilderness Lodge is hands down our favorite place to stay. The lobby is beautiful and well themed. The rooms are a little on the small side but still very comfortable. Our room was very clean when we checked in and was well kept all week. (I'm very picky and by my standards the rooms were clean!) We upgraded to a woods view room (worth the money) we were able to hear the boat parade but not able to see it from our balcony. However, the view of the Magic Kingdom fireworks from our balcony was outstanding!!! The boat to the Magic Kingdom is convenient. Bus punctuality is just ok. The main pool is large and has a nice waterslide. It's close to Roaring Forks and has a nice walk up bar. Make sure you see Stewart at the pool bar he's very polite and knowledgeable! We enjoyed breakfast at the whispering canyon. Had lunch many times at roaring forks and it was always good. They had a good variety of sandwiches on the menu and a different homemade soup every day. Overall, great location, well kept rooms, nice pool and good dining options!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: kimmy04
Reviews.Content: This resort is just beautiful! We stayed here for 5 night the last week in November. From the time you pull up you feel like you are transformed to the North West. Transportation was very easy. We used the boat to MK and CT. Buses ran every 10 to 15 minutes. Food was always good and hot. At night they have a movie on the beach with a fire going for roasting marshmellows. My 6 year old daughter loved that most of all! You could spend hours walking around the resort and just taking in the beauty of it all! This is our family's 3rd time at the WL and it will not be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Love...Love...Love”
Reviews.Author: Nicole S
Reviews.Content: Our trip started with an almost three hour flight delay...boooo! We therefore got to our resort only 40 minutes before a 6:10 dining reservation at the Grand Floridian.....Disney Magic took over right away with a taxi voucher to get us there with time to spare and paying for a new Disney shirt for my daughter who had spilt chocolate milk on hers during the plane ride! All other transportation worked wonderfully (especially loved the boat ride to Magic Kingdom!). We ate at the Whispering Canyon one night for dinner which was fun and the Roaring Forks was a nice quick service. I loved the decor...pool....surroundings......if we ever come back to Disney, I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: filmgirl325
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many of the Disney resorts over the years, from the Grand Floridian to the All-Stars, but this place is still my favorite. It's a beautiful, rustic lodge that from the minute you walk in, feels warm, comfortable, and inviting. There is even an enormous fire place in the lobby with rocking chairs to relax in. The rooms are very spacious, with tasteful decor and big comfy beds. The pool isn't quite as flashy as some of the other resorts, but none of the other resorts have a geyser either, which is pretty magnificent. The lodge also boasts one of my favorite places to eat at Disney, which is Whispering Canyon Cafe, where the waiters are almost as great as the food. If you want to have a more adult meal you can also experience fine dining at Artist Point. While the lodge is a little more secluded than the other deluxe resorts, and doesn't have monorail access, the lodge does have boat service to the Magic Kingdom as well as boat service to the Fort Wilderness Campgrounds. I personally love that you feel tucked away from everything else when you stay here, and how cozy it feels and that it has that great woodsy/fireplace smell. It's definitely my favorite place to stay at Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas magic”
Reviews.Author: yvrgirlToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Dec 8-11 for a short getaway and to soak up the holiday ambiance and decorations at Disney. We picked the best resort for that! Because it's modelled after Banff and has a lodge feel, it was very cozy with a welcoming lobby and gorgeous pool, 2 hot tubs, and a geyser that goes off every hour. We had a pool view and it was very nice. The room, like at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and villas are styled to be on the darker side. The furniture, bedding, and room decor were all themed with animal carvings. Beds were very comfortable. The granite bathroom sinks were outside the room with the toilet and bathtub/shower which I like. There was a coffee / tea maker with tea and coffee and condiments; toiletries; a refrigerator; in-room safe; and ample closet and drawer space as well as 2 luggage racks. The location was very convenient - a 20 minute boat ride to Magic Kingdom as well as buses. We have been to Disney 6 times now and it always takes at least 30 minutes to get anywhere at Disney with their transportation. The bus to Downtown Disney stops at the Grand Floridian first. And do note - the only way to get to Downtown Disney from a theme park is to take the free Disney transportation to a resort first. Our room cost $240/night (35% seasonal discount). Certainly more than if you stay off Disney property but the Magical Express is included and you get the Disney feel. We also visited nearly all of the other Disney resorts to see their Xmas decor and felt most in the holiday spirit at this hotel. Joined in Mickey's Very Merry Christmas Party which was great. See my other reviews regarding where we've stayed for Disney trips. I would recommend this resort. Make sure you make advanced dining reservations online so you don't have to wait or find out the restaurants are full. We had Macadamia pancakes at the Kona Cafe in the Polynesian Resort and dinner at Citricos at the Grand Floridian and both were great! We have read that Artist Point at the Wilderness Lodge is excellent for dinner but were not able to get online reservations. Could not get into the Whispering Canyon at this resort for buffet breakfast as we did not make advanced reservations. The quick service Roaring Forks is adequate for breakfast; they have hot flatbread after 11pm until 12 am even though it's not advertised if you need something after returning from the parks!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Terrific Service”
Reviews.Author: CamAndPhoebsDad
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here over the Thanksgiving holiday, and overall we enjoyed our stay. Many people that we know say this is their favorite Disney resort, and I definitely can see why. This was our fourth trip to Disney in about 5 years, but our first venturing into the Deluxe resorts. For those who don't know, Disney has three "tiers" of resorts: Value, Moderates, and Deluxe. The Value and Moderates are all motel-style (no lobbies), while the Deluxes have often elaborate lobbies, concierges, and higher-quality "table service" restaurants. Some of the Deluxe resorts are located on the monorail line or have boat services to the some of the parks. The Wildernes Lodge is beautiful: the lobby is huge, with natural wood timbers throughout. During the holiday season, it is dominated by a large (probably 50 foot) Christmas tree. It is very imposing. There is a boat service to Magic Kingdom, as well as the Fort Wilderness Campground and Resort, which has a number of activities. The pool area is landscaped to continue the outdoor/natural motif. A water slide is tucked away within large boulders for instance. It looks so natural that ducks were swimming with us and were not bothered by people in the least! There's also a geyser nearby that erupts every hour. The resort has three restaurants: Artist's Point, which Disney calls a "signature" restaurant (read: expensive), Whispering Canyon Cafe (a family restaurant), and Roaring Forks, which is a counter-service quick service restaurant. There is a also a pool-side bar. Since we have two children, we got bunk bed rooms. Even though I know that Disney rooms are small (when compared to comparably priced hotel rooms outside Disney), I was still surprised once I saw them. This is the one thing that bothers me about the Disney resorts--they're definitely charging a premium for the service quality as well as the locale. The rooms have a set of bunk beds and a queen bed. The furniture is very heavy, so that makes the room seem smaller as well. A patio or balcony opened up to the courtyard area.There is also a flat screen TV. In our case, there was another negative to our room: it turned out there was a transformer or something located somewhere in close proximity to it which buzzed. This kept my wife and I up for the first two nights. When we complained, we were offered (and took) another dentical iroom on the same level. While this was a little inconvenient (we had to pack up and move the kids at 9 o'clock at night), we felt that the staff was very accomodating towards us. That's the best thing about this resort (and Disney in general): the service. All of the employees at Wilderness Lodge went out their way for you, and sought to make you feel that you were the only ones that mattered. As an example, I wanted to order my wife a special treat for our anniversary. Mary, working the concierge desk, not only put the special events coordinator in touch with me (she actually called me), Mary re-contacted me to make sure I was satisfied. We experienced many such instances of great service while staying here. For families, I can't recommend the Wilderness Lodge enough. It is more expensive than the moderates, but the proximity to the Magic Kindgom by boat (which is like a ride in itself), and the exceptional service provided by the staff, make it a great choice for a resort while visiting Disney.

Reviews.Title: “This sholud not be called a Deluxe Resort”
Reviews.Author: TLL1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge between Nov. 27 through Dec. 3. This was our second time at this resort and we were dissapointed that the quality was down from just 3 years ago. I read some of the recent reviews before booking but would have never thought we would have some of the same negative experences. We were not given the room we were susposed to have and had a crappy view of the maintenance yard. We had a light bulb burned out in our room the whole time and the hot water didn't work the last day we were there. Did I mention that the bed and pillows were very uncomfortable? The bus service there is absolutely horrible. You would think after this many years Disney could get their bus routes down. The property was clean and up kept so I will give it that. I guess things could have been worse, we still made the best of what we had.

Reviews.Title: “Ask about being the flag family”
Reviews.Author: ccs4756
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I asked too late, but on a first come, first serve basis, you can ask the front desk to participate in the flag raising ceremony on top of the Wilderness Lodge in the morning. I assume this means you have to wake up fairly early, but I suspect it's worth it. As for the hotel: It's a very nice hotel with adequate amenities, but the Disney brand is the only thing that makes this "deluxe." Free wifi, comfortable beds and flat panel TVs are standard nowadays even among hotels that are 1/3 of the price of WL; however, these hotels aren't on Disney property. (Sort of along the same line, personally, I was slightly irritated by the premium prices Disney charges for its souvenirs, considering that "Made in China, Brazil, El Salvadore, etc" frequently appear on them. I suppose it's a small world after all.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice and relaxing feeling, great for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Whobetterthanace414
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when it first open and came back on my honeymoon. A cozy feeling you get when you first arrive beautiful lobby and easy check in. Breakfast is good, big fireplaces and rocking chairs, pretty pool. Buses do come to the parks or take a boat to magic kingdom or the monorail. At night a light parade comes to the hotel on the lake Disney theme it's ok but fun to look.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: princess41
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights last week - first time at this hotel. Have stayed at Beach Club (twice) and French Quarter previously. Got off the magic express and was greeted by name and told our room was ready (this was around 10:00 a.m.). Lovely room overlooking the lobby (king bed), not noisy at all. Very convenient location. Mickey towel art on the bed. Had towel art 2 other mornings. Had a good breakfast at Roaring Forks one morning (the other mornings we ate in the room, stuff from home). This hotel is pretty centrally located, so bus rides were not too long to any of the parks. Loved the boat to MK. The lobby with the big Christmas tree and decorations - just beautiful! We had a balcony overlooking a stream. It was quite chilly while we were there, so didn't really use it. Pool looked nice, again too chilly to use it. We did use the hot tub a couple of times - loved it. Saw the Electric Water Pageant from the hot tub and some of the fireworks through the trees, really nice. Would definitely recommend this hotel and we'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: katiej122
Reviews.Content: This was my family's first trip to WDW. We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge and I can't imagine a better experience than the one we had. It had a great location. I loved being able to ride the boat to Magic Kingdom and the campgrounds. My kids had the best time at the pool with the slide. The decor was fun and cozy, and we found that this resort had the best food by far of anywhere else at WDW. Our room was one of the cheaper ones - over the parking lot, but our view was actually a small side parking lot with woods. We were able to watch the fireworks from our balcony every night. We would stay here again if we were to go back.

Reviews.Title: “our favorite resort”
Reviews.Author: venusb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at this fantastic resort about twice a year. I love it when you stop at the guard gate and he checks your name then gives a "Welcome Home" Then your glorious adventure begins. The Lobby is grand and welcoming with rocking chairs by the fireplace , a great meeting place for friends and families. Noisy and full of fun. There are indian artifacts in showcases which are quite interesting. Very kid friendly. The rooms are very spacious and clean, beds are comfy. Huge bathroom equiped with shampoo, conditioner and lotions. Large TV with Disney movies and shows free. The gift shop has all kinds of things, from food to film to gifts and stuff in between. The pool and surroundings are an eyefull making you to want to hurry up and don your bathing suit or trunks. For those who enjoy a cocktail by the pool tropical drinks and more are available. The pool is surrounded by tropical foliage, running streams and a waterfall!! Enchanting!!. There are so many activities for children, young adults, adults and grandparents to do. We have rented a small boat to skittle about in the large lagoon wizzing past other Disney hotels. Taken a romantic horse and buggy ride through the woods ( it was a little pricey) gone horse backriding through trails which was a bit boring. We went over to the Wildneress campground and rented a golf cart and had a grand time exploring. Sometimes we just come to this resort just to get away from home ( we live in South Florida) All transportation to other Disney resorts and parks are free , there is a Disney bus to take you but can get very crowded and lengthy as it stops at other resorts. The bus stops are covered and each bus is clearly marked where it's destination is. The staff is so very helpful and polite, eager to please. We had even stayed at the Wilderness Villas which was really nice, we had the screen door open and a little rabbit came into the living room!! Deals can be had at the resorts. We call the main number and ask if there are any specials for Florida residents or if there are any specials at all. There is always a discount at one of the hotes/resorts, you just have to ask. The restaurants inside the hotel are nice but on the pricey side, the main restaurant is all you can eat and the food is good, nice BBQ and fixins. There is a fine dining restaurant which was excellent but very expensive. Or you can opt for the Canyan cafe' which is open all night. You can leave those wallets in the safebox in your room, your room key can be used in place of money anywhere in Disney!! Even downtown Disney. I suggest that if you want to eat at any restaurant in Disney, call ahead for reservations or you will wail for a lengthy time, the staff can recommend a restaurant and call for you. A few years ago when I was waiting for my husband to check out I was waiting outside watching people come and go, when this little boy was crying, it seems he did not want to leave, he wanted to stay, well my eyes teared up and you know? I knew exactaly how he felt, I wanted to stay too. So if you have kids GO!! if you want a romantic get-away GO!! if you want to have loads of fun GO!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: halwebb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wilderness Lodge Nov 22-26, 2011 at a cost of $410 per night including taxes. The room was adequate but on the small size. The bathroom had been enlarged to accomodate wheel chairs. There was a walk in shower and the like. When checking in I asked for a microwave oven and it was delivered at no charge. Included in the room cost was transportation from and return to the airport. A big plus. The hotel is convenient to the transportation system that takes you to the 4 theme parks (free). You can pay $75 per day per park to enter the theme parks. The staff was very helpful and desired to make guests comfortable and point you to the activity you want. I think the room is over-priced as well as the food in the Lodge eating facilities. One banana cost $1.29.

Reviews.Title: “For those who like the outdoors”
Reviews.Author: Walter S
Reviews.Content: We spent eight nights at Disney's Wilderness Lodge in Nov. 2011 and couldn't have stayed at a better place on Disney property. We are outdoors minded people and have stayed at and visited Old Faithful Inn in Yellowstone numerous times. This felt like we were back in that warm, friendly, comfortable place. Not only the architecture but also the little details made it so much like OFI. Somehow their phony geyser and hot springs didn't come off as cheesy but were very, very close to the real thing. Like OFI, they have a relaxing cocktail lounge for when you need to escape from kids. We also visited the Grand Floridian, another deluxe property in WDW, and found it to be a bit stuffy and formal. The Wilderness Lodge with easy access to the biking and hiking paths around the Wilderness Campground was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic with a touch of magic!”
Reviews.Author: beachdude654
Reviews.Content: This is the only Disney hotel I have ever stayed at. We had a woods view, bunk-bed room right above the check-in desk. We walked in the lobby with our friends who we were traveling with and were in awe when we walked in. This hotel is very family friendly and is in a great location. We took the boat to the Contemporary for the monorail one time, then we took the boat right to magic kingdom. The rooms here are like a log cabin in a smaller room, but nicer. The pool here is amazing! We went pretty much every night for a swim and a view of the fireworks. At night, the pool will get crowded. I would highly recommend this resort for the families who want to get a bit of rustic magic in their stay. Next place I want to stay is the Contemporary

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Maureen P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks, in October, 2011. We loved everything about this hotel, the lobby is stunning, and the restaurants are very good, especially Whispering Canyon. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. The rooms were great, we had a woods view room, with a balcony, and a small lake right outside our window, with lots of wildlife, including otters one morning. All in all we had a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Lobby”
Reviews.Author: terry k
Reviews.Content: Public spaces are beautiful with the great northern lodge architecture and atmosphere. The check-in process was very quick and well managed. The rooms are on the small side with just a queen and 2 bunk beds. There is a large flat screen tv, but overall the rooms are a little dark and dreary at night. Transportation to the Magic Kingdom is either direct by boat, or boat to the Contemporary and then monorail, or bus to the Transportation Center and then monorail. We were there in mid-November, so it wasn't crowded and the direct boat was fine. If there is a large crowd, waiting for boats can be very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip.”
Reviews.Author: Travelingfan36
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying here. The hotel was huge. I really enjoyed all the different kinds of waffles in Roaring Fork. I didn't like the buses this time. Either they went to Grand Floridan or Fort Wilderness. The location was perfect for being next to Magic Kingdom. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fort Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: JanWaldorf_MD
Reviews.Content: Last week my husband meet our son, his wife and our 2 grandsons for a week vacation at the Fort Wilderness Lodge in Disney World. I can't say enough about the lodge. The rooms were wonderful, the staff was absolutely unbelievable and always there waiting to assist you. The restauant, (Whispering Canyon) was so much fun and the food was outstanding. If go make sure you ask for Ketchup!!! The lodge offered boat service to the Magic Kingdon and bus service to all the disney parks. I would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and even better location!”
Reviews.Author: mzimm0
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Wilderness Lodge. Our main complaints (and you'll see that they are minor) were that our room was like a 3 mile hike to the elevators and the rooms/bathrooms were a bit outdated. Since we were at the parks all day long we didn't have to deal with this stuff too much. The restaurants are great at the hotel, the staff is amazingly friendly, the location is spot on and really...our trip couldn't have been any better! The main pool is fantastic (but usually very crowded) and the quiet pool is just that....a little bit of heaven! The lobby is amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Lodge”
Reviews.Author: JohnVTaunton
Reviews.Content: Family just arrived back to UK after 2 fabulous weeks at Wilderness Lodge. There are two types of people in the world. Those who have stayed at Disney's slice of American life. And those who need to get down their nearest travel agents and book a vacation. From the moment my wife and three year old son arrived in the majestic lobby the magic began and didn't subside until we left. Great location- ideal for our planned half day visits to the parks- and fabulous poolside. Ok, yes the rooms aren't massive but size isn't everything. We originally had a wood view room, which was great but following morning when we asked whether there was a room with more light on the balcony for evening drinks, they offered us a pool/lake view without a blink. I would thoroughly recommend the beginning of November for a visit as most of the time parks were relatively quiet. Tips: always book if you want to eat at brilliant Whispering Canyon and be prepared to wait a bit for your table. Lincoln logs table for kids easily passes the time! Except if you are there for an extended period the menu doesn't change so do eat at other places. We took advantage of dining plan to do 6 Character meals at Epcot, Grand Floridian and the Contempory. All can be booked through concierge. Kids Den for the evening was great and allowed us to do fireworks at Magic Kingdom and Epcot. All in all a great place to stay- yes, not cheap but well worth it. We did the dining plan, made use of free transport and magic hours. 2 weeks of memories which will never be forgotton.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic peace”
Reviews.Author: kandzhawk
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit, we stayed three weeks in Disney World, each week at a different resort to get a real perspective. This was our favorite. What we loved about the Wilderness Lodge: The pool and slide The view (our room overlooked the docks,lake, ft.wilderness, fireworks) Boats (aka water taxi's) to park, other resorts and monorail Kids area/arcade room Onsite laundry Artist point (my son's favorite of all restaurants in the parks/resorts) Free food (we went with a promo package offer) Free drinks/mugs (with pkg) could refill at All resorts (not parks) The lobby, amazing (so peaceful and beautiful) All you can eat breakfast Going in the "off season" no crowds, and great deals. The authenticity, everything so rustic it really felt like we were in a big ol cabin in the wooded swamp on a bayou. What we wish was different: Laundry room needed a cabin makeover... very commercial laundromat (AK lodge's is posh) Size of hotel room was small (we expected that from the rewiews, but it was a bit dark...) and when you first enter the room it's really tight, not room to turn around with a bag... it's a little hallyway type are with a closet on one side and the door to the bathroom on the other...it opens up after that but you've already got that squished feeling in your head... if you go out on the balcony it feels better, lol. We left the glass door open most of the time. Looooooooooooooooooong hallways (lots of walking on already tired feet) of course we wanted the view we got, so we accepted the walk, just an fyi. You can get rooms closer to the lobby/elevators, but!!! We never heard a sound back there! Nothing else. We're pickey, opiniated people, 3 different age groups (kid, adult, grandparent) different professions, different lifestyles from real casual to fine dining high end type and we all loved it here and were totally relaxed to come "home"at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for adults and kids”
Reviews.Author: Terps92
Reviews.Content: The front desk person was from Perth, Australia and she made us feel right at home the second we walked in. She told us all about the hotel and she upgraded us to a suite as it was my son's birthday. The room was very comfortable and the kids enjoyed the towel animals that the housekeeping crew made. The pool and hot tubs were great and had a slide. They had lifeguards on duty all day and into the night. The lobby and restaurants in the lodge were very good. We enjoyed Whispering Canyons a lot, be careful when you ask the waiter for ketchup. The club access was perfect as they offered food throughout the day and even beer, wine, etc... for adults. Getting to the parks was relatively easy via bus or boat, although at times we waited a bit. I would highly recommend this location and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: FamTrav2011
Reviews.Content: You know you are not just on any vacation but a Disney Vacation when you pull up to this wonderful resort. The closer you get the bigger it gets, the way it fits into the Surroundings is amazing. When you pull up under the Huge overhang to drop off your luggage and family, you hear the music and instantly get swept away. Walk through the front doors and a transformation takes place, you are taken to a different place and time in history. You forget that just outside lies the pure magic of Disney. The sounds of other families, resort tour guides, the sound of the bubbling spring, yes there is a spring in the lobby, takes you away and the outside world is replaced by a Disney World. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, not that you will be spending much time in it. Back to the Spring. In the back of the lobby there is a small Bridge that goes over a babbling brook that starts with a spring that gently pours up out of the ground. Turn around and look through the huge viewing windows and an entirely different landscape unfolds. Walk out the back doors and follow the stream from under, yes under, the wall and down through a rock arch way, a short flight of stairs and you come to the end at the pool. In true Diisney fashion the pool area is now a Scenic over look as you would see in Yellow Stone. There is a replica of "Old Faithful" that goes of on schedule. Look just past the majestic scene and you see breathtaking scenes of what used to be "Discovery Island" and the shore line of the lake. All the water sports, Including Small boats called "Water Sprites" to guided fishing trips, Para-sailing. So much to do that your vacation could be spent at the resort, but don't limit your self. There is so much to do and the key to getting in as much as you can, with out wearing yourself out, is planning. There are more choices for transportation than just "Disney bus" here. There are regular boats that take you to the Magic Kingdom, Other disney Resorts and from there the "World" is yours to travel. I highley Recomend this resorts for Family's as well as couples. We have stayed here several times and every time we enjoy it more.

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WrldTravLR09
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at the All Star Sports Hotel and wanted out ASAP. So, our hotel search yielded an opening at the Wilderness Lodge. It is paradise. I can't say enough great things about the staff, the location, the scenery, the room, the furnishings, the view from our balcony, the ease of getting to and from the parks, the decor, the food, etc. Everything here was amazing!!! If we make it back to Disney and need a hotel again, rest assured, it's gotta be this place!

Reviews.Title: “Northwest Wilderness Wow!”
Reviews.Author: AliceandJiminy
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at Wilderness Lodge was very nice. The lobby is somewhat reminiscent of Grand Californian and Animal Kingdom Lodge (Jambo House) with a huge impressive 'living room' expanse as you first walk in. Kids will enjoy the theming...Woody and Jessie would be right at home there. Cast members at check in were outstanding...very enthusiastic and helpful. Our room overlooked a small wooded 'campsite'. We ended up in a handicapped room with a roll in shower, not my first choice...but the handheld shower was nice. Water in the bathroom was mostly lukewarm, regardless of how far the knob was turned toward hot. Rooms are well kept and comfortable. This was our second try at Whispering Canyon restaurant, but this time for breakfast. We ordered the endless skillet, but our server wasn't readily available to refill! (The bounty platter served at some of the other quick service restaurants at WDW, though not unlimited, were just as filling at about half the price!) A nice hotel overall, just not my first choice at WDW...that would be AKL!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel at Disney”
Reviews.Author: dora_pirate
Reviews.Content: We are from the Orlando area but have little ones and so try to stay over if we're committing to Disney. I have always been adamant about staying at one of the hotels on the monorail, which is a lot more expensive but a lot less stressful with a huge double stroller and two littles. This is my new favorite (if you are going to the Magic Kingdom). It is one easy boat ride away from being dropped smack dab in front of the Magic Kingdom entrance! Plus, it is a lot more reasonable than the other *deluxe* resorts on property. Kids will love it. They have a great pool and a lot for the kids to do. They have an adult restaurant and a family restaurant ... don't do room service ... it's atrocious. Nice people, bad food. We also had 3 adults and two kids, got a room that had two queens separated from a sitting area .. very spacious. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Close but no cigare”
Reviews.Author: frenchladyalberta
Reviews.Content: Wilderness pros: Quiet, Nice boat ride to MK with little or no wait, beautiful resort. Wilderness cons: Isolated, Small rooms, Bus everywhere else, very uncorfortable beds. We also stayed at Bay Lake Resort and for us it wins over the Wilderness Lodge due to Great location, access to monorail and comfortable beds. Plus, we had a view of MK and could watch the fireworks from our room every night. Bottom line, Wilderness Lodge is a nice resort but unless you like very old beds, you may not get a good night sleep. Here are my top 5 Disneyworld tips: 1. Get to the park early. By the afternoon, lines are way way longer. 2. Book breakfast in the park prior to opening time. This will get you inside the park before everyone else. 3.Buy an advance photo pass CD. You will save $50 on the regular price. Well worth it! That way, you don't have to carry the camera around plus, the photographers have all the best picture spots throughout the parks. 4. You don't really need a step-by-step touring plan. The only plan you need is this: Go to the most popular rides first thing in the morning and get a fast pass for the rides you want to go on again. Study the park maps before hand to quickly locate your favorite rides. After that, enjoy the rest of your day! 5. Get a wait time app. It is a great tool which can help you decide where to head to next. There are several apps out there but our favorite is called "Magic Guide" which shows the wait time on a map. There is plenty info on the web regarding WDW. Do your research and have fun. My favorite web site is "EasyWDW.com which contains free touring plans, crowd calendars and lots of info. (Note that I am not affiliated with this web site)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: linzy8
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a nice stay. Breakfast at the Whispering Canyon was a lot of fun and was delicious. Boat access to the Magic Kingdom was wonderful. The pool is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL LODGE”
Reviews.Author: NANA007UNDRCVR
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Wildneress Lodge twice now. Once, we had a "bear face" room which is off the beautiful lobby, and overlooked pool area. This last time we had a room which overlooked the woods and not off of lobby. Both were nice as rooms go, the Lodges' rooms are a little small and kinda dark. Very clean by Disney standards but not alot of choice for a King size bed. You have access to the boats to go to other resorts and to Magic Kingdom. The pool area is very nice with a small water slide. Whispering Canyon restaurant is very nice, just make sure you have a reservation. Other quick restaurants on property usual Disney fare and price. Very nice choice for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Stay Yet!”
Reviews.Author: Tracerr
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took an adult trip to Disney and we decided to try Wilderness Lodge this time. We loved it!! From the second we stepped off of the Magical Express to the time we left was A+ for us. The customer service here was top notch! Our view was not great but we did not pay for a great view so it wasn't a problem for us. The food court was a lot smaller than the value and moderate resorts which was a little disappointing but the food was always excellent. The lobby was amazing and the restaurants were fantastic. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.”
Reviews.Author: Taylor M
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at The Wilderness Lodge, they have very nice and spacious rooms, and they have a beautiful pool. They also have an extremely nice lobby. It's in a good location as well. I would recommend this hotel to fellow Disney goers anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: lovenyc210
Reviews.Content: We love the Wildnerness Lodge and have stayed there 4 times over the past 8 years. It is a great place because it is not as large as some of the other Disney properties. You can take the boat to the Magic Kingdom and walk or ride bikes to the Fort Wilderness Campground. We like to stay in the Jr. Suite which has a small sitting area and a separate bedroom. On the nights the kids were exhausted and needed to get to bed, we could stay up and relax without disturbing them. The Roaring Forks is a great quick-service food option and they also have the Artist's Pointe which is our favorite high-end fine dining experience in Disney. The Whispering Canyon Cafe is also on site and a lot of fun for all. It is an interactive dining experience typical of Disney and the kids have a ball! The pool is great fun with a small slide coming off of a rock mountain and there is a geyser to watch every hour. At night, the electric light parade moves through the Lagoon and we went to the dock to watch it or we'd see it from the boat on our way back from the Magic Kingdom. It's just a very special place to spend your Disney vacation. We've stayed at other resorts, but always find our way back to the Wildnerness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brewers1982
Reviews.Content: I have visited Walt Disney World 18 times over the past 16 years, staying on property at one of their resort hotels 17 of those times. My favorite Disney resort hotel has been the Wilderness Lodge (WL). The moment you walk in the front door, you are transported to the great hotels of the western United States. The decor is fabulous, the rooms are quite large and the amenities are second to none. Plus, its proximity to the Magic Kingdom makes it ideal for families with small kids. A short boat ride drops you off at the entrance of the Magic Kingdom. That same boat makes it convenient to return to the WL for a brief respite mid-day. The WL is the least expensive of the "deluxe" Disney resort hotels and although it is pricy, you get what you pay for and it si worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge well worth the visit !!”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4 days @ the lodge, everything was first rate, eating @ whispering canyons was a lot of fun, just be careful about asking for ketchup. I wouldn't sugget getting a woods view, not worth the expense in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, but.....”
Reviews.Author: mlr61915
Reviews.Content: I've always consider myself a Disney person and have never stayed at a Deluxe Disney Resort (always stayed at Moderates), so with that said......... My wife and I (traveling alone) were offered an upgrade from Port Orleans Riverside to the Wilderness Lodge for a very modest price (Oct 17th thru the 22nd of 2011). As everyone else has said in other reviews here, the lobby is gorgeous, the boat ride to the magic kingdom is nice and relaxing, the pool area and grounds are immaculate, and the staff really go out of their way to make your stay here at the WL as pleasant as possible. Our room (5142) had a beautiful wooded balcony view of the Vacation Villas and their quiet pool. There were a few small minor things that I would like to mention about the WL. The prices at the Whispering Canyon restaurant were a bit pricey ($28 for waffles, suasage, and coffee for wifey and I...not including the tip) however the food was good to very good. The cafeteria style restaurant's (Roarin' Forks) food was poor at best. The seating area is very small and congested, especially from 8 AM til 10 AM. Our room was sufficient, but I was expecting more from the bathroom area being a deluxe Disney hotel (very basic and similar to what you would have at Port Orleans Riverside). Bottom line, for what we paid (approx. $200 a night) it was well worth it. But if your paying full price $400, I'd consider staying at one of the moderately priced places.....especially if staying with children. Side Note about the Parks: This was the first time back to WDW without my now college aged son, and it will be awhile before my wife and I return to the magic of Disney. The shows like Illuminations at Epcot and some other attractions need to be changed and updated....it's been like 15 years doing the same show night after night. Come on Disney, shame on you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good food!”
Reviews.Author: momplusthree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the wilderness lodge for three days and this was the first time on site at disney. Won't stay off property again! The convenience to the parks was wonderful and did not have to get in the car once during our trip which makes it worth the money. Rooms are okay for what you are paying for. Pool is great and food was good. Staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “Meh for a honeymoon package”
Reviews.Author: Meatpopsicle
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Boats to the magic kingdom and buses right outside the door. Over heard during the busy season the waits can be high be we went in October and got right on and off. Room was clean, housekeeping was a little annoying but otherwise ok. The floor we were on had its own concierge and this seemed like a cool feature, instead it became creepy and annoying. They would great you and talk to you when you were in mid conversation. Most times they didn't even make eye contact. I had asked for help with a possible cancelled event I had at Epcot. I was told there was no cancellation and he even wrote up a notepad with the reservation number and details. After paying to park at Epcot on my last day and showing up I find out my event was indeed cancelled the concierge is useless. Also the honeymoon sweet is right next to screaming kids and families, forget about sleeping in. I'm now staying in a families timeshare property in Orlando for the next week of universal studios and it's 5 times nicer with better service, I'd def reconsider staying there again with my future family especially for the price. The hotel is perfect for young families, No one else.

Reviews.Title: “A "MUST" for any family visiting Disney World”
Reviews.Author: GK1Impulse
Reviews.Content: This was our family's second trip to Disney in two years, the first being the same week, last year, at the Caribbean Beach Resort. We decided to "upgrade" to a deluxe resort and had received a 35W% off promotional pin from Disney which made the difference from moderate to deluxe level a negligible amount. If you've made it to this review you've no doubt come across countless others which sing praises about the resort, staff, location and value- this review will do the same, but from the perspective of a 30-something couple with 2 young children in tow under the age of 6. Location/Transportation- PRIME!!!! I do not care what anyone says about monorail resorts, as they have nothing on the WL and it's quick boat ride across 7 Seas Lagoon. Boat's serving the resort under a red flag arrived approximately every 10-15 minutes, while blue-flagged boats which hit WL, Fort Wilderness and the Contemporary came with the same frequency. There was no greater joy than leaving ML at closing, to see 600 people lined up for the monorail while the red flagged boats within the same walking distance were truly "walk-on." Being so close to the MK meant that the other resorts were no more than 20 minutes away by resort shuttle bus. My only complaint here is that for Hollywood Studios and Animal Kingdom, WL shares a bus with the Grand Floridian, which added an extra 10 minutes to any bus ride, as you went out further to pick up GF guests, only to then turn around and come back past the WL on your way to a park. Again, this is a minor thing but worth mentioning as we were somewhat suprrised. given that both are deluxe-category results. Room- We had booked a courtyard view with bunk beds and requested an upper-floor so that we could take in the view of the pool, Bay lake, etc. I'm happy to report that the hotel didn't honor that request and we received a first floor room, just steps from the pool. With 2 small kids this particular room couldn't have been any more ideal. Bunk beds worked out great, side rails were provided within 10 minutes or our request, used on the lower bunk. Linens were very fresh, room was immaculate and loved the separate vanity/tub/toilet setup. My only criticism here- with 4 people, the room does feel a bit "small" and "cramped," but we spent so much time outside of the room, whether it was on the property or parks that the size of the room wasn't much on an issue. The only other critique here, again, not a major one- lighting in the room is not the best. I know that Disney was going for a "rustic" look in the rooms, and they've accomplished it, however, lighting could still be improved, since what's provided it fairly basic and doesn't serve to really compliment an otherwise stellar room experience. Setup was a queen bed, bunk beds with twin matresses, desk with 2 chairs, in room fridge, safe (keyed), closet, dresser with limited drawer space (we normally live out of suitcases) and bathroom 2 sinks, storage below vanity, hairdryer, coffee maker, toilet, tub and shower with curtain. This room was considred a "Courtyard with Bunk" in terms of pricing category. Grounds- Disney hit their mark here as you really do feel as though you're staying at lodge nestled somewhere in the Pacific Northwest. The lobby is truly awe-inspiring and the attention to detail in terms of landscape design (greens, pool) is flawless. Pool is large and seating around the pool is quite ample. You never felt as though you couldn't find a seat near the edge of the pool, even on days where the weather was just perfect. Loved the touch of the geyser and hot springs, and the beach location, while we didn't visit it other than to rent watercraft, was picturesque. From the moment you step onto the property, you're firmly convinced that your hotel is somewhere outside of central Florida. Food- We have eaten at Whispering Canyon in the past and love the food, along with the service. The place seems to be always packed to the gills and the food is really quite good. We always seem to opt for the skillet and everyone leaves with a full stomach. The Roaring Forks quick-service restaurant is limited both in terms of choices and seating- I suppose that we were spoiled by the Caribbean Beach last year. We did not eat at Artist Pointe during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favourite Disneyworld Hotel”
Reviews.Author: potosalinas
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights here from Sep 14 - 21, 2011 and had a ball. The only reason we would consider staying outside of a Disney resort is because it's such a challenge to get the kids away from the hotel! No zero-entry pool but our toddlers didn't mind, the little kiddie pool was deep enough (~12") and kept them entertained for hours. The hotel itself looks awesome from the lobby to the surroundings. The playground on the beach and the beach itself on the seven seas lagoon were a lovely touch and we felt added to the magic, especially every evening when the water parade would come around.We rented a 4-seater "bike" (forgot what they're called) and took the kids for a ride to Fort Wilderness and on the way saw some squirrels and were even lucky enough to see a deer! Plus it was nice to just enjoy a quiet ride away from the business of the parks. The boat rental provided a similar level of relaxation which we enjoyed. The room was pretty standard, clean and comfortable which was all we wanted/needed. Occasional towel animals waiting for our return to the room were a nice touch. Only one minor problem and that was the internet playing up. Was fixed in minutes and we even got the 24 hour period free! I can see how some people felt the rooms were small because if our kids (aged 3 and 2) were a lot bigger it might start to feel cramped but we'd still feel cozy. Bottom line is don't expect the Waldorf Astoria and you won't be disappointed. Even though there are no Magic Kingdom views, our room (courtyard view) allowed us to watch the fireworks every night over the resort which we thoroughly enjoyed and the kids looked forward to each night. Whispering Canyon was awesome and is worth experiencing at least once! We loved it and would love to do it again but our location makes it a little difficult! Roaring Forks was good enough to keep us satisfied when we were too tired to venture anywhere else to eat with its standard fast food fare. Can't fault the transport system as it was always prompt but we'll probably rent a car next time just to make things more convenient. Plus you get free parking anywhere in Disney and no need to get up extra early to catch the bus for a breakfast reservation! Overall it was a great stay and we can't wait to go back. We've stayed at the Polynesian, Animal Kingdom Lodge and Grand Floridian but there was something special about this resort that we fell in love with and can't wait to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good time, but remodel needed”
Reviews.Author: JPMato
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed all over Walt Disney World. This was our second stay at the Wilderness Lodge. The hotel is very picturesque, with the theming exceptionally well done. It feels secluded from the rest of the property, while still being very accessible. Staff were great, as always. My only issue involved the actual room itself. It was obvious that the bathroom hasn't been remodeled since the hotel was built. Caulking was coming apart, the shower fixture was outdated and leaked if it wasn't turned extra tight, lighting was very poor, etc. At these prices, comparable hotels outside of Disney property would pay attention to these kinds of details. Also, food court felt very crowded/small for such a large hotel. Breakfast tables were sometimes tricky to secure at the counter-service restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Deluxe Resort - Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Steinhaus29
Reviews.Content: Amazing place to stay. Location is perfect! Short boat ride to Magic Kingdom and bus ride to Epcot, Typhoon Lagoon and Animal Kingdom! Would certainly stay again! Everyone was so nice and made our first trip there truly magical. Wilderness Loge has a nice beach area where you can rent little boats to cruise around the waters past the Magic Kingdom. Movies every night on the beach and the boat parade each night at 9:35. The pool was awesome (open 8:00 am - Midnight!) and the water slide was a ton of fun! The Lobby in itself is a sight to see! Lots to do for the family at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “great in and out of Disney”
Reviews.Author: 3Jennifer
Reviews.Content: WE went to Disney for the Labor day weekend. It was a last minute trip...fabulous!! This was our first trip there with our 4 and 6 year old. everything was very convenient and getting to Magic Kingdom couldn't have been easier. NO lines and multiple stops. The rooms were clean but not plush and the food was acceptable at the restaurants you can feel comfortable bring your kids. The grounds are immaculate and the pool was a great resting and relaxing place! All and all we will go back there for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Level Was A Great Experience For Our Family”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie-MP
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Disney staying at one of their hotels (previously Contemporary and Animal Kingdom Lodge). We loved the west coast design of the Wilderness Lodge and grand lobby complete with totem poles. The team on the concierge floor was excellent - attentive, informative and wonderful with the kids. Morning breakfasts, snacks and evening treats were ideal for our family, especially wine for weary adults post longs days at the park. Very convenient and great for kids looking for snacks. Pool is terrific - toddler area, hot tubs and pool with waterslide for older kids and adults. Would definitely stay concierge again. Expensive but worth it! We had an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in park”
Reviews.Author: Dpf11970
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several of the moderate and deluxe hotels at Disneyworld and think the Wilderness Lodge is fantastic! The kids love the bunk beds (a highlight of the trip) and the proximity to the Magic Kingdom is great! We love it!

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: disneydad331
Reviews.Content: This is my family's second time at Wilderness Lodge. I know it's Disney's job to go overboard and be wonderful to you, but the staff that works at the Wilderness Lodge are genuine. The rooms are pretty standard, but very well kept and clean. We had a beautiful courtyard view on the first floor with a walk out patio. We were given this upgrade from a standard room! From the check in desk to the servers at the restaurant, Wilderness Lodge is top notch! When you stay / check-in, please ask to be the flag family! It's a wonderful experience that lets you go to the roof of the Lodge and raise the flags at around 8am. It's a wonderful view and you can see every Disney Park from there. We were also invited to the breakfast on the Concierge Floor that morning, what a great treat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Disney”
Reviews.Author: Tattyadams
Reviews.Content: What I can I say? This is a truly amazing place to stay. The lobby and fireplace are amazing and many an evening can be spent lounging here. The hotel can appear dark but it just adds to the atmosphere of the place. The rooms are adequately sized and the added Disney towel arrangements are cute. Roaring Forks is a good place for a quick snack but the Whispering Canyon is a must. Just don't ask for the ketchup. Magic Kingdom is a short boat ride away an alternative to the usual buses. The background music at the hotel took me back a few years.......Bonanza, Magnificent Seven amongst others.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this property. Location is EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: southplainsgroup
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year. This location is great. I love the locations where you can take more than one form of transportation to the park. It is extremely relaxing to take the boat back and forth to the Magic Kingdom and is incredible at night. Keep in mind with Disney deluxe resort doesn't always mean the Westin. With that said, the interior corridors are very nice especially when traveling with small children. We have stayed at several of the other Disney properties and this is one of my favorites. The food in the resort is good. It would be nice if they had a bit bigger quick service meal area since so many people are on the meal plan, but this was really the only thing that I would have found negative about the resort. The buses are quick to and from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel...shame about the boats”
Reviews.Author: daveyLondon
Reviews.Content: Family stayed at the Wilderness lodge at the end of september...have stayed previously at the the Grand Floridian so this had alot to live up to... The hotel was very good value with comfortable rooms, greats beds and good facilities....roaring forks restuarant was great for snacks...i did not eat a meal there however as i was on the dining plan. My only gripe really was the boat transfers to the contempoary and magic kingdom....these were really hit and miss with waits of upto 20 mins each way...this is a real shame as the hotel is very close to both of these and it really did extend the length of the journey times however i guess unless you are on the monorail line this is to be expected at disney. However would definately go back to the wilderness lodge again as it was good value :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: sazoram
Reviews.Content: LOVE the Wilderness Lodge. This was our third time back to Disney and our third time at the Wilderness Lodge. My husband won't stay anywhere else. Rooms are great- breath taking decor and "just our style". I love that everything is under one roof. Loved "Roaring Forks"- ate ourselves silly while being entertained by the waitstaff. (Shout out to our waitress, MT (pockets- ha ha!)). Was able to see my daughter in the pool and the electric light show on the lake from our balcony. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting Decor and Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: ForTheLoveofAustin
Reviews.Content: We traveled with a group of eight and all loved the Wilderness Lodge! The best part is the great location. Every time we enjoyed the boat rides to Magic Kingdom and Epcot. The buses are not fun, but end up being part of the trip no matter which Disney resort you stay at. The staff was nice and the rooms were clean. We paid for a standard room, but we could still see the fireworks at night and enjoyed the forest view. The small cafe was good and the Roaring Forks was a hoot. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MSRuby-7
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Wilderness Lodge many times, and consider it our favorite Disney hotel. This was our 24th trip to Disney, and we have stayed in Disney resorts each time. Since the Wilderness Lodge was built, we have made this our home. It just seems to fit our style. Although we didn't stay in a suite, the room was comfortable and clean. We stayed in room 5146 overlooking a wooded area facing the villas. Unlike what some reviewers have said, our room had nice carpet and bedding. It would have been great to have a sofa, but we spent much of our time at the room on the balcony. The quiet location was perfect! One reason we prefer the Wilderness Lodge is having everything under one roof. It is really convenient to get food, or shop at the mercantile. It is especially nice during rainy weather. We enjoyed the convenience of the boats to Magic Kingdom and the Contemporary. Bus service was adequate, but seemed to make several stops before getting us to our destination. Some trips to Animal Kingdom and Epcot took over an hour. I don't remember making so many stops on previous visits. I still feel that we will choose Wilderness Lodge on our next visit. It just seems quiet and more like home to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful themed hotel, low end deluxe”
Reviews.Author: Antandmike
Reviews.Content: Great property near the magic kingdom. We read many reviews and will agree this is not really a "deluxe" hotel, but Disney does charge a moderate hotel price. The grounds are amazing we stayed in room 6034 with a perfect view of the castle and fireworks, it's a corner room two beds and very quite. The laundry is directly down stairs and is by the pool and roaring forks which is the quick service restaurant with excellent food. The bus to AK does stop at the GF hotel all other busses stop at fort wilderness. The only con was the old man at the bell service desk, very grumpy, and un-Disney attitude but was the only person we ran into like that. Plus I would leave a note for housekeeping not to turn your air off it was so hot when we got back to the room in the afternoon. But again fir the price a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: oec7516
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth time staying at the WL. Again never disappointed. This time I tried a courtyard view which wasn't bad. It's a lot quiter than the pool view but I still prefer the woods view. Everyone at the hotel was friendly as always, great service, quality room, wonderful mouse keeper. Roaring forks (the quick serve) was delicious as always (try the grilled chicken sandwich). I made a mistake when leaving and had forgot to update Disney with a new flight number causing me to not have enough time to make it to the airport on the Magical Express. They gave us a voucher for a cab ride to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: chris b
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days here in September and the place is a fantastic family destination. Kids will love the northwestern rustic atmosphere with a stream running through the lobby, old faithful out back, pool with slide and games in the afternoon. Easy access to magic kingdom. Great restaurant with the "Whispering" Canyon Cafe. Will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that we expected & not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: ksmama
Reviews.Content: So I guess we thought the rooms would be bigger & nicer than where we've stayed before. Not the case at all! The grounds were gorgeous & the lobby was amazing, but so not worh the extra money in our opinion and we will not be staying here again. Our 6 year old son did enjoy the balcony, but we decided we wouldn't spend the extra money to stay there again as the rooms were just too small. They had us in a room that did not have a view as we were paying for and moved us with no problems. Most of the people working there were nice. My husband was snubbed by one of waitresses in the bar and the pool bar didn't hve set hours, but rather closed anytime they wanted my husband was told when he asked about the hours. NOT convenient,we never got to use it. The Roaring Forks was TINY & this is another reason we would go back to Riverside or Port Orleans. The beach, while our son thought that was cool & I have to admit, I thought the idea of movies on the beach was cool - we could not get past the biting that my husbandand I were getting on our feet & had to leave. Sand fleas... YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasures Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: LisaBlockusBrown
Reviews.Content: One of our favorites! We are DVC members and stayed at the Villas at the Wilderness Lodge for a long weekend and left wishing we had extra days to stay. This resort can be enjoyed with or without a trip to any of the Disney Parks. The lobby is breathtaking and will leave you looking up, down, and around every time you walk through it. The surrounding grounds are exceptionally well kept with tall pines and vibrant flowers everywhere - it is easy to forget you are still in Florida. The geyser is a little hokey - but Disney magic just the same. For those looking for a fun pool, the pool at the Wilderness Lodge has a slide a three year old or sixty three year old will like. We spent an afternoon on a treasure hunt looking for a dozen Hidden Mickeys around the property. In the evening we sat on the beach and watched a movie from our lounge chairs until the electric light parade on the lake came into view. I haven't seen that show since 1976 and it was quirky fun for 15 minutes. We were tempted to take the boat that runs between the Lodge, the Contemporary (so close you won't believe it) and the Campgrounds - just to be on Bay Lake. The details that went into the design and construction of this resort are worth taking the extra time to enjoy. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful in every way. Our room was ready before 4pm and our bags were at our room within three minutes of calling the desk! The Whispering Canyon restaurant can have a wait - plan accordingly. We look forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth $1k/Night”
Reviews.Author: Piedmont33
Reviews.Content: We spent the extra to do a "bucket List" item and stayed in the President's Suite. Nice but NOT worth $1k per night. The Bedroom was small and overloaded with furniture- be sure to move a few items before going to bed or you will shout great obscenities if you get up in the middle of the night! The coffee maker was one of those OVER-rated Kuerig things but the supplies were for a conventional coffee maker: they are NOT interchangable. It was decent but not the cleanest place I've ever stayed in. I could have fingered my name in the dust on the underside of the glass on the desk. Upside: Great bath with a super shower, lots of ammenities in the baths, lots of towels, a nice selection of goodies in the concierge. Sidenote: if staying here in ANY concierge room and you want a cold brew, they are free at the Concierge. Otherwise, it is a lousy selection in the Hotel store and a lowly Budweiser is $6.00!!!! It was a nice stay, but if I had known then what I know now, all that $$$ would have been spent on something else. It just ain't worth that kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: maesea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at this hotel for 12 years. We keep coming back here because of the location, for it is just perfect.We always eat at Artist Point,just love everything about that restaurant. However, as we come back year after year, we see the hotel getting a bit tired, it needs some upgrading now. It's still maintained, but the carpets throughout need replacing and the rooms could use a little refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Club level review”
Reviews.Author: ohana7
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this is our favourite resort. It is laid back and a change of pace from the parks. On this visit we stayed club level. The room was the same as the rest of the resort with bunk beds. Not a huge amount of space but room enough for us. The old faithful lounge was always spotless, food and beverages were plentiful and fresh brought out constantly. Breakfast was the same each day cereal and fruit, lunch cookies and goldfish, dinner hot appetiser, chilli, pot stickers, chowder and salad, cheese and crackers, dessert was a cobbler. The staff were very friendly and always looking to chat, and always ready to welcome you back after your day out. The room was magic kingdom view, and indeed the castle could be seen, but there was only half window, so the room was a little dark, the room was also above the service area, so when ever you were out on the balcony it was very noisy, especially during the mornings. We had club level at a 40% discount, and I felt at this level the price was about right ($300 ish per night). Had we paid rack I would have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Met our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: SMcLafferty
Reviews.Content: While I would agree with others that this is not a "deluxe" hotel, it is nice and served every purpose we needed on our recent three-night stay. The major complaint I have is that the bed was terribly uncomfortable. We did notice on the last day that the other queen bed which our son was sleeping in was a little better so it may be hit and miss. I would also caution other travelers that the rooms are not huge. We had two queens in our room with a pack n play for our infant and it made for very tight quarters. There was only one cleaning oversight that I noticed. They did have lots to offer to do in the evenings with the kids - good pool, movie on the beach etc... I wished that there was one other dining option. Whispering Canyon was good for the kids, but Artist Point was too quiet for a 3 year old. Another middle of the range restaurant option would have been nice (and traveling to another location for dinner after a long day at the park just wasn't happening!)

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: scrapmomsyr
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Wilderness Lodge 3 times and my boys love it! They refuse to stay anywhere else. The pool is great. They have a guyser that erupts every hour which they find fun. The boat to the Magic Kingdom is wonderful. You are there in minutes. Everywhere else requires a bus ride which isn't bad but you do make one other stop before you get to your destination. The staff is great too. We love visiting at Christmastime with the large tree in the center of the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Peace away from the Parks”
Reviews.Author: KerriSayville
Reviews.Content: Just want to say that I have stayed at this property numerous times and I'm finally writing a review. I love the place so much that I bought into the Disney Vacation club. The Wilderness lodge is a peaceful boat ride away from the Magic Kingdom, as well as the Contemporary with Monorail service to Epcot. The Pool is in a beautiful setting with a fun slide and quick service food and drink nearby. The lobby is magnificent any time of the year, but the holiday decorations really are amazing blending with the theme of the resort. Being that Disney hotels in the deluxe category are not cheap....I think the Lodges prices are worth the slightly smaller rooms and no direct monorail access.

Reviews.Title: “Not Deluxe IMHO, But many reasons we'd return!”
Reviews.Author: vanchelle
Reviews.Content: We are Disney Lovers! After visiting the Wilderness Lodge for dinner on our last trip we were eager to stay at the lodge if we could. While my review is mixed...we really would return!! Read on for the good stuff:) In the end, I feel that-Dollar for Dollar- the rooms are not any better than the moderate WDW properties. Basic hotel style room, smallish bathroom, decor isn't especially over the top, fridge, mini desk, TV, IPOD alarm dock, small terrace. Clean but not pristine, carpets in rooms/halls are aging. I would NOT pay rack rates for this room-discount only! We were fortunate to book at the 40% off rate. Here are the reasons WHY WE WOULD RETURN! >The ambiance is very cool, we enjoyed it as did our 6 year old. >The hotel did a great job recognizing our nephew's birthday celebration. >We had a very swift check in and were happy with our 6th floor MK facing room-we could view the fireworks and see a bit of the Castle and Space Mt. >The Quick Service was great-smaller than Saratoga Springs, Pop, or Caribbean Beach but the food tasted better and we liked the selection better. >The pool-was always clean and in early Sept, we had no problem finding loungers at any point in the day. pool games were good for the kids- 1 side of the pool was always quiet-kids stayed on the slide side. >Hot tub-very comfy and not crowded >Beachfront is serene...grab coffee and just watch the lake >Loved the boat launch transportation-7 or 8 minute ride -we used it for MK, breakfast at the Poly and visits to the Contemporary >Campfire at the camp was fantastic-Chip and Dale dance and sing, they sign autographs and take pics (You can get a S'More pack for 8.99 at the wagon) or pick them up sooner at the market) >Cast Members were wonderful-pleasant, helpful and outgoing >when I shared a concern about a small area of cleanliness, they corrected it immediately and left us a carved white chocolate Donald duck:) >Magical express/bell check out was great-timely and effortless on our part >Cub's Den childcare was helpful, my nephew enjoyed himself for the few hrs he visited. >If the price is right...we'd be back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KPrich
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The only problem with it is the price. It can be very expensive. The pool is awesome and the layout is superb. The design is set up to look like a giant log cabin. Transportation from the hotel to the parks is easy offering both bus and boat transport.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wai to come back!”
Reviews.Author: petesquad
Reviews.Content: My family and I are big travelers and Disney fans, and have been to Disney at least once a year since we started a family 18 years ago. We have stayed at almost every Disney Lodge, from budget to Deluxe. This was our first time to their Wilderness Lodge, and it surpassed our best expectations. The lodge is Rustic, yet elegant - not an easy accomplishment. The service was superb, particularly the concierge, however every "cast member" we ran into were pleasnat and eager to. We stayed in a one bedroon suite, and while slightly smaller than some of Disney's other Deluxe Villas, was spotless, well appointed and exceptionally comfortable. The location is great, an easy walk or boat rideto the Magic Kingdom, or the Transportation Center if you want to visit a different location. The food options are plentiful, and the food better than expected. All in all, It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Magical hotel”
Reviews.Author: anthrojason
Reviews.Content: My husband scored a great discount deal to this hotel where we spent an evening on a mini-retreat. The hotel is beautifully decorated in the NW lodge theme. The rooms are efficient and clean.
