The best part of the hotel IMHO is the boat launches to magic kingdom which are pretty special inane of themselves, but are even more so at night when the boats are lit up with thousands of little twinkly lights. I am usually not that into Disney, but it's hard to not be taken in by surroundings like this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: camtell
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days in August 2011. Hotel Lobby and Grounds are beautiful. We were welcomed as soon as we pulled up to the hotel. Staff was super friendly. Rooms are Pretty Good. We reserved the lowest price room and when checking in asked for a room with bunk beds. They upgraded the room at no charge which made our 6 and 4 year old happy. The room had a beautiful view of the coutyard, pool and lake. The hotel is very close to the Magic Kingdom, which is nice , but really not that important. Disney has a terrific transportation system. Next time I will try to set aside one day to spend at the hotel pool. Our last day we had breakfast in the lobby restaurant which was awesome. Staff is super friendly and they have fun activities for the kids. Overall it was a wonderful experience for my kids first disney trip

Reviews.Title: “Many Perks/Still not what I imagined”
Reviews.Author: KristieKrejci
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, teenage son and 7 yr old daughter, stayed at the Wilderness Lodge during the third week of July. I will have to say, hotel aside the weather was miserable!!! I would not recommend going during the summer if at all possible--the crowds are ridiculous and the weather is terrible. However, our family was impressed with some aspects of Wilderness Lodge. It was our first Deluxe category stay at Disney and we were interested in finding out if it were worth the extra money we paid. The transportation to Magic Kingdom is a cinch. Not enough good things can be said about having a direct boat to the Kingdom. Epcot isn't too bad as it is easy to take the boat and then get on the monorail. Of course endless walking is involved, but this IS Disney. Now, if you want to go to Hollywood Studios, Downtown Disney, or Animal Kingdom, prepare for the longest 4 mile bus ride of your life. First the bus must stop at Ft Wilderness Campground, and that is out of the way quite a bit. This was a big downer for my family but we spend more time at MK than any other park so I think that we can let that go. The hotel has a beautiful theme and grounds and two queen size beds. Our room was upgraded on arrival to have a nice view of the pool and the geiser. I will say for those sensitive for noise, ask for a different room. On the 5th floor we could still hear the pool music loud and clear. They do stop that before too late though and its fine with the doors closed. The Whispering Canyon and Artist Point are both nice places for dinner or breakfast, which made life easier, no reservations were needed for either. Not much more to say, its a Disney Hotel and when it comes down to it, even the deluxes lack luxury of even a Holiday Inn, the internet is NOT free, and there is no free continental breakfast. Regardless, in Disney you are paying for the privilege of staying in a themed hotel with proximity to the parks. We have stayed at the Pop Century, Port Orleans Riverside, and Coronado Springs Hotel in the past. Out of these, Wilderness Lodge wins out on theme and proximity. However, I have never been dissatisfied at Disney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - perfect for our family!”
Reviews.Author: Stokesbe
Reviews.Content: Fabulous resort with great pool, lake activities and food. The room was good sized with bunk beds for my 2 kids. We loved it and will stay there again for another Disney trip. We even took a day off the parks to ride boats on the lake and hang out at the pool with the waterfall and water slide.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lodge but prefer Animal Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: keltic14
Reviews.Content: This is in no way a negative review of the Wilderness Lodge. First impressions are lasting impressions and the drive up as well as the lobby are stunning. I traveled with my wife and my 5 year old daughter. The room was a good size but we paid extra for a view but the view we had was mostly of other balconies and a little bit of the pool. We were close to the exit to the pool/geyser area, which is very impressive. We booked a 2pm lunch at the Whispering Canyon Cafe because we heard that it was very lively and fun for the kids. I guess our time was too late because it was not what we expected. The waitress tried her hardest to but there was no atmosphere since there were only 4 or 5 tables. There seemed to be more life when we walked by the Cafe later in the week so I'll put it down to bad timing. The quick serve restaurant was good. There was a great selection and it we never waited long for our food. The location was great for access to the Magic Kingdom. There is a boat that's only a 5 minute trip right to the front gate. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus to the other parks. The one thing I liked was that the bus only stopped at the campground before going to the park and was the first stop on the way back. My sister-in-law stayed at the Broadway Inn and was the 4th or 5th stop on the way back from some parks. As usual in Disney, everyone was very helpful. From the front desk, to housekeeping to the shop, everyone was great. I preferred Animal Kingdom only because of my daughter's experience. It seemed like there was more for her to do and waking up to a giraffe eating from a tree right outside your room was unbelievable. The Animal Kingdom Lodge was as impressive, if not more, than Wilderness Lodge and the pool area was great. People had issues with Animal Kingdom being too far away from the parks and long waits for the buses but I didn't find this an issue. When it comes to comparing the 2 lodges, I guess it just comes down to taste. We honeymooned in South Africa and our daughter loves animals so that's why we lean toward AKL. I would highly recommend the Wilderness Lodge to anyone though.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, great location, crowded pool...”
Reviews.Author: pabirds
Reviews.Content: Just spent Labor Day weekend here. The lobby is a "WOW!". Rooms are clean, as is almost always the case with Disney. Pool area is not big enough for all the tons of people who stay here, but the water is kept warm and the surroundings are pleasant with lots of "rocks" and pine trees. The pool is especially nice for kids, because during the day, the Disney folks do poolside Bingo, a dunk tank sort of thing where kids can try to get their dad's wet, and there's a pool volleyball net. There's also a small slide, but this is strictly for real young kids. The bus stop is a short walk from the elevators, but a nice tip is the boat ride you can get from the dock behind the pool to Magic Kingdom, which is a nice break from the busses, and a GREAT way to leave the park and get back to the hotel, especially if you're willing to leave a little before the fireworks wrap-up. The restaurants are nice, but here's a tip... for a very affordable hot, tasty breakfast, head to the small snack shop near the entrance to the pool. You can get enormous bacon-cheese-and-egg croissants here for about $5.50 and they let you walk the food back to your room, using provided trays. You can buy juice, too, and if you have leftovers, most rooms have a fridge, so, "Viola!". For about $8 a pop, you can get two Mickey Waffles. I would highly recommend the Bananas Foster. Again, this is a cheaper alternative for familes who don't want to waste time and tip money on table service in the morning. You can also get cheap lunch sandwiches and even fudge a cheapo dinner here, if you happen to be at the hotel. There's a nice bar that will allow you to take drinks into the lobby in the evening, or out on a nice, quiet deck just off the lobby. Oh yeah---this is typical Disney---I had accidentally left my room key after using it to charge a drink at the bar, and the bartender tracked me down on the outdoor deck to return it, all with a smile. This may not be quite as convenient as the Big 3 resorts on the monorail line, or the group of hotels that are walking distance from Epcot (Beach Club, etc.). But the price is a little less than those, and you still are in one of Disney's larger, deluxe resorts, which is a nice way to go.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!”
Reviews.Author: marierobichaud
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Lodge, stayed at POR last Nov. and couldn't wait to get back to the Lodge. We have visited most of the other properties and have to say that none compare, the theme is continued everywhere and it is so relaxing. The staff is the best and make you feel at home. We are saving our pennies for our next trip, and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “I've been there, and back, and back, and back agian...”
Reviews.Author: sulldogga
Reviews.Content: My wife and I always prefer to stay at the lodge. I've stayed at other Deluxe resorts on the property but I always go back to the lodge. It offers the perfect combination of rustic appeal, proximity to multiple transport options and great amenities (pool, restaraunts, etc....). I also have found it one of the best housekept resorts, although Disney is tops at all their resorts as far as cleanliness and friendly service of the staff (the parks could use some work, but that's another review...) Go here for your first visit, or your one hundred and first. You wil not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge - The Truth”
Reviews.Author: PWPres
Reviews.Content: Well folks i'm back with another Disney resort review...(check out my other reviews on AKL,SSR,Beach Club,Poly and Pop Century)....once again this is a review from a regular person just like yourselves and not some lady complaining that she has been waiting for a bus for 21 minutes and "they said 20".........if there is one word i could use to describe WL it's RELAXING.....even with a lot of families,the place just soaks up the noise and gives off an air of serenity. Beautiful and clean and reminds one (of couse) of the AKL. The cast was friendly and very helpful(since we have been to Disney many times,we didn't need a lot of help but i'm sure if we did this staff would have been all over it with a smile..lol)....i dont just throw out 5 stars on every resort i review but i think the WL justified the rating. We loved it. ......you may have read some negative reviews on Artist Point....throw them out the window....elegant place,delicious food,first class service.....but very expensive....very much worth 2 DP credits. This resort is ideal for a romantic getaway as well as a family vacation. Boat to MK is very convenient. The pool can get a little crowded but if you pick your spots and times you can get it almost to yourselves. This is the truth people you will love the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: hipmouse
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge mimics a quaint Vail or Aspen mountain retreat.. and being from Colorado I finally felt relaxed and at home coming here after a hot and crowded day at the parks.. it was just the retreat and peace I needed with my 2 and 4 year old sons and husband. From the second you come into view one of the hostess/ front desk employee greets you and walks you to the front desk to make sure you know where you are going. The architecture and design might go unnoticed by some but they really took the time with handcarved totem poles, a frame windows -- a 100 foot tall fireplace. The geyser that starts in the lobby and trickles down into the waterfall and then the pool is awesome! We had a balcony overlooking the smaller pool and even during crowded times of the day my kids could nap because it's a very quiet resort. The Roaring Forks restaurant had much better food than most quick dining restaurants offer and they will pack it up to go for you if you want to eat in your room. My kids really had fun at the real sand beach making castles and playing on the playground equipment. Transportation to Magic Kingdom is a breeze.. just a short boat ride away and buses are ample that go to the other parks. I was hoping that they would have better coffee than the value resorts which is just awful.. Nescafe syrup style coffee.. but we at least had an in room coffee maker that was a bit better. There's a parade and movie nightly for the kids and a waterslide in the big pool... so much to do at just the resort it was hard to make it to the parks :-) If you want your stay to be a peaceful retreat where you can relax and have quiet after the parks this resort is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Home, at Last!!”
Reviews.Author: TheMarschallin
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite resort, hands down! I get teary-eyed when I get to the guard house and the guy says, "Welcome Home" and get a great big grin on my face when the Lodge comes in sight after rounding the corner. As always, the standards here are high and I've never stayed here when the place is less than spotless, but the front desk staff always seems to be "training" someone and the check in process this time, once again, took over an hour. Do check your room keys and make sure to ask if they are coded with the proper kind of park ticket, as they are often wrong and you don't discover it until you get to the park gate! February is a nice time to visit WDW because not all of the schools in the country are off, so it's not crowded, and by that time, I really need a break from the snow, ice and cold! Ask for a room with a Wood's View in the North Wing if you like a more peaceful vista. On the higher floors- 5&6- you might get a glimpse of the fireworks in the Magic Kingdom- but I love the ground floor rooms in the center of the hallway; easy access to the lobby on one side and the end door the pool and the dock on the other end. The best part is that you can watch the otters play in the pond outside your patio window! Mousekeeping was great, as usual, and it's always fun to see if any towel animals are waiting somewhere in your room when you get back from the parks! Don't forget to tip them EACH day, because you may not get the same person every time. While the waters in Bay Lake can impact the ferry runs to the MK, but it was running and is the fastest way to get to the MK. In the colder months, it's nice to grab a lounge chair and sit on the narrow white beach ,listening to the waves lapping on the shore while the kids rent bikes and head over to Fort Wilderness! Then go back inside and curl up with a book in front of the huge fireplace or in the second floor window seat overlooking the Lake. The Wilderness Lodge is considered a "Deluxe" Resort, and the rooms here (and at the Animal Kingdom Lodge) are a little smaller than at the other Deluxes, but there are often some really good deals to be had if you ask when making your reservation. Personally, I really don't like palm trees and the whole "tropical" thing, so staying at the WL affords me a little bit of the NW while in Florida! Although I look at other resorts and price out the trip each time, I always return to the WL and wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A great time had by all!”
Reviews.Author: Kahala4
Reviews.Content: We prefer to stay on the grounds of Disney to take advantage of the magic hours. We go about twice a year and have stayed at many locations. We tend to stay at either deluxe hotels or value depending on what we expect from our trip. We're not a big fan of the moderate hotels because you still need to take the bus and they aren't all that much nicer than a Pop Century type hotel. As for the Wilderness Lodge, it was excellent. We enjoyed the overall rustic feeling of the hotel and that it never felt crowded. It had an easy-going feel to it and yet you knew you were at one of the more upscale hotels on the grounds. The pool was nice and the kids liked the slide. We enjoyed the little things that made it fun like the nightly campfire with marshmallows and the movies under the stars. It was easy to rent bikes and boats. The water launch to the Magic Kingdom was a welcome relief from the bus. It was so relaxing on the water at night going back to the hotel. We didn't go to the Artist's restaurant, but did eat at Whispering Canyon. The food was delicious and the family atmosphere was fun. The counter service restaurant was fine, but didn't have nearly as big a selection as the value hotels. This is expected since the value hotels only have counter-service. The rooms were spacious and comfy. The sinks were outside the bathroom which made it easier for everyone to get ready faster. The kids liked the bunk bed option. The room also had a refrigerator which was convenient for the Whispering Canyon left-overs! We were able to use the microwave in the counter-service restaurant to re-heat things. The front staff, including the concierge were terrific. They want out of their way to make sure we had the best stay possible. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkDad_of_2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many of the Disney hotels over the years and have steadly found them to be going downhill. You would think at the price they charge you for the rooms they would at least throw in free internet ,maybe a microwave just to heat a pastry or a single cup of water for tea (instead of using the coffee maker). I still love the overall theming of the hotels but you can get more bang for your buck staying at one of their good neighbor hotels

Reviews.Title: “Another one of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: srfdoggin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August of 2010. Went down to Disney on a whim with nowhere to stay. Used a time share that we have and lucked out to have stayed on Disney's property esp. this place. After calling our time share we arrived from Mass. Less than 2 hours from the property and were able to book these accommodations. Stayed in a 1 BR Villa nice and close to the transportation stops and Lobby/Dining hall. Extremely clean grounds. Clean pools. Very convenient having Laundry in the rooms and nice to have a full kitchen to do quick breakfasts at. You can take the bus's to the park or take the boat over to the Magic Kingdom which we did often if the lines where tong for the buses. Your right outside the Magic Kingdom so the ride is Ultra short, which was nice traveling with a 11 month old. I have been to disney many many times but once you have a child you look at things in the park a different way. Never realized how many things a small child can do here at the park. She'll never remember it but she still had fun. Very cool Train display in the "Train Room" in the lobby of our Villa's. The train that was used at Walt home is on display with stories and pictures. Would def. stay here again once I try the rest of the resort hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and atmosphere, room was ok”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in the Wilderness Lodge for a visit to Animal Kingdom and the Magic Kingdom. I had never had the opportunity to stay inside of Walt Disney World, and decided on this trip to go all out as this was also my 3 children's first visit. The location on the lake was great. There is boat service to the Magic Kingdom from the hotel. Only a 7-10 minute ride. The Lodge itself is beautiful and really make you feel like you are in Colorado or Yellowstone. The Lobby itself is worth seeing as it is HUGE, almost 8 stories. The whole structure is post-n-beam log cabin design. There is a faux river running through the lobby and then outside to create a waterfall that appears to then become part of the pool and hot tubs. The kids loved the pool and water slide. Even more that they enjoyed the parks: which could have saved me a ton of money :-). Staff was very attentive and helpful. Especially Jasmine who helped me on two occasions; one locating a nearby pharmacy that would deliver, and then helping with options in case we needed to stay a few extra days due to hurricane Irene. As there were 5 of us we were forced to book adjoining rooms. This was a bit annoying as we usually request a cot for our son, and all of stay in a single room. But this is Disney, and you know what that means to your wallet. Plus this is one of the "premium" hotels in DW, so my typical frugality would be frowned upon. The rooms were spacious and clean, with towel animals left by housekeeping, a mini fridge, and double sinks outside of the bathroom. Both rooms had balcony's that overlooked the pool. The room and decor are in need of an update as it did feel kind of gloomy with the dark prints and overly painted woodwork. I believe the hotel was built in 1995 so it is due. Bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: md662
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed five nights at the Lodge in mid-August. The front desk agent who was waiting for us curbside when we pulled up to the front doors was a nice, unexpected touch. Check in was a breeze. I appreciate the international students that compliment the front desk staff as they strive hard to present a professional, polished interaction. Kids had fun at the swimming pool, although the water temperature was a little too warm for my liking (think bath water). Counter service restaurant was surprisingly tasty and not too pricey for a Disney resort. Coffee at that restaurant was better-tasting than the stuff they served at Chef Mickey's. What's the deal with that? Room was very clean. Nice to have the USA Today at the door step each morning as well. Found the majority of cast members to be friendly. Kids spent a few hours at the Cubs Den in the hotel lobby one night and seemed to enjoy themselves. Would recommend and consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: KauaiMom2011
Reviews.Content: Needs updating. Carpet, tile, bedspreads-- needs to be remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: 25yoldcanadian
Reviews.Content: We were visiting WDW as a group of 4 adults. Two of us had visited Wilderness Lodge before, and two of us were first timers to WDW. We opted for early check-in, and arrived at 8:00am. As we were leaving the security checkpoint, we overheard the guard radio ahead to the lodge, and so when we pulled up at the front there were attendants waiting for us. (actually, they were dancing while our car pulled up) They unloaded our luggage and checked it in with Bell Services. They use a barcode system so it was quick and painless. We opted to self-park and got a spot right in front of the building. During check-in our attendant tried to get us into a room right away, but when there were none available he collected our cellphone number, and we received a text when our room was available (about 10:00am) Meanwhile our luggage stayed with Bell services. When we got back to our room at night our luggage had not made it up, but we checked with Bell services and they sent it up right away. The room was much larger than I was expecting, on the 2nd level. We had a terrace overlooking the pool. We paid for a standard view room, so I am not sure if this was actually standard view or if we were upgraded because of space... Either way we were not complaining! The room had a fan and AC, and they were quick to bring up extra pillows. The soaps were pretty nice, and the room had nice touches. It is too bad that we did not spend more time there but there is too much to do outside the room! A few other reviewers have mentioned that it is annoying that room service ends at midnight, and I would agree: We got back very late from the park and would have loved to have some snacks brought up, or to be able to use our bottomless mugs at the snack counter for some coffee or pop. Unfortunately everything was closed up tight and in desperation we ended up ordering Dominos Pizza. We would also agree that the fee for internet use is a little bit 2001. I know that it would cost Disney a lot to support a free wireless network, but we are paying a lot to be there, and if Super 8 can do it, Disney should be able to figure it out. The pool area was very clean, and there were a LOT of towels available, even well after "closing" hours. It was great to come back from the park and have a warm swim and soak our feet in the hot tub. The smaller pool at the Villas was nice to try out, but neither were busy by the time we had a chance to try them out (very late at night and early in the morning). Above all, convenience of the parks, and the service from "cast members" was what makes this hotel worth the money. Although we would like to try a different resort just for fun next time, we would not hesitate to recommend Wilderness Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Great family accommodation in a lovely setting”
Reviews.Author: Katie S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a lodge whih was spacious and had everything you needed for a comfortable self catered stay. The lodge was clean and the daily maid service really helped especially with two children in tow! The pool at the hotel was lovely and was a great place to have some time out from the parks. Mickey's Backyard BBQ, held at the hotel, wast also excellent and enjoyed by both the kids and parents! We will be back there next year. Having stayed at five different Disney hotels over the years, this is the one that we would go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Parks, but not very Deluxe”
Reviews.Author: triciads
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we only had a few days at Disney and wanted to be near Magic Kingdom and Hollywood Studios. The location was great, the hotel was fairly clean but it was far from a true "deluxe" hotel. The pool area was small, not sure if that is typical for a Disney hotel. We were not impressed with the restaurants either. There were some issues with the hallway and terrace door locking. Was a bit concerned about the safety too-- being in the "wilderness" and all. I would probably stay in a different hotel next time -- unless I got a great deal on the rate.

Reviews.Title: “VIP Service at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: BMichal
Reviews.Content: The trip was for a family of 6. Three adults and 3 children (17, 15 and 10). Since we had a large number in our party, we were upgraded to the Concierge Service. Check-in was a breeze. We were a little early, but were hand delivered upstairs to the Concierge Lounge and had refreshments while waiting. Check-in staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful during our entire stay. I don't believe we waited more than 45 minutes for our room (early flight) and were given a room next to the pool area, which was great for the kids. Room was a bit cramped for the number of people, but honestly, we were there for the parks, play, swimming and exploring. Sleeping, showering and a quick rest was the main use for the room which suited us just fine. The hotel itself was immaculate and cleaning staff was fantastic. The pool was great and well supervised by lifeguards. My daughter loved the on-going activities around the pool area. She and I also enjoyed some of the nightly movies on the beach. The teenagers loved the game room. The VIP Level Lounge offered a quick breakfast. We would leave early in the morning, so always grabbed something the day before for a quick breakfast for the kids. Nightly snacks, appetizers and FREE alcoholic beverages were great. The Whispering Canyons was hysterical. I think you need to have a personality that matches the antics-if you are looking for something quiet, it is NOT the place for you. We loved our waitress and the continual noisiness of the restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised when the Head Cook came out and visited with me due to my severe tree nut allergy. Going into restaurants and eating food that I have not cooked myself is extremely scary, however he walked me through the menu and even made me a special desert. We used the bus system quite a bit, which may be the only complaint, as some times we needed to wait a long time. Another complaint is the lack of internet - would have liked to have posted pictures for the family back home, but as mentioned, we were not in the room that much. Liked using the boat into the Magic Kingdom. Overall a very pleasant stay and would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Not deluxe in our eyes”
Reviews.Author: TOGETHER_WE_TRAVEL35
Reviews.Content: Last Christmas we stayed at The Grand Floridian and found The Wilderness Lodge to be lacking behind even the moderate resorts never mind the GF. The Whispering Canyons restaurant is so unbelievably noisy, yet quite plain, boring and bland inside. The Artist point restaurant is too posh and you simply cant relax with those type of prices and lack of atmopshere. They miss a trick with not having a view of the fabulous woodlands or pool areas from the restaurant. I also find it hard to believe that hotels that cost this much dont have a bar in the lobby or main area to sit and relax in. If there was one, we certainly couldnt find it. A woodland view room can get quite tedious after several days, and a standard view room can leave you overlooking delivery lorries day and night. However online it is impossible to book any club level rooms so goodness knows how you do that. The pool was unuseable in December due to the cold weather and Disney really need to consider indoor pools at their hotels. The health club had minimal and often broken equipment. I find it incredible to believe that a hotel in 2011 does not have wifi access in rooms and room service stops at midnight. What are you supposed to do at 1am for food when you return from your extra magic hours? Especially when most food outlets are closed in the parks by that time. Even a sandwich would suffice but you wont get anything here. The room does not have a stocked mini bar. I cant remembert the last time I paid Â£300 per night for a hotel room without a stocked mini bar, no wifi, a small room, and no room service after midnight. I think the improvements to customer relations need to be looked at at this hotel more than any other. Staff walk past you without aknowledging you and the check in staff can be very rude. I had to ask for our honeymoon badges and she then didnt even congratulate us. She just looked as if to say "how old are you". It was very embarrassing. Especially after we had queued for 45 minutes to check in. It was so slow and the room we had requested (woods view) was not what we were given. It was the reason we spent so much money on a deluxe resort, to get deluxe treatment, but the staff at the wilderness lodge really fall behind the Coronado Springs resort whos staff were extremely friendly when we stayed there. We also had huge problems booking online and Disney would not allow us to carry our Dining plan accross from The Coronado Springs Resort where we had spent our first 6 nights and bought 14 day park tickets, into the Wilderness Lodge where we moved to for Christmas Eve and our final 7 nights. Its disgraceful and Disney really need to close this loophole with the disney dining plan booking problems. I find booking with Disney so restrictive in that you can not contact the hotel directly and ask for a bottle of champagne on arrival for your wife etc. You send email after email that goes unanswered and telephone operators, apart from Dsiney Dining operators, can be extremely rude. We wont be staying in a disney property again. Extraordinary prices for below ordinary service and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Family fun”
Reviews.Author: TravelKing76689
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this property. It is a wonderful property for families. Housekeeping always leaves towels in shapes of various animals and the kids love it. Pool has a nice slide for smaller childre and they love the totem poles. Our Disney experience is always great. I recommend getting the dining plan also. Having everything paid for in advance is great. We have been able to take advantage of their free dining periods the last two trips and that is even better.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey S
Reviews.Content: Disney's Wilderness Lodge gets the job done, in that they have the free transport to the parks like everywhere else, they have 2 swimming pools, and they have clean beds. Our initial arrival went very badly though, as the check-in person gave us the wrong directions to the elevator, they didn't offer anyone to help us or at least walk us to the elevator, and when I went back to speak to management they were incredibly rude. Not a good start. Our first room smelled like someone had thrown up, and we had two double beds even though we promised a queen-sized bed. We complained, they gave us another room, it smelled fine but the beds were the same. We asked for a bigger bed, and the staff insisted they were dual queens and the bigger bed is only for special needs individuals. The food... nothing special here at all. And Whispering Pines gets old VERY quickly. All you can hear is people yelling at the top of their lungs when you're in the lobby and main restaurant. Pretty aggravating considering how much they charge for such a limited selection too. Fitness center had a lot of broken equipment, really not what I expected. Next time I'd sooner stay at Saratoga Springs or the Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: MissMatryona
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Wilderness Lodge repeatedly now and couldn't be more pleased. The theme pulls you in as soon as you walk in the door, you are surrounded by sights, sounds and scents that all work together to welcome you. To get to the parks you can step out back and take a a short boat ride or take one of the many buses that stop on a regular basis. (note: this is the one resort on the lagoon that is not connected with the monorail, mind you that wouldn't fit in very well with the theme, but you can always take a boat to the Contemporary and then use the monorail if you like). Every hour during the day "Old Faithful" erupts out back next to the pool. And if you find you are at the hotel in the evening instead of one of the parks, make sure you take a stroll down by the docks. Each night they have a light parade on the water that is not to be missed (ask the front desk for the time they are scheduled to come by). As with Disney in general, that cast members go above and beyond for you. They will check you in and hold your luggage while you go to the park if your room isn't ready yet. They can help mail gift items home for you. And they are always friendly and welcoming. When deciding on my rating I was torn between "Excellent" and "Very Good" only because of the expense. I mean it's not everyday that I would spend hundreds of dollars on a room at a hotel. But then I thought I had to be more fair and objective about it, the only way to do that is to compare it to the other hotels that are of the same level of service and in the same area. Those hotels are The Contemporary, The Grand Floridian and the Polynesian. Out of those hotels on the same lagoon, the Wilderness Lodge does indeed have the lowest rates, hence me leaving it at an "Excellent" rating.

Reviews.Title: “Really Cool”
Reviews.Author: I_L0ve_Travel_Too
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we kept oohing and ahhing over the lobby. It is very dramatic and definitely looks like a Rocky Mountain lodge. We loved the river running through the resort and the pool was amazing. The kids loved the geyser and the restaurant is also very good. We used the boat shuttle and it was much more relaxing than driving and parking the car. The room was okay, we had a balcony overlooking the pool. The kids thought it was great because of the bunk beds.

Reviews.Title: “We love it and the staff are excellent!”
Reviews.Author: casofamily
Reviews.Content: The Artist's Point in the hotel is an excellent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings on Disney's Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: ss69-72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Disney's Wilderness Lodge for one night in August. This was the last day of our trip and the first time we stayed onsite. It was supposed to be a highlight and we splurged to stay here. I was expecting a lot of Disney magic, but did not find it. With that said, however, the foyer was beautiful and breath-taking. It had a gorgeous fireplace and a creek that flows down to the pool. We were excited to be there and couldn't wait to get to our room. The young lady who checked us in, however, was less than enthused. She did not exude any of the Disney charm that we had previously heard about. Another family was being checked in by another cast member immediately to our right and there was such a difference in the approach; the other lady was super friendly, excited, gave the other children what looked like Disney loot bags and constantly referred to them as prince and princess. My two young children received nothing. I'm not sure if it was an oversite or something, but my two children noticed they didn't get a treat upon check-in and the other kids did. Not a great way to start. We asked about the delivery of our luggage and the lady simply said to give our luggage tag to the bellhop. She never gave us any direction as to where or who the bellhop was. It just wasn't good enough, particularly for the money we paid to stay there. Our room was on the bottom floor and it was showing its age. We were very underwhelmed by it. The only plus was that it was located close by the pool. We paid for a courtyard view and this was really disappointing; literally, our view was of the restrooms. We found a Mickey shaped towel on one bed; nothing on the other which I found odd. I was expecting a lot of Disney extras and hidden Mickey's but was again disappointed. It was a regular room with two beds, one having a Mickey shaped towel, and the worn bedspread had hidden Mickey's as did the wallpaper. There was one Mickey shaped soap and a coat rack that had a few Disney characters on it, but that was it. Nothing magical or fuzzy. So the room and check-in was a let down. The pool area was great, though. It has a kids' slide, lots of towels and a place to buy drinks and snacks. The geiser was not what I expected, either. On the hour, it spouted out a little water, but nothing like I had read about in other reviews. I actually think they may have been having technical difficulties with it because it was so small and short in duration. Nothing great to see. My favorite part was the beach/boat rental area. Just a short walk from the pool, this area was awesome. Beautiful view, little play structure for the kids and a nice sandy beach. We rented two small raycer boats and that was a lot of fun. We travelled all around Seven Seas Lagoon and Lake Bay. It was awesome and something I would highly recommend. The other thing I loved about this resort was the water taxi to Magic Kingdom. It was only a five minute trip and it was very scenic and lovely. We even saw some deer on the way to the MK. The boat wasn't crowded and it was such a relief to know we didn't have to battle with tram lines and the parking lot at the end of the night. I loved the water taxi and its convenience. The water taxi almost made up for the let down of the room and the less-than-magical check-in. I also liked the convenience of charging items on the room card; we used it at MK and the charges showed up on our bill at check-out. It was nice not having to carry money to the park. Overall, the Wilderness Lodge had some positives: the beach/boat rental/pool area and definitely the water taxi. The negatives for us included the check-in and room in general. I know the resort is supposed to be rustic, but there is a difference in rustic and run down. I liked certain aspects of the resort, but I felt certain other things should have been better for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not Great, Mixed feelings on the Value"”
Reviews.Author: Mainstream_Traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and our 3 children (ages 6, 5, 2) decided to stay at a Disney property for 2 nights prior to our real vacation at Cocoa Beach. After some internet research, we selected the Wilderness Lodge. Comments: - The hotel decor & theme is nice, but not nearly as much of a wow factor as the similar Lodge near Animal Kingdom. - The rooms are smallish for the price, and feel a bit dated. Bunk beds were a fun novelty. - We paid more to be on a higher floor with a balcony. That was wasteful for our family. Didn't use it once. - We really didn't understand how "Disney Transportation" works. Had we, we would have selected a hotel that is on the monorail. - Taking the boat to / from Magic Kingdom was fun, but lengthy process. - Taking a bus to / from Epcot is not as much fun and a lengthier process. - We ate several times at the quick serve "Roaring Fork". It was ok for the kids. Pretty bland for us. - Why does a hotel that costs 300 - 400 a night have powdered coffee machines? Really? - Drinks at the pool bar were not resort quality, but resort priced. - We ate once at the Canyon restaurant. Great service, very bland food. Particularly for the price. - Pool was packed most of our time there, but they have the staff to handle it. - Water slide was fun All in all, this was not a bad place to stay. Its just not great for the money. I think the real value in staying in a higher end resort is the caliber of families staying there with you. Most of the families were classy, nice, and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yantaml
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, we stayed in 4 different Disney resorts, this is the best one, my kids loved the resort and we will be back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby, nice place”
Reviews.Author: Todd020
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this place is stunning. There are many pictures online to get an idea of what I'm talking about. The room was average -- it was clean but nothing special. Our view was part woods and the back service parking lot and some dumpsters (where's the Disney magic to hide that stuff?) The staff was nice, but their uniforms are horribly dated. The pool was nicely designed and very fun to look at, but it and the deck space around it were far too small for a resort of this size. However, the hotel is in close proximity to the Magic Kingdom and the ferry boat takes you right to the park, which is a big plus. I would stay here again, but don't expect to be awed by anything other than the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: rcmor
Reviews.Content: This was our second 10 day stay at Wilderness Lodge and we loved it. The grounds were beautiful, the room was clean and the staff friendly. The pool is nice, but deck chairs are hard to come by in the afternoon. Whispering Canyon is fun to eat at and the food was good. Booked a bunkbed room over looking the "Otter Pond" which at this time was a "Gator Pond". Look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Themed Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bethyah
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to stay here at a Disney Deluxe Resort for my boys' 7th birthday. It is on the "low end" of the deluxe resorts. You may take a water taxi to the Magic Kingdom, which is quite convenient, however all other places require bus transportation. The pool area has a small slide. The geyser is interesting, and it "erupts" every hour. The smaller pool area is quiet and it had 4 jet springs of water for a spa-like feel. The resort has a nightly campfire for the kids with marshmallows. The Electrical Water Pageant can be seen nightly on the beach at 9:35PM. The resort also shows nightly Disney movies on the beach. There are many other activities, which may be experienced at cost. The rooms were well appointed with bunk beds for the boys, and each had a small light. The bathroom is small, however the double sinks are outside of the shower/toilet area. There is a small table and chairs with an adjustable light. We also had a porch area on the first floor. A table service restaurant Whispering Canyon Cafe was fun as we had to yell "We need ketchup!", and when another table yelled it we had to take 9 bottles to their table. The boys rode "hobby horses" around. The food was good, and the fun was nice for families. The quick service area is quite small Roaring Fork, but it serve its purpose with salads, sandwiches, pizza, and snacks. We did not experience Artist Pointe which is a signature dining experience. Overall, we enjoyed the comforts of "home".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Disney!!”
Reviews.Author: AndreaToronto
Reviews.Content: Travel Date: July 22 - July 29, 2011 Ages: 25 - 65 years old We have travelled to Disney 7 times over the years and 6 of those times we stayed on the Disney property. This was the first time we stayed at the Wilderness Lodge and it was great! Hotel Room: We had two rooms located next door to each other and they overlooked the maintenance parking area...and we had no problems with noise. It was actually nice to have no one that could see into the room at night it we had the drapes open and we could see the Magic Kingdom fireworks in the evening over the trees!! The room was spotless and the decor was cozy!! Both rooms had 2 double beds and the rooms were a perfect size...and the bathroom had double sinks! You also get a coffee maker and fridge which was super! Pool: We used the pool once since we spent everyday in a park. It was very nice, a good size and the water slide looked like fun!! Hotel: The front desk staff were very good!! We were able to check in when we arrived at 10am and got our rooms immediately. The hotel is large and beautiful and the property is very nice as well!! I loved the lodge feeling!! The gift shop had everything you would need...we visited almost everyday to look around and to pick up water for the next day!! Bus and Boat: The two modes of transportation from the Lodge are bus and boat. We never waited longer than 10 minutes for either of them. The boat was really nice to use to get and forth from the Magic Kingdom and we also used it to get to the monorail!! Dining Plan: THIS IS THE BEST THING EVER!!!! Your room key is also your park pass and dining plan card - which made everything very easy. We had a quick service meal, a table service meal and 1 snack per day and based on the cost of food in the parks you will save money in the long run if you get the plan. All of the restaurants (both quick service and table service) we ate at were fantastic!!! We all agreed that we will book the plan again next time we return!! Table Service Restaurants we ate at: Luau at the Polynesian Hotel: the show was a lot of fun and the food was delicious!! :)Crystal Palace at Magic Kingdom: Buffet - ok food! Good for kids, its a character dinner. Tony's Town Square: great menu - great food! Le Cellier at Epcot: excellent menu - excellent food!!! Coral Reef at Epcot: great menu - great food!! Boatwrights at Port Orleans Resort: good menu - good food! Disney Magical Express: This is the service that takes you to and from the airport. This was very convenient to have...you don't have to worry about getting a cab or renting a car to get you to the hotel. We had a great time at this hotel and would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Place”
Reviews.Author: MistyMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our third stay at the Wilderness Lodge and love it just as much as our first time. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are comfortable the location cannot be beat. The Roaring Fork counter service has some of the best sandwiches for lunch and dinner although the breakfast selections are a little boring. Transportation is great, the boat ride to Magic Kingdom is litterally like a seven minute ride. We could see the water parade every night from the beach area. Hotel is very clean although this time it wasn't immaculate as it had been in the past. Still I would not stay anywhere else. It is truly home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “best themed Disney Resort next to the Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: 2Euro-Travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in March 2011 and I have to say that the Wilderness Lodge is the best themed Disney Resort at Walt Disney World. We did not like the transportation options as the boat ride to the Magic Kingdom is short, but you do not have boats every 5 minutes. All the other Disney Parks can be reached by bus, but it is quite a ride. The rooms have a dark look and sleep up to 4 people. They are also smaller than all other Disney Deluxe Resort Rooms. I think all rooms offer a balcony which is very nice. + most rooms offer nice views over the courtyard where the pool is, a great family pool with slide, stunning lobby and great take away food options (Roaring Fork). - no free wireless internet access (10,-$ for wired 24 hours access), smaller rooms than most other Disney Deluxe Resorts which have an old and dark look

Reviews.Title: “OUR FAVORITE DISNEY RESORT!! LOVE LOVE LOVE”
Reviews.Author: southernpride1
Reviews.Content: Our family visited Disney and stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for three nights including July 4th. We stayed Club Level and loved every minute of it. We often visit Disney- at least 4 times per year and have stayed at all of the other deluxe resorts and many of the value and moderate too. However, even though the Poly is very nice and has the relaxing tropical feel, the WL seems to be more of a family oriented resort. Our teenagers love the pool, the ability to stroll around the lodge, and of course the beautiful lobby area with the massive fireplace. On this last visit we had a wonderful room on Club Level with a PERFECT VIEW of the castle. We could watch the fireworks every night from the balcony of our room. We also enjoyed the ability to have the food and drinks available several times a day. There was always many choices including cookies, brownies, cereals, bagels, muffins, fruit, assorted juices, hot chocolate, coffee, cokes, water, etc.. The dinner meal would vary, but always a nice hot dish as well as salads and all the extras needed. Well worth it to us!! We have stayed at Christmas too at the WL and LOVE all the special added touches for the holiday season. It is so nice to come in from the parks and see that huge roaring fireplace!! You just have to stop and "warm up" for a few minutes in the lobby!! If you want to be able to leave the busy parks and be able to come back to a nice quiet resort that is both relaxing, beautiful, and not cramped, then this is the one for you!!!!! We will return and soon!!!!!!!! Thanks to all the staff at the WL for making our trip one to remember. It is magical every time we visit.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: travelP2P
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3n/4d in 2 queens room. The atmosphere was great, there was a large pool with slide for my brother to use. The were 3 places to eat at the resort. Breakfasts were as simple as you choose and dinners were either fun and filling or exquisite and filling. The cafe by the main lobby doors were more suited to family, the resturant in the back towards the walk to the swimming pool was heavenly. We went there to eat twice. It was that good. Had the seasonal salmon, buffalo, and mussels. Excellent! Of course rooms were clean and quiet, we had a room facing ultilities entrance, but on the 3rd or 4th floor. It was very quiet. There were movies on the beach every night. And lots of activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with a littly Disney magic”
Reviews.Author: SkiNut101
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the lobby with it's great National Park theme. Every area and item carried forward the theme, even the mirror in the room with the pine cone edges. My family had a forest-view room on the 6th floor with a balcony that we only stepped out onto once (just didn't have time to sit). The room was nice, clean, and well-laid out with a double-sink vanity area separate from the toilet/bathtub. Only two room complaints; the in-room safe was very small and used a key to lock; the noise from the hallway (late returning guests) was loud enough to wake me up both nights of our stay. My son loved the pool and the little slide, while I enjoyed the wooded setting and geyser that went off each hour. There is easy access to all the Disney attractions and parking at the hotel was free and easy. I would definitley like to return to this resort again for a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Jandj126
Reviews.Content: We loved the Wilderness Lodge. Check in was really fast and easy and despite the fact our room was not ready they look our cell number and said they would text when it was ready and they took our luggage to hold. We decided to hang in the lobby for a few minutes since we had just arrived and we wanted to figure out what we needed to take to the park and when I checked back our room was ready. It was a bit of a hike from the lobby to our room and most days I felt like I was on the verge of getting lost! The room was a good size for a family of 4 with a balcony that looked out to the pool. We were not usually in the room in the afternoon as the kids rarely took naps (although I would have loved to!) so we did not experience too much noise at the pool. The restaurant at WL was good - but the menu did get a big old after being there for a week. We loved that we could take the boat to MK and Contemporary. However, some nights we had to wait a long time to get back on the boat to get back to WL and there were no "express" boats - they all stopped at Contemporary and Ft. Wilderness. The pool was great - the kids really enjoyed it. Bus service was always very fast to the other parks - I think we must have been pretty lucky with our timing because the longest we waited was maybe 25 minutes to go to Epocot early one morning. The front desk was very nice and helpful. The store had everything we needed although the prices were high (as they are througout Disney) for food/drink and medicines that we had forgotten or ran out of. We stayed at Polynesian the year before and loved the monorail access but overall Wilderness Lodge is great - it is a bit less expense and while the monorail access is nice we spent a lot of time at MK and used the boat launch so that helped with cutting down on times on buses and waiting for the bus. I will note we did not receive any "towel animals" or anything like that and we did tip the cleaning staff - I know I have read reviews at other disney deluxe properties who say they have received them - we did not at polynesian either.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic”
Reviews.Author: momy319
Reviews.Content: The room was always clean early in the morning. The pool was a great family atmosphere. There were organized games for the kids and the staff was fantastic. All the staff was helpful and eager to give us tidbits of information of ways to better enjoy our trip. There were nightly movies on the beach that was a great family experience. You have to eat in teh Whispering Pines restaurant and don't forget to ask for ketchup, the kids (big & small) will love it.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Wilderness Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: amisrn1
Reviews.Content: Disney's Wilderness Lodge is a great resort on the Disney property! We have stayed at a few of the resort hotels, but we like the Wilderness Lodge best. It's right on the lake so it is a convenient boat ride to Magic Kingdom. Having 2 young children we usually spend most of our time at Magic Kingdom! We love that the boat also goes to the Contemporary (for dinner and fireworks viewing at California Grille, Chef Mickey, and monorail service) and Fort Wilderness (for the Hoop-De-Doo Review--a must-see for families!). There is a nightly light show on the lake that the kids love. The other parks and resorts are simply a bus ride away on Disney transportation. The resort has comfy rooms. We like to upgrade to the club level. The Old Faithful club offers snacks during the day and a cocktail hour in the eveing. The club level staff is always helpful and friendly. There are Junior suites that have separate bedroom. These aren't on the club level, but they allow club level access. We enjoyed staying in the junior suite because of the separate bedroom, as well as the view from the balcony. We could enjoy the light show from our room! Plus, since the club has drinks and snacks available, we simply grab some bottled water and snacks and head to the parks! We have not dined at Artist Pointe since it is more upscale, but we enjoy the Whispering Canyon Cafe. The staff is greatly entertaining! The kids like the "stampede" when they allow the kids to "ride" horses through the restaurant. Not to give away any of the secrets of the entertainment, make sure you ask for ketchup!! You'll see why when you go! The pool area is very nice. There is a separate kiddie pool for the little ones. The larger pool offers a waterslide and there is a poolside bar. Since we go off-season it is never crowded, but I could see the pool being packed during hotter months. The pool staff have games at certain points during the day, mostly for the kids. The Wilderness Lodge also has "Old Faithful".....well, a miniature version anyway! A geyser erupts hourly near the pool area. We love the Wilderness Lodge! Having stayed at several of the Disney resorts, we enjoy the Lodge the best so far and definitely plan to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Marb89
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is surrounded by tall trees native to the pacific Northwest and away from all the hustle and bustle of the parks. It is a great retreat after a busy day enjoying the parks. The staff and the service at this resort was above and beyond our expectations. Whispering Canyon restaurant is a really fun pace to take the family for a great time. The pool and water slide was a source of great entertainment for the kids. There is a really nice beach area where they show movies every night on a large outdoor screen. This resort is in the Magic Kingdom area and it is only a short boat ride over to the Magic Kingdom. Bus service from here was really good, we never had to wait very long for a bus and we there for 11 days. The rooms were clean and decorated in a lodge fashion. Love this resort and can't wait to return. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “One of my top two Disney resorts!”
Reviews.Author: canter2u
Reviews.Content: This is my husband's favorite resort, and it ties with Animal Kingdom for me. I love the smell of the food from the restaurant lobby, and the American music of Copland and The Magnificent Seven. It has greAt comfortable atmosphere, western, logs, huge rocks and boulders, native American artifacts, a bubbling spring in the lobby that runs down to the pool. Having spoken to many Disney employees at manynresorts, almost all agree this has the best pool. Love the food, the pool, the smells, the concierge level rooms (you'll hardly buy meals!). We have stayed here many times and in fact built a log cabin that we live in because we love the Wilderness Lodge so much! Every time we come home, we feel we are on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: christabKatyTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and 7 days, we added the additional 630.00 to stay in the club level... it was great, we had 10 kids with us and 4 families that were able to stay close together. The kids were able to meet each other in the morning and afternoon at the food and beverage station, they have all sorts of goodies during the day with tables and sofas on which to lounge. The kids loved spending time with their friends and just hanging out on the 7th floor. The hotel is older but still very clean and the rooms were quiet. We didn't have the best view but it didn't matter since we were never in the room. The ferry leaves every 10-15 mins from the lodge to Magic Kingdom and the bus service was fairly good...

Reviews.Title: “Ideal home while visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: Cindy_Louer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a villa and loved everything about this resort. It was a very relaxing place to return after days touring the parks. It lives up to it's name: felt a million miles away from the crowds. We took the boat to Magic Kingdom, Grand Floridian and the Hawaiian Luau and the monorail. The boat was never packed while we were there, even though our vacation was during prime time. The lodge itself was stunning - gorgeous, soaring lobby area with excellent dining choices. The casual restaurant was a blast for the kids. Another night, we checked the kids into the Lodge's children's program where they were fed and entertained while my husband and I enjoyed a night out at the "signature" restaurant . We've also stayed at Animal Kingdom. Really enjoyed it there too, but would probably choose WL if returning because we so enjoyed taking the boat as a main means of transport.

Reviews.Title: “Waiting for service”
Reviews.Author: AineFlorida
Reviews.Content: The lodge was spectacular, clean, open and filled with numerous individuals to assist you. The employees were chatty, friendly and always ready to assist you with your needs -most of the time. Phone in room did not work, made several calls with no response. T.V. remote did not work - made several calls with no response. Clean, clean clean. Always towels by the pool. An issue with having the lugage delivered to the room as promised. After a two hour wait we were told it would be another 10-15 minute wait. Spouse had a little temper tantrum and a Disney employee stepped in immediately and brought our luggage. Bell service is a contracted service and not staffed by Disney employees. They might want to rethink those positions. Help at the Cafe were difficult to understand due to the accent and a bit slow to provide the correct food. Perhaps it was her first day on the job? Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, everything I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: mnscp
Reviews.Content: We visited Wilderness Lodge July 8-13 and loved every minute of it. From the breathtaking lobby to the sounds of laughter coming from their cafe whispering canyon, everything was themed perfectly. The geyser was awesome,so was the bubbling hot springs that were inside the hotel flowing into the pool. So many trees surrounded us it was extremely nice plus t is one of the only resorts to offer a boat directly to Magic Kingdom. We never waited more than five minutes to hop on the next boat. Rooms were not as big as some other deluxe resorts, however I don't believe the theming could have gotten any better. "Mousekeeping" was amazing, they made us towel animals every day of our stay. Every employee e came in contact with greeted us warmly and asked how our day was. CLEARLY Disney does a great job at training and choosing their employees. Their snack stand was much more than a snack stand. We ate at Roaring Forks every morning before heading to the parks for the day. Good selection and good amount of seating. I can't wait till our next trip so we can stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for!”
Reviews.Author: trippy95
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge has always been our hotel of choice when we take our annual Disney World trips. The staff is so friendly and welcoming and the amenities are outstanding! The lobby is terrifically themed with a nice stream/pond and a large gift shop. There are also nice places to eat on-site, and the pool/beach is a nice place to relax in between trips to the parks. There is also great convenience to Magic Kingdom with the boat that runs back and forth. A great Disney property for the whole family!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing wilderness retreat amidst all the busy Disney fun”
Reviews.Author: Greenlocnar
Reviews.Content: The wilderness lodge does a great job of capturing some of the elements of Yellowstone national park while still maintaining a Disney spin. They have buses and boats to get you anywhere you need to get and a fun poolside bar. When we first arrived we were placed in a room that had a "walk-in" shower that was more like a locker room shower. We discussed it with the staff and they found us a different room with a more traditional bathroom. They really helped make our stay a more wonderful experience. We really like the creek that runs through the hotel and the Whispering Canyon Cafe is fun too.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IrishGirl2006
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful hotel at WDW. The lobby is breathtaking as well as the grounds. The attention to detail is amazing and helps immerse you in the lodge theme. I love getting hot chocolates at the Roaring Fork and sitting in the rocking chairs by the giant fireplace in the lobby. Our room on this last visit was on the first floor facing the Villas pool. The rooms are smaller than other Deluxe Disney hotels, but that would not stop me from returning to this hotel again and again. In the past, we've also had rooms facing the lake and the courtyard. The courtyard view from an upper level room is the best in my opinion. I love watching the stream and waterfall, and of course the geyser! The Lodge has a beach where you can rent small speedboats. We also rented a surrey bike and rode along the path to Fort Wilderness. We even saw a mother and baby deer along the way. At the beach, you can view the Electric Water Pageant too. There is boat service directly to the Magic Kingdom which is very convenient and quick. I have stayed at the Beach Club, Boarwalk Inn, Polynesian, Animal Kingdom Lodge, Port Orleans French Quarter, and All Star Music. This hotel is by far my favorite. It is a beautiful hotel and pulls off its theme better than any other hotel I have stayed in. If I won the lotto, I'd move in there! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ShavonneTurner
Reviews.Content: My family and I (3 adults, 1 child, and 1 infant) stayed their from July 2-July 7. The hotel lobby is immaculate. All of the hotel's staff is very helpful and friendly. The only complaint I have is the room size. It's a little cramp. I think it's a marketing tool. They make the rooms small so that you will want to stay in a villa, even possibly becoming a Disney Vacation Member. Transportation by boat to MK was frequent; the bus transportation is okay. The buses have to pick up at Disney's Grand Floridian too. So, plan on a 20-30 minute bus trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quality yet dated Disney resort.”
Reviews.Author: Masseyjake
Reviews.Content: Great place for the family. Disney does vacation well. All of the cast members are wonderfully helpful, making it a comfortable and relaxing place to stay. The resort is getting a bit worn and dated though. Nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, very nice”
Reviews.Author: mismoothorwhat
Reviews.Content: This vacation was much nicer than I had anticipated as I am not a huge disney fan. Our room was not huge but it was very well maintained and clean with plenty of room for what we needed. I would definitely recommend the dining plan, we had the quick service plan which gives you 2 meals, 2 snacks and a refillable mug for like 35 dollars a day. What a great deal this was since we used some of our snacks on huge breakfast danishes, muffins and fruit bowls for breakfast. 3 meals a day in disney with drinks and desserts for 35 a day is a steal. Tip.....go to cosmic rays you get a half a bbq chicken, ribs, mashed potato and stringbeans with drink and dessert for one quick service meal. Also remember that even though they sell 3 dollar bottle water they also offer complimentary tap water anywhere drinks are sold, this saved us a ton of money. My only complaint was the transportation. I really feel like disney executed everything perfectly except for the transportation. The ferries were usually pretty good, came every 15 minutes or so. The buses were terrible, 2 broke down while we were on them. You would be waiting for a magic kingdom buswith 20 other ppl, and 3 buses would come to take people from your hotel to fort wilderness campground and all of them would be empty. The magical express also sucked, couldn't do the quick checkout and had to drag 7 bags with us through orlando airport.

Reviews.Title: “This place is amazing”
Reviews.Author: cigar_girl
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience staying here. We were celebrating my son's birthday and went to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom while here. As expected, Disney made for a truly special birthday. The Wilderness Lodge was an excellent location to the parks we were visiting during this stay. The shuttle and boats were easy to get to with short lines. Like all Deluxe hotels, we did not have to walk as far to the pick ups as the cheaper hotels. The lodge itself is beautiful. Very relaxing while fun for the children. The breakfast was fine but make advance reservations. The atrium is huge and has a creek going through the lobby. It's a nice area to explore with children. The pool was a highlight. The kids loved playing while I relaxed in the hot tub. It was huge and never too crowded. The landscaping is lush and feels like being in the wilderness in a Disney (not natural, manicured but well done) kind of way. The first night we went to the pool a rabbit hopped across the sidewalk and into this wooded area. We are not used to that at hotels. Every night we ate at a different signature restaurant but since we stayed at Wilderness the birthday celebration was at Artist Point. The menu is like what you would find in the Pacific NW and everyone's food was excellent. We had two elementary age children so we picked a room with bunk beds. Of course it was not just a bunk bed - not at Disney. They were made to look like they were made from logs. The kids loved everything about the North West theme. If you are going to Disney and want to stay close to Magic Kingdom this is an outstanding choice.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: ladle69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are have season passes to Disney and each month we try and stay at a different location. We chose the WiIderness lodge this month and had a wonderful time! The lobby was amazing! The time and effort that was put into each detail makes you shake your head in amazement! We loved the way the water arouse from a underground spring located in the lobby and wormed its way down the canyon to wind up in the swimming pool! Even the headboards on the beds were unique, each was carved with a outdoor scene. We only ate at the Whispering Canyon Cafe for breakfast, but we loved the way the staff interacted with the guest, especially the kids. Our room was located on the 6th floor inside the lobby area and was the only downside to our stay. Noise loves to travel in the place and they start serving breakfast at 7 so be prepared to be awoken to banging pots and laughing children. If we'd had know it woas that loud we would have requested a different area in the resort away from the main lobby. Besides that, our overall experience was wonderful and we would make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Disney Resort!”
Reviews.Author: amyn1438
Reviews.Content: We go to Disney often, and have stayed at many different hotels on property, and this was our favorite. We were actually down for our wedding, and stayed the first half of our trip at the Grand Floridian. We have visited the Wilderness Lodge before, but staying here was even more special. The lobby is absolutely stunning. The pool is my favorite at Disney, the hotel itself is just so relaxing. You have the convenience of being in the MK area, but feel as if you are a world away. It's so nice after a long day at the parks to return to such a relaxing resort. We ate at Artist Point which was great, and our room had an amazing view of the castle and fireworks. We were able to watch the electrical water pagent from the pool, and getting to the parks was pretty easy. Compared to the other Deluxe hotels at Disney, we feel this is by far the best value. We would highly recommend staying here, especially for a winter stay!

Reviews.Title: “"Okay but you should note the following”
Reviews.Author: dtravelJohnston_RI
Reviews.Content: We chose the Wilderness Lodge for its sheer beauty and the hotel is reminiscent of the great wilderness. While the lobby is captivating, and the theme is right on point, there are some things that may not be a fit for everyone. Once outside the lobby going to the grounds of the pool and beyond, there is an incline which would not be suited for elderly. I took my 85-year-old mom and she had issues with this. My 2 teenage children accompanied me and I was given a very small room with bunk beds, again something I or the staff should have picked up on. My son at the time was 5'9" and not good at all. when we presented this to the desk, they took no initiative to change this at all. All in all, I would emphasize care when booking a reservation here because this is not a 1 size fits all . Lastly the restaurant is very loud in the lobby and the pots and pans will be banging until 10 or so, again something to consider when trying to sleep in a bunk or otherwise. A good experience, but thoughtfulness is required when booking....the staff will not point this out unfortunately. at least in my experience, so somewhat less than magical for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good for visiting the Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorGC
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness lodge is good for visiting the Disney Parks. The Lodge Main entry is beautifull and replicates the lodge in Yellowstone. The rooms and halls are a bit aged but maybe that adds to the rustic style of the lodge. The hotel store is convenient to get drinks and food (saves a little money for breakfast and lunch items). The transportation (bus or boat) from the Hotel to the parks can be hit or miss. We had some waits of the less than 5 min and one wait of 50 min (ave of 20min)

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Great Club Level!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeucfknights
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at nearly all the Disney Resorts (from value to Deluxe) and can report that the Wildreness Lodge was wonderful!! We booked a standard room on the Club Level, the accomodations were very comfortable. The rooms are nice but don't expect to see the same furnishings in these rooms as you would at the Beach Club or Boardwalk Inn, after all the rooms are intended to resemble a lodge. Our room was located on the 7th floor it had a generous balcony which viewed out on to the courtyard with the streams, we also had a great view out to the left of the pool and lake. The best part about staying on the club level in my opinion is the Old Faithful Club which offers snacks, wine/beer/cheese/appetizers, desserts and breakfast options. The staff were running around to make sure everyone was taken care of, they weren't hovering or being annoying (which has been our experience at the Boardwalk Inn). They were prompt to refill the refreshments! The pool was very nice! One word of caution, watch out for the geyser- it is subject to drench you should the wind blow!

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: sqivdad4life
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you can't enjoy this property, at Disney World?? the HAPPIEST PLACE ON EARTH??, I seriously question the individual and not the resort. My family arrived from a 20 hr road trip for 6 jam packed days of magic. We arrived right at 3pm (check in time) with wife and 4 children 14, 12, 10 and 8. We were taken upstairs by the hotel manager to the club level. Wife and I were introduced to the club level concierge team. Both ladies did a great job of making us feel welcomed. Asked tons of questions about our kids printed pictures for them to draw and walked them over to the snack area while wife and I received hotel tour. First room was on bottom floor on far side of hotel. View was non existent. Trees and shrubs only. Pretty disappointing. We called the front desk to ask for an upper floor and within 20 minutes received a phone call offering a different room. This room was in the main tower on the 6th floor. The view was priceless. Overlooked the bay, geyser, beach and pool. Again, nothing better than feeling the breeze off the lake at night and waking up the water and trees each morning. Insist on a bay view. It's worth the money!!! The resort itself has enough to consume your vacation. Two of the most memorable amenities were (1) The pool. I'm not usually a fan of public pools, but the pool was clean, lots of lifeguards, plenty of lounge chairs etc. great for families. (2) Club level service. What better way to power up before or after a day of Disney theme parks. Light breakfast in the AM, snacks in the afternoon, appetizers in the evening and desserts shortly thereafter. This was a must. The only regret was not having enough time to take advantage of all the hotel has to offer. Boat rental, watching Cars or Beauty and the Beast outside under the stars each night, great arcade, and much more. The only, I repeat only real complaint was no internet service. REALLY???? Disney come on. We paid an unGODLY amount of money for this trip and it was well worth it, but 10.00 per night for internet at a DISNEY property should be considered a crime. Book this hotel, pay the dough. Your children like mine will remember it for the rest of their lives.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, staff nice, pool nice!!”
Reviews.Author: cdarbygrl1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the WL was a great experience! Not sure what the negative reviews are about. We arrived at 9:30 AM on May 15, 2011, and they had our room ready! Double beds were great for my boy/girl twins. They pool was fun, the staff was ALWAYS courteous and helpful, the food was good and more! Several reviewers commented about rude staff, so maybe they were being difficult, but everyone was so nice! The breakfast pancakes were good, and although they got a little busy in the morning with everyone trying to eat before they went into the parks, they were efficient and the food was good! The rooms were MUCH quieter than the Poly. Resort and the beds were comfy! We had stayed at the Polynesian the last time we went, and their rooms feel much smaller and very dark and dingy! The buses were very prompt to take you to the parks, and so was the boat!! Don't hesitate to go here with kids, we all loved it!! Will stay at the WL next time!

Reviews.Title: “ABOVE AND BEYOND!”
Reviews.Author: BVMiddleschoolmom
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to WDW was our most memorable vacation ever! Lodge is extremely clean and well maintained. There were no Florida bugs in June! Staff is knowledgable and pleasant. Quiet and spacious rooms with hot water instantly. Pool is amazing and life guards are attentive. Transportation by bus had short wait time. Boat transportation was very tranquil, smooth and surprisingly quick to get to other areas of park. Dining puts you in a good mood with their silliness. Come with a big appetite-- the portions at Disney are huge. We will definitely stay at Wilderness Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Resort - Spectacular Themeing”
Reviews.Author: mke60
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Resort is spectacularly themed. Having stayed at several of the Great Lodges of the Western National Parks, we really enjoyed staying in the Disney interpretation of them. We would stay again on that account. This resort is classified as Deluxe by Disney but it's really a tweener between Deluxe and Moderate and in our case was priced like that (more than a moderate but less than most of the other deluxe properties).
