You might be a little disappointed in the room size and quality if you have stayed in the other deluxe properties. Our room was comfortable but not large and the theme carried nicely into the room decor. The soft goods are ready for an update. Our room had a mini fridge and a queen bed plus a 1 set of bunks. The bunks were preferable for our kids--they slept better each having their own bed. The pool area was also nice but not large enough to handle the crowd if the property is operating in hot / nice weather at near capacity. There weren't any available lounge chairs mid afternoon when returning from the parks. Contributing was the apparent lack of a pool attendant clearing left behind towels from abandoned chairs. We ate at the both the quick service restaurant and the Whispering Canyon Cafe. Food at the QSR was better / fresher than the QSR park food, and we enjoyed the WCC and were amused. Avoid rooms that directly overlook the main lobby above the restaurant due to the evening restaurant noise. The resort location is great for touring the Magic Kingdom with efficient boat transfer that we never had to wait very long for on either end. The bus service from this location however was unacceptable in our experience. We used it to the Studios and Animal Kingdom and waited > 30 minutes in both circumstances on both ends. The Studios bus route ran through the campground too contributing to making it pokey. Because the wait was so long, the bus filled for AK so we could go directly there, but it still was an hour from door to door (due to the wait) at the start of the day. My sense was that buses were filing at previous stops before reaching ours. If we stay here again, I'd get a rental car (self parking is free) and drive to the parks other than Magic Kingdom. Parking for resort guests is free at the parks. At the Wilderness resort, the Disney magic and service is very much present and well done throughout. The overall experience was enjoyable and I would stay here again, especially if I was focused on mainly touring the Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “4th Stay and will definitly be back LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Devyn1990
Reviews.Content: One of the best stays ever! We celebrated a Birthday and Graduation and what a way to do it! Everyone made our stay wonderful from the room being ready on check in to the concierge who helped with reservations and ticket upgrades! The rooms were fresh and clean and we LOVED the little towel characters every day! The servers in the Whispering Canyon ANNOUNED our Graduate and Birthday so everyone could celebrate with us! Here's a nice hint try renting a bike and ride through the grounds it gives you a break from the park lines and leaves the cooler evening and extra late hours to enjoy at a slower pace. Buses did take quite a while use the water taxi or drive and park for free if your in a hurry to make a dinner reservation. Will Stay Again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay here....”
Reviews.Author: hawaii888
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on the concierge level at Disney's Grand Californian and now at Disney's Wilderness Lodge and I have to say that I enjoyed both Hotels tremendously! For this visit my son lost a tooth the first night we were there enjoying the evening snacks and the concierge desk people (sorry I didnt get names) were so sweet and gave us a little wooden tooth box to put his tooth in. As far as the food on the concierge level it was good but not a lot of variety as far as snacks and desserts went but it was still sooo good and when we had stayed at the Grand Californian we were able to get as much bottled water as we wanted but we had to ask for it here at the Wilderness Lodge. Thankfully we had brought our own along. I would recommend Concierge level to everyone. We filled up for breakfasts. Also we needed a box to ship some stuff home and the Concierge people went out of their way to find us one. They were sooo nice and helpful. There was a little bit of a snafu with the Valets when we first pulled up. They went to other people who pulled in after us to offer help but once they realized we needed help they were helpful. Our room was ready right away and it was a nice room with a private balcony. The room was a little dark but as we werent in it much it wasnt a problem. The beds were very very comfortable. The pool was great. There is a baby pool that my 5 year old had fun in and a bigger pool with a slide that my 9 year old had a blast on. Getting to the different parks was sooo easy. There is a bus stop right outside to get to Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios and a boat to take you over to the Magic Kingdom. We had a blast eating in the restaurant...great meal and we loved our waitress Laura!!! She was wonderful and if you have never eaten there before...be prepared....they love to tease....it is all in good nature. I would stay here just for the pool and the concierge club room. Will plan to come back in the future!! We ended up taking our rental car back early and using the Magic Express Shuttle to the airport...dont know about parking costs and Loved the Magic Express Shuttle!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: MarylandMarie
Reviews.Content: My son and I recently stayed at Wilderness Lodge. It was a nice resort and convenient to most attractions. We stayed in a room overlooking the woods with bunk beds. We were able to see the fireworks from Magic Kingdom from our room. The resort does need a bit of updating. The room was clean but definitely seems to be getting a bit worn. Considering Wilderness Lodge is a Deluxe level hotel, I'm not sure it matches some of the other deluxe hotels. But it really is overall a fine place to stay. We had fun renting wave runner boats and bikes. We biked over to Fort Wilderness and also took the boat over there to see the camp grounds. The pool is a bit crowded. But has a nice slide.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: disneyfamily007
Reviews.Content: I stayed the Wilderness Lodge for 2 nights during the first week of June with my husband and two children. After those 2 nights, we stayed for 6 nights at Pop Century. Therefore, I feel I can adequately compare the two resorts. The WL was exceptionally quiet, peaceful and calm. There were several occasion when we walked down the hallways and never saw another person! The pool was beautiful and the kids really enjoyed the slide. The setting and surrounds were beautiful. Getting to MK was very easy, the boat ran regularly and we never waited for more than 10 minutes. The lodge itself was stunning and while the rooms were small, they were nicely decorated with extra disney touches. The Pop Century was a really fun place for our kids; they LOVED the pools and the larger than life decorations. The down side to the POP was the crowd. There were people EVERYWHERE at all hours of the day and night. It was truely the polar opposite of the WL! Both places were fantastic in true disney fashion however, if returning with my kids....we would stay at POP. Having said that, if returning with just my husband we would always choose the Wilderness Lodge. Such a beautiful place!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for a Deluxe Resort!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyLover28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 2 kids (9 and 11) and booked the bunk bed with the woods view and ended up getting the bunk bed room with a wonderful view directly over the river, but you can also see the woods and the bridge too for no extra cost. What a nice surprise! The room is pretty small, but the bunk beds gave us more floor space which was great, and the mattresses were a lot more comfortable than Fort Wilderness. The flat screen TV was really nice, but the bathrooms were kind of gross. It appeared clean, but when you looked closer there was a lot of dirt on the sink. In the corners of the sink, there was a mini pile of dirt, and my toothpaste ended up with a booger on it. Ew! The shower was really nice, and the toilet had a button on the top instead of a side handle to flush it, and you have to press hard. My daughters left their 3 dolls out on the bed with a bunch of doll food because at Fort Wilderness the maid set out a food platter but this time, the food was spread out on the bed and Rapunzel's hair was messed up (20" of hair). The lobby is beautiful! There's a bridge over a "river" which is an excellent photo spot but there are some kids on it. The only way you can have the bridge to yourself is by holding up a camera, but the lobby is actually pretty peaceful! There are tons of rockingchairs by the fire and a nice cafeteria that accepts snack voutures for pretty much any breakfast besides a sandwich. There's an arcade, and a package we chose, they give us 100 points, and that seemed like a lot, but each game is 75 points. The pool is a good size, and has 2 hot tubs. The only special thing however is the little slide, which closes at 10:00 pm and drops off in only 4 feet of water. The pool isn't crowded after 10, and is a little quiet the rest of the day. A great thing for everyone is you can rent boats and bikes! There's a really long trail in the woods and your boat is in a huge lake the theme park boats are in. It's a good price and I recommend that for the last day you're there instead of going to the theme park. Bottom line: There's not too many kids here, a selection of restaraunts, average pool, peacefull lobby, and the cleanliness is ok

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: Beausdad
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney 14 times since I was 11 or so and I have to say that this last time was my absolute favorite all thanks to staying at the Wilderness Lodge. It started with the Disney Magical Express at the airport. The only way to go is flying and taking the bus to your hotel. I have never had so much fun. Whether a first timer or a seasoned veteran I will cherish my bus ride with my wife and son as we had a blast talking to all of the other families on the bus. We got off the bus and approached the main lobby where several Cast Members greeted us with "Welcome Home". It truly did feel like we were coming home. The lobby is absolutely spectacular. The height, the smell(it smells like fresh cut wood), the hot spring, the fireplace, the totems, the lounging areas, it was simply amazing. Check in was a breeze. Off to the room. The room is nice. Nothing special. The beds were comfy, the room clean, Decor was excellent. The hidden mickeys in the wall paper are a nice touch. The Cast Members leaving towel animals on the beds for our son or even better if we left his Disney characters out they would be arranged as a welcome party when we got back from the parks. Always plenty of toiletries left each day as I had to take home the Disney Hotel experience with me. Favorite part of the room was every time I walked out of the door I was greeted with the smell of fresh cut wood. I swear I think they pipe it in some how. Every morning my son and I would sneak off to the lobby to eat breakfast and right beside the Check in desk there is a little seating area with a large flat screen tv playing a loop of old Mickey shorts. It was great. At night when my snoring was too much for my wife I would venture out to other secluded seating areas to read a book. there is a small area on the 3rd floor with a fire place and two chairs that is wonderful. the rocking chairs in front of the fire place in the main hall will suck you in as well. The pool was fantastic. Kiddie pool could use some modernizing. Shame that the Moderate resorts have better pools for little ones than this "deluxe" hotel. The large pool is nice but much too deep for a toddler and baby pool not quite exciting enough. No happy medium. Wife visited the spa and now I have one more expensive gift I have to get for any giving occasion each year. So ladies I highly recommend the spa. She said it was assuredly the best part of the trip for her. Roaring fork was always packed at the beginning and end of the day as it is the snack, sandwich place to be. Ate at Whispering Canyon which was fun. Did not visit Artist Point, but enjoyed nightly beverages and good conversations with bartender and guests at the bar. Location - Transportation left a little to be desired. Buses were sporadic at best. Boat rides to Magic Kingdom were too few. But the nightly fireworks at MK from the beach were wonderful as was the electric float parade on Bay Lake. Overall - As I started with, it is the best trip so far. My wife and I both agree that we would like to stay at the Grand Floridian and I would like to do the Contemporary, which I haven't done since I was a kid, as well as the Polynesian. However, I have no problem with staying at the Wilderness Lodge for the rest of my trips because when the Cast Members say "Welcome Home" you truly feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “all they care is that you stayed with them and they have your money”
Reviews.Author: chisoxfan08
Reviews.Content: nasty customer service. i waited 5 days for someone to come change a light bulb and two days without shampoo and soap. i talked to front desk and a manager, everybody said someone will be right up and nobody ever came. the worst was the day before check out they sent someone to are room for a survey, i told him about nobody changing the light he came in and looked at it. he also said he would send somebody up right away. (haha) nobody ever came. when i checked out and they asked how my stay was. i told them how bad it was and they didn't care just gave me my check out papers. i would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge is stunning!”
Reviews.Author: GrannieB43
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge was an excellent place for my husband and I to celebrate our 45th wedding anniversary with our children and grandchildren from June 5-11. There were 11 of us in our party ranging in age from 5 years to 70 years. With that many people, check-in did take 2 hours as my request for 5 adjoining rooms with 2 queen size beds in all 5 of the rooms that I had reserved was not completely honored. Once that issue was resolved, one room became available immediately, and all the luggage for 11 people was moved in. However, it took 3 trips to and from this room, plus getting the manager involved, before we could get the key card to work. Our rooms were on the 6th floor (6130, 6132, 6134, 6136, 6138) facing the Wilderness Lodge Villas with courtyard view. While the lobby may be noisy, the 6th floor was very quiet and none of us had any trouble sleeping. Our Mousekeeper, Martha, kept our rooms spotless and delighted us with towel animals. The Wilderness Lodge and surrounding grounds are well maintained and all staff members were friendly and helpful. Everyone enjoyed the pool area and the pool side bar. We never waited over 10 minutes for a bus or boat to and from any of the parks. For this trip we used the Quick Service Dining Plan and all of us were pleased with the results. The Disney website has a list of places in each park, resort and Downtown Disney where the Quick Service Dining Plan is honored. I printed off this information and carried it with me to save time. I also checked with Allears.net for reviews on each dining establishment. We thought the food quantity and quality was greatly improved over our last visit to WDW. In fact, this trip we didn't escape the confines of WDW to seek better quality food at some of Lake Buena Vista's finer restaurants. We selected which day we would visit each park based on the extended hours for that park. We'd get to the park at opening, get the fast pass ticket for the most popular ride, note the time we could get another fast pass ticket, then move to a ride that had a wait of less than 30 minutes. Our best day was at Magic Kingdom where we hit 6 rides in less than 2 hours. If we ever get to Disney World again, it would be difficult not to choose Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Just a little disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: julesingeorgia
Reviews.Content: I was soooo excited to finally be able to afford to stay at the Wilderness Lodge. I had been here one other time just to eat dinner at Whispering Canyon but had not actually stayed here so I knew I was impressed with the lobby. The resort itself is beautiful. I had 2 13yo boys with me and they loved the pool. The boat transportation over to Magic Kingdom was great and ran frequently. The food at Roaring Forks was pretty quick and service was good. The bar by the pool made good drinks also. Bus transportation was not that great. Waited quite a while one morning to go to Epcot and then coming home from Animal Kingdom we waited over 45 minutes in the hot sun. My main problem with this resort are the rooms. Wow, what a disappointment. Our room looked like it had not been updated...ever. Bathrooms in rough shape, looked like tub had been re-glazed and was chipping along with caulk falling apart between tiles. Bedspreads, carpets & hallways just looked old old old. Stayed at Animal Kingdom lodge last year and their rooms were in much better shape. I would only consider staying here again at this price level if it was after the rooms had been updated. I have stayed at over 8 other Disney properties in the past so I am using others to compare to.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for Toddlers”
Reviews.Author: mgoblueNY
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at a great WDW resort. Had not been to WDW since I was a kid. My 18 month old LOVED it. We asked for bunk beds with bed rails and it was a GREAT idea. The cleaning service was good - although we found the previous room occupant's toiletry bag under a bed. NOTE: this place is expensive for the type of room (not a 4-star room by far), but you pay for the location. The wading pool is perfect for toddlers with lots of chairs for parents. The main restaurant (Whispering Canyon) is TONS of fun and my husband and daughter ran around doing a race and my daughter even did the hokey pokey! You do not need reservations. The boat ride to the Magic Kingdom is tons of fun and we never waited long. However, the bus rides to Animal Kingdom took a loooong time. We'll definitely stay here again. :) [One note: The "fancier" restaurant was awful - not even near the quality of the Whispering Canyon and five times the price. It was completely empty. Would not suggest it.]

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and worth the cost!”
Reviews.Author: ga_travel_family
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Wilderness Lodge the first week of June. Our group included 2 families, 4 adults and 4 children ages 18 months through 11. We had 3 "woods view rooms" and our stay was fabulous. We had a reservation at the Whispering Canyon for our arrival day and this was perfect as it got us right into Disney mode. The kids loved the rowdiness of the restaurant and because it is a noisy place, our fussy toddler wasn't bothering anyone. Since the Wilderness Lodge is near the Ft. Wilderness Campground, we also did the Hoop Dee Doo Review Dinner Show one evening - very fun and only a boat ride away. The heated pool is neat and has a water slide, kiddie pool, and two hot tubs. There is also a quiet pool near the Villas. We liked that fact that our rooms in the main buiding were close to the lobby, the quick service restaurant, and we were never too far from the action. (some of the other resorts are spread out) I did laundry and it was very convenient and reasonable ($2 for the washer or dryer). The boat travel to Magic Kingdom was great. We also took the boat to the Contemporary and then hopped on the monorail - you can get to Epcot, Polynesian, and Grand Floridian from there. The Contemporary has a few nice shops and restaurants. We also ate at the Polynesian and enjoyed the food there. Our toddler had a good time at the Ft. Wilderness campground and she played on the playground and we visited the pony stables. The campground offers pony rides, hay rides, and horseback riding. All in all, we had a great time and recommend that you take the time to explore the Wilderness Lodge! They had movies under the stars at the beach just off the pool area and there was a floating electrical parade each night out on the lake. We found all the staff to be very helpful and when one of our kids lost a pin (they all started pin trading on this visit) the man at the concierge desk pulled one out of the lost and found. Every time I went to the concierge desk to ask questions or advice, I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. We ordered breakfast through room service by placing the card on our door before going to bed and the food showed up 5 minutes early and was hot and fresh and plentiful. Our room had a coffee pot and refrigerator and there was an ice machine nearby. We were able to eat snacks in our room and enjoy coffee on the patio. The room wasn't huge, but was laid out well - the sink area had double sinks and plenty of counter space. We plan to return to Disney sometime in 2012 and may choose the Wilderness Lodge again - although we have seen the pool at Animal Kingdom and it is incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, great view”
Reviews.Author: desertdad67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for four nights in June. Our room was clean and the kids loved the bunk beds. It could use a bit of remodeling (especially in the bathrooms, the tile looks old and dirty). The bedspreads also looked pretty tired. The motif is rustic, but this was not rustic, it was just plain outdated. However, overall the hotel was very nice. The lobby is amazing. It has a gorgeous fireplace and looks like a lodge you'd find in a national park (but much nicer). Our check in was very fast and smooth. We arrived around 10am, expecting to have our bags held while we went off to a disney park. Our room was ready though and within 15 minutes we had all of our stuff stored away and had headed out. Our balcony overlooked the pool area and the lake. The view was beautiful! The gift shop had lots of amenities, and while the prices could have been a bit lower for bottled water, it was nowhere near the price hotels usually charge for mini bar items. Taking disney transportation from this resort is not the easiest. It shares buses with the Fort Wilderness campground, and even the shortest time to a park via bus was at least 25 minutes. The water taxi to the magic kingdom was a nice option, but not super fast either. Overall, it was a nice resort. Our kids loved the pool. It was a big property, but you didn't feel like you had to walk forever to get in/out of your room.

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING BUT LOVE”
Reviews.Author: Blondemoment84
Reviews.Content: Excellent, amazing, fun, friendly, lots to do, just simply wonderful! Transport to parks is brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Our family had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: LLe0n
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned before arriving, as I had read such mixed reviews on this page about the Wilderness Lodge. I have to tell you, however, that our family (two adults, and teenage sons ages 18 and 15) had a great time! We arrived on May 31st, and stayed through June 5th. We had a Wood's view on the 2nd floor. Most of the time, we had no idea we had neighbors, and the staff was incredibly friendly and very, very helpful. I had booked all of our dinning reservations prior to our arrival, but found I wanted to change some once there. No problem at all - the people at the desk in the lobby did all of this with much ease. The transportation was the transportation. The ONLY thing I can say is that if you get unlucky enough to get on a bus that is making stops at other resorts on your way to Epcot, it can take a while. Other than that, it was smooth as silk. And the boat to Magic Kingdom is the way to go. We forgot about the boat and took the bus one morning over to Magic Kingdom, and even that is pretty quick and painless. Our family has stayed at the Beach Club (my #1 favorite), the Port Orleans Riverside, The Caribbean Beach Club, The All Star Music, and now The Wilderness Lodge. I have to say that all the males in my family rate the Wilderness Lodge as their first choice as of now, and it is my very, very close second to the Beach Club. Yes, it is expensive. But, you know that going in... you are booking at a DELUXE resort. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but skip the Club Level Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Koho26
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite Disney hotels (and we've been to Disney more than 20 times). Lobby is incredible, the landscaping is great, pools are beautiful, and Disney continues to worry about the little touches that Disney is famous for. Room was very clean. Air conditioner worked well (note this is always a problem at Disney lower priced resorts such as All Star Sports, Pop Century, etc.) and ceiling fan was a nice addition. We had a car, but I agree with other posters that getting to other hotels in not easy - had dinner at Animal Kingdom Lodge one night, but would never attempt that via the bus system. We decided to splurge and stay on the Club Level (Concierge Level). That was wasted money. Essentially you pay a fair amount more to get a continental breakfast and snacks throughout the day. Our room was on the 7th floor, but if you weren't in the right room your view was of trees. Top floor rooms also have solid walls up to about 4-5 feet so if you sat you saw little. Lots of employees working on the Club Level and every one of them was extremely nice, but not very helpful. As an example, we noticed a brass dragonfly desk light at the concierge podiums just off the elevators. My wife was interested in seeing if the lamps could be purchased or if we could be given the name of the vendor where we might purchase a similar lamp. Over the course of our week stay we asked 5 different CMs (employees if you arenâ€™t Disney initiated) and never got an answer. BTW - an answer of â€œDisney doesn't sell those itemsâ€� or â€œDisney doesn't give out the vendor because ....â€� would have been a fine answer for us. That would be much preferred to asking for our room number so when they found out they could let us know or telling us that the woman in charge of purchasing items for the hotel was off today so they would follow-up and get back to us, yadda yadda yadda became annoying. Also, many of you who travel might think that a concierge can get things that normally you couldnâ€™t â€“ like tickets to a Show in NY that is sold out, etc. That is not how Disney conciergeâ€™s work. We have been trying to get a reservation at Le Cellier (Canadian Pavilion in EPCOT) for several visits and they were always booked. We asked the concierge group and they basically looked up in the computer no different than what I had done a few hours prior from my laptop â€“ and I think I was faster although I only type with 2 fingers. How about checking, then taking my name and cell phone and text me if there is a cancelation during my stay. Speaking of my laptop â€“ I agree with many other reviewers â€“ no wireless ability in the entire hotel â€“ are you kidding me? How about spending $475 for a Club Level room and I still have to fork out $9.95 for Internet access â€“ the Hampton Inn in â€œWho Knows Where, Georgiaâ€� gave me free wireless access earlier in the week. I'm paying $475 a night for a room and snacks and you still want me to shell out another $12 a day to valet park. Disney's greed sometimes shows - make it free that your valet guys will make much more money from tips and everyone wins. I love Disney and go there about once a year, but stop trying to test my loyalty! Worst thing was that I found myself throwing a handful of gummi bears in my mouth every afternoon to justify spending the extra money on the Club Level. If I was going to fork out the dollars I felt like getting my share of the snakcs was necessary!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Wahine3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for spring break. My room was very clean and well kept. We chose the bunk bed with a queen set up b/c we traveled with children. Our view of the pool was amazing. The grounds of the resort are beautiful and well maintained. We used the boat transportation to Magic Kingdom and were very impressed. We never waited more than 10 minutes to get a boat. Try the show at Camp Wilderness lodge. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but maybe not the best...”
Reviews.Author: MSTraveler2000
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9 yr old daughter & I stayed 4 nights at WL for our second on-site Disney vacation. I booked a standard room because we're never there long enough to care exactly where our room is, so long as it's quiet. We were upgraded to a courtyard view when we arrived, and that was very nice. I was worried about pool noise from the courtyard, but the room was quiet. It was also located on a corner, so there was no one next to us on one side. There was never any noise. Our room was clearly aging but was clean and fine. On our last visit 6 years ago, we stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge, and I believe we probably had better service there and friendlier staff, but that may be the difference 6 years makes. The AKL is rather distant, and we happened upon the Whispering Canyon Restaurant at WL on our last visit. Our wonderful dining experience there 6 years ago, & WL's proximity to the Magic Kingdom, made me decide to stay there on this trip. Our dining experiences at Whispering Canyon this visit were not as great as the one I recalled from 6 years' past. We dined there for breakfast twice and once for dinner. This is a fun, family restaurant. On our first morning, our waitress was fun and energetic. Our dinner was not the lavish canyon skillet that we remembered--my husband and I had trouble splitting it even though it was supposed to be for 2. Our waiter was nice and was prompt but lacked the energy of the servers at neighboring tables. And on our last morning there, our breakfast waitress was just a sourpuss, and our eggs were underdone and pitiful. The manager, Darlene, was wonderful at getting us into the restaurant, since it was completely booked & I couldn't make dinner reservations. We had simply walked in on our last visit to DW, and I discovered this time that we needed reservations even for breakfast. The quick service restaurant had excellent food but the options were limited. The concierge desk tried to help but didn't really go the extra mile that we experienced on our last visit to Animal Kingdom Lodge. The grounds are beautiful, and we loved the fact that we could catch a water taxi on regular basis to ride over to Magic Kingdom--and then the monorail on over to Epcot. We stayed to watch Illuminations at Epcot one night, then caught the monorail back to Magic Kingdom. We then went to the boat dock and managed to get on the water taxi just as the fireworks were going off over Cinderella's castle. That experience was much more wonderful than actually being in the park for those fireworks, as we were the next night. Our boat captain idled across the lagoon so that we could see the whole production. I can't say enough good things about the captains of the water taxis. We had terribly long waits for the buses at Animal Kingdom Lodge, but we didn't have that problem at Wilderness Lodge. The buses ran regularly. We had the deluxe dining plan, which allowed us each 3 meals a day--either sit-down or quick service--and 2 snacks each day. We were also given mugs as part of the plan (usual cost: $15 each) with unlimited refills in the quick service restaurant in the Wilderness Lodge. We like being able to eat without having to pay the huge fees that Disney World charges for food. The dining plans appear expensive but we feel that they are worth the money, and my husband likes signing checks without having to hand over money. He says that the money has already been paid. We had the premium dining plan on our previous visit, and it offered more dining options; I'm going to have to compare both plans and decide which was best before our next visit. My brother had the basic dining plan and doled out a lot more money than we did, so anything above that is beneficial. We dined at the Yachtsman Steakhouse at the Yacht Club, and it was wonderful. It cost us 2 meals each on our dining plan, but we had a large breakfast and just skipped lunch, eating our snacks instead. We also had a character breakfast at Cape May at the Beach Club; the breakfast buffet there was awesome and worth eating even if you don't want to encounter characters. The buffet included everything from cereal, fruit, waffles, croissants, to hot omelet casseroles, grits, bacon, and biscuits. Simply wonderful. I was very impressed with both the Beach Club and the Yacht Club as we waited for our reservations at their restaurants. Our daughter became tired at Epcot, so we walked on over to the Yacht Club to wait for our time (which was too near for us to return to the WL), and the lobby was quiet and elegant, despite the continuous flow of people. My daughter had a quick nap on the sofa there. I can't say the same of our time waiting in the Wilderness Lodge lobby. Several times there were noisy children running wild in the lobby; it is a family-friendly place, but one expects some manners. The Beach Club and Yacht Club just seemed to command more respect in their spaces. I will probably stay at one of them next time. I cannot comment on the pool at the Wilderness Lodge. Because we only had 3 full days at DW, we spent most of our time in the parks. We just didn't have time for swimming. The one evening that we returned and contemplated swimming, the pool was rather full for our taste, so we stayed in our room. The pool is really large, but we just aren't into crowded swimming areas.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Aniversary”
Reviews.Author: joinville
Reviews.Content: After spending some time at Epcot during the Food & wine festival, we checked in at the wilderness Lodge, enjoyed the pool and had dinner at the Artist's Point. Great time!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: ashman13
Reviews.Content: I must say, this hotel is overratted. We walk into the hotel and we wait about 20 minutes in line to check in. Finally, our turn after listening to the two people in front of us complain. We were told we were "upgraded" from a woodsview to a courtyard view. I told them I do not want a courtyard view, and rudly he said it is the only thing available. We walk into the room and we had absolutly no view. They put us in a corner where the balcony was brick and you had to stand on a chair to see anything. I complained right away and he said there are no other rooms available. At this point I am outraged. I ask for the Manager and he says he upgraded us again to a room on the 6th floor facing the Magic Kingdom. He did not tell us that it also faces the loading dock of the hotel and all you hear all day are trucks beeping when they back up to load and unload. I was too tired to complain and did not want to spoil our vacation so I sadly settled with that room. The staff is very rude and I didn't feel like fighting it. The hotel is very noisy, and you get contstantly woken up by the loud lobby and restaurants. Traveling to the different parks was a big pain, the busses do not come as often as other hotels and no Monorail connection. There is one small dinky boat that goes to Magic Kingdom that is usually full, and another smaller boat that goes to the Contemporary. I was royally ticked off with that fact that they do not have Wireless Internet. How does a hotel not have a wirless connection in this day and age???? No business centre or computer to use in the hotel either. This was very upsestting since we brought our Ipad and were planning on using an online guide and planner. And also we could not check in with our airline on our departure. The bed is old, and you feel the metal springs protruding out of the matress. The rooms were kept clean. The shower was old and rusty and poor flow. Cute animals and characters were woven from towels everday. The quick service meals at the Roaring Fork are pathetic, only a few items to choose from. Other hotels have dozens of items. Pools were fine. Pretty basic, nothing special but did the job. Very cool lobby, nice valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Real Disney Feel, Just Very Crowded”
Reviews.Author: Hosalito
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending three nights at the Wilderness Lodge. We arrived after check in time, around 5, and there was only one lonely soul working the desk. We noticed that those who had done online check-in got their own line and it was much speedier, so if this is an option for you, take it! Our check-in gal was able to finagle a king bed room for us even though we had booked a queen + bunk beds woods-view room online. The new room had a "view" of the villas' courtyard, which trust me, you want if you are a light sleeper. The courtyard at the main hotel was INSANELY busy and if our room had faced that we probably would have gone postal by the 2nd night! Speaking of insanely busy....this place was rockin. We could hear our neighbors very well and in fact, too well. Their kid was just going nuts every morning at 6 am and every evening at 7 pm. The sound proofing in this place could use some help and if you are a light sleeper, you might want to look elsewhere for accommodations. The room had a king bed as mentioned, a desk with two chairs and a dimming/vanity light, a TV/armoire combo, and a refrigerator in a cabinet. The fridge was a welcomed sight at first but then we realized it was cheap....or old...or both as it groaned all night long. Night two we had disconnected it. I believe all rooms have balconies and ours had a small table with two chairs. We were on the first floor and there was a walkway out in front. It wasn't so busy that it was like a scene from "Summer Rental" but there was a decent amount of traffic on the path, so we made good use of the curtains. The cable TV selection at Disney resorts just stinks. They did not have Versus anywhere on property, only at the ESPN bar at the Boardwalk, so unfortunately we missed our hockey game. C'mon Disney....you make way more money than I do and we at least have a decent cable package! The hotel itself has a very woodsy feel to it. There were three restaurants and a market/store. One of the restaurants, named Roarin' Forks, was good but the food was so greasy we started calling it the Greasy Spork. I was pleased, however, to find a hummus and quinoa sandwich there for lunch (there are healthy options at Disney, you just have to dig a little). The other restaurants are Artist Point - their fancy restaurant (we tried to walk up without a reservation and were turned down, so make plans in advance if dining here is important to you) - and Whispering Canyon or something to that effect. The funny thing about Whispering Canyon is that the servers are VERY loud and boisterous. If you are celebrating an event and are bashful, don't tell them as they will broadcast your event all over that place and some seemed annoyed by it while others loved it. The food at Whispering Canyon was tasty and the service was OK, not overly fast. After being turned down at Artist Point we realized we could sit inside of the Territory Lounge (attached to Artist Point), and eat off of the bar's limited menu or the full restaurant's menu. We ended up doing this twice, and had a very knowledgeable/funny server named Joey. All told, we had the cheese plate (awesome), the gnocchi (tasty), the snapper (very good), and the salad and mushroom soup (both awesome). They have good drinks in here (full bar) and I thought the wine list was priced very fairly. We rented bikes one afternoon ($9 for an hour, $19 for the day) and rode over to Ft. Wilderness. That was a lot of fun and a good way to get some exercise. I could not fault the boat service to either the Magic Kingdom or the Contemporary. It was always timely. We took the boat to the Contemporary and then traipsed around the Bay Lake resorts (Grand Floridian, Polynesian, etc), getting there either by foot or by monorail, and really enjoyed this "tour." We were sniffing around the other properties to see where we'd like to stay in the future. What can I say other than, it was Memorial Day weekend and man was this place rockin. If you need peace and quiet, go somewhere like the Waldorf. The Wilderness Lodge is totally Disney and you feel it when they are sold out!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: bpuszko
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Disney World and I nearly made myself crazy trying to make a decision on where to stay. I finally decided on WL because of the bunk bed set up for my two kids - I figured they would sleep better and fight less. I was right about that. I can't say enough about how great the WL is. Pressed the button for the elevator, it was there instantly. Everything was clean, the rooms, the common areas, the pool area. Although the hotel was full, we never heard a noise all week while we were in our room. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was super nice to us. We did not ask for it, but our rooms faced the Magic Kingdom and we were able to see the fireworks from our balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: disneyreviewsbymom
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at WL but not our first on site.We visited last May and stayed at AKL. First of all, this is not a negative review but i would prefer AKL over WL. THE ROOM-The resort itself was very inviting and theming very grand upon first entrance into the main lobby. Cast members were very efficient in getting us into our room fairly quickly.Our room was not too far from the main elevator or the lobby. When you pay for a standard room do not expect much more than that.We did have a balcony but the view overlooked the service entrance and the garbage dumpsters-not a pretty sight.In light of this being the cheapest category of rooms available at this resort, i feel they should be further discounted to reflect this. The noise alone at 5 am with trucks beeping below us was not a welcome on the first morning of our stay.This continued all week.The room itself was clean but i did get a musty smell upon first opening the door to the room.Never had any problems with housekeeping, towels were always refreshed and even left us a towel animal one day.I did have to call to front desk to request the bed rails that i had placed on the reservation as they were not in the room when i had arrived. THE POOL-The pool/kiddie pool area was very nice and never overcrowded, there was no zery entry zone into the pool though.Towels were available to use by the pool and lifejackets were available to sign out as well. There was a nice beach area/playground for the kids to play in the sand and movies were shown in the night time.Very nice for the kids and it was never crowded here.Hot tubs were nice and never overcrowded either. FOOD-Primarily ate at the counter service restaurant but found the same food choices everyday to be dull.We mainly bought breakfast items to our room in the morning to eat.There was a toaster and microwave available to use in the main sitting area.I would recommend buying the reusable mugs if you plan on buying most of your drinks here to save yourself some money.There were tables outside to eat but there were many blackbirds around the area.This was bothersome and my kids were actually afraid of them as they would swoop down and try to take food right off your plate.I actually witnessed one man come out thru the door with his tray and drop the whole thing on the ground when a bird swooped down at him. Food at the Whispering canyon cafe was good but found the atmosphere to be very noisy.If this is what you like, you will like this restaurant.Don't forget to ask for some ketchup here! TRANSPORTATION-Loved being able to get the boat transportation to MK, 10 min ride at most directly to the park. Also used the boat to go to the Contemporary and then hopped on the monorail to visit the Poly for breakfast.Very efficient.The bus to Animal Kingdom and downtown disney were good, about 20 min ride to either and they were never really full.The wait for HS one morning was well over 45 mins and we missed park opening because of this.When another person called he was informed there was only one bus going to that park and there were almost 40 people in line to go to the park once it arrived. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here but would either stay at AKL next time or try another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: John522
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights at the Wilderness Lodge and loved it! It was the second time we had stayed there. The hotel is wonderful and easy to get around. The food at both Roaring Forks and the Whispering Canyon Cafe was really good. Our grandchildren loved the shakes and the pony races. The ferry service was great to the Magic Kingdom. The grandchildren also loved the pool area. The Bus service to the other parks was not quite as good as you had to stop at Fort Wilderness or the Grand Floridian and sometimes go to one of the water parks. The only downside is the laundry area where they need more washers and dryers for the number of people ataying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second and last stay at Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: CampswdogNchild
Reviews.Content: I have to preface this by saying I glanced over some of the reviews for the same week that we stayed and there is a huge disconnect in the customer service received. Unfortunately ours was on the low end of the scale. After doing online check in advance, we arrived about 9pm and went to the online check in, where we waited about 10 minutes for a cast member to come up and help ourselves and the family ahead of us. When we finally got to our room, it was a woods view (we paid for courtyard view) with a king size bed (there were three of us). Now its about 10 pm and we still don't have a room. Back to the front desk where after a lengthy wait we are offered a room on the 6th floor (you have to stand on the balcony to see out...why pay for a view?) that we can "have for the entire week or come back tomorrow for a room change" WHAAT? i want to be at Hollywood studios at 8 am! Now DH is coming over to see what is taking so long and he is really ticked when he hears the story. now HE talks to a front desk manager. another 20 minutes go by. we end up with a woods view for the night, and a promise of a courtyard view the next day and they will move our luggage. The next day we are dealing with the room drama and miss park opening. We don't get to a park till after 11 am (not the 8 am plan). I get a call saying our room is ready, so when we head back to the resort about 1:30-2PM I get our new key and we head up to change int swim suits & have a snack in our room. but guess what? NO LUGGAGE! Bell services still has it. so we wait. when we get our items, we are missing our milk (we'd had a grocery order) so I go down tot he lobby to the bell services desk and they actually send me outside to where they store the luggage. grrrr. Ok finally I get back up to our room, but now I have to unpack instead of relax and refresh before dinner. We are about 15 minutes late for our dinner reservation but happily they don't blink over that one. Our final room did have a beautiful courtyard view (though the front desk girl told me it was a "nice upgrade" when I went for our new keys...I let her know politely that it was not an upgrade, it was what I paid for to begin with.) The assistant manager did call and leave a message the first Saturday night and again the next Saturday to be sure everything was okay. I didn't call back as I had nothing else to comment but was just frustrated at how they handled our reservation to begin with. Our mousekeeper was okay, there were no cute towel animals everyday as there had been the last time we stayed. We never had a "privacy please" sign to use when we were hanging out at the pool, and one day we had to call for glasses and toilet paper. The outlet in the sink/mirror area was loose, as was the outlet cover behind the night stand, which we needed to charge our phones every night. Our first visit to Wilderness Lodge was much better as far as customer service goes. The Whispering Canyons staff was great, as was the staff and food at Roaring Forks.

Reviews.Title: “great place to getaway”
Reviews.Author: BandwagonPa
Reviews.Content: A+ for the Theme, Beauty of Grounds and Hotel interior, Remote feel while at Disney A for large warm pool, hot tubs and water slide. Nice pool around corner at t he Villas too, for room quality and for some room locations, quiet as a campground. A for Artist Point Restaurant and the quick service restaurant. B for access to parks. You always take a bus except to Magic Kingdom take the boat. C for some room locations. We had room above the Whispering Cafe Restaurant so the music came into our room each morning at 7:45 am and played till 10pm. D for Whispering Cafe Restaurant, way too corny. Only good for very young children and rednecks

Reviews.Title: “1st Disney Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sscgec
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so convenient to the Magic Kingdom, we loved taking the ferry. The staff was very friendly and helpful with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: acueroni
Reviews.Content: Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Cueroni Honeymoon Suite #7085 Wilderness Lodge Resort May 8 â€“ 15, 2011 Disney Honeymoon Experience We began by working with a planner to make reservations and were told to get the platinum plan for the Magical Experience for our Honeymoon. We were contacted four separate times and assured that it would be the Most Magical Honeymoon we could imagine. We were assured that the Honeymoon Suite at the Wilderness Lodge RESORT was beautiful and Magical as well. We were asked repeatedly if we were coming to Disney for a Special Occasion and assured that is would be special and Magical. We were Very Excitedâ€¦ Upon our arrival, we were not greeted as we got off the bus. We had been told to go straight to the concierge floor and our luggage would be delivered to us, however we had no way to get to the concierge floor without a key. We asked for assistance and guidance and after what seemed like much confusion and a significant amount of time someone came to get us at the Bell Captains Station with a key to allow us onto the 7th floor. As we stood outside the room we were handed a packet of information two keys and told everything we needed would be in the packet and our luggage would arrive in 2-3 hours. We were not acknowledged by name or that it was our Honeymoon. When we entered the suite we were very surprised to find it was only a King Sized Bed that barely fit the room and a Large Jacuzzi Tub that was rather difficult if not dangerous to get in and out of. This room was in no way a suite. We unpacked our bags and found that there were not nearly enough hangers, we called down to housekeeping to ask to have some delivered and were told they would be brought up. They never arrived. After we settled in we realized that we had forgotten our camera and went to the concierge station to ask if there was any place to buy a digital camera that is was our Honeymoon and we had forgotten ours. The response we got was, â€œOh, just buy a cheap disposable one or have the photographers take pictures of you and just deal with it.â€� That evening we had reservations at the Artists Point, we arrived and again though the food was wonderful and the service very nice no mention was made that we were celebrating our Honeymoon. We thought this was odd as such care was taken as we made each reservation were asked specifically if we were celebrating a special occasion. The second day we went to the Magic Kingdom and noticed people wearing buttons that seemed to identify them and why they were there: Birthday; Anniversary: 1st Time Etcâ€¦ We asked someone and they told us that upon their arrival they were given these and were having so much fun being acknowledged for their stay. We went to the concierge desk in the lobby and asked about this and they seemed a little baffled then after rummaging around in a desk gave each of us a button that read â€œHappily Ever Afterâ€�. Amazingly, we were still not even congratulated or acknowledged by any employees at this resort for our â€œMagical Stay for our Honeymoonâ€�. By the third day we were having to request hair conditioner be left in the room when it was cleaned and noticed that the room (the Jacuzzi in particular) was not being tended to properly. Empty bottles left on the side of the tub and no replacements for amenities. (Still no hangers). We became wary of the actual cleanliness of the Jacuzzi and decided not to use it for fear that is was not sanitary. Unfortunately this was the only feature that seemed to set the room apart as a special HONEYMOON SUITE. By our fourth day we were beginning to feel invisible in this Magical Place. We went to the concierge in the lobby and asked what was going on. We booked the Platinum Plus Package for a Magical Honeymoon and couldnâ€™t even get Hair Conditioner replaced in our room. Friends told us, that they had stayed at Disney for special occasions and were greeted with baskets of fruit a bottle of wine or champagne and fun acknowledgments and treats throughout their stay. We had not even been congratulated on our Special Day! The woman we spoke to looked confused as if we were asking for the world, my wife was nearly in tears. She said she would talk to someone to see if there was anything they could do. A little like having to ask for a gift that should have been a surprise. A few hours later we received a plate with an orange, two green apples some grapes, dried fruit and nuts with a box of chocolate and a preprinted card congratulating us on our honeymoon from the staff. It felt almost insulting that we had to Beg and be brought to tears to be noticed. Whoever, it was that helped us plan our days and reservations (we worked very hard to be sure that everything would go smoothly before we got there) failed to tell us that some of our dining reservations were in different parks than we had other events planned and it would be impossible to be in two places at once. We had to reschedule a meal at the Brown Derby one day (which turned out to be a blessing as the meal and the service was horrendous. When asked if we wanted a drink one of us said no, so the other was just ignored, then when we finally got our dessert, one of us was done and the other was promptly removed even though it was only half finished.). We missed our evening at Cirque de Soleil and dinner reservations due to the fact that although we were told we had reservations we found out that we had to arrive at least 90 minutes prior to claim our seats and could not make it in time from where we were. We were told it was an easy stroll from Epcot when we made the schedule. The following night we were scheduled to go to Fantasmic. Thank goodness we brought our itinerary with us, because we were never made aware of tickets or procedures to get to the VIP seating. After waiting for someone to help us for over 20 minutes and much confusion we were finally allowed to come through the special line and be seated. Our last full day of our Magical Honeymoon, we decided to sleep in for an hour. The housekeeper knocked on the door and I asked her to please come back. we left a note to PLEASE LEAVE HAIR CONDITIONER, as we had reservations at Victoria and Albertâ€™s Restaurant that evening. Upon our return to the room at 4:00 to start getting ready the room had not been cleaned and we had to go find a housekeeping cart to get the shampoo and conditioner we had begged for all week to be able to get ready for our Special Evening. At 4:30 there was a knock at the door for evening turndown service. Mind you the room had not been made up for the day as of yet and we were trying to get ready to go out for dinner. We asked that they come back later. 5 minutes later there was another knock on the door asking if we wanted the service or not. We declined as we were trying to get ready for our evening and the cocktail hour had not yet even begun on the concierge floor. On the concierge floor at the Wilderness Lodge Resort (we use the term resort loosely and believe at this point it should be removed from all descriptions except for the cost) it would appear that most of your guests believe this to be a dinner plan. We witnessed people in their swimming attire piling up plates of food and carrying with them not glasses but Bottles of Wine and sparkling water to sitting areas and their rooms. We were appalled by this behavior and were told by the concierge that this happens all the time there. If this is the case and although it is listed in the description of the Resort that there are certain dress codes and behavior required in certain restaurants and areas (i.e.â€¦Artists Point, an the Concierge Floor) we feel very misled and taken advantage of. Not once were we told or was it suggested that perhaps this was not the â€œResortâ€� in Disney for our Magical Honeymoon Experience. We were in fact assured over and over again that the room was Beautiful with a beautiful view (which was the back parking lot) and we should expect a Magical Experience. On our departure morning we had breakfast at the Whispering Canyon Restaurant and for the first time in Eight Days was wished a Congratulations by the Manager of the restaurant only. We waited 20 years for this Dream Honeymoon and we thought that we had truly made the Perfect Choice in coming to Disney for a Truly Magical Experience. We talked about our excitement for our plans for our trip with everyone we know and even people we donâ€™t know. Upon our return understandably everyone wants to know all about our Magical Stay and we are sure they wish to Share In Our Blissful and Magical Experience. Sitting here writing this e-mail with a Heavy Heart and Tears Streaming Down My Cheeks recounting our experience, we truly wish that our Magical Honeymoon Story would have had the Happily Ever After that was promised. Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Cueroni

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but I'm not dying to come back right away.”
Reviews.Author: xxmissvxx
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying it is NOT a negative review. I really liked the resort and I encountered some things I didn't like, but they aren't what is keeping me from coming back. I just have other Disney resorts I like more (I've made more than 50 trips since 1991) and would give a higher priority to. The grounds of the resort are beautiful, well maintained, and really make you feel like you are far away from everything. The lobby is grand and breathtaking. The cast members were some of the nicest I have ever encountered at a Disney resort. There are plenty of amenities and services available. Every request I made (king bed, ground floor) was fulfilled which surprised me. My biggest issue with the resort is the layout. It is somewhat confusing and hard to navigate. Perhaps more directional signs with room numbers would help. Even after 4 days I kept finding myself going the wrong way, hitting dead ends, and ending up on the wrong floor to reach my destination. They give you a map at check in...I suggest you keep it with you at all times. My room was very clean and well kept. The decor isn't exactly something I would put in my own house, but it matches the theme of the resort well. The room was a lot larger than I expected and found there was more than ample space for storage. The bathroom was large and clean but had a very annoying exhaust fan that was on a motion sensor. It went on every time I even walked past the bathroom...I would have preferred to have it on a switch so I could keep it from going on/off so much. My patio faced the quiet pool which was nice. The bed was incredibly hard but I have yet to find a Disney bed that isn't. They also have the worst pillows, but again I am used to them by now. The one thing that kind of bothered me was that the linens, blankets, and towels were the exact same ones you could find in a $90/night All Star Music room. Since I was in a deluxe resort I expected something a bit nicer. Maybe only concierge guests get that. I used the pool twice and was happy to find there was a "deep end." This is a rare occurrence at a Disney resort these days. It claimed to be 5ft deep but I am 5'2" and the water was almost over my head. The pool was crowded but the lifeguards had everything under control as usual. I ordered room service for breakfast two days and they were on time and the food was good. Price wasn't too bad for room service. Another two mornings I went to Roaring Fork for breakfast and was happy with the selection. It wasn't as horribly crowded as I had anticipated...good thing too since it is a small area. I used the boat transportation many times and was quite impressed. I never waited more than 10 minutes to get a boat and the trips were quick. Maybe I just had good timing, but I definitely had planned to wait longer. The one time that I took a bus to Epcot I was the only one on it...despite that it was early in the morning and all the other buses were packed. Strange, right? All in all, I had a great trip but like I said before, I am not dying to go back. Nothing against Wilderness Lodge really, I think I would just prefer Beach Club or the Polynesian if I am going to stay at a Deluxe resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Going above & beyond to ensure a magical stay!”
Reviews.Author: alh5908
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights with our 2 children, ages 4 & 6. When we arrived our children were both sick with stomach virus. Cast Members immediately gave us extra linens & supplies to deal with their illness. They also made sure to clean in a sanitary manner that kept us healthy the rest of our stay. As if this weren't enough, our family was involved in a car accident in our rental car about 20 miles from resort. When I called the Dining Reservation number (all I had with me) from the ER they made sure I got connected with the resort and assured me they would get our family back safely. At midnight, a cab came to pick our family up at the ER and return us to the resort. The next morning at 6am they helped my husband get all of our problems taken care of so we could enjoy the rest of our stay. They arranged for a scooter for him (he had a broken foot) and fast passes for our family. The Cast Members at Wilderness Lodge helped us move past a horrible accident and continue making magical memories! We cannot say enough about the compassion and care ALL the Disney Cast Members showed our family. In a nutshell, the food at the resort was outstanding, transportation was quick & easy, laundry facilities a lifesaver, pool area & entertainment fun-filled, and the atmosphere worthy of "deluxe" rating . We plan to return in a couple years and there is only one place we'll consider staying and that's the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: bigblueinflorida
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at Wilderness Lodge and I must preface this review by disclosing that we were upgraded (complimentary) to a Deluxe Room with Club Level privileges from a regular room with a queen bed and bunk beds. Thanks to overbooking in our room class because of an Ironman competition this trip was amazing. Before I get to the grounds and other common areas I'd like to mention just what is included on the Club Level. We stayed in 4169, a lovely room with a view of the lake and the sandy beach area. The room had two queen beds with French doors separating the bedroom from the living room. The living room had a full sized pullout couch in it and there was a small balcony with a table and chairs to soak in the beautiful room. Our room key granted us access to the 7th floor. We had no idea what to expect but were happy to find evening snacks which included Buffalo with Edamame, Sesame Chicken Salad, Venison Meatballs, artisan cheeses and fruits, Hummus, Uncrustable PB & J's for the kids, Espresso BBQ Grilled Chicken Skewers and more. There were complimentary soft drinks and juice boxes for the kids and Widmer Hefeweizen, Heineken, Bud Light and Yuengling beers plus some nice Chardonnay wine choices for adults. There is also a huge coffee machine which can make everything from espressos to hot chocolates. We stopped hoping to get a quick snack and ate so much we didn't eat dinner later. Yes - the food was THAT good! We had previously stayed at the WL in 2004 and 2005 so it had been some time since we last visited. The grounds are still lovely with tons of wildflowers. We took advantage of the small boat transfers to Magic Kingdom and used the buses for Epcot. We swam all 3 days and the pool is large and my girls loved the waterslide. The pool bar has a nice selection of adult drinks and there are ample loungers available for all guests. We watched Old Faithful erupt a couple of times which was great and we ended up eating one night at the Roaring Forks Cafe. My girls, of course, asked for "More Ketchup"! The Artist Point restaurant was fabulous. I had Dungeness Crab salad which I loved. In all the prices there seemed consistent with Disney's better dining choices. The game room was a fun diversion during a rain shower and my girls were able to find some video games to keep themselves amused and they played air hockey as well. The lobby is a great place to grab a seat and people watch. The ceiling height is amazing! In all it was a fabulous visit and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME - Do not take mind to negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: jskjwilderness
Reviews.Content: We visited 5/5 to 5/10 with a large,extended family of 13 including a 12 year old, 8 year old, 4 year old, 3 year old, and 2 year old. The hotel was amazing - staff was super nice, amenities great - concierge level is so awesome! Corey and Gianna are AWESOME! Definitely do it if you can spare the extra $$. The transportation to the parks was really wonderful. Only had a couple short waits for the bus and boat. Overall, I would definitely return to the Wilderness Lodge. There is really nothing bad to say about it. If you read any of the negative reviews, pay no mind. This is our third trip here and all three times have been absolutely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: bigmaffy
Reviews.Content: It had been years since I had been to WDW. We decided to splurge on a Deluxe Resort while there and picked WL. Wow, were we pleased with this resort! It's a stunning building with a fabulous pool. It was very quiet for us, even though we were across from the vending area. We loved being able to take the boat to Magic Kingdom. My son thought the boat ride was one of the best parts of the day! We never had to wait very long and even took the boat to MK then grabbed the monorail. The only negatives were that either our travel agent or WL got our reservation wrong and didn't put our rooms together, so check-in took longer than it should have, since we had already used online check-in. The family restaurant is delicious, but can be slow. The cornbread was SO good though. The rooms are a little small, but typical of Disney and really, you aren't in the room much anyway. You can't go wrong with WL! We are going back to stay at the Villas in June!!

Reviews.Title: “10th Anniversay was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: darcybird
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate our 10 th anniversary at Disney and since it was Disney, we brought along our 2 youngest kids, boy age 9 and girl age 6. When we arrived, we had a blinking message on our room's phone. To our delight, it was from a "Disney staff member"- it was Mickey and Minnie singing Happy Anniversary to us! We stayed for 4 days and went to all 4 parks. The Lodge was so beautiful and breathtaking. The staff treated us like royalty and nothing was wrong, it was all just perfect! We are local, ( an hour or so away) and have been to to Disney countless times, but had never stayed in a Disney hotel. So this was an awesome experience! Took tons of pictures, the kids loved the pool and beach area, I think more than the parks, lol. We will be getting passes and come over much more often now.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Srzmyers
Reviews.Content: Where to begin.. this is our 4th trip to Disney. Our first time with children (twins age 2) This place was amazing! Very expensive I must say . We stayed in the studio which is in the building with the Villas. Compared to the other hotels ( moderate) it is a little bigger but not by much ( so depending on what you want to spend you can do a moderate and still be happy).The studio had one queen size bed and one pull out sofa. Perfect for us. Sofa bed was pretty comfortable. All rooms with balcony/refrige/micro. We were located on the 3rd floor. This hotel has alot of walking to get to certain areas. The Villa where some other family members stayed the room was not much bigger then ours they just had a full kitchen and washer and dryer. Very close to MK. And you can even take the boat over there if you prefer not to take the bus. Buses did not seem to run as often as other hotels. Not sure of the reasons. It is close to Magic Kingdom but not to the other parks. Now we had stayed at French Quarters and we thought that was further away but as we found out it seems that hotel was in the middle for distance to all of the parks. I would say the only difference between the moderate and the high end hotels is what is at the hotel. There were 2 pools. The larger pool has a slide and a baby pool ( to which was great for us) it also has another pool which is pretty large closer to the Villas but that does not have a slide. And the large pool always has something going on for the kids. Rooms were very clean. And we had maid service everyday. Maids were very nice. BUT one day I noticed a maid coming out of a room with a purse that she was zipping up. THAT I DID NOT LIKE! Went to general manager at desk and asked if this is normal for them to have maids carry purses in rooms and I DID NOT LIKE THE RESPONSE I GOT. He informed me that he would have to have house keeping call me and let me know what the policy is for the maids with purses because he did not know. HELLO your the general manager? And I did not want them to have my name and number as I was not looking for my stuff to be taken. And though he took my info no one ever called me. SO BEWARE OF THAT! I would say that was the only thing we did not like. But over all it was a great hotel! If you are trying to compare I would say a moderate hotel is just as good . We did the meal plan and the quick service area is not as big as the moderate hotels but this hotel does have a full service restaurant. like I said before the buses picking you up at the parks does not seem to come as often as some of the small hotels. The staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: WVClairenmaddy
Reviews.Content: 2nd year staying here. Loved it even more. Last year we did the Club level, this year we opted not to do that. Stayed on the 3rd floor with lovely view of the pool area. Room had bunk beds which my kids just loved. I actually felt the room was larger than if it would've had 2 dbl beds. Only complaint is the lighting in the sink area, it seems so dull and hard to see. I also don't like that the fan goes on every time you step into the bathroom, annoying after a while. The room was very clean, the hotel is spectacular. The Whispering Canyon restaurant was excellent as is the Roaring Forks. While we were there they had movie on their beach which is great fun. Pool area is excellent and very clean. I highly recommend a stay here. After staying at the Polynesian for years I'd have to say I like the lodge better. They also have very reliable boat service over to the MK every 10 min or so.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Careful-tourist-IN
Reviews.Content: We stayed from March 19-March 25, 2011. It was great. Before we left I read reviews of the hotel being run down and dirty. I do not know what they are talking about. I have heard about bed bugs being more prevalent so we brought flash lights and looked the room over more than you would know. We took the sheets off the beds looked at the box springs, check the closets (every screw hole) the table the chairs the Drawers I could still go on ----Nothing and very little dust. The dust we did find was in the screw holes and the rails to the drawers in the dresser. I was amazed. You could tell the carpet had been replaced not that long ago. The hotel is great we loved taking the boat to magic kingdom and when we went to epcot we took the boat the MK and then hopped on a monorail to epcot. My kids are getting older and this may have been our last visit (as our complete family) I am glad we picked the Wilderness Lodge. I want to go back already!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lyd2020
Reviews.Content: Nothing was to spread out, bunkbeds were perfect for the kids, Whispering Canyon was a great treat to us all, Artist Point was good for me and my husband, and the boat ride to Magic Kingdom was much easier than taking a bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spalmen4
Reviews.Content: This was our first Disney trip and I wanted a nice hotel that was not too big and close to the MK. The WL did not disappointed. As you walk into the hotel, the lobby is extremely impressive. Check-in took less than 5 minutes (I recommed doing on-line check-in prior to your arrival). The rooms are nice, nothing great. The pool area and grounds are beautiful. Lounge chairs around the pool are hard to come by. What I liked most about the hotel is that it is the perfect size. Some of the other hotels are enormous and I can only imagine how long it would take to get around. We were on the main floor and were 2 minutes away from lobby, pool and restos. Transportation was great - quick boat ride to the MK and the buses to the parks were great. I would definetely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best resort in Disney”
Reviews.Author: SightseeingMom
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Disney's Wilderness Lodge. We love it there! The staff makes you feel right at home. It's very clean, the rooms are spacious, it's a nice place all around. The pool and outside bar are a fun place to relax. One thing I will say is March seems to be one of the busiest times for Disney, I've never seen the pool area so busy and all lounge chairs were taken every day we were there. Food is very good at all restaurants on that property. You must have a good sense of humour to eat at Whispering Canyon. We will definitely be visiting there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Still a nice hotel but starting to show it's age”
Reviews.Author: shoestie
Reviews.Content: My family and I have traveled to Disney at least once a year for the past five years. On all but two of our trips, we have stayed at the Wilderness Lodge. We still find the hotel theme and the lobby unparalleled. I have to admit, though, that we didn't find our club level room as "magical" as we used to. The rooms are starting to show their age, the tiny bathroom started to become bothersome, the mattresses were not very comfortable and, with the exception of a couple staff members, the concierge staff on the club level were not terribly friendly. The "free" breakfast hasn't changed since we began staying there and the lack of variety was tiresome by day 4 of our trip. We also couldn't believe that they wanted to charge for Wi-Fi access. We still like the Wilderness Lodge but may try staying at a different Disney property the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “LIke going back in time!”
Reviews.Author: metrolady
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to stay at the Wilderness Lodge for 5 nites. The room was so cozy and comfortable, and it felt like being in a 1940's bungalow. I loved the option of traveling to the parks either by boat or taking the bus...This was my first time staying at a Disney Resort, but it certainly will not be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Nycountryfried
Reviews.Content: Firstly our visit didn't start out great. We had a few room issues ...but got the best person at registration ( gloria!!!)to fix it all. From then on..heaven. Pool was great but we did ...one day ...have a problem getting a chair... as visitors from the campgrounds had taken the launch over ..that was my one negative.. Otherwise perfection!!!!the roaring forks quick service provided better food then most of our sit down restaurants (except for our favorite ohana cafe in the Polynesian) we had a courtyard room upgraded after issues with our first assignment. Clearly Gloria cared and wanted us to b happy and get our requests satisfied. We even found the hidden Mickey in the fireplace that had eluded us for 4other visits.all in all couldn't recommend it more.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: tkaupke
Reviews.Content: We had a ball, the people were friendly, it was very clean, food was great , rooms were great, pool great, been their 5 times and we are going back. There is 17 in our group and this is our favorite of all the resorts it is smaller then the others and it makes it nice a cozy for all. Also we love being close to Magic Kingdom and not far from the tram. We love it.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home with PERKS!!”
Reviews.Author: hippiemoose
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best resort that we have stayed in on Disney property. We have never done any of the value resorts or the Grand Floridian but other than that this is the place to be. Always clean, always inviting, always cast members smiling and there to help. We had a room with the bunk beds for the kids. It was wonderful!! We could actually see the top of the Magic Castle from our room and at night could see most of the fireworks right from our room. I would NEVER hesitate to stay there again. We have spent many years and now keep returning to the Wilderness Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “OLD AND TIRED WITH RUDE EMPLOYEES”
Reviews.Author: mamalyn27407
Reviews.Content: Our "magical" experience began at 1:00 when we tried to check in. After a 10 minute speel about Disney, the hotel, etc., he finally told us the room was not ready. He said he would text us when it was ready, but he couldn't guarantee it until 3:00. At 2:00, I went back to the desk and there was another boy there. He said he didn' know why he told me that because check in is not until after 3:00. At 3:00, I went back and spoke to yet another person. He was very nice, though fake, I thought. He acted like he was going to try to find another room that was ready, but when he went over to the woman who was obviously his supervisor, she said no. Then she came over and proceeded to tell me that check in is not until 4, so technically they have another hour!!! At 3:40, I went back and started getting loud, but had no luck again. After about 5 minutes, I got the text that the room was ready and to "have a magical day". By this time, we were both in pretty bad moods. When we got upstairs, we saw the staff in the hall and it was obvious that the pace at which they move is extremely slow. To sum up this hotel, it is old and tired. The rooms, especially the bathroom fixtures, show the age of the hotel. The shower head is ancient and to top it off, there was no hot water.
