We only wanted to pay for the least expensive room, knowing we would not be in the room much, but we were shocked to see just how bad "standard view" is. All we could see was a parking lot for trucks (that beep when they back up at 6am) and a slimy pond. I do understand that part of the high room rate is for the transportation, which is still very good and fairly quick. In addition to this high room rate, they have the nerve to want $10 a day for internet. There is no microwave in the room, but there is a refrigerator. This is very annoying because we like to make coffee in the afternoon or after dinner. They obviously want you to go downstairs to buy whatever you want. I would never stay here again, but I do recommend staying on the grounds because it makes getting around so much easier. I also recommend the breakfast and dinner buffet at Trails End, which is at the campground. It is a little pricey, but the quality is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DisneyDad78232
Reviews.Content: I looked into all the disney resorts before our family vacation and I found this to be the most kid friendly of the deluxe resorts. The service was great. All the staff was friendly, and very prompt. The room was spotless. Transportation to all the parks was never an issue as the longest we had to wait was 10 min. We used the deluxe meal plan and found it to be a great benefit. there was more then enough food. Also it was a funds saver. My only complaint was with the food at the high end Artist Point. Save your money and go elsewhere. The food was over seasoned and I had to return my dish twice. One because the meat was raw, and then burned. All the other food was just ok. It did have a great wine list though. This was the only down side to our trip. I will return hear on my next Disney stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice near Magic Kingdon”
Reviews.Author: Ferrazalves
Reviews.Content: WeÂ´ve loved our stay at WL. The resort was amazing, beautifully landscaped, charming and the boat ride to MK was great! Also it was easy to get to Epcot - boat ride to Contemporary, hope to monorai and from there to TTC and Epcot! Much better than any bus! My daughter loved the slider and the pool! We had early dinner at Whispering Cannyon and the staff was great! Our reservation was to 6:30pm, but we missed lunch and it was 5pm - so we decide to try to talk to them and see if it was possible to antecipate it - and the said "of course" and we was seated in less than 5 minutes! Also the housekeeping left some animal towels that made my daughter smile all the time she entered the room!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Fun Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: wine_on_vaca
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Wilderness Lodge and we LOVE the atmosphere here! It is conveniently located for Magic Kingdom, however we were a bit disappointed that there were no shuttles to the other luxury on-property resorts for dinner (it takes approx 40 minutes to get to the other hotels to eat at one of their restaurants...though they are only a few minutes away by bus). We ate at Artist Point and it was excellent! Could not have asked for a better meal or server. Only wish was for a better wine list. We would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone planning to stay on-property and wanting to be conveniently located to Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location with great service - Prices to Match”
Reviews.Author: MLandLM
Reviews.Content: Our first stay on the Disney property. Fairly expensive for what you get and everything costs you. They do have a nice lounge and a restaurant with funny and great service. The meals are expensive, but every one we had was good quality and consistent. They have a very nice pool, but it's small for the number of people on site and they won't really let the kids have much fun other than floating around and going down the small slide - I understand no running and common sense, but they really frown on any kids on shoulders and that kind of stuff. Our kids were bored in an hour of swimming and had no interest in going back. We didn't really feel like they nickel and dime you, but it's obvious that they want you to spend money and are not embarrassed to charge top price for everything. The Lodge is beautiful and you can take a quick shuttle or boat ride to the parks. The room was very nice, but very small. It's definitely worth staying once, but we'll probably stay off site next time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service - rude staff”
Reviews.Author: terryc9313
Reviews.Content: You spend you life raising your daughter to the age of Sweet Sixteen and you want to do something special for this special day. We had AAA plan our stay at this Disney Resort. I was unable to get this time off from work at first but was able to work it out if I could do a few hour work each day by internet, I was unable to get on the ineternet our 5 day stay at Wilderness Lodge Resort. I was on the phone the first 2 days with support. They could not figure it out. The last person I spoke with was so rude I had to hang up the phone. This person should not be working for Disney, in fact he should not be working with the public at all. We had planned a Birthday dinner at Magic Kingdom for my daughters birthday. We were told by an associate of Disney if we went to another park for the day we could still get in magic kingdom for our dinner reservation. Well guess what, when we got to the gate to go to our reservation we could not get in. We had used our card for another park and we could not go in. We went over to guest relations and tehy would not help us at all. They told us the only way we could go in was to purchase park hopper passes an additional 54.95 per ticket making our dinner cost nearly $400.00 for our daughters birthday. We had to cancel our reservations. My wife and daughter walked away crying their eyes out. I ask to talk with a supervisor twice but was denied both times. It is all about money with Disney. Where dreams come true, not for my family. We returned to Wilderness Lodge to see if we could have dinner at the restaurant in our hotel. The host at the restaurant was as rude as the support staff. We ended up eating at a snack shop for dinner. The whole reason we went to Disney ruined. Our only bright side of the whole stay was our housekeeper Linda. She brought our daughter ballons and passes to any park but it was a little to late, we ran out of time. Why could Disney not let us in 1 hour before the park closed just to have dinner. We spent over $5000.00 for this special day all for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: pacomolly
Reviews.Content: It's nice to stay on the grounds while in Disney but this facility is waaaay overpriced. We paid $365 a night and they still wanted $10 a day for wifi?! Come on! The food is average at best and for a family of four to eat at their carry out restaurant it costs about $40. My advice save your hard earned dollars and stay at one of their more economical locations. You'll spend most your time out of the rooms anyways, at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “More than we could have expected”
Reviews.Author: havegunwilltravel
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great. Looks like a giant Log Cabin. Easy check-in, Good food (for a family resort), friendly, helpful staff, easy access to Disney attractions. Property is not new, but maintained very well. We had three 4th floor rooms overlooking pool. Perfect. Kids (7,6,3) all loved it. For anyone traveling to Disney, know where you want to go and what you want to do. Most importantly, make reservations for everything EARLY. 180 days in advance should get you into everything you want to do. Don't miss "Fantasmic" at Hollywood Studios and T-Rex restaurant at Disney Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The Wilderness Lodge is my favorite”
Reviews.Author: Travelingaroundtheus
Reviews.Content: The Good - This is a great Disney hotel. - The rooms are clean and I love the decor. - The kids had a great time at the pool. - The boat to the Magic Kingdom was a plus. - Roaring Fork food is good. - Clean The bad - Nothing really bad but I wish they would add a couple more boats. The ugly - Nothing

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy with Efficiancy of Hotel Employees and Services”
Reviews.Author: suzzyq6587
Reviews.Content: - We did not get maid service throughout the entire weekend - Wait for buses took 40+ to take us to the parks - Over an hour check in process - Constant errors in Disney Dining Plan System left unresolved the entire weekend - Incorrect deactivation of dining access and park access left us missing out on park time - unhelpful service and sarcastic implications from Manager, Paul.

Reviews.Title: “Super fun hotel, in a great location. Disney Magic.”
Reviews.Author: EnglishBlondCat
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I am a real Disney girl. Visited Disney over 10 times, stayed on Disney property 4 times and would happily go back 4 times a year if I could afford it and take that much time off work! Having said that, I don't think my attitude to the Mouse would jade my view on the hotel quality - I am no nonsense when it comes to my vacation, after all, it is my hard earned money! I am single and went on holiday with just my teenage son back in August 2010. We booked the accommodation directly with Disney and added the Deluxe Disney Dining plan which was on offer at the time. We also added the free Disney bus from MCO to the resort. Since most people stay in Disney property to experience the full "Disney Magic", I will include a review on other things besides the hotel in case it helps others. - Loads of people do the Disney Dining plan now. Absolutely ESSENTIAL that you book up your meals as soon as you can online (6months before when I went). If you don't you will not be able to eat at the best Disney restaurants. Fact. - Quite a long walk at the airport to the Disney bus stop. We then sat on the bus for over 30 minutes before departing. After a 10 hour flight this was a little annoying - although it was free so I guess you can't complain. Wouldn't do it again - would pay the relatively small fee for a private transfer. Multiple stops before arriving at Wilderness Lodge. - Goose bumps pulling into our resort - the lodge is really beautiful and we were helped with our luggage by the doorman - Only a 5 minute check in and receptionist helped explain the dining plan. Lobby spectacular. - Room was standard double on the lowest floor. We didn't have much of view, but then again we didn't pay for one. When I'm on holiday with my teenage son - neither of us could care less about the view really! Room did seem a little dated, but was a great size, nice big TV and table, dressing area etc. Housekeeping very good. - The Whispering Canyon Cafe (think that's what it's called) - very cheesy - particularly for our English way! But it was sweet and charming and the waitresses were very friendly to my kid. Breakfast very good and filling. - Disney deluxe dining gives you A LOT of food. In all honesty too much for us. We never ate the full three courses we were entitled to but had some great dinners. Particularly recommend the California Grill and the posh restaurant at Animal Kingdom lodge. Had a pretty decent steak at the steakhouse at Epcot also - although had to wait 45minutes despite having a reservation which we arrived 5mins early for. I have NEVER experienced that in all my life. We missed the fireworks because of it :-( - The disney buses /boats / monorails are very good - but you can wait up to 15mins. I don't care because it used to take 15mins from Carpark to park entrance when you drove so all works out in the end. - Pool very nice and clean. Loved the music around the pool (mainly for the kids activities I think). We got sun loungers middle of afternoon - unheard of in some hotels. - In all honesty there are not that many brilliant rides in Disney Park - ie. you will not find 10 roller coasters. However, there are some real gems which do make your stomach go, and are such good fun. Rock n Roller coaster / Terror Towers at MGM, Everest at Animal Kingdom, Test Track at Epcot, Splash Mountain at Magic Kingdom. Typhoon Lagoon excellent, although better slides at Blizzard. - Found nothing to complain about during the holiday (unusual!), but was looking forward to some Coaster action and something a little more upmarket at Universal Resort by the end of the 7 days. Debated whether to give this 4 or 5 stars. The hotel itself compared to say Mandarin Oriental in Washington DC is not a 5 star. However, the location, ambiance and general execution of the wilderness theme sways me a little to a 5. But I think I'm going to stick with the 4, and save my 5 for something I really think is close to perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, a little disapointing.”
Reviews.Author: jewles1128
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful, we had a great time hanging out by the pool, however when we arrived there we found that the entire hot tub and geyser area was under construction. This was a surprise to us and very disappointing consider we booked our stay partly because of the amazing pool area. The bunk beds we were promised were also unavailable and the kids were upset. We did enjoy the closeness to the parks and had a great view from our room of the lake and the electric water pageant at night. The kids also loved the pool and water slide. A great hotel, but would not have chosen it knowing that there was construction going on.

Reviews.Title: “The Wilderness Lodge brings out the finest in Disney hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: RatLamp
Reviews.Content: It took several years of dreaming, but our dreams finally came through when my kids and I packed up for a one week vacation at Walt Disney World and a stay at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. The pressure was now on Disney to make sure they would live up to those years of expectations, and the hospitality giant did not disappoint. It was one of the best vacations of our lives. The Wilderness Lodge Resort is themed around staying in an old National Park Lodge, only on a bigger and grander scale. The lobby is six stories tall and made of giant logs with Disney totem poles greeting you as you enter. Disney has a rapid check-in which allowed us to get to our room without waiting in the usual long lines. This was great and got us to our two queen bed room within 10 minutes of arriving. The room was beautiful and reflected the theme of the hotel and Disney's attention to detail right down to the towels in our bathroom. Although the room itself was not big and the beds were a little hard, you still felt cozy staying on Disney property. The bell staff soon arrived with our bags and spent a good 10 minutes answering our many questions about the hotel and the Disney parks. I must say that Disney knows how to maintain a well trained and happy staff. I cannot recall running into a single "Cast Member" at the resort who was not friendly and went out of their way to make our stay the best. Staying in a Disney resort may cost a little more, but they make sure you know your money was well invested. The Wilderness Lodge has plenty to keep the family entertained when you're not prancing about in the Magic Kingdom or around EPCOT. The resort wraps around a giant pool complete with a water fall and several hot tubs. The lake, which our room overlooked, has several different types of boats for rent and bicycles to allow you to ride around the Fort Wilderness area. Although my teenagers were too old for it, there are daily activities scheduled for the kids that looked like a lot of fun. A free taxi service was provided for us to the nearest Disney golf course so we could try our skills at the game. Disney has so many wonderful restaurants to choose from one could not eat at all of them if you stayed a month. The Wilderness lodge has a wonderful fine dining restaurant serving seafood and steaks. There's also a fun casual dining restaurant overlooking the lobby where the servers pamper you in a western atmosphere. The little cafe serves meals all day and into the late night. A bargain there is to purchase a Disney Mug for $9.99. You get free refills from the cafe for the rest of your stay. Disney did not disappoint in any way. Our stay at the Wilderness Lodge was magnificent.and everything we dreamed it would be. Although we visited during the off-season when rates are at their lowest, it's clear that Disney's craft in making you feel special knows no off-season. Our week flew by and no sooner had we taken the Disney Express to Orlando's airport than the dreams of returning to "The Happiest Place On Earth" began to take shape.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....terrible transportation”
Reviews.Author: Gretnatraveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the lodging but the transportation to and from the parks was unacceptable. Ended up renting a car and driving around to the parks after waiting 45 min. for a bus to take us from Hollywood studios to the hotel. Dinner reservations hit and miss. Never once got in at our reservation times. Always arrived 15 min. before scheduled and ranged from 5 min. wait at Whispering Canyon to 45 min. wait at Coral Reef. Missed fire works and they could not have cared less.

Reviews.Title: “Best themed hotel on Disney property!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel on Disney property! Its located almost on top of the Magic Kingdom. Its very close together and the whole hotel can be accessed indoors. Its not like some of the others (GF, POR) where you have to walk outside of the main building to get to your room. Transportation is excellent, there is the bus stop out front. The boat to Fort Wilderness and Contemporary (which you can jump on the monorail) or directly to the Magic Kingdom. The service is excellent, everyone is friendly and very helpful. The shopping inside the hotel is very nice too. Arcade and marina's are fun to kill time in too. The best view at the lodge in my opinion is the woods view. You can look out the back and see trees, but also hear and depending on the side of the hotel your on see the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom. I found the pool views to be annoying because if you try to nap durning the day you can very easily hear all the activity going on. Food at the Wilderness Lodge is also excellent. You have the option of Roaring Forks which is their quick service which has good food that is quick. Whispering Canyon is a nice sit down, just make sure to ask for the ketchup! The last option is Artist Point, it's pricy, but worth every penny. Its high end dining, but worth it! Overall I love Wilderness Lodge, Ive been there three of the five times Ive been to Disney. It seems to be the least expensive of the Deluxe hotels but also the best themed. Christmas they go all out and everything in the lodge is decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, breath-taking resort. Low flying bats every night tainted the experience”
Reviews.Author: blackacex2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights on the top floor (club level). We did not expect to be in club level as we had only paid for a woods view room, but I suppose we got lucky. This is resort has to be seen to be truly appreciated. The lobby is gorgeous, the pool is great, the beach, the boat to the magic kingdom, all the hidden mickeys and attention to details all make it an awesome place to stay. You could make a vacation out of just staying at the lodge, enjoying the pool, the restaurants, the fire place, beach, hot tub, boats etc. It has everything you could hope for in a dream resort. I'm not really an outdoorsy type person and I still really enjoyed the theme of the hotel. So all that stuff was wonderful but during our stay there were bats flying around in the lobby every night. They were flying up high and also swooping down low right next to guests in the lobby. This prevented my wife and I from wanting to be in the lobby or the connected restaurants at night. I did see animal control there trying to catch them, but it seemed as if they weren't able to do much as every night the same amount of bats appeared. The bats at one point flew right at my wife and I while we were waiting for a table at artist point, which led us to run out the door. Bat hit the glass and flew away right in front of us. Pretty discomforting. My wife and I were too tired to deal with changing resorts so we decided to just avoid the lobby and restaurants at night as much as possible. It was a real bummer but I will say this is a 5 star review if there were no bats.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!!!”
Reviews.Author: lvjen
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at the Lodge in January. This was our first trip to D-World , we did a ton of research before our trip & we ended up having an awesome vacation! The lobby & grounds here were gorgeous. We had a 4th floor courtyard view room & I loved sitting on our balcony every morning listening to the waterfall below. Made sure to enjoy some relaxation aside from the parks, enjoyed the pool & jacuzzi nightly. There are so many D-World hotels..after checking out a few others on our trip, we really were liking the easy layout of the Lodge, how everything was so close to our room (pools, restaurants, bus stops, etc) --especially like on day #3 or 4 when your legs are so tired from all the parks ! The best part was the transportation- took busses to most of the parks, especially loved taking the boat over to the Magic Kingdom & for a few meals at the nearby Polynesian Resort . Would really recommend the Disney Magical Express, handled getting us & our luggage to & from the airport, even our boarding passes upon checkout-- couldn't be easier. loved not having to bother with a car, maps, etc. We'd love to go back someday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: srgnix
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other level Disney resorts in the past, we stayed here this past summer. What a treat! The surroundings are outstanding and excellent for children including a geyser just past the pool. Be sure and go out at night for a light and music show on the lake. Staff was courteous and plenty. Don't understand the earlier comment about questions for the desk people...there is a separate concierge staff to answer questions, purchase tickets etc. Also, elevators are just past the reception desk! Easy lay-out and great location. Wish the pool was a little larger, but no big deal....

Reviews.Title: “Two vacations in one; frenetic parks and relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: yogimomma
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our choice to stay here. My 9 year old liked the warmth and coziness of it. We loved the scenery, especially in the morning on the dock waiting to catch the ferry to MK. Taking the ferry was a lovely and speedy way to get to MK and to the Poly and Contemporary . The girls loved the pool and the activities , the game room and the theming in general. It was impressive. The lobby is breathtaking and the resort is a wonderful place to come back to after a fun-filled albeit hectic day at the parks. We found the resort to be very quiet. Our room was on the sixth floor on the left wing facing some service vehicles which I anticipated might be a problem. I asked for a box fan and one arrived within minutes. It blocked the noise beautifully. An added bonus...we saw the fireworks clearly from our room. Loved that. My girls and hubby enjoyed Whispering Canyon so much, we went twice. ( For those vegetarians out there, they have quinoa cakes and a good salad; not just ribs, brisket and chicken, etc. They weren't bad.) None of us were crazy about Roaring Forks. Transportation to Epcot, HS and Animal Kingdom weren't bad at all. They stop at another resort on the way but are the first ones to be dropped off which is nice. We give the Wilderness a thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: BatonRouge_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great experience. The lobby is really cool (wish I'd have taken a picture to upload), and the room had everything we needed. We chose the "woods view" since we knew that we were not going to be spending lots of time in the room anyway. (We left in the mornings, came back for a short rest in the evenings, then were out for supper and more fun until we got too tired each day.) The beds were extremely comfortable! The room had a coffee maker, refrigerator, dual-sink vanity, as well as the vanity area separate from the toilet/shower. The rooms were always very clean and serviced daily, complete with a towel "critter" a couple of times to add a little something extra. In regards to access to the parks, the bus rides were very convenient with short wait times. The boat ride to/from Magic Kingdom is nice, especially after a long day, but the wait time is a bit longer for those. Downstairs the Roaring Fork Cafe had great breakfast as well as quick service meals which fit very well with our dining plan. It was cold while we were there, so we did not go to the pool area, though it looked awesome. Last time I went to Disney, I stayed at the Grand Floridian. I can say that for me, personally, the price difference is not really worth it unless the monorail is a "must-have". All in all, this is just a fun, convenient, nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Inviting theme, great for young kids”
Reviews.Author: KCmom3
Reviews.Content: I have never posted a hotel review before, but since I used TripAdvisor to choose my Disney hotel, I thought I'd put in a good word. Traveled a few days ago with husband, grandma, and two small children. I had previously stayed at the Polynesian and was a little wary about not having monorail access, but getting to the parks was a cinch - took the bus to Epcot (very speedy) or the ferry to Magic Kingdom (a bit of a wait to board, but only a 10 minute ride). Given the hotel theme, I think I may stay here again over the Poly. I had read that the rooms were too small, but we had connecting rooms with grandma and would have been totally fine in a single room if we had traveled with just the kids. Pools were beautiful, lobby was very striking and overall, we had a great experience. I usually stay at 4- and 5- star hotels, and while this isn't the epitome of luxury, it is a great choice among the Disney hotels.

Reviews.Title: “magical time at disney's wilderness lodge”
Reviews.Author: rookie_11
Reviews.Content: We had such an amazing time at the Wilderness Lodge. The best thing about it is the location. The quick boat ride to the magic kingdom was fantastic, and we never had to wait long for a boat. we also took the boat to fort wilderness campground one evening for the campfire and singalong with chip and dale, which was great. we wish we had more time to enjoy the lodge but were so busy with the parks didn't get to do it much. our room was small but comfortable and the 2 beds seemed bigger than queen. we expected housekeeping to "decorate" our rooms with the kids stuffed animals, etc, but they didn't do this. the lobby is amazing, and the boys (age 4 and 2) liked it, there was lots to look at and chairs to climb on, etc. We had a reservation at Whispering Canyon restaurant for dinner one night, which was very expensive, so I wouldn't really recommend it unless you are on the dining plan. Also our 2 year old was bothered by the loud yelling, but if your kids were in the right mood I could see it being fun. the bus transportation to the other parks was easy and we never waited long - also we seemed to be the first to be dropped off from every park. kind of nice! my husband and 4 year old swam in the big pool one night, it was very cool outside and they liked having a side entrance to come in so they didn't have to walk far outside. the pool is heated so they were comfortable. we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever!”
Reviews.Author: dct0608
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The staff is really friendly and the different options for getting to the parks is fabulous. We never waited very long for a bus or boat. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Wilderness Lodge is Magical!”
Reviews.Author: bigdisappointment
Reviews.Content: Been to Disney before, but this was our first time at the Wilderness Lodge. We plan on going back every year. Loved the hotel. Very clean, great customer service, and beautiful environment. Loved how close it was to the Magic Kingdom. Just about a 6 minute ride on the boat. Even the buses to the other parks were very convenient. Our room was very clean with a great view. Enjoyed both pools and the parade on the water at night. was a great surprise. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others. A Magical time had by all!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Hotel!!!! My favorite place at Disney so far!!!”
Reviews.Author: whitneyfox86
Reviews.Content: One word describes this lodge - AMAZING! The lodge's detailing is priceless and flawless. You feel as if you have been transported into a western lodge in a whimsical forest. Words cannot describe the lodge's beauty! The Christmas decorations are top notch and over the top! When I walked into the lobby I just had to stop and stare for a few minutes! The rooms are great - the service is high quality! Best resort I have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful, miserable reception staff, when you expect upbeat, cheery staff at a Disney Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KARENFURNESS
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our hotel at 10.30pm and, after I had attempted whilst booking to make everything perfect for my daughter's 21st birthday, we were initially given a â€˜kingâ€™ room, when I had pre-booked a 2 queen bedded room. You have no idea how unhelpful, miserable and disappointing reception staff can be! It really doesnâ€™t help when youâ€™re tired and know you have to be up early the next morning. They couldnâ€™t even give directions to the elevator and it really was not obvious and was several minutes walk from reception. So we were back at reception 3 times and had to queue each time to ask a question. We also phoned reception from the 'king' room to try and get it changed to the 2 x queen bedded room and we were left on hold for initially 15 minutes, then she came back and said "Not forgoten about you", then immediately put us back on hold for another 15 minutes before cutting us off. We then went back down to reception and queued up again for us to be left stood at reception whilst she went into the back room to sort it out - another 20 minutes. We did get a 2 bedded room eventually, but it was well after midnight before we had our bags moved, etc. Anyway, Saturday at Disney's Magic Kingdom was perfect. We left the park at around 8pm and caught the boat back to our hotel, from which we watched the fireworks. We were frozen by then, but had had an amazing day. When we got back to the hotel, I had organized our room to be â€˜Princessedâ€™ in the Disney fashion, but we couldnâ€™t get in, as our keys wouldnâ€™t work. We queued at reception and had them re-set, went back to our room and they still didnâ€™t work, so we had to go back and queue again to have them re-set!!! I was not happy with this, as we were absolutely shattered. No apology, no smile, no nothing and the surprise for my daughter was ruined. On Monday morning I decided we should give the hotel a chance to redeem itself, so we went and had a good look around. We came to the conclusion that it is a very nice hotel and all the staff are lovely, except those on reception and they continued to the end to have long faces and to be totally unhelpful. I am so disappointed and so surprised that Disney employees would be like this. Wilderness Lodge is a Disney Deluxe hotel and I expected it to be excellent, but it is not. It is only OK and is very expensive for OK! There was no evidence of a Manager and they need one to sort out the miserable, unhelpful reception staff. They have left me with such a bad impression of this hotel. If I passed any of the hotel staff in the corridors - on the long walk to the elevators - they would avert their eyes, rather than smiling and saying hello. It costs nothing to be friendly and cheerful and has left me with such a bad impression of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable rooms. Quick transportation to the Magic Kingdom.”
Reviews.Author: JLPNJJP
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the service at the Lodge was not good. Our flight into Orlando was delayed, so we did not check-in until after 11pm. The employee at the front desk was not the typical friendly Disney cast member. He checked us in with little to no enthusiasm and proceeded to point us in the wrong direction to our room. After wondering around the Lodge for 5-10 minutes (kids and luggage in tow), we finally went back to the front desk and waited several minutes for the less then helpful front desk employee. He finally pointed us in the right direction to our room. Also, we were celebrating 2 birthdays and a first time visit, none of which he acknowledged. As others have stated, rooms in the lodge are small, just your typical 2 queen bed hotel room, nothing â€œdeluxeâ€� about our room. Our room was clean and lodge theme in carried throughout in typical Disney fashion. We had a clean and comfortable room, perhaps a little overpriced, but that is to be expected at Disney. The main reason we chose the Wilderness Lodge was its location and transportation to the Magic Kingdom. You can hop on a boat and be dropped off right at the main gate outside the Magic Kingdom (closer then the monorail or bus stops). It can be a chilly boat ride this time of year on the smaller open boats, but there are larger enclosed boat that makes trips from the Lodge to the Magic Kingdom as well, if you donâ€™t mind waiting for the enclosed boat. You can also take a boat from the Lodge to the nearby Contemporary Resort and hop on the monorail to go to the Magic Kingdom, Polynesian, Transportation /Ticket Center (switch monorails there if you want to go to Epcot), or the Grand Floridian. The various transportation options available at the Lodge are a plus. We recommend dining at the Whispering Canyon at the Lodge. You will not leave hungry, huge portions! Our server, Bob, was a lot of fun and very helpful at explaining the Disney Dining plan to us. But if you are looking for a quiet meal, look elsewhere. This is a place the kids will enjoy and is very entertaining. We did not dine at Artistâ€™s Point (itâ€™s a signature restaurant and we were too cheap to use 2 dining plan meals per person). The quick service, fast food type meals at the Roaring fork are edible at best. Typical tasteless burgers and pizza you will find throughout Disney. They do have some tasty snack options- blueberry muffins are yummy! There is a microwave in the back of the seating area at the Roaring Fork too, so bring some popcorn or snacks from home to heat up in the microwave. This was the first time we took advantage of the Free Disney Dining Plan and we completely recommend it. Once you understand what you can order, it will save you a ton of money. We debated whether top take advantage of the Room discount or free dining (canâ€™t do both). We could have saved about $300 on our room, but we saved more with the free dining offer. Each time we had a character buffet or table service meal, we paid $80-180 for 2 adults and 2 children for 5 nights. Not to mention the fast food type meals would have been $25-40 each day for 5 days. So if you are planning on eating at the Disney restaurants- take advantage of the free dining offer!!! Overall, the Wilderness Lodge is a great choice. We have stayed at the Caribbean Beach and Coronado Springs in the past, and the Wilderness Lodge is our favorite. Wait time for transportation to and from the lodge was shortest of any of the Disney resorts we have stayed at, and that is a big plus for our family!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: tgropp
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for the 10'th time from Dec 19'th -26'th and had a 2 bedrrom villa through our Disney vacation Club points. This hotel is beautiful and the location is second to none. This is our 6'th time staying at Christmas and it holds so many memories to us until this last trip. We arrived and were immeditely queried on to why we had 11 people staying in our room. After 1 hour all was straightened out...so we thought. Later on that night, our meal cards would not work ( we purchased the DVC meal plan) , so off we go to the front desk. They told us that we would have problems since we had 11 in a room. I told them we had 7, plus a child. After 45 minutes all was straightened ou. Next morning the cards would not work, and off to the front desk. Again, we were told that we have to many in our room and there would be problems. After an hour, all was straightened out...until the evening when our keys would not let us in our room. Down to the front desk. Greeted by :how come you have 11 in a room"?. Next morning meal credits would not work on card. I go to the front desk and ....you guessed it. "How come that you have 11 in your room"? I explain and ask to see a manager. The manager comes out and looks at me and tells me that we have to many people in our room. After an hour all was straightened out. Until the evening when the meal credits would not work. Back to the front desk for 45 minutes to get straightened out. Next morning we go for breakfast....meal cards would not work. We go to the front desk and were told we have 11 in a room. I ask for a manager, he comes out and says he wants to make sure that we did not get any extra meal credits since we have 11 in a room. I am stunned but quietly explain what has all happened. I am wondering how many managers they have since I never speak to the same one. Next morning, we have no meal credits left on our cards. I go to the front desk and they see me coming and quickly run away as they know that I have been having problems that they have no way of fixing. For the next three days we had to pay for all our meals for counter services and hand in the receipts. The table service meals had to be verified as being paid by the hotel before we were allowed to leave the restaurants. This took up to an hour each night. I also had the keys reissued on three different occasions amongst many other incidents that happened. This went on for all 7 days. By the time the holiday was over I was ready to go home. I asked the front desk manager to phone me when I got home, but I had to phone them. I had lost 19 counter service and 24 snack credits due to them cancelling them on me. They reimbursed me for them but they sounded like they were doing me a favor as they stated that they never refund money for meal credits that were not used by the customer. I had to remind him that I COULD NOT USE THEM since they eliminated them from me with 3 days left on my vacation. They never once acted like anything was wrong and it was always like it was my fault for some reason or another. Honestly, Iwas expecting a phone call from the manager apologizing for all the inconvenience, but that was not happening. They just wanted to not recognize that there was a problem. I understand that something like this only happens once in a blue moon, but if it happens to you at this hotel....you are on your own. As I had said this hotel is beautiful, but after this experience and the hotels reaction to this problem, I can no longer visit this hotel for fear of it happening again. I just dont want to expeirence this again or want anyone else to go through what I did

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my visit to Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: bakedogg
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my trip to this Disney Hotel. It definitely had its advantages over many other hotels in the resort. Location was excellent, and it was easy to get to the Magic Kingdom using the boat service directly to and from Hotel. Enjoyed the food options, and the bar located in lobby of place. Awesome appearance on inside and out. Rooms could be larger, and this place can be a little over priced depending on the time of booking. Staff was very friendly and courteous. Overall, a wonderful time for my family.

Reviews.Title: “The Wilderness Lodge was awesome!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: abolvari
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED staying at the Wilderness Lodge. From the first moment when you walk in and see the breath-taking lobby, it's all magical. The main pool area was beautiful with the waterfall and slide. :) My son loved the slide! We stayed in the Villas and loved the details in the lobby. There were wood carved animals, fireplaces, game tables, a health center and other great details. We enjoyed the hot tub by the Hidden Springs pool after a long day of walking the parks. The pools were heated too, which was great for the cool evening or morning temps. There's a nice little beach and dock and you can rent bikes to ride the trails on the property. The staff was very friendly and the food in the Roaring Forks was great! We loved being able to jump on the boat and ride over to Magic Kingdom. It was a great way to get back and forth. We also rode the boat to Contemporary for our Breakfast at Chef Mickey's. We highly recommend a stay here and hope that we're able to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Very mixed feelings. . . .”
Reviews.Author: mg3542
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully landscaped with a nice pool and hot tubs and very, very attentive lifeguards (way to go Disney). It has activities if you are not too fried from the parks (movies on the beach, pool games) bike rentals and evening childcare( which we did not use. ) The first several nights I thought it was enchanting that we could see the Water Parade from the balcony and the fireworks, but this faded as fatigue set in from the parks. You will hear the music from the parade, the boom from the fireworks late at night and the piped in courtyard music starting at 7:30 a.m. whether you want to or not. I disliked how huge, HUGE this hotel was (it isn't cozy Mommy) and really hated the dim, mission style lighting. I couldn't get enough light to read in the room at night. The water taxi service was nice to Magic Kingdom, the campground and the Contemporary, but not reason enough to stay here alone. If I came again, I would prefer to stay at the moderate French Quarter, where we stayed in 2008. PS: Know your family well. The trip worked well for my 9 year old, my 7 year old hated everything but the pool - it was overstimulating. While we were there we golfed near the Dolphin (family oriented but not swarming with vomiting children) and had a great lunch overlooking their pool, and visited the Boardwalk. I would look at these 2 areas perhaps next time. The Boardwalk had a great selection of restaurants, it got old eating at the food court. I hated, hated, Whispering Canyon at the Lodge. I crawled on the floor to steal ketchup to avoid the yelling and hollering as I had a headache. My kids didn't like it either "too noisy, Mommy." Overall, too big, too stimulating.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!! WILL ALWAYS STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: snh2505
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE The Wilderness Lodge. I stayed there December 26-January 2. It was awesome! The beds were amazing, best sleep I ever had. We were the Old Faithful Club and the food was great! We even cancelled some of our dinner reservations because we couldn't stop eating the food for our level. We were treated like royalty being on the 7th floor. The place is beautiful. Everyone was so friendly and were so eager to help you out. I will always stay at this lodge from now on when I come to Disney. It's such a "homely" feeling being there. If someone says something negative about this place, please disregard what they say, because I can promise you this place is terrific!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun location with great pool & staff but beds very uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: mess0277
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Magic Kingdom visits with kids with added bonus of boat transportation. Staff are extremely attentive and the pools are incredible. Aside from hefty price, however, the main drawback is bad mattresses on the beds.

Reviews.Title: “So beautiful, so much disappointment"”
Reviews.Author: Bblbbl2222
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at five star hotels and resorts on vacation. We spent a lot of money on this trip and just grimaced and took what we got to be on Disney property and for the theme but this is the last time we will pay for the Wilderness Lodge. The check in person I think totally bamboozled us with the first floor suite we got seeing we were tired and probably had no energy to refuse the room and fight any fight once we walked the trek there with the two kids. We were happily tired after great days at the parks and pool fun so we slept through the poor room and service and were able to stand it only for that. This was the third stay in three years in a row for the kids at their magical ages. Second stay at wilderness lodge. We went for the club and larger room this time. The club was okay for snacks and repose in a limited and disappointing space. The snack hours were closed oddly timed for us and too late in the evening. The pool and hot tubs are very nice but crowded in afternoons when activities are on and music is overly loud. The beach is okay but small, no activities, no swimming and mostly empty. The lobby and theme of decorations and architecture are so enchanting but the rooms, service and value are such a disappointment. The landscaping - trees, geyser, waterfall - are lovely but you don't sleep and get service in the landscape and we had no view of it. Fireworks are noisy and late, watershow is noisy and late every night, halls are noisy, being near entry/stair/elevators is noisy. I don't think there is any peace to be found at any time. The suite had a worn and dated bathroom, very gloomy lighting, very stingy space. Everything is spaced very far apart; elevators, restaurants, club area, boat/bus Disney transport, pool, beach and pool bathrooms are all treks for and with kids. We paid club level rates but had a first floor suite with no views and a micro patio with a huge wood pillar and no space. We were supposed to get turn down service and got it once and attitude when we called for it - there was only one person doing it we were told and was very busy. The room felt grimy, there was someone's large hair clip on the floor between the bed and nightstand so not a good signal of any detail in cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “BEST DISNEY HOTEL EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: beaniegirl6
Reviews.Content: Me and my family have gone to Disney World 3 times! But i would say by far we all enjoyed the Wilderness Lodge the best. Me and my sister got to have bunk beds which made us both very happy. We all slept perfectly! The food was AMAZING!!! We all loved the art work. I would recommend this hotel to any one who loves the out doors. The pools are amazingly warm relaxing and huge. The transportation was outstanding we had buses and boats. The boats were so fast and comforting. If i ever go to Disney World again i will chose to stay at the Wilderness Lodge above every other hotel in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “A great WDW hotel, but not even close to AKL”
Reviews.Author: AACN
Reviews.Content: We are die-hard fans of Animal Kingdom Lodge, but wanted to give Wilderness Lodge a fair try. It came out OK, with a hint of a disappointment. Disney's re-creation of Yellowstone's Old Faithful Lodge is quite amazing, but falls short of providing guests with the sensorial delight of AKL. I have no complaints, but just wish I had stayed at AKL instead. On the plus side: dinner at Whispering Canyon is amazingly fun (hint: ask the waitress for ketchup) and Artist Point is also great (food & wine).

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need major cleaning and updating!”
Reviews.Author: Mike49389
Reviews.Content: This was a return trip to the Wilderness Lodge because we loved it 8 years ago. We didn't realize that the rooms had not been updated since then. When we checked in there were pretzels crumbs in our bathroom. When we checked out 6 days later, they were still there. Had to shower in ankle deep water and then wait 15 minutes between showers for the water to go down. Everything in the room looked old, dirty, and dingy. The lobby atmosphere is great and you can't beat the location. Visit the Wilderness Lodge but don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER. BEST TIME OF MY LIFE!”
Reviews.Author: amanda1997
Reviews.Content: my family stayed here two years. it was the greatest hotel in the world. the cast members were fantastic. plus, i am 13. the first time i stayed here i was about 11. this was a place where my parents actually let me wander around alone. i wewnt to the food area(roaring fork) BEST FOOD EVERRR. sooo happy about it. even 3 different flavored ice cream machine! the cast mambers were lovely. the only problem was the maid. she made me 2 little stuffed animals out of towels. so, i wrote he a note and asked if she could make more. but instead she took back the 2 animals and our money and didnt make me anymore animals. but that was just the only thing. the hotel is amazing. the pool is amazing. and in the back hidden by the beach you can watch a movie on a projector in the sand! also, there is another villa-pool in the back of the hotel. it was an overall WONDERFUL experience. first, we booked our hotel at the port orleans. HORRIBLE HOTEL. PERIOD. so we switched to the wilderness laodge and it made us sooooo much more comfortable. GREAT HOTEL! stay here, ignore the people that say it was horrible, cause obviously they arent disney people! well we are, and this was the best time of my life. thanks wilderness lodge! we love you! <3

Reviews.Title: “Lobby A+; Rooms D”
Reviews.Author: TombradyBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: Staff was great... received late checkout; bunkbed room upgrade. Beautiful lobby, especially at Christmastime. Roaring Fork quick service always busy and located inconveniently within hotel. Rooms felt like cheap motel-- bed linens poor quality and old with stains. Carpet the type you don't want to walk on with bare feet. Dingy. Also stayed at Yacht Club for same trip and loved it. Worth the higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Now I know why so many love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: PetefromRI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the 1st week of December and this resort was beautiful with all the Christmas decorations up.We've stayed at many Disney resorts and this is now one of my favorites.The rooms were clean and comfortable,the water pressure in the showers was good and the service was pure Disney.This is truly one of Disney's best themed resorts and there were plenty of ammenities with the Villas right next door.The restaurants were very good and the pools and hot tubs were also very nice.My only complaint would be that the transportation is a bit lacking.We had to wait about 40 minutes a few times going and returning from the parks but it wouldn't be a deal breaker for us.We really enjoyed this resort at this time of year and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed.”
Reviews.Author: atdallastx
Reviews.Content: We were terribly disappointed with the rooms here. They need to be updated (to say the least) - and are SO small with very little room for what is needed for a lengthy vacation. It was the type of room where I did not want to walk in my bare feet - it was just dirty & dingy. The comforters were AWFUL - reminded me of a motel quality, same for the rest of the linens...just really not impressed with every aspect of the room (for the price paid). We also found some kid's hairbands under the curtains, so obviously it wasn't cleaned very well. The tiles in the bathroom are from the 70s and it was just gross & old. So were the towels. I would NOT tip to get a towel animal, we got 2 while there and my child could've cared less. The TV channels were terrible & I think they only change the sheets every 4th day. One day, housekeeping did not even pour/rinse out the coffee I had made that morning they just left it along with the coffee grounds. More complaints? Why yes! We used the Magical Express which was far from magical, but that is another post. We requested 1pm check in multiple times since our flight arrived around noon. Well, the room was not ready even though check out time is 11am. So we sat around the hotel (without our luggage) killing time until it was ready - checking back every so often. Finally around 3:45 (check IN time is 3pm) I was furious so I went to check on it again. Come to find out, it had been ready all that time, but housekeeping did not alert the front desk. Really? We complained and got some fast passes from the manager for that inconvenience. Then complained again when it was close to 5 hrs and our bags still hadn't been delivered from Magical Express. It was ridiculous.... My advice if you are not having a "magical experience" is to tell them that and they usually will comp you something. We had a friend staying in the Villas part of WL and their room was much nicer. The boat service to MK was the best thing about this hotel. The bus service to the other parks were a beatdown, in my opinion, but it was really the only option to get to the other parks. The Quick Service place here was a ZOO!!! I avoided it at all costs - the Whispering Canyon restaurant was the best meal we had in the hotel. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Calm and tranquil, very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: marielynn724
Reviews.Content: Another member of my travel party had selected this hotel, it was not my first choice and I wasn't that interested in it originally just because I thought the themeing wasn't to my taste. However, when we arrived it took my breath away! The architecture (exterior and interior) and beautiful grounds are just stunning. The hotel also has a very tranquil feel to it. It is not busy and bustling like some other Disney resorts. The themeing was also lovely. Staff was great throughout our stay as well. After a crazy exhausting day in the theme parks, the Wilderness Lodge was the perfect sanctuary to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View!!”
Reviews.Author: theartfultable
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Resort for 3 nights prior to Thanksgiving. Once again the exterior of the resort and view exceeded my expectations however the room did not! We moved over to the Wilderness lodge from Animal Kingdom and the first thing we noticed was the room was smaller and more dated than Animal lodge. It was clean and had a great balcony. The view was wonderful though our room which was upgraded without an additional charge was on the 5th floor and overlooked the lake and pool area. I could even see the Electric Parade at night and the fireworks from our balcony. The resort's pool was fantastic with the lifeguards and waterslide. My son could of stayed there all day rather than doing the parks. The pool bar did lack food though just snacks and drinks. We ate at Artist Point one evening and I do have to agree it was bright for dinner but the food was good. We were on the dining plan so the prices didn't bother us. We also used the counter service restaurant which was less expensive than I was expecting. The other restaurant was ok the food was not really good at all Whispering Canyon but the service was funny and hokey for the kids. I think the Wilderness Lodge caterers to the kids better than Animal Kingdom ie., boat rentals, ping pong on the beach, bike rentals, pool area, arcade, movies on the beach at night, etc. but on the other hand my son loved the animals at Animal Kingdom. The geysor going off every hour was also a nice touch and the waterfall. The MK ferry ride was wonderful and such a great way to arrive at the MK. It was only about 10 minutes to get there and boats run all through the day and night very accessible. We did take a tour of the Contemporary, Grand Floridian, Polynesian and were very happy with our accomodations that we selected! By far it was the best value for what we got for the price. Can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “its nice, but not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bushbuck1
Reviews.Content: Yes the hotel has a great looking lobby, but even that gets a little spoiled with the commercial photographers, timeshare booth, and addl pin cart when there is a gift shop right across the lobby. the restaurant is open to the lobby and if you are sitting in the lobby you hear the constant yelling from there for ketchup and such. I know its a game they play there, but certainly makes relaxing out of the question. The rooms are average, dark and fairly clean. The pool bar hours should be extended and offer some actual lunch items. This is a nice, fun, safe and good family hotel. It is not what I expect to see under a class of luxury hotel. I walked thru the villas and there lobby and I would say that is more of a luxury atmosphere. There food needs work, but most of Disney does. If you are staying there for the parks and not the hotel, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: UNCCH81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our first opportunity in several years to get away together and decided to try the Wilderness Lodge since we had not stayed there before. The resort theming is beautiful and the lobby area is quite attractive. However, the rooms are a great disappointment. We were assigned an accessible room even though we did not need it. Our room was dark, the bed was so close to the floor that I had difficulty getting out of it, there was no chair to sit and relax in, and there was no vanity space for storing grooming essentials. You should not choose the Wilderness Hotel and expect a deluxe resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, location & pool. Would return anytime.”
Reviews.Author: marioOttawa
Reviews.Content: Althouhg expensive, I believe the hotel is a good value for money. Nothing serious to complaint. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic theme, but rooms and service disappoint”
Reviews.Author: JosephJ_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disney Wilderness Lodge from Nov 6-9th 2010. The lobby and public areas are cleverly designed and look amazing. It is Disney imagineering at its finest in a Northwestern theme. However, this resort really does not belong in the Disney Deluxe category. Here are the good and bad about the Disney Wilderness Lodge: The Good: 1. If you stay here take time to walk around the entire hotel. There are so many interesting corridors, balconies, staircases, fireplaces, pathways, nooks and walkways to see. The pools are nice (with the exception of ducks sometimes swimming in them) and the landscaping is top notch. Overall a very atmospheric place. Disney out did itself in the design of the main resort areas. 2. Very convenient boat rides to either the Magic Kingdom or Fort Wilderness & Contemporary Resort. The Bad: 1. The rooms themselves are small and have no comfortable sitting chairs like other Disney deluxe rooms. Also housekeeping short sheeted the beds and the flat screen TVs did not have high def reception. Also we could not turn off the closed caption function on the TV. The toilet/shower part of the bathroom was dark and drab looking. The shower spray was very wide and uncomfortable. The refrigerator did not get very cold. The room was clean, but rather worn looking. 2. Poor concierge service - the concierge told us to our face we were getting a Florida resident discount on our Disney tickets. The next day we found out we were charged the full admission price and complained. We were told that you have to buy tickets at least one day in advance to get the FL resident discount. So the concierge basically lied to us. Also another concierge gave us bad directions to Downtown Disney and we wound up back on I-4. 3. Poor reservations system - made dinner reservations for the Whispering Canyon Cafe in the hotel and were seated 25 minutes after our reservation time. Most respectable places would offer a free drink or appetizer as an apology for such a screw up. We just got a "We're so sorry". 4. Annoying ducks - ducks swim in the pool from time to time (so I assume they poop in there too.) Ducks also beg for food if you eat at the outdoor dining tables of the Roaring Fork Cafe. Staff seems indifferent to them. I guess the ducks are more important than the guests. The Bottom Line: I'd stay here again but only if I got a decent room rate. I would recommend to family and friends but only if they can get a great room price, too. Kids, in particular, seemed to be having a good time here, due to the grandiose theme. Also, If Disney wants to be honest about the overall quality of the Wilderness Lodge they should place it in their moderate resort category. If not, they need to ugrade the rooms and service for it to really be a Disney deluxe property.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy Crawlies & Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Disneynuts2010
Reviews.Content: After over 30 trips to Walt Disney World Resort, we had tried almost every Disney resort except for Wilderness Lodge, so we were excited to check it out. The hotel lobby and grounds were beautiful, but the size and cleanliness of the rooms leave a lot to be desired. Also, after unpacking, we all went out on our patio to take in the view of the woods and lake. Then we were joined by an unwelcome guestâ€¦an alligator. He was swimming in the lake and then parked himself on the grass a stoneâ€™s throw from our patio. People from upper level balconies were throwing food down to the alligator drawing him closer to the hotel building. Even the guests staying in the room next door to us left a whole muffin sitting on their patio step trying to draw animals closer. Who knows what they were thinking? Needless to say, we were unable to sit or relax on the patio, and my daughters were scared to death every time my husband opened the patio door. At first I thought it was a fluke that there was an alligator at Wilderness Lodge, but he obviously lives there since he was there all four days of our trip. How can Disney allow this at a family resort when they are such dangerous animals? The second thing that was incredible to me at a â€œDeluxeâ€� resort was the condition of the boat that takes Wilderness Lodge guests from Magic Kingdom back to the resort. I am referring to the larger boat with windows and a front and back open seating area. The small wooden boat was fine that we took to Magic Kingdom. On Sat. and Mon. night after leaving Magic Kingdom, we all boarded the S.S. Creepy Crawly (the larger boat) to head back to Wilderness Lodge. At first I noticed a very large mosquito on the wall and killed it with a tissue, then my husband said not to bother. I didnâ€™t know what he meant until I looked around (inside and outside) the boat and the walls and ceiling area were all covered with these huge mosquitoes. Then to make matters worse, there were huge (you have no idea) spiders like I have never seen before on the middle and bottom part of the boat walls and seats. People were literally ready to jump off of the boat once it finally docked at the resort. Also, there was a thick layer of dust on the bunk bed frames and in the dresser drawers. And the queen bed sheets and one pillowcase had black dirt marks on them. I reported this to Mousekeeping but did not receive a reply. This was definitely not a "Deluxe" resort experience especially for the $$$$ amount of money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “First Vacation without kids!”
Reviews.Author: lolabee2000
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel with so much to do for not only kids, but adults too! Close to the Magic Kingdom. We were able to see the fireworks from the beach too. Clean and everyone was so nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tipperary4
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge surpassed my expectations. The setting on the water is so tranquil. In the morning, I drank my coffee while looking out at the boats. Nice start to the day before running around the parks. The kids loved the pool while my husband and I enjoyed hot tub in national park setting. The lobby is gorgeous but loud. Dining options are not great. Whispering canyon is fun for kids but one visit is enough. Roaring Fork us only okay. Artist point was very nice but not worth the money. We had fun trying out dining options at other resorts. Rooms are small but nice and clean. Fantastic proximity to magic kingdom by boat. Concierge was not very knowledgeable. Booked family for a tour and when we arrived at location, we learned our children were not allowed so we were very disappointed. Overall, a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Young Children”
Reviews.Author: philschrek
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time at this hotel. My husband and I were travelling with a 6 year old and a 1 year old. We were upgraded to a courtyard view room at check-in and it was perfect. We could see the Water Pageant right from our balcony. They had lots of fun activities for the kids each day. Our 6 year old participated in a rubber duck race, crafts, and cookie decorating. The theming here is perfect and the grounds are beautiful. I would definitely stay here again. We were pleased with the transportation and the selection of food at the Roaring Fork.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: idahoin
Reviews.Content: Loved this place!!! The food was always hot and fresh, the rooms very clean. The staff went out of there way to make are trip the best every!! Always told us to have a magical day, smiled and helped us with what ever we needed. The best thing was the location, we took the boat to Magic Kingdom or monarail to Epcot. The only way we would go back to Disney World is if we could stay here. Thank you Wilderness Lodge!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing - Unsure about Conceirge Floor”
Reviews.Author: KareninColorado
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. We've been to Disney and stayed on the property four previous times, but this was our first time at the Wilderness Lodge. Overall, I would recommend the hotel. Very pretty setting, loved being on the water, the boat transportation to the Magic Kingdom was fantastic. We opted to upgrade to the 7th floor concierge level where breakfast, snacks, appetizers and desserts were served every day. Overall, we loved that feature but by the end of the trip we were very tired of seeing the same food day in and day out. Nothing is changed - every day it is the same muffin, cereal, cookies, etc. However, we did save a ton of money by having breakfast there along with beer and wine in the evening. I will say that the check-in process for the 7th floor was very confusing. We received 3 sets of keys and parkhopper cards. We were later told it was because we checked in on a Saturday and the people working on the weekends are not as experienced as the weekday folks. Who knows? The pool was nice, but we ended up at the quieter pool by the Villas more often than not. As I mentioned, the boat transportation was great. Bus service to Epcot was very very difficult to get. We've never had that problem before. We also waited for a long time at the parks for the buses as well. We ended up taking our rental car because it was faster. The beach party actitivies at the pool are nice for the kids. We rented bikes and enjoyed that as well. If you're considering the concierge level, please know that you will have a balcony but no view unless you walk to the edge of the balcony and look down. Kind of claustrophic for me, but it might not bother other people. As for the room, we expected the room to be "worn" as we had heard that before. It was worn, but the location was really good and quiet. My daughter had a bunk bed and LOVED it. Housekeeping was really nice as well. If we go again, we will probably try another hotel since there are so many, but overall I would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for the magic kingdom”
Reviews.Author: Lawyersontour
Reviews.Content: This is a good family friendly hotel with a great pool, exceptional staff and a spectacular lobby; access to the magic kingdom via just a 10 minute boat ride is the very best reason to stay here though. Access to the focal point of WDW via boat was a real highpoint, and getting the kids back to the hotel in the middle of the day because of the top quality pool was much easier than I expected. As others have commented, the rooms aren't huge and the bathrooms a little tired, but you won't be spending too much time in the rooms though, so this was no hardship. Downsides? The dining options for a 700 room hotel are pretty rotten. The roaring fork counter service option is small and the selection tiny by comparison with, say, the equivalent option at the Contemporary. The Whispering Canyon is the best option, but given the paucity of the other options is massively over subscribed. We waited for 30 minutes to sit down for breakfast one day, 15 on another and on busy days the kitchen clearly struggled. Dinner reservations? We were there 10 days and couldn't get in for a faintly normal reservation time once, so if you want to eat in the hotel in the evening you will need to make Disney Advanced Dining Reservations before you leave home. The service btw here is noisy, but great (Nanci especially). I have written separately about artist point, the upscale option in this hotel. How to solve this conundrum? We took the boat to fort wilderness and the contemporary, and ate there in the evenings when we weren't eating in the parks or downtown Disney. Again the boat trip made a charming start and end to the evening, and if you time your boat trip right you can get a ring side seat to the evening fireworks at the Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the World”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanDakman
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Wilderness Lodge after 4 nights outside. Impressive foyer - brings a smile to adults and kids alike. Very convenient to Magic Kingdom via the boat and especially convenient coming back at the end of the fireworks. Easy drive to the other parks. Room comfortable though a little dated and aircon temp setting old school dial so not very accurate. Great having the fridge in the room. Concierge very helpful. Restaurants all good and "the Cast" all friendly. As we discovered, the restaurants book out early so book ahead if you can otherwise it is dinner at 4.45pm at Fort Wilderness. Kids enjoyed the pool and I enjoyed the poolside bar. If a jogger, good trails to Fort Wilderness to train on.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at a moderate resort and save money”
Reviews.Author: ziggy3555
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Disney World plenty of times, we usually saty at Carribean Beach resort well this time we thought we would treat our selves, well we made a mistake the Lodge is beautiful on the outside and the lobby is great, but the room were small and dark and the bathroom small. And couldn't use the balcony at night the bugs were eating us alive, and the food selection was terrible a few things at the roaring fork all week and at Whispering Canyon restaurant the dinner was good but breakfast was sub par. The pool area was nice but the pool was very cold and the oustside bar closed at dusk, the bartender told me they have to close early because the inside bar opens at 4.30 well let me tell you the bar is dark and ver tired looking, rooms need updating, the parks were great as usual but very upset with hotel and the geyser goes maybe 30 feet in the air, save your money and go to a moderate resort or even one of the All Star resorts food is better and the rooms aren't much different, Bob

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful family resort”
Reviews.Author: maschmit
Reviews.Content: The Disney Wilderness Lodge is a great change from the normal resort hotel. The hotel is themed like the great National Park Lodges (the Old Faithful Inn at Yellowstone in particular) but with more of the comforts of home and amenities then the National Park hotels). The groto type pool is wonderfully themed with the water starting to flow from inside the hotel and down a lazy river and over a water fall and into the pool. The hourly geyser shoot off was entertaining as well as the Disney nightly light parade on the lake. The trip to the Magic Kingdom is excellent - aboard a boat that takes you directly from the resort to the Magic Kingdom. The rooms were nice and with all of the families at the resort it was suprisingly quiet. A great family resort.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Joleger
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel The themimg is absolutely beautiful Each lampshade, mirror, rug, elevator is all themed to the great hotels in the northwest. We had a room on the first floor which I was a little worried about but the room was very quiet and right next to the 'quiet' pool of the hotel. The only downside was the counter service restaurant. 'Roaring Forks' had terrible warm entrees but the sandwiches and pastries were very good. The Whispering Canyon Cafe (table service restaurant) was a great place to eat dinner as a family. Lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay - we loved it”
Reviews.Author: dismayedengland
Reviews.Content: Having read a few reports we went with some concerns - but these all seemed untrue - we stayed in a ground floor room with large shower room & king sized bed - & patio to small lake within easy walk to boat ferry to the magic kindom & easy walking to a lovely pool area- well stocked with a geyser every hr - housekeeping never let us down always had plenty of toiletries & towels made into animals - The hotel has 3 restaurants - roaking forks which we used for quick meals & whispering canyon for table meals this can get very loud - if you dont have children - & artist point which we didnt try - we were on the Disney dining plan - for which was vey good couldnt eat all the choices offered - a good point is buy the refillable mug although at $15 seems expensive as we were there for 14 days was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness lodge was very kid friendly!”
Reviews.Author: apamperedmom
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge had a very relaxed atmosphere. The pool was awesome and we loved the lodge feel in our room and the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return to Wilderness Lodge - great trip!!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyOnMyMind
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a great week at Wilderness Lodge. A perfect place to stay for families with young children interested in going to the Magic Kingdom. The 15-min. ferry boat rides to MK were quick and relaxing, and ran frequently so we rarely had to wait. Bus rides to Epcot and Hollywood Studios took awhile, so plan ahead for extra time. Stayed in a courtyard room and biggest complaint was noise from pool area a few afternoons we returned to the room for a nap. Otherwise very quiet and comfortable. We LOVE the WL, and would return!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel! It is the PERFECT...”
Reviews.Author: allyfitz
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! It is the PERFECT location if you will be visiting the Magic Kingdom park often during your stay. The shuttle boats make the journey simple! We loved our one bedroom villa too! It was the perfect size for 2 adults and one child without feeling like we were on top of each other. We will definitely stay here again if we have the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge - just ok”
Reviews.Author: travelerSan
Reviews.Content: The Lodge was nice, but could have been great. The interior of the hotel looks like a giant Lincoln log - the rooms were small and dark. The location was good as you could get on a boat to get to the Magic Kingdom and other stops, as well as taking a bus to the various parks and attractions. The restaurant in the lobby was just ok - didn't eat at the fancy one, but the menu items were expensive - don't know how families can afford to eat there. Don't like the fact that an 18% gratuity for parties of six or more is expected at the "Character" meals as you get your own food - they just serve the drinks. It doesn't insure good service and should less - maybe 15% or so.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: lazy8inc
Reviews.Content: You can not go wrong with Disney's Wilderness Lodge. We have stayed there for the past several years and have never had any problems. It is very clean, the staff is wonderful and the transportation that is offered is outstanding. They have a very nice pool with a great slide for the kids. There are 3 resturants onsite, which offer something for everyone. Every afternoon at the pool, they host a pool party with music that is alot of fun! The gift shop has alot to offer and the arcade is right next door to the shop. Disney's Electric water parade can be seen from the Wilderness Lodge Beach every night at 9:35 PM. The atmosphere at the Lodge is very relaxing and a great choice for families.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness wonderland!”
Reviews.Author: Kittehgrl
Reviews.Content: We had the good fortune of to spend our few day stay at Disney world in the Yosemite Suite in Disney's Wilderness Lodge. The lodge itself is spectacular from top to bottom, and you can't help but look up when you walk in. Based on the look of old Yellowstone the structure is simply magnificent with a floor to ceiling fireplace, an enormous lobby, three restaurants, a gift shop, and of course, the pool, the grounds, the geyser, all just spectacular. The Yosemite suite is an entity unto itself! This is "Disney luxury!" It features floor to ceiling doors surrounded by a huge balcony all around, a living room, dining room, kitchen, bedroom with King sized bed, and 2 baths, jacuzzi and shower separate. It is furnished in leather, in western style, with frontier decor, plush rugs, furnished kitchen..everything you could want or need for your comfort. This suite required a key card in order to even be allowed onto the floor, a private lounge for that floor, two incredible concierges, wonderful cleaning staff that folded our washcloths into beautiful little shapes..there was an enormous gift basket of chocolate awaiting us upon arrival, and cookies, free soda, brownies, and other treats along with coffee, tea, and spirits served in the lounge until 10 pm nightly. I could gladly have stayed in the hotel and missed the rest of the Disney world experience! The Artist's pointe restaurant on the main floor is five star gourmet!! Every single Disney representative that we met, did all they could to assure us that we would have a magical day, and every day that we were there, was indeed magical!! What an experience! This is not an inexpensive experience, but it really is luxury at its finest. If it's just "the two of you" then stay in the Yosemite suite. You won't regret it! Only one negative, that you must pay for internet service. Strange to stay in inexpensive hotels along the way with free wi/fi, and Disney charges $10.00 per 24 hours. As expensive as the entire Disney world experience is, I do have some difficulty understanding why this particular amenity is not free, as it is in most other both expensive and inexpensive lodging establishments. Still a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “The feel of luxury National Park lodge”
Reviews.Author: retrofuturistic
Reviews.Content: Why anyone would go to Disneyworld and stay anywhere but on-property is inconceivable. The Wilderness Lodge is a beautiful, grand hotel, with the open feel of an old luxury lodge in a western national park. The basic rooms are nicely sized for two. The woodsy setting is beautiful.
