The transportation to the Disney parks is efficient, especially the water taxis to the Magic Kingdom area. This is the relative bargain among the Disney "deluxe" resorts. The only negative is that the beds are a little soft for my taste, but that's a matter of personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic Splendor!”
Reviews.Author: babisbaby
Reviews.Content: Our family (myself, my husband and boys ages 7 and 4) spent 8 nights at the end of August 2010 at the Wilderness Lodge Villas at Walt Disney World and absolutely loved it. The 1 bedroom villa was spotless and in great condition. Mousekeeping kept it like that daily and even threw in a few towel animals for fun. The staff was superb from the front desk to the lifeguards, the pools clean and safe, and the Wilderness theme came through in every single spot right down to the family of ducks by the pool area. The transportation was flawless, never more than a 10 minute wait, usually less, for a boat to Magic Kingdom and even the buses were timely and usually empty. Even with a stop at the Grand Floridian on the way to most places, no ride ever took more than 25 minutes, and that was for the furthest places like Downtown Disney and Animal Kingdom. The food and service at Artist Point restaurant was superb and the best meal we had at Disney. If I was forced to say one negative thing, the pool bar could have stayed open a little later, not a big deal though since we were passing out right after the kids did every night. Every time we walked in the lobby at the Villas, it felt like we were home.

Reviews.Title: “Love the ambience”
Reviews.Author: Nancy2225
Reviews.Content: If nothing else, go to this hotel lobby and look in. It is fabulous. Looks just like you are in the Tetons or somewhere out west in a grand lodge. The rustic and woodsy ambience everywhere are awesome. Not to mention, the usual Disney staff that go out of their way to make your visit superb. The cafeteria in the lower level is a good place to get healthy food a la carte. Be sure to make time to see the geyser. Great boat service to the Magic Kingdom!

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: zumpie
Reviews.Content: Our second vacation here might've been even better than our first! Same lovely lodge, same lovely Artist's Point restaurant, but here and there new perks like a daily afternoon pool party (with great tunes!) and other little pluses. We had friends stay here as well, who had previously only stayed at a value and a moderate resort. They too, were stunned at the wonderful level of service, amenities and attention. In fact they had thought this was because of the poor economy, we explained that because it's a small resort (for WDW, at least) and a deluxe one, the level of service is far more attentive. A poster below said this is the second most expensive resort after the Grand Floridian. That is completely incorrect. Wilderness Lodge and Animal Kigdom Lodge are the two LEAST expensive resorts in the deluxe category--in fact they're sort of a little "near deluxe"/upper moderate category unto themselves. Which makes them an excellent value, but also explains a slightly smaller room, etc. For the record the second in cost to the Grand Floridian is the Polynesian. Both of these are nearly twice the price of Wilderness Lodge. I really don't get the noise complaints, either. We're always facing the raucous restaurant and lobby, but once our room door shuts we can't hear a thing. As for the reviewer who stated he "always stays at boutique hotels and is used to that level of service"---I worked for a well know boutique hotel company for several years. None of them offer any more service than does Wilderness Lodge or these days, a limited service chain near the airport. FYI, "boutique" is just a marketing label that you pay extra for! Our daughter was 10 this trip and seemed to enjoy it even more than when she was 7---she viewed the lodge as "her own" and enjoyed all the attention the staff bestowed upon her. A wonderful visit and I really don't know that I would stay anywhere else on Disney property but here.

Reviews.Title: “Absoultely amazing experience at the WL!”
Reviews.Author: holliadrienne
Reviews.Content: My family, including myself, husband and our 4 year old son, stayed at Disney's WL for 6 nights for our first WDW trip. Service was excellent, friendliness of all the cast members was off the charts...I loved it so much more than i even expected to. My husband and son felt the same...it literally felt like home. Totally relaxing...again, I can't say enough. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Average for a "Deluxe" Resort”
Reviews.Author: markluke
Reviews.Content: For young children, Disney World is a "must see" destination, and many parents have told me that the best way to go is to stay at a Disney resort on property. Normally I prefer boutique hotels with a high level of service, so my review might be a bit slanted towards those expectations. This shouldn't take away from other people's experiences (I realize that many people save for years for that "once in a lifetime" Disney trip) but as someone well-traveled I expect a lot, especially from a brand like Disney. I will pay more if I get more, especially if it makes things easier and more convenient. My wife and I got a great package deal for Labor Day week for a room at the Wilderness Lodge which included the meal plan and park admission. As this is a review of the hotel, I'll keep my comments focused on this part of the trip: Location The location of the hotel is generally excellent, with quick boat service to the Magic Kingdom. Bus service to other parks (Epcot, Animal Kingdom, etc.) was generally painless, although not always as timely as it should be - there would be no bus for 30 minutes and then 2 buses in a row. First impressions and check-in Painless and friendly. Great views inside the hotel. My wife checked in online and it was easy enough (juggling 2 little ones) to get through check-in and get our key. The room Incredibly average and small for a resort hotel (it was a 2 queen bed standard room). The look and feel was like a Ramada Inn or mid-range hotel, even when you include the desired "rustic" feel of the room. Everything seemed clean, but the air conditioning wasn't working - after a call to maintenance someone came after 30 minutes and got it going again with a temporary fix, saying that they would send someone the next day to fix it properly. There was no follow-up, so after another call it was fixed while we were out, but my son's pack and play (which he was sleeping in) had dust balls all over it from the maintenance person cleaning the duct. Sloppy. Also, while I can't be sure, I woke up with 10 small red welts on one arm and leg one morning that looked suspiciously like bed bug bites (the pattern isn't like mosquito bites). As i'm not 100% certain I didn't mention it to hotel staff, but I suggest anyone staying in hotels these days to always check for bed bugs! TV Entertainment While I realize you're not at Disney to stay in your room, at times it would be nice to see a movie, or something "special" related to Disney. Other than the resort advertising channels, there were only a couple of standard Disney channels. No pay-per-view was available, and very little for the kids to watch while we were getting ready. Disney has missed the boat here, as they could easily show old short films, or have some PPV options available. The pool Nice pool and well watched by lifeguards. Note that there are ducks around that will occasionally swim in the pool, and if they do their "business" while swimming the pool will be immediately closed for 15-30 minutes for an "unscheduled cleaning". This happened a few times during our stay. Otherwise it was a decent pool (there is a kiddie pool as well) but nothing really special when you consider this is a deluxe resort according to Disney. The playground and "beach" By a "beach" area near the boat rentals there is a small playground where younger kids can play, which was helpful. Meals - Roaring Fork This was a "quick service" restaurant. For the first couple of days of our stay it was very busy at peak times, with an over 10 minute wait for hot food. Later in the week it was quieter as most kids were back in school. The food was extremely average, but edible, especially if you like greasy McDonald's style breakfasts and lunches. Note for those on the meal plan - it's sometimes confusing. If you have oatmeal, it counts as a "snack", but if you have oatmeal with fruit, it's a quick service meal. I wish Disney would have a better plan which didn't have you worrying about counting, and what constitutes a kids meal and what's an adult meal. That's a separate issue but I felt like I was part of the socialist republic of Disney trying to keep up with what was what. For example, breakfasts came with 2 drinks, while lunches with a drink and a dessert. My 2 year old was expected to "share" our meals, so I found it easier here to order an adult meal that my kids could share as it was the same "cost" in quick service points as a kid's meal. A hint if you drink a fair amount of soda/coffee/tea/iced tea - the $15 cup purchase is great as you can refill without wait (or cost) for the duration of the trip. Meals - Whispering Canyon Cafe This is a "table service" restaurant, and it was OK, with a fun experience. The food was average yet again. We had dinner here the night we arrived, and despite a 8:05 confirmation we weren't seated until 8:40. With 2 young children tired from the trip down it was brutal to wait, and yet there were tables free, so either they reduced their staff levels or something else happened, but we had to practically push and beg for a table by 8:40. The service itself was very good. Meals - Artist Point The best meal we had at Disney the whole week was here. The food was fresh and tasty and the service was on-par with what I'd expect from a good restaurant. Note for those on the meal plan this counts as 2 table service meals each. By my standards, the portion sizes were excellent (some used to large meals would complain) and the kid's dessert was great - a cookie that kids could "paint" with a little brush and edible coloring on a palette, and a white chocolate edible puzzle. "Concierge" service Anyone staying at the Wilderness Lodge (and likely other properties) should note that it's more like an info desk than a true concierge. For example, we wanted to make changes to a restaurant reservation after a long day. We were told by the concierge that the restaurants were all "full" and they couldn't accommodate us, despite a light week (this was the day after Labor Day, apparently Disney's least busy day of the year). We were then forwarded to the Disney reservation line that anyone would call (which is incredibly painful and lengthy, but that's another story). On a positive note, everyone was nice. The net-net - I recommend this hotel, but with caveats. Aside from the amazing lobby view there wasn't anything special about the hotel or the overall experience, and certainly not "deluxe" in the true sense of the word.

Reviews.Title: “The Wilderness Lodge was AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: dlive6678
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the WL over the Labor Day weekend with our 2 little boys, my mother, and my in-laws. We were there for 5 days and I have to say that it was an awesome stay. The staff there is great. Anything we needed, they took care of. The Whispering Canyon was really good. My mom and I have dairy allergies, but the chef was more than willing to work with us. He made us an excellent dinner and we were grateful. If you eat at Whispering Canyon, definitely ask for ketchup. :) It was a memorable trip that we will never forget. Thank you Wilderness Lodge! We will see you next summer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: kellym_80
Reviews.Content: We have just had a 12 night stay at the Lodge, it was amazing, the lodge itself is so beautiful to look at. The rooms are lovely and clean, the staff are so very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend Disney's Wilderness Lodge Thank you all for a wonderful stay and making our engagement extra special for us. xxx

Reviews.Title: “Worth it ! Trust Me!”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl0307
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the lodge for a week long stay. The rooms are a little on the small side but clean and the beds are very comfortable. The pool was on the small side but my children really enjoyed it. Mousekeeping was excellent. I really researched this hotel and read all the reviews before booking. Next to the Grand Floridian, the lobby is just so impressive. Boat service to the Magic Kingdom was excellent, never waited more than 10 minutes. I have stayed at other deluxe Disney hotels and this one is not as deluxe as I would have liked as far as the room goes, but definitely worth it, it's simply beautiful. Take it from someone who does the research, this one is a Disney gem.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: indybindy82
Reviews.Content: just love the theme of this hotel! looks like your in the forest of a national park! spotless clean beautiful room with its own deck. 5 min to the Magic Kingdom on their bus. Beautiful lobby to just sit & relax.Fireplaces, rocking chairs. If you like a little rustic theme this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: puddnpie1023
Reviews.Content: We came up for the weekend for my daughters 6th Birthday. When we checked-in they wished her a Happy Birthday and gave her a B-day Pin to wear. Everyone who saw her pin wished her a Happy Birthday. My kids love this hotel. They especially love looking for the hidden Mickey's throughout the lobby. You can get a sheet from the front desk and look for them. We had dinner at the Whispering Canyon and it was the most fun dining experience we had. We had a room on the 5th floor with bunk beds. The room was great. Had a fridge, small balcony and easy access to the pool, lobby, etc. We are coming back in December and will be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous as always”
Reviews.Author: smokiecheshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after staying here for two week holiday. First time in summer normally go at Christmas A brilliamt family hotel we always upgrade to a courtyard room well worth the money had a room overlooking the main pool(lovely).The rooms are a little on the tight side especially when you have a teenager but worth it for the atmosphere in hotel definately the disney one with most character.Only two little complaints Mousekeeping a little bit slow our room not done till at least 3pm most days and the pillows are rubbish!!.Location is fabulous so close to disney just a boat ride away would go again and again value for money.

Reviews.Title: “my idea of camping”
Reviews.Author: BevHugs
Reviews.Content: The first impression of the Wilderness Lodge was awesome. No detail in the lodge was overlooked. Even the access for clean out drain had a cute frog cover on it! It was decorated beautifully and in the mission arts theme (which is my favorite). High quality materials were used in the construction. I never heard hallway noise and the flooring in the club level kitchen was immaculate. Not really sure if the extra cost is worth it since we were hardly in the lodge to take advantage of the club level food and drinks. But if you like a little extra pampering go for it. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. We had a beautiful view of the courtyard and lake. If you want to have a great time at WDW DONT GO CHEAP!!! It will end up costing the same at the end of the day and buying the package was a great deal. I don't think they made any money on the dining plan from me. I didn't use credits for breakfast and used 2 credits on a signature dining experience for dinner. I feel like my money was well spent. Greatest family vacation ever.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, easy feeling”
Reviews.Author: zdog
Reviews.Content: With all due respect to the Eagles, this is exactly the kind of feeling created by a stay at the Lodge. We just returned from a week long stay, and when we return to Disney property, this will be the place we'll book. Yes, compared to other deluxe resorts the rooms are on the smaller size, but larger than Disney moderate resorts. We've been here 5 times, and have never found it to be dirty, or the staff unfriendly, or the pool small. We find it relaxing, off the beaten trail at Disney (which considering the number of resorts is a hard thing to do) and worth the money we spend to stay here. You can read what other posters here have to say about the offerings, and yes, 10/day for internet is a bit excessive. But the food offerings are solid, the theme outstanding, and the overall ambiance outstanding. Discount deals through pin numbers can be found keeping the price in the 200/night range. The one thing that I'll always remember is the feeling I got each and every time I stepped into the lobby-with its soaring ceiling and western music playing in the background. Wonderful! Love the lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, relaxing and filled with Disney style”
Reviews.Author: JRDTexas18
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at the Wilderness Lodge. No complaints on the room or hotel, but for the hefty price tag, I would have liked more plush/modern accomadations to match the deluxe resort category that they put themselves in, but aside from that it was a great stay. The room was average. Clean, no problems at all. Looks a little on the old side, but still nice enough. The decor in the room was not my style, but we stayed here because my husband really likes the wilderness feel. They left us towel animals 2 of our 4 nights which I loved. The rest of the hotel outside of the actual room is pretty spectacular. The lobby is huge and beautiful as is the outside pool area and trails. Little disney touches everywhere which is really what sets a disney hotel apart from just a Hilton or other hotel. Staff were all friendly, bus and boat transportation was good. This is the kind of hotel that is nice to just sit and relax in the lobby or hang out by the pool. I wish we'd had more available time to do just that! I would probably try a different hotel next time just for variety, not because I didn't enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully themed”
Reviews.Author: lantz4
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with a stunning lobby. Beds extremely comfortable, though probably a rock would feel good after long hot days in the parks. One room for 2 adults and 2 eight year olds was a bit tight but met our needs. Would stay again most likely.

Reviews.Title: “This is a real DUMP!!....Motel 6 on steroids!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: southbound35w
Reviews.Content: we were expecting a nice luxury room since this is the second most expensive disney resort next to the grand floridian, but the rooms are 12X25 and very dirty and the bathrooms are distgusting, these look like they have not been updated since 1985, i see now, how this place makes so much $$, they can cram 3000 families in these little cubilcle type rooms and charge $300 per night, also the pool is very dirty and there is was always 300+ people in it, i have had better accomodations at motel 6!!! this place is a rip off, and is very dirty....do your self a favor and stay at the hilton park soleil right down the road, that place was awesome and very clean........also the first night we got to the wilderness lodge it was so nasty we went to the front desk and tried to get our money back, but that was not going to happen so we had to stick it out at the dirty wilderness lodge, also internet service will cost u an extra $10 per night...........we will never stay there again, it was miserable, but it is a good central location between the disney parks with the disney bus transport.

Reviews.Title: “We miss it already”
Reviews.Author: claudius061
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Wilderness Lodge. My family of 4 (two boys 12 and 13) had a wonderful time. Room was not huge, but clean and COOL and when you return from a HOT day at the parks you want a little pampering. Animal towels were on the bed everyday of our stay. Our "'mousekeeper" Maria, was SO friendly, and welcoming. My kids loved the Roaring Forks for our quick service meals and they made it so easy to eat and get on our way. My youngest son adored the pool with the water slide and we all loved the huge loby. I have read some reviews that suggest that the price isn't worth it, but we both feel we got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “This is our new favorite place to stay at Disney!"”
Reviews.Author: deecricket
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week stay at Disney's Wilderness Lodge and we have found a new favorite place to stay at Disney! Wilderness Lodge is located in the Magic Kingdom, but it feels like it could be miles and miles away from the crowds and bustle of Disney at high tourist season. The lodge is so impressive. You walk into one of the most beautiful lobbies I have ever seen. Our check in was quick, efficient and informative. Even though our plane was an early one, they had a room ready for us immediately (10:30 a.m.). We had a courtyard room with two queen beds. This is a deluxe Disney hotel and the beds were WONDERFUL! My husband, my teenage daughter and I all slept quite soundly each night and we had NO BACK PROBLEMS! Mousekeeping kept our room spotless each day. We asked for new linens a little early in our stay and this request was met happily. The fridge in the room is a nice addition as we could keep water and sodas there all the time. Our teenage daughter loved the pool and the daily music and dancing that they had. The restaurants are great. Artist's Pointe though expensive is a lovely place for a romantic dinner. Our daughter loved being able to get food and snacks at the Roaring Fork from early in the day to 11 at night. This is a great place just to sit and enjoy the beautiful details the Disney artists have put into the architecture. We loved it and will definately come again!

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge -- a huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: AGentlRose
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I am very much a Disney fanatic, and I hate anything negative being said about Disney, so it pains me to give a so-so review for the Wilderness Lodge. Maybe I am spoiled because we normally stay at the Polynesian or Grand Floridian and so I expect all Disney "deluxe" hotels to be deluxe. The Wilderness Lodge is more on line with the Disney moderates resorts except for the fact that they do have interior corridors and valet parking. The positives: Housekeeping was exceptional -- for the first time in all my Disney vacations, including club level at the previously mentioned deluxe resorts --- we were never left any towel animals. The Housekeepers at the Wilderness Lodge left us 3 during our 6 night stay and towels and all amenities were always kept stocked. The rooms was always immaculate and the turndown service was always a welcome sight to return to. The parking valets were always accommodating and prompt. The bus transportation was excellent, we never waited more than 5 minutes for a bus, however, the boat transportation from the Magic Kingdom to the Lodge was sporadic and never enough to accommodate the amount of guests the Wilderness Lodge has. The room was just adequate, smaller than the Poly or Grand Floridian. We were staying Club Level and normally the Club Level concierge cast members are always so helpful and have a great attitude. Not so at the Wilderness Lodge, with the exception of two cast members, Loyda and Miguel, the rest looked like they were auditioning for the part of Grumpy in Snow White. I asked one about printing boarding passes for our return flight, she told me they couldn't do it, something to the effect that it interferes with the resort airline luggage check in service. (Meanwhile back at the Poly, Grand Floridian and other Disney resorts --- including Guest Services at the Parks, they were all able to print boarding passes) Now to the concierge lounge --- if you are into exotic food, go for it. Anytime I saw the offerings at the evening hour service, I thought of the food they made contestants eat on Fear Factor (Buffalo on a stick, meatballs made of Reindeer (sorry Bambi), but nothing except cheese and crackers ever passed my lips there. Another negative about staying on the club level floor, the room's balcony has a solid wall, so you have no view unless you stand. If you want deluxe at Disney, go for any other resort (Poly, Grand, Yacht Club, Beach Club, Contemporary). If you're just looking for a place to sleep and want something just a slight bit better than the moderates, then go for the Wilderness Lodge, but in that case, I would honestly rather save the money and stay at Port Orleans-Riverside or French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: bishoparc
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's a very large resort. The lobby looks great and everything but it is definitely not worth the money. As others have mentioned, the rooms are extremely small. I paid $185/night as a passholder for a woods view room and it was such a waste of money. You're paying for location and that's all. This resort is listed as a Disney Deluxe Resort but if it wasn't on Bay Lake and had boat service to the Magic Kingdom it would definitely be no more than a moderate resort. As far as the room goes, it was very small. Much smaller than any Disney Resort I've stayed in including a value resort. The bathroom does have a double vanity that is separate from the toilet and shower. There is an in room refrigerator. Room had a sliding glass door on to a balcony. You do absolutely hear everything going on the hallways. Resort restaurants were good. We had breakfast at the Whispering Canyon Cafe and that was probably one of the best breakfasts I've had. As far as amenities go, there is a mariana for boat rentals, bike rentals, an average sized pool, and walking trails. I would highly recommend if you're going to spend the $, go for the Contemporary, Grand Floridian, or the Polynesian.

Reviews.Title: “BEST OF THE DELUXE RESORTS”
Reviews.Author: FOOPSIE
Reviews.Content: I don't write here often, but I absolutely love this resort. I have a 3 year old that could probably live in the kiddie pool they have here. You actually get sprayed from the fake geyser if the wind is right while you are in the pool!!! The kiddie pool is about a foot deep and a nice size. VERY KID FRIENDLY!! The outdoor courtyard is breathtaking!! I always get a courtyard view - which is noisy during the day with the pool activities, but the view is phenomenal. Last time we were on a high floor (6) facing magic kingdom so we had a view of the lake. We were able to see the firewords just over the top of the building. NO - you can't actually see magic kingdom, but the view of the courtyard, pools, river/waterfall, "fake" Old Faithful and the lake was breathtaking. This place is just charming. I have stayed at all the other deluxe resorts that are Magic Kingdom resorts and this is my favorite. The room is not fancy at all, but charming. The contemporary hotel is where you would stay if you like a nice modern room. The wilderness is not on the monorail, but a quick boat ride to the magic kingdom or contemporary hotel is nice. The area where you catch the busses to Hollywood studios or Epcot is nice and shady, so not too bad to wait there during the summer months when it's hot. Roaring Forks is a great restaurant for counter service food and they have a nice selection. VERY CLEAN - typical Disney fashion. You will pay a lot for this resort, but once you stay they are always having deals for 40% off room rates. We paid only 184 last fall and 213 this past spring per night for the courtyard view. Again, it is not a fancy room for that price, but the amenities at this hotel for the little ones is worth every penny. They had "cookie decorating" every day where you could visit the Roaring Forks and get a free cookie and put on frosting and sprinkles. Too cute!! Check out the Grand Canyon strata in the lobby too! We ate at the Whispering Canyon cafe and had great service and food. There is also a little table with Lincoln Logs for the little ones to play with right at the entrance to the restaurant. I could go on and on. Will stay here again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.......But Mousekeeping Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: kul8e
Reviews.Content: This is my family's 4th trip to Disney World, Our first stay at Wilderness Lodge. We paid a lot of money to stay at this Deluxe Resort and in return expected a lot. The lobby is beautifaul and grand. Many comfortable chairs to sit in. The hotel is surrounded by serene landscapes. My five year old son and 9 year old daughter loved the pool, especially the slide. They also got a kick out of seeing the ducks in the pool. There are a variety of restaurants at the resort. We really enjoyed eating at Whispearing Canyon. Remember to ask for ketchup and see what happens. You can always get a quick bite to eat at Roaring Forks Cafe. All said the food at the resort was great. I was really disappointed in our hotel room. It was smaller then we expected and did not look very clean. The tub always seemed to have a ring around it. There was a spider web on the bed post. The sink area never looked like it had ever been cleaned. The plastic bag in the ice bucket was never replaced. I thought a tip would help to clean up the place, so I left a tip on 2 seperate days. It didn't work. I really think that someone at the resort needs to supervise the cleaning staff and make sure that rooms are cleaned properly.

Reviews.Title: “First time Disney Visitors loved Wilderness Lodge Resort”
Reviews.Author: TAT2U1981
Reviews.Content: The location and pool make this a great deluxe resort for families with younger children. Our kids loved the pool w/water slide and play area on beach. If you're spending most of your time at Magic Kingdom, you can't beat the boat transportation directly from your hotel. Never had to wait long, peaceful, short boat ride. Everything is readily accessible - Roaring forks off the pool area, laundry, lobby, bus stop,etc. The Whispering Canyon Cafe was a great experience. The bunk beds were perfect for our kids - son age 6 and daughter age 5. They are regular, twin sized bunk beds. My only negative with the room is storage. There is only one dresser -- a small 3-drawer which didn't hold a week of clothing for 4 people. My husband was thrilled with the flat-screen TV on it that he opted to live out of his suitcase! However, be prepared to hear the late-night fireworks at MK everynight from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect as always”
Reviews.Author: kattraveler13
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 4th trip to the Wilderness Lodge, and as usual, it is a wonderful retreat from the madness of Disney! The rooms are a bit small, but the lobby soars up 7 stories of logs with windows framing perfect views. It is a great resort for a family with boys--from the fireplaces and totem poles, to the waterfalls, geyser and pools. Take time to enjoy the lodge and the alcoves of rocking charis and sofas in front of fireplaces on the 4th floor. The pool area is fabulous and the Whispering Canyon restaurant serves good food with lots of fun! The gate man always greets you "welcome home" and the lodge truly feels like a home away from home! The only cons--the bus trip to Epcot, Hollywood STudios, and Animal Kingdom stops at the Wilderness camp ground and can therefore be a 40 minute trip to those parks and a crowded ride back at closing. We took our car part of the time--it would be great if disney would run a Wilderness Lodge only direct bus.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the secluded setting”
Reviews.Author: Bonk56
Reviews.Content: Wilderness Lodge is secluded while at the same time only a 3 minute bus ride to the Magic Kingdom. It is set on a lake which makes you feel as though you are miles away from anyone else. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Epic”
Reviews.Author: RoxannaH2
Reviews.Content: Smiling faces, beautiful rooms, good food, polite employees, clean pools... who could ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “Gutted With Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachHunter_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the C Beach and loved it then for last 4 days we came here to finish the holiday wow we were in for a shock. When we arrived our room was not ready, ok no problem so we wandered around what we saw as a very nice resort, we went back in the hour as requested and was greeted by the same person whom stated she had told us the ROOM IS NOT READY! Ok jeeps whom upset her? SO we asked when should we come back? the answer 'When it is ready!" whoa this is not acceptable and was ready to get the manager but she then said she has a room we can have. Ok so went to it and we came staright out! The room stank was not cleaned and was for disabled people with the obvious adjustments they would need that to me at 6'3 are no use. So back at reception we explained we could not accept this room and we would like the room we booked and we got the best answer ever "What do you want me to do?" well I think we explained this very well we would like our room we booked clean. My paitence ran out and I explained very clearley and loudly. Well 5 minutes later we were in our nice clean room. The room was ok but the reception lady destroyed our stay. Hope she is long gone for the rest of you as the magic of our stay was stolen. Assuming you get a good check in they try to take in the whole resort as it can still be a good place to be based in Disney

Reviews.Title: “It was OK.”
Reviews.Author: Marykate29247
Reviews.Content: We just returned from DWL yesterday. Overall the hotel was ok, but there were many inconsistancies that make it very hard to call it "World Class Service". Mousekeeping was a problem. The first few days our room was cleaned, but not restocked with shampoo coffee, or tea. We did get 5 bottles of lotion though(?). On days 3 and 4 we obviously had a "fun" mousekeeper who left our two girls stuffed animals all bunched up on the bed watching TV. The girls loved it! No towel animals that I'd read about though. We also had an extra blanket (the room was cold) for the first few days but then it disappeared and was never replaced. Last two days, no fun stuff for the kids, no tea and no new shampoo. The other inconsistant thing was the bus transportation. On Sunday we wanted to take advantage of extra magic hours at Epcot. We got to the bus stop at 7:55am. The bus did not get there until 8:25. Our driver was HORRIBLE.... cranky, mean, had a copy of his union contract book in his front pocket (REALLY!) Then we had to go pick up at Fort Wilderness.... didn't get to Epcot until 9am! Other bus trips were great; friendly drivers no long waits..... LOVED the boat ride to MK! Captain Bob was terrific! Our room was great! Small, yes, and at first we thought it was a terrible view (we were on the sixth floor over the loading dock) but then our luggage was delivered and the bellhop told us we would be able to see the MK fireworks from our balcony! Wish the girl who checked us in had told us.... We watched the show every night! All in all, it was an ok experience, but I would never call it "World Class"

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge First Stay”
Reviews.Author: psantosoBC
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (two 12 yr old boys) stayed at Wilderness Lodge on July 7/10. I only have wonderful things to say about the hotel, service and staff. It took 40 mins. to arrive by Magical Express from the airport. I would highly recommend using this service. I used online check-in and it made our check in process much faster. Any doubts about using this service it definitely does make check in process much faster . I had requested a north view on the 6th flr. We ended on the 5th flr with a north view. My reason for this request is so we could watch the fireworks from MK on nights we weren't there. The view was perfect. Mousekeepers kept the boys surprised with animal towels each night we returned from the parks. Two queen beds and lots of drawer space. A fridge to keep extra drinks cool for our return was perfect. The pool area was perfect because it is open until midnight so it is a good way to cool off and wind down. We didn't have the opportunity to have dinner at either Artist Point or The Whispering Cafe because we had other character meals and dining else where but the Roaring Forks was great! A great quick service restaurant that even have toasters and microwaves for any one's use. They serve really yummy salads, flat bread pizzas, burgers and sandwiches for lunch and dinner. Breakfast was great too. All sorts of different snacks the kids can enjoy. Transportation was excellent. We love the quick boat ride from the hotel to MK and from there east enough to catch the monorail to Epcot. The buses to Animal Kingdom was pretty good too. We rented a car for a couple of days so drove to Disney Hollywood studios which takes about 15 - 20 mins. The Wilderness Lodge felt tranquil and relaxing after coming back from a busy day at the parks. The hotel looked busy but it never felt crowded. One last thing we had the pleasure of being the Flag Family of the day on our second to last day and it was fantastic experience. Make sure to ask at the concierge when you arrive ask to be a Flag Family. Our boys thought it was cool and us parents thought it was the coolest! If you can manage a dlx property I would say you have to try the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER AWESOME Disney resort!”
Reviews.Author: LuvinMomx3
Reviews.Content: Fabulous time and treatment for all! As always Disney goes above and beyond to satisfy and entertain the young , old and in the middle! They are awesome host's! This was our first time to the Wilderness Lodge and well worth the choice. Common areas are themed to perfection, the Whispering canyon is a must eat at ! Food is good and staff is the best entertainment! They could offer a few more dining choices, really that is the only change we can think of. Our room was nice with a balcony and wooded standard view. Hotel room areas are quiet and very comfortable.The shuttle boats are a fun way to travel to the Magic Kingdom and Fort Wilderness Campground. Wish we would have seen some characters dressed "wilderness" style...that would be an added plus! :) The themed pool area and geiser are clean, fun and well staffed with life guards! Nothing short of what we always get when staying with Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic at it's Best !”
Reviews.Author: imumfan1
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days and 3 nights at our first Disney resort. Can't say nothing but the best for the Wilderness Logde and staff. I recommend staying at a deluxe resort rather than a value or moderate. Disney service is hard to beat on all levels but if deluxe is within budget, do it by all means. I was able to self park but valet was avalible ( it's not far from the front lobby ) When you first enter the lobby..WOW..kids of all ages are amazed. What a beautiful, tall, rustic wilderness look.Luggage and coolers to the room after a swift check-in to room 4118 via the bellhop(with a short tour of the lobby ) The room was great.! I don't know what other people complain about. Sure, bigger is better, but with 2 queens,fridge,lots fo draw space,flat screen tv,ceiling fan,clock/radio/ipod and a balcony overlooking the woods .It was fine for the three of us. Clean and cold a/c. Lighting was fine (energy save bulbs) Murals of the West and wilderness adore the room. And this was a standard room. Now the pool and grounds are truly the best. I read a lot of reviews beforehand, but nothing quite like seeing it for yourself. My 9 year old girl loved the poolslide. There are bunnies hopping around and even ducks that will wonder into the pool occassionally. There is also activites by the hotel sataff daily. We won a stuffed animal playing Bingo !! The Lifegaurds act well trained and professional and I never seen them yell at the children for having too much fun ,anything pretty much goes.A steam flows fromt the lobby thru the grounds, over a waterfall and into the pool. Throw a coin and make a wish.Then it continues to the lake. Food is a quick service mini food court that we enjoyed with burger,nuggets ,pizza ..(buy the refill cup for about $13 it;s worth it) The other two resturants we didn't try ( we had our own daily snacks ,which i recommend bringing ) One resturant is great for the kids with lots of noise and silliness and the other is a formal sit down one. I highly recommend take the lodge tour with Ranger Joe (check the daily activities) It's free and you learn all about the logde in an hour or so. He also does the family flag raising which I heard was a blast. but have to make reservations when you arrive. I have so much more to say and I said when i made it home i would write a review to show justice to this AAAA+++ resort. To sum this up.....Do the Wilderness Lodge, I can't say enough. It makes you feel like you;re in the wilderness and on a lake. Food isn't cheap so be prepared, rooms are more than you need, everything you need is on the resort and lobby area. Shop at the gift store for Disney charms and trade your pins too. There's a boat to Magic Kingdom too. Watersports and more. It's your vacation so Enjoy...I'll be there next year.....

Reviews.Title: “My favorite resort in Disney!”
Reviews.Author: kajun213
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here during a two week stay for Christmas. We split our time between here and The Beach Club. And although we enjoyed both...this one was definately my favorite! We booked a deluxe room on the concierge level and we were told by more than one employee that our room was one of the best. I had a bedroom with two queen beds, which were extremely comfortable and it had it's own balcony. There was a separate living room with a sofa bed, and it too had a private balcony. Both balconies over looked the lake, and we were able to sit out there and enjoy the electric light parade. Concierge was excellent, and I would recommend it to anyone who is thinking about it. We got breakfast, drinks all day. mid - afternoon snacks, nightly wina and cheese, and nightly dessert. We also had the dining plan, so between the two, we bought nothing else. The kids also were able to get dvd's and games from the concierge at no extra charge. The resort was lovely. It was beautifully decorated and the pool was nice, the kids went down the slide at least a hundred times. There were plenty of other things to do including boating, biking, fishing, horseback riding, segways, and even sleigh rides. The boat which was available to take to the Contemporary and to MK was very quick and fun, and we ended up riding it more than the buses. The only dwonfall to the resort was that the waiting area for buses to the parks was not covered. This is a resort I will definately return to!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent about as good as it gets!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thedzoo
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the delay but we have been busy. We traveled to this hotel from california and stayed for 11 days. this resort is world class. From the moment the front desk helps you to handling special requests. We got our birthday buttons right away and the front desk went above and beyond to extend the Disney magic. The bus shuttle was easy and uncrowded from the airport. We were in a bunk bed room on the south side of the Horseshoe. We could see the fireworks from our room and enjoyed the boat parade at night. The disny transportation was amazing for all of the parks. There was even a manager who took us in his car personally because he was heading to animal kingdom anyway. The hotel is perfect and well kept. We got to be a flag family and one of the last with ranger stan. What a neat experience ask about this at check in. You get to go to the top of the hotel and put the flags up. They even gave us a free breakfast for doing so. We experienced many moment of special attention and this place was awesome. My only complaint was that the food at the cafe was less than spectacular and unable to handle large amounts of guests. We highly recommend the Disney dining plan and really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “I Said I Wouldn't, But I Did....And I Regretted It.”
Reviews.Author: gatorpac
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Disney's Wilderness Lodge for 3 nights pre-cruise in April. Before staying here we had only stayed at Disney's Polynesian Resort....which we LOVE. In a review of the Poly I had stated that I couldn't see our family staying anywhere else. I wish I had heeded my own advice because the entire time we were at the DWL all I could think about was how much I missed staying at the Poly. I'm certainly not slamming DWL, but there are two vitally-important factors that weigh HEAVILY in favor of the Poly vs DWL. They are (1) location and, (2) room size. Both are undeniably superior at the Poly. The first thing I noticed when we got to our room at DWL was the size----small. Very small and cramped-feeling. Our room at the Poly in the Tokelau building never felt small. Looking back at our pictures confirms this. In the Poly we had a sitting area with two chairs and a sofa. There's nothing like this in a comparable DWL room. And, the other factor----location. No discussion really needed here. Monorail and TTC at the Poly. Boats and buses at DWL (oh yeah....Poly has these, too). If a wilderness theme is your thing, I suppose DWL wins there. It's the Poly for me from hence forward. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort within a resort!”
Reviews.Author: johnnymike
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Wilderness Lodge and I have to say it was a great experience! This trip was a little unusual for me in that we wanted to experience a weekend at a Disney resort without visiting the theme parks. We made a great choice! Arrival/Lobby Pretty impressive lobby and gorgeous grounds. Very well maintained. Valet parking is available, but expensive: $12. We self-parked and walked the short distance to the hotel. Even at 11 am our room was ready, including a special request. Check in was a breeze...we were done and at the pool in 20 minutes. Room Other reviewers here are right that the the rooms aren't the highlight here. They are pretty standard but comfortable. Bed wasn't as good as the Contemporary across the lake but better than at the All Stars and I slept straight through the night so I can't complain. Our room was on the first floor with a woods view so we had a great patio outside complete with a pond and...yes...a real alligator swimming around. Not sure that was Disney-approved but we enjoyed keeping our eyes on "Toothy" during our visit. I recommend the woods view so you don't have to look at a parking lot but don't have the noise and hubbub of the courtyard unless that's a good thing in your eyes. Pool Awesome, but busy. Get there early to claim a spot. If you prefer a quieter pool experience there is a second pool around the building next to the villas. Stayed there until the daily summer afternoon rain came. Pool Bar Drinks are expensive...spent $10 each on frozen drinks. Yummy though. Artist Point Restaurant Most expensive meal of my life....but completely worth it. Great service, amazing food, very personalized. My menu had my name on it. We had the venison potstickers for an appetizer. Try the buffalo or the Copper River salmon when it's in season for the entree. End with the berry cobbler which is simply amazing. Whispering Canyon Cafe Didn't eat there this time around but wanted to say it is part dinner and part entertainment. Not a quiet place but probably a great place for the kids. Roaring Fork Snack Bar Great good for when you want to get going. Free soda to those with refillable mugs. Marina Spent a couple of hours running around the lakes on their Montauk boat which was a great deal of fun, provided great photo opportunities and was a great way to relax on a hot day. Transportation Since my trip wasn't all about the parks I had no complaints, but it is worth mentioning if you are going to be doing the park thing every day the transportation here is limited: boat to Magic Kingdom and other MK resorts, bus everywhere else, or drive your car and pay for parking. Shopping One store, lots of stuff for the kids and hotel-themed products. If you forgot film, batteries or want some groceries be prepared to pay for the convenience. No gum is sold on Disney property. Overall It was a great stay and I can't wait to go back. I would recommend it and have done so to many friends and family. A great place to relax at Disney without even stepping into a park.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Vacation(s)”
Reviews.Author: admit_it
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Wilderness Lodge twice - first time was our Honeymoon in 2006 and then with my parents in 2008. If you are planning a trip to Walt Disney World and considering - even CONSIDERING - staying at a Deluxe hotel, let me say that you cannot go wrong with Wilderness Lodge. Our first time we booked and stayed in a king bed room - club level. It made for an awesome honeymoon! Our 2nd trip we booked a regular room - no view upgrade- not on club level. We were upgraded to a woods view and upgraded again to club level. I cannot say enough about this amazing hotel. The total environment of the hotel is a departure from the rest of the Disney hotels that I have visited. Wilderness lodge is very laid back, very relaxed, and very well themed so that you know you are at Disney, but it's not 'crazy Disney'. The transportation options are incredible - you can't beat a boat to and from the Magic Kingdom - the monorail is right off the dock in front of the MK if you want to go to EPCOT. Bus transportation is typically every 10-15 minutes. The gift shop is incredible if you are an outdoors type of person! The dining options are great! We have eaten at Roaring Forks and Whispering Canyon - we have not eaten at Artists Point, but we have heard that it's great! The lobby is the MOST incredible lobby of ALL of the Disney resorts! We have visited almost all of the Disney Resorts, and nothing beats the feeling you get as soon as you walk through the front doors! It's such a dark, cool, and relaxing space. Even when Whispering Canyon is at full roar, and the lobby is full of families coming and going - there is still a great escape here! If you have the budget I would definitely suggest staying Club Level. The breakfast options are good, and the afternoon snacks are great options if you are going to hit the pool - and you can't beat free snacks, wine, beer, and cordials in the evening! Perhaps the best of all is the pool - with the stream running out of the lobby, the huge waterfall in the back, the pool, two hot tubs (set at two different temperatures) and then Fire Rock Geyser! Yes, this western-national park themed hotel comes complete with a geyser! The walk through the woods from the dock brings you back to the pool area with a beautiful view of the waterfall, and you can take a quick stroll through the tunnel - and then back into the lobby. Yes, folks there are even crickets and other woodland noises. Each morning on the way to the boat we would see rabbits, ducks, shore birds, lizards, and squirrels! If you stay here, don't forget to go next door to see the Villa's lobby. There are quite a few things to see next door! Disney Vacation Club has a property here as well - The Villas at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. We stayed one night at the Villas on our trip this past December and it was just as magical as staying in the lodge itself. We are Disney Vacation Club Members, so we hope to stay here for a week or so in the next two years, but first we are trying out the Boardwalk Villas! I have read a few reviews comparing Wilderness Lodge to the Animal Kingdom Lodge - we have stayed at both - and found Animal Kingdom Lodge to be somewhat annoying actually. From the front door of the lobby to our room, it was over 1,000 steps - door to door - and we weren't even the last room in the building! But, for more on Animal Kingdom and Kidani Village see my review for those that I will post as soon as I can. But, to finish my review of Wilderness Lodge - I have to say that you have to experience it for yourself! Finally - be sure to tip your mousekeeper daily if you want towel animals! If you have any questions about Disney Vacation Club or about Wilderness Lodge, PLEASE feel free to message me! During this trip we

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with service and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: rerickson
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel!! The theme was very authentic and fun for the kids... starting with the impressive lobby. The ceiling must be 100 foot high with totem poles and a babbling brook with a bridge. We even noticed a â€˜Dances with Wolvesâ€™ soundtrack playing lightly in the background :) The pool was unique with the mountain stream feeding into the pool. The second pool (by the Villas) has mini geysers in the water. However, the water was a bit on the warm side. This is not a problem for those who like heated pools. The service was incredible. I lost my cell phone and my credit card at 2 separate locations at WDW, and the Wilderness Lodge concierge went out of her way to find them both for me!! I was given additional personal attention (without my prompting) when I was given a ride to the WDW central 'lost and found' by their courtesy van to pickup my found items. Bus and boat service to the parks were very convenient!! The Whispering Canyon restaurant was incredibly fun. At dinner time, just as for ketchup and see what I mean. The adults were smiling and laughing like kids. Also, the Roaring Fork Cafe was very convenient with a wide variety of food choices. Both venues had quick service with friendly attitudes. My children loved the bunk bed in the room. Comfortable room, but a bit on the cozy side. The minor drawback was the collateral hotel noise late at night or early in the morning. However, it was not a factor since we were raring to go at the start of the day. P.S. Try the mini-speed boats on the lake. My 12-year-old couldn't get enough. I will return to this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disney Stay”
Reviews.Author: Really17
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews I had some questions but I was still excited to stay on property for the first time. I spent the money for a courtyard room and apon check in had my first hickup. The room they gave me was a courtyard room on the Villa side. I do not consider that a court yard view and I was really disapointed. I went down and explaned to the desk clerk that I really wanted to main court yard view and that I was willing to wait for a room since I was cheking in kind of early. The CM was very very nice and hooked me up with no problem. They took my number and Texed me when the room was ready. I returned to find they not only put me on the top floor with a main court yard view, but on the end where I had a clear view of the lake. It was Awsome! Yes the rooms are little dark but overly so. I thought the room was a standard size regular hotel room. Not overly small. I loved the fridge and the A/C worked like a champ. Mouse Keeping was awsome and it was very very quiet. My only small issue is there is not a really big selection of food. Roaring Forks is ok but basicly the same food you get in the parks. I would have liked to see alittle more selection at the quick service spot. The boat the the MK was great. The bus to the MK however was terriable. Waited over 30min each time I tried to use it and wathced multiple busses come for epcot,studieos and AK. I would stay here again and in fact I am thinking about treating my folks to a visit. While there are more Delux rooms on property, this resort is a great escape from the days at the parks and almost makes you forget that you are at Disney World. I totally recomend this resort and if you are nice and pleasnat with the CM they really will help to accomadate you.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the Wilderness atmosphere, then you will love this place...”
Reviews.Author: Mrlyn101
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my family and I went to Disneyworld. Our first room AC was broken. They sent someone up immediately to fix it but they were unable to do it in a timely manner. We were given another room across the hall but no one helped move our bags (only negative for the entire trip and Iâ€™m being quite picky). The Wilderness Lodge was nice and clean â€“ no complaints. Housekeeping was very polite and always did a great job. My child loved the animals they made from the towels. Whispering Canyon was rather uneventful (our waitress was a dud) but the Roaring Fork was good. The Artisan was good too but not worth the 2 meal vouchers (per person). The pool area was good. Staying at the resort made the transportation a breeze (no car rental needed). Disney picked us up from the airport and we were able to go wherever we wanted by boat, bus, or monorail (not located at Wilderness). Boat is by far the best way to get to MK. All in all, we were extremely happy with our visit (lodging, deluxe food plan, and parks). Definitely will be back to Disney but we may try the Contemporary resort next time (it's more my wife's style).

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Disney hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ilovedisney10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times. For the price, it is an awesome deal. I loved the location, close to the Magic Kingdom and a short bus ride to the other parks. Taking a boat to the Magic Kindom was fast and if you time it right you can see the fireworks at night. I think the most I waited for a bus was 15 minutes. My son loves the pool. Rooms are clean and comfortable. I loved the fact that there were laundry facilities. This hotel was well planned for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: KrisDiaz
Reviews.Content: This is trip was our first trip staying at a Walt Disney Resort property rather than a local Orlando Hotel. What a difference! First of all we really enjoyed not having to rent a car, we had transportation for our entire visit never ran into any problems. The resort itself is beautiful and the pool area is great with good kid's activities. Our room had a nice view to the pool and was a good size. The mini fridge in the room was a great plus since we have a small child that still drinks a lot of milk and we were able to buy it by the liter at the hotel store for a reasonable price considering. We had the benefit of extra magic hours and great help from the concierge for reservations on the different properties on site. The only thing stopping me from giving the Wilderness Lodge 5 rating is that the cost of food is a bit high but I do have to say the food at the Whispering Canyon was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok..much better experience at the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: vacationmom11
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 11 and 13-year-old sons)just got back from our 9 days vacation. We had our reservation at the Wilderness Lodge for 8 nights, but after visiting the Animal Kingdom Lodge on our second day (we had a dinner reservation there at Boma restaurant), we decided to switch over to the Animal Kingdom Lodge. ( So we ended up with staying at WL for 4 nights and Animal Kingdom Lodge for 4 nights. We are very thankful they let us.) The Wilderness Lodge was not that bad, but we all felt like it was not a deluxe hotel at all; room was dark and filthy, no music, staff was not very friendly, and it just did not give us the feeling of being on vacation there.. On the contrary, the Animal Kingdom Lodge was much clearner and funner, staff was friendlier, and made us feel like we were welcomed and were on vacation! Every time we came back from the theme parks, the staff greeted us saying, "welcome home!" This was my 4th time visiting WDW, and I must say, the Animal Kingdom Lodge was my favorite, and the Wilderness Lodge was my least favorite. I do not usually write reviews, but tought this would help someone deicidng which hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEGATRAVELER
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights here. A deceptively large hotel. Very well appointed rooms - two sinks is always handy - and a lovely view out over the animal habitat, with all sorts of disclaimers and warnings about animal encounters posted on the sliding glass door going out to the terrace. I honestly couldn't see how that could happen as the room was far enough above the enclosure to prevent any but the tallest of giraffes coming near - but I imagine there must have been something at sometime that warrants it. It's a well olied machine. Things seemed to run very smoothly during my stay. Only possible quibble is the wait for seating in the main restaurant, but even that wasn't too bad. They are big on buffets here - but due to the volume of people served, you can understand why. Good housekeeping and a fun environment (except perhaps for one clerk at check in who may have checked in one person too many and seemed to have lost the Disney spirit). And that Disney spirit is evident just about everywhere - which can be wonderful or slightly annoying depending on your point of view.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: EnzoScifo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5/27 - 6/1 2010 at the Disney Wilderness Lodge. Family of four with 10 and 7 year old children. I can only speak to our experience but we had a fantastic time. The pool is large and open late (midnight). The water slide is a nice perk. Bus station is close to the rooms as are the pools and boat dock. No long walks to anything at the resort. Room had 2 queen beds, patio, flat screen tv, double sinks, refrigerator and safe. Nothing fancy, but clean and comfortable. Located in Magic Kingdom and shares a bus route with the Floridian. Never had to wait more than a few minutes for any bus. The hotel and amusements parks were not crowded during this time period. Check-in, reservations, and check-out were all smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute must place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gg_sophia
Reviews.Content: WL resort has all the amenities you would want in a vacation. Decent size rooms - remember room size does not matter since we are not supposed to spend too much time here. Microwave and fridge in the room (you have to ask for the Mwave). Convenience store with anything you would ever need. Nice pool area with kids activities to relax when you get tired of walking at the parks. Hot tubs. Night time activities by the beach area - we never got a chance to attend since we were at the parks. Bike and boat rentals. Excellent connections to all parks. We would watch the firewaorks from the boat which would save us travel time. We did not like the Whispering Canyon because of all the yelling and screaming they do which is part of the whole ambiance. Roaring forks is very good for quick service meals and snacks. The Lobby is very nice for relaxing. The whole decor gives you the feeling that you are on a vacation as opposed to the Contemporary Resort or the Grand Floridian. Its very relaxing. The beach area I believe is not safe for kids to play since its adjoining the lake wthout a fence. Remember the dollars you pay are not just for the rom but for all the amenities at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel- wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: marierobichaud
Reviews.Content: we stayed in early May, my husband, me, and 5yr old dtr, The friendliness of the staff was contageous, the lobby was beautiful! Our room was small, but we were only in it to sleep, the pool was fun, and the staff was great. We plan on going back next year and staying for a few more days. We hope to have some time that we can actually spend some time at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and run-down rooms.”
Reviews.Author: gatormark91
Reviews.Content: Mie wife and I stayed at Wilderness Lodge this past weekend. We had wanted to stay at the Contemporary, but the Disney reservations agent sold my wife on staying at this 'deluxe' hotel. Deluxe it most certainly is not! It is dirty, old, and worn. When we arrived we were 'upgraded' to a 'woods view' room. When we got to our floor, we found that our room immediately next to the ice maker and the elevator! There was a gap under the door, so no privacy was possible, you could clearly hear every conversation in the hall. The upgrade 'woods view' overlooks a retention pond that was completely coated in green scum - so buyer beware. The room was disgustingly filthy. There was dried urine on the back of the toilet seat, the mirrors were splattered with who knows what. There were lightbulbs out in the bathroom and over the bed, and one of the cold water faucets would not turn. The room and hall were terrinbly worn looking, the cabinets and doors are banged up, and the carpet looked old and nasty. Not Deluxe by any strecth of the imagination. My wife and I complained to the front desk and asked them to clean our room thoroughly while we were out at the park - I told them I wanted it "CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN". When we returned, the things we complained about had been cleaned, but the trash had not even been emptied. So I did not have a good feeling at all about the cleanliness of anything in the room at this point. So my wife and I checked out - we did not want to stay in this filthy room. The manager was helpful, and offered us an upgrade to the 'concierge' floor, but my wife and I had enough at this point. The manager assured us we would get a refund for the night. I have had to call 3 back three times this week before I could get anyone to explain to me the status of my refund. I am told will take 2 weeks? They took the payment for the room out of my account the same day, but I have to wait 2 weeks for a refund?? Ridiculous. Also, when we arrived, we accidentally went to the Wilderness campground instead of the lodge. When we asked for directions, the security guard was rude and impatient - very un-Disney-like. I cannot recommend the Wilderness Resort Lodge at all. I feel we were pushed out of our initial plan to stay at the Contemporary - a real 'deluxe' resort - by Disney reservations trying to fill sub-standard rooms so they could sell rooms at the Contemporary at a premium. My wife and feel like Disney really jerked us around, we won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Rude valet attendant and bad beds”
Reviews.Author: taterbabydoll
Reviews.Content: We chose Wilderness Lodge because of the reviews on Tripadvisor. I really wish I had chosen another place to stay. This was our first trip to WDW and we were looking forward to it. The very first person we had any contact with was a rude valet attendant at the guest check-in. We parked to unload our luggage when he rudely informed us if we weren't parking valet we needed to move our vehicle. All we were going to do was remove our luggage from the vehicle so we wouldn't have to carry it so far from the parking area. Again he told us we needed to move that you could only unload your luggage if you were paying valet!!! Needless to say our stay did not get off to a good start. After parking and lugging our things from the parking area, we were greeted by a very friendly staff at the check-in area. We were quickly given our room keys and information packet for our stay. On our way to our room, we encountered multiple room service trays in the hallway. This was after 3 p.m.!! The room was clean and the housekeeping was wonderful. Also, we were pleasantly surprised to discover that we could see the fireworks from the magic kingdom from our balcony. What a treat!! The worst thing about the trip was the beds. The mattresses were horrible. You felt as if you were going to roll out of the bed at night they were so worn out! Overall the trip was good with the exception of the valet attendant and the mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “The theme is carried throughout the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Topchefnot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here September of last year. The property was beautiful. Wonderful indoor and outdoor lounging space. I would stay here again and again. However, I wished that this place was connected to the monorail. Most of the traveling has to be done by boat or bus. The boat times were very good, but the bus was at least a 20 minute wait each time. Beware there are a lot of mosquitos due to the proximity of this place to the water. You will probably leave with a bit or two. The concierge staff was very nice and welcoming. The rooms are your standard sized hotel rooms. All are equipped with a safe and refrigerator. This was a nice amenity especially with all the DDP snack we collected but could not eat right away. They even have a small arcade to entertain the kids during the late night, and on site babysitting. I did not use the babysitting services, so I cannot provide a recommendation on that. The only major complaint I had was that we were on the 2nd floor an odd smell seems to loom in the hall. Not sure if it was from the Roaring Forks Cafe just below or not. The pool area was perfect. There is a separate poll for little ones to wade in. Overall, great property, service, and amenities. Everyone should stay here at least once. Oh, yea almost forgot to add that our Mousekeeper was great.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate, great location, but not without flaws”
Reviews.Author: gtsports
Reviews.Content: When you do Disney, the only time you should be in your room is when you are sleeping. Remember, Disneyâ€™s definition of luxury isnâ€™t the same as at a Ritz or a Four Seasons. Itâ€™s about the atmosphere more so than the room. At the Wilderness Lodge, this feature did not disappoint. Amazing lobby, great pool and water slide, easy boat access to Magic Kingdom, free parking wasnâ€™t too far from the front door. Was it worth the $$$? Probably, just for the location and the experience. But did it â€œknock our socks offâ€�? Not really. True, we could have saved a ton by staying off site at the Hampton Inn or something similarâ€¦but for those who only do Disney once or twice with your kids, isnâ€™t it probably worth it in the long run? Upon check in we were given a room off of the main lobby. I think this was important because the lobby with restaurant seemed to always have a buzz about it. Neat for walking through, but not for sleeping close to, I can imagine. We ALWAYS travel with a little white noise machine, so we slept like babies every night from our sixth floor room and during every afternoon nap even though it overlooked the service entrance parking lot where trucks would arrive/leave at all hours. The key to this standard â€˜no frillsâ€™ view? Itâ€™s just over the trees to the Magic Kingdom. We had an awesome view for the fireworks on the nights we were back in our room by show time. Issues with the room: 1) Yes, itâ€™s smaller than you think it should be. Again, we only used it for sleeping, so not a huge problem. Though we were comfortable with our daughter, it would have been tight with 2 kids. 2) Dark â€“ after being in the sun all day, walking in and turning on the lights it doesnâ€™t seem like anything turns on. It takes a few minutes to adjust to the low wattage lights. Even then, the room seems awfully dark, which probably contributes to the feeling of it being small too. I went down to the lobby at night to read after my wife and daughter were asleep. I wasnâ€™t the only dad down there with a book or laptop. 3) The bathroom sinks are recessed under an upper counter on the vanity. This made it very awkward to use the sinks. My wife and I had trouble washing our faces and our tall 4yr old daughter, who has been reaching faucets everywhere for a while now, could not reach theseâ€¦frustrating and confounding since this is supposed to be a kid friendly place, right? We did NOT do the dining plan and I feel like we saved money and ate healthier too. Between a cooler and the room mini-fridge, we were stocked with water, Coke, juice, milk, and fruit. We had breakfast (cereal/breakfast bars, etcâ€¦) each morning in the room, and packed PB&Js/chips/drinks, etcâ€¦ for either lunch/dinner. This made the character meals a little more palatable. $100 for a family of 3 to go through a mediocre breakfast buffet? Letâ€™s be honestâ€¦youâ€™re paying for personal time with the princesses or Mickey and Minnie, etcâ€¦ Thatâ€™s how it goes. We had dinner one night at the place downstairs by the pool. Food wasn't that bad. Best value was a deli sandwich or a salad. 2 could easily split these huge portions. A note on Disney Transportation: I hate waiting in line. The boat to the Magic Kingdom is great if you time it right. If not, itâ€™s a 20-30 minute wait. If you want to be at the Magic Kingdom when it opens, be at the dock 40 minutes prior to opening. i.e. if you donâ€™t make the 8:30 boat, thereâ€™s no way in the world youâ€™ll be there for the 9am park opening. We didnâ€™t bother with the buses because we spent so much time on them our last trip. Another resort guest perk â€“ no parking fees. Itâ€™s $15/car/day/theme park to park your car if youâ€™re staying off campus. We took the boats several times and a bus once to the Magic Kingdom, but drove ourselves to Epcot/Hollywood Studios/Animal Kingdom. I drive faster than the buses and can operate on my own schedule. Nothing worse than waiting in a 40 minutes line at 10pm for a 20 minute bus ride when you could take your own car and be back at the resort in 15 minutes. Will we stay at the Wilderness Lodge next time? Undecided. Animal Kingdom Lodge a couple of years ago was a little nicer, but the Wildernessâ€™s location is better. Weâ€™ll probably try yet another of the â€˜high endâ€™ options else if we can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RoamingtheUSA
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and I visited the Wilderness Lodge during the first week in May. From the moment we walked into the lobby we were impressed with the design and ambiance. The service that we recieved at check in was wonderful! The nice lady that checked us in, Gloria, was welcoming and provided a great overview of the hotel and boat schedule to the Magic Kingdom. Altohough we knew it would be a long shot, we asked if we could be a "flag family". Much to our surprised Gloria checked the book and there was an opening. I have to say that you have to ask about being a flag family. It was a great experience, and one that our six year old daughter will remember forever We stayed in room 5041 which overlooked the pool and lake. We had seen reviews that warned of sound issues during the day in rooms that face the pool. We could not hear the pool sounds with the sliding door shut. Every night at around 9:30 there is a light parade on the lake right in front of the hotel. It lasts about 5-10 minutes and the kids really like it. On a few nights we watched the fireworks at Magic Kingdom from the parking lot of the hotel. At the end of each day in the park we came back to a clean room with different towel animals on the bed each day. On our next-to-last day Housekeeping left ballons in the room for our daughter. We rented a car to get to most of the parks and avoid the crowded (and slow) buses. The parking was free because we were staying at a Disney property and it only took on average between 9-10 minutes to get to and from each park. We did use the boat to get to Magic Kingdom and was pleasantly surprised by the speed...only about 10 minutes. Overall, this is an excellent hotel with a great location. Kids and adults alike will be amazed at the lobby, captivated by the pool, and very impressed with the staff. We are looking forward to going back to Wilderness Lodge soon!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time!”
Reviews.Author: jskjwilderness
Reviews.Content: Do not pay any mind to any negative views on this hotel. This was the third time we stayed here with very young children (3 under age of 3) and grandparents and all had a great time! Very close to the Magic Kingdom by boat (which was always there when you needed it). Spent tons of time at the pool and it was always clean and fun. Room on smaller size but did not matter when we were in there for five minutes to sleep! Great restaurants, good bar, friendly staff and lots to do. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “BE AWARE”
Reviews.Author: PinkL0ver
Reviews.Content: We had been her 2 times before and had a wonderful time. However, this third time was COMPLETLY different. Traveling over Christmas made it extremenly crowded and loud. We were meant by people who took all our luggage and seemed to not care about it. We then went to check in and waited in a 30 minute line when there was only ONE person in front of us. The room was extrmenely small and in the roof, literally. Every night, all night, we would hear kids running around like chickens with thier heads cut off and the constant sound of the ferry. The room was disgusting. We had bunk beds and the first thing you saw on them was cobwebs and about 3 inches of dust. It was disgusting. When we brought this to housekeepings attention they did nothing. The floor was gross and the bathroom was too. We waited an hour for a bus one time with a grumpy bus guy who just didnt wanted ot be there. When we asked him when it would arrive he just told us "When it freaking does. Now take a chill pill" Talk about bad customer service. Luckily thatwas the only time he was there. The pool was freezing (so much for a heated pool) and had duck poop all over it. The Roaring Forks cafe was always extrmenly crowded and there are just not enough tables nor is it big enough for the number of guests that say there. Overall, just say somewhere else and get your moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, convenient to the parks”
Reviews.Author: sbortzva
Reviews.Content: We stayed with two kids for a four night stay and really enjoyed the hotel. With the boats and buses (try the boats first), it's pretty easy and relatively quick to get anywhere in the park. the boatirde to the Magic Kingdom was usually only a 10 min trip and worst case a 10 min wait. After seeing Disney firsthand, I'd have to say the staff was comparable with everyone else in the park; friendly, helpful and always cheerful. Likewise for the hotel: clean and efficient. My only complaint was that I was not allowed to use a cart to take my luggage to the room myself. Since the bellhops must have a private service elevator (I never saw one inside the hotel), they wouldn't let me have a cart to take my luggage up. Still, it was an excellent stay and due to the proximity of the hotel, we'll probably stay there again for ease of access to the parks and restaurants. The rooms were not overly large but we didn't go to DW to spend time in the room. Our room faced the fireworks for the Magic Kingdom but it was quiet enough for the kids to sleep through it.

Reviews.Title: “nice but there is better value at WDW”
Reviews.Author: currycook
Reviews.Content: Over the last 15 years we have stayed at every disney hotel except the GF. We have stayed at the WL a good dozen times. It has always been one of our favorites. In the past we would have always rated our stay a 5 star according to Trip advisor. However our recent stay has convinced me that the value is no longer there. Little things were no longer taken care of yet the prices at the WL continue to rise. There are better values both on and off property.
