Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind paying for the lobby, this is for you!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewTorontoCanada
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at Wilderness Lodge, after a break of ten years. The lobby is as breathtaking as ever - truly invokes a different and better place. You'll feel relaxed and excited, all at the same time. And check-in is much improved - no line at all, as we'd checked in online. But... ...the rooms are really narrow. If you're unlucky to be allocated a 2nd floor room, it will be dark (and thanks to the the low energy lightbulbs, dim too). And the makeover, completed a few (4?) years ago has substituted plastic faux-wood bedsteads and armoires for the original wooden pieces. Restaurants are overwhelmed by the number of guests. You will need to book well ahead if you don't want to be offered a 3.45pm "dinner" reservation at a table service restaurant (this is true for most Disney dining locations, not just Wilderness Lodge), and you'll need to be up early to avoid the rush at Roaring Forks cafeteria. Wireless internet, which you'll be charged a daily rate for, is slow - don't expect to be able to stream video. Wish I could be more positive - used to love this hotel, but its drawbacks are becoming apparent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice, but food was disapointing”
Reviews.Author: marymomof2
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Wilderness Lodge. We stayed for 7 days. We loved the location and the short boat ride to the magic kingdom. The hotel was beautiful. Room was small, but clean and neat and was in good shape. We ate lunch at the Whispering Cafe one day and 3 out of 4 of us felt ill afterwards. They entertain you at the Whispering Cafe by insulting you. 'Elbows off the table' was a big line the waiter kept using. Not really that funny. Especially when they yelled at my son about not finishing his chicken and he got upset. 3 of us ate at the Fast food/Roaring Fork that night (one was still too sick from lunch to eat again) and the food from the grill so so horrible. All the food tasted like there was something burning in the oven and had this awful taste. So definitely rent a car so you can get out and eat some decent food as relying on this hotel to feed you will grow old fast especially if you are staying more than a couple of nights. If you do go to the Roaring Fork, stick with the sandwiches/salads. There were ducks swimming in the pool and water was dirty I think mostly from the kids running up and down the slide. Very crowded in the pool area. One hot tub was broken. The other was not that hot. Would stay again, but for a shorter stay because of the food few choices and not that good. At night the restaurant was loud and we were just above it. We put towels under the door to block some of the noise. Early in the morning, they would have trucks or something backing up and you could hear these beep beep beep out our window before 7am most everyday. Pillows were very hard and my son got so upset about it he had trouble sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again for sure...”
Reviews.Author: beachgurl62
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st stay here and we would definately stay there again. Although there were a lot of people, it never felt crowded and noisy. The lobby is huge. My 4 year old son loved the pool. It is odd (like I read in a previous review) that there are ducks on the property and in the pool at times. I asked a lifeguard about the sanitariness of it and his comment was "It's no worse than what some of the kids do in the pool." Oh yuck. It was a minor deal, at most. If you are going to Magic Kingdom you can take a boat ride to it from the resort. Very quick, easy and fun for the kids (and relaxiing for us, too.) Only drawback was there was no business center with computers and if you want to bring your own, you're going to pay extra for internet service. Kind of a ripoff considering all we were paying for the room already. Other than than that the overall experience was great. Would stay there again for sure. Also, the Disney Dining Plan (Basic) is a good deal so I would recommend that as well.

Reviews.Title: “great in so many ways”
Reviews.Author: hotelcrtic100
Reviews.Content: A great hotel would for sure come back. Friendly people, great view, fun pool with water slide, arcade, three great returants to eat at one a snack bar type resturant, the other ( my favorite ) is a good priced bbq/ and other food with an all-you can eat bbq, chicken, salad, pitchers of drinks, and more meat. fun games for the whole family and a secret that you have to go there to know about but keep it it a secret if you do. Last but not least is artist point a classy wouderful resturant nut bring a credit card because your bill will be high. Even if you are not staying here come to the returants there great. Perfection to say the least. I would highly reccomend this hotel to any one with a disney vaction just make sure you have the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: dlc76
Reviews.Content: Our family has been wanting to stay at the Wilderness for about 2 years now, so you can imagine how excited we where when we finally arrived. The lobby was spectacular and check in service was really great. Then we arrived at our room. For a "deluxe" hotel, the room feel short of that. We have stayed in three moderate Disney hotels and the room at the Wilderness was really not that much better. Other then the bunk beds, the space was exactly the same. There was nothing grand about the room. The dining wasn't terrible but the selection was very minimal. You have 5x's the selection at their moderate hotels then you have at the Wilderness. If you are on the quick service dining plan, prepared to be disappointed. The pool area was nice, not what I expected for a deluxe hotel. The slide and the pool itself were small. Overall the Wilderness is a very nice hotel but definitely not worth the price. I believe I will stick to the moderate Disney hotels from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: tootles1
Reviews.Content: This wasn't our first trip to the Wilderness Lodge but it was probably our most favorite. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a courtyard view room and it was a wonderful view. We were on a lower floor and were very close to the lobby and dining which was especially nice after a long day of walking at the parks. Taking the boat to get to the park was very relaxing and this week was probably some of the most enjoyable weather. The Whispering Canyon was fun as always and the food at the hotel was very good. I would recommend this hotel as it lives up to the "Disney" reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic is a small word for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pelicanoPortugal
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed 6 nights on the Club Level (7th floor). It really worth's the extra money to stay on that floor, specially if you have small children and value the all day available food and drinks. The staff was fantastic and very helpfull, in the concierge of that floor or in the general concierge. All the problems were solved quick. (The only downside we found was the lack or internet acess at this hotel, but the boat trip to Contemporary (Where there is a business center) was good enough to forget that) I read some reviews complaining about the size of the rooms, but ours was big enough for three and with a fantastic view over the Magic Kingdom. The housekeeping did an excellent job daily and even turned our beds down at night with chocolates on the pillow. There were ample pillows and towels. All the spaces surrounding the main building were fantastic and well inside the theme. The pool area was fantastic, including the smaller, hidden pool. We just ate at the Roaring Forks and the food there was good enough and with a good food selection. We loved the boat trips to Magic Kingdom and to the Fort Wilderness. We surely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Despite some shortcomings, a good Disney experience here.”
Reviews.Author: DaddyNJ
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Wilderness Lodge after eight days and eight nights, so I believe I have a pretty good feel for the place. The only major downside of the hotel may be the rooms; as other reviewers have noted, ours was small and somewhat dated in terms of the amenities offered and furnishings. Lighting is dim, towels somewhat ratty, and the room we stayed in wasn't especially clean for a hotel billed as deluxe (it's about on-par with your typical U.S. hotel). However, we did not spend a whole lot of time in the room, so it wasn't really a major issue. When getting a room reservation, unless you're looking for a Spring Break vibe, ask for a room at least one floor up and not facing the main pool; our room was totally quiet on the fourth floor and facing the quieter smaller pool. The rest of the hotel is pretty amazing: the lobby and grounds are nothing short of stunning and extremely well-kept; the main pool (despite the closed slide), second smaller pool, and three hot-tubs are great and clean, although the music is a bit much in the main pool; there's a little beach on the lake which is delightful; you can rent bikes and boats right near the beach; hotel features a lot of activities for kids and families around the pool and beach; room service was excellent all three times we used it; and the hotel staff and concierge were extremely helpful and responsive. Three restaurants on property: one for quick service (Roaring Fork) is OK to good for breakfast and lunch, but please do yourself a favor and skip dinner there. Whispering Canyon Cafe is better and a fun experience for families unless you want to just shut up and eat. Artist Point was really good (albeit expensive), plus it offers a nice bar. Service at the latter two was a bit slow, but overall very good, including attention to our young daughter. Location of the Lodge is a huge plus; it's a very quick boat ride to Magic Kingdom and boats are generally frequent, especially during the day. Riding the boats back and forth was fun, pleasant, and convenient. Bus transportation to the other parks, however, was a bit of a shortcoming here. Sometimes it takes forever for the bus you're waiting for to arrive so you can get to Epcot, or Hollywood Studios, etc. You wind up killing quite a bit of time waiting for the bus and riding there and back, plus the trips are often slow. We took the boats and connected with the speedy and fun Monorail whenever possible. We did not use the child care services or workout gym, so we can't comment on that. Bell-hop and valet services were excellent. Good store for getting Disney stuff in lobby. Restrooms off the nicely appointed lobby were immaculate. We enjoyed our stay here and, despite the few shortcomings, we plan to return. After also having explored the Contemporary, Grand Floridian, and Polynesian a bit for meals, etc. during our stay, it's my opinion that each of the deluxe properties has a few drawbacks (including the constant and annoying piped-in Disney soundtrack music) depending on what's important to you and what isn't. The Wilderness Lodge, overall, is a pretty darn good Disney experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great relaxed setting”
Reviews.Author: tarheelmomCary
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying on Disney's resort versus staying offsite. We agreed that is was worth paying more for the location and experience. The lobby is great....beautiful fireplace, soothing running waterfall (inside and outside), exposed timber beams. We never had trouble with boat, bus, or monorail transportation. We loved that we didn't get in our car for 5 days. We brought our own breakfast food, some lunch food (PB&J), and then ate out for dinner. They had 8 p.m. movies outside by the beach area ...kids noticed the stars, moon, and the jumping frogs. You can rent boats, bikes, etc. It has a great biking trail. Room is a little dark (and small) but our room overlooked the pool and lake...great views. The slide was being repaired for part of our trip so we took the transportation to see and compare the Grand Floridian, Contemporary, and the Polynesian. We agreed that we like the Lodge the best for our family. GF is a little too stuffy (not many trees), Contemporary is too cold-looking, and the Polynesian pool was a little small. The kids went on the slide at the Polynesian.....had a blast. Once our slide was fixed at the Lodge, the kids had fun on it. The Concierge was great and always helpful. The staff were very friendly and always helpful. We can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “March Break vacation”
Reviews.Author: GitKat
Reviews.Content: we just got back from a 6 night stay at Wildness Lodge. I will start off by saying although we had an enjoyable, memorable stay there, I wouldn't go back or rave about it to anyone else. The staff service, lobby & guest activities were fantastic but the rooms are old, dark, kind of yucky and need a desperate makeover and the pool had ducks floating in it at all times (not sure how they get health inspection for this!) and the pool slide was closed without notice. The food at the "forks" cafe was awful and offers the same food everyday! The main sit down place is very loud and fun and family orientated but will give you gut ache after! It's exterior and lobby is very impressive. Overall its probably priced right (for Disney deluxe standards) and a great resort for young families trying Disney for the first time and a great location. Boat ride to Magic Kingdom is super fast and great too.

Reviews.Title: “If you're thinking about staying here this is the review to read”
Reviews.Author: golfpro22
Reviews.Content: I have to admitt that I'm totally split on this hotel. The lobby and pool are absolutely beautiful and fantastic! Tons of great activities for kids in the lobby area and the pool is one of disneys best. Where I was stumped was in the hotel room itself. In a word; tiny. The size of the room is what I would have expected from one of disneys value hotels. Two shoehorned beds dominate the footprint of the rooms. The bathroom was also subcompact with very poor lighting. No frills what so ever in the room. Nothing about this room said Delux; which is what they're selling to unsuspecting people here. I've been to the contemporary, Yacht Club, and the GF; all of their rooms were far better. Like most disney experiences, the service was hit and miss... I opened a tab at the pool bar for us one afternoon. My wife (who is nearly 37 years old), came back to our chairs and told me they wouldn't serve here a glass of wine without ID. I was shocked this was a problem. The two of us haden't been carded in over 10 years; ESPECIALLY AT A SO CALLED DELUX HOTEL LIKE THIS! I went to the bar to try to rectify the problem and got no where. She had to go back up to our room and grab her ID. Needless to say, this was ridiculous and almost ruined our day. Another problem we had was at the baby sitting service (the cubs den). The staff was very nice,but english was not their first language. We left our son with them one night and an hour later I recived a call from a woman on the staff that we had to return and pick up our son because he was upset. Now I don't blame them for that, but the problem I had was that her accent was so thick, I couldn't understand what she was saying. I had to have her hand the phone to a manager. what a nightmare!!! Even though we didn't have dinner, we were still charged the baby sitting fees. The hotel manager did make it up to us with a credit, but it was an overall mess! The location is good, but you're much better staying on the monorail. Average time from bus station to parks was 30-45 min. I'm thinking the cons outweigh the pros overall here...

Reviews.Title: “The BEST of the Disney Property Hotels”
Reviews.Author: witwisAlex
Reviews.Content: Travelers: Family We have stayed at just about every hotel on Disney property, multiple times, over the years. There is something for everyones taste. When you enter the Wilderness Lodge you feel like you stepped right into Yellowstone National Park. If you love the look and ambiance of a mountain lodge, this is it! Ask for a room that looks over the grand atrium. This is our favorite. The swimming pool is fashioned like a running stream, and of course "old faithful" blows out back. The resort is on a Disney Lake, so you can step right onto a ferry boat that will transport you to the magic kingdom. There are buses that take you to various parts of the Disney property, Or you can drive (less than 5 minutes) to the monarail. There are several restaurants in the lodge including a fast food service, a formal bistro, and a country-family-style restaurant that is alot of fun. Our family lives in Florida, so we see palm trees & sunshine most of the year. The mountain lodge ambiance is a welcome change of sceneray for us, and reminicint of our visits to Yellowstone. You can expect something special and first class service in any Disney Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great themed Hotel w/ excellent location but Artist Point dining was poor”
Reviews.Author: hawright01
Reviews.Content: This was our family's third stay at the lodge for 7 nights, and overall we were pleased with the hotel, service & amenities. Best thing about the hotel: it's open & airy feel makes it easy to relax after a long day at the parks. Worst thing: Artist Point restaurant. Artist Point is highly over-rated, with small portions, sky high prices and below average service. We were extremely disappointed with the food, and our waiter's obvious disapproval of our children dining with us. Our youngest child felt ill during our meal and the waiter took over 30 minutes to bring us our check. What a huge disappointment this place is. If you're on the dining plan, they charge you 2 table service meals for the meal, which is so not worth it. Don't bother eating here. The Whispering Canyon cafe, however, is always reliable and has excellent quality food.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up - we had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: roadtrippervoyageur
Reviews.Content: My two daughters (age 4 and 8) and I spent a week at the Wilderness Lodge in late February, taking advantage of a Disney promotional package "4/3" deal, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had booked a standard view room but were assigned a room on the 4th floor that overlooked the smaller quiet pool, villas building, and also in view of the beach and lake, views we thoroughly enjoyed from the balcony and much nicer than we had hoped for considering we'd booked a standard view. Neither the quiet pool nor the larger main pool were crowded during our stay, due in part to the colder weather toward the end of the week no doubt, and we enjoyed them most the first couple of days when the temps were in the upper 70s during the daytime. Our room was immaculate and just the right size for the three of us without feeling claustrophobic, with 2 queen beds that we found very comfy with soft bedding and plump pillows for a good night's sleep after a day out and about at the theme parks and resort. Animal towels greeted us several times upon returning to our room courtesy of the mousekeepers. We were pleased with the dining facilities at the Wilderness Lodge and with their staffers. We ate dinner one night at the Whispering Canyon Cafe and service and food there was excellent and the chef and server were extremely helpful and accommodating regarding my daughters' egg and peanut allergies. The same was also true of staff and food at the Roaring Fork counter service/food court where we ate dinner several times, and room service pizza delivery was also prompt and pretty decent pizza for our first night's meal after an early evening check-in. Disney's bus service to the Magic Kingdom was particularly swift and direct, arriving at the Magic Kingdom only about 5 minutes after pickup at the Wilderness Lodge. Bus rides to Epcot, Animal Kingdom, and Disney Hollywood Studios took a bit longer and sometimes involved stops at Ft. Wilderness or the Grand Floridian after pick up at the Wilderness Lodge, but still were reasonable considering we were on vacation and I was free from the responsibility of driving us around. We also utilized the Disney boats between the Wilderness Lodge and Contemporary Resort and Ft. Wilderness several times and didn't have to wait for a boat more than a few minutes at most, and in many cases found the boat was docked and ready for us to board instantly. Our only snafu involved the Magic Express service for our return to Orlando airport and that was partially our fault. We assumed the buses used for Magic Express were all expressly (pardon the pun) painted/labeled as such because this was the case for the buses we had rode on previous trips. We stood by idly under the roof near the Wilderness Lodge's entrance to keep out of the rain there while watching a yellow Mears bus pull up and then leave around the time of our scheduled pickup, not realizing that the yellow Mears buses are also sometimes utilized for the Magic Express service. Oops. Disney should be more proactive in informing guests of the use of Mears buses on occasion, and the bus drivers could also make more of an effort than this particular one did to be sure guests who are obviously waiting for a ride aren't missing their bus as well. Live and learn, lol, as we did when we inquired at the resort airline check-in counter about why our bus hadn't shown and learned the Mears bus should have been our bus. We ended up catching the next Magic Express bus (a clearly labeled one to boot) about 45 minutes later, and still luckily had plenty of time to spare to make our return flight. All in all, we had an enjoyable trip and found the Wilderness Lodge was well suited for our family, and give it a big thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “It was an average stay.”
Reviews.Author: dwest61071
Reviews.Content: My family (with 2 kids 5 & 7) stayed at Wilderness Lodge from 3/3 to 3/10/10. Our room was on the 5th floor and when we looked over the railing outside our room we were looking down at the Whispering Canyon restaurant. Out of our balcony window we saw the roof of other buildings. Not exactly impressive, but we didn't go to Disney to sit in the hotel. Upon arrival, a nice employee helped my hubby get luggage out of the car and bell service brought the luggage to our room. That was nice. We drove a rental car, since being frustrated with how long the Disney Magical Express took to get us to our hotel last year and the ensuing 4-hour wait for our luggage to arrive. We were concerned about having a room overlooking the Whispering Canyon, but it wasn't overly noisy. They gave us a room with bunk beds even though we didn't pay for one. The room was clean, maid service was average. One day it took until 4pm for maid service to clean the room, but other days it was more timely. When we left a $10 tip we got towels made into animals, other days we got nothing. One note for families with small children, the rooms that overlook the lobby area have railings that you can look over into the lobby below. We have 2 children with HF autism, and they could have easily climbed over these railings and fell 5 stories to their death. So if your child is adventurous in any way, you may want to ask for a room on a lower floor. Our kids were good about it, but I was initially concerned. My biggest complaint would be the food. To eat in the Whispering Canyon it's like $35 a plate, and for a family of 4 to eat there a week is not economical at all. We didn't eat there even once. We ate at the Roaring Forks quick service cafe for breakfast 2 days and dinner one day. The selections were too limited and the food too expensive. A tuna sandwich was $9 and it didn't include anything, not even a drink. And the drinks had no refills unless you bought the refillable mug. We ended up either eating at the Disney parks or we went off property to Cici's pizza and the Steak and Shake. Both were more economical and offered a variety of food items. The Roaring Forks food court was very small. At the busiest time there were 10 families in there and it was full. I was most disappointed with the fact that the water slide at the pool, one of the main reasons we booked this resort, was CLOSED for refurbishment. I called and checked around when making the reservation because I wanted my kids to have a great pool and slide. This was very disappointing. I also saw many unsupervised children in the hot tubs and no lifeguards (or parents, sadly) manning that area in the day time. The hotel was certainly not full, in fact relatively quiet, so this was a surprise. Overall, my kids liked it there very much. We traveled to Magic Kingdom by boat and liked the Electrical pageant at night time. When traveling to Epcot or Hollywood Studios by bus, however, we waited 30 minutes or more for a bus and then had to stop at Fort Wilderness or the Grand Floridian hotels also. On the plus side, the busses were less full, but this seemed to be true overall with attendance at the parks lower. So I would say it was an average stay. There were a couple of nice perks (like water transport) but other than that it was similiar to the All-Star Movies resort we stayed at last year. All-Star movies was more crowded, but had a great family atmosphere, large food court, great pool and ambiance. At Wilderness it was quieter but fewer amenities; pool was smaller-half closed, arcade smaller, food court smaller. It was okay but not sure we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A FANTASTIC resort and a MUST stay for all Disney fans!”
Reviews.Author: guerns17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge during December and it was AMAZING. The lobby is beautiful when you walk in. They have a huge Christmas tree and holiday decorations all around. It really got us in the Holiday spirit! We had paid for a courtyard view room and we ended up on the south side of the resort directly facing the beach and water . We were on the third floor. It was BETTER than being right in the courtyard area because that becomes quite loud during the day. The room was great. Two queen beds, flat screen TV, IPOD player/clock (this was really cool because I did bring my IPOD and we would just sit out on our porch and listen to music), two sinks; which are separate from the toilet/shower room. The bathroom is a nice size compared to the value and moderate resorts. There is also a mini fridge, ice bucket and glasses, coffee maker (we never used this), as well as a closet. Below the TV there was a dresser to store your clothes . The porch was my favorite. It has two chairs and a small table. Our porch was a little different because of the design of the resort the third floor in this area has a lot of stone work and it made the porch VERY private. Which I really prefer because sometimes it is awkward to have a thin board between you and your neighbor. We also ate at the Whispering Canyon Cafe and it was GREAT. They do have kind of a quirky thing that the servers do and they try to joke around with you and do other crazy things, but we came toward the end of the night and we were seated toward the back and our server was just fine. We were just there as a couple so we don't really get into that, but a family with kids might enjoy it. The food was YUMMY. We had the Canyon Skillet which is an endless meal. They just keep replacing food you run out of. It comes with a Smoked Pork Ribs, Pulled Pork, Oven-roasted Chicken, Beef Brisket, Mashed Potatoes, Cowboy Beans, and Corn on the Cob Mixed Greens Salad with Apple Vinaigrette, Coleslaw, and Fresh-baked Cornbread. So it is A LOT of food. We had no room for dessert in the end so pace yourself!! :) We only ate at Roaring Fork counter service once for breakfast. It was great, nothing amazing, but I heard that the lunch and dinner selections were really fresh and good. The pool area is awesome. The pool water is constantly fed into the pool from a water fall that starts in the lobby! There is a water slide, but we never went on it, and there is a hot tub, but it was always so busy we never went in that either. If you are looking for a quieter pool walk over to the Villas at Wilderness Lodge because the pool is smaller and there are not as many people there. Another neat aspect of this resort is the geyser that goes off every so often. I think kids would love this. Finally, the boat to and from Magic Kingdom was really fun. We never waited in line long and it got us right to the Kingdom in no time. The buses were great as well, I think probably the best I have had at Disney. The buses do share other stops at the Polynesian resort and Wilderness camp grounds, but it really did not add to the time getting to and from the parks very much. My recommendation is to definitely try this resort. It is WONDERFUL!!

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge is relaxing. Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: tempocontour
Reviews.Content: Fort Wilderness Lodge is trually a wonderful hotel located just off of Seven Seas Lagoon, on Bay Lake. When entering the expansive lobby you will be greated by giant toten poles on each side of the lobby and wood animal carvings all over the place and beautiful back ground music from movies such as Big Country, Dances with Wolves, etc. A big fire place at a far corner of the lobby burning real fire, even during the summer! Great place to sit and relax from the heat or to just check out the lobby. Make sure you ask for a tour of the great lobby, it's free. For restaurants, there are 3 places, Roaring Forks a counter service restaurant for sandwiches, burgers, fruits, chips and desert. The brownies are bigger here compared to the value resort (Pop Century - stayed there right after Wilderness Lodge) for the same price! Whispering Canyon Cafe an all you can eat buffet restaurant. The wait staff are a blast! Make sure you ask for some ketchup and see what happens. Make resevations for this restaurant because they do fill up quick for breafast and especially dinner. And Artist Point, a very expensive restaurant. There is a bar near the lobby just around the corner from Whispering Canyon Cafe. There is Mercantile, a store to buy mickey shirts, watches, books, cups, candy and personal hygene stuff. There are 2 heated pools located at the back of the resort. A bubbling stream leading from inside the lobby through the outdoor grounds to the main pool (water from stream seperate from pool water) and continues on from the other side of the main pool to just before Bay Lake. The 2nd pool is smaller surrounded by trees for more shade located on the right side of resort where Disney Vacation Villas are. Also a kiddy pool and 2 jacuzies. Pool have multiple life guards on duty to help keep the kids safe. People swim even after closing hours which seems to be ok. There is a outdoor bar near the main pool. There also is a geyser near the pool that shoots water up every 90 minutes(?). The area surrounding the main pool is beautiful with a water fall, plants and trees....and live ducks swim with you plus live bunnies help keep the grass short around the area. Take a leisure boat ride to the Magic Kingdom or to the Contempory Hotel for lunch/dinner if your not in a rush, its a great relaxing ride with great scenery of Bay Lake and the now closed Discovery Island and parts of Seven Seas Lagoon. There is a beach on Bay Lake great for sunning but no swiming in the lake. There are boats, bikes and fishing rods for rent. Outdoor Disney movies shown during the evennings near the beach. You could head over to Fort Wilderness Camp grounds by boat, bus, or even walk for horse back riding, meals at Trails End buffet restaurant or even a dinner show at Hoop De Do Musical Review. There is a small arcade just outside of the lobby heading to the bus depot. Also a weight room for you exercise fanatics, located in the Disney Villa building located on the right side of the resort heading to the bus depot. There is a laundry facility to wash and dry clothes. My room was located on the 6th floor, left side of hotel facing Bay Lake, with the pool view! Trually great view of the pool and Bay Lake! Recommend getting a room on the 5th floor or below because the view from the balcony is obstructed by the roof. You will have to stand up and look over the roof for the view. Room had 2 queen size bed (bunk beds are offered), with a small undercounter size refrigerator, coffee maker, hair dryer, thick towels, free newspaper Mon thru Thurs., ceiling fan, digital tv and great a/c. There is a (very) small room safe in the closet to lock away your valuables. The room rug seemed a bit warn, the shower curtain rod was a bit loose, and shower head a bit clogged up, other than that, no complaints. Maid service was wonderful. Free buses to and from the parks were never that long a wait and never qiute packed compared to the other bigger resorts that have more rooms (Wilderness Lodge with only 700 rms versus Pop Century w/2880 rms, All Star Resort combined w/6000rms, Caribean Beach with 7 stops around it's resort, fill the buses up fast and often), but the buses here do stop at one other (small) delux resort depending on which park you are going to. It beats getting (and returning) a rental car, getting lost, finding gas, worrying about damage to the car, and remembering where you parked at each of the huge parking lots. FYI, the bus from the resorts to the Magic Kingdom drops you off right near the entrance, compared to driving to the parking lot, taking a tram from the parking lot to the transportation center then taking either a ferry or monorail to the Magic Kingdom, then you have to do that in reverse going back to your car! Tough to do after a long long tiring day. But if staying at a Disney resort, parking at all the parks is free. This is the only delux resort on or near Seven Seas Lagoon not part of the Monorail System. The night time water pagent light parade runs thru Bay Lake from Seven Seas Lagoon. You could see parts of the nightly Magic Kingdom fire works form either the boat launch or even better from the beach. I used the Disney Magical Express to and from the Orlando International Airport (MCO). I've heard scary stories about the Express going to multiple resorts to pick up/drop off from MCO which can take a while. It all depends on the time of day. At night (off hours) it's great! It sure beats driving which I have done serveral times . If you want to take Disney's Magical Express, make sure you request it when booking your trip. They do not eccept walk ons! Disney Magical Express runs 24 hours a day and they will take care of your luggage for you from MCO airport straight to your room while you go to the parks and back to the airport when vacation is over. = ( But if you come in after 10 pm and before 5am(?), you will have to get your luggage yourself and take them to the Magical Express counter and bus, and from the bus to your room. The Magical Express is located in Terminal B on the 1st floor at MCO. Remember that!!!! I didn't. (heh heh) Do remember to tip the room maids, and other help. Did I miss anything????? I would definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: TheRock13
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week at the Wilderness Lodge and we LOVED it! Like some of the reviewers, we were also given a ground floor room at check-in. At first, we were unsure, but then we realized our location was perfect. We were halfway between the Roaring Fork and the exit door to the boat launch, and we never had to wait for an elevator or climb any stairs. Everything was totally convenient to us. We had a lovely patio, and a mama and papa duck who liked to visit us every morning. The lobby was breathtaking - beautifully themed with plenty of space and loads of comfortable seats. There was plenty for the kids to do (arcade, Cub's Den, cartoonist at night) without having to "plan" an activity. I agree with others on some things, like the lighting in the rooms. A little dark, but I believe that was intentional, given the motif. Bright fluorescent lighting would not be reminiscent of the great lodges of the Pacific Northwest. Honestly, it also helped us to relax when we came back from the hustle and bustle of the parks. The rooms have connecting doors to the room next door, which makes things a little noisy sometimes. We had noisy neighbors for the first few days but thankfully they checked out. Maid service, while not "white glove", was good enough, and our attendant left little animals made out of washcloths in our room each day. My daughters were absolutely THRILLED with this, and began to make their own animals to leave for her. We found the front desk and concierge to be helpful and attentive, although I did overhear some people talking about the difficulty they had getting quarters for laundry. These same people were making racist remarks as well, so I am not sure I trust their opinion on anything, but I thought I would mention it. As for food, we were pleased with Roaring Fork - everything was fresh and tasty. Whispering Canyon was about as good as most places in Disney, which means average. But we didn't go to Disney for the food, we went for the experience. Whispering Canyon was fun for the kids. Everything is overpriced but the meal plan saved us a lot of money because we shared quick service meals. I know there are a lot of complaints about service, luxury, etc., but I think people have to remember that the price of Disney resorts is at a premium because of the real estate they occupy and the amenities they offer. Of course the monorail is the most convenient method of transport, but we had an easy time with the boat to MK and The Contemporary, and the buses to anywhere in Disney World. If we decide in the future we absolutely must be on the monorail, we can stay in one of the 3 resorts it serves (and pay more than the Wilderness Lodge rates, by the way!). One day, toward the end of our trip, we took a stroll over to Ft. Wilderness to check out the ponies and horses. We had called ahead to see if our 7 year old daughter could go on a trail ride and they informed us that the minimum age was 9 but that pony rides were available. When we arrived, we saw a sign that said "Maximum height for pony rides: 48inches". What is a 50 inch tall 7 year old to do? She was very disappointed, and we were annoyed that no one had told us this important piece of information when we called. However, we did get a chance to pet the ponies, and view some of the horses that work in the parks. We even saw one of them the next day at Magic Kingdom! Overall, a great trip, and we would return to Wilderness Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “1st Time Stay - We will be back”
Reviews.Author: WISGrumpyswife
Reviews.Content: My husb & I celebrated our 18th anniversary by taking our first Disney vacation w/o the children or grandchildren. At check-in we were informed we were being upgraded from a standard room to a 6th floor room overlooking the pool/courtyard. I was somewhat disappointed we were assigned a handicapped room and wanted to ask for a different one, but being it was an upgrade my husband said we'd try the lower bed out and yet I would have preferred a regular bathroom with a tub. The patio on this 6th floor room didn't allow us to see below without standing, which would have been difficult for one in a wheelchair to see w/o standing. The laundry room was so small, so I got up at 4:30 am to make sure I could have washers and dryers before it got crowded, yet the quarter changer was out of change so I had to get quarters from the lobby clerk on duty at 4:45 am. I was a little surprised that a man was lying down on a chaise lounge by the pool, that turned out to be a hotel employee that was supposed to be cleaning the pool area. Once I dangled my feet in one of the hot tubs, he suddenly appeared with a closed sign & placed it next to the other hot tub w/o a word to me. He was probably surprised to be caught sleeping or lying down on the job. It was cold our entire 5 nite stay from 2/2-2/7/10, so I never even swam in the pool or got into the hot tub. The hot tubs were both full of guests when the sun was out and we were in the hotel. I was disappointed with the employee from housekeeping assigned to our room. There was a towel animal on the table the day we arrived, so I left a tip the next morning. Another was in the bathroom with a shower gel bottle that 2nd day, so I left a bigger tip the 3rd day. No towel animal was in 0ur room the 3rd day, so I didn't leave a tip. The next day we ret'd to our room from a park and noticed the 2nd animal was removed by this housekeeping employee, probably because she was mad we didn't leave a tip when she didn't leave an animal. It was the principle that she took an animal and didn't replace it. I informed the asst mgr (night) our last (Sat) nite, who contacted Housekeeping. The 2 ladies came to our room and delivered a whole bunch of towel creations, one with a lei on the top, I was so moved. They both apologized. I was so happy to get more than one animal from a Disney World hotel as we have never gotten more than 1 animal on any visit in our past 6 visits to WDW resorts since 2008. I left my sunglasses in the room on our last day on the bed, and called the hotel from one of the parks. They called me later that day after while we were in one of the them parks stating nobody turned in sunglasses from our room. I assume that 'maid' was not going to turn in any sunglasses if she found them on our bed whenw someone complained about her. I will return to Wilderness Lodge. The reason I chose WL was because of the $750 Disney gift card incentive and the lower rate/nite than other Deluxe hotels on Disney Property. The geyser was cool, but it was so cold that we had to wait quite a while for one boat, and the second time we waited to go by water, it took so long we gave up and went by bus, as did another family 10 minutes after us. I hope we can return to WL with a similar incentive and possibly swim and sunbathe. The small food service area surprised me as we have been to Port Orleans Riverside many times and enjoyed their selection of food/beverage. I enjoyed the more modern room than the POR rooms we also stayed in right after leaving the WL taking advantage of the Chase Visa cardholder $89/nite room only rate the next 4 nites.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at WL during very busy park week”
Reviews.Author: dawneg
Reviews.Content: We retn'd last night from an absolutely wonderful time at the WL. I was more than surprised to see the mixed reviews below and wanted to put in my two cents, esp since we travel to nice hotels often and know what we like and don't like. The rooms are not huge, but we had knew that. The best tip I have is to send one adult to scout the first room they assign before you schlep kids and luggage. Our first room was a dark cave, the next one an incredible view and was infinitely brighter. The staff was very kind and housekeeping seemed just fine to me, esp considering all the wear and tear that kids put on these rooms. The setting is gorgeous and restful and a great retreat at the end of the day (or anytime). Pools were beautiful, easy transport to Contemporary or MK and even buses to Epcot, HS, etc. were easy. We visited Polynesian which we had originally wanted and it was a zoo. It is WL 100% for us from now on.

Reviews.Title: “There's no place like home...except for Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyWilloughbyOH
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review a while ago. We hadnâ€™t been at WDW in three years but decided to go the week after Thanksgiving in 2009 to enjoy the Christmas decorations and avoid the crowds. This is our fifth stay at Wilderness Lodge (weâ€™ve also stayed at Polynesian, Contemporary, Caribbean Beach and Dixie Landings (which is now part of Port Orleans) as well as the Hilton near downtown Disney for a conference). This is, obviously our favorite hotel. It is very calming and comforting in the midst of the craziness of Disney. Plus itâ€™s the least expensive deluxe hotel. It isnâ€™t on the monorail but that ensures that the illusion of the Pacific Northwest continues. The Christmas decorations were up and the holiday music was playing. Even though we didnâ€™t get to enjoy the hotel as much as in the past since we had park tickets for each day of our stay, it was still wonderful to spend our down time here. The only downside was that the Christmas choirs donâ€™t start appearing until the second week in December. The express check-in that you do on-line prior to leaving home was great. Check-in was a breeze. They had everything ready for us when we arrived (around noon)â€”well before check-in time. All of our requests were met even though they were very full at that time. We were lucky to get one of their king-bed roomsâ€”weâ€™ve only had this once before. Typically, youâ€™ll get 2 queens and that doesnâ€™t leave a whole lot of extra room to move around since the rooms are small. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ll be choosing a courtyard view again (unfortunately, the woods view was sold out during our stay). It is one noisy place during the day with a staff person on the bullhorn. Itâ€™s great that there are activities for the kids, but come on. Some of us would like to take a rest mid-day and itâ€™s just not possible with all of that noise and music. We were lucky in that Disney was running a special at that time. I was hoping to catch the 'pay 4 days stay 7' but the only package available was the free dining plan. Iâ€™ve never done the dining plan before (free or otherwise). It probably saved us more $ in the long run than free nights, especially since we rarely eat off site, except for the occasional visit to Celebration. Per person, you receive one snack, one counter service and one sit down meal per day's stay (although you don't have to use them on specific days). Some of the better restaurants (CA Grill, Yachtsman Steakhouse) require 2 sit down points per meal. The counter service meals were wonderful for lunch. You received a non-alcoholic beverage, entrÃ©e and dessert (ditto for dinner). Examples of snacks are pineapple dole whip (try one, youâ€™ll get hooked), popcorn, coffee, soda pop, Krispy treats, ice cream bar, etc. Donâ€™t use your sit down points for breakfastâ€”save most for dinner and use counter service points for lunch. Just to give you a flavor of what where we were able to dine, we ate dinner at Sci Fi Diner and Mama Mellrose at Studios, Yachtsman Steakhouse, CA Grill, Pescos Bill at MK, Rose & Crown at Epcot. We enjoyed lunch at Germany and Chefs de France at Epcot, Flametree Barbecue at AK and at Polynesian counter service restaurant. We paid for lunch at Brown Derby since it requires 2 pts even for lunch. We also got a coupon for one free mini golf and discount and souvenir at Planet Hollywood along with a few other items (free arcade, etc.) that we didnâ€™t take advantage of. The entrees at Yachtsman Steakhouse alone are in the $30-40 range. If they are offering it at the time, be sure to do this. You will get your moneyâ€™s worth. We had a bunch of snack coupons left the last day, so we took home a lot of really delicious Krispy Treats. The Lodge is much quieter than the other resorts. I donâ€™t know why because there are still kids running around. Maybe the calming music and colors helps. I have to say that service was much better than in yearsâ€™ past as well. Thereâ€™s a ferry from WL to MK. We didnâ€™t get to try it yet againâ€”got rained out the last few days we were there. One of these days, weâ€™ll go over to MK on the boat even if we come right back. To reiterate what must have been said previously, a geyser goes off hourly, the pool starts as a brook in the hotel, thereâ€™s a huge fireplace and the lobby is just breath taking. We didnâ€™t eat at Artist Point this trip but have had good meals there in the past albeit very long meals. The snack bar seems to have improved as we grabbed a quick breakfast a couple of times there. We do not like the food or atmosphere of Whispering Canyons (I wish theyâ€™d come up with something else), but Iâ€™m sure the kids enjoy it. The nooks and crannies are still enjoyable and blessedly empty, with great views of the lobby and the beautiful music to lull you to sleep in an easy chair or sofa. Some of the rooms have views of fireworks from MK (and you can hear the music) and/or the electric water parade. Thereâ€™s a nice gift shop where you can purchase outdoor Disney themed items along with snacks and sundries. You can rent a bike and bike over to Fort Wilderness. We did this one year, riding a surrey. It was a lot of fun but obviously we did this in the winter monthsâ€”Iâ€™m guessing itâ€™s just too hot and/or humid in the summer. The pool has a bar/snack shop, hot tub and slide, but we usually donâ€™t use the pools any more. Housekeeping was fine and did leave a few hearts and I LUV YOUS spelled out in towels on various days. No towel animals, which was ok I guess as we still have some from previous visits. However, if we had never visited before, that would have been disappointing. We were celebrating an anniversary of sort. We did receive buttons and a few cast members wished us happy anniversary but not all that many. We were offered free glasses of champagne at Brown Derby, but, being that it was lunch, we declined. So our lovely waitress brought a heavenly serving of dense, chocolate mouse instead. We received a card from the hotel but no balloons or chocolates as we did when celebrating anniversaries and birthdays in the past. I guess the economic times have hit Disney as well. As I said, we didnâ€™t spend much time in the hotel this trip, but the time we did spend was relaxing and nothing went wrong unlike my past trip. I left with a better feel for Disney than Iâ€™ve had in the while. And I almost forgot to mention the mattresses. They must have been changed since our last visit three years. They were the most comfortable mattresses I've ever slept on--anywhere. I have an extremely bad back, having been rear ended by a school bus when I was stopped, and I always worry about how I'm going to do with a mattress other than my own. I wanted to check those mattresses on the plane when I left, they were so comfortable. I would recommend staying on siteâ€”you get too much in the way of convenience, extra hours, free parking, time and atmosphere not to. And since there are hotels for every budget, thereâ€™s really no need to stay anywhere else. Plus if you are really watching your $, stay on site and don't get a car. You can get Disney's Magical Express from the airport (won't have to carry your luggage--goes right from plane to Disney bus to hotel) and you can use Disney transportation throughout. However, we always get a car; it's just more convenient and we sometimes can't take the crying, tired kids at the end of the day, plus we like to park hop and we visit the other hotels and that is a nightmare to do on Disney transportation. At least for us, it is difficult to stay anywhere other than WL. Even if you donâ€™t stay there, make a trip to check out the lobby and the grounds. My bet is that youâ€™ll be spending your next visit to WDW there.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous but very poor service”
Reviews.Author: sairam66
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Wilderness Lodge numerous times, and always enjoy it. However, we are always amazed at the utter lack of service from the front desk personnel. On this particular trip, having paid for a courtyard view room I was sent to a ground floor handicapped accessible room that did not have a bath tub. Additionally, the view was of a gigantic boulder. My family was already at Magic Kingdom, so I had to schlep baggage for four back down to the lobby and then to the new room. I should add that they did not apologize for the inconvenience and only gave me the new room after I became testy. I met another gentleman who had a similar experience. I suppose that some people just don't bother to raise a fuss, and stay in rooms that are less than what they paid for. Overall, the quality of service at WL has significantly declined in the past 15 years (we went there the first year they opened). We keep going back (it is gorgeous, especially at Christmas), hoping things will have improved. The management does not seem to be aware of, or does not care about the declining service standards. It's a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Typical overpriced Disney accomodations....”
Reviews.Author: naport44
Reviews.Content: I didn't hate the place, but it was far from worth the price you pay. Like everyone else the structure itself is very cool, and the community areas as usual with any Disney resort are done well. The average and below average aspect of the resort starts with the traditional small Disney Rooms. The bathrooms are beat up from the nasty Florida water with the tubs stained with a gross yellow color. The beds were hard and not exactly what I'd expect for the price. Even though we went a week before the big President's weekend the maid service was terrible and our room was only cleaned once on a five night stay. Every time we came back from the parks for an afternoon nap (couldn't go poolside because it was frigid) they had yet to clean our rooms, and we would end up just getting clean towels in order to rest. The food was terrible at all the restaurants, and we were glad we had a car to leave the resort and not be tied down to Disney food 24 hours a day. Unfortunately we had to use the Laundry facilities due to the bad weather, and it was like a zoo with only five washers for a hotel with over 850 rooms. You had to camp out in the laundry room to snag a washer or dryer, felt like a line at Magic Kingdom. We had another offsite hotel booked but thought getting the "magic" mornings and evenings would be worth the extra cost. Well that didn't really work as we found it was easier to go to a park without the magic morning and rides were actually quieter there. We still think Disneyland is better, and much easier to navigate and Southern CA just has so much more to offer outside of parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Visit to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: spanielrage
Reviews.Content: The WL is a great place for young families. The restaurants are pretty good and everything that you could possibly need is there. We had a nice Woods View, although it was more like a view of the villas across the path. The balcony was nice to have though. Big bathroom area, with a separate double-sink was handy too. Transportation to the theme parks was mostly by bus, with the exception of the option to take a boat ride to Magic Kingdom, which I would recommend doing at least once.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Incompetent Hotel Staff in the Nation”
Reviews.Author: Jeff1246
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of staying at the Wilderness Lodge for five days with my family. The staff had the professionalism one would expect at a third world dump. Room service was virtually non-existent and after two hours or so when the food was delivered it was inedible. The restaurant staffs were rank amateurs, but the prices were set as if they were not and the food was actually recognizable. The rooms were dark and dingy, and the average light bulb put out no more illumination than a candle. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: travisanti
Reviews.Content: We split our stay between the Polynesian which I also loved and the Wilderness Lodge. The Wilderness Lodge is my favorite hands down. It is so beautiful and serene. The water falls were so relaxing, the geyser, beach, boats, food etc all were amazing. We were in a concierge room and the service was wonderful. The food served was also fantastic. We never went hungry that is for sure. We were able to see the evening water parade from our balcony. It is all under one roof so you don't need to go from building to building. We never had to wait for a boat or bus to go to the parks. Everyone was friendly and accommodating. Our room was very clean and I never heard any noise coming into the room. It was unusually cool when we were here so I didn't get to go in the pool but that also looked great. There are a couple of hot tubs, health club, great restaurants - who could ask for more. If you take the boat to the parks at 7:55 pm you can watch the fireworks from the boat!! Its a secret - don't tell anyone.... I liked the quick service restaurant better than the Polynesian. I love the breakfast bacon, egg and cheese croissant - yum. There isn't a lot of seating in the quick service restaurant and it is busy at peak times so I brought the food back to our room but that was fine. Anyway, you won't be disappointed, it is a beautiful, serene rest from the crazy pace at the parks. Staying on site is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Mommy we're at the castle!”
Reviews.Author: JoJoTraveler
Reviews.Content: Loved loved loved this place! This hotel is so beautiful everytime I walked into it I felt so happy to be staying here. I traveled with my husband, little girl and my parents and we had an amazing time. The theming is great, and it's a great value considering you're at a delux but not paying the higher prices of the other delux hotels. We thought it was a great location as we staying at the Magic Kingdom most of the time and could easily take the boat to and from the park each day. Coming back to the rooms for naps was easy too. We also took the boat to the Contemporary where we could eat or get on the monorail to go to other resorts. The best part of the hotel was that everytime we walked in to go to our room my daughter (who was about 2.5 at the time said "Mommy we're at the castle" It was so sweet and she just loved it. Lots of Disney magic to be found here. We even had a wonderful lady at the pin station in the lobby who would give our little girl free Tinker Bell pins when we stopped by because she knew she liked them so much. We are already making plans to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Choice for Young Kids”
Reviews.Author: mcnugget
Reviews.Content: After a great deal of research, we decided to stay at the WL rather than one of the Disney hotels on the monorail line. The WL was rated the best for families, and it has a boat to the Magic Kingdom, and it is fairly new. We won't be staying there again. Here's why: (1) kids aren't into the decor -- they just want to be in the parks and on rides -- so the State Park theme didn't matter much; (2) the wait for the boat to/from the Magic Kingdom is sometimes short, sometimes quite long and sometimes the boat is an open craft (no walls), and sometimes enclosed -- it was cold when we were there, and it was colder on the boat -- we will definitely stay somewhere on the monorail line next time; (3) the rooms are basic, reasonably clean, but nothing special; (4) you must take the boat or the bus to get anywhere (such as to the other resorts for dinner), which was a bigger hassle than expected; and (5) our room had excellent acoustics from the water, so we heard the boat whistles/toots all day long. All in all, it was not a bad place. It's just further removed that expected. On the plus side, the staff was excellent -- truly helpful. And Roaring Forks makes great sandwiches. And the Mercantile in the lobby sells a half gallon of milk for $3 -- a stunningly good deal given the prices of other food/drink in WDW. We paid under $200 per room for 2 connecting rooms, which was a good deal. But next time I'll pay a bit more just for the monorail option.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jesslyn848
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to stay at the WL for years, and recently took advantage of great FL Resident rates and did so. I am sorry to say, however, that I probably won't be back. Having stayed at several other WDW resorts, I was expecting great service and a nice room, and I didn't really receive either. When we first arrived at the Lodge, we checked in and were given our room. It was on level 1, which I really wasn't thrilled about, but the check in "cast member" stated that it was currently all they had available. I was a bit taken aback when the "cast member" further stated that she was surprised our room was already cleaned and available for check in. This was at 2:50 PM and check in time was supposed to be after 3:00, even though I had requested our room be available at 2:00. Upon entering our dark room, I noticed that we were given a king sized bed, even though we had requested two queens, but figured I wouldn't complain since I was so tired from our freezing day at Animal Kingdom. The bed itself was maybe 1.5-2 feet off the floor, which was a bit strange and made it difficult to get in and out of (I'm about 8 months pregnant) They apparently use queen sheets to make the king sized bed, because every time we sat on the bed, one of the corners came off and it was obvious the sheets didn't fit. The bathroom had no tub, which made it hard to bathe my infant son and the fan in the bathroom was malfunctioning and made a constant annoying humming sound. The huge shower was a bit dirty, with many stray hairs throughout each corner and dingy tile grout. These of course are not huge flaws, but I was just disappointed in the room in general. I've had much nicer rooms at the cheaper Port Orleans and Coronado Springs resorts. I later came to find out that we had been given a handicap accessible room, even though I didn't request or need it and would have preferred a regular room. I also noticed that it seemed to take a long while for room service trays to be cleaned from guestsâ€™ doorways. We walked past the same several dirty trays 2 days in a row, which was really gross. I wouldn't expect that level of service from WDW, and I thought that they maybe neglected the rooms on our basement level a little more than the rest of the hotel. It also took forever to have our room cleaned each day. We came back from the parks at 5:00 to the same unmade bed and no clean towels, which was really unacceptable. (Normally I wouldn't care, but since the bed was so jacked up to begin with I couldn't really figure it out or bend down low enough to make it myself) It wasn't just us who had problems either. My mother and grandmother checked in one day after us. We had requested that our rooms be either connected or close by and they actually put them on the 5th floor. When they checked in (at 4:30 pm) they were given keys to a room that they discovered was already occupied, with Disney bags and luggage to boot. Good thing they are not thieves, because they could have easily swiped someoneâ€™s' souvenirs if they wanted to. Upon their asking if a handicap accessible room was available (my grandma is wheelchair bound) they were told that those rooms were only for those â€œwho really needed itâ€�?!? This is obviously hilarious, because I was given such a room even though I obviously didnâ€™t need or want one. All in all, the grounds are great, the Whispering Canyon and Roaring Fork are pretty good, but my room and the service was definitely lacking. If I do return to another WDW resort, it certainly will not be the Wilderness Lodge. This makes me very sad, as I said I have always dreamed of staying there and had such a substandard experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Best WDW trip EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: disneyisgreat1
Reviews.Content: This was a really enjoyable trip, We Have been coming for the last five years and this hotel makes you feel at home, The rooms were pretty well kept and were always cleaned, After years staying at the Contempery it is good to stay here because you feel like a guest insted of a number. Also if you are taking the time to read this let me recommend the BEST RESTURANTS that you MUST TRY if you are on the dinning plan. ALL ARE IN EPCOT ,Le Celeair in Canada Pivillion . Tu Tu Italia Coral Reef Tapan Edo PLACES NOT TO TRY Akerchus Royal Dinning Hall The princesses were a great amusement but the food was terrable and no one ate it Thanks for reading: )

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ONCE AGAIN !!!”
Reviews.Author: zye01
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Disney and we chose the Wilderness Lodge for the second time because we liked it so much. I am quite picky and I must say everything was extremely good. The property was maintained so well both indoor and outdoor. This has to be the best deluxe hotel in Disney. The front desk and room attendants were very friendly and even upgraded us to a bunk bed woods view room which was very clean and perfectly sized.( The rooms are a good size and not small like other have stated !) Once again I only stay at 5 star properties and this place is a definite 5 star plus !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: luv2run32
Reviews.Content: How can you not be impressed by this place? As we pulled up in the Magical Express, the hotel came into view and it was awe inspiring. I know that it is more expensive than other places, but as you walk around the lobby and see the detail and thought that went into this place, its worth it. The rooms are standard, nice big flat screen tv's. The pool area is very nice and had entertainment for kids every day. The boat was convenient to MK and was a nice change from the buses. We never had a problem with the staff or housekeeping, everyone did their job and was very professional. The kids had a great time in the restaurant, the waitstaff are very entertaining and involve the kids in the fun. We went to other resorts for meals, (Grand Floridian, Animal Kingdom, Beach club) and these places were insane around mealtime with all the restaurants. That would bother me if I were staying there. The best part about this place is that it seems out of the way, but is very convenient. If you are looking for a peaceful retreat after a busy day at the park this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnandstacey
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Wilderness Lodge and loved it! Breath-taking lobby! We had considered Animal Kingdom Lodge and are glad we stayed here as it was a bit more central and close to some of the other deluxe resorts (for meals we ate at Polynesian and Grand Flordian) as well as Magic Kingdom. The boat service worked better than I expected - our 22 month old son was happy to ride the boat - we didn't even need to go into the park 8-) Used the bus service to get to Epcot and drove with our rental car to AK and HS. Even used the boat to get to MK, then took Monorail or Boat to other resorts. Pool area was very nice....still used by many in the winter months. They do have a pool party every afternoon. Our room had a balcony facing on the pool which meant we could hear in our room but our son still slept through. Housekeeping was accommodating. Staff were pleasant. Nice to have a refrigerator to keep water and milk cool. Room was comfortable - nothing extravagant. The double sinks were outside the bathroom which meant we had to be really quiet if we tried to get ready before our son was up or get ready for bed after he was sleeping. Would definitely stay here again. Would love to visit here in the summer when we could use the beach and the pool with warmer weather!

Reviews.Title: “Good to be home”
Reviews.Author: BlueBird Watcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for the last week of September 2009 into the first week of October. It was our third trip to the Lodge. Once again, we enjoyed ourselves immensely. The staff is friendly, the hotel is amazing. I never tire of sitting in the lobby just looking around at the detail. As on our previous trip, our only problem was housekeeping. At first, it was wonderful. But our usual staff must have had a day or two off. One day it looked as if our beds were slept in, they were all wrinkled. Then on another day, they didn't make my son's bed. Well, they pulled the bedspread over the whole bed without straigtening the sheet or blanket. Very odd. One afternoon by the pool, the towels were overflowing from the towel return, and there was actually cups with straws around the pool area. We had never seen that before. It was cleaned up within several hours, but I remember thinking how disappointed Mr. Disney would have been had he seen it. For the first time, I used online check in and it worked like an absolute charm. It was wonderful to just walk up and have my folder handed to me. Lovely! For the first time, I walked over the Wilderness Villas and checked out the lobby there, along with the Spike Room. This room had some train memorabilia in it from Walt Disney. I could feel his presence there. It was a wonderful and quiet diversion. I would recommend this hotel/resort to anyone. It is a bit pricey, but it is very special to hear the train from the Magic Kingdom when sitting on the balcony or by the pool. There is a great view of the evening Water pageant. The access to the Magic Kingdom by boat is a wonderful touch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place”
Reviews.Author: proftravlr
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I had always wanted to stay here and we found a good deal and decided to stay one night. We were not going to any parks-just wanted to roam around the lodge and see the Electric Water Pagaent. We were not disappointed. We were upgraded to club level so we got some free food too and our room was nice, quiet and huge. Definitely the National Park lodge feel with the Disney touch. All cast members we encountered were terrific. Don't miss the Electric Water Pagaent and look at all the special touches and Hidden Mickeys around, and the cool topiary. Great place. I would stay again. It might be a little pricey if you were staying for a few nights and going to the parks, but for what we wanted to do, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great for kids, great room.”
Reviews.Author: pcook
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were a bit put off that the driveway was being resurfaced but (because Disney can afford for a round o'clock labor shift) the driveway was finished completely in 24 hours. When we checked in the front desk gave us a variety of rooms to choose from - we stayed in room 6014. Faces the Contemporary and MK and is the middle of that side of the building at the top - away from the driveway in the front. Its like having a private balcony with a roof overhead. My wife commented that the wall (where a railing would be) did make it hard to sit in the chair and see it was great to be able to see the fireworks every night and see a little of light show in the lake every night. Roaring Forks downstairs is a great place to food cheaply for Disney's standards. I also saw many families grabbing extras like utensils and napkins and sides to bring up to the room for the fridge. We did not go the Whispering Canyon - very loud sometimes and pricey. We bought breakfast food in the Mercantile and had a lot of breakfasts in the room that way. My wife went on the hotel tour and loved it - learned a lot about the lodge. The pool is a lot of fun - heated - swim with the ducks - great slide and they provide entertainment at the pool every afternoon and evening. We also didn't realize there are Disney movies shown on the lodge beach every night outside. We went on the pirate tour fireworks boat with "Patch" the pirate - fantastic. Snacks and drinks at the Contemporary - meet and greet with Captain Hook and Schmee. Patch was great - knows a little about every town in America as he got to know everyone on the boat. Stand up comedy (clean Disney humor) and fireworks for kids and adults - every kid gets a pirate prize when you leave and Peter Pan was on the dock when we got back. We went on the bass fishing trip on the Disney lakes - 2 hours - about $240 for four and we each caught a bass - JR the guide was excellent with our kids and us - very laid back trip - just perfect. Bring along your portable DVD players - oddly there are none in the rooms. You can rent DVD's at the Mercantile. On one day my daughter had a stomach bug (probably snacking too much on too many things) and made a mess on the carpet. Instantly housekeeping cleaned and disinfected the carpet and we didn't smell anything. They also left the towels animals most days. Regarding internet access - Disney - its 2010 - put in the free WiFi - you can afford it. We actually accessed the internet with a USB dial modem and a local 407 area code access number - sure it was a little slow but we were jsut checking business email - nothing more - we were at DIsney to have fun. The only negative I had was the bell hop as we were leaving - he got very opinionated after he learned we were from Massachusetts (the senate race) and made sure to tell me what he thought about the state and its politics. I was on vacation at Disney - I didn't need the outside world intruding or his opinions.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for families with children”
Reviews.Author: momoftwinsOntario
Reviews.Content: Our family had a wonderful stay at the Wilderness Lodge. The room was spacious and clean and it had a partial view of the lake. Our children looked forward to the towel animals that housekeeping would make for them. It was quiet at night and the staff was very friendly. On-line check in was simple and even though we arrived hours prior to official check in time, we were given a room. The cast member at check-in was very friendly and extremely helpful, answering all of our questions and entertaining our requests. The weather was warm enough for swimming so we were able to use the pool and our children enjoyed the pool side activities. The location of the Wilderness Lodge is ideal. We enjoyed the boat rides to Magic Kingdom and the proximity to the other Magic Kingdom resorts. I would definitely return to the Wilderness Lodge. The only dissapointment was the concierge when we were checking out. She was not very helpful and was not very pleasant. Also, it was disappointing to have to pay for internet access...most other hotels include this or provide wifi, not sure why disney refuses to get on board with this...perhaps because they can drain more money out of visitors this way.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: mcd5
Reviews.Content: This is a fun resort for families with children. Lots of outdoor activities (fishing, bike & walking trails, pool/hot tub). We spent all of our daytime hours away from the resort so unfortunately, we were unable to take advantage of all the amenities that the resort offers. Check-in went smoothly. I advise doing the online advance check-in service if possible. We stayed in a 2 queen standard room facing the woods. For $165/nt this was fine but I'm not sure I would pay much more. These rooms are not "deluxe" in my opinion. We had friends that stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for $565/nt with concierge service and the only perk was the concierge food and drinks on the 7th floor. Even with that, they were not overly pleased with what they got for the money. Having said that about the rooms, overall I feel like this is a wonderful resort with many options offered away from the parks. Staying on Disney property allows you to take advantage of free bus and boat transportation to the parks and also to the airport. I would definitely return to Disney's Wilderness Lodge if the price is right; if only to check out the bike trails, fishing, camp fire, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good”
Reviews.Author: marie2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 8 nights we got there about an hour before check in and they did have a room ready. When we got to this room we couldn't believe it was consider a deluxe hotel the room was dark and the carpet was dirty. When I picked up the phone to dial the front desk the phone was so dirty I couldn't believe it. We were moved right away and what a difference the second room was. After that our stay was very good housekeeping was good even got a few towel animals. You can't beat the location so close to the Magic kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “It was the best for us”
Reviews.Author: Mishy119
Reviews.Content: January trip - 11-19 - with a 9 year old - We arrived at a wonderful site, valet was helpful and courteous. I had done on line check in and everything was ready. We checked into room 2107 - right off the lobby - first floor - with a little patio. My daughter was in love. Unfortunate for me - the room was located next to a staircase fire door and when that closed the whole room shock. By the next day my daughter complained, I went to the front desk and without question and with a smile moved us to 3115 - the fantasy continued - our sliding glass door was in the trees facing the courtyard - at night the trees were illluminated by lights, you could hear the creek, from the balcony - you could also see the pool area, the lake, the gyser (that goes off on the hour - what a treat to see)- the view could not be beat. At night you could watch the light show. Whispering Canyon cafe was a hoot, be sure to ask for catchup and a little more soda and Roaring Forks cafe was great. We had the refillable mugs and had hot cocoa every night. We had the deluxe meal plan and even with signature meals did not use them all. My daughter loved the resort so much she did not want to go to the parks. She swam, attended children's programs, games, arcades and roaming the lobby with the totem poles, indian items and fire place and rockers, and the stream starts in the lobby. The boat to Magic Kingdom was the easiest and such fun. Never a line. We rented a two person Surry and rode over to Fort Wilderness and checked out the ponies. Staff was always there to help. Devora was our cleaning person, and everyday she made us new animals, it was such a treat to come into the room and see a new creation. The rooms are regular size, but then there were only two of us. There were two sinks, safe and refrigerator - and that was fine for us. The beds were sooo comfy and the pillows also. I wanted to take their blankets home. Yes there were always plenty of towels - I think there were six daily for us. Oh there is laundry facilities $2.00 washer and drier and we used them. Pop in washer, play bingo - go back pop in drier another game of bingo. I can not express what a joy it was to stay at this hotel. I have never stayed at a deluxe - but if you have kids and they need to run and roam this it it. They have a play ground, water slides and a beach. Please consider this one. Also remember I went on the off season. It was not crowded and I really had a blast. We both wore birthday pins and were greeted all the time with Happy Birthday Princessess - it was a magical time for us. I hope it can be for you also Any questions please email me - will be a joy to answer them= also used a great travel agent through Kingdom Consultants Jenell - she planned everything and made all my meal reservations - can not thank her enough for making this dream vacation come true

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: mcpmia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge with my mother and 22 month old daughter. First of all, the hotel is beautiful and the facilities (including heated pool) and restaurants are excellent. I definitely plan to stay here again. Two things to note: (1) if the winds are high they stop boat service between the hotel and Magic Kingdom so you have to take the bus (somewhat less convenient); and (2) the rooms are small. We had a beautiful view, bunk bed room - which is the highest (i.e. most expensive) non-club level. It was small and considering the cost somewhat disappointingly so. And if you plan to use the internet - it is $10 per 24 hour period.
