The only other thing I would mention is that it is a loud hotel, especially if your balcony overlooks in any way the pool - as there is Bingo every day from 5-6 with a LOUD woman with a megaphone (literally) announcing the numbers. All of that said, I would still definitely recommend it - we had a great time and will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Another Disney Magic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Catsaver911
Reviews.Content: Stayed at DW Wilderness Lodge for 8 days (4 in a standard Room and 4 on the concierge floor). Initially we were given a poor room which looked out over the loading dock and still had someone else's clothes in the dresser. We complained and the staff were excellent. We were quickly moved to a ground level room just above the pool deck. The room was comfortable with an great deck. We didn't partake of any of the higher priced restaurants this visit (this was a 3rd trip to the WL) but we did discover the amazing value that was the casual/fast food location. Disney has made a great effort to offer healthier, tastier foods meeting far more reasonable price points. As fort he hotel it is our favourite at Dworld as it has amazing theming, over the top friendly staff and a location that is both convenient and away from the hustle and bustle. For the last 4 days stayed on the concierge floor as a treat. The food offerings were better than in the pat and the wine and beverages were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing, beautiful awe inspiring lodge.”
Reviews.Author: gene247
Reviews.Content: The lodge is not on the monorail system so it is not as busy and crowded as other hotels in Disney World. Take th boat to get access to the other transpotation venues. The pool area is relaxing and nicely set up. watch the geyser shoot the steam into the air. Everyone of the staff is polite and friendly. This is the only place we snow stay when we go to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking lobby, helpful CM's, a few bugs and not so good mousekeeping...”
Reviews.Author: nladams
Reviews.Content: The lobby at the Wilderness Lodge is just breathtaking. The Christmas decorations were amazing and the CM's always friendly and helpful. Roaring Forks was never busy and had a good selection of food. Used the refillable mug a lot. Transportation was always good ...never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus...longest wait was 15 min for a boat. Although due to the cold weather I only used the boat once. The first room I was given was on the 4th floor overlooking the lobby and check-in desk. Not too noisy. Found a couple small white bugs on the bed but thought nothing of it until I woke up the next day and they were all over the bathroom counter. At 6am I went downstairs and requested a change in rooms. The staff were very apologetic and moved me with no hesitation. The new room was quieter and overlooked the woods (rather than the paid for standard room) and the Villas. No bugs. However when I entered the room there was a dirty tissue on the floor and old moldy cup of oatmeal on the sink. Mousekeeping was alright. Never recieved any towel animals ( I know not to expect this though). Overall would recommend this hotel for the lobby and the location to the MK but other than that would recommend saving the $$ and staying at a Moderate rather than wasting the money on the deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: jjbarrier
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking lodge!!! Bunkbeds were great for the kids. Beautiful pool. The only negative was are neighbors kids were out of control loud which means walls must not be very thick!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: DJD43
Reviews.Content: The Lodge itself is absolutely wonderful and as you would expect from a Disney property it is spotlessly clean and well presented. We just spent 14 days at Disney over Christmas and love the convenience and atmosphere of staying on property. However for a luxury resort the rooms (including the bathroom) are too small and over-priced. Also, for a luxury resort free Internet might be nice, after all you are paying a fortune to stay there. Maybe try a moderate resort instead and save yourself $150 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ktiffin1
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved Wilderness Lodge!!! Stayed here during Christmas. Beautiful and all of the cast members were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: LostonaRoadTrip
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Wilderness Lodge! The room was clean, the lobby was beautiful and the restaurants were great. We enjoyed the camaraderie at the main restaurant in the lobby - lots of fun by the wait staff. It was too cold and rainy to swim, but the grounds, gardens and pool were quite lovely. We have stayed at many hotels in Disney and this is our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: canuckgal33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for 5 nights in December. It was myself, my husband and an 8 year old child. We have stayed at many Disney World hotels and this one is by far my favourite. The check in was quick and the front desk was very helpful. We arrived early (before check-in) so our room was not ready and we had to leave our luggage at the valet luggage station. We spent the day at the park and then picked up our luggage in the evening. The Christmas decorations in the lobby are beautiful. There were characters in the lobby for pictures every evening. The pool was great, very big and it has a small water slide. Our room was very nice. We had two queen beds. Everything was clean. The beds have the traditional hotel bedspreads, which I don't really like, but we never use them, so it doesn't really matter. You can control the temperature of the room with the wall thermostat (which I always like). The bathroom was nice as well. Double sinks outside and the toilet/shower area behind a door. The toilet/shower area was a bit small. Complimentary toiletries were shampoo, conditioner, lotion, face soap and hand soap. The room had a fridge and a safe in the closet. The bus service was pretty good....we usually shared with one or two other resorts, so sometimes the drive to the parks was a bit long, but we rarely had to wait longer than 10 minutes for a bus. We took the boat once, which was fun. This is a fantastic hotel and I will always stay here when we return to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort on Disney Property!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dangol
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough great things about Wilderness Lodge. Beautiful rooms, beautiful lobby, wonderful restaurants, wonderful location, wonderful pool, wonderful transportation. Simply the best Disney has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “December stay - Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: logcabinmama
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here from December 11-18th. We had value season pricing and free dining. Whoa! The Christmas decor, music, theming, friendly CM's, and warm cozy atmosphere just could not be beat. Our 6th floor room was quiet, clean, and comfortable. My 'tweeners' agreed with me that this was the prettiest hotel of all those surrounding Magic Kingdom. After staying at a value hotel on a previous Disney vacation, I greatly appreciated the quiet, fast, cozy, service of Roaring Fork. Food was reasonably good, and the hot chocolate and Twinings tea was always flowing. In the evenings, after the fam went to bed, I could sneak out, have a cup of tea and enjoy the the warmth of the 7-story fireplace. Oh yeah baby...my kind of wilderness roughing it.

Reviews.Title: “Second time and can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: KHOIT
Reviews.Content: First off let me say this. You will read some negative comments about this hotelâ€¦ignore them. Realize that there are some people out there who unfortunately are never satisfied and will complain about any and everything. We all know at least one person like thisâ€¦the type that would complain because they thought the showers were out dated!! I actually read that on here!! And you canâ€™t go to Disney in July and complain because the hotel is crowdedâ€¦come on people!! Our recent trip in May was for our honeymoon. We spent 9 nights there are loved every inch of this hotel. The first time we went was 2 years ago when we were only dating. It was actually on that first trip that I realized I wanted my then girlfriend to be my wife. Two years later there we were. The staff could not be more friendly and accommodating. Whatever you needed/wanted no matter the time of day it was never an issue. Everyone treated us like Kings/Queens and greeted us with big smiles. From making dinner reservation anywhere in the Disney property to setting up special event reservations (horse back riding, Fantasmic, etc.) they were the best. The rooms are a bit small but guess whatâ€¦ITS DISNEY WORLD!! If you want to stay in your room on vacation go somewhere else!! The Whispering Canyon is an awesome themed restaurant. We did breakfast there everyday and it was so much fun to watch the all the little kiddies there have an absolute blast. The Artist Point is a rather expensive restaurant but if you are looking for a great meal with gourmet food, this is the place for you. If you have kids this is the place for you. The buses come by constantlyâ€¦about a 10 minute wait tops. If you are going to the Magic Kingdom simply walk to the back of the hotel and catch a quick boat ride. The pools are great. There are two of them there. The main one can get a bit crowded with the kiddies during the day but the â€œHiddenâ€� pool is perfect if youâ€™re looking for something a bit more relaxed. We absolutely love this place. Throughout of our lives together this place will always be â€œourâ€� place and hold a space in our hearts. We now have a little baby girl and are in the midst of saving $$ for our 2011 trip. We canâ€™t wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cute, 'n' Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Wan2Scream
Reviews.Content: There was a slight bit of rust on a small edge of the folding stool in the shower. That was the only imperfection we found at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. We saw absolutely no evidence to justify some of the complaints we have read here. My husband and I spent our anniversary week at the Wilderness Lodge. We were given anniversary buttons to wear and were wished a happy anniversary by almost every cast member who saw us. We also received a special card and special treats. Our room was spacious and clean and quiet and the bed was big and comfortable. Outside our patio door was a beautiful view of the waterfall. Ducks were waddling back and forth, adding to the charm. There was a swimming pool (which the ducks enjoy) and a spa (which the ducks avoid). There was also a nice beach with Disney movies shown outdoors each night and boat transportation to the nearby Magic Kingdom and Fort Wilderness. We knew we were in Florida but it felt as though we were in the Pacific Northwest. Be sure to look for the two cute topiary bisons near the lobby entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Stress-Free Travel with Food Allergies!”
Reviews.Author: Research-R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Wilderness Lodge with our 3 small children. We had a fantastic vacation, enjoyed the location of the hotel in proximity to the Magic Kindgom (you can take a bus or a nice relaxing boat ride.) We decided not to over-do it and only went to the Magic Kingdom for 2 of our 5 days at Disney...it was a perfect balance because we hung out at the pool on the off days. We also really enjoyed taking a boat to the campground to the Chip and Dale Campfire Sing-a-long (which is free and super fun!) I can't say enough how pleased I was with the allergy-safe food options at the resort and Disney in general. It took a little extra time, but everyone was well-trained and knowledgeable about preparing safe meals for my kids with multiple food allergies. At every sit-down meal, we were flagged for the chef to come out and discuss meal options and prepare/oversee them from ordering to delivery! At counter service meals (even at the Magic Kindgom, the manager takes your order and oversees that it is safe.) It really was unbelievable for a mom like me who constantly worries and stresses over feeding my kids while traveling to be able to relax and enjoy a stress-free vacation. (I even packed a whole suitcase full of safe food because I never know what to expect-I didn't even open it on this trip!) Not to mention that my kids ate like kings and queens...the chef Beatriz Candelario at Cape May Cafe made special Mickey Mouse shaped waffles that the kids absolutely loved! And special thanks to Andy, the manager at Roaring Forks for making our trip extra safe and special-the kids loved him! The resort itself was very nice and very clean-the rooms were a little small but comfortable enough (we tried to get a suite or 1-bedroom but we booked late and there were none available.) I would say the Wilderness Lodge reminds me of a Great Wolfe Lodge but not as new or fancy. The bunk beds were a hit with the kids. I was surprised that there was no pay-per-view or Disney Channels in the rooms, so we were glad we brought the DVD for pre-bedtime wind-down time. All in all-a great trip and a great hotel. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Attractive lodge with great surroundings”
Reviews.Author: LJHSViking
Reviews.Content: Disney's Wilderness Lodge was an excellent accommodation for a first trip to Walt Disney World Resort. Two adults and one teenager stayed comfortably in a Villa at the lodge. The studio-style suite had a king bed and a fold-out sofa, divided bathroom with large dressing area, and a mini-kitchen, which was useful for stashing water bottles and all those snacks and desserts you get on the Disney dining plan. The lodge has a nice upscale look and feel, with a beautiful lobby and very nice pools and grounds. There is a beach area with cool lake water perfect for soaking tired feet. The bus service was fine and we were able to visit at least two parks every day of our six day trip. President's Week is a fairly busy time at WDW so there were crowds but there were also very generous park hours, including extra hours for resort guests. And the weather wasn't hot or humid, as it can be in spring and summer. The Villas are separated from the main lodge building, and cater to Disney Vacation Club members as well as visitors. The fitness center was attractive and well-equipped and the building itself had some nice lobby and seating areas. During our rare down times we enjoyed sitting outdoors on the lodge grounds. There is a nice poolside bar and the quick-serve dining facility is great for a grab & go breakfast before heading into the parks. There are shops that sell souvenirs as well as sundries and snacks. The Magical Express took us from the airport in Orlando to the lodge and then back again for our flight home. We didn't rent a car for this trip and found the resort bus service to be just fine. Trips to Downtown Disney were enhanced by using the Dining Plan to eat at the Wolfgang Puck cafe and a couple of other restaurants. Reception and concierge staff were helpful, professional and well-informed. We would stay at the Wilderness Lodge again except...there are a lot of other interesting choices at WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: prfctcellsgrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week long honeymoon to Disney. As a gift, a relative had booked us a honeymoon suite in the Wilderness Lodge. The lobby is gorgeous. It does tend to get a little loud due to the western music playing and the Whispering Canyon restaurant but it is a beautiful hotel and it adds to the fun. Our room was on the concierge level. We loved the snacks that they provided during the day but it kind of got old after a few days, seeing as how they served the same foods every day. The room was great- it was very clean, the bed was comfortable, and the jacuzzi tub in the bathroom was wonderful to relax in after a day of park hopping. The view was kind of not so good but you could watch the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom on the balcony (which was tiled and clean). The cast members were all very friendly and helpful. I would say the only downside is that the honeymoon suites are located on the balcony side of the hotel, overlooking the lobby so the loudness from the Whispering Canyon can be heard in the room. This was NOT so fun when you are trying to sleep at 7:30 a.m and you can hear people yelling for ketchup. Also, the lobby music can be heard through the room as well so don't expect to be sleeping past 8 o'clock if you are a light sleeper. All in all, it was very enjoyable and I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort and Free Upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: gemmybear83
Reviews.Content: We had booked 1 night for our anniversary at the Wilderness Lodge in courtyard view room on Expedia. When we checked in we were upgraded to a concierge room! Concierge service was fantastic, they trated us really well and we loved the lounge with free snacks and drinks. These were nice as a treat, but you could not use these for your main meals. We loved the resort it is beautiful and the boat service to Magic Kingdom was a nice treat. The main pool was crazy busy with kids when we were there (something the moderates are a lot better for as there are so many pools they dont get busy) but the villas pool was nice and quiet. The room was ok - love the theming, but the room didnt seem any bigger than the moderate resorts, and they were looking slightly tired - surprising for a concierge room. The only extras were a dvd player, robes and turndown service. We had a great view across to the castle through the trees and we were able to watch wishes from our balcony (just avoided looking down at the service yard!). We ate Artist Point, and it was an excellent meal. All in all a great stay - I dont think I would pay for a concierge room but were looking forward to staying at the resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: amywma
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 adults, kids aged 1.5 & 5) stayed in a woods view room with bunk beds. The kids loved having the bunk beds, and I appreciated the small amount of additional floor space they gave us. While the room was not exactly spacious, we were not cramped for space. We were on the 4th floor and could see many of the nightly Magic Kingdom fireworks from our balcony...I'm sure if we were a couple of floors higher we could have seen them all. The hotel itself is beautiful and the pool and grounds were great...our 5-year-old loved the pool slide. We really liked the boat access to Magic Kingdom and the Contemporary resort; riding the boat back to the hotel in the evening was very relaxing and peaceful. The bus access to the other parks was good, too; we never had to wait very long for a bus either coming or going. While I would be appalled paying the price we did anywhere else, I realize that everything Disney comes at a premium price. All in all, though, we very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Washington_DcKristin
Reviews.Content: We returned a few weeks ago from our stay at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. We had a fantastic time. The hotel has very nice public spaces. The lobby is impressive, the streams are lovely, and the pool was beautiful. The kids (6 and almost 4) loved the water slide and the ducks that have made the pool home. They also liked the activities around the pool. The woman who ran the activities when we were there was great with kids and spent time building with blocks with our son and helping my daughter with chalk. When we arrived our room was ready. We asked if any upgrades were available and they did upgrade us to a pool view room at no extra charge. The rooms were fine. There was nothing particularly exciting about them - yes, they are in the "camp" theme. The kids were happy. The downfall is the bathroom. The double sink is outside the shower/toilet area which is fine. But the actual bathroom is small and not impressive. It's fine and clean, just nothing to write home about. I just kept thinking we could have been staying off property at a Ritz Carlton for considerably less - but we would have lost a lot of the convenience. It just made me wonder if this was "luxury" what was "moderate" like. I would not be interested in finding out. As far as convenience, I would not pay extra to stay at a hotel on the monorail. From what I saw the Grand Floridian, Contemporary, and Polynesian were all about $100 more per night. I have to tell you that we really enjoyed taking the boat directly to the Magic Kingdom. It was beautiful and relaxing (our weather was good though). There is a separate boat that brings you to the Contemporary so you could take the monorail from there to the other hotel (we had some character meals planned at the Grand Floridian). We checked out the Contemporary and Grand Floridian properties. The Contemporary was stark and I don't think as fun for kids. The Grand Floridian was very fancy - my daughter called it Eloise's hotel. But I still preferred the natural beauty of Wilderness - with lots of trees and wild greenery. The only big downfall of Wilderness are the restaurants. We didn't go the top end restaurant there as we were with the kids. The casual sit down restaurant is fun for a one time meal. The servers joke around with you, the kids run around on hobby horses each hour on the hour, and it's fun a raucous. That's a one time thing in my book. Then there is a fast food type place. The only healthy options are a couple salads. Lots of double bacon cheeseburgers, chicken nuggets, etc. It would have been nice to have some higher quality there. We ended up going and eating at a lot of other resorts for character meals - there aren't any at this hotel. We had no problem hopping over to other resorts in the morning, but by the evening we were really tired and just didn't want to have the hassle of venturing out. I would have liked some other food options. But, bottom line, we all enjoyed ourselves and I would stay again... Oh, and some people complained about how far it was to the lobby or the docks. Well, I have to say that is pretty shocking. The property is really not that big. I think that a lot of people have gotten lazy. If you have a disability I could see the halls being long. We just exited out the pool and walked to the lobby by way of the pool and pretty streams. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nicely Themed”
Reviews.Author: stylizpinkangel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four day trip at the Wilderness Lodge. The resort is very well themed and has a pleasant none stuffy atmosphere. We have stayed at many Disney resorts and have been coming here for years. I personally thought the rooms were typically Disney. They are small, but have great decor and our room was spotlessly clean. The boats to Magic Kingdom and Fort Wilderness were convenient and we never waited more than a few minutes for one. The thing I liked most about this resort compared to many of the others is that everything was close by. At most of the Disney resorts you walk and walk to reach the buses, restaurants, and pools, not here. We ate at the whispering canyon cafe and enjoyed it. We also ate at the Hoop Dee Do Revue at Fort Wilderness. This was a fun dinner show, but the food was mediocore. Every night at the resort they do family portraits with your photo pass. I highly recommend this especially if you come back and get cleaned up from a day at the park for dinner. Its the perfect time for a photo and they do a very nice job. The cast members at the front desk and restaurant were friendly, but I must say that most every one at the resort was not. We waited an hour ( patiently) for the lady in front of us to chose her photos at the resort photo pass desk the guy gave her top notch service and when it was our turn we weren't even spoken to or acknowledged. This was one instance we had out of a lot during our stay. We encountered many unpleasant and down right rude cast members on our trip this time, more than ever before. Yes, everyone has bad day, but you do pay a lot for Disney service and I felt it was severely lacking this trip. After going to Disney for over 15 years and getting married there I don't think we'll go back anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Northwest comes alive at Disney in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Cooking_in_Chicago
Reviews.Content: This is a great location if you are a family with young children and want to remain on Disney property. The location is nicely wooded and unlike any of the other Disney locations you will find. One short boat ride gets you to the MK in about 5 mins and you'll wait no longer than just a couple of minutes for any boat to and from WL and MK. The room decor may look a bit rustic but it fits with the Pacific NW theme. Check out the pools which are fun for the kids, the boat landing where you can rent a boat for a ride around the lake, play at the beach with lots of sand altho no swimming is allowed in the lake, see the geyser, and don't forget to feed the bluegill fish while waiting for the boats. Your kids and your family will have lots of fun at this resort hotel and really enjoy the relaxing setting which is much needed after the fun filled days at any of the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and very mediocre.”
Reviews.Author: Gabriele
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth trip to Disney and second at the Wilderness Lodge. Until now, I was a believer in staying onsite Disney. October was supposed to be the off-season so I was expecting to pay a little less than the almost $300 a night. Nevertheless, I decided to spring for it, remembering the great times we had at this hotel before and also its convenient location. It was disappointing. The walls in our room seemed paper-thin. Sound moved freely and loudly through them and also through the ceilings whenever someone was walking overhead. The noise level in the hall was also loud and began very early in the morning. Issues with cleaning and cleanliness. The rooms need updating or a good cleaning. Concierge service was erratic: different information depending on who you got. For example, we were trying to book a haunted carriage ride at Fort Wilderness and the concierge we talked to had never heard of this activity. The next one told us everything was completely booked. Ten minutes later I called the Disney reservations number and found the carriage rides were wide open. This was the first trip to Disney where we had difficulty obtaining reservations. Shuttle service irregular. Shuttle service to the airport leaves three hours before flight. You could get a nicer hotel off property for a lot less money. That's what I will do next time.....and rent a car to drive to and from the parks and to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we will be back.”
Reviews.Author: upnorthWV
Reviews.Content: We traveled with eleven family members and had three rooms at the Wilderness Resort. We just returned last weekend and we loved it. The rooms were clean, not like the Ritz Carlton clean, but they were very clean for a resort that has a lot of visitors. No problem with us on cleanliness. We loved the theme, the pool was really nice (both loud pool and quiet pool). Wasn't too sure about the ducks in the pool and my daughters were playing one day and splashed water toward them and got in trouble by the life guards, hmmm, didn't think ducks were suppose to be in the pool, but didn't bother us, guess disney wants the ducks there, ha ha. Overall, the resort workers here were very friendly, on occassion ran into one that was a little grumpy but for the most part they were friendly and very helpful. I had a moment one morning to go onto my balcony, we had a room that overlooked the courtyard, and the water sounds were so peaceful, with three kids I didn't get that often. My parents stayed on the woods view side and it was also very quiet. The boats were good no big wait time, but sometimes ten or fifteen minutes, busses were very quick to come and pick you up. The food at the Roaring Forks was good, lots to select from, just be careful how you use your dining plan for combinations, etc. The Whispering Canyon had great food, we really enjoyed dinner and breakfast there. Didn't try the Artist Point. I would recommend this resort, we will definitely consider going back, I would like to try other disney resorts, but since we liked this one so much I will be afraid I will be dissappointed and wished we would have been at the Wilderness so we will be back here. ONE THING WE WILL NOT DO AGAIN: is the Whoop De Doo Show, not worth it, the show was nice the food was o.k., BUT, they asked everyone to be there one half hour early, we went as well as did everyone else registered, they gave us a peice of paper and we stood outside in the heat for a half hour before we got in. It was really, really hot and with kids, not nice. I was upset, thought ok, don't be upset you are on vacation, then I went to the restroom, where there were lots of moms rubbing cool rags on their kids faces and just as upset as I was. We got all cleaned up for dinner from a sweaty day in the parks and they asked for us to be there early, then we were really, really hot and sweaty standing in the sun. It was 95 degrees. Wouldn't do this again. But our waiter was outstanding there. I believe most people will really enjoy this resort, it is a nice relaxing feel to a hectic week at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Wilderness Lodge -- Great Atmosphere, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Spider90
Reviews.Content: Although I am an extremely frequent visitor to Walt Disney World, this was my first stay at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. I had visited the lodge before to eat in its restaurants, but not to stay. I was not disappointed. The Lodge is a cozy, Northwest inspired hotel. Althought it is a fairly large hotel, the rustic atmosphere definitely gives it a homey feel. Don't be fooled by the log cabin look -- this is an upscale hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean (as are all Disney hotels). The beds are extremely comfortable. We stayed in a Courtyard View room and requested a view of Silver Creek Falls. It was wonderful! We looked out over the falls and over the pool. The lodge also has two excellent restaurants -- Whispering Canyon Cafe and Artist Point -- as well as a quick-service location. Aside from the wonderful atmosphere and comfortable rooms, location is a key feature of this hotel. Wilderness Lodge and Animal Kingdom Lodge are the two least-expensive Deluxe Resorts at Disney. Their pricing is the same, but the location of the Wilderness Lodge is far superior. We were just a 10-minute boat ride from the Magic Kingdom! The buses for the other theme parks came frequently and we never had difficulty moving from place to place. Wilderness Lodge is an excellent choice for those looking for a Deluxe Resort with an excellent location at a reasonable price. One of my new favorites!

Reviews.Title: “Would definately book this hotel the next Disney trip”
Reviews.Author: kathi1217
Reviews.Content: My friend and her 3 - 12 year olds and I with my 3 year old daughter had booked this Disney vacation leaving our husbands at home this trip. Our trip was from Thursday, September 24th to Monday, September 28th. We originally had booked the Coronado Springs Hotel, before arriving by Disney Magical Express and our driver getting pulled over by the police. We finally arrived at the Coronado Springs Hotel only for the hotel personnel to tell us that we would not be staying there and we would be going over to the Wilderness Lodge. So off we were, back into a white van this time with one of the Coronado Springs front desk employees driving us over to our new hotel. When we first walked in, the main lobby of the Wilderness Lodge is beautiful, with its tall timbers, and log cabin look, it really gives the feel of being out west. The Disney feel was there as I was trying to find the hidden Mickeyâ€™s in their dÃ©cor. There is a living room area over to the right of the check-in counter with a TV playing Disney movies that my daughter really liked. Check in was quick, staff was very nice, and our rooms were on the 7th floor club level with access to the Old Faithful Club with concierge service located right off the elevator. My room was one queen size bed and one set of bunk beds which my daughter thought was the coolest thing around. Rooms were exceptionally clean especially the bathrooms; housekeeping really does a nice job. The flat screen TVâ€™s in the room were also great to relax and watch some TV after a long day walking the parks. The Old Faithful club was the added bonus. My room was a few steps from this great kitchen area where we were able to have breakfast in the morning before going over to one of the parks. There was usually bowls of fruit, an assortment of cold cereal; (Cheerios, Fruit loops, Raisin Bran) bagels, muffins and other pastries along with coffee, tea and juice. This would close by 10:30 a.m. and then reopen about 11:15-11:30 with cookies, brownies, gummy bears etc. The Mercantile store downstairs in the lobby was great for any last minute souvenirs, and I thought it was great that they closed at 11:00 p.m. The quick service restaurant was also convenient too for snacks â€“ and they closed at midnight. I had two quick services left on my card the last day so I went to the Roaring Fork and used it for rice-krispy treats, cookies, etc. to bring on the plane for my daughter â€“ and just to use up the last meals I had left so they didnâ€™t go to waste. There is also a photopass desk across from the Mercantile store, that you can purchase pictures taken in the park. I thought this was a great perk as the photopass people are right there to help you with your picture selection. I do recommend doing the Mickeyâ€™s Not So Scary Halloween party in the Magic Kingdom. The parade that Disney puts on is the best, the headless horseman rides by pretty quick and if you blink or turn your head you will miss him. My daughter liked the trick or treating in the park after the parade was over, just certain attractions are open as you get another map of the parks with your wristbands. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and would definitely book this hotel in the future. If anyone has any questions, please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - We will return”
Reviews.Author: lindas0809
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for 5 days in September. We loved the hotel and will return. We had the added luxury of staying on the concierge floor which offered pre-trip itinerary planning and a great lounge we used daily. Our room was a standard room with two Queen beds. We had plenty of space with a large dresser and closet where we stored our luggage. The room was clean when we arrived and cleaned daily. We used room service and dined at the Whispering Canyon restaurant and both were great. Itâ€™s obviously the place to stay if the Magic Kingdom is your main destination because itâ€™s so close. We took both the boat & bus to MK and we never waited for more than 10 minutes for either. The buses to the other parks were very quick also. I was surprised by the negative reviews I read on this site and hoped for the best. We were blown away by the atmosphere and service.

Reviews.Title: “Into the Wilderness...”
Reviews.Author: thejackbox
Reviews.Content: My family was planning a trip to Walt Disney World, a total of 13 people including 5 children aged 3-8. Everyone else stayed at the Port Orleans-Riverside resort, a moderate resort. We've always liked the woody/outdoorsy feel, so the Wilderness Lodge was appealing, but it was a deluxe resort, so it was more costly. Luckily, it went on sale, so it wasn't that much more expensive, but I feel that we got a lot more for the money. The resort looks like a giant log cabin and you're greeted by a giant lobby when you enter the building. There's 7 stories to the resort and each side has a totem pole (The Eagle and the Raven). The floors are wooden and the resort gives a very open feel. There's a spring in the lobby which leads to a river outside which leads down to the pool. Check in was super-easy. We checked-in online, so everything was waiting for us when we got there and the online check-in line was easy to find. (In Port Orleans, it was harder to find and several 2/3 rooms were not ready at check-in.) We went up to our room and it was a "long" hallway that opened up to the sinks/vanity on the left, the closet on the right and then the room itself which had a queen bed and a bunk bed. The motif all stayed with the outdoorsy feel, with carved wooden animals on the bed posts and a beautiful carved headboard. The room was a little dark because there are 2 small lights at the head of each bunk bed and no overhead light on that side. Our room was 5061 which was in the corner of the courtyard which gave a nice view from the balcony. It had a large flat screen TV and sufficient drawer space for 2 parents and a child for 1 week. The one downside to the room was that we heard what sounded like a sliding closet door opening and closing all the time. We think that it was the service elevator that we heard because our room was next to the stairs and I believe there was a service elevator in there. It wasn't loud enough to keep or wake us up, but it was kind of annoying. The pool was great. There's a small kiddie pool good for toddlers/babies. There are 2 jacuzzis, one was set hot and one was set warm. The hot one is on the left with the pool to your back. The pool has lifeguards until 8pm and the waterslide closes at 8pm, but the pool is open until midnight. The waterslide is not huge, but you can get some speed on it. The pool is 3'6" at the exit of the slide. Beyond the pool is the walkway to the boat dock. You can take this boat to the Magic Kingdom or the Fort Wilderness Resort/Campground. There were a lot of bugs on the walkway, but out by the dock, it wasn't bad. At night, you can see the fireworks from the MK, but many of them are obscured by the trees. At 9:35pm each night, they have a floating electrical parade which was probably my son's favorite part. (We saw it 4 times!) Boats float out and there's music playing and they light up individually. You can also see it from the balcony area on the 5th floor and hear the music if you don't want to go down to the dock. Food options: We never ate in the Artist Pointe, so I have no opinion on it. The Roaring Forks is a "quick-service" cafeteria-style restaurant with some really good food. I think we had dinner there 4 times during our stay. We didn't get the $13 refillable cups, but many people did and seemed to fill up quite a lot. The flatbread pizzas were very good. The bacon double cheeseburger is HUGE! The fries were awesome, the pasta salad was just ok. There was plenty of selection to choose from. The Whispering Canyon restaurant gets a lot of press as being very good. The food was delicious! The bottomless milkshakes are awesome! (seven flavors including chocolate, caramel, bubblegum and cotton candy) It is pricey, so it's best if you're on the meal plan. Dinner for 2 adults/1 child ran around $90, not including the tip. They have various things going on while you're eating including a wooden pony race, sing alongs and call outs. Be sure to ask for some ketchup while you're there! Our first night we ate there, the food was good, but our waitress was awful, it took forever to get anything and they ran out of a bunch of stuff (including the milkshakes and iced tea). The 2nd time we ate there was more out of necessity than desire, but the experience was night and day. In the end, I would recommend the Whispering Canyon, but plan on possibly having to wait. Also, make your reservations early as they fill up quite a bit. A couple of odds/ends: The room has a small fridge and there's a microwave in the Roaring Forks, so you can keep leftovers. We also brought a giant bag of cereal, dollar store bowls and spoons and bought milk at the mercantile to not use up one of our items from the meal plan. We had so much food to eat that we didn't eat too much of the cereal, but did have our glass of milk in the morning. The resort has a pretty good store with touristy stuff in addition to bread/milk, etc. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. One item that we noticed different from the Polynesian (where the magical express went first) was that no one greeted us when we arrived, we were dropped off and then had to find our way in. It would have been nice to be greeted/welcomed. However, at the bus depot (off to the side, not in the front of the resort) where you took buses to the attractions, there was someone there to answer questions, so that was nice when 5 Hollywood Studios buses came, but no Epcot one. She called to find out where our bus was.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort with a homey feel!!”
Reviews.Author: wesch
Reviews.Content: This resort was fantastic. The ambience, pacific northwest theme, was really nice and inviting. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Bellman was quick with the bags -- in the room less than 5 minutes after checking in. The restaurant in the lobby, Whispering Canyon Cafe, was phenomenal. It's noisy, so if that bothers you, be warned. But the food, especially the skillet, was just great. There were a few minor things I wish the resort would change: the sinks in the rooms are situated pretty far back from the edge of the vanity. Not a major problem for adults, but it made it impossible for the kids to brush their teeth! We had to turn one of our carseats into a makeshift step stool for them, and even then it was a challenge. They should provide step stools in the rooms for the kids. Also, they only bring glass for drinking. Again, not a problem for adults, but a 4-year-old should not be holding a glass! After the first night (and first break), I left a note asking for plastic, but none ever arrived. We would've liked more shallow area in the pool so we didn't have to hover over our youngest, but that was a minor thing. The pool has a slide that my daughter LOVED. We would definitely stay here again. Oh.... a great shop in the lobby too!

Reviews.Title: “An attraction in itself”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastwahine
Reviews.Content: We stayted at the Wilderness Lodge in September. There were 11 people in our party and we all had a great time. I loved the Pacific Northwest theme. The theme started the moment we arrived at the front door and continued all the way down to the docks. The pool was absolutely incredible. They designed a fountain that originates in the hotel lobby and then continues into the outdoor pool. It was beautiful and provided a nice attraction and respite for my son from the activity of the parks. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My father in law used the services of the Concierge a few times with dinner reservations and found them to be very helpful. We loved everything about our stay at Wilderness Lodge and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: TheNanRedding
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from The Wilderness Lodge and it was PERFECT! Previously we have stayed at the Polynesian and the service at the Lodge was impeccable! From the beautiful view, the fluffy towels, incredible decor, mints on the pillows with turn-down service, the open and friendly staff, the great food, the fun pool area, our stay was the best! Can't say enough about how great it was (and we spend quite a few days each year at various hotels throughout the country). We re-booked on departure day, we loved it so much!

Reviews.Title: “Simply put - We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: JandAinAZ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending a week in the Disney World parks and stayed at the Wilderness Lodge Resort. We had a great time with absolutely no problems (except one not Resort related - see further down). We had arranged to use the Magic Express and had no problems in either getting our luggage or in our return trip. Our bags were delivered to our room within 2 hours of our stay and the Bell services came and picked them up the morning of our departure day and stored them for us for our bus ride back to the airport. Tip: Call Bell services (there is a button on the phone for them) to get your bags once they are packed and ready - they will not automatically come get them and will get there in about 10 minutes from your call so be ready to hand them over. As stated in many other reviews the lobby is awesome - be prepared to take lots of pictures I have seen some negative reviews for people staying there very recently and wonder what happened to them; The staff is EXTREMELY friendly - everyone we met in the resort and the parks The resort, grounds and room were spotless Our room was cleaned daily - housekeeping was there by around 9:30 each day because I bumped into them a time or two when leaving Sheets were changed daily - towels and wash clothes made into little animals. Our room was in great condition - shabby and outdated?? NOT! The pool was excellent with a water slide - water was chrystal clear and warm - my son, 3 1/2, LOVED the water slide..as did most of the children. Tip: The pool is open late, till midnight I think, but the water slide closes at 8:00 PM because this is when the lifeguards go off duty and it becomes swim at your own risk. This is also why the poolside bar closes at that time ( we did not use the bar but I seen some reviews complaining about why it closed "early") so if you want to use the slide, be aware of the hours. They might change with the seasons so ask a lifeguard to be sure. The beds were very comfortable in the room and we had a big screen tv (which we barely turned on) and a balcony overlooking the wooded courtyard and the lake.We had a queen sized bed and a bunk bed in our room and it worked out great with my son sleeping on the top bunk and us using the bottom for staging clothing, cameras, etc. The only reason I did not rate the room a "5" was that I think a deluxe resort room would be bigger. The room was defintiely a comfortable size but it being a bit larger would push it to a 5 but it was never an issue, this is purely opinion on my part. Tip: The room has a safe (very small maybe six inches deep) and a small refrigerator but no microwave. There is a microwave in the eating area of the Roaring Forks restaurant on the main floor which you could use if you needed to but you cannot heat anything up in your room (there is a coffe maker in the room though). Keep this in mind when taking home leftovers. I also listed value as a "4'. We got a great deal on the room during a special they were running - Defintiely look for these when traveling. If I was going to pay full price for the room staying there a week, I might look at one of the cheaper resorts depending on the cost just because it is pricey ( relative term of course) so that is why it gets a 4 not a 5. The Roaring Forks is a fast serve restaurant but the food quality is very good and good sized portions. It looked like some of the food ( pasta) was microwaved but the sandwiches were big and I watched them grill burgers, chicken breast sandwiches and make pizzes so the food is good. The main restaurant - Whispering Canyon - in the lobby is very good - it is loud but fun - it is SUPPOSED to be loud - the staff jokes and carries on with the guests - and ALL YOU CAN DRINK MILKSHAKES - 7 FLAVORS! Transportation around the area is well managed - Different buses take you to and from the various parks and at most there is one stop between the Wildenerss Lodge and another resort, both going and coming. The waitts are minimal. There is a boat that runs solely from the Wilderness Lodge directly to the front gate of the Magick Kingdom and back and is about a 7 minute ride each way. We used this several times. Tip: If you have a little one and are bringing a stroller - if it works for you bring an umbrella stroller - MUCH easeir to get on and off busses and boats. We had one and saw a lot of people wrestling with the larger types. Also it rains intermittently in Florida as the norm and in the parks you will be "parking" your strollers outside in the open while going on rides. Bring a cheap rain poncho or large plastic bag to throw over your stroller if it looks cloudy while you go on rides so you don't come out to a soaked stroller and belongings. We picked up ponchos at home at Walmart in the sporting goods section for $5 - they cost considerably more at Disney All in all a beautiful resort, clean comfortable room and great service Now - only "problem" as previously mentioned was dining in the parks and the resorts for sit down or "table service" meals - almost everyting was booked ahead..months ahead..long waits for openings without a reservation - if you could even get in at all at some places. Without a reservation be prepared to wait about an hour at some locations, this includes the Whispering Canyon Restaurant. TIP: Make reservations ahead of time and I mean days or weeks ahead if practifcal. If not, try the concierge desk at the hotel,,they really try but they are also using the same web based system you can use at home. best bet, go direct to the restaurant you want the day before if you can - they have much more control on-site than the concierge or you at your pc. We did this a few times at restaurants showing booked for the entire week and the people at the podium got us in the next day with a reservation or gave us times to come back on stand-by that were not crowded. Other than the first day or two of learning the "system" we had no significant waits for meals after this. Final "problem" you pay daily for internet acess in your room - we did not use it, we were on vacation ..so are you..hit the parks or the pools and enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: neslxcivic
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel to stay at. The theme is wonderful and it feels very at home when you walk in the place. The lobby is amazing and the totem poles were worth seeing. The rooms themselves I found to be clean with comfortable beds and nice televisions. The buses here ran a little slow while we were there. But having stayed previously at Caribbean Beach Resort it was nice to have just one bus stop. I would LOVE to stay here again. I think it is now my favorite Disney resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Wilderness Lodge, the perfect Disney experience”
Reviews.Author: mrsp81206
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a full week at the Wilderness Lodge and had read several of the negative reviews here on this site before our arrival. I have to say that I honestly have no idea where the negative reviews are coming from. I understand that there could be some debate about the use of the term "delux" however, the room we got was exactly what was pictured on the website and so I was in no way disappointed. The room was extremely clean and the view was fantastic. I was awed by the lobby and the staff were very friendly and efficent. There was some mix up with our reservation (got two queen beds instead of a king) but this was immedately taken care of and we were switched to a new room the next day without any type of hassel. We were able to store our luggage with them, go to the park for the morning and by the time we were ready to relax poolside the new room was ready to go and our bags were delivered within five min. It in no way impacted our day. I love the pool area, and thank goodness for the hottubs!! I was really impressed with the food at the quick service resturant... much better than I had expected. If you stay there make sure to see Kenny Durkin the characture artist in the lobby, he does great work and is very friendly... we had him do three different drawings for us! Overall it was a great vaction hotel and we were sad to be leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Tworottstown
Reviews.Content: We came to the Wilderness Lodge on a Disney package. We had a great first impression with the decor. It is beautiful on the inside and out. The room was comfortable and we had a nice view. It was clean. We had some issues at first with our park passes and dining reservations and the dining plan not being on our cards when we had gone to eat, but the staff at the restaurant and the lodge were extremely helpful and fixed everything we had an issue with. We loved walking on the grounds and the boat to the Magic Kingdom was quick and relaxing. We will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Still My Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Circletheworldby2020
Reviews.Content: Vacation at The Lodge was so much fun with my family. While I agree that it's time to renovate the property, It's still one of my favorite hotels. It's so secluded and fun from the rest of orlando, it truly feels like your in a lodge away from the hectic city. I hope they update soon... we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bearluvrAlabama
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge is a wonderful Hotel. It is so beautifuly designed and very authentic. The rooms are very clean and there was plenty of room for my family of 3. We took advantage of the dining plan. Great food and lots of it. My daughter (4) loved the pool and the slide. They have "fun" time by the pool every afternoon 3p-4p and the kids love it! This place is truly magical! We are planning our next trip and can not wait to go back "HOME"!

Reviews.Title: “Other Disney hotels more relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ABQfamilyguy
Reviews.Content: Staff is wonderful, as with every Disney hotel, but the walls in the rooms are paper thin. Do not use this hotel if you plan to wake early to take advantage of early monring hours, then return to the hotel to get some rest, then head out again to another Disney park in the evening. The reason: you will get no rest. Lots of kids, rooms with paper thin walls and afternoon pool dance parties will guarantee no rest in the afternoon at this hotel. Rooms dated but functional. Use the black-out shades because they keep the high-power floodlights over the pool area on all night. Have stayed at many of the other Disney Deluxe hotels and found them all to be more relaxing. Not giving this hotel a negative review, just know what your getting into when you select this hotel. Used my rental car to get to parks because bus and boat transport were inconvenient. Tried Wilderness Lodge because I thought it would be out of the way and quieter - I thought wrong.

Reviews.Title: “It was an amazing and relaxing vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChermanNorthern_VA
Reviews.Content: To sum it up - the Wilderness Lodge Resort was WONDERFUL!!! This was our first trip to this resort and there wasn't one thing we can complain about really. Arrival: Check-in was prompt. Our luggage was delivered timely. All of the staff were helpful and so nice and pleasant. Room: At first it was quite a let-down location wise. We had a standard room and looked out on the smokehouse and a swamp. Then we remembered that we wouldn't be in the room during the day much so stopped stressing about it. What stood out was at night when we were not at the Magic Kingdom to see the fireworks up close, we had a perfect view from our balcony and it was such a nice ending to our day. Our room was nothing spectacular really - nice flat screen tv I guess. We didn't receive any towel animals. We did tip but after the 2nd day, we realized nothing extra was going to happen so with the cost of the room being so pricey, we thought that we were already paying for them to do the basic cleaning and replacing our towels and it wasn't necessary to give them anything more. Restaurants: We only ate at Whispering Canyon and Roaring Forks 1x each but what we did have was good. We loved the refillable mugs especially since they offered tea and Coke Zero. Big plus!!!! Amenities: The pool was great. We usually came back in the mid-afternoon and it was nice to go out and swim. Since we were there the day after Labor Day until Saturday, it wasn't crowded at all and we had plenty of room to swim and relax. The boat ride was great and so efficient. We never waited very long. The bus to Hollywood Studios was quite long and it seemed like it took forever to get there but I guess that is the way of the bus system there. Overall, we would recommend the Wilderness Lodge. We had the opportunity to dine and visit other hotels and if our budget allows us, we will probably try anothe resort but if not, we would definitely stay at the Wilderness Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “As always, Great”
Reviews.Author: TrippperNewYork
Reviews.Content: We go to disney yearly and this is the best place to stay. Beautiful rooms and pool. They were easy to check in with and really helped us with the great rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Resort!”
Reviews.Author: jbhein91805
Reviews.Content: We visited the Wilderness Lodge 8/17-8/23. Overall the resort was as expected. The rooms were clean and there was ample space for 4. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a pool-view room. Housekeeping throughout the week was good overall; however, we experienced a problem the day before we left and it took housekeeping over 3 hours to get the problem fixed. We also experienced an issue with the shower faucet that was taken care of promptly by maintenance. We had the dining plan and only used the counter service restaurant 3 times over the course of our stay. My only issue was that it is very small for a hotel of that size and often it was difficult to find a table. The location was excellent and provided quick transportation to the Magic Kingdom and some of the nearby resorts. We used the bus service mostly after a nighttime trip by boat back to the hotel was plagued by tons of mosquitoes. Overall, I would definitely recommend this resort. Just remember, you are paying for location and convenience and not the size or comfort of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgiagrl
Reviews.Content: I am not sure where all the negative reviews are coming from. We stayed here first week of August and it was wonderful!!!! We are FL residents, and have stayed in over 10 disney hotels, value, moderate and deluxe. And this one is superb. The grounds are green and beautiful. We were upgraded for free from garden view to courtyard view. The workers were super friendly, and the room was very clean. This is now one of our favorite deluxe hotels, and I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great time at Disney World and WIlderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: luvztravel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night trip to Disney World - we stayed at Wilderness Lodge and loved it. Two adults and two teens (16 and 19). Location - Is fantastic. A boat trip to MK or a boat and monorail to Epcot. Bus service to everywhere else. Our room was in a great location - at the lake end of the 4th floor -overlooking the woods and pool area of the villas next door. Very quiet. Quick access to the stairs to get down to the pool and to walk to breakfast. Ambience - is nice. The wilderness theme is carried throughout the resort right down to the smallest detail!! Very warm and relaxing. The main lobby is quite spectacular and the views are wonderful. Restaurants - we ate at all three. We had breakfast everyday at the Roaring Forks. Yogurt and fruit parfaits and huge fresh muffins were yummy - but they also had fresh fruit cups, whole fruits, cerals, oatmeal and hot breakfast options. We had lunch there our first day when we arrived. It was great. Huge fresh made to order sandwiches and salad. Didn't have dinner there. The people working at the checkout were helpful and really pleasant. We had dinner at the Artist Point. It was lovely. The service was terrific and the food was really good. We had dinner one night at Whispering Canyon. It was very hectic - which was fun for the young ones. I wasn't crazy about the food choices. Not my favourite dinner of the trip. The pool area is really nice. A small but fun slide in the middle and lots of room to move around. There is another pool at the Villas next door and it is less crowded. There is a small wading pool, as well for the little ones. There are two hot tubs for late at night, if you like hot tubs. We ended our hectic days at the theme parks with a swim and beer by the pool - very relaxing. Rooms were kept very cleam by housekeeping. Fresh towels everyday and our linens were very clean. Really comfortable pillows and beds, as well. We leave tips daily (rather then at the end of our stay) and always have excellent room service. Our room was cleaned by noon every day of our vacation. I think that the rooms are starting to get a bit dated - but they were clean and ours was oversized - so we can't complain. Also loved to have that first coffee everyday out on the balcony with the paper. Very relaxing. Gift shop in the resort was really well stocked. Everything from bottles of wine to T-shirts. The games room was fun - lots of arcade type things to do. This was our first trip to Disney. We've managed to avoid it for all these years by travelling other places with our kids. However - we are super glad that we went and enjoyed every minute of it. Staying at the Wilderness Lodge definitely contributed to our excellent vacation. We don't plan to return to Disney - once is enough for us - but we would definitely recommend this resort to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money. Stay at another Deluxe resort if possible”
Reviews.Author: bubbler88
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 2 nights at Wilderness Lodge. As mentioned several times, the Lobby is a site to behold but the room we stayed in was musty, dark and showed lots of aging. The shower and water smelled and the staff, though not horrible, were not the most friendly I had ever encountered either. The Pool Bar closed during high bar time (evenings), the Geyser featured chipping paint at its base which made it less than appealing, the whole property was strewn with trash and frankly it was simply not "magical". I would prefer a value or moderate resort over this place. Some plusses were the Vintage Electrical Water Pageant at 9:30 PM on Bay Lake, the rooms were relatively sound proof, and there were constaly chances on seeing wild animals all over the resort (bunnies, ducks, etc...). A HUGE negative was the internet access....$10 a day for wired access.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: GA1111
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment. We arrived in the room (studio at the villas) and were disapointed by the small bed and TV, let alone housekeeping had a visibly dirty blanket on the bed. Internet did not work. The shower curtain rod was the old style not the newer half moon style. We had a short walk to the the main pain and again we were not thrilled with the activities offered. For dinner we ate at Whispering canyon and I did enjoy the meatloaf but breakfast was another story, the food was not great and all you can eat skillet very expensive for what you get. Better option would be to go to Ft Wilderness where the cost is less and you have a better selection. We would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: hoodfamily
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our Disney trip 08/29/09. I think I expected it to be much nicer than it was. The Wilderness Lodge needs some updating, and I did not think the staff was very friendly. The water in our bathroom stunk really bad. I complained to the manager and was told that it was just the way the water smelled. I did find that very hard to believe... my skin smelled after getting out of the shower! The sheets on our bed were never changed on our bed after being there for 1 week. The pool was nice, and the boat to Magic Kingdom was great! The lobby is beautiful, and they have great things for the kids to do.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Redcarfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 years ago at the Caribbean Beach and loved it. We decided to upgrade this year to a supposed 'deluxe' Disney Hotel. We were very disappointed. The entrance lobby is impressive but that is about it. The room was okay but was never cleaned before 3.45pm each day (just when you are returning from the parks) and so we ended up swapping towels with the cleaners in the corridor - so in effect our room was not cleaned half the time. When I complained the receptionist was dismissive and rude - folding her arms and quoting me how many rooms they had to clean every day. (No Disney magic here then).Some of the hotel staff were friendly but I found most of the reception staff unhelpful, arrogant and patronising. The access to the Magic Kingdom by boat across the lake was good but as stated in other reviews the buses stop at other hotels on the way so the journey can take up to 45 minutes to go just a couple of miles.I could go on about the lack of extra 'magic hours' but will concentrate on the hotel review. The Roaring Fork cafe was basic, very busy and serves microwave meals (including the burgers)! It was impossible to get booked into the main restaurant - 'The Whispering Canyon' until 9.30pm due to guests booking it solid 90 days in advance. That said on the one occasion we did dine there it was terrible - poor choice of menu and very noisy. The pool area is dated and in need of refurbishment. By far the worst feature of the holiday is the change in guests staying at Disney since we visited two years ago. In 2007 we met nice friendly people. Since the introduction of the free 'Disney dining plan' the hotel is now full of loud, greedy individuals who are obsessed with getting all they can to eat on their 'plan.' They are loud and their children run around the hotel unsupervised till all hours. Not what we expected from a 'deluxe' hotel and Disney need to do some serious re thinking. We enjoyed Florida but won't be staying at Disney again.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not book a room here!”
Reviews.Author: mom42Ohio
Reviews.Content: Please don't even think about staying here! Honestly, I cannot even fathom why some would say "best ever"...unless they've never been anywhere nice before! It's a total waste of money to be considered a deluxe resort. It is dirty, plain and simple, the staff is unfriendly right from the start at check in. The rooms are very dark and dingy, extremely small. Our linens had not been changed when we checked in...when we asked them to be changed, they acted like they can only do it every four nights! I wasn't going to sleep in a bed strangers had slept in, come on! The pool is gross as well with ducks sharing it...ducks who I assume are pooping in the pool while we swim! It's just plain gross and nasty. I can't say enough. PLEASE, just choose another hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: diamse
Reviews.Content: This was our 8th stay at Disney. We go yearly and decided to try somewhere new. Even though we knew it would be more cumbersome to get from Park to Park from the Wilderness, we booked there. We've always stay in the "deluxe" hotels. This one was the worst! Very SMALL rooms, unkempt rooms, peeling paint, dirty rugs, stained sheets, hair on the towels & bathroom, severely scratched walls - very dilapidated. The lobby & pool were fine. But our room was horrible. We complained and wanted a new room, but they were booked. They offered to switch us to another hotel, but ALL hotels were booked except the Floridian and the pain of having to repack and unpack and move hotels - missing out on Park time - wasn't appealing. So we stayed and paid high $$ for a bad room. I expected A LOT more from a Disney Deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: septembermom
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Disney World (many years ago), we stayed at the Wilderness Lodge. When we walked into the amazing lobby, we knew that we were going to have a great time at WDW. We decided to splurge and stay here again and we were just as delighted as we were the first time. The hotel has a great atmosphere. The rooms are a bit small - but were clean. We loved taking the boat to the MK. Our biggest complaint is that there are more stops on the buses. I don't remember stopping at both the Fort Wilderness Campground and the Grand Floridian on our way to the various parks. We also stopped at Water Parks. I realize that Disney wants to cut costs, unfortunately it now takes longer to get where you're going. We had a great stay and would definitely stay at the Wilderness Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Derryone
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Wilderness Lodge for 3 days at the end of July, with husband and 2 kids in tow (kids 2 & 4 years old). Booked it based on the reviews I had read, and have to say we made a great choice. The hotel was totally different to anywhere we had previously stayed and kept the kids entertained. We didn't make full use of the hotel facilities as it was the end of our 3 week trip, but what we saw and experienced would make us return soon. We were able to check in early with no fuss, and they did our on-line check in for our flights home. The transportation service was great, and the boat to the Magic Kingdom came in very handy at the end of night, considering the large numbers who stay for the fireworks. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and we can;t wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ReeciePeicie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disney Wilderness Lodge this past June for our honeymoon and it was a truly memorable stay. The lobby of the hotel is nothing short of breathtaking. From the moment we walked in, we were excited and impressed! We have stayed in Disney value and Moderate resorts and this hotel was worth the extra money! Upon checking in, we told the lady we were on our honeymoon and she congratulated us with some "Happily Ever After" pins and a room upgrade! The room was clean and designed to theme perfectly!! We really loved all of the details and "hidden mickeys" this hotel had! My husband got a kick out of looking for all of the secret Mickeys they had hidden at the hotel :) The hotel pool was great. The geyser was not working when we were there, but I imagine when it is it is pretty cool! There were 2 jacuzzi's which also came in handy after walking all day. I would suggest buying a suvenier mug from the take out resturant they have near the pool. It may seem like alot at first, but it allows you to get as much soda or juice from the fountain as you would like for free for the remainder of your stay. It's hot down there, we were always filling that thing up! We brought it to the parks too. While you cant get free refills with the mug at the park, we filled it with water from the water fountains. It was a good purchase! Lastly- If you have the chance, we highly recommend renting a boat or water racer... if even for a half hour! This was the highlight of our trip!! No special license needed as the boats don't go very fast. We took a 'Boston Whaler' out and it was so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: RN90
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just average. The rooms are dated, the carpet, bed skirt and wall papers need to be changed. The comforter on our first night had a strand of long, blonde hair (none of us are blonde). The overall service,though, is excellent. If you rely on eating in the hotel, they only have 3 restaurants, so for our 9-night stay, we'd take a taxi to go to other hotels to eat, for variety. The food at the restaurants are excellent, though. If you like the feel of a log cabin and country, you'd like this hotel. But if you want elegance, and money is not an issue, the Grand Floridian is a place to stay. If you are on a budget and like a modern hotel with lots of restaurant on site and does not mind the big crowd, The Disney Swan and Dolphin is a very nice hotel. The other disappointment with the Wilderness is that there is no dining with character! (unbelievable for a Disney hotel!). On the bright side, we enjoyed biking through the woods and I took my daughter for a camp fire with Chip and Dale at the Fort Wilderness Lodge closeby.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and great location for magic kingdom”
Reviews.Author: FERGIE88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated across the lake from Magic Kingdom so you only need to hop on a boat to get there and the boats leave every 15 mins which is ideal. If you want to go disney for the morning you can use the boat back then pick up what you need for your next outing! The staff are very friendly and helpful in the hotel and the food at the Artist point restaurant was excellent, kids will love the mickey mouse puzzle dessert! We didnt eat at the Canyon but the food looked good there too. We occasionally ate breakfast at the Roaring Fork which was adequate but if you had a car you could find countless places for breakfast outside the hotel which would be nicer. The pool area is very attractive and has a small slide which kids and adults loved. The constant presence of about 6 lifeguards around the pool was another great factor of the pool area. The only downside is that the characters do not come to the hotel for breakfast/lunch/dinner photo opportunities which would have been the icing on the cake for us. However we had a wonderful stay at the Wilderness Lodge and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Wilderness”
Reviews.Author: springerlover1
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews that are mostly positive. We have stayed at the Wilderness many times (and other deluxe hotels at disneyworld). The wilderness has been our favorite place to stay. We have traveled with our adult children and now come with our Grandbabies too. It is the BEST place to stay. The place is beautiful, staff is the best, food is wonderful and delicious. Our young Grandson has many food allergies and the cook came to our table before our meal and took the time out to find out what his allergies are and advised what he could eat. I cannot say enough about the Wilderness lodge. That first time you walk into the lobby it just takes your breath away every time you come. We are planning to come back July 2010 and we are counting the days. Everyone is looking forward to it. I do agree the rooms are a little small at the Wilderness, but how much time do you actually spend in the room? We have stayed at the Floridian (small rooms too) and you have to walk to the main building even in the rain, the Polynesian that is really nice with nice rooms, but again you have to walk to the main building even in the rain. We absolutely LOVE Disneyworld and we will be staying at the Wilderness again and again. Love having the room and the restaurants all in one building. Thanks Disney for doing such a great job!!! The LaBoda family

Reviews.Title: “As fabulous as we'd always hoped”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelAmherst_NY
Reviews.Content: We checked this place out 12 years ago on our last visit and hoped we'd get a chance to stay here. We had a room overlooking the pool and it was heaven. Staff is terrific, check in was a breeze, the food at Whispering Canyon and Artisans Point exceeded our expectations. The Territory Lounge was a delight. The gift shop had all our needs met between beer, wines, drinks snacks and other sundries. We'd only stay here. It is small enough to get to the restaurants and the bus terminal without walking till you're tired before you get to a theme park and big enough to imagine you are in South Dakota! 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort - Should be "Moderate" and not "Deluxe"”
Reviews.Author: Me215
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 5 days. As with most Disney Resorts, the grounds were impeccable, the service was great, and the rooms were very clean. As you might guess from the name, the theme is "wilderness" - so the rooms feature rustic decor. Things I liked: - Everything in the room seemed fairly new and clean. Our room had a very small (I mean, barely large enough for 2 people to sit side-by-side) balcony overlooking a wooded area. We did enjoy relaxing out there, though. - Housekeeping service was great. We requested turn-down service, and each evening they turned down the beds, left chocolates, replenished towels, and left us adorable towel animals! - The staff were very courteous and helpful. The front desk person did a great job of welcoming us to the resort. - The ferry service to Magic Kingdom Things I didn't like: - The ferry service to Magic Kingdom. :) Every time the ferry comes in or leaves (which I believe is every 15 minutes during the day?), they sound a horn. If we happened to be in our room relaxing between parks during the day, the annoying horn could be heard every 15 minutes. Not great for napping. - The famous geysers were not working at all during our stay - The hotel was nice but lacked the feel of elegance that is typical of other Disney Deluxe Resorts (Grand Floridian, Yacht Club, etc). I don't understand why this hotel is categorized as "deluxe" and not "moderate". Great hotel - as most of the Disney Resports are - but not any better than much cheaper "moderate" resorts. If you are looking for "deluxe" -- look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: tourist_or_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights with my husband and daughter (15) and we liked the hotel and the location. I booked a woods view room but was given a pool view room on the fifth floor overlooking the lagoon. It was great to sit on the balcony in the evening and watch the electrical parade. The room itself wasn't huge but it was big enough for three and it was cleaned every day. My only gripe with the cleaning was that the black coffee mugs had a thick layer of dust that had obviously been there for a while. The lobby is impressive but the look is spoiled by the location of Whispering Canyon. The pool area was very popular with families and the little kids seemed to be having a great time. There was entertainment by the pool in the afternoon which was rather loud if you just wanted to read a book and relax. The boat trip to The Magic Kingdom was very convenient and it was never busy. We had breakfast everyday at Roaring Fork and the quality and choice were very good. We also tried Whispering Canyon in the evening and although the food was decent everyone is encouraged to make lots of noise which isn't our style. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: shajijiji
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel for our entire trip last year.it was very pleasant.as our family has different allergies,room service was well taken care.very nice,ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge was Great for all ages!”
Reviews.Author: hledgewo
Reviews.Content: I want to say I was a bit nervous with some of the bad reviews I wasn't sure if it would live up to my high expectations. The place was great from start to end with only a couple of minor hiccups. There is so much I want to add but I will keep it short and sweet. We arrived early and I was surprised our room was ready (12:30 pm) with a great view overlooking the Magic Kingdom Cinderellas castle which we got to see the fireworks every night.
