I recommend getting a room with bunk beds if you have two kids. There was tons of room for us even though the room is really just a place to rest until your next adventure to one of the parks. Our housekeeper was great and checked with us to see when it would be a good time to tidy up our room. She even left great towel animals for us when we came back in the afternoon. Room service was fast and the front desk had a great scavenger adventure for the kids to find the hidden Mickey Mouse heads. The food at the Lodge was great and large portions to take back for later. The lobby is very grand and we regret not taking the tour which talks about all the details in the large area. The pools were great to include my girl being able to swim with the ducks that hang around. Keep your eye out for a couple rabbits which like to come out along the walking path. The nightly boat parade is something to enjoy along the beach with the family. The boat/bus schedule was great to get you to the parks in a timely fashion and only had one issue on a return trip back from Hollywood Studios where the bus didn't show up and we were offered a ride from another bus. We waited over 45 minutes with no luck and we arrived to hit two ride and get back to our room for Animal Kingdom. If you are on the Dining Plan make reservations way in advance or you will be eating late or not getting into a place you hoped for. Make it a point to do the HOOP DEE DOO Musical Review which is a great place for everyone. My teenage boy even liked it and ate his share and then some. Overall we got a great deal through the military which was well worth the money spent. If you want some advice about the parks, get the fastpass right away for the rides you want, go early to Hollywood Studios which was the most unpleasant of all the parks. You can only get one fastpass at a time until it tells you when to get the next one. Try to stay ahead of the tour groups. Great place and trip for everyone :)

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place We Stay”
Reviews.Author: sekarpenko
Reviews.Content: We absolutely enjoy every visit to the Wilderness Lodge Resort. It's the least expensive of the Deluxe Resorts and we take the boat right into the Magic Kingdom! With little ones, you want to be close to the Magic Kingdom with a short ride back for a nap or a little break. The decor is magnificent and the rooms are just right. We love the restaurants and the pools. What more can you ask for in Disney? We've been twice and will only book at this resort from now on.

Reviews.Title: “The great location, attentive staff,& beautiful hotel, made this a wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: kmi1123
Reviews.Content: I read so many reviews before choosing this hotel and I would like to add my own to assist others in picking which resort to stay at while vacationing at Disney World. First off the hotel itself is beautiful and the staff here are fantastic- we were upgraded to a bunk bed room with courtyard view free of charge upon arrival without asking and were also selected to be a flag family and receive a free continental breakfast afterward on the 7th floor concierge level. The location is great- we used the bus service almost exclusively and with exception to Downtown Disney and Animal Kingdom there was little to no wait for a bus and the ride was less than 15 minutes. The wait for the Downtown Disney and Animal Kingdom buses was a bit longer (about 10 minutes) and did take longer (30-45 minutes) to arrive at the destination but they are the farthest away from most of the resorts as well . They also offer a very quick boat ride to the Magic Kingdom which we really enjoyed. We were able to visit up to three different theme parks each day as well as returning to our hotel for a couple of hours in between using the Disney transportation system. Last year we stayed off site and found this to be impossible. The hotel also offers many special activities free of charge daily including cookie decorating, games, and prizes all free of charge. My family and I ( myself and my husband 35, son 15, daughter 09) really enjoied our visit and would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment! Disney making too many cutbacks.”
Reviews.Author: H0liday-Pe0ple
Reviews.Content: I'd read all of the positive reviews about this hotel so I had good expectations about this place. Don't get me wrong the lobby is fabulous but you're not sleeping in the lobby. The rooms are quite small for a deluxe hotel but my biggest gripe about this place were the midges and mosquitos. They were there in their droves. I wanted to watch the electric lake show but within 5 minutes I'd been bitten 15 times. I paid the extra to stay here for the balcony - sitting out in the evenings after a busy trek in the parks - well - in my dreams. If they didn't attack you on the balcony they were watching you through the patio doors, desperate to attack. My next big gripe was the room allocation. We booked with Disney and paid extra for a Wood View room. The first room we were given overlooked the bus stop and the edge of the car park - there were two trees. That was the wood. We asked to be moved. The next room they gave us was situated at the edge of the service area for the hotel. And when I mean service area I'm talking about the size of a Wal-Mart distribution depot. Not only was it huge and ugly; the large articulated lorries were delivering at 5:30 am in the morning with their reverse beepers going. I felt sorry for the standard rooms that directly overlooked that place. I would have left the hotel and gone somewhere else. So we asked to be moved again. They gave us a room 10 rooms away from that last one. We could still hear the service centre but at least we couldn't see it. We overlooked a swamp and some trees and the lake. The best thing about this third and final room was that we could see the Disney castle and fireworks through and above the trees. It was worth complaining but we shouldn't have to. Most importantly I cam concerned about the Disney service. It's going downhill. Some cast members are great but others......one cast member who was carrying the trash voluntarily gave some helpful information on events around the parks and then wanted a tip! He didn't get one but it made me feel very uncomfortable. One of the Captain's of the ferry boats needed to go to charm school but the others were fantastic and great. It's a shame that their colleagues let them down. One morning I went down to the main pool for an 8:15 swim...urghh..the pool was freezing cold and there were plasters stuck to the edge. The pool water was a foot below the top and not going through the vents and large bugs the size of scorpions were swimming away like this was just an extension of the lake. I was so disappointed. A deluxe hotel with a dirty cold unheated pool....will not be going back...the moderate Disney resorts are run better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rymorse
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2 night 3 day weekend trip to Disney World, staying in the Ft Wilderness Lodge. I cant say enough about how much I enjoyed this resort hotel. I did the Disney Online Check-In, so when I got to the desk everything was ready. It was a standard room booking so I was not sure what to expect, but after the trek to the room I was happy. We got to the room, and at first I thought it looked a bit odd. The bathroom was a walk in shower, and all 1 big open space with tile. There was ample room to move around, and we were on the ground floor (Room # 1154) so there was a patio looking towards the Villas. The large bathroom was because we were given a wheelchair accessible room. No big deal to me, it was nice to have the oversized shower! The bed (1 King) was comfy, and the room theming was nice. The bed lights were ingirated into the headboard and there were light switches built into the bed posts. We took the boat over to the contemporary one night, it was quiet and peaceful. Even with all the humidity and nastiness that is July in Florida, the boat ride was very nice and cool. We didnâ€™t use Disney transpiration to much, it was more convent to work on our own schedule and just take the car. Did however take a little round about way to goto EPCOT one day. A Boat to the Contemporary, then the monorail to the TTC and then the Monorail to EPCOT. (This was believe it or not faster then the BUS!). The one time we did use the bus was from EPCOT to the hotel. This was just after illuminations and the bus was packed. I expected as much, however our driver did not seem to bright. We were literally standing onto of one another, and she kept trying to cram more people in! After some mild yelling on the crowds part she stopped letting people on and left. Now driving from EPCOT in a car, even in traffic takes about 5-6min tops, it took the Disney bus 15-20 to go the same distance. I donâ€™t know if it was just this driver? Regardless of the bus situation, I cant wait to go back. It is a great hotel with so much to offer. (O and btw the pool is great for a late night swim!)

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful escape in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 3july83
Reviews.Content: We just reurned from a six day-five night stay at the wilderness lodge. We were in the Villas, so we had a two-bedroom suite. It was very enjoyable. The room was clean and provided all the amenities we needed. Sitting on the balcony at night, we would hear the tree frogs, and it was peaceful. We are Disney Vacation Club members, so we have tried other Disney properties. They were nice, but this was my favoritie so far. This was our first time using the dining plan, and it worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Everything went right!”
Reviews.Author: loudube
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 night stay at this resort and the whole family couldn't have been happier. We spent most of our time at the pool instead of the parks and the wading pool was perfect for our toddlers. The rooms are small, for sure, especially when compared to the Polynesian or the Contemporary, but it wasn't anything unexpected. Comparing the value of these rooms' rates to anything outside of Disney is kind of silly. You're not paying a premium for the rooms. The boats were a nice trip when we did go to the MK, but better yet was the bus ride back which took about two minutes with wait times never exceeding five minutes for either service. Our room was steps from the pool, yet still convenient to the lobby, restaurants, and even the laundry room. The surrey rides were short but fun and the jogging trail was convenient as well. The maid service was consistently good, even showing up immediately when we called when our child spit up in his bed. I didn't really like the set up of the Roaring Forks counter service If you wanted a cheeseburger but had to buy PB&J for the kids, it required you to wait in two separate (sometimes lengthy) lines. The menu was pretty limited as well and I still can't figure out why they don't have hot dogs! We ate at Artist Point and Whispering Canyon Cafe and they were both great

Reviews.Title: “Never again....not worth the money, not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: tandlu091400
Reviews.Content: We are currently still on our vacation at the Wilderness Lodge, I could not wait to pay $9.95 to use the internet to write this reveiw for those preparing to travel. Where to start, well---let's just start with the fact that our luggage was not "Magically" taken to our hotel as promised by the disney staff at the airport, at the lodge, or the manager. We did not see our luggage until almost the end of our second day. I did not appreciate how when we spoke to the manager, that we were told they had our luggage in their possession, only to get a call from AA to let me know THEY had our luggage, and what they should do with it. I had to go into the lobby store and buy clothes and bathroom items for my three children and husband. $300 worth. The hotel, well to start they sent up four tooth brushes and gave me a $20 credit for diapers for my toddler, who was in our room running around naked. It was not until we went downstairs and spoke to the manager face to face that they offered to comp us for our expense for the clothes. And let's not forget how the manager came out to us and gave both my husband and I the impressioon he was annoyed with us. The hotel is old and needs some serious updating. The cleaning is VERY poor. My son had an upset stomach and soiled the sheets (he's two). I took the items off the bed and put them on the floor, only to return that evening to find they took them and put them back on my bed. I was so annoyed! Internet---I am a work at home mom, with a need to check email. I knew there was fee ahead of time, but when I got here I found out that it is $9.95 for CONTIGOUS connection. I spend over $50 for internet. I don't even pay that much per MONTH at home. I can tell you aside from the wonderful staff at the Whispering Cafe, I was not impressed and will not return or suggest this to anyone I care about.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge...great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shopping4u
Reviews.Content: Wilderness Lodge was a great place to stay. We stayed in a one room with bunkbeds with a courtyard view. Kids, 11 and 8, loved the bunkbeds and towel animals. The resort pool was busy-and had a great slide. I am glad that I picked a Disney resort hotel because of the convenience of transportation and information. We were able to pack ALOT in within seven days. The boat ride to Magic Kingdom was a blast. Transportation to the WDW was convenient and much easier on my husband and I. At the end of the day it was nice to not have to track down a car or pay for parking--this is how I justified the price of the hotel. Roaring Forks was great and not quite as overpriced as Whispering Canyon. Consider a meal plan if you are spending alot of time at WDW but Plan WAY in advance and make all of your reservations at least 6 months ahead of your travel date. All in all I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Englewoodlian
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's the Parkitecture that transports you to the Pacific Northwest, or the boat ride to the Magic Kingdom, the waterfalls at the pool, or the view of the Electric Water Parade from your window at night - whatever it is, this is my favorite place to stay at Disney. I know it's more expensive than staying off-site and the rooms are kind of small, so do what we do, resort hop. Stay in the deluxe hotels only one or two nights of your trip. Visiting the resorts can be as much fun as the parks, if you do your research.

Reviews.Title: “This resort was not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: luvdisneyPrescott_WI
Reviews.Content: When we first saw the resort it was huge and very awesome. But after staying a few days (we were there 11 nights) we were very disappointed. Our room was not clean at all, I found slippers under the sink that we did not bring. Which made me believe that they did not even clean the room good before we got there. The help at the desk was usually good, but there were some people that could not understand english very well and you did not get full answers to your questions. This was our 4th trip to Disney World and I would not stay here again. The geyser was broke during our whole visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel poor service”
Reviews.Author: jdhill619
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge is a beautiful hotel and in a great location. The transportation to the parks not so great. Going to MK is easy whether you do boat or bus. Epcot is at least 30mins due to picking up other hotels and Downtown Disney is about a 30-40min bus drive. I really considered driving our own vehicle...the buses were not good. Our first night in the room we noticed the ceiling was leaking and could not believe the maid did not report that. We called down and someone came but said it was upstairs and never came back or anything...day two we complain again but hear nothing till almost 10pm at night when the manager calls and tells us we must change rooms now because of that leak in the bathroom. Two days without a shower in Disney is not fun. We were just about to put the kids to bed. After we packed up our room he said oh you could have waited till tomorrow. They said they would send up the new room keys and help us move...well nope that did not happen so my husband had to go downstairs to get the keys and drag all our bags by ourselves to the other side of the hotel. We did not get any apology from management or any compensation. The hotel itself is beautiful and the pool is great although very warm when its 95+ degrees out. I also talked to another lady in the elevator that also had trouble with her room getting the wrong type of room and had to wait to be moved so keep in mind the service is not that great at this hotel and be sure to check your reservations many times before you show up at the lodge. For the lack of service and the not so great transportation we'll be headed to another hotel for our next visit to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: winags
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for the first time in 1998. I remembered it being such a beautiful property, and it still is in the lobby and pool areas. However, the rooms are on par with a La Quinta at best, yet you must pay "deluxe property" prices. I would definitely not put the room quality on par with a deluxe hotel. I have stayed in much nicer Omni and Hyatt Regency rooms for much less, even in the Orlando area. We had problems at check in as our hostess was in training and did not speak very much English. For some reason they had our address, city and state terribly wrong, and I overheard other guests with the same difficulties. I was glad that our room was not near the open lobby area which seemed like it would have been noisy. Though we went during the "off season" the resort was sold out, but the transportation was very unreliable. Many times during our stay there would be several busses come and go to a few of the parks, but others would have one only every 45 minutes or so. They had also combined routes with other disney hotels and we had to stop at 2-3 other hotels before making our way to parks. I did not remember this from the last time we stayed at Disney in 2002. I thought each resort had dedicated park transportation. We also attempted to take the ferry to the Contemporary for a character meal, however, we had to wait nearly an hour and one of the boats that came during the hour was full with no room for other passengers. On a positive note, the lobby areas and pool areas are still fantastic, we enjoyed the water parade in the evening and the concierge was extremely helpful in getting meal reservations for us.

Reviews.Title: “EXPENSIVVVVVVE”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMusicMajor
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and not very clean. Found belongings under beds from previous people including children's dolls and disney trinkets. over prices, over crowed and ever so loud-

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge is "On Par" with other Disney Deluxe Hotels”
Reviews.Author: fafaaway
Reviews.Content: I'm slowly making it to each of the Disney Deluxe properties at WDW. As usual, this trip was with my wife and 2 year old twins. The rooms are almost identical in size, layout, and quality of similar rooms in the Polynesian and Animal Kingdom. The room has touches to make it feel "lodgy", like "carved" headboards with a wilderness scene on it. Overall, I found the rooms to be less quiet versus other WDW properties. For starters, the toilets have some sort of pressure boost on them that make them extremely loud. We were on a lower floor and heard toilets in adjacent and above rooms going at all hours (extra magic hours at MK meant people coming "home" at 2 and 3 AM). The other noise complaint I have is the frequent horns blowing from the boats taking people to the Contemporary and MK. I ate at the Whispering Canyon restaurant for breakfast and found it moderately entertaining. The scene is a quasi-western feed house (more like Wall Drug) and the characters do a lot of shouting and tom-foolery. It's very entertaining if you're the 5-15 crowd. My 2 year olds didn't get it. As an adult, I enjoyed some of the pranks that were played on other guests (like putting all the ketchup at one table then "making" them take it to the other tables on demand... was more fun than my description). Breakfast options include an all you "care to" eat skillet which contains pancakes, waffles, egg, sausage, bacon, and home fries. The food itself was good, consistent with other similar meals at other Disney resorts. The main swimming pool is decent. It's smaller than AK's. It's a standard entry (vs. beach entry) and in the main pool, I think the shallowest portion is about 3 feet deep. There's a short water slide. There's also a children's pool near by that is bowl shaped and is maybe 18 inches deep. The pool area is themed with a geyser/waterfall motif which creates some good visual interest. Bus transportation is available to all other major Disney destinations and to Downtown Disney (where you can connect elsewhere). There are 2 water taxis... one to the Ft. Wilderness campground & Contemporary hotel, and the other to MK. Just a guess, but it seemed like the taxi to MK runs every 20-30 minutes, or so, during the day.Personally, I preferred this aspect of travel to MK versus the bus system from other Disney hotels because it maintained the ambiance of being away from the typical hustle and bustle. Overall, I was very satisfied with the Wilderness Lodge and would definitely recommend it to others. My main complaint about toilet and boat noise wasn't enough to keep me away, but if I had a choice between similar WDW properties for a similar rate, I think I'd choose AK or Polynesian over Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: Canadian007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge June 13-20 2009 with our family of 2 children (6 and 2). We had a great stay and highly recommend this hotel. ROOM & FACILITY As mentioned in other reviews, the rooms are a bit small, but for our family of four, was fine. There was a refrigerator in the room (which was convenient) and it was cleaned every day. The maid even asked us when we expected to leave our room every day so she could plan for cleaning it before we would return. We had a "woods view room", two queen beds, with a view... on the woods. So not a lot of "view", but all the sound from the fireworks at Magic Kingdom at night and the boat arriving at the lodge. It was not a big issue for us, but if you are sensitive to noise, you may want to make sure you are not on the Magic Kingdom side. It is true however that you will have a fair view of the fireworks at night, across the trees, especially if you are at least on the fifth floor. Advice: if you want a room with bulked beds, or a view of the pool/lake, make sure to book your room as such. We booked our room through Club Voyage/Nolitour. The only room category they offered was "standard" and "woods views". The travel agent told us that "wood view" was the top category and we just had to ask for bulk bed/lake view on the file and it would be considered. This was incorrect information as they have many rooms categories. The type of room we wanted was another category that required a small additional charge. They were not able to updgrade us to a different category at check in because the hotel was booked solid. Our room was still very fine - but the advice is to check directly on Disney web site for the different room categories and not rely on your travel agent. The hotel has a very nice pool, I would say a bit small given the size of the hotel - so it was very crowded all day, but we could always find a spot. There is a convenient pool bar offering various drinks. You can get a life jacket for infants at no additional charge. Bicycles and boats are available for renting just by the "no swim" beach. RESTAURANTS We highly recommend Disney Dining plan - it saved us a lot of money. DO BOOK your restaurants in advance, otherwise you may not be able to eat even at your hotel's restaurant. We could never have a spot for dinner at the Canyon CafÃ©, even if we booked our restaurants more than two months in advance. But we did have breakfast there and it was very enjoyable, lots of humor, family oriented. We had dinner at the Artist Point - excellent food and service, but a bit over-priced. Note they will ask for two meal vouchers on the Disney standard dining plan. As others have said, the busy Roaring Fork is fine - but with limited menu options. TRANSPORTATION We found the Disney transportation service very convenient and reliable. The Wilderness Lodge is a 10 min. boat ride from Magic Kingdom. We never waited for the boat more than 10 minutes. So if this a first trip to Disney with young kids, probably one of the best spots in the area, beside the Contemporary, Polynesian and Grand Floridian directly on the mono rail. (But the Wilderness Lodge do come across as the best one for family with young children). The bus transportation service to the other parks is also very convenient. On our transportation to the Animal Kingdom, we waited for about 20 minutes - that was the biggest wait time we experienced. Advice: if you have an early breakfast reservation at the Grand Floridian (ie 1900 Park Fare character meal), take the boat ride to Contemporary and then the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay in Disney Orlando”
Reviews.Author: PA-PJ
Reviews.Content: We booked a 5-day trip to Disney and stayed at the Wilderness Lodge. What a terrific place to stay. Excellent ambiance run by very friendly and helpful staff. If you book be sure to ask for a room with The Woods view. It's the back of the resort and faces the lake and the wooded area. This resort has an excellent "upscale" restaurant called Artists Point. The night we ate there I had wild salmon and it was amazing--the real deal and not that farm raised junk from China. The resort staff was very helpful. We also used the Disney transportation and that was excellent. You can get to and from anywhere in the Disney complex by bus, monorail, or boat, but take the boat when you can. Nice ride, especially at night. I'm looking forward to visiting the Wilderness Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation at the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Renee1503
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for four nights. We had a standard room with two queen beds. The room was clean. It had an alarm clock with an I-pod dock which was a surprise. The refrigerator does not have a freezer compartment. The size of the room was the only con. There is not a lot of space to move around the room. The view from the patio was nice, but it is also small. The hotel staff were all helpful and extremely kind. They went out of their way to make our stay "magical". We ate at two of the three restaurants. The Whispering Canyon has a great atmosphere and the food was delicious. The Roaring Forks serves cafeteria style food. There was a wide selection of foods to choose from. We brought our own beverages from home, so we did not use the resort refilllable cups. I saw a lot of people lugging their resort cups around. The cups are not that big and you would have to continue to fill them. I think it was much easier to bring your own beverages considering the mugs cost $14 and the individual beverages were $2.75 each. We used the Disney Dining Plan and were very pleased with the amount and the quality of the food. The snack option comes in handy when you are in the parks and the weather is steaming. Trust me, Florida is extremely hot and humid in the summer. The pool area at the lodge is also nice. The hotel provides pool towels and life jackets. Transportation to and from the hotel is available via bus or boat. We enjoyed using Disney's transportation system. It was quick, convenient, and clean. The only down side is when some of the parks closed the buses, monorail, or boats were crammed with people. I suggest you take an extra few minutes if you are there when a park closes and wait for the crowd to disperse. The Wilderness Lodge is a wonderful place. Make sure you check out the lobby and the native American exhibits. The lodge also has an excellent arcade. It is easy to spot hotel employees because they all wear costumes. Don't hestitate to ask cast members for help. They were great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Disney Wildnerness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: 052510h
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really beautiful inside and out. The staff was so friendly. We were upgraded to the concierge floor which was a nice treat. Found the room to be clean and neat. Our room faced the Magic Kingdom and we were able to watch the fireworks at night from our balcony. We took the boat to Magic Kingdom and the bus to Epcot which was very convenient! We had a very enjoyable stay and would highly recommend this resort to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “It truley is a magical experiance”
Reviews.Author: Yellowstone39
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for 7 nights for our honeymoon. We had great service and everyone was friendly and talkative. Not only at Wilderness Lodge but everywhere else we visited in Disney as well like Downtown Disney, Animal kingdom, Magic kingdom, Blizzard Beach, Epcot, Fantasia Gardens mini golf and many more places. The service was great and the courtyard view was even better. There is so much to do for both adalts and kids. All around it was a GREAT and magical vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Deluxe standards”
Reviews.Author: rav4momOhio
Reviews.Content: I was very disppointed by the wilderness lodge. Not very friendly when we arrived. "park rangers"- customer service associates were too busy talking with each other to help guests. Room was dark and damp, very muggy and smelled like mildew. That was after we finally made it to our room even with online check-in. We had to wait 2 hours. Then, we were given the wrong room number - TWICE! Huge hotel to drag a tired toddler around to the wrong room. Staff in hallways very rude when we asked for help. Nice view from the room to bay lake but way too many trees to really view anything. After staying at the Yacht Club and having a true deluxe disney experience, I would reclassify this as a moderate disney resort. Mostly, due to the staff. Nice Property decor and beautiful lobby. Pool was boring compared to other disney properties, hot tub was broken and the geyser never erupted. Good access to Magic Kingdom via boats. Not worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Miss This Review-A Must Read!”
Reviews.Author: bacaporale1
Reviews.Content: we returned from a family vacation on May 22-29. The location of the hotel was great, under 10 minutes you can be on the ferry and over to Magic Kingdom. If your room faces the MK, you can even see the fireworks. The previous review mentioned the housekeepers coming on off times, which they did, but we were one all day anyway, so who cares. The pool was great. Our 6 yr old had just as much fun there as the parks. Funny how kids are. Checkin was really easy, when we checked our bags in Baltimore, we didnt see them again until they delivered them to the room-very convenient. It was about 2 hours after we got to our room that our bags arrived, but it was worth not having to lug them allover. Checkout was fairly easy too, we checked our bags at the hotel and picked them up once we arrived at our home airport. Food-In wilderness lodge is not bad-the quick service-is just that, quick and simple. notinh too extravagant, just gets you in and out and on your way. The restaurant wasn pretty good, cowboy themed. Some meals served in skillets like the western days. now the food inside the parks, at the sit down restaurants were always very good. Do yourself a favor and get the Disney dining plan. Each person gets 2 snacks, 1 quick service and 1 sit down a day. Plan your sit down meals in the parks you are going to be in that day-makes it alot easier! i cant even imagine how much $ we would have spent on food. Also, plan character meals for your kids so they can meet the characters. The kids love it and it also saves you time in the park-you donthave to stand in line to see the characters and get their pictures-you get that at the dinners or breakfasts. Try the Cinderella dinner at the Round Table resurant or The breakfast with mickey and friends at animal kingdom-great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and a great location for families.”
Reviews.Author: lbmesq
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at the WL and it was our second visit. I have stayed at all of the deluxe Disney resorts and the WL theme is simply spectacular. Our room was located on the 5th floor and overlooked the pool and Bay Lake. We were able to see the MK fireworks and the electric parade. I thought the room might be noisy due to the pool, but not at all. Since I have stayed there previously, I knew where I wanted my room to be located and the staff accomodated all of my requests. It was a little disappointing that the geyster was having a "geothermal" malfunction for our entire stay and never worked, but that certainly didn't deter from the resort. Mousekeeping was fine, but could be brought up a notch. Admittedly, I may be picky, but there were cobwebs on the ceiling that blew from the wind from the ceiling fan and a straw wrapper stayed on the floor between the nightstand and bed for 7 days. I did have to request another bar of soap since it wasn't replenished and it was brought up immediately. We went to all 4 parks and the transportation via bus and boat was excellent. We never had a long wait and all transitions were seamless. It was always lovely to wait for the boat and look at all of the wildlife on Bay Lake. We also used the Magical Express and that worked out fantastically. Probably our best experience with taking it was this trip. Our luggage arrived in our room within 3 hours of landing in Orlando. We also arrived at 9:30 a.m. so I suspect if you arrive earlier in the day, you have a better chance of your luggage being delivered more timely. The pool does tend to get a bit crowded but the lifeguards on duty were right on top of everything going on in the pool. My 4 1/2 year old daughter loved the rock slide! Whispering Canyon is great for kids and the Roaring Fork is fine for a counter service restaurant. They do have a selection of healthy choices as well as some not so healthy! Overall, this is one of our favorite places to stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay at WL again. We took advantage of the promotion of staying 7 nights and paying for 4 and it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE !!”
Reviews.Author: Debccorbitt
Reviews.Content: We visited the Wilderness lodge May 23-30. My husband used one of the black coffee cups(In the room) to soak a dental appliance . I happened to remember an investigative report on our local TV about how the room attendants would just wipe out glasses and cups with the same cloth they used to clean the bathroom and put them back as if they had replaced them with clean ones. So I marked the white rim on the bottom of the cup with my red lip liner pencil , a vey small line ,maybe an 8th of an inch and laid it on its side in the sink..We left that morning and went to the Magic Kingdom ,I was SHOCKED when we came back to the room that evening and found that same cup(with the red line) wiped out and sat back on the shelf on the paper coaster by the coffee pot . I immediatly called housekeeping , they had a manager call me back, she apoligized and said that was not up to Disney standards, I told her with all the children staying in the Lodge and the swine flu and other diseases going around that was TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE. I also said if that happened in my room it was happening over the entire LODGE. She said the room attendant(Madese) would be reprimanded. The next day I received a box of chocolates and a generic note saying have a magical vacation. Needless to say we never drank from the cups or glasses in our room . I did not hear another word from anyone at Disney .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with only minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: Lefty33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 5/9-5/16. The Good: 1. The place has to be Disney's best looking property overall in terms of grounds, rooms, restaurants, it has the whole package. 2. Waits for buses/boats were minimal. We never had to wait more than ten minutes for the next one to come. 3. The bunk bed rooms are perfect for families with children. The Bad 1. Housekeeping would just show up at very random times. One day they were knocking on the door at 8:45am and then another day we came back for our break/nap time around 3:00pm and the room had not been serviced and no one ever came until we called. 2. Roaring Fork is a nice place for sandwiches and snacks but changing the menu a little more often would be great. 3. The front desk/concierge staff was clueless the couple times I had to interact with them. I checked in online and walked to the appropriate line at check in just to be waived over to the regular line and after giving my name and confirmation number the desk clerk huffed and had to walk over to a stack of paperwork in the online check in line where I started. I also asked for the appropriate number to call so that I could order my daughter a birthday cake so we could have it at the Whispering Canyon Cafe at Dinner. Well 4 clerks, three wrong numbers, and almost an hour later they finally found the "cake hotline" number. Overall Wilderness is wildly expensive and I doubt I could justify the expense without buy 4 get 3 deals from Disney. But that said the hotel is immaculate and it's not stuffy and pretentious like Grand Floridian or dumpy like Contemporary. For families with some money to spend this place is the best.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Anneversary”
Reviews.Author: Silverstereak
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and Stunning Lobby. Have always loved the look of grand mountain lodges and this one captures them in all their glory. Impressive, Overwhelming, Beautiful, Relaxing, somewhat off the beaten path but that adds to the charm. Mousekeeping was impecable, leaving towel animals and turndown service for us. we were on the first floor adjacent to the pool. Would highly recommend the Wilderness Lodge Tour and sign up for Flag Family, unbeleavable views from the roof. It was fun and relaxing to come home each night of our 17 day anniversary to our room. Fabulous restaurants, especially the Wild Bore at the Artist Point. Save up so you can stay here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: hoteluserNottingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a fortnight in May and will only ever stay at this disney property in future. The staff are fantastic, nothing is too much trouble. The rooms and location really couldn't be better, the Wilderness Lodge made our Disney holiday truly magical. The longest we ever waited for a boat or a bus was 10 minutes, and that was on a bad day, usually there was transport within minutes. At all the Parks for the journey back, the Wilderness Lodge appeared to be exceptionally well serviced by buses. Artist Point was outstanding, I really would recommend a meal here. I know you pay more to stay here, but you won't be disappointed, the Guards at the Gate say "Welcome Home" each time you return, and believe me, home is what it will feel like, you won't want to leave!.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovedisneyOhio
Reviews.Content: The lobby is absolutely breathtaking. We had a very easy check-in on Mother's day, our room was very clean and ready when we arrived at one in afternoon. The pool was clean but could of been a little bigger. The grounds were very well kept and beutiful to look at. We were on the fourth floor and yes it was quiet. The snack bar was nice but maybe they could of changed up the menu every few days we were their a week. The buses were a little slow in coming and going and it makes a stop at one other hotel, but when your on vacation are you really in a hurry?

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at Disney Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: lcaughey
Reviews.Content: Nightmare at Walt Disney World I am staying at the Disney Wilderness Lodge, in the Disney Vacation Villas portion. The dates are May 22 - 29, 2009. I have reserved two units and it has all but ruined our vacation. A Motel 6 would have been better. First, it doesnâ€™t matter what you pay, or even if you exchange through RCI, you will not get the extras the Disney Vacation Club members do. Be prepared to be put in whatever leftovers other people have thrown up from, because it left such a nasty taste in their mouth. Thatâ€™s right folks, why bother. Do yourself a favor, if you want to do an exchange go down the road and stay at the Marriott or Hilton Grand Vacations. Second, donâ€™t come with children unless you have trained them to â€œeat on cue.â€� You can not eat in ANY restaurant at the Disney Wilderness Lodge, Contemporary, Polynesian, or the Grand Floridian without a reservation. Pardon me, but I should have known this. I expected to need a reservation at a â€œCharacter Mealâ€� and/or specialty restaurant, but PLEASE, every restaurant? The only other option is what I consider to be a daily â€œjunk foodâ€� diet from the snack bar i.e., hamburgers, chicken nuggets, fries, etc. If you like to give your kid a sugary soft drink, you have it made. For about $14.00 you can buy a special cup and your kid have all the soft drink refills they want (not milk). They do have low fat milk and juice you can substitute for a soft drink at each kids meal. You can also substitute carrot and celery sticks instead of fries at each kids meal. A great selection for every day of the week! Third, drive your car if you are staying here and donâ€™t like the above mentioned food idea. You will need access to a real grocery store. We have been living off frozen diners, bagels, and condiments. This is the first review I have ever written. I have been to Disney multiple times in my life. I stayed at the Contemporary about 15 years ago and it was wonderful. I guess the world of acquisitions and corporate mergers does not always result in a pleasant experience for the vacationer. I have talked to the employees and believe me the money is not going to them. The employees are afraid to tell you what is going on but it appears there have been too many personnel and resource cutbacks (only two rolls of toilet paper a week for a family of four) to handle the load. Further, the employees must put up with numerous abuses from poorly behaved adults, and occasionally children, and still be able to say â€œHave a Magical Day.â€� One piece of positive advice, if you are not afraid to complain, you might even be able to get things quickly replaced that came with your broken with your room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, lots of fun for kids, great proximity to Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: TrpReviwr
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (including a 7 month old baby and a 4 year old girl) stayed here for a week in May, 2009. Having stayed in the Animal Kingdom Lodge previously, we were very pleased with our choice and noticed many similarities to that hotel. The Wilderness Lodge was stunning, the theme was great, and the grounds were beautiful. Every employee we encountered at the hotel was kind, professional, and helpful. The proximity to the Magic Kingdom was a big plus for us with the 2 small children. There was a short (8 minute) boat trip from the Lodge to the Magic Kingdom and we never seemed to wait more than 5 minutes for the boat to arrive (either at the hotel or the park). Like other Disney hotels, the rooms themselves were fairly small. It was sort of a tight fit for the 4 of us, but we made it work. We had one of the bunk bed rooms which worked out well. We had the 4 year old sleep in the bottom bunk, hung a blanket from the top bunk, and gave ourselves a bit of privacy. We brought our own travel crib for the baby, but Disney does offer these if needed. The housekeeping staff did a good enough job, and the linens were actually pretty comfortable! The hotel room was not especially clean, but it wasn't too bad either. Overall a good choice for a family. Next time we would consider one of the 1-bedroom villas. We had a courtyard view. We were often in the hotel room fairly early (with the 7 month old). Every evening Disney put on a short (about 15 minute) water parade on Bay Lake which was quite loud inside the room. It never seemed to bother the kids though. I guess this is one of the things that goes with being so close to the park!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of tips to get more out of your stay here!”
Reviews.Author: heatherjp
Reviews.Content: I have loved this resort in the past, but you can really sense the demise of Disney....due to corporate greed. The staff are unhappy and very phony. Service is "alright" at best. You really need to bring your own joy to a Disney vacation these days...you won't find it there. The vast majority of people visiting Disney these days are obese or unhappy. We saw SO MANY people in people-movers because they were either obese or disabled. It was sad to see. It was very reminiscent of the movei Wall-E. We saw so many parents yelling at their children and eachother. My husband and I came to the conclusion that our own town and community was more "Disney" than Disney World is. I honestly used to love Disney and it was a tradition for our family for a little while. Our children are about to turn 5 and 9 though so I doubt we would ever return. The pool at this resort is a lot of fun and very beautiful...do not eat at the Whispering Pines though! The staff are obnoxious and loud...it is not the place to relax after a busy day at the parks! It is supposed to be all "cutesy" and festive but it is just rude and annoying. A tip.....go the the Territory Lounge with your family and get a fun drink or two and some nachos and snacks! It is a great atmosphere, very peaceful and a great deal in comparison to the other options! At Artist Point a meal costs about $30 or up! Even on vacation that seems silly to me!And you will pay just as much for everything at the busy little Roaring Forks cafeteria. In closing, if you want a Disney vacation, the Wilderness Lodge is very beautiful....but stay by the pool and relax as much as possible! Don't wear yourself out...it will make the vacation fly by and you'll be too tired to really enjoy it! Also...Cub's Den is a nice option for childcare when you would like a few quiet hours...perhaps some time in the hotel room and a cocktail at Roaring Forks! That was what we did as we felt safe being in the same building as our children...and it was only for 2 hours. (They have a two hour minimum) Also...ask them not to give the departing gift to your kids!!! It is a bag of junky candy....and will keep your kids up late! We were very angry with them for giving our kids candy late at night! Another tip...ask for a room on the fifth floor facing the inner courtyard/pool/magic kingdom. These rooms have lovely balconies and you can enjoy the fireworks...even though they claim you can't see the fireworks...trust me you can! :) Enjoy! One more tip! The 7th floor club level doesn't have as nice rooms (in my opinion) but they do have lots of complimentary food and a beautiful , peaceful lounge to eat and relax in, so if you spend the extra for the room, you may save money on food. We never bought any food AT ALL while staying on the 7th floor...but really missed our 5th floor room. Maybe you could find a room with a similar courtyard view on the 7th floor ....and that would be perfect! Our room assignment faced a service area and the balcony was so buggy that you couldn't enjoy it. And the balconies on 6th and 7th floors have a high barricade that makes it hard to enjoy the balcony. Another tip! Focus on Epcot...we found it to be the cleanest, most fun and most relaxing this time around. And Blizard Beach is great (not Typhoon Lagoon) but make sure you go when not crowded..preferably a weekday and towards closing time. We went on a Saturday and it was CRAZY! A man ripped a floaty raft out of my 4-year-old daughter's hand....and it was so crowded with locals that you could barely move. We stayed till closing one cloudy afternoon weekday though and had a blast! Try to slow down and breathe deeply while at Disney and don't get sucked into paying too much for food and merchandise just because you are too worn-down! And buy your kids the $16 water sprayer fans the first day! They are pricey...but we broke down on the last day of our trip after the kids begged for them all week, and they really do feel wonderful and make the kids sooo happy! Heat exhaustion is a real concern, and these protect against that a bit!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but transportation NOT so great”
Reviews.Author: IndianaKris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge the week after Mother's Day. We had the special Disney promotion, buy four nights, get three free. That is the only way we could afford this hotel. The lobby and grounds are beautiful. And it really does have the FEEL of being in a National Park Lodge. The stream and waterfall sounded so peaceful (when not drowned out by the sound of excited kids!). And we paid for a wood view room but were upgraded to a courtyard view room. Our balcony overlooked the creek and you could see the pool and the lake and the geyser. Don't leave your balcony door open. We had it open just part of the way for fresh air and a crow came in the room. Before we could get it out it got sick and left a mess. It scared my daughter! They are very bold. And be prepared to share the pool with the ducks. They aren't afraid of people either. Of course, if I were a duck, this is where I would hang out also. The room itself was very clean. And the beds were comfortable. I do think Disney ought to get fitted sheets. But at least the sheets were long enough that you did not wake up without a sheet under you. But the sheets were also kind of rough. The shower did not have much force and the water would not turn off completely. And the toilet seat was loose. But the room was overall nice. There is a little more room than at the moderate hotels, but not a whole lot more. Mousekeeping did a great job and left us many towel animals the first part of the week. Then that diminished as I think we had a new mousekeeper. But they did a good job of cleaning. They did not do a good job of replenishing the shampoo. But they did replenish coffee and everything else. The staff was all very friendly. Roaring Forks is very small and very limited in what it serves. But it was usually not too busy and it made for a nice quick meal. But they did not have nearly as many food selections as other food courts, such as at Port Orleans or the Contemporary. IT was mainly sandwiches, soups, salads and burgers or chicken nuggets. I would have loved something more substantial offered here. But it was always clean and a good bargain with the refillable mugs. The hotel is very large and it was a long, long walk from our room to ROARING FORKS. And after a day of walking at the parks, it was not fun to have that long walk to the restaurant. We ate one time at THE WHISPERING CANYON and it was wonderful. They had you dancing and singing and the staff was a hoot. Charlie the host was amazing. And make sure you ask for ketchup! They also have free refills on their milk shakes...and they are home made ice cream and very, very good. The food was also very good there. That was our best meal during the whole trip. Kudos to the staff of the whispering canyon. We were there during an unbearable early May heat wave. Temps neared 100. So the parks were not as much fun as during cooler times and were surprisingly much busier than I had anticipated. We saw tons of school groups. So keep that in mind if you go in May. My biggest complaint was with the bus transportation. Others have said the wait was not bad. But we waited one time forever and saw bus after bus go by for other parks, but not for Epcot. And then they do not just go straight to Epcot. Each bus at Wilderness Lodge also goes to either Fort Wilderness or the Grand Floridian. AND it can take forever to get to some parks. Plus we accidentally got on a bus that went ONLY to Fort WIlderness from DOWNTOWN DISNEY and we spent a ton of time lost in Fort WIlderness. We finally flagged down a bus and the driver literally yelled at me. The worst thing is the Magical Express which I now call Miserable Express. They assign you a time three hours before your flight. You need to check in two hours early at Orlando Airport. So we were assigned 9:05a.m. but told to get there fifteen minutes early. We did get there early and waited for twenty minutes. Then it took time for the driver (who was very NICE) to load all the luggage. Only some airlines allow check in of baggage at the hotels. So many had luggage to store. It was about 9:30a.m. by the time the bus pulled out of Wilderness Lodge. So we had been there 45 minutes just waiting. We needed to be at airport at 9:55a.m. Well the bus driver then told us he had to make two more stops...the Grand Floridian and the Polynesian. He also said the bus had 51 seats but that they had put 59 on this bus assuming some would not show up. Who would not show up for their ride to the airport? Bus was packed. IT was 10:30a.m. by the time we made it to the airport. Then we had to carry our luggage up to another floor to check in at Southwest...where about 100 were in line before us. We literally got the last two boarding passes for our flight. It should not take an hour and a half to get to the airport. And why tell us to be there fifteen minutes early? I was so sick of bus transportation after this trip. My advice to you is to get a car. SO I say the WIlderness Lodge itself was great. The room was very nice. And I would love to stay there again. But I would get a car and avoid Miserable Express and the bus transportation to the parks. The boat to the magic kingdom was nice, but could get very packed at times And this was not during a so-called busy time. It is fun to watch the electic water parade at night. And if you had a room on the other side of the lodge you could probably see some of the Magic Kindgom fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: tkljam
Reviews.Content: Definitely not what I expected for $250 a night. Small room....loud neighbors...LONG walk to lobby...It was not a DISNEY experience!

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: global-engineer
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Wilderness Lodge, and we would happily return. We spent Spring Break week here. This was our second stay on the Disney Property. Perviously we stayed (once) at the Carribean Beach Resort, and several times off-campus in Lake Buena Vista. In our book, the Wilderness Lodge beats the Carribean hands-down (but it is more pricey...) We were not planning to stay on campus this time, but we got a last-minute deal on the WDW web site -- basically paid the off-season rate for this busy week. The kids especially liked the pool, and the bunk beds. We all liked the lobby and the theme. We also liked the proximity to the Magic Kingdom. We were a bit worried about the timing of the boat launch to the MK (as opposed to a monorail resort), but we found it to be about the quickest form of transport in WDW. From our room o the MK gate or back was never more than 20 mins total.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Get Away!”
Reviews.Author: jereca74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April of this year. It was a very nice place. We really liked that it was very quiet and cozy. The place felt like a mountain retreat we see often in our home State of California. The pool areas were very nice, with a small wading pool for the very little ones. They had a beautiful white sandy beach area for sunbathing and napping. But there was no swimming in the lake water. But no one seemed to mind. It was so beautiful. April was a great time to go as it was really nice weather! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Howdy Pardners - wholesome camp at the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the wilderness lodge for 4 nights. I booked and get a king bed standard room with a courtyard view - and was in the "bearface" - very close to the elevator and facing straight down to the pool and the lake. the hotel has a wilderness theme - the Disney staff told me that it's story was the frontier people heading west discovered a fresh water spring and they camped next to it - eventually building accommodation for other travellers to also stay and refresh. It looks absolutely stunning - you've all seen the pictures - the HUGE foyer, the carvings, the fireplace, the light fittings etc - heavily themed - and thus a favourite with families. the hotel was opened in 1994 so a few things a bit beaten around the edges but it is mostly in good condition. My room was clean and everything worked. Toiletries limited to shampoo, soap, lotion and conditioner. Towels are good. GREAT location - buses to MK are a few minutes, the boat ride is really nice. Kids LOVE the Whispering Canyon Cafe - the servers take on roles of those original pioneer folk. I used the valet service - very prompt and no problems. got towel animals on 2 mornings. I did not eat here. the one strange thing was that the bottom sheet on my bed was a foot short of the end of the mattress - I have never seen this in my life - so when I pulled back the top sheet the last foot of the mattress was hanging out! Has a little mini fridge but no mini bar. No fresh or UHT milk - but you can buy this at the Mercantile or the Roaring Fork shop. typical disney - NOTHING is free - paid $10 / day for an internet cable (where is the wifi??) No business centre - I couldn't find any casual computers or internet access. This Hotel is really popular with families and the pool was very busy - the hotel was full on the weekend and Disney bumped my friends DOWN to Port Orleans! the staff are not intrusive. the rooms were well soundproofed and I'm reasonably happy. Way expensive - but you are buying being on resort. Nothing was the best - it was all above average though

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort, average service”
Reviews.Author: oasisannie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wilderness Lodge for 7 nights with my husband, myself and two kids, ages 6 and 3. The hotel and pool area are truly amazing. Kids loved the pools (large pool with slide, kiddie pool and two hot tubs). Even when it was crowded, we were able to find a lounge chair to drop our towels etc. The kids loved the ducks that swim in the pool along with the guests. The pool bar was ok, but a limit of two drinks per person seemed a little strange and we observed several people getting aggravated that they couldn't buy three or four alcoholic drinks at a time. Often there was only one bartender on duty and the line was 4 or 5 people long and it took 15 minutes to get a drink. We also thought it was strange that you couldn't get food at the pool bar. (only small bags of chips available). If you want "real" food, you have to go indoors to the Roaring Fork cafeteria and bring it out. Fortunately for us, on day one, the bartender told us about the food at the Territory Lounge which was so much better. A little further to walk, but definitely worth it, especially at night. The pulled pork flatbread is absolutely delicious! Overall though, most employees are just average, and not the least bit interested in helping. Example: we paid for a room with a courtyard view and had to go back three times to get what we paid for. When they finally gave us a courtyard view room, it was on the 6th floor with a really closed-in balcony. When you sat in the chairs on the balcony, you literally were walled in and had absolutely zero view of anything. It also was dangerous since my kids kept climbing up on chairs to see over the solid balcony wall which was freaking me out. We finally got a great room on the 5th floor, but it took some work. Also, no one told us that life vests are available for FREE for little ones for the pool. Just go to the boathouse where they rent jet skis and sign one out and keep it for your entire stay. Very convenient, but we had to find it out for ourselves. When checking out, I asked if there was someplace where I could get online to print our airline boarding passes, and was told by a woman at the concierge that the closest place was at another resort, the Contemporary. Another clerk overheard me and called me back and was able to get online for me and print the boarding passes, which the first person was completely unwilling to do. Very odd. If heading to Whispering Canyon Cafe, try to ask before you are seated for a waiter who will have some fun, especially if you have little kids. Our waiter told us point blank that they've "really curtailed alot of the silliness because it was getting old" but several other waiters were still doing all the fun and silly stuff so our 6-year-old was very bummed. Our waiter, Bob, was the pits. And yes, I did speak to the manager to let him know. After reading all the stuff about small rooms, we didn't really have an issue with them at all. The bathroom area is a little awkward, but we were four people for seven nights and had no problems. The ferry rides to MK are fantastic...a really great way to start and end a day. Never a long wait and definitely more fun than the buses. The onsite store has a great selection of gifts and snacks. The Roaring Fork has great breakfasts, especially for kids. We got two pancakes, two slices of bacon with butter and syrup and a drink of milk, juice or water for only $4.99 and the lunch selections come with a choice of fries, baby carrots, fresh grapes, jello or pudding. It really filled them and gave healthy alternatives. The free movies on the beach are fantastic. They show a Disney movie every night on the beach and you can see the fireworks from MK and the Electric water parade from the same location. Absolutely fantastic and my kids were blown away. Also, we highly recommend www.gardengrocer.com if you want to pre-order groceries and have them delivered to the hotel for a fee of $12. This was so great for us since we ordered diapers, a case of water and some fresh fruit. (all rooms have a refrigerator.)

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Wilderness Lodge is unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: Centerfire40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from May 1st until May 8th. I don't even know where to start. The resort is amazing. The service, either in your room or at the restaurants, is fantastic! Everybody is very friendly! We had a view of the courtyard, and while sitting on the patio, a bunny came up and visited us! It is just an amazing place! We go to Disney every year and stay at a different resort each time, but it is going to be very hard not to book this resort again next year! We just loved it! Mousekeeping was fantastic! Everything was just wonderful! You must try it for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mistyiv
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Wilderness and we were so sad to leave. What a beautiful place. Everything was very clean, the staff was extremely pleasant and accomodating from the concierge to housekeeping. The pool area was nice but sometimes hard to get a chair. My five year old loved the pool. The pool bar was open so it was nice to sit and sip on a drink while watching our daughter play. We ate at the Whispering Canyon Cafe which was nice. We also ate from the Roaring Fork which is the Counter Service Restaurant which was also good with different hot and cold sandwiches and burgers. Could get extremely busy at times. The best part of the hotel is the location. It's so close to Magic Kingdom, literally a six minute boat ride. The boat service was great, never waited more than five minutes for a boat. Definately beats riding the bus. Tons of families with kids staying here but I never really heard anything other than other peoples toilets flushing. If we return to Orlando I don't think we will every stay any where else. We've been spoiled. I miss sitting out on our balcony having breakfast. Disney is really the happiest place on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney resort- depending on the price”
Reviews.Author: floydfamily202
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th visit to Disney (we visit each year for my daughter's birthday) and our first time in a Disney Deluxe resort. For the past 5 years we have stayed at the moderate resorts of Riverside and Port Orleans FQ. Because of a SUPER deal of $200 per night, we decided to splurge and upgrade to a deluxe. We had visited the Wilderness (for dinner) and already knew how impressive the lobby and overall theme of the resort was. We did enjoy our visit, however we do believe for the money, we will return to the moderates in the future. The room and service were no more exceptional than what we were use to at the moderates. While we enjoyed the boat ride to the magic kingdom, we didn't find it any more convenient than the POR. I should explain that we always have a car on our trips and DO NOT use the bus system so I can not compare the bus system at the Wilderness verses our other resort choice. The food court was tiny compared to what we were use to at the moderates- I even drove over the POFQ for to grab breakfast to go one morning. The Whispering Canyon and Artist Point are great but if you are not on the dining plan they can really add up. I recommend the Whispering Canyon for anyone with children but one time per trip is enough for us. The rooms- we booked a standard view and I almost cried when we checked in. It was such a dark and depressing room (I had high expectations since this was our "splurge trip"). I would NOT have stayed in that room for our 5 night trip, luckily when I called the front desk with my complaints they moved us to an upgraded court yard view room. I had booked a standard view and Disney did not have to do this so I was very happy but I would have paid what ever it took to move once I saw the standard view room. The lodge motif is dark and the standard view room had a view of the roof gable that blocked most of the light- you could see nothing but the angled roofs directly in front of our balcony. The room decor was not my taste but it was ok for my husband who is a big hunter and likes the lodge motif. The room did not appear any larger or more luxurious than the moderate rooms. I did find the room and hotel very clean but this has been the case with all my Disney trips. The Wilderness Lodge lived up to its name- we saw a lot of wildlife. We saw deer on the beach, ducks in the pool, armadillo in the bushes, an eagle on the lake and bunnies everywhere. The pool is nice but my daughter rates the pool at the POR and POFQ higher. I guess in the end I would say that I am glad I satisfied my desire to experience the deluxe resorts but I am equally glad that I only spent $200 per night to do so. If we had spent any more that that, I would have been extremely disappointed with the value. We will return to Disney resorts (wouldn't consider staying off property) but for the money- this family is sold on the Port Orleans resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CJ0707
Reviews.Content: This resort is like a piece of heaven. The atmosphere is sooo relaxing and friendly. Theming is brilliant and the staff was first class all the way. The was never a time we I walked by any staff member when I wasn't greeted with a hello. Stan greeted us when we first arrived off the magical express(which was great), and that was the beginning of a wonderful stay. The size of the room was fine for us, we had 3 in our party, myself, my husband, and our 2.5 year old son. MouseKeeping was wonderful, no matter what time of day we left the room, our room was clean when we returned. Everything was neat & clean everyday. They left our son cute towel animals, so he was always excited to see what was in the room at the end of the day. The landscaping makes the walk to and from the boat enjoyable. We ate a Roaring Forks a number of times and always had good food and the service was great there! No complaints about anything, everything was great. It is expensive but its Disney and its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Dacystravels
Reviews.Content: This was a great Hotel. My kids and husband loved it. Yes, the room is a little small. How much time do you spend there any way. We stayed on the Club Level 7th floor. Which was great. Every day, they would provide food in the lounge. My favorite was the wine and cheese. As soon as you arrive you feel like you're staying in a forest. My advice take the boats to and from Magic kingdom much faster. Very nice...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: moffica
Reviews.Content: Firstly this hotel is awesome. From the moment you pull up you are immersed in the theming. The lobby is amazing and really does take your breath away when you first walk in. Check in; there was a small queue when I arrived but check in was still very quick and efficient. We had booked (and paid for) a pool view room, and when we checked in were informed we had been upgraded for free! I thought concierge level great. When we got to the room it was a pool view no free upgrade, but to be fair thatâ€™s exactly what I paid for. Rooms; the rooms are small, but as there was only two of us there was lots of room. We had a two queen bed room. I can see how a family of four would be beginning to find it tight. Our room was clean and tidy ad not much noise coming up from the pool. We had a great view of the electric water pageant every night which I found surprisingly entertaining. I know its only barges with lights on but is still fun. Mousekeeping; This was great, room cleaned everyday, fresh towels everyday (even though I hung them back up) and a few towel things, cant really say animals but fun things done to hold soap and TV remote. We also had a few messages from the mousekeeping manager checking everything was fine. Food; Whispering canyon is loud, but can be fun, the food was good for Disney, best mashed potato on site and the berry cobbler was to die for. Roaring forks is ok, the food is pretty standard but itâ€™s open till midnight and is very convenient. The resort is not huge so your refillable mug is extra good here. Roaring forks is small, very small and can get super crowded at peak times, but if you time it right can be great. We often went down early for breakfast and sat out in the sun watching the ducks and rabbits. Artist point I really donâ€™t want to be negative but found it slightly uninspiring. The decor is a bit boring/bland (some of the hidden Mickeyâ€™s are fun to find). The food is average I much prefer Jiko (amazing), I had a buffalo steak and it was a bit tough. The desserts were amazing. I would say if youâ€™re on the DDP give it a go, otherwise I wouldnâ€™t go out of my way. Transport; the boat ride to the magic kingdom was great, very quick and frequent. The buses were fairly consistent, no queuing system but thatâ€™s the same at most Disney resorts and you all know how us English love a good queue!! We were never on a bus more than 15/20mins and never waiting more than 15mins for a bus to come. I chose not to use the valet parking as it looked a bit unorganised and they openly compare tips in front of guests. Hotel Grounds; spectacular. The pool area is nice and the whole theming is fantastic. When you return from the fun and amazement of the parks the hotel usually brings you back down to earth but not here it just keeps the whole Disney experience going. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, you wonâ€™t be disappointed everything about it was great and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service, Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luvdiz
Reviews.Content: The room was great, large enough for a family of 4, refrigerator, double sinks in bath. Recently updated. Transportation to and from the parks is seamless. Riding the boat to the Magic Kingdom was a treat for my kids and a nice relaxing time for me! When we had to cut our trip short because of a death in the family, the hotel could not have been more gracious and accommodating! We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon at the Lodge”
Reviews.Author: MartyMcfly1985
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Wilderness Lodge in early April for our honeymoon. Check in was very easy as it was 1.30am and we were the only guests in the lobby (due to a ridiculous wait at Dollar car rental at MCO, but thatâ€™s another story!). We booked a Woodview room which was located on the side overlooking the Lodge Villas and smaller pool. The room was more than adequate for the two of us and we liked the balcony and in-room safe option. As others have mentioned the rooms are quite dark. Also, the bathroom had a strange aroma and the shower strength was quite feeble. The resort was beautiful and possibly the most spectacular lobby Iâ€™ve seen. The boat transportation to the Magic Kingdom was fantastic â€“ ran from Â½ before the park opened until 1Â½ hours after closing (including Magic Hours). We also used the Bus Transportation which was better than I had expected. Not realising it was â€˜spring breakâ€™, we werenâ€™t expecting the crowds, but this was only really an issue at the parks - only time I have ever seen Magic Kingdom reach capacity! There is also a Boat and Bike rental facility. We hired a â€˜Boston Whalerâ€™ and had a great time sailing around Bay Lake and Seven Seas Lagoon, yielding to the steamboats of course! We also hired a â€˜Surreyâ€™ Bike to explore the grounds, which was harder than it looked! The Boat and Bike rental place was understaffed though. We ate at the parks most days but did make use of the Roaring Fork restaurant a couple of times, which was great for quick snacks and sandwiches. If driving, the main road to the resort takes you through the Magic Kingdom toll plaza. If youâ€™ve never been before, basically stay in the right hand lanes, as indicated by the not-so-obvious lane markings, but not the far lane as this is for buses. A cast member will wave you through. If returning late at night, the booths are empty so no need to stop. Despite the very minor complaints with the room, we would definitely stay here again. It was our first stay at a Disney property - itâ€™s a wonderful resort and canâ€™t wait to go back, but not at Spring Break (Iâ€™m not queuing 170mins for Toy Story!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, once again!”
Reviews.Author: Windybaker
Reviews.Content: We had the time of our life and love the Wilderness Lodge! I am not sure what the few bad reviews are about because we love it here. And we went at the busiest time of year. The room was clean, no dust that I could see, and the kids loved the bunk beds, less fighting that way. We had new toiletries every day as well as some cute little character made from a towel. We had dinner at Whispering Canyon, loved it, and also ate at Roaring Fork, great for a quick meal. This resort is a wonderful place to bring the family. The staff is friendly and helps you with whatever you need. The pool was great for the kids, and there was always a chaise to be found and plenty of towels. The ease of transportation was something that my husband remarked about. We took the boat, the buses and the monorail around town! There was never a long wait, except once when the monorail had a small delay. This is our second time staying here and we all agree we would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cjanel
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for a week during March break. Had previously stayed at Polynesian and wanted to try something different. The rooms were standard, clean and adequate for a family of 4. food was perfectly adequate at both restaurants although we found portion sizes at whispering canyon way too big for normal eaters. We rarely waited for any transportation. Our only issue was over crowding at pool. There seemed to be a lot of people swimming at the pool who I don't believe were staying at the hotel. Consequently, we swam everyday at the smaller pool. Overall a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, dirty room and bad food experience”
Reviews.Author: zipandlucy
Reviews.Content: While the Wilderness Lodge has a truly beautiful lobby, pool, and grounds, our room was extremely cramped and dirty. It had a horrible smell from the moment we walked in until we left 5 days later. There was dirt in the corners in the bathroom. Also, the Roaring Fork (snacks, quick service meals) was overly priced, and the food quality was poor. I had something in my sandwich that shouldn't of been there. That being said, the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “dust”
Reviews.Author: Ninrew
Reviews.Content: The dust in this hotel was horrible. My husband had to use my daughter's inhailer. Room was dirty, so they moved us after not cleaning it. But the dust all over this hotel was terrible. You could see it on everything, and floating in the air!! Stay somewhere else if you have allergies to dust.

Reviews.Title: “go somewhere else!!!!”
Reviews.Author: victorian246
Reviews.Content: lobby & pool great, rooms dirty, maid service left cups in the sink dust on radio coffee pot,under tv white with dust - quilts stained, loud bingo and band at pool,tile chipped in first rm then moved to rm5147 to have connected rm with family just as bad dust noise bathroom floor dirty never again!!rms so small!!

Reviews.Title: “Transportation Difficult at Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: tarheelblue822
Reviews.Content: I think the Lodge is beautiful in the lobby areas, so we decided to give it a try. The rooms were very disappointing - much smaller than I imagined and the comforters on the beds were stained and dirty and had to be replaced. The room was minimal at best. The onsite counter service was fine for a quick breakfast. The transportation was the challenge. We like to get moving and that was impossible here. The boat to the MK was tedious - much too long to wait for it on both ends, seemed quicker to just take the bus - once it arrived. Busses to other parks were few and far between as well. Took forever to get where we were going in the a.m. Coming home at night was easier if you left the park during the fireworks to beat the crowd. Probably a fine hotel if you have young kids and hang out at the resort and pool a lot, but not for families on the go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent again”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 4 nights at the lodge. As disney vacation club members we are lucky enough to be able to stay frequently. Hotel is beautiful, location excellent and service brilliant - but it is Disney so what do you expect. Restaurants expensive but again thats to be expected in Disney World. Looking forward to our next stay already

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, great pool”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoKevin
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel that is designed as a grand National Park lodge. Although it is not on the monorail line, it is just a boat trip away from Magic Kingdom.
