The two lodges Animal Kingdom Lodge and Wilderness Lodge are my favorite Disney hotels. They really transport you to a different setting in your imagination.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Indeed!!”
Reviews.Author: momgogreen
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with annual passes and have always stayed in the moderate Disney resorts. This last visit we took advantage of a special passholder rate and stayed at the the Wilderness Lodge! It was an amazing and wonderful experience! I want to focus on the differences between the moderate and deluxe resort values. The pools and playgrounds at both resorts are great! Gift shops have fun stuff and the atmosphere at both types of resorts are magical ! What made the difference is the service and comfort of the deluxe location! There was always someone to available to ask for help or suggestions at Wilderness Lodge! Our son was horribly ill the first two days of our trip! Somehow the staff managed to help us get hot chicken soup and crackers and even a funny "citation" from the security staff because he was behaving too well! They even told him to report to Mickey's Judge's tent the next day for a "hearing"! It was just the thing he needed to help him feel better! The rooms are so quiet!! I couldn't hear any of the teenagers that were next door, who never seemed to leave their room and ordered days worth of room service! I wouldn't want to see their bill! And the beds were huge and comfortable. It was so easy to sleep a family of four comfortably in the room. We always felt crowded in the moderate resorts. Lastly, the boat ride to and from the resort to Magic Kingdom was always an amazing beginning and end to a day! There is the added bonus of a beach, the evening water parade, and the geyser which "erupts" every hour! Whispering Canyon restaurant was by far the best meal and the most fun a family could have with children! It is comparable to the Biergarten meal in Epcot's Germany! The kids will always remember the fun and relaxed family friendly meal!

Reviews.Title: “A good but pricey Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen5791
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the WIlderness Lodge as the final part of our Honeymoon (North Conway, NH and San Francisco). Have previously stayed on Disney property at Port Orleans Riverside and must admit I preferred POR and not sure if I'd spend the extra to stay at this deluxe resort again. The hotel has excellent theming though and having said that we had a pool view room that also looked across Bay Lake so were able to watch the Water Pageant from our room and see the MK fireworks above the building on the opposite side of the pool directly infront of us. Never went in the pool and tried to use the whirlpool but it was ALWAYS packed throughout the day. Roaring Forks (the CS food area) was adequate but again always busy. We do recommend the refillable mugs though very handy! A nice touch was that Mickey left us a balloon and 'Congratulations on your wedding' card on our second day - a lovely surprise which is now framed at home! We also never quite worked out why our beds got 'turned down' for the first five nights but not for the second - we had two seperate bookings so presume it was something to do with that and we had to assume that it was a honeymoon perk. Transport wise we did not use the resort buses as we had our own car as we prefer to not be reliant on Disney transport and we go to other places and do lots of shopping!! We did however use the resort launch boat from the Lodge to Magic Kingdom and it was a nice change of pace and very quick! Although from a personal point of view we would be unlikely to stay here again (for cost reasons) it was perfect for our special honeymoon stay and set it apart from staying off site as we usually do (the POR trip 12 months earlier was supposed to be a one off stay on property but hey ho!). If I were to try a Deluxe Disney resort again it would be the Polynesian or the Yacht and Beach club but that won't be happening unless the lottery numbers come up!!!! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel as a great holiday place with excellent theming and a real 'away from the hustle of Disney' feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MeggTravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 12 days, have stayed at other disney resorts(Floridian, AK, Polynesian) so was pretty excited about the reviews. AFter a 4hr drive we arrived later than expected, right when we had dinner reservations at the "Whispering Canyon" so we exected to lose that and been given a not so nice room. We got lucky on both accounts, got our dinner.......and a great room on the 6th floor overlooking MK! Yes the main lobby does get noisey and the rooms above must suffer so if you can get a room out on the wing do so. The "Roaring Fork" cafe does get busy and be prepared to stand in line to pay (or like one guy a few of us watched...he got tired and just walked out with food and beer and didn't pay...the manager proudly announced she couldn't do anything!). Get the family settled at the table and get in and out with your order and back to your family and enjoy. We rented a car so didn't use the buses, but we did use the ferry..which was very handy for MK. We walked to Fort Wilderness for the "Hoop-de-doo show" and took the ferry back. Had dinner at the "Artiste's pallette" really outstanding food...but be warned very rich in taste.....but great menu. Pool - heated and very popular.....even in Feb. Got so busy that it was impossible tp get seating at the main pool, so we snook around the corner to the smaller pool and chilled out there for a while. Would cetainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Panthers127
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Disney Riverside in the past and decided to upgrade for this trip...and it was a good choice. All areas were great (with the exception of one that I'll explain later) including the pool, beach, arcade, lobby and health club. For those that enjoy a workout before hitting the parks, this club is very nice. The attendants were not helpful for those new to the equipment but for those that know the routine...the equipment is modern, clean and plentiful. The room was small but expected from the earlier reviews. Transportation to the parks was excellent. Make sure and use the boat for trips to and from Magic Kingdom. The quick serve restaurant was fine and the staff was helpful when asked. We didn't try the Signature Restaurant...Artisan Point. The properties regular restaurant..Roaring Forks...was our only negative the entire stay. The food was average (basic Disney fare) but we were taken back by the service. Our server was very pushy about her tip almost to the point of making us feel intimidated. She was very clear from the beginning that she was expecting a huge gratuity for "taking such good care of us". It was quite unbelievable! As we left the table, the server checked the book and made a comment about us not leaving the "RECOMMENDED 18% GRATUITY". I should have said something to management......and in hindsight, should have....but was so upset (angry) at the behavior that we didn't visit the restaurant for the remainder of our stay (another 6 days). So...the visit was outstanding despite the behavior of this staff member. I would recommend this resort for young children since our two loved the pool/beach area and searching for rabbits on the numerous trails around the property.

Reviews.Title: “Very good with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: whiteshadow
Reviews.Content: Returned today from a stay at Wilderness Lodge, Two rooms to accomodate four adults and three grandchildren, ages 3,5 and 7. We had the cheapest double rooms (about $350.00 a night per room) and so, was not surprised with the view of concrete and smokehouse ( for the salmon I suppose.) However, much to our surprise, the rooms, #6050 and #6052, on the 6th floor provide a magnificent view of the 9:00 p.m. fireworks display if you don't want to fight the crowd at the Magic Kingdom. In order for this to work, you need to watch the 8:00 parade from the town square by the rail station, and as soon as the parade ends, leave the park and catch the first ferry to the Lodge and up to your room to see the fireworks. The only problem with the room was the toilet not properly flushing a few times although maintainance was willing to come up and fix it. Staff uniformly friendly and the ambience is Northwest rustic. We would do it again. Kids loved it as did the adults. Get a better rate in the offseason and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic hotel--a tranquil oasis”
Reviews.Author: Mark-in-Boston
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Wilderness lodge 3/1-3/8 as part of the buy 4 nights get 3 free special. The public areas of the hotel and the exterior landscaping and facilities are all top-notch. It is majestic and awe-inspiring--I was amazed at all the details and quality of workmanship. We had a King room (Room 1014) on the ground floor with a view of a small pond. It was a handicap accessible room, so the bathroom was a bit larger than most rooms and it was a roll-in shower. The bed was very comfortable and the furnishings and size of the room were more than adequate for our needs. The room was clean and on our first few days we received different towel animals. All the staff I interacted with were more than helpful and always courteous and thankful. The Disney service ethic is amazing. It was a real shock returning to the real world. :) We ate at Artist Point the first night of our stay and had a very good/excellent meal. It is expensive, but comparable to the prices you'd find in a quality restaurant in a major city. We ate at the Roaring Fork counter service restaurant for breakfast each day and that was very good as well--we were very pleased that it offered healthy choices. The hotel provides a very relaxing respite from the excitement and crowds in the park. I just wish we had had more time to enjoy the hotel, since we spent most of our waking moments at the park. Transportation to/from the hotel is excellent. Boat shuttles are very frequent to/from the Magic Kingdom and also to the Contemporary Resort and Fort Wilderness. The buses were also nearly as good and on average we waited about 10-15 minutes at most for our buses. It is truly a well-coordinated affair. I want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Nice but Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CampswdogNchild
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Wilderness Lodge, but could afford it only because of Disney's buy 4 get 3 special. We found the hotel to be well kept, and the staff very friendly and helpful. While we didn't participate in them there were a lot of activities for children, and a beautiful sandy beach play ground. Ferry rides to the campground & Magic Kingdom were convenient and enjoyable. We hit a cold snap, so did not spend as much time swimming or playing on the beach as we would have liked. The Whispering Canyon's menu for lunch seemed much more kid-friendly than the dinner menu, but the food was great for both meals. The roaring forks had a nice selection of options for cafeteria style & snack foods. We had a ground level room (walked out to the pool) with one queen and one bunk bed. The room was clean and well kept, though truly it was not any larger than the room we had at the Coronado Springs, a moderate priced hotel. I knew this going in from other reviews, so was not surprised as some folks were. Our room was home to 3 adults and one child. it got a bit crowded sometimes but..well, you deal with it! Best thing I did was take time each morning to enjoy a cup of coffee in the lobby. between the fire place, the stream, totem polls, and the comfy sitting areas on the upper floors, i started each day refreshed and ready to take on "the World".

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kleex20x
Reviews.Content: When you walk into this hotel the lobby is amazing, very large with huge fire place and totem poles! Check in was quick and staff were really friendly 'welcoming you home' to their hotel, even though we didnt arrive until midnight! (Due to 5 hour delay with virgin) Room was very nice, quite large for only the two of us. Balcony was nice and had a good view of the swimming pool and we could also see reflection of fireworks from magic kingdom everynight in the window opposite us. The rooms were cleaned daily and towels changed whenever you wanted. Food in the hotel was quite nice, we mainly ate breakfast here and then out at the parks for the rest of the time. I think the food is fairly similar whichever Disney hotel you choose. Burgers, pizza, chips, nuggets etc but also they had fruit, pastries and a sandwich counter (these were huge!!) You can buy the unlimitted refil mugs here which i would recommend as we saved alot of money this way. We also realised when we got here that they use the same mugs as the Disney Caribbean beach resort so we could of taken those instead of buying more. If you want to eat at the whispering canyon (Which looked lovely) i would highly advise that you book this before your stay, as we were here for 2 weeks and only 2 of us, we couldnt get a table for our whole stay. (Only random times like breakfast at 11:30, which by then we were wanting to be out at the parks etc) The pool is nice and a geiser goes off on the hour every hour which is good to watch. The boat to the magic kingdom is great, and the man even stopped to let us watch the fireworks on the lake one night at 9pm! We went durign christmas and the decs were lovely, tree was absolutely huge! Had a lovely stay at this resort and would def return!

Reviews.Title: “Buy 4 nights get 3 free is great deal for this deluxe Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssfer
Reviews.Content: My family just returned after spending a week at Fort Wilderness. We've been to Disney before, but this is the first time we stayed at a deluxe resort. Our children are 9 and 4.5. I gave this hotel high ratings b/c of the location and the package we booked. First, with regard to the hotel, the location was excellent, as all the parks were easily accessible. Our kids loved that they took a boat to the Magic Kingdom. We were able to to do parks most of the day, return for a swim and then leave again for dinner. The lobby is beautiful and the food at the Roaring Fork is very good - fresh and diverse for a small menu. We had a standard room which was fine for the the size of our family. It had a queen bed and a bunk, which the kids loved. It did take a day to get used to liviing in a small space, but we adjusted b/c we were rarely in the room. The comments about the room size are true (on the small size) and the view was louzy if you looked down from the balcony (parking lot). Our maid service was excellent - cleaned everyday (folded the kids pajamas and placed their stuffed animals in a cute way). Buses to other parks ran efficiently. We visited the Grand Floridian for breakfast and the Contemporary for Chef Mickey's dinner, two other deluxe resorts and our hotel seemed more quiet and secluded, which we liked. The elevators are noteably fast. The pool was very crowded on Saturday, which is expected, given the 83 degree temp., but otherwise met the demands of our family. As noted in another review, there are ducks that swim in the pool. I, too, was dismayed by this, but it did not bother my kids at all. They enjoyed the small water slide and the kids activities. As mentioned, we booked the trip for our school vacation to benefit from the deal Disney was running, buy 4 nights, get 3 free. This promotion allowed us to stay at the Wilderness. We were looking to stay at a moderate class hotel (Port Orleans), but the difference in price and bed size (queen at the Wilderness; double is standard elsewhere) in the room made the decision easier. I do have to admit, I'm not sure I would have paid full price for the hotel, only b/c of the little time we actually spent at it using the facilities. We ran into a snow storm and looked into staying another night if our flight was cancelled, and the room rate was $495/night. Yikes. Overall, however, with the promotion, we believe that we got a great hotel for the cost. As an aside, we also bought a meal plan, which we have not ever done before. I recommend it. It was a quick meal lunch, snack and table service dinner. I was surprised that every dinner was over $100 for a family of 4, with both kids eating off the kids' menu. With tip and if we ordered an appetizer, the bill was usually $140-$150, just for dinner. The meal plan was a great value, b/c we ate well at some lovely restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Could have stayed here all week without going to the parks!”
Reviews.Author: KBTravel
Reviews.Content: 1st time to Disney with 4 year old. 1st impression walking in the lobby was amazing. The service is impeccable - when checking in they said "Welcome home" There was many activities for kids at the hotel - cookie hour, arts and crafts. Our room was on the 6th floor facing the main pool. We could see the Magic Kingdom fireworks each night and the Electric Water Pagent at 9:30 pm. Comfy beds, room a bit dim, but we usually crashed every night after being at the parks. Contrary to other reviewers we found we waited longer for the boat to Magic Kingdom, than for the buses to the other parks. Maybe we were lucky. We never had to wait long at the parks for our bus back to WL either. Whispering Canyon was a hoot - and great food. Roaring Forks was okay - mainly just had coffee in the am. We brought cereal & oatmeal with us for breakfast so we could get to the parks early - which is the best advice I can give anyone going to Disney with younger children. The grounds/pool area are beautiful - lots of spots to sit and eat (only did this the last day waiting to go home) or to take photos. Kids loved the pool but it was a bit chilly. Hot tub was nice. Loved it and would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: booklady4
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 2/17-2/24/09 at Wilderness Lodge with our two sons, ages 16 & 14. What a beautiful property! Outstanding pool complex with a view of a geiser that shoots off every hour.. except at night it is turned off. Activities during the afternoon for little ones and adults... name the artist of the music, etc. A nice small sandy beach with lounge chairs overlooking the lake. My favorite pool was the quiet pool and jacuzzi located closer to the villas on the property. Being a NYer I was out swimming laps every morning (usually all by myself... who else would swim when it is only 50 degrees in the morning?... but the water feels like bath water, toasty) The water was kept warmer than the larger pool and the area is surrounded by towering pines and thick vegetation... beautiful soft music being piped out from somewhere under one of the many ferns... my idea of relaxation. The food is fairly priced in the counter service area.. if you have the dining plan (1 sit down, 1 counter service, 1 snack) you can easily have 3 meals a day... a snack can be a bagel, muffin, drink, dessert, etc. A good tip is if you have extra snacks left at the end.. get delicious pastries in Epcot in France or other pastry shops in the WDW and bring them home. Anyway, very comfortable beds and excellent maid service. Great nooks... 4th floor; couch and 2 chairs with fireplace to read the morning paper... I will return... you should too! - writing now from the cold and sun in Buffalo, NY

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: Worldwidetraveler710
Reviews.Content: I just took my 10 grandchildren and their parents (18 in all) to the Wilderness Lodge for a 3 night stay. I chose the Lodge because it is close to the Magic Kingdom and 3 of the grand children are 5 years old and younger. I up-graded two of the the rooms to the Concierge Level because Disney planners said it was well worth the extra money and I also selected one of the Vacation Villas for another part of the family. The Vacation Villa was lovely. Large rooms and well appointed. I about paid $900/ night for the villa. It was worth it. On the other hand, the Concierge rooms were $600 a night and were not worth the money! They were very small, the bedrooms had two king size beds and barely any room to move around in much less put suitcases in. The tiny living room contained a king size sofa bed which when pulled out left no room for anyone to walk around in the room much less sit and chat! The one small bathroom was poorly maintained- leaking shower head, rusty curtain rod rings and the double sinks in the alcove outside of the bathroom barely provided enough room for one person to be at the sink much less two! The food in the concierge dining area provided a continental breakfast (cereals, rolls, fruit and juices) in the morning. I don't know what they served in the afternoon and evening. The only hot food in the morning was oatmeal. The hotel lobby is crowded and noisy. The only way to get to the Magic Kingdom is by taking a bus or the small launch. Both were acceptable. When I spoke to the Wilderness Lodge managers detailing my concerns, they told me they were very sorry and would be sure to contact the necessary people to correct the problems. Good Luck! I will not ever go back to the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “So Disappointed with the room quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: Disappointedindisney
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 Jr Suites and 1 Villa for 18 family members for our first Family Reunion. The Villa was beautiful and for $800/ night it should be. A family of 8 were there comfortably. The Jr Suite on the " Club Level (was actually on the ground floor with cold cereal priviledges every morning upstairs)- was another story. That room was over $600 a night and it was horrible with an uncomfortable pullout couch and 2 marginal double beds in the bedroom. It was tiny and the bathroom fixtures were rusty and pitted. The shower dripped. The furniture and doors were banged up and scratched. When we brought it to the management attention on several occasions they came and looked- agreed with us and did NOTHING . Over $6000 was spent on 8 nights of rooms. I am a Florida resident and have stayed at some of the Moderately priced Disney properties and had good experiences but, I would not waste my money on this place again. On top of that they still charge you $10/day for internet usage! The biggest shock was that they would do nothing for our concerns. Offered us nothing. So much for the year of a Million Dreams.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but standard rooms are not luxury”
Reviews.Author: sj1908
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge is in a great location for families...especially those with young kids. You can take the boat to Magic Kingdom and the wait is 10 minutes or less. When we were leaving Magic Kingdom to take the boat back, there was NO wait. Awesome! The resort is beautiful...especially the main lobby and the courtyard. Landscaping was on point! The staff was friendly and the food at the Roaring Fork and Whispering Canyon was decent for a family. However, the room was not luxury at all. We had a standard room with two double beds. The separate vanity area was nice, but the bathroom was very cramped and there was still some stains behind the toilet and near the tub. Because the stains remained there during our four-day stay, we did not leave a tip for the housekeeping staff. Also, our toilet did not work for the first flush. We had to constantly keep pushing the button until it finally worked. We contacted maintenance and it took two full days for them to come up and check it out. They left a note that it was repaired, but it wasn't. So, we spent our entire four-day stay with a toilet that required extra time to flush. We repeatedly contacted maintenance during our stay. Not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our time at Fort wilderness”
Reviews.Author: paws101
Reviews.Content: I should preface that with, when the kids were well... unfortunately even Disney can't prevent illness and my kids both suffered from fevers the first two days which put a bit of a damper on things.. my husband spending two hours driving around Orlando trying to find the Walgreens for liquid tylenol was quite the farce(just ask for directions honey). Back to the review... Gorgeous hotel, the lobby is a work of art. The room was fine for the four of us- two kids 11 and 8. I echo the dark bathroom part - one ceiling light with a dim bulb behind a dark shower curtain. Before arriving, I asked for special accomodations for a "quiet room" as my child has sleep issues and sometimes, if woken up abruptly at night screams at the top of his lungs, good ole night terrors. They accomodated my request and we were put on the 6th floor facing the Wilderness Villas pool area. nice and quiet. The room was clean, mousekeeping was very good- changed towels every day and supplied extras during the "sick days" . We got towel animals for two days then they stopped. I made a fatal erro rwhen planning the trip- buying the Deluxe Dining plan. I had no concept of what 3 table service meals and two snack per day per person would actually be like. My family are - regular to light eaters we faced the gargantuan task of trying to get our money's worth out of the plan. Let me explain - each table service meal comes with an appetizer, drink and dessert. If you go to the park and get a quick service meal at a take out place you don't get the appetizer just the drink and dessert. I tried valiently to make reservations for all our meals and nothing ever worked right, my family didn't want to go to the parks where the reservations were I had to cancel and scramble for a new place which are hard to come by once you are at the parks. We ended up on the day before we left with like 26 meals left and 30 snacks.... we did 2 room service meals (they count as two meals each per person) a signature dining at Artist Point (highly recommended - excellent) and bought home a lot of rice krispy mickey treats to use up our snack credits. I doubt we ate half of what we spent for this plan but I have learned my lesson - no more deluxe plans - the regular would have even probably been too much. the refillable drink mugs came with the package and we got good use of them. Getting to the Magic Kingdom was a quick boat ride from the dock, I never waited more than 10 min for the boat and the ride was an easy 8-10 door to door. We rented a car from Alamo for 149 for the week- I prefer having my own wheels when I'm on vacation. I get a liitle anxious on a crowded bus. There was free parking at all the parks and on site at the hotel with a pass they give you at check in. I felt I made a good decision when I saw people waiting on long lines for the buses. We were there the week before presidents day and were lucky crowds weren't too bad. We left the Sunday before Presidents day and that weekend everyone else showed up - the parks were super crowded with extra long waits for everything . All in all, the hotel and staff were great, I would come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lizab
Reviews.Content: We chose the wilderness lodge due to proximity and other online reviews. We thought we'd be spending more time at magic kingdom, so the boat ride was a plus. We actually spent a lot more time at Epcot instead. Service was fine, people were friendly, location great, never had to wait long at all for transportation; however, the one night we decided to dine in at the restaurant we were pretty much held captive for 1 1/2 hours -- food was expensive and wasn't that great. Should've just ordered from the snack bar and eaten in our room, which we did do the following night -- food and service were MUCH better going that route. We had a woods room that overlooked a stinky green retention pond --- bleah. Had pictured myself sitting on the deck reading a book and relaxing. Basically a convenient, average hotel room. Nothing spectacular. Bathroom fan drove me nuts -- was load and would go on any time we entered the vicinity. Floors could've used a good scrubbing and vacuuming -- noticed crumbs and spots from previous guests in the corners, a couple towels seemed to have coffee stains... Also, I usually tip housekeeping the day we leave and had planned to do so, especially the first day when our maid left the cutest ilttle towel animals for ds surrounded by the stuffed animals he brought; however, following days, his blanket and animals were just tossed to the side -- once on the floor, had to track someone down for coffee (hadn't left any for us).. Oh, and we were so busy park hopping that we didn't have time to enjoy the pool area, but probably would NOT have done so anyway because every time I walked past the pool area there were DUCKS!! Swimming in the pool. Can't imagine the mess they were making in there. And people were still swimming in there with them.

Reviews.Title: “could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: lyonmane
Reviews.Content: This was everything I had hoped it would be. I am surprised to read some of the disappointing reviews, because my stay at the lodge was wonderful. The rooms are not 'luxury' as others complain, but if you've stayed at Disney hotels before you'll know that this is standard. The only way to get a truly 'luxury' room is to book a villa. After staying at Coronado Springs, which was very disappointing room-wise, this place seemed like a mansion. Sure the rooms are dark - it goes with the cozy wilderness lodge theme. Like bright rooms? Try the contemporary. If you've ever been to some of the older, more historic lodges in upstate NY or PA, this will be very much like them. The details to this building are incredible. The pool is nice, good outside bar with friendly staff, and the hottubs were pretty good too. We went here the week before Christmas and the lobby was beautiful with the huge tree in the center. Location is great with the boat service as an added travel option. If you want to find those 'secluded' nooks, find the two small fireplaces on the second and third floors above the front doors. Other than that, there really isn't too many other private areas - remember this is Disney - made for families primarily. The only complaint that I have is about the Roaring Fork. The fast food there is ok, not anything to write home about though. The menu was reduced beyond what was listed the hour before closing. The staff seemingly wanted to clean up faster to be able to close up faster. The food at the other restaurants at the lodge was good. Also want to mention Jikos - great food! Make your dinner reservations at any Disney restaurant EARLY! It might sound funny to have to plan your meals out a few days in advance, but it'll enable you to get reservations at reasonable hours - unless you like eating dinner at 9pm. It seems like a lot of complaints come from people who haven't been to Disney resorts before and don't know what to expect. Go to your library and get a few Disney travel books before you go. There are a few 'tricks' to making your visit better. And although most of the staff is pretty good at catering to your needs, you're going to find a few bad apples every now and then. Get their names and let a supervisor know. But this has been rare in my Disney experiences. Keep your expectations reasonable and enjoy the ride!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- 2nd trip!”
Reviews.Author: aceandj
Reviews.Content: We went 2 years ago and stayed at the Disney wilderness lodge villas. Lots of space for my family of 4. The washer and dryer in the 1 bedroom unit was great. Last week we stayed in the wilderness lodge and we all loved it. We upgraded our room to a bunk bed room and the kids loved that. The room is pretty small, but not too small. The decor was nice and everything looked/smelled clean. I loved the little balcony to sit out and read (too bad it was cold!). The balcony chairs aren't those uncomfy plastic chairs either. The kids favorite part was the chocolates on the pillows when we got back from the park. The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 is because it is expensive. Also we did the magical express to and from the airport and I don't think we will ever go to disney any other way. It was so easy and the morning we left our boarding passes for our flight were already slipped under our door. All we had to do was pack and call bell service and check the bags outside the hotel, we never had to carry a thing!

Reviews.Title: “very family-friendly”
Reviews.Author: kluttel71
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Lodge, although I wouldn't necessarily stay there the next time we go to Disney. My husband and I were traveling with our 1- and 3-year old children, and we never once had to worry that our kids were being too rambunctious or active because there were kids everywhere. The lobby is really wonderful, and the pool and beach areas are nice. (The lifeguards are pretty crabby, though--stay out of their way.) Our kids loved finding the "animal tracks" (bear, deer, buffalo, raccoon) in the concrete sidewalks. Check-in went well, and the bell-hop was helpful. We had reserved a standard room (and requested a crib) but were given a room with a queen bed and bunk beds (no crib) for some reason. We ended up with a much better view (courtyard, overlooking the little "stream") than we paid for, I believe. When we called the front desk to ask for the crib, it arrived in about five minutes. I do have a complaint about Disney's Magical Express (the luggage tags never arrived in the mail, so we had to pick up the bags from baggage claim ourselves), but that's not the hotel's fault. The room was like everyone says: dated and dark. Some of the decor was attractive (cool pseudo-kitschy wildlife scene light covers, carved animal wooden bedposts, new marble countertops and double sinks with nice fixtures), but the curtains on the balcony door were pretty dusty, and the bathroom was old and unattractive. The rooms are also quite cramped. And my number one pet peeve: disgusting unwashed bedspreads on the beds! Ours had a gross white stain on it, and it clearly hadn't been washed before we moved in. We also found some little toys in our room left by other kids, and housekeeping wasn't very diligent during our stay. The restaurants on site were good, although drinks (wine, beer, mixed drinks) were unusually expensive. We used the boats and buses to get around and had good experiences with all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Property and Lodge are beautiful, and the location and setting was perfect, but...”
Reviews.Author: cookyo
Reviews.Content: we were very disappointed in our room. They were much like any standard hotel room, nothing outstanding. The queen size bed was average, nothing luxarious, plus we had a set of bunkbeds. Cheap standard bed coverings. I have slept in nicer beds in a Hampton Inn. I wish we had asked to be upgraded. It is nice that you have the boat as transportation to the Contemporary Resort , Wilderness Campground, and Magic Kingdom. The Artist Point Restaurant was outstanding. We were on the Deluxe Disney dining plan and of all the upscale restaurants that we ate dinner at, this restaurant was the best. If you plan on having dinner at the nicer restaurants, I highly recommend the Deluxe Dining Plan. I totaled up our dollars compared to points and we got more than our monies worth. I don't understand why they tell you there are no openings when you call for reservations but we were able to just walk into most. The Whispering Canyon Cafe was a lot of fun & the food was good. Just don't ask for Ketchup! The smaller cafe was always busy, but had a great variety of foods and snacks. The build your own yogurt with fresh fruit was yummy and the coffee was very good. I picked this resort because it was listed as "ROMANTIC" with lots of little secluded spots. It was far from romantic because it was all families and lots of kids. The lobby was always bustling and we did enjoy just sitting in it and people watching. We never did find the secluded spots outside. I hoped to use the spa hot tub but could not get near it as it was full of kids every time we tried. WHEN is Disney going to build an ADULT ONLY nice resort, or at least an adult only spa and pool? I don't plan on staying there again, and to be honest I think all Dsiney properties are highly over priced and over rated. We have visited all of them and stayed at three, all of which I feel are over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Far from "Magical"”
Reviews.Author: brmSt_Louis_MO
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Wilderness Lodge on an 8 day vacation. The Wilderness Lodge is far from what we expected and overall is disappointing. Let me give you a few positives and then the negatives about this resort. 1. The lobby of the hotel is very nice and entertaining for small children. Our two year old has really enjoyed the small bridges and streams. 2. The other common areas are very large and you can find plenty of areas to sit with your group without feeling like you are being crowded by the other guests The negatives to this resort are as follows: 1. The rooms are not a quality hotel. For example, we didn't even have hot water in the shower of one of our rooms. 2. The rooms are extremely small, the size of most NYC hotel rooms. 3. The rooms are furnished very poorly and lack the finishes of luxury hotels. The bathrooms are dingy and is really showing its age. I am confident this is all consistent with most of the rooms because I do have two rooms and they are both the same. 4. The LCDs TVs in the room have closed captioning on at all times on the HD channels and it can not be turned off. We found this out after calling the front desk during the Superbowl. 5. I paid for an upgrade on both rooms to be a "Courtyard View" and they are both on the second floor looking directly at the woods. I have been told that when I look to my right I see the Wilderness Villas and it has a "Courtyard" of which I am viewing. Not exactly what I had in mind considering the Wilderness Lodge does have a beautiful "Courtyard" overlooking the pool. I asked nicely to be moved and the front desk could not accomodate my request. 6. The valet parking does not answer the phone on a regular occassion and you have to call the bell hops to find the valet. A little disappointing especially considering the hotel and park have very light volumes. With all these issues we decided to try and just cut our losses and move to the Grand Floridian. My wife has stayed at the Flordian and had a wonderful experience. Overall, the Wilderness Lodge is not in the luxury class. I do understand that it was cheaper than some of the other Disney hotels. With this in mind, I asked to be change my reservation for the remaining 6 days to the Grand Floridian and I would pay the difference. I was told this could be done if I paid an additional 4 thousand dollars for 6 nights. This seemed a little ridiculous since when I booked the trip through Disney.com and we originally booked the Grand Floridian. The Disney travel consultant convinced us that the Wilderness is better for children and still of great quality. It was only $1200 more for both rooms for all 8 days and I was wanting to change after 6. I was told that I need to pay the "rack rate" difference which is insane when rooms are available. Overall, my experience has been far from "Magical". Forget the fact that I did not get the rooms that I paid and upgrade for, I did not have hot water in one of the showers, the rooms are on par with a Holiday Inn, I did expect a little of assistance from Disney. In no way has Disney tried to make my stay what I expected. I have no problem paying even $2500 more just to make it right, but the attitude of $4000 or take it or leave it seems to be a little crazy. If I had to do it all over again, either stay at the Floridian if you want a luxury hotel or just save yourself a lot of money with the other options. They did send my kids a picture Mickey and Cinderella worth about $5 because we were not happy with our "Courtyard View Room" Look at the other reviews like I did before I left. The reviews have been getting poorer and poorer over the past few weeks and I am not sure why. It seems that the Wilderness is going down hill in quality and service. At least that is my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Close call”
Reviews.Author: kitties
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 night stay at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. We booked using miles through a travel agent and were worried when we saw our room. It was a standard room that was in the corner of the hotel, dark, depressing, with a terrible view of the garbage dumpsters and a side parking lot. We went back to the front desk and immediately requested another room. We were unaware that a standard room is equipped with 2 double beds. In order to get a king bed, you have to move up a room class. Luckily, the front desk staff was very very nice and upgraded us with no charge and gave us a much better room. The view was ok. Still a parking lot but we could see the fireworks over the Magic Kingdom each night. The rooms are basic. Nothing special and a bit dark because of the color scheme. They have a refrigerator, which is nice. The bathroom was not very nice. The ceiling had rust on it but no mold. Overall pretty clean. The beds are comfortable and there was a ceiling fan which was nice. The room had a small balcony with a table and chairs, which we did not use, given there wasn't really anything to look at. It's also very very close to the balcony of the neighboring room. The room temperature was good and the AC was quiet. We could occasionally hear kids outside in the hall but overall it was pretty quiet. The concierge desk staff were very helpful. Being our first time at Disney, we didn't know it would be difficult to get dinner reservations at the Disney signature restaurants. We ate at Artist Point at the Wilderness Lodge, which was very good, and did not have difficulty with reservations there. However, when we made reservations at Jiko at Animal Kingdom Lodge and Narcoosie's at the Grand Floridian, we could not get reservations before 9pm. We booked the day before or day of, so likely we were booking too late. Both Jiko and Narcoosie's were wonderful. Staff were terrific as was the food. The dining options at Wilderness Lodge included Artist Point, fancy sit down with pacific northwest theme, Roaring Fork, cafeteria take out with sandwiches, soup, chili, chips, fresh fruit, baked goods, pizza, and hamburgers, and the Whispering Canyon Cafe that serves a sit down breakfast every morning. It's pretty loud and mostly for kids, but we found it pleasant enough as a couple. They serve BBQ for lunch and dinner but we didn't eat there except for breakfast. The fitness center was very nice. Plenty of cardio equipment including elliptical machines, treadmills, stationary bikes, as well as free weights, weight machines, and stability balls. The fitness center is always staffed and there are towels and cups for water from the water fountain (not the best tasting water... it seems to be an Orlando thing). The fitness center is in the Villas at Wilderness Lodge, a very short covered walk from the main hotel. We, in fact, had thought we'd booked a room at the Villas, which have kitchenettes, but found out after we arrived that our reservation was actually at the main hotel. Be careful, because it can be confusing. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. We would stay there again but would probably try Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge next time, which is right on the Animal Kingdom property with a view of the Savannah. The ambiance was of a smaller version of the Wilderness Lodge and not as loud. Beware of the standard rooms. The one we almost ended up in was pretty depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful disney property”
Reviews.Author: nugent17
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Wilderness Lodge and I must say I was very impressed. I have been to Disney many, many times and never wrote a review on any of their properties, but the Wilderness Lodge was different, and I would highly recommend it. It is a little more out of the way, yet very easy to get into the action when you choose. The Disney transportation system was very efficient and we never had to wait long. It is a really nice change of pace from all of the hustle and bustle of Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: cally1999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Wilderness Lodge for 12 nights from 16th Jan 09 - first time to Disney - Initial comment - Fantastic!!! what a lovely place to be - I was bowled over by the level of service not only in the hotel but throughout the whole of Disney World. The Hotel itself was quite spectacular and very well appointed - the outside space was particualrly impressive - Room wise I was relitavley impressed - it was very clean and comfortable with a large LG LCD and 2 King sized beds (I had my wife and 2 children 6 and 9 yrs with me) I found the room plenty big enough for the amount of time you spend in there, housekeeping was good. Food wise we had the dining plan and I booked all our table service meals well in advance (I would recommned this as even at this low season time every restaurant we booked at were turning away "spot" customers on the night DDP is well worth it by the way especially if you take my lead and book quality restaurants for the evening meals (some of our meals would have cost us $200 + had we been paying cash)- The parks were all out of this world!! we used a hire car from Hertz which was handy as we wanted to visit NASA, Discovery Cove and the Shopping malls - Cars and Fuel are cheap and Driving is easy so go for It! Overall a briliiant experience in a quality resort would definately do it again no question.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time of Our Lives”
Reviews.Author: melba1228
Reviews.Content: The second part of our honeymoon included a very brief (2 day) visit to Walt Disney World. Being on our honeymoon we asked for a hotel that might be less kid-friendly than others...this is not to be found at Walt Disney World but still we ended up with a very quiet room in the Lodge. The staff were very helpful and transportation to/from the various parks was top-notch. Upon checking-in you are given a room key that also acts as a credit card. Anytime you eat at any Disney-affiliated restaurant or buy any souvenir, you just hand over the card and you pay everything at the end of the trip. Check-out was easy as pie. We woke in the morning to find our boarding passes printed and hanging on our door. We took our luggage downstairs, handed it to the airport desk and didn't see it again until we arrived in Los Angeles. They have got transportation and people-moving down to a science. I would highly recommend this place to any guests who like the rustic, log-cabin feel.

Reviews.Title: “Just something about it....”
Reviews.Author: JMSC-92
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by stating that I agree with many of the complaints from other reviewers -- rooms are small and dark, and are starting to show signs of age. Additionally, the housekeeping and bell staff weren't as stellar as those we've encountered at other Disney property resorts. My luggage was misplaced upon arrival, and I overheard conversations by other guests who had the same experience. Finally, water transport service from the Magic Kingdom back to the hotel after fireworks was abysmally slow (although I think I overheard the captain state they were short one boat that evening, so what we experienced definitely wasn't the norm). However, this resort is absolutely beautiful, and the concierge, front desk, and food service staff members are superb. Additionally, this has a great workout facility in the Villa section of the resort. The resort is large, but it had a very intimate feel to it due to its somewhat isolated location in the woods. Despite the location, it is very convenient to the Magic Kingdom, Contemporary Hotel, and Fort Wilderness via water transport. I have a family member who has special food requirements, and I found it extremely easy to accomodate him in this resort. There is a small counter in the room over the refrigerator and away from the bathroom and other living areas of the room (I LOVE it when I don't need to use the vanity area to prepare food). Additionally, our close proximity to the Roaring Fork dining area allowed us to have a microwave, toaster, and paper goods available to us all day long. If you have special food requirements, definitely request a room close to the Roaring Fork. Speaking of food -- I am perplexed by the negative reviews regarding the food, as I am a picky eater and loved absolutely EVERYTHING we ate there. We made use of ALL of the food services available, including the Artist Point, Roaring Fork, Whispering Canyon, and even the bar menu, and everything was more reasonably priced and of much higher quality than anything we ate at the parks or other resorts. My gourmet-loving kids who usually order salmon over chicken fingers at restaurants RAVED about the juicy burgers and flat-bread pizzas. Yes, seating at the Roaring Fork is an issue, but I enjoyed taking our food back to the room and enjoyed eating on the balcony while enjoying the beautiful views. Although the Beach Club is still my favorite Disney resort, I loved the Wilderness Lodge and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, ugly bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Thrillrider
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WL for two nights over the past MLK weekend and had a great time. The hotel is gorgeous, both inside and out. We had a king bed room (non-handicapped) that was a courtyard view that also bordered the lobby. There have been a few complaints about the size of the rooms, but I did not think our room was particularly small. There were two sinks outside of the bathroom which were great for getting ready in the morning. My only negative comment relates to the bathroom itself. It was an extremely dark and depressing bathroom. It looked like the type of bathroom you might find at a low end Days Inn. It just didn't really seem to fit with all the other fine elements of the hotel. Since we were staying over the MLK weekend, we were not sure what to expect with the boat service to the Magic Kingdom. However, we went first thing in the morning and there really was not much of a line for the boat which was great. Also, we went to the MK for extra magic hours on Sunday night which ended at 2 AM. We caught the boat back around 2:15 AM so they do run late if the Magic Kingdom is open late for whatever reason.

Reviews.Title: “There's good news and bad news”
Reviews.Author: HopSkipJump
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to DW. I didn't do much research and I didn't know what to expect but I wanted to get away to a warm place and not have to drive so I picked the hotel based upon the reviews I saw on this website. I'll say, in general, that I arrived during an unforeseen cold spell which brought rain and cold temps and caused lots of cancellations so the hotel seemed pretty empty most of the time -- strange since it is such a giant resort. For example, on a couple of occasions, I sat in one of the rocking chairs in front of the giant stone fireplace in the 5-story wood-beamed lobby and sipped my tea and finished the murder mystery I was reading. It felt like staying at a really big, family cabin. I'm not sure that it would feel this way under ordinary circumstances (and full occupancy). The lobby and the facilities are what make the place unique. The "spring" at the end of the lobby which feeds a waterfall and creek which spill into the end of the swimming pool is one-of-a-kind, along with Mallard ducks who had no qualms letting us share their river/swimming pool with them! There was a slide which had the same jerky left/right movement (at the end) that a lot of the Disney theme park rides do. Intentional? I ate breakfast in the snack bar every morning and I thought the variety was ample: muffins, yogurt parfaits, waffles, cereals, juices, etc. Check in was swift but it took 3 times to find a room that was acceptable. The first was a ground floor room that was dark and faced onto the grounds between the hotel and the adjacent 'cabins' (which was another wing of the hotel with suites that had kitchens). There was no wall or landscaping to provide any privacy in the room and since there was a path running past the room (at some distance away) it still felt a little bit "non-private" so I suggested a room higher up. The second room reeked of cigarette smoke -- strange for a hotel that, according to the concierge had become "non smoking" over a year ago. The third room did the trick, facing onto the "cabins" on the fifth floor. In spite of the grandeur of the rest of the resort, the rooms were kind of average. (I wouldn't call them small as others have). After all, they had 2 queen size (or 1 king size) beds in them plus a dresser and a table with a couple of chairs. I've stayed in hotels in NY that could barely fit ONE double bed.! But, the feeling of smallness is intensified because the rest of the place is so large. Still the room had plenty of little quirks. Here are some of them: The decor was supposed to be "rustic cabin" and it was, in some places but then looked kind of Holiday Inn in others. For example. some of the light fixtures were ordinary modern fixtures that they painted "to look old". Kind of strange. There was a flat screen TV which I never turned on and granite counters in the bathroom but the bed was a little bit lumpy and uneven. (There were two in the room but I didn't bother to try the other one). The toilet was one of those "water saver" "exploding noise" ones with the button in the middle of toilet lid that you would press and the water would be sucked down in a split second. I found it to work about 50% of the time; during other times, it would sputter a little and then I'd have to wait for it to reset (30-40 seconds) and I'd try it again.. The bathroom was split into 2 parts; toilet and tub/shower in one room; sink in the other. The door to the 'tollet room' opened OUT and literally banged into the left half of the sink counter The toilet/tub room had an exhaust fan on the ceiling which was connected to a motion sensor so if you reached into that room to grab your bathing suit that was hanging from the shower rod, the fan would turn on and it would stay on after you walked away for about 2 minutes. Conversely, if you were in the bathroom and you were motionless for a while (I was doing some tourist-related reading), the fan would stop until you moved your head or arm. It took a little to get use to. I found the refrig to be noisy (I'm a light sleeper) so I turned it off the first night. Lastly, the draperies were in 2 parts. The right portion would not pull shut (there was a wand for pulling it toward the center of the window). A previous guest had pulled on the curtain, not on the wand and had twisted the mechanism that allowed the drapery to slide on the track. I got on a chair and bent a piece of the drapery bracket until it was straight and I had no further problem with it. The people at the concierge desk were absolutely wonderful, recommending restaurants, transportation options, etc. All in all, I'll rate it as "3 circles". I probably wouldn't stay there again since the best part is the common areas which I could visit anytime without staying there. I also thought it strange that a huge resort like that didn't have a business center. I left my laptop at home but had to do some business but the only access to a computer was at the Disney Contemporary Resort which was a short boat ride from the Wilderness's dock. Not a big deal, just kind of silly: waiting for the boat: 10 minutes; riding to the Contemporary: 5 minutes; waiting for the return boat: 5 minutes; riding back (via a different route: 10 minutes) So, that's 30 minutes of transit so i could spend less than 10 minutes on the computer. It just seemed silly since the Concierges at the Wilderness all had internet-equipped computers. Couldn't they find a tiny space to hook up a couple of computers for the guests who don't want to drag their own from home? I visited a number of the resorts and I think the Disney Beach Club will be my next choice.

Reviews.Title: “All about the Disney Magic!”
Reviews.Author: drofnah
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel for a conference. It was WONDEFUL. The rooms are somwehat small and dark, but the beds are very comfortable,and I loved the little patio. The restaurants are fantastic...and service was... Well, it's Disney... If you haven't been to Disney, you don't yet understand the service. It truly is like no place else on earth. You could rent bikes, go on the nature trail, enjoy the hot springs. I also like the private boat to take you from your hotel to the Magic Kingdom. I love to travel in general... but there is no service anywhere I've been that compares with Disney! Buy something in the store? Youd ont' have to carry it with you--it'll go back to your hotel... Leave your credit cards at home... Your room key gets you into all of the parks and pays for all of your merchandise... Oh, I miss Disney already! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “4th Stay in 6 Years and going back!”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyR
Reviews.Content: First stayed here in 2002 and the quality has remained at its high standard! Rooms have always been great with excellent room service and maid service. (Leave tips for the maids and you may recieve a towel animal) On one stay we recieved a car park view room due to high occupancy levels however were quickly and efficently moved the next day to a forest view room! Staff are more than helpful at reception with room and hotel queries, park information and reservations. Lobby can become quite noisy due to restaurant activities! Roaring Forks fast service food can become extremely busy at mealtimes to best to go slightly earlier or later. Pool can also get quite busy in afternoon, beach is much more peaceful and provides more space and a slight breeze which is always appreciated! Rental of a water mouse for a few hours is a must to tour round the lake near magic kingdom and the other hotels and is great fun but beware of sun bun while doing this!! New family photopass photographer cna be booked at this hotel. allows guests to get family photos taken around the hotel and printed or put in a CD to take home - we were lucky to experience this during the trial for free and is well worth doing ! Boat to magic Kingdom is definatly unsafe and overcrowded after fire works and spectromagic so bus is a much safer and generally quicker option. Doors were blocked on the boat and strollers / prams are supposed to be folded along with wheelchairs and this was never enforced! Overall a great resort and complex!

Reviews.Title: “I didn't know Disney could get any better!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyLover29
Reviews.Content: This was our family's 12th visit to Disney since 94. We try to go every year. We have a lot of experience with several hotels on property. We have stayed at all levels. This was our third Deluxe Resort on Disney property. As you may know there is a lot of hype that goes along with the Wilderness Resort. I was skeptical that it could really be THAT good. We wanted to try it so we booked the resort through CRO. My mother scored a AAA rate for 2 courtyard view rooms. We got extremely lucky as I know these are hard to come by. Our travel party consisted of myself, my husband, our three daughters aged 16, 11, & 8. We also brought my oldest daughter's best friend and of course my mom! EVERYONE loved it. This experience totally lived up to what everyone says about this resort. The lobby is unbelievable. The Christmas tree in the lobby blew us away when we walked in. The courtyard is truly amazing. We took the boat to the Magic Kingdom. The bus service to the other parks was very good. The pool is beautiful!!! There were planned activiites every day that sounded really neat. The staff bent over backwards and were very nice. The clientele there seemed to be very laid back. Lots of families having a really great time. I loved this as much as Animal Kingdom Lodge. I can't decide which of those is my favorite. My family couldn't decide either. They all loved this. I highly recommend staying here with any age. You won't be disappointed !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Costly, Small Rooms, Not For Teenagers, Can't use Hot Tub”
Reviews.Author: melody847
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights from 12/31/08-1/8/09. The Wilderness Lodge is very beautiful with a wonderful lobby and layout. We had stayed here once before when our kids were younger and it was perfect. No longer. The STANDARD VIEW ROOM for $350 was much too small for the four of us. Now that my teenagers are adult size, we were very cramped. I also found that Disney no longer has the customer service that we have grown used to. I was told that the WL had rollaway beds. I have a son and daughter and need 3 sleeping areas(the bunk beds are for 4'10" and under). My husband and I insist on sleeping together on our vacations and not with our teens! I had called Disney a dozen times because of numerous booking problems with our park tickets and eating reservations. Found that they no longer can be counted on for accurate information. When inquiring about the rollaway, I called the hotel directly to be sure we would get one. I asked for a manager and was assured there would be no problem. Well, guess what, no rollways on the property. We were given a blow up mattress to put on the floor. Now, if my kids were young they would of thought it cool. My 16 and 17 year old did not. Also, the room was so small there was no place to put it. They had to move out the only table in the room to fit it. The room did not have a reading chair, the only place to sit is on the bed. The manager refused any compensation or upgrade and explained that many hotels do have rollways but this one never has and the manager I spoke with was confused . We were also upset that the hot tub was filled with little kids, no matter the time of day. Sorry, no longer for us at these prices along with the aggravation of extremely crowded parks during our entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: Clara9
Reviews.Content: Visited over Christmas of 2008 with a young child. Very pleased with our stay. The staff were very friendly, rooms are very clean, and the rooms had good views. Thought the boat trip to MK was great, never waited more than 10 mins. Parks too busy at this time of year and most rides had a waiting time of 2 hours. The extra magic hours are a great bonus. Nightmare to make reservations to eat at the hotel as they are booked for months in advance. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge is our favorite resort”
Reviews.Author: yellowdiamond13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Wilderness Lodge many times. This past visit was great. They have remodeled since our previous visit. We love this resort because it has transportation via boat to Magic Kingdom as well as bus service to the other parks. The resort is very warm and cozy. It is not too large and the dining is exceptional. The Artist Point is one of the best places to eat at WDW. This resort caters to families with children as some of the rooms have bunk beds. If you want a quiet retreat for couples, I would not recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Magic at the Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Bridget1720
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a magical five night stay at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. 90% of our stay was wonderful. Things we liked about the wilderness lodge: -beautiful lobby and grounds -nice pool area -two hot tubs -Artist Point-fancy restaurant, had an excellent dinner there -Roaring Forks- quick serve restaurant was dependable -good housekeeping -convenient to the Magic Kingdom -authentic national park lodge feeling Things we disliked: -their version of a "king-sized" bed is actually two twins beds pushed together with a king sized fitted sheet over it. not as comfortable as a real king sized mattress. -front desk attendents didn't seem to know the answers to ANY of our questions. Overall we had a wonderful time. The hotel was crowded but not too noisy. It is the kind of hotel you could stay at all day and skip the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice huge lobby but small room”
Reviews.Author: SG2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wilderness lodge for our 3rd trip to Disney. This was our first stay in a Deluxe resort - pricey for a small room. Lobby is breathtaking huge beautifully decorated. We had a standard view room on the 5th floor that faced magic kingdom could see the castle from the room although looking down at service area and a slimy green colored water on one side and the smoke from the restaurant was not optimal for sitting out. Room was small with limited walking space with 2 Queen bed bathroom a much tighter squeeze but it was clean service was excellent. Boat ride to MK and buses to other parks were great.

Reviews.Title: “Like yellowstone only disney style”
Reviews.Author: mountiamsandcanyons
Reviews.Content: My stay at the wilderness lodge on 12-7 through 12-13 was a great time with the kids ages 14 and 11. First off we were upgraded to a 6th floor room with a great view of the fireworks at no additional cost. The room itself is comfortable enough, it has 2 queen size beds,table,chairs closet ,full bath,outside vanity with 2sinks and a clever shelf and storage area for all the bath needs. Balcany has small table and 2 chairs.The main sleeping area has tv and drawer storage and the front entry has a dresser with hidden fridge. We never felt cramped or crowded however i can see how a family of 4 adults or family with teenagers would feel a little cramped for space. of all the disney deluxe hotels i think wilderness has the smallest size rooms.The room also has a ceiling fan and wood carved animals on the bed post. The hotel itself was great. The attention to detail was amazing looked alot like the lodge at yellowstone. The pool complex was good only used it one night as the weather was cold most our stay. there were 2 hot tubs one was warmer than the other so check them both out if you go. There was this float parade that went by the boat dock at around 9 30 each night if your out it was worth a look. The on site dinning was good the roaring fork fast food cort worked well for us on our first day in. They have pizza,salad,hot and cold sandwiches,snacks,drinks ,and chips. Also the refillable mug is $13.00 and you can refill it with anything you want soda,milk,hot chocolate,orange juice ect..... the only draw back is only at the hotel not the parks. It would be cheaper to pack some 2 litters with your checked bags .Tipps for the kids---- on some weekdays the gameroom has free games available. check to see.This was the case for us on wednesday and thursday night. The gift shop had all the stuff you would want including drinks,snacks,souviners ,tumms,ect.............. this is where your packages from the rest of the disney world will be delivered if you have them sent to the hotel. nice free service to have.If you are useing the magical express , the bags showed up in the room sometime after we checked in no problems just dont expect to see your bags anytime soon after your flight lands may take 5 hours to get to the room. no one was dissapointed all had a great time this place gets a high marks on my list. last thing tranportation--- the boat service the magic kingdome does not start until a half hour before park opening. waiting too early is not recomended. the buss service is ok for everywhere elce.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: TinLizzy90
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay at the Wilderness Lodge. Just us adults, and we had a great time. Our balcony overlooked the pool at the villas, and we ate at both the Whispering Canyon and Roaring Forks, and had drinks at the Territory Lounge. The room was clean and housekeeping service was excellent. All of the staff members that I encountered (front desk, gift shop, wait staff, and bartenders) were cheerful and friendly! The lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays, with a huge tree and decorations everywhere in the public areas. I love the Disney touch, and will return to this hotel again and again. Boat transport to the Magic Kingdom and the Contemporary Resort is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “One of Disney's best!!”
Reviews.Author: vaderbarb
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was a tad concerned with some of the reviews I read. We are a married couple in our 30's NO kids and just wanted to enjoy Disney. Our room was on the 4th floor facing the pool/lake. It was quiet, until the elecetric water parade went through and we could hear people taking in the hallway, But none of this took place between 10pm-7am so you can sleep. Its Disney you exspect to hear excited kids! It was to cold our week to use the pool even though it was heated, getting out would of been the freezing problem but should I go back when its warmer I will deffenatly use this pool it was very nice and had a slide built in. We ate at the "quick service" resturant it was basic and clean just what you need after or b4 a busy Disney day. The boat trans portation to the Magic Kingdom was nice. The buses might of been faster but had no charm. We never waited more then 10 min for either a bus or boat. One night we stayed late for Mickeys christmas at magic kingdom, It was a FREEZING cold night we got back to the hotel at midnight. Now this hotel boostes cabin charm but since I was freezing I ran to the massive fireplace they have and it was hardly lit !! It should of been roaring the entire time to go with the atmosphere! I asked for an extra blanket that same night thinking housekeeping was gone I was planning to wait at the desk for one..NOPE they brought it right to me! The room was cleaned daily but just tidy up, new towels. Only towel art the first day, That was a dissapointment. The grounds were nicly kept. I recomend this hotel and will return. While there we went to other disney resorts and didnt like any of them ( ones we can afford anyways) nearly as much as this one. It is nicely decorated clean and good locaton. Feel free to email me any questions.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: john02345
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a 21 night stay at the Wilderness Lodge in November. This was our 22nd trip to WDW, and we had previously stayed at the Polynesian several times, plus other hotels in the Downtown area, mainly the Hilton. We couldn't get our dates at the Hilton this time so decided to go with our oft-made "We must stay at the Wilderness Lodge one year..." intention. After our stay, this has now changed to "We must ALWAYS stay at the Wilderness Lodge" ! I could write page after page about the hotel, and how much we enjoyed it, but I'd just be repeating many of the good reviews that appear on this site. From the moment we walked thru the front door and checked in, to the time we boarded the Disney Magical Express to head to the airport there was not one single point on which I could fault the hotel, its facilities, and its staff - (If Jasmine in the Roaring Fork is reading this we'd like to say "Hello! We miss your charming smile and friendly start to each day, but we'll be back next year!"). The Mousekeeping - in our experience - was excellent, with regular "surprises" of toys and dolls made from towels - PLUS the room was always well cleaned. The staff in the shops and the restaurants were very helpful and friendly, and the health club was well equipped. I think I'll stop typing at this stage and book my next stay at what I feel is Disney's best WDW hotel! J.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool area”
Reviews.Author: disneytraveler04052
Reviews.Content: Expensive!!!! Great hotel if money is not a concern. Family of 4 will squeeze into a room but there will be standing room only. We paid extra for a "Woods View" room. Kudos to the one tree we had between us and the dumpster. (it was collected promply at 530AM the entire week there room 4083) Hotel was very nice and the staff was on hand to tend to your every need. Food here was OK but pricey. Transportation was good . Both the bus and boat ran very smoothly even though Disney was at capacity. Overall good time.

Reviews.Title: “Very magical this time of year.”
Reviews.Author: fquinter
Reviews.Content: In an effort to be helpful, my review will include some additional information beyond The Wilderness Lodge. The Wilderness Lodge is a beautiful resort inside and out. I returned from a five night stay on November 28th. Several months ago, while planning this magical Christmas time experience for my family of four, daughter 11 and son 8, I posted a forum thread asking for the deluxe property that had the best Christmas magic. The Wilderness lodge was the unanimous choice. Indeed it was beautifully decorated for Christmas. The atrium lobby is home to a six story Christmas tree, and there are wreaths all over the resort, and many, many smaller Christmas trees adding flare to the experience. We had table service dinner reservations at other deluxe properties. From a lobby point of view, I had no regrets in choosing the Wilderness Lodge. It is very roomy, warm, and I really appreciated the Christmas music and magic of the decorations for my children. We had a courtyard bunk bed room overlooking the time share villas wingâ€™s pool. I commend my Disney travel planner for accommodating my reservation request of an upper floor with a view, away from the noise of the lobby. We had room 5148. The bunk beds were my kidâ€™s request, but I will not be asking for those anymore. Both of my kids were nursing head bruises by the end of our stay from not being used to having limited head room when getting in and out of the bottom bunk. And, these bunk-beds are well made and unforgiving to a childâ€™s head. Other than those occasional tears of pain, the room is very satisfying. Definitely enough room to be comfortable. There was a two drawer chest that housed a mini-fridge at the bottom, and a three drawer dresser. There is a double vanity that had enough shelving for all of our necessities. I found that I could store three of our suit cases under the bottom shelf of the vanity. That freed up more space in the closet for hanging clothes and dirty linens. In case you have time, there is a flat screen television on top of the three drawer dresser. We did eat in the Roaring Forks food area for one lunch and each breakfast. It was the best lunch I had while at Disney World. For a resort with 727 rooms, there are only 64 places to sit in the eating area. Overall the food choices were filling and tasty. This was my familyâ€™s third trip to Disney World, the second of which we stayed on property. Both times we had the Disney Dining Plan of one table service, one counter service, and one snack per day. It is really a good deal, but has changed since we stayed two years ago, mostly with the table service meal. Two years ago gratuity was included and everyone received an appetizer, entrÃ©e, and desert. Now the gratuity is additional, and there is only an entrÃ©e and desert. I was told the â€œsnackâ€� for each day is good for items less than $4. With that said, some things are cheaper to simply pay out of your pocket. The Mercantile within the property can allow you to get more from your snack dollars. The Mercantile handles everything from apparel to souvenirs, to milk and beer. I learned by the 4th day it was smarter to buy milk and water from the mercantile. Doing this allowed us to get a true food snack with our snack of the day. Also for purchase is a property exclusive refillable mug for 12.99. If planning on going before the end of the year, you should know that it is extremely busy! I leaned on the Birnbaum guide during my planning for this trip. Based on his words and a friend of mine who went last year during the week of Thanksgiving, I felt sure it would be less crowded than my previous end of May trip in 2006. It was much, much worse. While waiting on a ride, one of the cast members told me his daily memo on attendance was 30,000 in the parks. I asked what was the lowest he had seen and he said 10,000 in September. There were electric cars and strollers in every direction! The on property status does allow for early and late hours to the park on certain days, not to mention the â€œfast passâ€� option that accompanies your own property status. You can plan on waiting 45-90 minutes on rides such as Soarin, Test Track, the new Toy Story experience, etc. At least it wasnâ€™t hot. We were able to wear shorts and t-shirts from 11 am till about 4 pm. It was mid 70â€™s during the day, and 50â€™s at night. The pools are heated to 83 degrees. There are three things you canâ€™t forget to bring: money, patience, and a little more money. I love Disney World and hope to take my family there again, but everything has a price tag. If you are taking stroller aged children, your going to be exhausted. And, Disney is charging $15 a day for a stroller rental. Have a magical time

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Wilderness Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoResortsFan
Reviews.Content: Arguably the best Disney Hotel, in my opinion. Beautiful grounds. Tons to do. Awesome location. A total blast!

Reviews.Title: “A True Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: bn21
Reviews.Content: Just walking into Wilderness Lodge was worth the visit. But staying at the Lodge was pure Disney. The atmosphere in and out of the lodge was like being at the lodge at Yellowstone Natl. park. The staff was helpful and polite. Thanks for the Magic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: kritt2009
Reviews.Content: WOW! We just got back from our Disney Vacation and it was the best vacation we ever took. The Wilderness Lodge was great. The staff, the atmosphere, the surroundings, the pool, the rooms (w/ bunkbeds) - everything was wonderful. The staff was so nice- The girl checking us in even let my daughter help her check us in. She felt so special. The only person that wasn't very nice was the girl at the photo pass desk - it seemed like she didn't want to be bothered and lacked a personality. But other than that, it was a perfect stay. The wait for bus rides to the parks weren't too overly bad. The longest we had to wait was about 20 minutes, but usually we got on within about 5-10 minutes. The boat ride to Magic Kingdom was the best. The food places at the resort didn't really have many choices, but we had plenty of choices to eat at other places on the dining plan. Our favorites were The Garden Grill in Epcot with Chip and Dale, Mickey and Pluto. Le Cellier in Epcot was really good. and The Coral Reef in Epcot was good. We did a breakfast with Donald in Animal Kingdom - That was really good too. I can't say enought on how great it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoCalvin
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to Disney World with a package from Expedia. The only thing about doing that is you cannot contact the hotel until 24 hours before check-in to make sure your room request was received. And you also can't get the Disney food plan either.
