My wife called the day before and everything seemed fine with our room reservation. We rented a car at the airport and drove to the Lodge. When we arrived we checked in (we stayed for 6 nights) and the room was nice. We had asked for a room with a queen and a bunk bed but they were all gone. When we got our room it had 2 queens. There are 4 of us (2 kids, 5 and 8) so we called the front desk and they immediately brought up an air mattress. The woman set it up for us too and we put it on the floor right next to the second bed. Our kids had a blast bouncing on it! It worked out great to have my oldest sleep in one bed and our daughter on the mattress. I had read reviews about not getting a room that faced the lobby as the Whispering Canyon Cafe restaurant is anything but whispering. Our room did in fact face the lobby but we were above the restuarant (a few floors up) and did not hear much. I would advice if you do or can sleep with a "white noise" machine, it probably won't hurt. But to tell the truth, we were so exhausted every night, you could have landed a plane next to us and we wouldn't have noticed. I think if you were across from the restaurant it may be a bit more noisy, but coming out every morning and seeing the beautiful lobby and the view out the windows to the lake, it was worth it. Also, as an extra bonus our room balcony faced Magic Kingdom. The couple nights we went back early at 9 PM we would still go out and get to watch the fireworks! Very cool. The hotel does a very good job at making sure you are happy. When we arrived with our car we had to get a parking permit and leave it on the dashboard. The one thing we did not realize was on our second day when we went to another park and drove, that permit got us into the parking lot for free. Saved us $12 right there, not a huge amount but add it up over 5 days with 5 different parks.... The Wilderness Lodge is very convienent to Magic Kingdom. You can just go down to the dock (a short walk) and the boats come about every 15 minutes. The longest we ever had to wait was 10 minutes. The one thing you may want to avoid is waiting by the hotels dock after dark. They have some lights there and when we came back one night you could just see the millions of mosquitos eating the people alive who were waiting. You can wait up near the pool and then wait until you hear the boats horn, they blow it about 3 minutes before they are tied up to the dock and ready to start boarding. The pool is beautiful with a great waterfall feature above the pool. The bar at the pool is the place to get a drink anytime as the bar tenders are fast and pour a good drink. The hot tubs are nice and comfy and you can watch your kids in the larger pool while there. The restaurants. We had breakfast at the Whispering Cafe one morning and it was ok but nothing special. Typical family stuff. The staff does have fun and on Friday night it was very loud there with every other person having a Birthday. We did not try Artist Point but it looked very nice. We really enjoyed the Roaring Fork the most. It is a quick service restaurant with pizza, chicken nuggets and hamburgers for the kids. They have the same for adults but also have some great gourmet sandwitches. Turkey with brie, roast beef with a light blue cheese spread, really everything was good. We did not buy one of the cups but probably would next time. The Roaring Fork was also a great place to grab breakfast. In the morning my wife and son would go down and get coffees and bagels for us and pancakes or cereal for the kids. By the time they got back I would be showered and getting everything ready, it saved us a good 20-30 minutes a day. On the second to last evening, we were exhausted from the day at the park and went back to the hotel early. We were all just sitting around and we decided to go for a walk. Just off the lobby of the hotel, we found a very nice game room with arcade games. A fun place to spend an hour and play games, get your picture in a photo booth, etc.. You also have to try the small speed boats. Very fun. You can rent them down by the beach area (they also have very cool bikes to rent there) and the boats are very fun. My wife had never driven a boat and it was easy for anyone to do. They are 2 seaters and don't go to fast, the best is to have either one adult or and adult and child in one. 2 adults I think you may not go very quick. Overall we had a great time at this hotel. The staff was very nice and courtious (every staff member said "hello, how are you today" in the hallways when walking by. Even the maids. We will return here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It.”
Reviews.Author: volt11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from October 24th - November 1, 2008. I Have to say from the moment we arrived we were blown away by the beauty of the hotel. This was my 35th trip to Disney and from now on I will stay only at the Wilderness Lodge. We had no complaints, everything worked/operated flawlessly. The front desk was helpful. The check in and check out was smooth. If you read all of the other reviews the only negative reviews appear to come from selfish individuals who appear to have the me, me, me complex and love to just complain. This hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Magical !!!”
Reviews.Author: RustyGriswold
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first week of October at the Wilderness Lodge Villas--2 Bedroom, 2 Bath with family room and full kitchen--very clean and kids loved the towel creatures waiting for us. Had groceries delivered thru gardengrocerer--great plan. We ate all of our breakfasts at the villa and used the disney meal plan for our snack, counter meal and sit down dinners at the parks and resorts(ate at the Boma at the Animal Kingson Lodge, Kona Cafe at the Polynesian, Crown & Rose at Epcot, Whispering Canyon twice and San Angel in Epcot). The ambiance of the wilderness lodge was so peacefull, it was nice for downtime after a hectic day in the parks, truely felt like I we were in a lodge of the upper northwest, loved the pines, flower and landscaping all around. We enjoyed both pools, but ended our days in the quieter villa pool, be sure to rent a suree bike at the rental shop and bike over to the disney camp grounds and take a pony ride for the kids. Magic kingdom is a quick 8 minute boat ride, and bus ride to MGM, Epcot and AK was 15-20 min. Really enjoyed the meal at the Whispering canyon cafe, very casual--kids do toy pony races around the restaurant during dinner and the food was very good (I very picky about my bbq as we are from North Carolina)--definitely go with the all you can eat family style (ribs, chicken, brisket and pork, corn on the cob, great homemade mash potatoes and deserts). Service from the staff was great!!--no complaints, very accomodating. We would absolutely stay at the Lodge again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Wilderness Lodge !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrismikeNewYork
Reviews.Content: We we're at the Wilderness Lodge from 10/09/08 to 10/14/08 I must say I've stayed at other Disney resorts and always had a great stay but after staying at the Widerness lodge it's going to be hard to stay elsewhere. Everything from mousekeeping to our room - the grounds, just wonderful. I read some negative reviews and we're worried. But I must say those few must have had just a bad day or very very high expictations. For a holiday weekend the service was great and the parks not really crowded. Hopeing to go again next year .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: chazleen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a Disney vacation where we stayed at Disneys Wilderness Lodge with our daughter, son in law and two grandchildren ages 4 and 1. It was our second visit though our first stay at the Lodge. We had a woods view room where we were able to watch the fireworks every night (Rm 5028). The room was very clean, comfortable and a good size for us but somewhat small for our daughter and family. I discovered that all of the rooms are the same size (regular rooms-not the suites or villas) but you pay extra for the views.The towels were very soft and the bed very comfortable. The lodge itself is beautiful and has so many little surprises. The majority of the people who work there were very nice (I found that only those at the concierge desk were not very happy looking and sometimes seemed annoyed that we had questions). The counter service area was a bit small but the food was always good (same menu everyday but we liked everything they had). The pool and beach area were always clean and never overly crowded. You actually swim with the ducks! We were able to take the bus to any destination but chose the boat transportation most of the time. We attended the Hoop-de-do review and it was great-alot of fun. The night we attended many of us had taken the boat to the campground and were caught in a downpour-soaking everyone on board. We all ran into the Trading Post to get dry clothes and it was pretty funny to see about 30 of us all dressed in Mickey sweatshirts and shorts! The staff at the review provided warm dry towels for us which was very thoughtful. That night I lost my cell phone when changing into dry clothes and it was returned to me a day later-thanks to the honesty of the person who found it. Of course Magic Kingdom and Epcot were wonderful and we had a great time with our family. If you are looking for a nice place to stay with alternative transportation and wonderful views-choose the Wilderness Lodge or campground.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MomsView
Reviews.Content: Warm and Welcoming Lodge feel. Beautifully kept facility and grounds. Convenient access to the parks ~ the kids loved taking the ferry boats. We really enjoyed our Disney Vacation ~ having a great place to rest our heads at night....made the the trip even better!! Nobody does it like Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: lschmitty
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Disney's Wilderness Lodge from Oct 3rd - Oct 6th for a girls' weekend. We fell in love with the Wilderness Lodge in 2000 during our first family Disney vacation. This was our 3rd stay, and I have to say that I think this was the best yet. We arrived at around noon after a VERY tough morning (missed our flight, had to re-book with another airline...NOT a great way to start a vacation with a 4 year old!), and were pleased to learn that we had been upgraded from a standard view to a courtyard view. Having stayed in a courtyard view previously, I knew that rooms facing the main pool could be very loud, so I asked for a quieter room where my daughter could nap mid-day. The cast member went to her manager, and to a certain computer to find us a wonderful room with a view of the villas pool and a sideways view of the beach and lake~room 4158. It was lovely to come back to the hotel and sit out on the balcony listening to the soft music coming from the villas while my daughter napped. On previous visits, we felt that the decor in the rooms had been a bit tired looking and in need of refreshing, and I was so happy to see that this room had recently been renovated. The furniture, double sinks and vanity, carpet and bedding all seemed fresh and new and sparkling clean. I would definitely recommend asking for a renovated room; it was a pleasant surprise. Mousekeeping was great...towel animals every day, and my daughter's princess accessories were always arranged creatively arround the room. Our room was always made up by the time we came back for a nap around 2:00 each day, and we always had plenty of towels and toiletries. We had a limited view of the Electrical Water Pageant from our balcony, but found it much nicer to view from one of the outdoor verandahs on the 4th or 5th floor off the lobby. The only negative about the rooms is that they are small...perfect for 2 or maybe 3 people, but a family of 4 would have a tough time. We had a few quick meals at Roaring Forks and was impressed with the selection of grilled items, sandwiches, soups and grab-n-go items. We got our dinner to go the first night after an ehausting day, and it was a nice change from the hustle and bustle of the restaurant to have a quiet meal in our room. If you are a coffee or soda drinker, the refillable mugs for $12.99 + ta are a great value...and a nice souvenir. I probably got my money's worth by the second day with my drinks as well as filling up on drinks for my daughter on the way out to the parks. You can also fill a cup with ice water for no charge...another great way to save a little money. We also ate dinner one night at Whispering Canyon, and were disappointed. Our food took nearly an HOUR to get to our table, and by that time, my daughter was melting down. When I asked if HER food could at least be brought out (what does it take to put some mac-n-cheese on a plate with some fruit?), our server apologized for the "slight delay" (?!) and brought our food. We've had good luck at this restaurant in the past, so I'm guessing it was just an off night, or our server was just poor. Either way, the food was good and it is a fun place for the kids. It was also nice to be home already after dinner...no bus, boat or monorail ride to get to bed! The weather was hot and humid, so we were able to take advantage of the pool a couple of times. My daughter LOVED the shallow kids pool, and I had a blast just watching her with my feet in the water. I also had a surprisingly good Margarita from the Trout pass pool bar. The location of this resort was ideal for us since we only visited Magic Kingdom and Epcot this trip. The boat ride to MK is so convenient and enjoyable, and I was able to roll my daughter right onto the boat without having to break down the stroller. This was a lifesaver on those frequent occasions when she was too tired to walk. We also took the boat to the Contemporary, and then hopped on the monorail to get to Epcot...again, no need to break down those strollers...HIGHLY recommended. All-in-all, this is a WONDERFUL resort with fantastic Disney service and all the amenities you would epect from a high-end accommodation. Staying here is a vacation unto itself, and such a pleasant respite from the crazy busy Disney theme parks. My daughter had such a great time skipping through the lobby, across the bridge over the bubbling spring, shopping in the Mercantile, and just eploring the many nooks and crannies around the resort. I would stay here again without hesitation. We'll be heading back to Disney in September '09 with the whole family, and would happily stay here if we weren't travelling with 5 people. We'll be trying out the Polynesian, but will miss our home at the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge is GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: alfritz77
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Wilderness Lodge in Disney World. The building is beautiful, you can sit and stare at the lobby for hours and not get bored. Our room was clean and neat and our bed was very comfortable. We liked the convenience of having the snack service down stairs and no a mile walk away like other resorts on disney property. Transportation was great, you can boat to the Magic Kingdom or to the other resorts on Bay Lake, or you can take a bus to the other parks. All the conveniences of a deluxe without the huge price of staying on the monorail. We booked again for next year and will be staying at the Wilderness Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful getaway at WDW”
Reviews.Author: Sidhuri
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge is great choice when visiting Disney. While the location gives the feeling being in a remote, peaceful wilderness, you are actually quite close to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot. The boat travel to and from the Magic Kingdom is a real treat. The public areas are what rate the Wilderness Lodge above average. The lobby is simply stunning, the pool area is beautiful and there are plenty of nooks and crannies in which to relax with coffee, an adult beverage or a book. The rooms are showing some wear and, in my book, rate as average. Once nice feature is the double sinks outside the bathroom--great for more than one person trying to get ready. My courtyard view room had a great view of the pool area and part of the lake. This hotel can be expensive as compared to non-Disney hotels of the same caliber. However, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again for the lovely public areas, proximity to attractions and feeling of being immersed while at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal for Disney”
Reviews.Author: famtraveler23
Reviews.Content: We go to Disney every year with our 2 toddlers and this was our first stay at Wilderness Lodge. The views were beautiful - the kind that photograph amazingly well. Our tried and trusty stroller broke on the 2nd day of the vacation and we were still able to find transportation from WL to everywhere we wanted to go (Hollywood Studios, Epcot and MK) without having to collapse our stroller (our only option of salvaging its usage for the remainder of the trip). The Disney food prices always seem high to me, especially for the experience of dining with toddlers but the casual dining cafe was nice to have access to and of course the refillable mugs are such a great deal - coffee, soda, hot chocolate, etc. Our room was a standard room in the main lobby and the noises from the lobby and the lobby restaurant penetrated well into our room but once we were all asleep at 9 or some crazy early hour none of us were disturbed throughout the night, amazingly enough. And I'm a light sleeper. The rooms seemed a little dirty (similar to rustic cabin feel) but I'm kind of nutty about cleanliness, especially with little ones, and that's the main reason i didn't give this hotel a 5. There is so much to do at the hotel. Of course the pool but there is also a beach access with a little playground and lounge chairs that provide a peaceful & quiet rest. And the hot tub (there are 2!) is wonderful! I wish I was back. This was a vacation we were so unwilling to leave - pretty rare for a 7 day trip!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: farcus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lodge Sept 21-26. We are a couple in our early thirties with no children. We used the magical express transportation from the airport and had no major issues other than long lines to check in for the buses. We arrived at the lodge and waited a short time in line for check in but our room was ready at 1:30 pm so we were happy. The room was a bit on the small side but was ok for just the two of us. The decor was ok but honestly the room was smaller than a Holiday Inn type room. Mousekeeping did a really good job with keeping the room clean and fresh towels for us. The grounds are really nice at the lodge. You will really appreciate how quiet and relaxing the lodge is after standing in long lines everyday. The pool is great and the trout pass pool bar is a nice place to check ballgame scores on the flat screen. We only used the Roaring Fork for bottled water but didnt eat there. The boat service to the Magic Kingdom was always efficient. We never waited more than five minutes. The bus service to other parks was ok but we did wait about 25 minutes one morning for the Hollywood Studios bus. Most other waits were 10 minutes or less. We used the resort airline check-in which is located outside the lobby in the front. It really sped things up not having to stop at the airline counter at the airport. Overall this was an awesome stay. I forgot to mention that we rented a sea racer boat at the wilderness and took a tour of the lake around the magic kingdom, grand floridian, polynesian and fort wilderness. It was cool to see those places from the water at you own leisure. The only major complaint we have with this hotel is the noise level in the rooms. You can really hear everything going on around you in other rooms and in the hallway. We read this in the unofficial guide to disney and man were they right. Some of it was due to excited children coming back from the parks but at midnight when you are in bed its not fun to listen to it. I dont blame the kids but do blame the parents on that. Any questions please drop a message. If you've booked the Wilderness then you should look forward to it. I dont think it gets much better at Disney than this place.

Reviews.Title: “1st Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ursalita
Reviews.Content: We visited Disney for the first time with our 2 year old son and had a great time at Wilderness Lodge. The service was great and the room was really nice - clean, spacious, nice location/view. One day our room was not cleaned all the way but it was corrected immediately. The staff was very helpful when it came time to check out and there was some problems with our flight home (we used the check out service disney offers). We used the boat transportation to Magic Kingdom and bus transportation to Animal Kindgom which was so convenient. The pools were wonderful. We also loved the restaurants. I'm already planning another trip in a couple years and will definitely stay at the Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “What can you say but "awesome"”
Reviews.Author: Geoff1725
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at all sorts of hotels throughout Kissimee and Orlando for the last 10+ years and this was the best experience of them all. Nothing was bad, but we are not too picky. The boat service to and from the Magic Kingdom was awesome! The food was awesome. We went to the Hoop De Doo and it was awesome. The pool and overall theming of the hotel and grounds, you guessed it awesome. We rented those little speed boats I think sea racers and that was awesome. The Magic Kingdom, Wishes, revamped Haunted Mansion, Disney Dining Plan, staff, everyone was AWESOME. We will definitely go back! And I can't wait. the whole experience was incredible. When thinking of the rate you pay you must consider all the free stuff. The boats, buses, access to the other hotels grounds the ease that you can go about with no money in hand cause it's all on your room key. Just a great place to stay young and old.

Reviews.Title: “Great When the Price Is Right”
Reviews.Author: HillRochester_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort the last week in August. We choose this hotel as we had received an offer on a previous Disney vacation and got 40% off the hotel rate. Because of this discount we did not receive the free dining plan. (We actually saved $100 booking this way anyway). The Hotel was great for what we paid. We had a bunk bed room that overlooked the main courtyard. Please note that we had requested this view, however when we checked in we were assigned the other courtyard view of the quiet pool. We asked to be moved to the main courtyard view and this request was accomodated. The rooms are on the small side, but the kids loved it. I never complained about the housekeeping to the hotel, however the room needed a good, thorough cleaning ie: water marks on furniture, dusty corners of the rug, etc. The grounds, lobby and pool area are beautiful. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus or boat. We ate b-fast each morning at the roaring forks (quick service) and always found a table. The kids really enjoyed Whispering Canyons Cafe. We would stay here again when the price is right. I can't bring myself to pay peak rates for this hotel as we have stayed at the moderate hotels and have never been dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Walt Disney World Resort!”
Reviews.Author: caam04
Reviews.Content: We love the Wilderness Lodge. It is our all-time favorite Disney resort (and we like 'em all!). We've had a hard time branching out trying other Disney resorts and always find ourselves returning to the Wilderness Lodge. Nothing beats the feeling of entering the lobby for the first time (stunning!). The rooms are comfortable and the resort grounds are fabulous. We enjoy the pool, watching the Electric Water Parade on Bay Lake at night, the option of boat transportation to the Magic Kingdom and just about everything else that the Wilderness Lodge has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort & Property - Disney Favorite”
Reviews.Author: danielleflorida
Reviews.Content: We are huge Disney fans and visit several times a year. We have tried a bunch of the on-site hotels there but this one is our favorite! The resort is beautiful and laid out very well. Just to walk around the property and lobby is an experience - you do not feel like you are in Florida. We stayed a few days in early August, mostly to relax at hotel and check out the water parks. Our room was ready early which was a plus and very convienant to the elevators by the lobby/busses. Other times we have had to walk down long corridors from the elevators to our room - but those rooms are closer to lake and pool and boat. You can mae a request for which you prefer. Pool seemed very crowded but still nice - great water slide. Try the smaller pool over by the Villas for a quieter time. We checked out the Club Floor and Lounge but not sure its worth the extra money. As we are loyal fans to the Ritz Carlton in Orlando - it does not even compare or come close to their Club Floor/Concierge offerings. Kids Club at hotel is very nice - in afternoon they offer free arts and crafts. Also games out by the pool arranged by the lifeguards. Pool bar had very friendly staff but no waitresses - walk up only. The boats and buses are great transportation options to get you around. We had no problems going anywhere throughout. Tickets can be bought at front desk - much easier then waiting in park lines. We really enjoy this hotel, the architecture and ambience. The Lobby bar offers great wines and appetizers. The counter service restaurant is a bit small but some good options and open most of the time. Very big store off the lobby for all things Disney and drinks, snacks, toiletries, etc. - very handy. If wanting to stay in Disney, this is your place. If willing to drive - check out the Ritz about 15 mins away!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: ksvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for a week in June. We didn't have a single problem all week. From the time we arrived at the airport to the time we left everything was amazing. First of all I would definitely recommend Disney's Magical Express. What a great option that they didn't have the last time we were here! It only took 1.5 hours to have our bags hand delivered to our room after check in--I thought that was really fast considering it was the middle of June. At check in we were given a handicapped room--this was fine because it was actually much larger than a regular room and we had an awesome view! We even had rabbits in our grassy area outside of our sliding glass door! The lobby was beautifully decorated and the furniture in our room was cute. Our maid service was wonderful and they even made towel animals for us everyday. We had a great collection by the end of the week! We did not eat at the family style restaurant in the lobby due to other reviews we had read. By the end of the day we were just too tired to eat somewhere that noisy. We did have some wonderful meals at Epcot (Italy), Magic Kingdom and at the Grand Floridian. The nightly parade on the lake was awesome and this was a great hotel to watch it from! Also the transportation from the hotels to the parks is great! One day we were the only people on the bus and instead of taking us to the monorail station the driver went out of his was to take us to the Grand Floridian for our lunch reservation. Talk about awesome service! The hotel staff was very helpful and went out of their way to make our vacation wonderful. The hotel was extremely clean! I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “great for kids”
Reviews.Author: michigan007
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our Disney trip (8/24/08-8/29/08) and stay at the Wilderness Lodge. Having stayed previously at Port Orleans Riverside and Carribean Beach I liked the Wilderness Lodge better. First of all, staying in any Disney deluxe resort gives you queen size beds as opposed to those tiny double beds they give you at the moderates and value resorts. I'm used to sleeping on a king size bed so this was important to me. Secondly, I liked how close everything was to my room compared to PO and CB which you have to walk far for everything. The pool, dining, the bus stop, and boat launch were all fairly close. We had connecting rooms on the 2nd floor which was much better for us than staying on a higher floor. Everything is on the 1st or 2nd level so we never had to wait for an elevator. We usually just took the stairs to go to the pool. We got a free upgrade to a courtyard view so we could see the pool from our room which was nice. If you plan on visiting the Magic Kingdom often like we did this is a great place to stay. The resort has a boat and a bus to the MK. The bus to MK was very quick running every 10 minutes or so. The boat was quick too. That being said, it did seem to take significantly longer to get to the other resorts (Epcot, Studios, and Animal Kingdom). Usually, going to those parks involved a stop at another resort on the way which added a lot of travel time. On one occasion it took us an hour to get to the Animal Kingdom. If you got a car I recommend driving to the other resorts but using their transportation to the MK. The Whispering Canyon was great, the Roaring Fork counter service restaurant was good, and my kids loved the pool and the waterslide. The staff was awesome too. They were so friendly. The resort theme was so great for the kids. I probably will stay here again when we return to Disney. This isn't about the resort, but I will say a few things about their dining plan. We got their basic dining plan for free on a promotion. The basic dining plan gives you one sit down meal, one counter-service meal, and one snack (fruit, water, soda) each day for each person. It was so nice eating at their restaurants (which are overpriced) and not having to worry about cost. They give you so much food. Each meal consist of one entree, one beverage, and desert. We could not eat it all. The only negative thing I can say is the sit down meals took up a big chunk of our time, especially when our reservations required us to travel to a different park. We didn't have a car so we relied on their transportation. Sometimes dinner ended up eating almost 3 hours of our day when you factor transportation time. We had to make all our reservations ahead of time cause the restaurants were all booked solid. They offer a deluxe dining plan which includes 3 sit down meals per day. I saw one of the Mom's on the mom's panel on the Disney website promoting this saying its so much easier. I strongly advise against getting this unless you want your entire Disney vacation to revolve around dining cause it would just take too much time and be way too much food. If you want that go on a cruise instead. The basic plan is the way to go. Use your snack for breakfast, eat a counter-service lunch at the park your at, and then enjoy a sit-down dinner in the evening. That worked great for us.

Reviews.Title: “best disney hotel!”
Reviews.Author: julaki21
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay with a 1 and a 7 year old. best hotel ever stayed in disney. beautiful atmosphere, very efficient staff, wonderful location, fun pool and baby pool,good food. the lobby is worth a visit. after 16 visits in wdw, and staying in most of the hotels there, i would and will definetly return here. make sure you ask to be in the main bulding, which is even better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tinkwannabe
Reviews.Content: Disney's Wilderness Lodge is charming and relaxing! If you like the big, wide open spaces of nature, you will feel right at home. While this isn't my favorite Disney resort, it isn't because of the resort...nature/woods just isn't my cup of tea! It greatly resembles the Animal Kingdom Lodge without the aromas and theming. The grounds are beautiful and you can take the ferry to The Contemporary and the indoor water feature is soothing. The tree was beautiful and the Goofy totem is a must for photo opps!

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness was the BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: vgarr
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Resort was my favorite so far. This was our fourth time coming to Disney. We stayed from Aug.1 thru Aug.6th. Just got home 2 days ago. We got to the Resort a few hours before the 4:00 check in time. Normally you can never get your room early anywhere else but they had a room ready for us.WOW everyone was so nice. Brittney took care of us and she was terrific!! And thanks to Mary Ann we were able to eat at LaCellier. A canadian resturaunt in Epcots World Showcase that we could never get reservations the last 3 times we were in Disney. We even tried 6 months prior to arriving. Anyway the Wildermess is beautiful and the pools were perfect and not over crowded. I would definitly suggest this place to everyone over the last places we stayed. Not that they were bad! I just love the style more natural and down to earth.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - restaurant was another experience”
Reviews.Author: katsarsmom
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 staying at this hotel. Rooms were comfortable for 2 adults/2 children. Room was clean and quiet. Lovely structure and so many interesting features in the lobby and surrounding outside area of property. Pool was wonderful. Great waterslide for children. However, that restaurant in the lobby -- Whispering Canyon -- was another story. Very expensive for a familystyle place and the food was less than mediocre. The servers constantly holler for ketchup, salt, water, etc. For the price charged, the atmosphere and noise level were very undesirable. The other restaurant, Artists Point, was outrageously expensive and had hardly any patrons. The best restaurant -- try the snack place off the side of Artist's Point. Food was better, more reasonably priced ala Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness is beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: SuzetteL
Reviews.Content: We loved the Wilderness Lodge. The hotel and grounds are outstanding. The staff members were friendly and helpful, everything that you would expect of a Disney property. We could have spent a wonderful one week vacation here and never went to a theme park. There were lots of places in the "public spaces" where you could sit by a fireplace, or rock in a rocking chair, or watch the stream go by. The pool was just the right temperature and never too crowded, although there were plenty of people in the pool. My kids (ages 3 and 5) really liked the slide. We saw the ducks. They only tried to get in the pool once while people were in it, but that didn't last more than a second. The houseskeepiing staff made a bunch of cute animals for the kids out of the towels and wished us a good day each morning when we left. We always had plenty of fluffy towels and toiletries. The hotel gift shop had the stuff we needed after days in the parks (Bengay, children's Tylenol, etc). The cub's den had a cute little craft during the afternoons - a nice way to wind down when the rain drove us out of the park. My only complaint is that the beds are soft. I'm sure this is a personal preference thing, but my husband's back was bothering him at the end of the week and we think it was the bed. I really wanted to check out the sandy beach, the playground area and the marina, but didn't have time. I would absolutely go back to this hotel. I would like to try the villas next time. There are wonderful accurate picures on allears.net. They really show the rooms, grounds, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge...a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: BeckyT803
Reviews.Content: We spent the last few days at the Wilderness Lodge. It is a beautiful resort. The service was excellent. Transportation to and from the parks was great. This resort offers a very relaxing atmosphere in a beautiful setting. We hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: SteMur
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks from July 10th - 24th after a week at the Royal Plaza Hotel near Downtown Disney. As soon as you arrive in the grounds and the hotel, you notice the difference (even though we did enjoy the other hotel). Upon arrival our luggage was taken into the hotel while we checked in. We arrived around 11:45am and decided to check in, even though check in time is not until late afternoon, and our room was ready. We went up to the room and our luggage was delivered within 10 minutes. The rooms are quite spacious and fine for the amount of time you spend in them while at Disney. Our room overlooked the pool at the Villa's side and we could see out to the lake if we looked over the balcony. The housekeeping at the hotel are excellent and every day they arranged all of my kids soft toys into various patterns and scenes, one day we had them in canoes made out of towels while on other days we had them arranged on a slide made of pillows and towels. This along with the towel animals we were presented with each day made us look forward to getting back to the room each day to see how housekeeping had arranged the toys. We did use the pools and while they are busy through the day, they are good fun for adults and kids alike. Another day we hired a 4 wheel bicycle to take a trip to the stables to see the horses at the camp ground. The transport is excellent as you can take a boat to the Magic Kingdom or a bus to any other parks or to downtown. We made good use of this. We would go back to the Wilderness Lodge as we did have a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Worth seeing once but dont expect good service”
Reviews.Author: KS_JHawk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for an anniversary trip to the Wilderness Lodge. We really wanted to see the lodge and it is really impressive. We did have a complaint with our treatment when we first arrived. The bed in the room they gave us was in terrible shape totally broken down and not what you would expect in a motel at half the cost. We walked back to the desk to lodge our complaint and they told us thats all they had. After threatening to take our business elsewhere they made us meet with the matenience supervise to prove to him the bed was bad. Keep in mind it was about a 5 min walk to the room each way. After we proved that the bed was bad we were allowed to go back to the desk again to try and get a different room. We were offered no help with our luggage at any time. We finally got a differrent room and it was OK. Given that we had just spent most of the day on airplanes we didnt need to spend another hour of trying to get an acceptable bed. First I would expect that a hotel in this price range not even have a broken down bed on their property but at the very least not make us jump thru hoops to get an acceptable bed. Another thing to consider is you are at their mercy for drink and food prices there is no place else to go. Even though it doesnt sound like it we had a good time but next time we will stay off the Disney property. We like the Hilton at Disney World because you get the extra park hours and have a good shuttle service but dont pay the Disney prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but beware”
Reviews.Author: ConnAWR
Reviews.Content: One can't help but be impressed with the overall design of this hotel. Has all amenities one could want. Fantastic transportation options although the buses take forever, and I mean forever. Now, beware: the standard room is very small. I understand that people really don't spend a lot of time in their room but if staying a week and spending over a thousand dollars, it should be bigger. The bathroom area is very very small and poor lighting. The sinks are dangerous; at least for me who hit my head while splashing water on my face. There is an overhang that you can put your toiletries on that is in the way. What disgusted me most; was that our check out was 11am and we didn't have to leave until 4pm. Keep in mind we spent a week and a lot of money - a lot of money I said - and still nothing, they would not give us a late checkout. So we sat with our carry on bags (we had 8 people with 3 rooms!) which had our necessities/travel clothes, at the pool - until it rained and then we sat in the lobby like poor white trash. The attitude of the staff was marginal to poor. Does anyone speak English? The staff could use some customer training; esp the blonde guy who runs the gym on Sundays. We'll be sure not to return to this hotel - and although a nice touch, the GM should take speech lessons because her welcoming and existing 'thank you' voice messages sound very blah and scripted.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: tvlmimi
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge was perfect setting for our family trip taking our 5 grandsons (along with their parents) to DisneyWorld for the first time. Hard decision choosing with such a large group, booking 3 rooms. So very glad we went with the WL and now that we've seen all the resorts, would choose this hotel again in an instant. It is beautiful with immaculate grounds and pools, yet feels so family friendly and comfortable. Everyone loved it! We were there for six days and visited all the parks but spent more time (and trips) to Magic Kingdom which is an advantage at WL. The bus is direct to and from and takes only about 5 minutes, no other stops. The dropoff and pickup at MK is the first slot so not much walking involved when you finally leave the park and are dead tired. The kids also enjoyed the boat ride direct to MK and Chef Mickey's (at Contemporary). The WL is the closest to MK off the monorail resorts and after riding the monorail also, the bus transport was much faster. To the other resorts, there was one or two stops but the bus was never crowded, always a seat and at night we were often the only ones on the bus. Only regret was having to leave : )

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: SirAR3
Reviews.Content: Having been to Disney World a number of times, this was our first time staying at one of Disney's Luxury Resorts, and I must say that it was well worth the extra money. The hotel is amazing, the design is spectacular, and it somehow manages to fee quiet and cozy even with all the exited kids running around. Me and my partner and another gay couple stayed here and felt right at home. The pools and hot tubs, while crazy during the day with kids and parents, were nice and quiet at night. We even had a nice little Disney rabbit munching grass right outside our window. The rooms were nice, well designed with plenty of space, and had a modern touch to them with a big flat screen TV. Its easy to get around to all the Disney parks and events, especially to the Magic Kingdom which is just a boat ride away. One of the restaurants on property, Artists Point, is hands down the best food in the entire resort. We will for sure we going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall, but beware the boat horns!”
Reviews.Author: slmjim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for 5 nights in January 2008. I had hoped to stay there for our entire 9-night WDW vacation, but couldn't get all of my nights there and booked the Animal Kingdom Lodge for the other 4 nights -- which is why I compare WL to AKL throughout this review. Let me first say that it is hard to find many negatives with Disney resorts...they are fantastic overall. If you have already booked the WL, get ready to have a great vacation! Basically what follows is just splitting hairs! As far as the Wilderness goes, while it is a neat-looking place, I wasn't blown away by the interior architecture. (Maybe I would have been had I not just come from the beautiful AKL.) I actually found it a tiny bit cheesy. Just my opinion. Additionally, our room seemed a bit dreary (although the kids were excited by the bunkbeds). Our particular room had a view of woods as promised; through them, we could see some of the Wishes fireworks, which was fun. Not as great was the fact that we were situated on the lake side, so we heard the LOUD boat horns late into the evening (up until 11:30 or so) and early in the a.m. We also had to listen to the Electrical Water Pageant music every night, which takes place at 9:30 -- by which time we were usually in our rooms with our two small kids. This got pretty annoying because the music is synthesized and outdated (trust me, hearing it once is enough). We just had to laugh each night when it came on. The other thing I wasn't "Wild" about at the WL is the Whispering Canyon dining. It was good for a hearty breakfast, but we had zero desire to dine there for dinner. It just seemed chaotic, and unless you absolutely love barbeque, the smells are overwhelming. It's also right in view of the main lobby which was weird in my opinion. Granted we didn't eat dinner there so maybe we missed out. At the AKL, we loved dining at Boma's interesting buffet. The quick-service area was fine food-wise, but the seating area was small and unappealing as compared (again) to the AKL. The Mara quick-service there is awesome and has a great selection. Taking the boat to the Magic Kingdom from the WL is fun initially, but it does take a while. The pool area is very nice. The geyser is truly neat-o! The stream that bubbles down from the lobby and over a waterfall into the pool is very well done. The poolside snack bar staff was very friendly and accommodating, and lounging poolside adjacent to the lake is very relaxing. There's even a little beach. The buses were prompt and no problem in terms of getting to the other parks. Overall, our room itself and the unappealing dining will probably mean I won't pick the WL again. The AKL has it beat in just about every category if you happen to be deciding between the two. If being close to MK is what you are looking for however, I'd say try the WL. It's good but just not my favorite. (The Polynesian is also fantastic, but will cost more than AKL or WL because of monorail access.) P.S. We also ate at Artist Point. It was pretty good, but I wish we had tried Jiko at AKL instead...

Reviews.Title: “Really liked Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: daisylynn
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Orlando area for 10 days in April 2008 as two adults. This Disney hotel was where we stayed for our second half of our vacation. It was really wonderful. The staff was friendly, grounds were kept nice (we are night owls, so as we'd be getting in late, there was always maintenance going on while most were sleeping...very nice to see this happening). We really loved the food options at this hotel, and the close proximity to other Magic Kingdom area hotels can't be beat! We did not have a car, but the transportation to and from the parks and other activities was quite efficient. There was one day we did wait over an hour for a bus, but as a frequent traveler to WDW, I realize that this is not the norm. The only real issue we had was our first room assignment. We checked in and had requested a king bed at booking. To my surprise, they notified us that we had been upgraded to a woods view room from standard view. Well, when we got to our room, I would have taken a view of a brick wall over the condition the room was in. It was an accessible room, which we didn't need. I was traveling with a very tall man, and this was just uncomfortable to him. The bed was very low to the ground, as if it were just a mattress on the floor. Also, the room was quite worn and I can't say that the mousekeeping did their best with a worn room. Handprints on the windows, crumbs on the floor, etc. I went to the front desk that evening and asked to be moved the next day. She spoke with the manager, and let me know it would be no problem. We were put in a MUCH nicer room, though it did not have a king bed, we were very pleased with the room. Also, as an added bonus...we were able to see the MK fireworks from our balcony at night. Cinderella Castle was seen through the trees! Overall, great stay and we will be staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: TeresaHouston
Reviews.Content: Stayed late June at Wilderness Lodge for the second time, it is a really good hotel and a very beautiful lodge. There are lit fireplaces on almost every floor with sitting areas for reading or watching TV outside your room. Somehow we got assigned to the 7th floor instead of our reserved courtyard view, but it turned out to be a bonus since we could watch the Magic Kingdom fireworks from our balcony, plus there is private concierge service and snacks provided by the Old Faithful Club - an all day snacking kitchen! Morning offers a free help yourself breakfast (with a pretty good selection), lunch and evenings offers other snacks including fruits, homemade cookies & milk, finger sandwiches and a small selection of wines, liquors, and alcohol - there's also a good quality coffee/cappaccino/espresso machine. The hotel has a bubbling spring just inside which runs to the outside and down the outside walkways amidst the generously landscaped grouds (Silver Creek Falls) until it turns into a large waterfall and empties into the pool, which is very inviting and with a nice slide for the kids. Just past the hot tubs is their Fire Rock geyser, which erupts every hour. We didn't use the pool bar (Trout Pass), but we enjoyed the Bay Lake beach and you can enjoy the nightly lights/musical parade sail by every evening. Their resterants are all good, with Whispering Canyon Cafe offering home-cooked meals at a reasonable price and the waiters provide entertainment and games; the highest priced is Artist Point - good food with smaller portions, not sure it's really worth the money (although the service was pretty good). but it was nice to try; the median priced resterant is Roaring Fork. The hotel has an excellent gift shop with a groceries selection, too. This hotel is also one of the few that has constant ferry service directly to the Magic Kingdom and is for hotel guest use only (comes in very handy after a long day in the park when you want to bypass most of the crowds to return to the hotel). Arcade, bike/boat rentals, hiking trails, premium fitness center, etc. This hotel also offers onsite airline check in and baggage check. We enjoy this hotel so much we skip the parks some nights and just stay at the lodge. Would recommend to most everyone if you have $300+/night to spend on accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Campergal
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Wilderness Lodge...everything about it...staff was helpful and polite, Roaring Fork had decent food/snacks and truly was never crowded when we went, room was small but clean and comfortable, Whispering Canyon had good food and our kids loved the antics, pool was so much fun for the kids and the pool activities were fun for everyone, grounds were beautiful...hotel was fantastic...lobby was amazing...mercantile/store had everything Disney as well as sundries if needed...fireplace in lobby made you feel you were not just in a regular hotel! My husband and son took a walk from the hotel to the Ft. Wilderness campground...they saw armidillos, deer and rabbits on the walk. We did see rabbits and ducks on the grounds of the hotel...pretty neat to see. I never saw ducks in the pool when we were there so that was not a problem. We truly felt that we were on a great vacation and our kids did not want to leave. We love Disney World and try to go every 2-3 years...we usually stay at a family member's time share near Disney (Vistana, Orange Lake Country Club) but this year we decided to splurge and stay in a deluxe resort with all the benefits of booking a vacation package. Originally, we booked a campsite at Ft. Wilderness but decided not to take the camper down...we cancelled the reservation and booked the vacation package back in February. I booked our one week vacation via AAA and requested a standard view room (I also asked for an upper level room near the marina), 5 day hopper passes (Monday through Friday) and dining plan for 2 adults and 2 children for the week. We did not need airfare as we drove. The AAA agent booked the trip and did not tell me that we were upgraded to a woods view room. Well, we were pleasantly surprised when we could watch the MK fireworks from our room each night! Our balcony on the 6th floor faced the Contemporary and we could easily watch the fireworks. When requesting an upper floor near the marina, I figured it would be an elevator ride down and out the door down the path to catch the boat shuttles to the MK...I had no idea that requesting such a room would place us with a great view of the fireworks. Yes, it was expensive...a little over $3,000 but using the Disney VISA saved us almost $700 off the total cost of the package...we were able to accumulate almost 700 points and used those points to pay for the package. If you are planning a trip, I suggest getting the Disney VISA and use it for a few years and save up the points. You can use the saved points to offset the vacation package via the travel agent or by calling the Disney Travel Co. when you book your package. You can also use the benefit of the credit card to have a 6 month/zero interest method to pay off the vacation package. Also, if you use the Disney VISA in the World of Disney store in Downtown Disney, you will receive a 10% discount on your total purchases! We purchased the dining plan and strongly suggest you add it on...it was only $96 per day for our family of 4 but that included a counter service meal, snack and table service (including character dining) per person per day. The dining plan is linked with the number of nights you stay...we had the plan starting on Sunday, June 15 and meals were included through Friday, June 20...all benefits expired at midnight on Saturday, June 21, the day we checked out. We used all benefits of the plan...we ate well and we were never hungry although we might have gained a few pounds! We dined at The Wave (dinner-Contemporary...new restaurant and excellent...an absolute must...this restaurant specializes in local produce and organics...no food items are fried...only baked, broiled, sauted), Boma (dinner-Animal Kingdom Lodge...average buffet/will not go again), Crystal Palace in MK (Pooh characters at breakfast...wonderful for kids and breakfast was good), Liberty Tree Tavern in MK (character dinner, food with Thanksgiving theme...heavy meal but OK), Garden Grill in Epcot (character dinner...food was good, served family style but kids received standard kid food of mac-n-cheese and chicken fingers...restaurant revolves and shows views of the Land attraction) and finally, our last night was enjoying a dinner at the Wilderness Lodge at Whispering Canyon...good food and so much fun for the kids! We did have dinner reservations at the Grand Floridian Cafe (cancelled those because we were able to get a reservation for the Crystal Palace breakfast) and the Coral Reef at Epcot (cancelled because of heavy rain and we were able to get a seat at Whispering Canyon.) If we did not have the dining plan, it would have cost us $120-$150 per dinner or character breakfast, which included the tip...the dining plan saved us so much money...all we had to do was leave a tip! Don't forget...the dining plan includes a counter service meal which can be used for breakfast, lunch or dinner...we chose to use the counter service meals for lunch...most of those lunches would have cost us $30-$40 for the four of us per meal...so again, the dining plan is a definite way to save! We also used the snack vouchers for iced/slush drinks which usually cost around $4-$5 each...perfect on those hot summer days. The only problem we encountered at WL is that my son lost his Tower of Terror Mickey Mouse in the bedding of the hotel room...we think housekeeping wrapped up the sheets/linens and did not see it...the stuffed animals never left the room because the housekeeper would move them around on the beds and the kids could not wait to see how they would be placed. I called Lost and Found as well as filled out a missing item form at the front desk and was told that if found, they would mail it to us. The Tower of Terror Mickey was purchased two years ago on a special trip when our son rode the ride for the first time...bringing the Mickey back to Disney World again, two years later, was important to him...Mickey was coming back to visit. My daughter brought her Stitch stuffed animal (also bought on the same trip two years ago) but that one was fine...housekeeping continued to put it in different places. Unfortunately, we don't think we will ever see the Mickey again as once it goes to Disney laundry, which is in a huge building off site, it most likely will never be found or will be damaged during the laundry process. No one at the hotel offered to replace it if it was not found. So, other than having the Tower of Terror Mickey lost in the bedding, the Wilderness Lodge was great and we definitely would stay there again!! Last tips...get the Disney VISA and use all of the benefits it offers (unless you have a credit card that gives you more cash back or better benefits), get the dining plan if booking any Disney hotel...it is linked with the number of nights you stay and will definitely save you money if you are eating all of your meals in the "World", eat at The Wave at the Contemporary (the best meal we had during the entire week), use Disney transportation if staying on property as we did not drive our car once we parked it upon arrival, book your dining reservations 6 months in advance, especially for character dining...make them early as you can always cancel and/or make changes like we did. Most of all...enjoy your vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: famvac04
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th time at Disney in the last 7 years. Without a doubt this is the most beautiful hotel we have stayed at. The lobby is gorgeous and huge. Very relaxing atmosphere to hang out in. Check in went pretty smooth we arrived at 9:00 AM so our room was not ready yet so we headed out to epcot. When we got back everything was ready for us including our luggage which was nice. The rooms were decorated very nice with the bunkbeds and the flat screen tv. The rooms, like all we have stayed at in Disney were not very big, but we do not stay in them that much. The pool was again not as big as some but it was again very nice and very well guarded with many life guards. It had a nice water slide and how the stream from the lobby flowed into the pool was a very nice touch. The grounds were very well kept with cricket sounds and pine scents piped in. The resturants were very good. The Whispering Canyon was alot of fun with good food. Artist Point was quieter with excellent food. I tried a buffalo steak for the first time and it was fantastic. My son had the special cedar plank samon and loved it. The food court(if you can call it that) was a little small but never seemed to crowded. The transportation to the parks worked pretty well we only had to wait a lenghty time for 1 bus to Disney Studios. The boat to Magic Kingdom worked out great. We used this for many different uses and never had to wait more than 10 minutes. One of the only downfalls to this hotel was the maid service was not as creative as in the other hotels we stayed at. My younger son loves the towels decorated in different shapes and our maid never did this for him. I know this is minor but it bummed him out. Also the shower heads had the low flow heads which made the showers a little weak. But overall this is the hotel i would stay at again. I have stayed an Dixie Landings and Coronado Springs previously. My son and I took some trips to check out a couple of the other hotels (Animal Lodge,Polynesian,Old Key West) and without a doubt this was the best of the bunch. When you first get to your hotel make your dinner reservations for the week right away then sit back and enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great week at Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: jmhmom
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. We booked a standard room and were upgraded to a nice view once we arrived. The rooms were VERY quiet with the exception of the muffled noise that drifted up from the Whispering Canyon restaurant about 8:30 every morning. Not loud..just noticeable. We were on the fourth floor just above the restaurant. Other than that little thing, we found the room to be beautiful and perfect for a family of three. We especially loved having a fridge. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again. It is definitely worth the extra money to have queen beds and an awesome slide at the pool. TH Saranac, Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, nice location.”
Reviews.Author: lvebeachvac
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Wilderness Lodge. We have 2 kids (4 and 6). I was going to book the Contemporary, but the only rooms available were the very expensive ones, so I switched to the Wilderness Lodge. It is a good hotel, convenient to the Magic Kingdom. It is not on the monorail, but it has direct boat service to the Magic Kingdom and another boat service to the Fort Wilderness and the Contemporary. The Grand Floridian is a short bus ride away. This is convenient for when you have restaurant reservations in these other hotels. The restaurant Whispering Canyon was ok, I preferred the Grand Floridian Cafe and Chef Mickeys. The rooms were fine, plenty of space. We had a woods view and was very quiet. It overlooked some trees and you could also see the lagoon. Concierge was pleasant and helpful. Pool was very nice. We liked the slide and my son loved the little kids pool. We did the dinning plan and I thought it was so worth it. Just the dinners alone cost over $100 for 4 people. Plus you get one fast food meal (usually used it for lunch) and a snack (water, soda, ice cream, etc.) I was happy with the bus service. It was not a long wait and we were the first hotel picked up, so there were always seats available. Overall, we had a great time and got to see most of the parks. We particularly liked the water parks, especially Blizzard's Beach. We would go to the Magic Kingdom or Epcot in the morning, carry our bathing suits in a backpack, and in the afternoon hit the water parks. That worked out great in those hot Florida days.

Reviews.Title: “Wild About the Wilderness”
Reviews.Author: k8cdi
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Wilderness Lodge in early February. The lobby truly is good as others describe it and it was truly breathtaking. We arrived for check-in a few hours early and were able to get a room immediately. Check-in was smooth and friendly. Our room was located near the cafe, on the second floor with a balcony. It was nice--it's not a luxurious hotel in terms of amentities, and the rooms are a bit dated, but the ease of access to parks makes it worth the price. It was clean, we loved the flat screen TV. Bathroom area was spacious. Cafe was good, got crowded at peak times but a half-hour off either end and it was clear. We ate once at the Whispering Canyon. The food was great, but the service was incredibly slow. Don't eat here if you're in a rush. Their gimmick is to be very interactive, but as an adult couple they didn't bother us. Kids were having a great time and it was fun to watch. The pool area was very nice, even in early Feb it was warm enough to swim. We didn't see the "hidden" hot tub. We didn't look very hard, but it's nice that it's enough out of the way to truly be private. We rented bikes (a bit of an ordeal, customer service not quite up to Disney standards), and really enjoyed the bike paths. We rode to the Wilderness Resort (campground) and rented a kayak, which was also a relaxing way to spend the afternoon. The boat service to the MK and Conteporary was good and we never had to wait too long. Buses seems less frequent. We can see the benefits of staying in a hotel on the monorail. Had made breakfast reservations in advance at several different hotel restaurant, but the logistics and time required to get there early in the morning ended up being too difficult and we slept in instead. :) All in all, would hilghy recommend the hotel and would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great family experience, non Deluxe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikefromChile
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in this wonderful Hotel and it was great! We were concerned about bus transportation to parks as many reports mention this as a weakness of the Hotel (no monorail available). In our case, half of the times the bus was waiting and departured in 2 minutes and in other ocations we waited less than 8 minutes. Boat to Magic Kingdom offers a great service. I agree with opinions that point this is a non luxury Hotel. Lobby & pool are amazing, but rooms are just normal. It is true: the hotel is big and if you don't like to walk, ask for a room close to elevators. Hotel offers excellent conditions to families: self operated laundry, Roaring Fork restaurant prepares hamburgers, salads, pizzas and also works as a minimarket to get cereals, milk, juices, sandwiches. All these can be taken to the room. Concerning the room location we took a standard view, 4th floor, north wing. Nobody goes to Disney to stay in the room, so it was ok, but kids enjoy MK Fireworks full view each night. I will spend my last words to say it is a VERY beatiful Hotel for families that like nature and "lodge" style. Pool ist great for kids and adults supervise them while staying in the warm spa-pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- good time!”
Reviews.Author: chapopote
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here over the Memorial Day holiday, and had a great time! The lodge is beautiful, especially the lobby and grounds. I was also impressed with the little common sitting areas overlooking the lobby or overlooking the courtyard. The couches, rocking chairs, and fireplaces were a nice touch! We were checked in by Mary Ann who was very friendly and accommodating. We were pleased to find that we had been given an upgraded room at no charge. We had forgotten to request bunkbeds for our two kids, so I had written a note to the hotel before our arrival. Not only did they grant the bunkbed request, but they upgraded us to a courtyard view. The rooms are on the small side, but you really don't spend much time in them, since Orlando is chock full of other things to do. The balcony outside our room on the 4th floor was nice, and it gave us a chance to enjoy some fresh air read the paper, and enjoy some peace and quiet early in the morning. I was afraid that I might hear noise from bathers in the pool in the evenings, but when we shut our balcony door and pulled the curtains, I couldn't hear a thing from outside. We ate at Artist's Point one night (killer piece of halibut!) and a few times at Whistling Canyon Cafe and Roaring Forks. The Lincoln Logs were a big hit with the kids while waiting for our table at Whistling Canyon. As with most resorts, food is Very Expensive, and make sure you have a reservation during peak times. Buying the refillable mug at Roaring Forks is a good idea. We were able to see the Electric Light Parade each night from the dock, as well as the fireworks. The ferry to the Magic Kingdom and the Contemporary was great. We rode the ferry to the Contemporary and then jumped on the monorail one night just to take the loop around the different properties. I think one of the best things about staying at a Disney resort is the transportation system. We never waited more than 5 or 10 minutes for the buses, and they take you everywhere "disney" you'd like to go, including Downtown Disney. Also, this was our first time using the Magical Express, and not having to worry about our bags getting from the airport to the lodge was great. My kids (9 and 4 years of age) particularly liked the pool slide. (We adults liked the bubbling hot tubs!) We also had the kid's characters drawn by an artist in the lobby. There were a bunch of planned activities for kids during the day, but we could never participate since we were at the parks all day long. Would we stay here again? Sure! It was a nice getaway. The rooms weren't luxurious, but were entirely adequate for our stay, and the amount of time we actually spent in them!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at the Lodge”
Reviews.Author: bhackehs
Reviews.Content: For a family vacation / reunion to Walt Disney World at the end of March, our family decided to spend the weekend at the Wilderness Lodge near the Magic Kingdom. We visited during the peak time of March 28 â€“ March 30, 2008. The Hotel / Arrival: Upon approach to the hotel, you definitely get the feeling that you are entering a forest or a National Park out west. With the hedges cut in shapes of animals and tall pine trees, it was a very festive and unique atmosphere in the middle of Florida. I arrived under the porte-cochere and found our other family members had already arrived. The bellmen offered no assistance, but since I was only traveling with one bag, assistance was clearly un-necessary. However, the outside of the hotel and the architecture was striking and pleasant, and what was more pleasant, was that the hotel seemed relatively quiet for being in the Peak season. Lobby: Wow! What a lobby! Upon entering the seven-story lodge, you are greeted by tall totem poles, a bubbling hot spring, comfortable seats and a fireplace. The atmosphere of the lobby was quite inviting and truly made me feel a world away. However, check-in wasnâ€™t as smooth as expected. I had reserved a room with club-level access and was supposed to be greeted and checked in by a specialized agent. After fifteen minutes of confusion, I was finally taken to the room and shown the club lounge. Room: Because more family was meeting me later in the evening, we had reserved a Deluxe Club Level Room. The room is large for Disney standards. It has a large balcony overlooking the pool and geyser from the large living room. Attached to the living room with French doors is the bedroom with two queen beds. Then, finally, there is the bathroom, with easy access to the bedroom and the living room. The shower and the toilet are separated from the sinks. Furnishings could use a little bit of an â€œupdateâ€�, but for the purposes of sleeping after a day in the park, the room would suffice. Housekeeping, or Mousekeeping, was great, leaving special towel animals on the bed or the floor every time we returned to the room. Club Lounge: The Old Faithful Club located on the top floor of the hotel is for the exclusive use of those who have booked a club-room. The floor is basic, with concierge desks (this is the reason to get club level, since they can help with everything Disney and with those Priority Seating times), five food presentations, and quiet seating areas. No one ever seemed to be in the lounge, so it was very quiet. The food is great for travelers like us, who wake up early and go to bed late to maximize time in the park. However, the food could not replace a meal for those who are hungry. Fitness Center and Spa: There was a fitness center on property, but come on, this is Disney, the daily walking / running though the park is enough exercise. A spa was advertised at the Grand Floridian Resort nearby. Dining: Since we spent most of our time at the park, dining at the Lodge rarely happened. However, I did notice a wild restaurant called Whispering Canyon Cafe in the lobby, which sounded exciting. Most people I talked to highly recommended the restaurant, and I suggest reservations / Priority seating since there appeared to be a wait. In addition, there is a semi-formal restaurant called Artist Point. There is also a cafeteria-style place toward the pool of the hotel, which served light items and items to-go. Cost: The Lodge is considered a Deluxe property of Disneyâ€™s and therefore is part of the most expensive category of hotels. Again, since this was peak travel for Disney, the room rates were expensive. I donâ€™t recall exactly what was spent on the room, but I believe the total for the room and park tickets for three days totaled over a thousand for three people. I only wish that I were able to spend more time in the room and the club for that cost. Service: I was shocked by how poor almost all of the service of the Cast Members was. I have been to Disney more times than I can count on both hands, and this was the first time that I felt like a burden to the staff. No one seemed happy and they all appeared to be highly stressed out. I understand that it was Peak season, so Iâ€™m giving them all the benefit of the doubt, but almost all of the other guests I talked to felt the same way about the service at the hotel and the parks. Transportation: Disney Transportation at the Lodge included a boat ride to the Magic Kingdom, Fort Wilderness, and the Contemporary Hotel. A bus is required for all other parks and resorts. The busses, we found, were less than reliable on this trip, but it always seems to take 30 to 45 minutes to get to the parks. Overall: A very pleasant stay. My advice: If you can avoid the peak time, you should. I have had much better experiences with the staff and overall happiness during value times. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS RESORT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMickeymoo
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here in 06 and absolutely loved this resort! The service and staff impeccable, the gournds beautiful, transportation great. We stayed at the Poly in 08 ( a more $$$ hotel) and were disappointed after staying at the Wilderness. Different strokes for different folks I guess. I would love to return to the WL, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the only thing deluxe is the lobby and price!”
Reviews.Author: Kirkd
Reviews.Content: I will begin by saying that we enjoy Disney World as a family outing and I have probably been 20 times since childhood. I dont want to criticize Disney, but I feel that I need to call a spade a spade. Disney advertises their high end resorts as "deluxe". They are impressive from the outside and have extraordinary lobbies. Beyond this however the rooms are similiar to a motel 8. They are very small with unimpressive furnishings. The bathrooms are small and very non-deluxe. The beds are very ordinary and less desirable than the beds in a Hampton Inn or Courtyard Marriott. Disney charges very high prices for these elaborate lobbies with small plain rooms. Disney needs to re-price and re-advertise these as moderate resorts. It really would be nice for Disney to create a true deluxe luxury resort that was comparably priced to other fine hotels ie. Ritz, Four Seasons etc. We will not stay at another deluxe Disney resort because they do not exist. There are plenty of locations close by that offer much more for less. Even the location while very useful, does not justify the higher price. Take your money and go elsewhere so you have more to spend for the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoriA
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here the week of May 11-16. It was a truly magical and wonderful experience! My 9 year old son loved the pool and the waterslide. The lobby is so impressive that I wished we had more time to enjoy it. The bunkbeds were a big hit with both kids and the balcony was a nice addition. We even watched the Magic Kingdom fireworks one night -- right from the balcony! Our balcony also overlooked a small pond and my son enjoyed watching for the rabbits, turtles, birds and even an armadillo! The fridge was very handy as we were able to eat all of our breakfasts in our room. The kids also went to the Cubs Den one night while my husband and I enjoyed an adult evening, They loved it and although it is expensive we definately would recommend it!! We ate one night at the Whispering Canyon - it was a little too loud and the food was just o.k. so that is why we only ate there the one night. We rented a car and found the parking very convenient. We also used the the boat transit which was the best way to travel to the Magic Kingdom. The only negative is that I found the bathroom was begining to look a little faded. There was mold along the tub and some of the shower tiles. It could use a little updating. Otherwise it was a perfect choice for our family and a vacation to remember!

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: archantgirl2
Reviews.Content: This is a true account of how we found this hotel. We spent our Honeymoon here for 14 nights in April 2008, and from the moment our taxi pulled into the drive of this beautiful building, my heart almost missed a beat, it was fab. From a bright hello from the bell hops on the outside station to the vast amazing lobby, you were filling up with a true magic experience. Check in was very quick, as it was on our records we were on honeymoon, the hotel upgraded us from a woods view room we had paid for up to a court yard (pool to you and I) view at no charge. Although we did have a disabled room which meant the bed was lower, a roll in shower, no tub, but that was fine. We were also asked if we would like to be the flag family, which of course we graciously accepted ( I had read about it on here and got very excited) the young girl Lauren was very helpful and nice. We got to the room and I didn't like it, because of the shower and we were on the 6th floor which meant our balcony was closed in. I went back down, they could not move us that night but promised they would move us to a woods view room in the morning. So we stayed the night still packed. We got into the room, got changed very quickly and went down to eat as we were starving. We went to Whispering Canyon Cafe, which I have made a separate review on (it gets very loud) we then went to roaring fork and purchased a refillable mug for the resort (and believe me, worth every penny the amount we filled up for free!) then to bed to find a Mickey head made of towels and a photo congratulating us from Mickey and Minnie with 2 balloons - a really nice touch. The room has a small fridge in it, which you can't find to start as it is under two drawers! It is noisy but you get used to it. You have a dresser with a plug socket, and a lighted mirror, handy for hair and makeup! You have ice and vending on each floor, and guest laundry are opposite the lifts on the ground floor. Lots of machines! Very good. Next morning we got a phone call asking if we wanted to move, and we decided to stay as the noise of the pool was not too bad, and the fact we got used to the shower. The staff were very accommodating. Every night we had a turn down service, and was left 4 chocolates every night (again a nice touch) mousekeeping staff was nice, but, and I say but.......... we noticed that they do not clean the room every day. They change towels, emptied the bins, gave you new shampoos etc but they did not clean. One night my husband was ill and was sick, 2 days later we noticed that it had not been cleaned from the toilet. This is the first time I had ever stayed anywhere where they don't clean every day. We figured that it was our own dirt and as we don't clean the bathroom back home every day we would live with it. We lived with it. We used the shop (Mercantile) on several occasions, and if you have a package delivered from a park to resort, it will end up here - not in your room, but that was fine with us.
