We sampled all the restaurants. Roaring fork almost every day for either lunch or breakfast (1 quick service credit on both). This suited us well on our Disney Dinning Plan. Artist point was very very nice (2 table service credits). The bar was also nice. The pool did get busy at times but then you expect that with the amount of rooms. We loved the pool and never found it hard to get 2 sun beds together. The troutpass bar is also good. There was a family of 8 baby ducks born whilst we were there and they were running all over the place, we loved that! We saw lots of rabbits, birds(red cardinals) (also a nest with babies in it) squirrels and an armadillo, which was a first for us! The spa was nice, with the 2 pools having different temperatures. The main pool was warm too, which was a pleasure! We went to the beach, on one day we rented a surrey bike (real good fun) and on another a Boston Whaler which was also very good fun. We also went over to Fort Wilderness campground and done the horse riding which was great. we had been in the hotel 2 days and not touched the theme parks! There is so much to do. They hold pool parties which are good fun too. Oh and at 9.35pm each night you can the the Electric water pageant, this is very out dated and needs looking at! We watched a couple of times and had a giggle at it! But I guess it was fun! Oh and if you catch the wishes fireworks from the boat taking you to magic kingdom, you will get a fantastic view! The bus service outside is excellent, we never waited more than 10 mins for a bus getting out of the hotel, sometimes coming back at peak periods we waited 45 mins but at closing times of the parks you sort of expect it. after-all there are thousands of people trying to get out and anyone who can't understand that must be daft! The boat service to magic kingdom, and fort wilderness / contemporary resorts are also very quick and had near to no wait time. The extra magic hours was a real benefit at magic kingdom, one night we were there from 10.30 pm until 1.30 am and done most of the park. with Epcot, that was different, EVERYONE wanted to go on Soarin', so no extra magic benefit really. We found it so handy having a room key that was a charge card, our admission into the parks and our Disney Dining plan too, really handy. You will need to show this to get your extra magic hour wristband. It has your name printed on it so you can keep it as a keepsake. Oh, and the hotel gave us "Just Married" badges, which gave us loads of perks everywhere, like free drinks, free bike ride, given front row on rides, in mexico a whole boat to ourselves which was nice! Loads of people coming over and congratulating us! Free Champagne flutes from Magic Kingdom at Cinderella's royal table. All sorts! When we were the flag family, ranger Stan was great bless his heart! He took us up, we raised the flags, videoed and took loads of pics from up there! What a view, do it if you can! You get a certificate, then he takes you to club level and you get a free breakfast after giving your family a certificate! Great fun - an absolute must! All in all we are really pleased we stayed here, ok so the cleaners could have done better, but you are paying for the location to the parks. The room was not huge, but big enough by far. we loved it. It looks a bit dark but this is keeping in with the theme. Also, there re light switches on the bed, so be sure to find them. Oh, and just a warning, every time you turn the telly on (a flat screen to boot!) it automatically turns on the disney top 7 must see's, anyone who knows Stacey will know what I mean! And although she is very cheery, when you get back from the parks all worn out and want half an hour of telly to wind down, she can get very irritating! And you get loads of disney channels including disney vacation club secrets, but no channels like the discovery channel which we love (I know what you are thinking - GEEKS!) as it is different to what we have back here at home in the UK (we don't have Sky) but then we only spent little time in the room so it didn't matter. We would stay here again, and though it is very expensive for what it is, I think it is worth it, just to be hassle free and you can come and go as you wish. We have always staying on International drive, and had to rely on the free shuttles to the parks which are great, but you have to book a time to come home, and you don't get to see the fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “location and hotel perfect”
Reviews.Author: MinnieTink
Reviews.Content: We were there the week of May 5th and we loved it. The "geyser" they speak of looks like a large water fountain by the lake. The room and grounds were great. The slide at the pool is fun. Must eat dinner at the Whipering Canyon. All you can eat bbq. Such a fun night. The Roaring Forks ( counter service) could have a little more to choose from, but all food was good. We used the Magical Express, but didn't tag our luggage and took it with us on the bus. It was a plus as we could check right in and didn't have to wait for it. Since so many use Magical Express there was hardly await for our luggage. The big plus was that this hotel countered with our Airline so on our return we could check in right at hotel, get boarding passes and check in luggage before arriving to airport. The dining plan really worked for us too. I had to use 2 dinners for lunch at the Castle - not worth it., The boat service was a plus. You can take a 3 minute boat ride to contemporary and use monorail ( we rode in the nose of the monorail with conductor - it was great) Everyone who worked at the resort was wonderful and accommodating. Some of my recommendations. - Chef Mickey's for breakfast; 1900 Fare buffet for dinner with Cinderella and ugly stepsisters. Sci Fi at Hollywood Studios. Fav parks - Epcot and Universals (both). Don't miss fireworks at Magic Kingdom and Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: chocoholic61
Reviews.Content: This was my 10th vacation at Disney and first stay at Wilderness Lodge. First I came by mystelf so I don't have some concerns that families w/ small children might have. I had nothing but positive experience dealing w/ the hotel staff whether at the front desk, mousekeeping, the people in the restuarants and the counter service. My room was a courtyard room. It was clean enough, could tell it's one of the "older" hotels, but everything was perfect. 5-6 nights I found a towel animal in room which totally added to the "Disney" experience and everyone I dealt with had the "Disney Customer Service" spirit that Disney is known for. As far as the bus and ferries, only 2 times in 7 days did I have to wait for a 2nd boat and that wait was about 15 minutes, all other transportation was less than 10 minutes whether in the morning, afternoon or extra magic hours. This is my new favorite Disney Resort and I can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel. Defenitly recommend it A+++”
Reviews.Author: amandap372
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week this spring and we had a great experience. It was our first trip to Disney w/ our 2 kids ages 8 & 6 and the room was a great size. We had a queen bed and bunk beds. We had a flat screen tv and a view of the pool. The dressing area was sufficient and the bathroom was a good size. I was happy to have a small refrigerator to store our leftover water in and was impressed with the hotel staff. They were very pleasant and when we had a small issue they resolved it immediatly. The housekeepers always left little surprises for the kids and the room was exceptionally clean. The pool was busy but not too crowded. We enjoyed the boat a lot with regards to traveling back and forth to the magic kingdom and the buses seemed to be quite easy as well. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, whether you are a first timer or a well traveled disney expert. I am hoping that if we go again in the near future we will stay here. I certainly can't imagine staying anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Wilderness Lodge!!”
Reviews.Author: minnei
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from 4/15-4/19. Had to leave the Wilderness Lodge to board the Disney Magic for a 7-day Western Caribbean cruise. Next time we will skip the cruise and just stay at the Wilderness Lodge and Disney World for another 7 days. We had the least expensive room and it was perfect for us. Our view was of roof-tops - pretty bad - but that did not matter to us - we were never in our room. Our room did have the balcony overlooking the lobby with rocking chairs to sit in, which was our meeting place and worked out great. (There were 6 of us, all adults, traveling together.) All of our rooms were next to each other - a fantastic accomplishment on Disney's part - considering how many people constantly come and go. The room was very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. Loved the convenience of just going down the elevator to the lobby to shop, eat, and enjoy the beautiful lobby and outdoor area. We did not use the pool as the weather was cool. The buses and boats were very convenient to all parks. The only downside was the bathroom. Wishing it were a little brighter and larger. But, actually, it was in keeping with the theme--the wilderness did not have large, bright bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great WDW Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: prgirl73
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Wilderness lodge the week of 4/20. I only have two complaints. The resort is very large, and with two little ones under the age of 5, it was hard for us to lug them and their things around, such long distances. Also, their quick service food area, the Roaring Fork is really small and cannot accommodate all of the guests staying there that choose to use it. Oftentimes, the lines to get food were too long. The selection is also too small, as well. But other than that, the resort is great. The wilderness theme is wonderful, and the lobby is gorgeous. Even the music that they pipe through the property is great and adds to the ambience. The pools are phenomenal, and my kids loved the main pool with the slide. The transportation service (boat and bus) are great, and are not as slow as people told me they would be. And lastly, our housekeeper, John S. was wonderful. We were there to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary, and every night we would have not only a different towel animal waiting for us, but balloons, chocolate candy hearts, pictures signed by Mickey Mouse, etc., waiting in our room for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Wind Down”
Reviews.Author: West_C0ast_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Our kids (ages 7 and 9) loved the hotel. They had bunk beds in our room which added to the adventure. The staff were all very friendly. I highly recommend staying on the concierge level. It gave my wife and I a place to relax and talk after we put the kids to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to like it but didn't”
Reviews.Author: mclevitt
Reviews.Content: First let me say i am a huge fan of the Disney properties and have had suberb stays at the Polynesian and Grand Floridian. We decided to stay at Wilderness Lodge for our four night stay as we felt it would be great for the kids. we even booked the Club Level to ensure some extra creature comforts. The bottom line was that we were very disappointed. the service levels were not up to snuff and housekeeping did my turn down on the first night before 5pm, before we made it back from the pool. on the second day, we returned home from the parks at 4pm to find our room not yet made. additionally, i called down for a toothbrush and shaving cream at 10pm and by 11.30pm i finally gave up. still nothing until i called down again the next morning. Josh and Anna the guest services managers were nice and very apologetic, but it does not change the annoyance of these incidents. The Club Level was also not what i was expecting. at the Polynesian the lounge is spacious and has some charm, the Wilderness "lounge" is a small area with some cookies and drinks. the tables are in the regular hallways and it has no atmosphere what so ever. the club level staff were pleasant but unlike previous trips, they were powerless to get bookings for breakfasts or dinners beyond that available to the general public. The worst part of the stay was the issue of travel to and from the Parks. the combination of boat shuttles and buses was nowhere near that of the monorail. there was actually an hour and ten minute delay for a bus home from Epcot on our last night. people were going crazy. i actually calmly reported this to the front desk and was told a manager was looking into the delay and would get back to me. i am still waiting!! Lastly, the pool was way too small and way too crowded to the point where my kids were not even anxious to swim. we normally spend half the day at the parks and half at the pool but that did not happen this trip, as just not desirable or relaxing. On the plus side, Disneyworld is a great vacation. my kids ages 8 and 6 had fun. Whispering canyons restaurant in the lobby is a hoot and food was good. we liked our room and it was plenty big enough for the four of us. keep in mind that bathrooms are small and very dark. i know i am sounding very critical and i guess that is because i am disappointed in this resort. my expectations of Disney are just higher. my suggestion is try the Polynesian before going here.

Reviews.Title: “only ok”
Reviews.Author: deannamort
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the wilderness lodge from 4/21-4/26. This trip was booked directly through disney and although they were very accomidating during the booking procedure when we arrived all that was told to us did not necessarily come to pass. Numerous times both my sister in law and myself contacted the resort directly to requested adjoing/connecting rooms. We were even as specific as stating with the door in between. although initially being told this was not a problem. We ever resived the rooms we requested. I felt our room was not the greatest with a strong odor of mold. The toilet ran constantly and the beds were soso. I would go back to the other disney properties I have stayed at, such as the contemporary or the grand floridian before returning here. Some positives.........my daughter enjoyed the pool very much which has a nice slide and the artist point restaurant was a lovely night out treat for my husband and myself

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: IndiTravler
Reviews.Content: We got sucked back to Disney on the "bounce back" promotion offered during our stay in Dec 07 at Animal Kingdom Lodge. We specifically booked April to see the Epcot Flower and Garden Festival. We chose the Wilderness Lodge based on reviews and price. Animal Kingdom Logde (AKL) was great and this was better. This time we got our request for a King bed (rather than 2 queens) and a quite room. I know the rooms were exactly the same size but it felt so much larger and more "duluxe" with only one bed that it totally changed the experience. This room also had a flat panel TV that provided more room. Mousekeeping was much better and I ended up with a wide variety of towel animals that I never got at AKL. We also enjoyed the short boat ride to Magic Kingdom. We really enjoyed the Epcot Flower Festival, but were pleased to see lots of toperaries (sp?) at most parks and resorts. We were also able to really relax becuase we didn't have the pressure to see everything in one trip. Would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort with minor issues...”
Reviews.Author: minmin20
Reviews.Content: We visited the Wilderness Lodge from April 12-19th and overall our trip was excellent!! We used the Disney Magical express and the previous reviews were very accurate we didn't have any delays and our luggage arrived about 3 hours later. Our room wasn't ready yet as we arrived at 10:00 am so we ate at the Wispering Canyons for Breakfast which was a great way to start our vacation (be careful when asking for ketchup =) After our breakfast we decided to see if our room was ready and we were in luck so we headed up and the previous reviews were very accurate. Very nice room but darker and not as large of a room for a deluxe hotel, but this doesn't bother us as we spend very little time in our room. Our view overlooked the pool which was great to view the electrical parade and you didn't hear any commotion at night. Our mousekeeping wasn't as good as in previous stays to the value resorts we only had one towel shaped in the form of mickey ears then we had a bowtie in the bathroom which remained the whole week w/o being changed. We've stayed the past few times in the all star resorts and our now 9 year old son looks forward to those little things as he comes back each night. As far as the dining we ate at the Wispering Canyons for breakfast and dinner a couple of times. Which was a great experience and my son loved all the commotion. I agree with other reviews on the food court "roaring canyons" while the food was good there really wasnt as much selection and our biggest complaint is the lack of room. My son loved getting the mickey waffles in previous stays and they weren't offered in the food court and it would be too expensive to eat in the wispering canyons each day. The area was very small and during rush times was way too hectic. Overall the resort is extremely beautiful and the lobby is amazing...I would recommend this resort as long as you do not mind the food situation. We had a great week and will definitely come back to disney but would probably try a different resort...

Reviews.Title: “World Class”
Reviews.Author: Travel-LifeIsShort
Reviews.Content: This is a great property at Walt Disney World. We booked a studio in the Villas section through an exchange with Interval International. That's timeshare trading for those of you who may be unfamiliar. We were even fantastically lucky to get Spring Break week. The property was immaculate, loaded with world class hotel amenities, beautiful landscaping, comfortable bed, polite and frienldy staff. Parking is very close to the hotel, so I would not really recommend paying for valet parking, even though it is relatively reasonable at $10 day. A boat docks at the resort which goes to the Magic Kingdom every 20 minutes. Location-wise, this property is very close to Magic Kingdom, and farther from Epcot, Hollywood Studios, Animal Kingdom, and Downtown Disney/Pleasure Island. So, if you plan to spend a lot of time at the latter locations, you might want to pick another place, such as the Boardwalk Villas. On the other hand, we would gladly return and stay there for the resort itself, even if we had no intention of going to a Disney park. It's just a great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel Rooms just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: leapinluluHartfordCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the wilderness lodge for 9 days in March of 2008. It was myself, my husband and our three children ages 6, 4, and 2. We stayed at the concierge level and that was fantastic. The extra level of service is well worth the extra money. The concierges were wonderful. The breakfast was fine for everyone and the kids loved all of the snacks esp. the after dinner snacks. We were unable to get reservations at Cinderella's Castle for breakfast. I asked the concierge once if they could work on it for me (never mentioned it again) and two days later we had breakfast with Cinderella. My two year old son became ill (ear infection) I asked the concierge about a medical clinic. He made a phone call and immediatly escorted myself and my son to the valet area where there was a van waiting for us to take us to the clinic. We had a room with a beautiful view of Cinderella's castle and of the nightly fireworks (it was also a view of the loading dock and we were able to hear the back up beepers of the trucks throughout the night and the very early A.M. The rooms are not big and are nothing much to look at. We were not in the room that much and thank god, because they are the smallest rooms I have seen in a delux property hotel. They were however clean. And we did have funny characters made form our towels most days on our beds and housekeeping made a special girl bunny toothbrush holder for my daugher, and a boy bunny toothbrush holder for my son out of towels. Whispering Canyons Was fun (the kids loved it). And artist point was delicious (but expensive) I don't remember how expensive but it was over $200 my 6 and 4 year old ate from the kids menu and the 2 year old shared from my plate and my husband and I don't drink. But the dinner was fantastic!!!! The boat to the Magic Kingdom was nice (staying on the monorail is easier with the young kids) and one day it was windy so the boats were unable to run and the only way over was bus to the contemporary and than the monorail That was fine for the way over to magic kingdom but they failed to mention you can't get a bus back that way. It took some creative talking to the bus driver and he broke from his route and delivered us to the wilderness lodge anyway because his bus was empty. The pool was nice my kids loved it and my 6 year old loved the water slide. I did however see a toddler fall and split his nose on the rock edge of the pool (seems dangerous and crazy for a toddler pool). Our overall experience would have been just fair but was made very good because of the concierge level. We have stayed at the poly before and this resort was only slightly cheeper I think I would probably spend the extra money and go back there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: flajay
Reviews.Content: Beware !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I had a bad feeling when I found a parking spot next to the taxi side of the Lodge. (I have two boys 4 and 2) The language was filthy as the drivers sat waiting for calls I was amazed at the language my two boys heard within the first two minutes of our stay. I decided to pull up and pay for valet at $10.00 a day I thought that was reasonable. Here is where things got crazy, luggage everywhere, very disorganized, and the system is flawed. The idea is to leave your luggage with this group go to your room then call down for them to bring up the baggage. After I noticed the confusion I asked to have my bags taken up with us when we went up. Well that is against the rules they will not even give you a cart so you can take your own bags up. So I had to carry everything (remember 4 and 2 yr old) up to our room. Pay attention to the small print the hotel is not responsible for damage or THEFT to your bags. So ask next time you see this unorganized group what would you do if you had to replace all your things. I was told from the valet manager that it was a real busy day and that is why all the confusion. So in other words if they are busy you will pay the price!! When we checked in I requested one king size bed with a court yard view and was told that would be fine. When I finally found my room after asking two different employees where it was It was two queen beds over looking the maintenance department.(very loud) I went down to ask the same clerk and he said that "HE" thought we would be better off with what he assigned us. (UNBELEIVABLE) One of the managers "Josh" called up and offered reservation to the hotel themed restaurant and we accepted. I would warn all normal people to really watch the set up before eating there. If you are into the screaming rude theme this is the place for you. Very small dinner selection with a average food cost. I had to send my Prime rib back three time's there was no real eating together. As I wait for my dinner we find our self caught up running around with ketchup bottles from table to table. I believe the server should have realized I have not even received my meal before I got the check with items on it we never ordered. I finally received my meal and the Prime was very good the third time around. The server did remove the incorrect Items from our check but what a mess!!!! When you throw napkins and and when asked for a refill respond "when I can, I haven't had a break yet seems like a strange "theme". Being a full time Florida resident my wife and I will never stay here again. We would not have stayed this time although the resort of choice was booked. So Beware I would choose another spot next time in Disney, the polynesian was fantastic the past few times!!

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: ridger_8
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at the Wilderness Lodge 6 times. The first stay was 6 months after it opened and the latest during December, 2007. We absolutely love this place. The staff is very friendly and aside from the occassional small problem, attentive to detail. The bellman we had 12 years ago recognizes us and runs over to hug us whenever we arrive. Many of the staff at Whispering Canyon remember us as well. It truly makes you feel like you've come home. Whispering Canyon is a bit pricey but their meals are experiences more than just food. Definitely worth it. Artist Point is one of the finest restaurants I've been to. The buffalo steak is very nice. Access to the parks is efficient by bus. The Magic Kingdom is also accessible by boat which is a nice relaxing ride on the lake. A stay at WDW in December is very special with the decorations, holiday events, etc. Wilderness Lodge is very special at this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: bostonstm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from 3/21st to 3/30th and it was excellent. Let me preface this review with the fact that I am very critical of lodging. I have a little one with allergies/asthma so I tend to be overly concerned with the cleanliness of a hotel and room. Having said that, the Wilderness Lodge exceeded my expectations! The grounds, lobby, hallways, restaurants, and our room were cleaned impeccably every day - and every part of the resort, inside and out are immaculate. My family stayed there during the busy Easter week and we never felt overcrowded, rushed, or jammed whether it be in the restaurants or while using the resort's transportation services (boat and bus). Our room was located on the 5th floor and overlooked the waterfall and creek - It was very quiet - never heard our neighbors and enjoyed the electric water pageant from our balcony. We also loved the nightly turn down service - what a luxury after a busy day in the parks - and how lovely to even have them replenish your towels that late in the day! The pool area was quite nice with a wonderful water slide, hot tubs and snack bar right there on site. The restaurants were superb. Artist Point is perhaps the best meal at Disney - the food by far was our best meal ever on property (and we have been on property 5 times in the past 5 years). Whispering Canyon had both great food and such fun ambience that we cancelled reservations elsewhere to enjoy dinners there instead. Roaring Forks is the only place where perhaps I think could improve - as other reviewers have noted, it is a small space and the options are nowhere near as exhaustive as other food courts - having said that, what food they offer is prepared very well. I cant say enough good things about this resort. You can see the pictures and appreciate the beauty - but you need to really be there to see the little things that just make this the best property around. We cannot wait to return next year and foresee it as becoming our home away from home when visiting Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: FilmmakerMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were concerned about staying on a Disney property with our six-year-old twins because of over-stimulation and over-exposure to all things Disney. We just returned from a week at the Wilderness Lodge and were pleasantly surprised to find that hotel was beautiful and tastefully decorated. The staff was courteous and our room attendant made cute little animals out of our washcloths, which delighted the children. We generally spent our mornings at the parks and the afternoons at the hotel. Although we were there at peak season, the pool never felt over-crowded and the waterslide was a big hit. There is a great running/biking trail through the woods where you can see deer on a regular basis. There are also boat rentals on the property and boating there is very easy and the waters calm. The Whispering Canyon Restaurant in the hotel had great barbecue although a loud atmosphere. Beware if you ask for ketchup - you may get more than you bargained for! If your main reason for going to Disney is the Magic Kingdom, this is the place to stay. Travel to the Magic Kingdom was easy and pleasant by boat or by bus and never took more than twenty mintues, even with the wait. One day we took a boat to the Contemporary and then took the monorail to the Magic Kingdom, a fun trip in and of itself. Overall, I would highly recommend staying at the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel at Disneyworld”
Reviews.Author: BushkaTexas
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disneyworld eight times in the past 15 years. We have stayed at many of the hotels on the property but the best one is the Wilderness Lodge. The location is great and the scenery is beautiful. The rooms are very nice, service great, restaurants, especially Artist Point incredible, pool fantastic and the ambience is very soothing. We honeymooned at this hotel in 1996 and finally was able to get a room there for our vacation in 2007. It's still one of the best hotels on Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars but missed the mark”
Reviews.Author: rthiggins1
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and had a great time at the parks. The boat over to the magic kingdom was fun at first but after a while got annoying. The hotel was four stars but very expensive. We were there at peak season rates. I was a little disappointed in the size of the pool. They built a huge hotel with lots of guests so obviously the pool should be huge.....but it wasn't. Very crowded, lots of elbows and bumping into people. Disney nickel and dimes you too much. Everything is way too expensive! Water, soda, breakfast. Big $$$$$. There was no Wi-Fi in the hotel or anywhere in the park. I was working so I had to pay $10/day to get on the internet. Also, if you like good coffee....don't do to Disney! The entire park is linked to Nescafe instant coffee machines. I'm not joking. Even the coffee bars are instant coffee....yuck/$2.00 a cup! Obviously Disney made a deal to maximize profit....someone call Starbucks! My advice...pay a little more and stay at the Polynesian or Grand Floridian...better access to the parks, less removed and very nice accomodations. Disney still has the magic......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasMte
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on previous reviews and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in the middle of forest-like area with plenty of trees and plants while overlooking the lake. Luggage transportation from airport to our room took about 5 hours (arrived 4:30 PM at airport and received luggage at 10:00 PM). Location and transportation to parks are amazing. Both boat and bus transportation are very reliable. We used the boat to Magic Kingdom and the bus to all other theme parks. The rooms are adequate and well appointed and they have a small fridge. One big plus in the room is that the double sink is separate from the bathroom and allows for multiple users to do "their functions" at the same time. Food is a bit tricky. The Whispering Canyons required reservations and we did not like their breakfast. The Artist Point is pricey and be prepared to spend $50 per person for dinner. We frequently used the Roaring Forks for breakfast and snacks, it was quite good. Water bottles (20 fl) are $2.00 all over (hotels or parks). If you are a coffee drinker in the morning, buy the hotel mug for $13, which allows you to have it filled with hot and soft drinks with no limits and you can transfer your last fill to a to-go cup for the ride. The extended hours was the only way we were able to take the Soarin' ride at EPCOT (60 minutes wait) compared to 120 minutes during regular hours. We ckecked our luggage all the way to our final destination and had our boarding passes at the hotel. It was a very pleasant experience for the 5 of us.

Reviews.Title: “What an Impressive Place”
Reviews.Author: Nantucket2007
Reviews.Content: I found this resort so interesting and beautiful and really appreciated my time there. The lobby is such a great first impression, almost overwhelming. There are also plenty of great spots around the atrium to enjoy the indoor and outdoor views. The rooms were very nice - gives you that fancy lodge feel. We had a roomy balcony and I believe most of the rooms do - it overlooked the Wilderness Villas pool and it was a terrific view. At night, I loved the sounds - granted, not real but convincing - of crickets chirping (don't laugh - it sounded great!). The Wilderness Lodge offers so much - several restaurant choices, lush grounds and a great atmosphere - that pool is a great centerpiece. This was a very cool destination hotel - less expensive than the biggies at Disney but more than the moderates. Very worth it either way - it's a great setting.

Reviews.Title: “Wild Adventure At The Wilderness”
Reviews.Author: Liveinthesunshine
Reviews.Content: okay well i just found this website browsing on the web. I have been to the Wilderness Lodge hotel 16 times. And i am a kid. I love it! The poeple are so nice there. They smile at everyone including those yelling adults who scream through the hotel because something didn't go thier way. Get over it. You cant have everything you want. The lodge is great for anykind of person yourng and old. It brings all of the adventure of the wilderness into a 5 star hotel, without stepping foot outside. It has great food. Very clean and short trips to whatever park you want to go to. I will always go back to the lodge believe me it's wonderful. A great place to make new memories with your family that will last a lifetime. Who knows you might have some wild adventures too! Sorry for any typing errors i am only a kid please remember! Thanks and have a pleasent time wherever you stay at in Walt Disney World

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Disney”
Reviews.Author: blcpearl
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge seems to be very popular for Disney visitors, so we decided to give it a try. Our room was very nice, flat screen tv, rustic furniture with animal carvings on headboard. We were on the 6th floor overlooking the pool. Our balcony was tiny and partially enclosed, so you had to stand up to see over the railing. It seemed that the visitors were primarily families with young children, as strollers were everywhere. I think I would have chosen a different resort for an anniversary stay. I wasn't impressed with the food court offerings, but Whispering Canyon has excellent food and is a fun, unique restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “all i coulda WISHED for (:”
Reviews.Author: marycait
Reviews.Content: Well, this is definitely all i could have asked for and more. The most amzing hotel i think i have ever stayed at. You feel that you are really in a disney movie, as they go all out to make you feel comfortable, and as if the hotel is made of magic! Not only are the rooms, SO CLEAN you could deliver a baby in it, but the whole hotel follows this rule too. The Whispering Canyons resturant which is located in the lobby is perfect for kids, as they not only make it a wonderful place to get food, but entertainment that the kids will love. If you dont wanna spend alot of money on food, go to the Roaring Fork, where you can get perfectly fine food for lower prices. This hotel models disney, and in that is perfect for kids, to adults, making everyone feel welcome. The pool is amazing, and even includes a miny slide, very clean. Within travelling distance to ever park, whether it be by bus, or by boat. I definitely recommend Disneys Wilderness Lodge to anyone, of any age as they are sure to have a magical time as i did :D

Reviews.Title: “What a BLAST!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Disneylover92
Reviews.Content: People who did not like this hotel are NUTS! This hotel is my favorite of all disney resorts. my last check in said that i have stayed there 71 times!!!! This resort has all u can ask for and more. It has a wonderful pool and a slide for little kids and adults who are litttle kids at heart. the food is OUT OF THIS WORLD!! there is such a selection of food here. there is anything from rosted chicken to huge chocloate chip cookies. the rooms are just amazing. you feel like you are really in the widlerness! And the location! man is it a great location. it is right next to magic kindom. and many more. This wonderful hotel even had mini boats for you and 1 other person to go flying down the lake. it even has pontune (sp?) boats that can take you and your whole family out. There is even bikes that you can take for a ride. there is bikes anywere from one seat to 6 seats. i perfer the 6 seater one because all your family can ride in it. like i said before this hotel is great, fantastic, wonderful, and awesome. so come and experience the disney magic at the hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Tonedog86
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Disneyworld in July 2003 and stayed here. This was a great friendly hotel. It had a high class restaurant, a friendly middle class restaurant called the Whispering Canyon which served southern food and at 5PM they always banged the large bell and said "COME AND GET IT!!!!" and the Roaring Fork which served fast food and cafeteria style food. It had a running path where one could run for a few miles and was right next to a ferry stop on the way into Disneyworld. It had an outdoor pool and hottub and was a great shelter from the daily storms that occur during hurricane season. Probably my second or third favorite hotel of all time.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelSC
Reviews.Content: I was determined to stay on property this year after my experience with an Orlando "resort" last year. Let me set my expectation level: I wanted something CLEAN and in close proximity to Walt Disney World (especially the Magic Kingdom). The Wilderness Lodge met these expectations - plus some! The hotel itself is gorgeous. The lobby is breathtaking. We simply didn't have time to eat here, and had to squeeze in time to swim. My kids LOVED the pool area (I loved the hot tub!). They really enjoyed the water slide. There were ducks in the pool which turned me off a bit, but my kids thought they were awesome. The geyser just past the pool was really cool also. What a neat thing Disney added! I absolutely LOVED the boat transportation to the Magic Kingdom. It is not exactly speedy, but it sure beat cramming onto a monorail car at the end of the night with everyone else. I felt the boats were timely, and the ride "home" was an extension of the enjoyment of staying on property. We opted to drive when we went to Animal Kingdom, Epcot (we took advantage of the extra magic morning hours that day which was AWESOME!), and Downtown Disney, so I cannot comment on the bus service. Driving was easy, and after the first day we easily found our way around. The rooms here are small, but very well equipped. I was impressed at the spacious bathroom area, plenty of drawer space, sufficient closet area, and CLEANLINESS. Our housekeeper was also very attentive and met our requests. The kids LOVED the bunk beds, and I cannot imagine they would have slept nearly as well sharing a queen-size bed (they are 7 and 5). Yes, the rooms are small, but as the "vacationing Mom" it forced me to have a week off also. I did NO laundry all week and didn't fix one meal or wash one dish. We used the room as designed: as a crash spot to bathe and sleep in after long days at the parks. We were pleasantly surprised by the added amenities (especially the pools) which caused us to want to spend more time there than we had planned. I personally heard very minimal noise, and we all slept quite well (even sleeping in several mornings after VERY late nights out with two little ones). I am very picky about hotels being clean, and I felt our room was very clean. I held my breath until we got to the room. The kids squealed when they saw the bunk beds. I squealed when I saw the immaculate bathroom! :-D The Wilderness Lodge is considered a "Disney Deluxe Resort" and is priced accordingly. Keep in mind you are paying for location, not huge, plush rooms. However, if you are looking for a great family location close to the Magic Kingdom that is CLEAN and extends the magic of your vacation, I think you too will find the Wilderness Lodge is a great fit. I pray we'll get to go back some day!!

Reviews.Title: “Come for dinner but stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: travelingranger
Reviews.Content: I brought my parents here for two days to cap off a week-long vacation to Orlando in celebration of their wedding anniversary having spent our first five days at a nearby (and far more practical) condo resort. In any case the idea was to spend a couple of special days on Disney property near the Magic Kingdom and though this resort is impressive the stay was not really magical. First, there is no doubt that the public spaces inside and out are indeed fantastic and impressive. Everything in the soaring lobby and the man made stream and pools outside was amazing. Of course you could enjoy these spaces in almost the same way if you made reservations at the hotel resaurant. The disconnect comes when you go beyond the public spaces and into the rooms. There is nothing special about the smallish rooms to set them apart from any other rooms - except if you were anywhere else they would cost one half as much. And the room were a little worn. In one (we had two) the drapes were torn from the curtain rod and would not close all the way. Both looked like they needed some freshening and for someone in hosuekeeping to look beside and behind some of the furniture. Our rooms were apparently located over the loading dock - deliveries seemed to come and go all through the night. Yes, these were the least expensive rooms but two night still cost more than a grand! Disney has a reputation for being about the details and throughout the hotel they were getting it right but we were just dissapointed with our rooms. As anyone might expect, the staff at the resort were all delightful and very attentive, especially to my Mother who is dissabled. In any case, my family and I are fans of the Disney experience and we will return. We'll likely have dinner at one or two of the resorts but we're not likely to stay over!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive! Good location.”
Reviews.Author: March1970
Reviews.Content: My 3 year old son and I visited Grandma and Grandpa in The Villages for 5 nights and then decided to hit Disney for 3 nights. My poor husband stayed home in frigid Michigan to work and watch the dog! We had stayed in a cabin at Ft. Wilderness over Thanksgiving 2007 but wanted to try something new this time. When my son and I checked in we were surprised to find out that we were complimentary upgraded to the Conceige level. Which was a bonus since I was traveling alone with my son. I wasn't worried. It is Disney afterall but it was nice to have the added security. The concerige level is on the 7th floor and you need card key access for the elevator. The room was a standard room but the view of the pool and lake was great! The room was clean and quiet. We had a free continental breakfast in the morning, cookies and snacks in the afternoon and wine and snacks in the early evening. The boat to MK is very convienent and the buses run very timely from the front of the resort. We could see the electric light parade from our balcony which begins at 9:25 every night. The hotel is great and is wonderful condition. I didn't see any construction or see anything that looked dated. You MUST make reservations at Whispering Canyon. They didn't accept any walk in's while we were there. Roaring Forks was ok but the wait to pay for your food was long and annoying when you have hungry kids! The pool is nice with a slide and lifeguards but there were ducks swimming in it 2 feet from people! What the heck? I would think the resort could install some high wires to deter the birds and ducks from flying in. This is my only complaint about this resort! The weather was great and my son can't wait to go back again. I think next time we will try another hotel but not for any reason other than wanting to check other places out.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: cairo031
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney World about 19 times and 2006 was the first time I stayed in the park. I was 27 at the time and as soon as i walked through the front door I almost cried I was so overwhelmed with how amazing this hotel looked (and all I was looking at was the lobby). There was not one bad thing about this hotel and the location to the theme parks is great. I loved it so much I am going back December of 2008. I don't think I could stay anywhere else. I am too spoiled now.

Reviews.Title: “Not very magical”
Reviews.Author: StiffyJones
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Wilderness Lodge. Our stay was 7 days and we had the park hopper tickets and the meal plan. Hotel: Very nice atmosphere, nice pool area, beautiful lobby. A little more trash laying around the outside compared to other Disney resorts. Room: Average. We had two queen beds on the second floor. The sliding door was improperly fixed with a cheap sliding bolt for the lock. You want this door to seal nicely because of the constant horn blaring from the boats. I improvised a few slips of paper under the door to seal it and keep the noise out. The TV is a very nice LG LCD flatscreen that is locked to receive about 40 analog channels. You will hear your neighbors. Bring ear plugs. The plumbing was noisy. When a sink was turned on there was a loud hum that went along with it. Maid service was excellent. They made a new animal out of washcloths and towels almost every night. Grounds: Apparently there is no enforcement of the smoking policy anywhere outside this resort. Encountered a few drunk and vulgar people around the pool and boat dock area. You can get an OK glimpse of the Magic Kingdom fireworks from the beach area. Pool was too cold to use a couple of nights. Roaring Forks (quick counter service): Can get very crowded in the morning and has a poor traffic flow design. Disappointing selection of soft drinks. Whispering Canyon restaurant: All you can eat breakfast and dinner. Dinner is barbecue. The food is very good. The noisy atmosphere and antics are cute for about 10 minutes, but gets old real fast. Disappointing selection of soft drinks. Front desk and concierge: Some of the most unhappy and least helpful people I've encountered at any Disney resort. Not rude, just not any different than any other counter person at any other place of business. Magical Express luggage delivery service to room: 5 hours. Don't have anything that can't handle a pounding. Our luggage was obviously thrown into our room in a pile right in front of the door. Two plastic luggage tags were broken. Transportation: Poor. We averaged about 2 to 3 hours a day waiting for buses and boats. There seemed to be some confusion amongst the drivers at times. Many bus routes will make additional stops before arriving where you want to go. Boats were crowded and a few times we had to wait for more than one boat. Airport check out service: Very nice. You can leave your bags with them and they will be checked all the way to your final destination. Not pertaining to the Wilderness Lodge, but DisneyWorld in general-not their best week. Broken down rides, rides closed for refurbishment and poor transportation certainly didn't make our week magical. The entire Disney property is not diabetic friendly. With a very wide variety of diet soft drinks on the market there is only a choice of Diet Coke , water or occasionally lite lemonade. My 10 year old son quickly got discouraged with this. I was actually told by one "helpful" cast member that I should take a cab to the Hess gas station for a better selection. For all of the promotion of "year of a million dreams", I didn't see it happen once in seven days. We will be attempting to get at least a partial refund from our travel agent. If you want a deluxe resort, stay at the Polynesian or an Epcot resort. Disney meal plan: Used to be good. Now it has changed. No appetizer and no gratuity. To boot, a very cheesy solicitation of business with a 18% and 20% "suggested" tip. I actually had one waitress (at Whispering Canyon) ask me if I wanted to charge my tip to the room or was I leaving cash. In a year that had many challenges for my family we were hoping to have the same type of Disney experience that we have had before, if not even better. This trip didn't come close.

Reviews.Title: “Great first impression but just another hotel”
Reviews.Author: AgsOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Upon pulling up to the front of the hotel you immediately think that this hotel is awesome. They have apparently spent tons of money on the first impression. The hotel check in was quick and easy and someone will unload your bags from your car. Be cautious not to give all of the tip to this person as they are not the actual one that takes the bags to the room. A totally separate person will do this. This was very strange to me but apparently the way it is done. The room was clean as a room should be but nothing spectacular. It has two queen beds and enough room to sleep. I found out one thing of on property resorts at Disney. You are paying for the convenience of transportation and extra magic hours. The hotel room is not any nicer than a Hilton or even some Comfort Suites. It may actually lack in some areas. We woke up one morning to find that there was no hot water. We called the front desk and was told that yes a pipe was messed up and it would be a few more hours before the problem would be fixed. I would figure a hotel of this expense would have some type of backup system in place for this. I have stayed in many hotels and never not had hot water. I chalked this up as a freak disturbance and moved on. The next night we grabbed a quick bite to eat at the Roaring Forks counter service restaurant. I asked a simple question to please substitute grapes on the chicken nugget platter instead of french fries for my child. We were told they could not substitute anything for the fries and if we wanted grapes we needed to order the salad plate that came with grapes. I told them that my child would not eat salad but wanted grapes instead of fries on the chicken nugget plate. Once again the lady told us "Sorry, no substitutions". I was appalled as even McDonald's will substitute apple dippers for fries. On the way back to the room we spoke to the manager about the hot water and how we could not substitute grapes for fries. I know these seem like minor details but a substitution of grapes for fries should not be a problem. The manager listened to us about the hot water and grapes and basically said, "Oh well, I hope you enjoy the rest of your stay." For the prices Disney charges they could seem a little more caring. The hotel is fine but just keep in mind the room is a normal room, nothing special. If you come with great expectations of the room you will be disappointed. The pool is a normal pool, and the food is normal Disney food. If you are going to use the benefits of the extra magic hours to get into the park early and stay late then the on property resorts are worth it. The bus transportation was very nice especially on those rainy days when you don't have to drive and they drop you off at the front door (front door to Disney parks is still a little walk). If you want a large room luxury hotel this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - great location for Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: luaar78
Reviews.Content: This resort is a great option for families who want to spend a lot of time at the Magic Kingdom. It is only a boat ride away from the park. This resort has beautiful theming and landscaping and a great pool. The rooms are very nice, but nothing overly special. Like all the Disney resorts, this one is immaculately clean and has great service. The Whispering Canyon restaurant is a great, fun place to eat, especially with kids. The counter service food area is very small compared to some of the other resorts. The resort is also only a short boat ride from the Contemporary Resort and the campground, so there are other eating options nearby. Overall, this resort is worth the money, although it is not nearly as deluxe as some of the higher priced deluxe resorts.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to love this place, but I just liked it”
Reviews.Author: Courtesy_Flush
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to stay at the Wilderness Lodge because I was so impressed with the lobby during my last stay in Orlando. We went to Artists' Point for dinner (highly recommended), and I just fell in love with the property. My impression didn't change when we walked in; the lobby is really something. The outside pool area makes you feel like you're in the hot springs in the forest. I loved hopping on the boat from the dock in back. It was relaxing just going around the lake. What made this stay average is the pathetically small room and terrible view of the dumpsters below us. I'm sure we got one of the worst rooms on property which is to be expected given our bargain rate ($115/nt). We were on the dining plan so we visited their main cafe often. They were poorly staffed most of the time. How hard is it to hire another $7/hr cashier?! Another Disney policy that I hate is the poor access to a concierge unless you're paying for the "concierge level." I wanted to get an explanation of one of the activities that was going on at the hotel. I couldn't just pick up the phone and call without being transferred to a central line back and forth until I got someone who knew their stuff. And yes, I did just try calling the front desk at first, but they were the most clueless of all! I won't stay here again when I go back to Disney. I'd go back to the Beach Club in a heartbeat (see separate review).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: GlenRock111
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from 2/5-2/10. Very happy with the place. I was part of a family group of 13 including 4 kids ages 3-9. We all loved it. Nice grounds, warm pool open late and decent dining options. We ate in all three restaurants. the Roarking Forks is your standard counter service place. I wish it had more options, but it was good for what it was. Anything we got from there was tasty. We did a large group at Whispering Canyon and that was really fun for the kids. The food was nice too. Lastly, 4 of the adults when to Artist Point one night. It's certianly a nice restaurant for Dinsey and the service shows it. My dughter used the Cub's Den for a kids activity in the afternoon. It's a small playroom in the hotel that is used for baby sitting at night, but in the afternoon adults can take their kids their for supervised projects. She made a puzzle. Boat transportation to Magic Kindom was excellent and the bus service was decent. Never waited more than 15min. for a bus. The hotel seemed lively, but not overly crowded or packed. I'd recommend this place to anyone who wants to stay on-property and want's more than what the All Star Resorts offer. (you pay for it though)

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend at the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Magmosh
Reviews.Content: Went to Disney for a long weekend in September. Knew we would have fun - just didn't know HOW much! This was my first trip to Disney. We had a court-yard (or pool) view. It was beautiful. We were high enough that we didn't hear much noise from the pool at all. We were able to take a quick siesta in the middle of the day. Enjoyed the room thoroughly. It was very clean - every day when we came back from the parks, we found the room was spotless and there was a towel created into a famous disney character. We enjoyed the poolside bar. It has delicious frozen beverages (non alcoholic). The food there was great. Wanted to try Artists point, but we didn't make the time this trip. Room service was excellent. We had 2 days of room service breakfasts and 1 night of dinners - very quick and easy to use. (yah, expensive, but worth it after a long, hectic day in the parks). We felt that there was a lot to do at the resort itself. It was very tempting to just stay there and rent boats or lounge by the pool. September was an excellent time of year to go. Not so terribly crowded, easier to get onto the rides. Would definitely go back to Wilderness Lodge again - the service was excellent, there was a lot to do at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “A magical place”
Reviews.Author: BLMyers
Reviews.Content: We have been to Disney many times and on a recent visit, were fortunate enough to stay on property at the Wildnerness Lodge. The hotel is stunning, full of amenities that our children enjoyed and worth every penny that we paid (during high season too!). It made our Disney experience just that more magical and we can't wait to return (and try other Disney hotels!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wilderness”
Reviews.Author: Mickeymotto
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this resort! The lobby is grand and yet warm and welcoming! The pool was a great way to relax every night...we loved the current near the springs! We had a first floor courtyard a short walk to the pool. Everything was convenient....even transportation to the parks was easy. If we didn't take the bus, we could always take the boat to MK and other MK resorts. The food was good as Whispering Canyon, both breakfast and lunch were fun! Roaring Forks was a great quick stop for food too! We loved the Trading Post Store, we found a lot of great things there to take home! Water recreation is also available here too! It was like being transported to a Mountain Lodge in the middle of Florida! We loved it here and would definitely consider staying here again. It is also a great value for a Deluxe Resort!

Reviews.Title: “High Disney quality as usual”
Reviews.Author: ILDrew
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Wilderness Lodge a number of times and went back over a long MLK Holiday. Over the weekend and through Monday, the hotel was quite crowded but the hotel staff was still friendly and helpful. The pool area is very enjoyable and we found the boat service to and from the Magic Kingdom to be very good. The hotel lobby is of course almost without comparison. The only complaint I would have is that we were in a northerly facing room and we could hear the delivery trucks come and go in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone loved it!”
Reviews.Author: GramyB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two sons and families( one 5yr old & two 18mo olds) to the Disney World Half-Marathon and stayed for eight days at Wilderness Lodge. The only rooms available were woods view so I wasn't sure about the view but our rooms overlooked some woodsand also had a pond where we saw otters playing. The rooms were very clean and the service was great. The rooms have a small fridge so we all stopped at Publix before checking in for supplies. We also bought the mug at the Roaring Creek and then we could go down and get drinks whenever we wanted. We found the rooms to be quiet, we only heard noise from other rooms in the hallways or out on the balconies. We found it amazing that with as many rooms as there are we never had to wait more than 30 seconds for an elevator. The staff was always friendly and pleasant. We had a whole flock of cute little towel critters on our bed by the time we left. I can definitely say all the families enjoyed their stay at Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pennsey
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the "COLD" spell.. Hotel had nothing to do with that and even though it was 30 degrees outside there were people SWIMMING in the pool and in the jacuzzi so it must have been kept at a great temperature. Rooms were very clean and always neat. We traveled with our 2 grandchildren, daughter & husband and had adjoining rooms which was fab!. We soon discovered that the boat ride to the Kingdom was the fastest and the best way to travel. Never waited more then 10 minutes for the ride. Everyone was very helpful in our questions. We had a sick child during the trip and they arranged for someone to pick us up to take to urgent care. Could not have asked for more. We ate most of our meal via the cafeteria but took the food back to our rooms since it was always crowded. But that worked out much better for us anyhow. We could relax and eat at our leisure. They could of had more variety of foods but I can't complain. We always found something we enjoyed. The gift shop, arcade rooms, Whispering Cafe, Artist Point were great. Would stay there just b/c of the boat ride to the kingdom. You never had to walk far to get either the boat or bus no matter where you stayed in the hotel. I have heard that some of the hotels you have to walk 15 minutes just to get the bus. Not here. Everything was very close and comfortable. Check in was a little long but there were also many people ahead of us. They left messages on your phone and on your door when you needed to at the bus for airport pickup. Definetly give this place a 5 star and would stay there again! Didn't get a chance to participate in any Hotel activities b/c we were busy with the Parks but would have liked to . Maybe next time we stay we will have more time. We needed a microwave in one of the rooms for my grandson's special eating needs and they were very prompt in getting it right up to us. EVERYONE was always pleasant and courtious and helpful. Recommend 100%.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: disney-pals
Reviews.Content: hi me and my family stayed at wilderness lodge in july 07, the check in was quick and we got upgraded free of charge. the rooms are clean and comfy we payed for a pool view which was worth the extra money. the dining is great we ate at artist point and whispering canyon. we stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks before moving onto the hard roack in universal and we were not ready to move on, could have easily stayed on a while longer. we visit disney every year and therefore like to experience different disney hotels as we feel that each hotel is theamed differently this year we are trying disney port orleans watch out for my review. happy holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A Favorite”
Reviews.Author: ChrEliza
Reviews.Content: Walking into the lodge is an experience unto itself. It's large, open, and kind of takes your breath away with it's Disney Magic. It doesn't look very Disney-ish at first, more like something you'd find at Yellowstone Park. The rooms are clean, nice, with fun rustic touches to make it seem like a lodge. All the amenities are available. Most recently we stayed in the Villas but in the past we've also stayed in the main lodge. The villas have a kitchen, dining area, living room area and separate bed and bath. The pool area is amazing. There is a little creek that runs through the hotel, outside, down a rocky waterfall area and then into the pool. Near the pool is also a hot tub. Our son loved this too (he was just over 2 at the time). I would definitely recommend it. ~Christy

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful inside out (but only worth it for Disney fans)”
Reviews.Author: MidwestLawTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for three days in January. This property is beautiful inside and out and considered one of Disney's "Deluxe" hotels. Having stayed mostly at moderates in the past, we decided to try something new. The property itself is gorgeous, I could have stayed in the lodge the entire trip instead of going to the parks and been just fine. There were many activities scheduled throughout the day, but we never actually made it to any of them so I can't vouch for the quality of these. But it was nice knowing they were available. The room was nice, clean and with a decent view. We had a woods view and could just see the top of the Magic Kingdom and Cinderella's castle from a our second floor balcony. There was a small man-made pond in front of our room. Nothing more than a few ducks. The high points of this property are the beautiful design and the proximity to the Magic Kingdom by boat. The convenience that this boat service adds cannot be beat. You literally arrive at the front steps. Anybody who's trekked to or from from the bus drop-off understands the benefit of this, especially after a very long day at the parks. It is a fun place to explore, there is lots to see and look for inside the lodge, and outside there is a walking trail. The area around the pools and beach is fun to explore, with a geyser and bear tracks on the sidewalks for kids to follow. The low points for me were the concierge and the dining. Concierge was friendly but had limited knowledge. I had questions about seasonal passes and show times at the Magic Kingdom. Concierge didn't know show times (I was told this was specific to the parks), which I understand but it sure would have been helpful info to help plan my day. They also didn't have info on the seasonal passes and had to Google to get the needed info. This was disappointing after waiting in line for twenty minutes to speak to the concierge. The snack bar had the exact same items as are available in the moderate food courts, yet there is only one cashier and it's a tiny tiny space. The lines were excessively long and there were very few places to sit. This made breakfast impossible unless you got there really early or else really don't mind standing in line. I don't understand why Disney made the snack-bar dining smaller in the Deluxe accommodations? The Whispering Canyon restaurant was fun. The kids enjoyed the goofy service and spinning buffet wheel on the table. However, it's not really worth it unless you have more than two or three adults eating. Our waiter disappeared after the first service, so for us, it wasn't really "all you can eat." In closing, the Wilderness Lodge gets high marks just for being stunning, and we would stay there again - but service is inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lodge”
Reviews.Author: becky1red
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Staff were very friendly and the hotel was very clean. They had santa come on Christmas eve to see all the children and on Christmas day Mickey and Minnie were there to greet all the children. We had a great holiday. The extra hours were amazing. The park were not crowded like during the day and you could meet all the characters and princesses with no long lines of people. We stayed in the parks some nights to 3am. From the hotel you take a boat that leads you directly to the Magical Kingdom. Excellent hotel would recommend strongly. Collette (Ireland)

Reviews.Title: “Read this review before staying at the lodge”
Reviews.Author: ericacheers24
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to say that the atmosphere in the lobby is amazing. When you walk in you will be overwhelmed by the massive fireplace and small pond with a bridge over it. It's very lovely. There's also an area for kids by the check-in counter for kids to watch disney movies. The whole thing feels like Bill Gates's Log Cabin. Bottom line: it's awesome. After check in you will most likey go to the elevators, which are right behind a wishing well. This brings us to rooms, many people have probably commented on the rooms being dark. Well, the light switches are hidden behind or even IN the bedposts. Many people don't notice this. Also, many people don't realize that bunk bed rooms are available for a slightly higher price. My suggestion is that if your child is over 10 years old don't get a bunk bed room. The layout of the rooms is nice. My only complaint would be the stiffness of the sheets and the holes in them. Unfortunately, my sleep didn't feel very sanitary. Room service is very good, but its pricey. HERE IS WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW!!!!! There's a water parade on the lake some nights. It's very pretty. Also, in some rooms fireworks are partially viewable. Don't try and argue with a lobby lady for a room with a view of the Magic Kingdom, because there is no such room. The boat transportation to the Magic Kingdom is very pleasent. It takes 7 minutes on average. (We timed it.) The roaring forks resturant is the ideal place to take your young child. It's an interactive restuant where, you will be asked to wave your napkin and waiters have names like "Betsy May Brown Dog!" It's really a nice experience. The other resturant aka the food court is so-so. They have pretty good chicken strips. WARNING: If you eat by the pool you may be swarmed with crows and even an armidillo or two. Trust me. There is plenty of Wilderness in this Lodge. During our stay I say 1 armidillo, 1 swimming aligator, trillions of ducks, 1 snake on the path to the boats and too many crows to count. The Wilderness Lodge also has many secrets to it such as: the Vacation Club pool that is open to the public, but is hidden and you can never see it, the workout room, and the mini-boat rentals/ 4 person bike rentals. Just ask about these things.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Shammy41
Reviews.Content: Our family, which includes 2 children aged 7 and 5, stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for 9 nights and had a wonderful time. The resort lobby is quite spectacular and the Christmas tree and decorations definitely had us in the holiday spirit. Check-in was quick, the staff were helpful, our room was small but clean and comfortable, and the kids loved the bunk beds. The resort itself is very clean and most of the staff were friendly. We spent time in the pool with the ducks and ducklings which was the highlight of our daughters day, used the hot tubs which were always hot, and played in the sand at the small man-made beach. Our only complaint about the pool was that one of the lifeguards would not let the children use their water rings because they weren't clear and he couldn't see through them. Maybe a little restrictive given that we were in the pool with them constantly and no more that a couple of feet away. We had to carry lifejackets with us each time. We weren't overly enthusiastic about the Whispering Canyan Cafe but used the Roaring Fork self-serve cafe on a regular basis. It was convenient, with a relatively good selection of food. The kids loved the pancakes for breakfast. We didn't try the Artist's Point restaurant. We always seemed to miss the bus to the parks and often had to wait but, overall, the transportation was good. The boat to the Magic Kingdom was very quick. Our overall experience was definitely above average and we would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Special Place”
Reviews.Author: bchall5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attended a Disney World family reunion and stayed at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. The trip was great and the hotel, an overall positive experience. PROS: The lodge is beautiful. The lobby is grand, the pool area and waterfalls are breathtaking and you really do feel like you are in the middle of a beautiful national park. There are 3 great places to eat in the hotel, all at different price points. The boat transportation to the Magic Kingdom is also very convenient, and fun. Front desk, valet and "lodgekeeping" staff were all very friendly and helpful. The rooms were also decorated nicely with a lodge motif. We had a nice balcony that overlooked the courtyard with pool, hot tubs and falls. Very nice. Being that we stayed over New Year's the lodge was beautifully decorated for the Holidays. CONS: The park transportation from the hotel (except to the Magic Kingdom) is via bus. These buses make multiple stops and we waited, at times, for more than 30 minutes. You had to leave an hour for getting to any of the parks (except the Magic Kingdom.) Our room showed some wear, and the bedding needs to be updated. OVERALL: I would recommend this hotel. Especially if you enjoy the lodge feeling and would be spending most of your park time at the Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Pool kept way to cold”
Reviews.Author: DEE1120
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my 2nd stay at the wilderness lodge. I went during the very busy Christmas week. The pool was freezing cold and during my 8 day stay myself and many other guests repeadly complained about the cold temperature of the pool and jacuzzi. Everyone stated that there was nothing they could do and swore that the pool was kept between 78 and 82 degrees. With the pool and one of the jacuzzi's being kept so cold the only remaining jacuzzi which was hot had at least 12 children in it at all times. The limit for the jacuzzi is 9 and children are supposed to be with there parents. Myself and many quests discussed this situation during the 8 days and really could not believe that no-one would raise the temp on the pool. The hotel was booked to capacity and must of been making a bundle off of all the very same people who requested to have the temp raised in the pool. There are really no other activities at the hotel that do not cost extra money and I thought it was very inconsiderate to have the pool kept cold and the only thing seen in the pool everyday were the ducks and there poops and feathers flooting around. It would have been packed with very happy guests if they could of only raised the temp to a comfortable level. Do not bother complaining no-one cares.

Reviews.Title: “5 Peaks, A Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: mytwobuckaroos
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several Disney Resorts, we go at least once a year. This is was the first time to stay at the Wilderness Lodge (note: this is not the campground). I travelled with my two children and mother in law. This is so far the best overall hotel at disney!! First, the hotel offers the Fastest transportation to the Magic Kingdom -by boat. It is about a 10 min. direct ride to the park. This is much faster than the monorail with multiple stops and overcrowding. Also, this hotel is new and seems very peaceful compared to the other hotels. I truly felt like we were at a resort in the mountains. The hotel is on open water with trees, a really nice pool and huge white sand beach. There is a casual and more formal bar in the hotel. Also, the quick service restaurant provided gourmet pasta dishes and sandwiches as well as the standard nuggets and fries. The lobby is beautiful with a huge fireplace, indoor water features, nice shop, two casual and one more formal (for disney) restaurants. The rooms are very pleasant and relaxing. There is an option for bunk beds. I have stayed at Animal Kingdom, Port Orleans-Riverside, and Contemporary and I really like this hotel the best. No complaints. If you don't want to spend the money for this I recommend Port Orleans. This hotel also offers boat service to the contemporary to catch the monorail and also to the Fort Wilderness Camp Ground for MIckey's backyard BBQ - this is a must see event!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: teachermomVirginia
Reviews.Content: I hadn't visited Disney in years and decided to take my daughter over the summer. My mom had recommended the Wilderness Lodge and, without much else to go on, we booked there. It was fabulous. The hotel looks great when you drive up but it really starts when you enter. The lobby is incredible to look at and we must have stared for a few minutes, just turning in circles and looking around, before attempting check-in. The details are a lot of fun to notice, even after getting over the initial impression (I'm thinking of the somewhat stirring Western music, cricket noises, lanterns outside). My family and I stayed on the concierge level and also participated in the Disney meal plan---I'd say doing both was probably redundant, since we often ended up with more food than we could use. Staying on the top floor provided fabulous views of the lobby and I liked watching the activity below. It was nice to have a morning paper and a place to sit and enjoy the food and snacks that were put out periodically during the day in the conceirge lounge. Especially with a little one, being able to go get snacks, juice, and milk for her when necessary was fabulous. It made the things go much easier when all we had to was walk down and grab something for her to eat, rather than risking a trip to the snack bar or another sit-down meal---she especially enjoyed the gummy bears. The property is slightly more expensive than I would normally go to but I'd probably do it again....the place is great and the convenience can't be beat. Of course, we tended to stick to the Magic Kingdom and with a little kid, we weren't usually willing to stay the whole day in the park without coming back for a break at the pool or even a nap. But the hotel contributed to a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: laulaubee79
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip to Disney (it's been 12 years!!) I don't know why I haven't been back for so long, had an amazing vacation! We (my boyfriend and I) stayed at three different resorts (Pop Century, Hard Rock Hotel Orlando, and finally Wilderness Lodge over a weeks time. The place is amazing!! When you walk in the lobby (it is decorated for Christmas) it was just gorgeous!! The tree was the same size as the ones they use at the entrance to each park. The details like the carved wood beams and intricate headboards in the room were beautiful! We had a room on the 6th floor on the inside of the lodge. The room was very nice, fluffy towels, nice tv, mini-fridge, and a comfortable bed (not sure why others thought it wasn't! I slept through the whole night which I never do! and I own a Temperpedic at home!). The cons of this hotel: the bathroom floor seemed dirty, the Whispering Canyon Cafe (I like funny stuff too!) but this place was annoying with the loud guy yelling crap and the food was not that good except for the cornbread!, and I only got one towel animal (I was excited because on the first day we got a Mickey on our bed) and then there was never another! It sounds stupid about the towel animal but I thought it was cool and Disney makes me feel like a kid again! Other than a few small issues the place is amazing! The grounds were beautiful!! The hotel is very cozy! I would love to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: CletusSquatford
Reviews.Content: Pros: -The bunk beds are a little small, but a lot of fun. -Room was clean. -Concierge was friendly and helpful. -Staff at the whispering canyon cafe were friendly and did a lot of fun spontaneous things (the cafe in general is a lot of fun) -My 3 year old had a great time on the "hidden mickey" scavenger hunt. -We had a decent view of the magic kingdom fireworks each night and the electric light water parade deal on the bay lake. -The food was excellent at the "signature dining" artist pointe restaurant. -Everything decorated for Xmas, live Xmas music performed in the lobby, random events for kids (like making animals out of towels and pipe cleaners) -The children's pool was a lot of fun for my 3 year old and there are 2 hot tubs which are life savers after long days walking at the theme parks.
