The fact that there is one stone step down into the pool all the way around wasn't really an issue. A child under 3 should be monitored while in the pool anyway. Bring your own floatation device. -You can buy a souvenir mug for $15 that gives you unlimited refills on coffee, hot chocolate, sodas etc for the length of your stay -The grounds are just lovely, well maintained, with various disney magic (like hoof prints going off into the grass with a hedge-scuplted buffalo). The stream that starts in the lobby, turns into a waterfall outside and then empties in the pool is also especially lovely. We even saw a mother duck with her 10 offspring at the top of the waterfall. Cons: -Yes, it costs more. but, It's closer to the theme parks, you get a lot of magical extras for the kids, you can take a fun boat ride to magic kingdom, you get a lot of conveniences, especially if you're on the disney meal plan. You get what you pay for. -Yes, the rooms are a little small for more than 2 adults and 2 kids, but you shouldn't be spending that much time in the room anyway. Quality of the sheets and mattresses were decent, I've seen better but i've also seen worse. -Yes you should make your dining reservations in advance, though we got seated within 30 minutes without a reservation and you can sit in the majestic lobby while you wait and your kid plays with the lincoln logs they have set up. Service was a little slow for us, but really it wasn't a big deal. -Yes some of the staff are useless. There are a lot of employees most of them were friendly, helpful, and the manager of the artist point restaurant was even going around checking on the tables and seeing how everything was. But there are a few bad apples. If anyone at disney is reading this, the guy doing the "magic cookie hour" at the roaring fork dining/snack stand was downright creepy. It lasted 5 to 10 minutes, enough for my son to put some sprinkles and icing on a cookie and he made him a certificate with his name on it and that was it. Other than that, it was a lot of fun for all and worth the money. I might try a different resort now that I know what to expect at the lodge but it was a great first trip. I think the naysayers expecting more luxury were being overly picky. You're paying for the disney magic

Reviews.Title: “What a Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: kaycimbrazell
Reviews.Content: What an awesome place!! The lobby is absolutely gorgeous and the pools are wonderful! It was my sons first trip to Disney and he loved it. In fact, he enjoyed the resort and swimming as much as the parks. Totally worth the money. The only negative is the transportation, but that's at any resort. You just have to wait on the buses. You can take a boat to the Magic Kingdom and catch the monorail. Definitely go to the Whispering Canyons to eat. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: galaga_girl
Reviews.Content: Although pricey, the Wilderness Lodge is Disney's best property by far (i've stayed at deluxes and values) I can't even explain the feeling you have when staying at this hotel, everything is just superb. One thing that I did find odd was the size of the pool is rather small for a Deluxe resort. If you get the chance I highly recommend hiring a boat, crusing around the lake is fantastic and CHEAP!!

Reviews.Title: “Our last time here”
Reviews.Author: adriNorthport
Reviews.Content: This is our fifth time here in four years and with the exception of a flat screen tv nothing has changed since our first visit. The bathroom ALWAYS smells of sulfer-all 5 times. The facilities cannot handle the number of guests. We won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but if this was my first trip I would NEVER go back”
Reviews.Author: dvcmemberarkansas
Reviews.Content: Over the years, we have stayed at Wilderness Lodge & Boardwalk. Wilderness Lodge was a huge disappointment. While checking in the girl at the front desk acted like she didn't want to be bothered was actually short when I would ask questions. NEVER saw this before & haven't seen it since at Disney. I've read other reviews with the same problem at this resort.There were ducks swimming in the pool & all their poop was in & around the pool. NASTY!!I wouldn't let my daughter go in. Others were having a grand time swimming in poop. whatever!!! When we went to the restaurant Whispering Canyon CafÃ©. You better be ready for this one. When we were there & someone asked for ketchup they brought about 20 bottles sometimes cases to your table. No exaggeration. Then when some poor unsuspecting soul asked for ketchup. You got to get up & give your 20 bottles to that table. Luckily we saw the show in action before & didn't ask for ketchup. Here is an idea I NEVER thought of . The said table with the 20 bottles of ketchup had probably 6 adults & about as many kids. One fine young chap LOVED ketchup was sticking his fries in the ketchup bottle then double dipping. Finally, that wasn't enough so he started licking the ketchup out of the bottle. No one at the table ever told him to stop. Guess what they did with the bottle???Put the cap back on it & sent it on it's round around the restaurant. I have never looked at a ketchup bottle the same since. This hotel is basically out in the middle of nowhere & if this is what you want then this is the resort for you. We like a little life ,we choose Boardwalk. Which we have had a few problems at Boardwalk too over the past 8 years but nothing worth writing a negative review over. Another problem I had which isn't really the fault of the Wilderness Lodge. But the FINE folks that stayed next door to us had this delightful bundle of joy That SCREAMED FOR 1 1/2 HOURS EVERY NIGHT until he finally went to sleep. Only to wake up the next morning SCREAMING. I am often confused by people who think taking a 1 year old to Disney World is a great idea. Little Johnny isn't going to remember the time he SCREAMED bloody murder every night for a week much less his picture with Mickey. Maybe the walls at Wilderness Lodge are paper thin. We have never had this problem at Boardwalk. Here is a note for people who take small children. We took our daughter for the first time at 5 years. We didn't have the mind set of DO ALL OF DISNEY OR DIE!!!! You would have to live at Disney World for a month to complete that Disney Quest.We would do as much as she could handle & then go back to the room & rest. Some days we spent half the day at the pool, of course not at the Wilderness pool. We see too many parents ticked off at the world because there kids can't keep up.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Deluxe Resort Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: juliefetters
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 3 children (5, 2 and 8 mos.) stayed at The Wilderness Lodge at Disney World the last week of November 2007. My husband and I were extremely disappointed with the resort in general. After reading tons of reviews online about how wonderful this resort was, we booked it. We were expecting a lot more from a Disney Deluxe Resort. This was our first trip to Disney and we thought we did our homework. The hotel itself has a nice appeal when you walk in. The staff was very friendly but not overly helpful. The concierge did not even know when the Disney Magic Hours were, she gave us the wrong times, luckily my husband and I checked our own printed information. We also wanted information on some of the water parks and they seemed clueless. They only promoted the other Disney parks. It took 2 and phone calls and 4 hours to get a pack n play crib and a set of bed rails for the bunk bed. The room was the worst part of our vacation. We were facing a horrible swap/pond and a fence with dumpsters behind it. We asked for a new room but we would have been charged $35.00 more per night. We booked this room for $395 a night already. After being in the room for a half an hour I wanted to cry and couldn't believe we paid for this place. It pretty much ruined the entire trip. We had a double bed and a set of bunk beds for my 2 boys and a pack and play for my infant. My son's own bedroom is larger than this room. It was very small and extremely difficult for all of us to move around. We had to spend 5 nights in this tiny and very ugly room. This room was meant for 2 people not a family. The room was not very clean, the bathroom floor was dirty, the decor was very bland, and the beds were uncomfortable. The bunk beds were merely made of ply wood and the mattresses were like foam. The bottom mattress of the bunk bed did not even fit on the bed it was too small. You could see the ply wood sticking out from the mattress. The sheets and blankets were cheaply made and not up to deluxe standards. This was a very basic and average room. There was nothing fancy or nice about this room. There was a very small table and a flat screen t.v. (nicest thing about the room). We have stayed at many hotels and have traveled the country with our children. We personally like the Marriott hotels much better. At least the rooms have more appeal and are much cleaner. The staff also caters to you and the food is good. This is a rustic themed resort but we were expecting a much nicer room. The adult pool was very nice but the pictures on the internet make it seem larger than it actually is. If you have small children I would not recommend the baby pool. The baby pool is 15" deep but it also has a step made of stone and stone all around the pool. My 2 year old kept falling all over the place and I was worried sick that he was going to either break his neck or knock out a tooth. All he wanted to do was go up and down the stone steps. By the time we left he had cuts all over his knees and feet. There were several other mothers at the pool who also thought the pool was dangerous for small children. If this is a baby/toddler pool why all the stone? I have been to many resorts that had pools just like this one with rubber around them. There were also many children who were around 10-12 unsupervised jumping in the baby pool scaring the small children. There were staff members walking around and didn't say anything. The food at the hotel was average and in order to make a reservation you have to call months in advance. They are also very overpriced for what you get. They offer a boat ride to the magic kingdom which was convenient but we rented a car so we really didn't need the other transportation sevices that Disney offers. If we do go back to Disney we will not be staying at a Disney Resort. For the money we spent we will stay at a Marriott or Hilton instead. At least we know the food will be good, the rooms will be nicer, and the staff will appreciate our business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: wyonative78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge November 17 - 24, 2007 for our honeymoon. We would not change a thing! This was our first trip to Disney World as adults and wanted a resort that was going to be relaxing and not too loud. After reading reviews and forum postings, we decided upon the Wilderness Lodge. Our room was just fine for the two of us. We were on the first floor at the end of the hall and across from the second, smaller pool that is part of the Villas. Each room has a flat-screen TV, mini-fridge, and patio or balcony. We loved having our breakfast out on our patio! The property and rooms were immaculate. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Roaring Forks, the food court, was just fine for what it was. Make sure to buy the refillable mug for $13 - you can refill it with soda, tea, coffee, and hot chocolate as long as you are staying at the Lodge. Our king bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. The lobby was a great place to sit and relax at the end of the day while gazing at the spectacular Christmas tree. Overall, we were thrilled with our stay. Definitely a great choice for couples travelling without children.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but trapped without car”
Reviews.Author: newtonmatraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness lodge and had a very good stay. The rooms were as expected (nothing fancy) and the lodge quite nice. We booked the free shuttle bus from airport so we did not need to rent a car. The one issue and I would strongly recommend that people book dinner reservations prior to arriving or as soon as arriving. It was impossible to get dinner until 10 PM on 2 nights of our stay and then only at the overly priced Crab House in Disney Village (expect to spend $200 for a family of 5). Since we had no car to escape Disney there was not any alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Hotel ( best value of Deluxes)”
Reviews.Author: SLOmom
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge was the first Disney Hotel we stayed at in year 2000. We have been back twice since, splitting stays between Wilderness Lodge and Grand Floridian. Kids especially love this hotel. It's amazing. The theming in the lobby is amazing and the cast is great. The rooms are not that amazing..but they still have Disney Magic. And there is NOTHING to beat staying at Disney when you go to WDW, especially if you love the Magic Kingdom. The pool is wonderful. The whole resort is so pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisMagic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the wilderness lodge from nov 9-16. We had standard room which was located in the lobby area (4093). The rooms were average size. What they had in our rooms was a flatscreen tv, h20 shampoo, conditioner and lotion. They also had a small refridgerator , blowdryer and iron/board in the room. Sometimes it got loud from the whispering canyon restaurant. Which by the way we didnt like. The entertainment was good but the food wasnt good. We did complain about our food. We only told them that the steak didnt taste right or that it was bad and they took it off the bill. We didnt tell them that all of our dinner came out cold. Plan on spending there for a family of three with drinks about $100. ( all adult prices). The roaring fork was our favorite. The price was ok( $7-8 per meal) and the food was good especially the salads. We did take advantage of the unlimited pop service when purchasing there mugs. We only bought one considering we were mostly on the go the whole time. Now on for the pool area. It is small for the resort but we went during the slow and cooler season so it was fine. I can see how in the summer seasons that it could be a problem. They do have life guards there on site which is nice for small children. They also had a kids pool next to the big pool and hot tubs. The only complaint if any was that the washrooms werent close by the pool. Take advantage of the ferry's to the m.k. Its much faster then taking buses. Bring a sweater for the cooler season! Oh forgot to mention when taking the bus you may not go directly to the park , You might pick up ft. wilderness campsite and grand floridian depending how much the bus is filled. We did do one dinner and show at the aloha. The food wasnt good and the show was average. We paid for 1 catagory and it was with tip 179. for three. Cant complain to much- you get what you pay for. If you are going for a week and have a day or two of no activities I would suggest going to the parks during the week and not the weekends. We noticed the lines were much better in fact we pretty much walked right on. We went during the end of wine week (epcot)and soap opera (MGM) what a nightmare! If you are going to universal expect to pay 35-40 one way for a cab. All together we were very happy with our hotel and vacation. I would say most the worker we very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wilderness Experience”
Reviews.Author: JCrowther
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay as a DVC member. The lobby was incredible and loved the theme. Had free valet service with DVC which was really useful when returning home after a long day out. Extremely helpful staff. Our room was a studio and so had a queen size and sofa bed - on the small side but adequate for our needs. The view was of the lake and main pool. Porter who brought our bags (Arneil) couldnt do enough for us and remembered who we were days later. Halloween theme was great. All housekeeping had a pumpkin competition and the guests judged them. Only gripe was that we needed to do some laundry and we were not told that there was a laundry room (free to use) in the villas so used the main hotels which we were charged for. But this was an oversight on our part as we didnt ask. Great bonus having a boat launch to take us to Magic Kingdom, Wilderness Campground and Contemporary too as we were able to take time off from driving, although of course there are the buses but we preferred the more scenic route. Would definately recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could enjoy this hotel a little more...”
Reviews.Author: PMTexas
Reviews.Content: I spent my dream vacations on Disneyworld for 10 days and I picked up this hotel because we decided to go on an off-peak period of the year: I knew it is usually very expensive. The best month to enjoy excellent rates is September. Cons of this hotel: my room were somewhat small for the size of my family: 2 adults + 2 children; and, of course, the extras are pricey, Disney standard, I am afraid... But that's it. It worthed every penny. Good service, great facilities (external and internal), exquisite swmming pool, spotless indoors, looking brand-new... we wish we had more time to spend exploring the amenities of this hotel... We usually arrived so tired from the Disney parks marathon that we just fainted on bed at the end of every day. What impressed me the most were the hotel docks and the lake/river transportation to the parks. Awesome! The hotel restaurant was so good (food and service), that they receive reservations from folks from other Disney Hotels. Very crowded, fun and noisy: perfect for kids, bad for romance. In short: a perfect place to spend with your family. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed on in my entire life.

Reviews.Title: “Good... but not great.”
Reviews.Author: tigrompy
Reviews.Content: I expected the best of the best here and quite simply didn't get it. Please don't get me wrong, it's a nice hotel, but at $315 per night I'd expect it to be a great hotel and it was not. The rooms are not that large for starters. It was my wife and I and a 4 year old and we were tripping all over each other. The worst part of this trip was the bus transportation. On our last day we waited at Epcot for a bus to return back to the hotel for almost an hour! I mentioned to this someone at the hotel and all I got was a flippant, sorry. I actually had to be back in the room for work related conference all and I was not happy at all. I wasn't asking for anything, but a flippant, I'm sorry really didn't do the trick. I'm not feeling the magic.... Oh well. For the most part Disney is all magic. I guess I'm just disappointed with certain aspects of this hotel. We're experimenting so we're moving on to the Pop Culture Hotel tomorrow... Should be interesting.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dzyfan
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the lodge about 10:00 am room was not ready which I knew it wouldn't be that early. Check in is at 3:00. They said they would check us in and hold our luggage, gave us a number to call to see if room is ready. Needless to say at 3:30 our room was still not ready, but saw other guests checking in and going to there rooms. Went to front desk to find out and was told that our room was still not cleaned. They could not tell me when it would be done. Spoke with manger whom never come over to speak with me just stayed behind his computer and never looked up while I was speaking to him. Very rude. They told me they allready assigned me a room in the am i said don't you think they would give priority to clean my room since I have be waiting. Check in is at 3:00 now it is 3:45. Finally after about 10min conversation they moved us to another room that was ready. That was the only issue. Loved the hotel itself. Would stay again but would NOT let them check me in if room is not ready. Would come back at 3:00.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Lodge”
Reviews.Author: game_mom
Reviews.Content: Second time to the Wilderness Lodge and it's still awesome! Amazing lobby - six stories high; so majestic! Everyone (the cast members) is so friendly. They really bend over backward to help you out. The college interns are great to talk with! Rooms have been updated for the better since our last visit. Rustic furnishings with copper and wrought iron really add to the alure of this hotel. Beware that the rooms are SMALL! There is not much storage/drawer space and they don't offer King beds. We (my husband and my 13 yr. old son) had a corner courtyard view room with a Queen and Bunk Beds. It was just right for us since we were never in the room (except to sleep and nap between parks). The room had a view of the lake; so we could see the nightly water show. This was a little disconcerting the first night - weird music at 9:30pm - couldn't figure out where it was coming from - then we looked outside and saw the light show on the barges. Simply breathtaking! Disney does everytthing over the top. Food at the Whispering Canyon is great, but nothing compared to the silliness of the waiters and dining activities (please ask for some ketchup!). So much fun! And Roaring Fork has got the best fast food (cafeteria style). Get a mug and drink for free the whole time you're there. We were on the dining plan (included free - part of a Fall/Sept. promotion) and had TOO much food. We had to use 10+ "Snack" rations our last day - good thing we were still traveling on vacation (got muffins, choc milk, water, fruit, etc.). We all gained at least 5 lbs. on the meal plan (even with walking through the parks every day)!!! The pool is fun (water slide needs to be upgraded - pretty lame). No problem getting a lounge chair and tropical cocktails were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor service!”
Reviews.Author: shareair
Reviews.Content: My family including an infant stayed at the wilderness lodge last week of september and our first trip to disneyworld. The hotel is beautiful and nicely located by the lake. We booked two rooms and asked to have two joining rooms since there were 5 adults and a baby so we can enjoy our stay as a family. The hotel staff told us they don't have any availability although I told them a month in advance and checked in early on arrival date. They appeared very annoyed with the request and didn't bother to spend a minute to even check for us. The following day, the room next to ours checked out and we asked to have the rest of the family moved to that vacant room so we can now have the joining room. The hotel staff (going back and forth with the manager) told me they are going to do maintanence on that room for the entire week so we couldn't have the joining room again. Two hours later, I found out they gave the room to a couple who checked in pretty much right after we were told the room wont be available. I thought we have really asked nicely to have the hotel staff to accomodate us for something that is so easy to do but they went out of their way to NOT make it happen. We have travelled and stayed at many hotels but have never seen such a blatant performance of lying by the hotel staff and the trouble they have to go through to make the stay unpleasant for their guests. I guess at the end, the rooms situation wasn' that big deal after all but I was disappointed at the kind of treatment we received. The rest of the trip was not spoiled by the hotel staff. We enjoyed the different parks and restaurants and will definetely come back to disneyworld again. I don't think I'd stay at this hotel again since I felt so belittled and mistreated by the hotel's front desk staff. This is a shame because I think the hotel itself is really nice and never had problems with the maid service or any other disney employee. I'll probably stay at the polynesian the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ColinaConnecticut
Reviews.Content: My sister and her husband, 2 boys age 4 & 8 and my husband and I spent 7 nights in early August here. We had decided a year ago to do the "Disney Experience" and we spent many hours researching to make this an unforgettable trip. We knew we would be spending much of our time at the Magic Kingdom and decided on the Wilderness Lodge for its location and amenities. Upon arriving, the guard at the gatehouse greeted us with "Welcome Home" which really made us realize we were finally there! The Lodge lobby is just spectacular being 5 stories and done in rough logs and stone. We had arrived at 8:00 AM so we were not surprised that our rooms we not ready however, our packets with our hotel info and park passes were all set. The staff was friendly and attentive and told us to call back at 1:00 PM to see if our rooms were ready. We could have left our luggage there but decided that we would need some of the stuff for the park we were going to. We were able to get adjoining rooms with bunk beds for the boys that really gave us much more room. We were on the ground floor in the 1000's number and I think these were the best location because you are not far from the boat launch that will take you to the Magic Kingdom, Contemporary (Chef Mickey's), Wilderness Lodge Campground (Hoop-Dee-Doo Review dinner show or from the Roaring Forks counter service. However, it is about a 5-minute walk to the buses that take you to the other areas of Disney so this is something to think about. We had purchased the Disney Dining Plan and I can honestly say that that was the best decision we made. The first night we stayed in at the Lodge to unpack and explore and made reservations at the Whispering Canyon CafÃ©. What a blast. The food was good but the wait staff was fantastic!! The meal wasnâ€™t rushed. The kids had a blast with the stick pony rides, singing and other great entertainment. When the youngest asked for ketchup, he couldnâ€™t stop laughing for all the bottles that came his way. The Lodge has a large swimming pool that looks like it is at the bottom of a mountain stream with a great water slide. There are life guards at the pool at posted times and plenty of pool towels available. There is a pool bar with frozen drinks and beers available and behind it is a designated smoking area. Smoking is only allowed at two or three outdoor places, pretty much like the parks. Donâ€™t forget the water geyser that will erupt seemingly on 5 minutes after the hour. We found the Lodge to be well-maintained, clean, staff very helpful and friendly, a unique place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NycEmily
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Wilderness Lodge for 9 days in late August and had a fanstastic time. Although at first they attempted to give me a room with a parking-lot view, I reminded them that I had paid for court-yard and they gave us an excellent room. We could see the lagoon, pool, geiser and fireworks every night from our room. I would plan ahead by reading guidebooks etc because it certainly made a difference knowing where you were going and what you wanted to do. We planned our days around dinner reservations and then had juice, tea and poptarts in our room most mornings as the food is very expensive. We did not participate in the meal plan because I thought we really wouldnt eat that quantity of food to make it worth while - but in retrospect I think we would have saved a bundle. (One day my daughter wanted to stay at the hotel and play in the pool the whole day. We ordered in pizza, soda, dessert etc to the room - and it cost almost $50. !!!) Otherwise, everything was wonderful - lines were really not so bad - they over estimate the wait (if the line says 20 minutes or less - just go right in - you probably wont have much of a wait at all). My advice - 1) dont rent a car and stay at a disney hotel 2) stay for about 2 days longer than you planned to allow for "melt-down" days 3) make meal reservations and plan your days ahead of time and 4) eat breakfast in hotel room when possible. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Wild about Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: cwhboys
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four night stay at Wilderness Lodge and had such a wonderful experience! From the moment we drove up, a bellhop was there to greet us and help unload our luggage. We arrived at 8:30 am, so we were sure our room wouldn't be ready but it was! We booked a junior suite which was very comfortable for a family of five. We had access to the concierge level which was wonderful - breakfast, afternoon snacks, wine and cheese, and desserts and cordials were offered every day - Delicious! All of the staff were so courteous and helpful and I truly felt like they were making our stay there "magical". Our children had a ball at the Whispering Canyon Cafe and the ladies working at the pin trading station were beyond sweet to the kids. We will definitely be back and would highly recommend this hotel if you want to stay on the Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations - 1st Class Disney”
Reviews.Author: JQuatt21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Walt Disney World Resorts before. I have been lucky with staying at what I call â€œthe big 3" resorts (Disneyâ€™s Contemporary, Polynesian, and Grand Floridian Resorts.) This trip, we decided to try Disneyâ€™s Wilderness Lodge. I was pleasantly surprised on what I experienced. On most Disney World Travel Forums, The Wilderness Lodge is ranked as one of Disney Worldâ€™s most popular hotels. So needless to say, I had high expectations. Here is what I thought of Disneyâ€™s Wilderness Lodge. Location: Located in the Magic Kingdom Resort Area in what I think is the heart of Walt Disney World, the Wilderness Lodge is set aside from the other resorts in a wooded area in between Disneys Contemporary Resort and Disneyâ€™s Fort Wilderness Resort and Campground on the shores of Bay Lake. It is in a peaceful setting when you are there, you do not feel like you are anywhere close to the hustle and bustle of the theme parks yet it is so close to everything and anywhere you want to be. Transportation Options: One of the keys on choosing a resort inside Walt Disney World is itâ€™s travel options from itâ€™s resorts. Disneyâ€™s Wilderness Lodge has two main forms of transportation offered by Disney. The 1st is bus service which serves Disneyâ€™s Fort Wilderness Resort, Downtown Disney, The Magic Kingdom, Epcot, and Disney MGM Studios as well as Blizzard Beach and Typhoon Lagoon. Also, at the rear of the Lodge, there are two Ferry Boat options you can take as well. One boat services the Magic Kingdom (Green Flag) and the other Boat services (Blue Flag) Disneyâ€™s Fort Wilderness Resort and Disneyâ€™s Contemporary Resort. This boat is also great because you can connect to EPCOT, The Magic Kingdom, and the Grand Floridian, Polynesian, and The Transportation and Ticket center via Monorail from the 4th floor Grand Canyon Concourse Monorail Station. This is a nice option besides taking a bus everywhere. Lobby: The Lobby makes you feel like you are in a giant Log Cabin. Located in the lobby is the front desk, Concierge, Bell Services, Whispering Canyon CafÃ©, and Wilderness Lodge Mercantile. The lobby has a giant fire place that has old style rocking chairs where you can sit and relax. Also, the lobby is the start of the bubbling geyser that ends up at the rear of the resort that resembles old faithful. Also, the craftsmanship that went into the wood carvings that are in the lobby are remarkable. Rooms: The hotel is all one building (excluding the Villas which are Disney Vacation Club). The hotel is 7 floors and have dark brown and green colors. We found that the rooms were very nice. All contained flat screen televisions that were set in wood. Also, each room had a balcony with two chairs and a small table. Some rooms had a view of the pool, some had a view of the wooded areaâ€™s around the resort. Regardless, each view was nice in itâ€™s own way. Each room had two sinks (his and hers), ironing board, mini fridge to store drinks, plenty of closet space, and a small table and chairs. All in all, the room was very comfortable with two Queen Size beds each containing 3 pillows each. Maid service was exceptional. Restaurants: Disneyâ€™s Wilderness Lodge has three eateries on itâ€™s property. Artist Point: I personally did not eat here but this is their premier restaurant. (Dress Code) Whispering Canyon CafÃ©: A home Style Restaurant serving Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner. Roaring Forks: A counter service restaraunt serving snacks, pizzaâ€™s, sandwhiches, homemade salads made in front of you and of course, Mickey Mouse Ice Cream Bars! Open Late till 11pm. Gift Shops: Wilderness Lodge Mercantile has everything from Resort Souveniers to Walt Disney World Souvenirs. It also serves as a small mini market for sundries and spirits. Pool Area: The pool was great with a full service pool bar next to it. Also, the geyser from the lobby runs through the pool area to the old faithful in the rear of the resort. Also, there is a beach area on bay lake (no swimming allowed) and full service fishing, boat rentals, watersports etc.. Service: What can you say. Itâ€™s Disney! We arrive at 1:00pm and found out that our room was not available. Literally 10 minutes after leaving the front desk, we were in the Mercantile Gift Shop just browsing around and was approached by the general manager of the hotel. Within 5 minutes, she had found us a 6th floor room and were able to check in immediately! What can I say, service was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel if you are wishing to stay inside the Walt Disney World Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Something Special”
Reviews.Author: MichelleJR
Reviews.Content: We came to the Wilderness Lodge and Disneyworld for our honeymoon. We want something a little different and special that we would remember always. And we definitely picked the right hotel... The staff are fabulous, the food is so yummy and the portions are massive, Our room was huge - and so was our TV! We had a view of the 'Secluded Pool' which was lovely - the whole place was so quiet and peaceful. The hotel lobby really is something that you MUST see - I really can't rate this highly enough. And I can't wait till we go back (with the kids - when we have them)!

Reviews.Title: “FIrst Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: nrd01lj
Reviews.Content: Our First Trip to disney therfore decided to go the full hog and book a deluxe resort with room upgrade also. The house keeping was always on hand and more time than not were knocking at the door whilst we were still in bed ( it was around 10 am though) the rooms were clean, not the largest room we have stayed in but still made for a great disney atmosphere. Our room was on the first floor and our balcony/Patio opened up just accross from the side sheltered pool which was great having been on your feet all diy just to hop out the kids straight into the pool while the adults hit the jacuzzi/spa sometimes till 3 am. All the staff were very friendly I did need to find a Uk number as we had a family crisis back home but I could not get any help from the front desk so when i asked if i could use the internet and find this number myself they directed me to the next resort where they may be able to help out!!!! perhaps disney needs to be connected to the net which we know they are but have some way of making this available to paying guest! The cafe and restaurants were good value but a little sick of cheese burgers and pizza now a good tip is the re-fillable drinks mug for around $12 lasts your whole holiday and iff you dont want the all wilderness theme then please stay clear from the wispering canyon cafe if you do venture in please please do not ask for ketchup......gosh only knows what this was all about but some found it amuzing while we looked on with a puzzled look. Overall this 10 days was the best 10 days holiday ever spent as a family! great transportation to all the parks and the water crossing to the magic kingdom may seem lengthy to some but 10mins was all it took and the best way to travel also a light show came accross the lake one night which was a added bonus to our stay. One tip would be if you are travelling to universal studios whilst staying in a disney resort , take the transport to downtown disney and take a cab from there its much cheaper than from the lodge $50 from lodge and $22 from downtown disney ( both one way) CANT WAIT TO RETURN

Reviews.Title: “OK, but don't know if worth the money”
Reviews.Author: HunterJayDogg
Reviews.Content: We checked in the WL on 08/15/07. The lobby was visually impressive but I don't spend much time in the lobby (also noticed that the lobby was extremely loud). We booked a woodland view room and I guess we got it (our view was more of the villas than the woods). Our room was on the first floor so our slider opened up to the outside (which I didn't care for - I'd rather have a balcony for safety reasons). The room didn't impress me. One of the light bulbs on the bed was burnt out, the bathroom seemed a little dingy, and the size was nothing great (I may be overly harsh, but I'd expect more from a "deluxe" resort). Mousekeeping didn't earn their keep - They didn't bring us new soap one day and on another day they were late to clean the room. The transporation was really slow as well (i.e. we planned on seeing the fireworks at MK one night. We arrived at the dock at 9pm, at 10pm we were still on the water looking at the fireworks). We learned that no matter where we were going, we needed to allow 1 hour if taking Disney transportation. Pros: Nice Lobby Good Counter Service Fridge in every room Helpful front desk Cons: Dingy bathroom Slow transportation. Mousekeeping not up to par Overall, would I stay there again - only if I got a great rate, otherwise I may try the polynesian or a moderate.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Stay ! Will stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: HH2
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge the week of August 26th for 6 nights. Overall, the Wilderness Lodge was mediocre. The room was dark and the maid service was sketchy. The bathroom floor wasnâ€™t cleaned the whole time we were there. We tipped the maid to see if service would improve and it didnâ€™t. As a mother of a young child, I wasnâ€™t pleased with the cleanliness of the room. The restaurants and the transportation were good and I have no complaints about them. The Lodge itself is quite nice, but for the money I would stay elsewhere. We stayed at French Quarter earlier in the year and I would return there before the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Management Look up !”
Reviews.Author: jezebell
Reviews.Content: Wilderness Lodge has it in as far as the location is excellent and the facilities together with access to Fort Wilderness facilities are very good. DO your research before you go. Do the Disney Dining Plan as it saves you a fortune if you are going to stick around Disney like we did. (family of 3 adults 5 children aged 3 to 16). you should plan were you really want to eat and book as soon as you can as much of it is booked as early as 6 months in advance. If you want to eat a Chef Mickeys and havent booked then go early as they do stand bys. Dont bother going if after 8 am. You can have loads of fun and better quality foods if you dont go to the most popular options. Try Animal Kingdom Lodge for Breakfast. Or Contempory steak restaurant for breakfast. Great. Wilderness lodge needs to look at the food and bring it up to the standard seen in Animal Kingdom lodge which has much better and bigger facilities as far as food is concerned. The roaring fork is inadequate, two small and poor choice. It is also understaffed and not enough seating. It tends to be overused as a such it is not clean. Managers you need to really look at your staff. Half of them are useless. They really dont care. Many of the customer relations officers are poorly trained and wont give any advice. In the womens restrooms downstairs 3 locks of the 5 toilets didnt work rendering 3 restrooms unuseable. I had 7 conversations with different staff over 2 weeks and I was unable to make a difference because at the end of the 2 weeks those locks were still broken. One of the locks was the only disabled toilet. No one cared enough to actually ensure that they were mended. I spoke to housekeeping 3 times the porters twice reception twice and even team leaders. Wise up management you need to weed out the 1 baggers youve got enough of them ! You also have the occassional 3 bagger the cleaner in the room was marvellous and had been there for 14 years. These are the people who keep you in your jobs.

Reviews.Title: “Disney, with style”
Reviews.Author: ohashem1
Reviews.Content: I was planning to stay at the polynessian or grandflordian, but somehow I got luck and I could not find availability except in the wilderness lodge. Worried about the experiance, I searched the internet to get some reviews about the lodge, and found super reviews on the place, my expectation went so hi. I have to admit from the moment I booked the hotel, the fun started, I was contacted by the internary service team, and that was the best thing to have, as I pre-booked all of the important events that are cool for the kids: - Chef's mickey ( a must visit charecter dinning ) - Grandfloridan ( charecter breakfast ) - Cirqu de soliel ( a must see ) - Cinderlla Royal table lunch, magic kindom, in the CASTLE!!! as for the hotel itself, I stayed at the club level, good service, the staff are super friendly, the room is on the small side, but we never felt that as we were most day in the parks, and by the time we were back it was crash time for every one. the ferry ride to the magic kingdom is a plus, away from that I used the car to move to other resorts, especially I used the valet parkin at the lodge and based on that for free I was able to use the valet at other resorts for free. the best thing about this hotel it makes you feel home, and at ease.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Bay Lake”
Reviews.Author: JAGmass
Reviews.Content: We, (Dad, Mom, 2 boys 13 & 15) just returned from the awesome Wilderness lodge 8/21-8/27. Our boys loved renting the sea racers and cruising around bay lake through the channel on into 7 seas lagoon. The boat ride to MK and boat to the Contemporary to link up the monarail to Epcot was great. The bus trans was good too. Lunch @ Whispering canyon was quiet, the food was very good. It seems all the fun is at dinner. We could'nt get a dinner reservation to suit our schedule.Bell service was great and maid sevice also great.I found cast members @ the front desk to be pleasant, but not very informative, I think (new hires) The roaring folks was always crowded. The XMH benefit is not good any more, too many disney resort guests. Stay away from parks with Xmh that day. My husband & I loved the hidden springs pool at the Villa's. No little kids made it very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Wildreness Lodge is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jools16
Reviews.Content: Go through the doors into the lobby of Wilderness Lodge and be immediately amazed and awe-struck at its size and grandeur. The sheer scale of the lobby is astounding and the attention to detail will leave you impressed. Massive oak columns and intricately carved totem poles appear to support most of the structure, a clever deceit. It is based on the rangers shelters in national parks though on a grander scale. If Disney wanted to make an immediate impact, the lobby certainly does the job. We were upgraded because it was our anniversary and the room was spacious, clean and tidy. A separate 2-sink wash area was a nice feature and the bathroom was a good size too. A huge integrated TV was provided though not used very much. A balcony with table and chairs was welcomed for early evening drinks and a well earned rest. A fridge was provided at no cost and an ironing board and hairdryer meant less to pack! Wilderness Lodge has a geiser (artificial but still impressive) which is active once an hour, a lovely lake which shows a light show 'Pageant on the Lake' every evening at 9:30 and a dock provides a boat service to Magic Kingdom every 20 minutes. If you wanted to do Disney in a special way and have a memory to hang onto forever then stay here. The 3 restaurants, Roaring Forks (fast food, always busy), Whispering Canyons (food lovely, noisy, themed fun) and Artists Point (a la carte, bit posher, didn't eat here) provide adequate onsite dining. The pool is a nice temerature with a slide for children, towels are provided free of charge as are sunbeds. The ducks and rabbits running about in the pool area provide an interesting diversion! A truly wonderful hotel, I'd love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic and Elegant...We would definately come back here”
Reviews.Author: gigglepezy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed her on our honeymoon and we absolutely loved it here. Of course the rooms are all farely standard, but the room was very clean and had a great room location overlooking the lake and the pool. The staff was very nice and the hotel was immaculate. The whispering Canyon Cafe was a little much for a couple without kids but the food was fantastic!! Try the all you can eat skillets you won't be sad you did. At times the wait was a bit long for the buses, but the lines to get home from the parks were never overcrowded and we always had a seat unlike when staying at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “One of My Favorite Disney Resorts”
Reviews.Author: dom2737
Reviews.Content: Disney does everything top notch, but this resort was truly incredible. It is designed as a huge log cabin placed in a wooded mountain location next to a lake. The main pool, which unfortunately was being refurbished, is set up to look like a flowing stream with waterfalls. There is also a beach for the lake as well as a second pool. The parks are easily accessable with the bus system and there is also a boat dock that transports you over to the Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: krob126
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wilderness Aug 4-Aug 10. This was the greatest resort! The Whispering Canyon Restuarant inside the lobby was so much fun. The kids loved it. Of course it was pricey, but what isn't at Disney World. Our room was on the 2nd floor overlooking the pool. The bunk beds were great and the quick access to the boats to the Magic Kingdom were great! We went through the Contemporary for Monorail access to the Polynesian and it was so much louder and there was so much more noise than the wonderful Wilderness Lodge. Then we were in the Polynesian for the Luau Dinner and it too was loud. The Wilderness was so nice because it wasn't a hub for anything. There didn't seem to be many people just walking through the resort. The buses to Typhoon Lagoon, Animal Kingdom & MGM were quick. The most we waited was at Typhoon Lagoon. The pool was great and the kids loved the slide. It was very tame compared to the rides at the parks, but still fun. The only bad thing I can think of is that the bathrooms weren't as up-to-date as I wouldn't thought they would be. The shower wasn't as shiny and nice as expected, but it did the job and wasn't dirty by any means. The staff was excellent and the employees at the gift shop were very friendly. They offered and openly traded and gave our 9-year old pins. I would definitely stay at the Wilderness again. It was so amazing I wish that we were still there.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: gincapello
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 kids ages 7 and 9) stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from July 21st thru July 27th. Check in was a breeze, I had booked our room (a Courtyard view with bunk beds) at the Disney travel site and had received the hotel voucher in the mail before the trip. All I had to do was present the voucher and they checked me in and activated our park hopper tickets and meal plans. We were assigned to the 1st floor facing the woods which would not have been so bad foregoing a nice view if it would at least have let us also forego the elevator wait, but unfortunately the hotel is split level and the lobby and entrance are on the 2nd floor. I asked for another room (nicely of course) and was quickly accomodated with a 3rd floor "original courtyard view" We arrived a few minutes prior to check in time and got the other room in the nick of time according to the front desk clerk. We used the valet parking service ($10 per day) and the bellman brought our luggage up to us in our room and brought it inside the room also) Well worth the tip! The kids loved the (newly renovated with flat screen tv)room because of the bunk beds and the view of the pool and Bay lake. The only complaint about the room that I had was the mattress absolutely killed my back! ( By the last day I had serious problems) Mousekeeping was pretty good, but we never got our handtowels or washclothes twisted into anything neat like I had read about :-( After settling in we went to Roaring Forks snacks to eat. Choices are limited there for hot food, mostly hamburgers, chicken strips and flat bread pizzas. They offered some soups and sandwiches also and an awesome bakery that offered cookies, cupcakes, rice crispie treats etc. If you are thinking about getting the dining plan DO IT! We saved so much money! Mainly because of all the food you get for your meals. The counter service meals, as well as the table service meals include a snack/dessert. We were always too full to eat dessert so we brought it back to our room to eat later. By the end of our stay, we had to throw food away that was left over. We also had 18 snack credits on our dining plan left the last day of our trip. We used them in the bakery and for bottle water for the trip home. The kids loved the pool and the hotel grounds. We saw a lot of rabbits and tons of ducks, and an armadillo. The only problem with the ducks is that they think the pool belongs to them and they defecated in the pool, you would see it floating along beside you. NOT sanitary! We only swam twice during our stay after noticing the duck poop on our second swim. We had two dinners at the Whispering Canyon Cafe. The first night we had a great time and our kids were thrilled with the antics of our server Slippery Pete. They liked it so much they wanted to go again a couple of nights later. We didn't enjoy it as much the second time, I think because our server, although nice, was kind of boring for the place. The boat transportation was great to the Magic Kingdom and Fort Wilderness. The bus transportation to MGM, Animal Kingdom, and Epcot was a little spotty and it took forever to get to your destination on the bus. Forget driving your car, because while the signage was excellent to get to Disney World and our hotel the signs to leave the place left a lot to be desired! It took us 45 minutes to find Wal-Mart with a map! and only 10 minutes to get back! We do not normally have a problem finding our way around either. Overall we loved the place and the service was excellent. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awsome awsome awsome”
Reviews.Author: disney101Nc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort around 12:00. They went ahead and checked us in with no problems. My first impression was how beautiful everything was. This resort has everything that you could possibly want and all of the staff is very nice and helpful. Our room had the best view.I don't think we would have been happier with any other room. We had a view of the lake, pool, and also a great view of most of the Magic Kingdom fireworks at night. I strongly suggest that you stay at this place. We will not be going anywhere else. This will be OUR RESORT that we always come back to. Hint: Eat at the Whispering Canyon and be sure to ask for ketchup!! It's alot of fun!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Resort”
Reviews.Author: Shelley65
Reviews.Content: My family and I, consisting of 7 and 5 year old girls, stayed at this resort for 7 days, 6 nights in July. We loved this resort. We did have the chance to see other Disney resorts and what they had to offer and we still liked ours better. The Grand Floridian was nice, but was too ritzy for us. The Yacht and Beach Club was a consideration in the beginning when making reservations but was $700.00 more--we were attracted to the beach/pool they had. After seeing it I wasn't impressed. I am glad we chose the Wilderness Lodge in the end. At the Wilderness Lodge we loved the pool and the bar next to the pool. They even made a Shirley Temple drink for my 7 year old. She thought she was big stuff. They have a place where you can get clean towels and disgard your used ones for the pool. They also have a beach with chairs and a playground area. The food restaurants were also great. There was a wide selection in my opinion. The Roaring Forks had lots of things to choose from and the price wasn't shocking--it was reasonable for the amount of food you got. The Mercantile shop was great also. You can buy cereal, popcorn, snacks, bottled water, beer, wine, health and beauty supplies and also a wide variety of souvenirs. My girls also loved the dolls/animals the housekeepers made and left on their bed after cleaning our room everyday. All of the theme parks and resorts were very clean!! I've read many different reviews about the transportion---some good, some bad. Overall all I vote good. It doesn't take long to figure out how to get around either by boat, bus or monorail. I would much rather use their transportion than have to drive a car and have to figure out directions and park the car in every parking lot at every theme park as well as other places plus pay for parking. The transportation was a god send. The Magical Express was convenient also. I would definitely refer this Resort to others and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Carol059
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from July 18 to July 23. We just love this hotel. Beautiful. Gorgeous landscaping and theming throughout the hotel, rooms and grounds. Very friendly and helpful staff. Very accomodating. Had room service in the morning and evening turn-down service as well, which included clean towels and chocolates. We celebrated our 20th anniversary and also received a card and balloons and a button to wear on our shirts. Had a courtyard view room with 2 Queen beds. Very clean. Rooms had been updated since our last stay 2 years ago. Every room now has a small refrigerator, you do not have to request one anymore. In room coffeemaker/hairdryer. Small table with 2 chairs. Flat screen TV. Plenty of drawer space for clothing. Extra shelf storage space now under the 2 sink vanity as well .We traveled with our 2 teenage daughters and they love it here as well. Ate at Whispering Canyon Cafe. Always a fun time there. Plenty of good food and fun. Our waitress, Lazy Suzan, was great. The manager, Jimmy, was a good sport too, galloping around the entire lobby on his stick pony. The chef came out from the kitchen and mingled with the diners. Roaring Forks has an updated menu with salads and sandwiches and wraps along with the standard chicken fingers and fries and pizzas. Be sure to buy the mug if you don't have an old one and get the free refills on drinks. Mugs now cost $11.99 but worth it in cost of the free refills. The maintenance staff still makes the cute animal figures with towels and washclothes along with arranging any of your children's stuffed animals from home. Always cute. Great family hotel. Great honeymoon hotel too. Pool was great. Water warm because it is July in Florida. No surprise. The geyser still blows on the hour. Used the boat transportation to Magic Kingdom and buses to everywhere else. No problems. No long waits. Always got on a boat or bus. Boat staff and bus drivers very friendly. Love this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Also rented the Sea Raycers at the dock for 45 minutes. Always fun out on the water. Children must be 12 to drive but be accompanied by an adult. My husband used the jogging trail for exercise in the mornings. Unfortunately, we had to leave and come home to the real world. Have a Disney Day!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: ncbeach1
Reviews.Content: We have been to Disney and stayed at Disney resorts several times but this was our first stay at the Wilderness Lodge. Overall the lodge is beautiful and the layout was well thought out. First the bad: 1) At check in I was not impressed with the staff. They were not as friendly and receptive as we have become accustomed to at Disney. While we did receive a free upgrade to our room without asking, the clerk did not give us our parking permit in our welcome packet and wrote the wrong room number down. We also asked to be put on the list for the "flag family". She said she would take care of it and call me in the room to let me know what days were available. I didn't hear from her so I stopped by the front desk the next day and she told me that she was sorry that she forgot and all the spaces were now taken. 2) When the bellman unloaded our luggage he said he would meet us at our room in 20 minutes, he didn't show up until an hour later and after 3 calls from us. 3) The pool was fine but the ducks need to go. At first my kids thought it was cool to swim with the ducks but after having "matter" expelled by the ducks (you know what I mean) end up on them a couple of times they didn't think it was cool anymore. 4) The Whispering Canyon Cafe food quality was not what you would expect and too loud to enjoy your meal. 5) The Roaring Fork menu was fine but they need additional seating. THE GOOD: 1) The overall theme of the lodge is fantastic. It can be overwhelming at times just sitting in the lobby. The indoor springs and bridge were beautiful. 2) We rarely ever waited on an elevator. 3) The ferry service to the Magic Kingdom is great but be prepared for a wait if you stay till park closing or just after the parade. 4) The rooms were a little on the small size but honestly we don't stay in them much anyway so all in all we found them comfortable. 5) The covered walkway to the bus depot was very nice. 6) There were always plenty of clean towels by the pool and the lifeguards were very friendly and attentive. 7) The rustic setting on the lake is great and you don't realize that you are as close as you are to the Magic Kingdom. 8) It was very quiet in our rooms and we were never disturbed by noise from the hallway or pool. 9) And the best thing about the lodge, believe it or not, was the housekeeping staff. Our room was kept absolutely spotless. We left a note on our pillow asking to have extra coffee and towels left and we were amazed by the quantity they left us upon our return. Our children were left "towel critters" 3 of the 7 days we were there. One day we decided to stay in until late. We called housekeeping and asked them if they would delay cleaning our room until 6:00pm and they had no problem at all with it. One of the most impressive things also was that the person who had been cleaning our room all week actually stopped by one afternoon to see if we were satisfied. She also made a point to thank us for the tips we had been leaving her. I would recommend staying here and will most likely stay here on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “calming but.......”
Reviews.Author: carlnix30
Reviews.Content: we stayed as a couple without our children. quiet strolls and relaxing atmosphere. we asked for a king and got a king. our room was average in size (normal hotel size) not extravagant. I believe they are relying on the atmosphere rather than luxury. We are smokers, soo the new policy of no smoking on property was a killer. there were smoking areas, a rather nice one behind the pool bar. I did not like waking up getting dressed, and walking down to the smoking area to smoke. There are people there, and I do not like talking with people before I wake up and have a cup of coffee and a smoke. Yes people wanna talk all the time you are there. I think a better alternative would be to allow us to smoke on the balconies!! rooms that allow smoking in the room STINK but balcony its outside. The bellman? I do not know what they do there. they seem to be bothered by my questions. Front desk? they were always great and helpful any complaints or advice they were there. concierge? they were always great. Transportation? the boats to magic kingdom were always there without a hitch. the buses ran great the only problem we had was going to downtown Disney. it took a while for them to come. Restaurants? Whispering Canyon was not what I expected at all we were looking forward to the jovial atmosphere, but it was far from that. I was looking forward to barbeque (it was all baked) no bbq. If I wanted all you can eat baked chicken I would have bought a chicken. I think that small children would have loved the little games they play with them. Roaring Forks- cafeteria atmosphere burgers and fries, pizza great for the first couple days. but not good for much longer. Artist Point- absolutely the best mussels I have ever had. my wife ordered buffalo toughest she ever had (it was sirloin) should have been ribeye for the price. they do not tell you that it is sirloin until you get it and try to eat it. I had the filet mignon delicious as any should be. I think that if you are going to eat anywhere in resort eat at Artist Point Housekeeping- Pam our normal housekeeper was the nicest most thorough employee there. we had a problem with the standby housekeeper (Pam was sick for 2 days). We left an envelope on the desk one for housekeeper and one for turndown each a tip. when the standby housekeeper came to clean the room, "she accidentally took both envelopes". if we would have not returned before turndown came we would have never known that housekeeping STOLE turndowns tip!!!! we were not happy.. the views were gorgeous the pool was great bunny rabbits lizards armadillos and even an alligator came out to say hello. great escape from the huge city of Philly. Overall I think that I would stay again. It is hard to keep a smile on a vacationers face for 9 strait days!!

Reviews.Title: “A super vacation”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: We vacationed here in June 2006. Our room on the 5th floor faced the pool area and offered an oblique view of the Seven Seas Lagoon from the balcony. The room included a decently sized vanity area, a small refrigerator, one queen and a set of bunk beds. The pool is very nice. If you have no tolerance for screaming kids, then you have no business being at WDW in the first place. All in all, the restuarants are fantastic. Artist's Pointe is well worth the $$$$ if you can swing it. I wrote an extensive review for a disney forum - contact me for further info.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home!”
Reviews.Author: irunnoft
Reviews.Content: "Welcome Home!" This was the greeting from the security guard at the gate as we arrived at the Wilderness Lodge! My family just returned from our stay at Disney's Wilderness Lodge from July 9th to July 19th. We planned a long 10 day Disney Vacation for this summer and were really excited about staying at the lodge. This was our first time at this resort and our expectations were high. Disney far exceeded our wildest expectations on this trip! We started saving for this trip back in September 2006 and did the 10 day park hopper w/ dining and water park options. For this extended stay, we really couldn't afford to be too lavish, so I just booked a standard view room. I figured we wouldn't really be spending too much time looking out of the windows anyhow as most of our time would be spent in the parks. We arrived at about 10:30am on July 9th and I got us checked in while my wife and son checked out the Mercantile Shop (gift shop). I know people rave about the lobby of this hotel and I can't begin to describe how awe-inspiring it is to walk into this resort. I'll try, but heck, most of you reading this probably already have the Disney Vacation Planning DVD and have watched it over and over again already. From the minute you pass through the doors in the lobby, you are wrapped in Disney theming. The music swirls around you - as does the blessed air conditioning - and you are ushered into the vast expanse of the most spacious lobby imaginable! Prepare to crane your neck but be careful not to walk into one of the many chairs, coffee tables or other amazed tourists as you gaze about! The lobby is massive and adorned with huge teepee light fixtures - these, by the way, are not cheesy in the slightest! There are two giant totems guarding either side of the lobby as well as the "Grand Canyon" 82' fire place to gaze at. Again, as I mentioned, there are plenty of places to sit and relax and just soak in the ambiance or to wait comfortably while checking in. At the rear of the lobby is a bubbling geyser that rushes out of the building, into a creek, turnes into a water fall and ultimately flows into the pool. So, the pool actually begins in the lobby of the hotel! Another nice feature is the heavy Native American theming in decor. It was handled with great taste and attention to detail. My wife is an enrolled member of the Eastern Band of Cherokee Indians and she was most impressed with the respectful handling and presentation of Native culture in this resort. None of the war bonnets or jingle dresses in the displays are true Native artifacts, but they are amazing replicas that were produced with impeccable attention to detail. There are several Northwestern Tribes represented in the decor. NEAT STUFF! I suggest taking tour around the lobby and resort during "down time" from the parks. There are actually different displays of paleozoic artifacts that would be found in the Grand Canyon on every floor of the resort. Each floor tells about the layers of strata in the Grand Canyon and what types of artifacts would be found in that particular layer. In effect, the fireplace in the Lodge represents 1.2 billion years in the making of the Grand Canyon. Ranger Stan also provides tours of the Lodge on certain days of the week, but these occured at 9:00am so I never took one as I was always in one of the theme or water parks with my wife and son. And now on to check in. I'm a Dave Ramsey fan and therefore had this vacation paid for in full months before we ever packed up the car to leave! Since we arrived so early, our room wasn't ready yet, but Haley was able to give us a business card with a phone number on it for us to call to check on the readiness of the room. We got our room cards, resort information and everything else in about 10 minutes. Check in was fabulous! I was given plenty of information about the parks and about the dining plan and restaurants. No sooner than we got there, we were off to the front of the resort to the bus area and on a bus to Epcot. The bus area was located conveniently a short stroll away from the front entrance and was better accessed through the lobby by the Mercantile store. We waited about ten minutes before the bus arrived and that was pretty much the case for every other bus we took. Perhaps the longest we ever waited for a bus was 20 minutes for one to MGM Studios. However, most buses seemed to be showing up every ten minutes or so. Before I continue...a quick note about the Disney Dining Plan.... DO IT! We saved a TON of money by dining this way and it was more food than we were able to eat at times. We almost never needed to eat breakfast because we were still so full from the day before! I'm not kidding! My wife and I packed chewy granola bars for ourselves and go-tarts for my son and that was all we ever needed in the way of breakfast. With the dining plan, you get a snack, a counter service meal with a drink and a dessert, a table service meal which includes drink, appetizer, entree, and a dessert for each evening you stay. In our case, we each got 10 of each because we stayed 10 nights. Each time you use one of your entitlements, you receive a receipt with the remaining balance left. For instance, I got each of us an ice-cold frozen Coke in Epcot on our first day. That counted as a snack for each of us, so my receipt said 27 snacks remaining. You will really save tons on this option - plus the gratuity is included with this plan and Disney gives the servers 18% gratuity. Just in case you're wondering, the servers treat Disney Dining Plan guests with great hospitality! I think we paid somewhere in the neighborhood of $500 to add the this option to our park tickets, but in more than paid for itself! Each snack runs about $3.50; our counter service meals for three were about $38.00 and table service meals for my family averaged about $85-$100. Considering we used the plan to dine at Artist Point twice, we racked up about $400 right there! More on Artist Point later, though. After spending several hours in Epcot, we called to check on our room at about 1:30pm and found it was ready. We were given a room on the 6th floor. When I got to our room, we were astonished! We'd paid for a standard view room, but opened the door to an upgraded courtyard view luxurious room! I immediately called down to the lobby to check and see if our room was a courtyard view and was told it was. I thanked the front desk clerk and my wife, son and I took a quick elevator ride down to meet with the manager. Adam was the front desk manager we met with and he was just as nice and polite as he could be. He explained that they "upgraded" our room and that they do that from time to time whenever possible. What was amazing was that I didn't ask for an upgraded room. I never thought to and probably wouldn't have because I would have thought it somewhat rude. My whole family thanked him deeply for the lovely room and told him how deeply we appreciated what he'd done. We went back to our room to put away our belongings and within an hour there was a knock at our door. In strode a cast member with an enormous basket of fresh fruit (grapes, apples, oranges and pears), gourmet crackers, cheese and summer sausage! Along with basket was a card wishing us a magical vacation from the entire staff at Disney's Wilderness Lodge! We were just stunned with this treatment, but not long after that, it was time to hit the park again, so we went back to Epcot for the evening. When we returned to our room that night, we found that our room had been "turned down" for us. Our beds had been turned down, a towel angel and lamb had been placed on the bed and mints had been left on our pillows. This was a concierge level service that was just amazing. We began referring to this as "the BEST vacation ever!" from that day on. From the moment we arrived and were greeted with "Welcome Home!" to the last day we left when we had a word of prayer during our Flag Family ceremony with Ranger Stan, everything was simply wonderful....simply Disney! The resort is just amazing. The main pool had a water slide that seemed a bit underwhelming after staying at the Boardwalk and riding the Keister Coaster. However, that didn't seem to matter too much to my son or to any of the other kids that rode it endlessly! The pool was free-form and was very family friendly. There were lots of parents and kids splashing about and having a great time. We never had a problem finding a lounge chair or clean towels. Even though we were there in July during one of the busiest times, the pool never seemed crowded. Lifeguards were vigilant and closed the pool at the first sign of bad weather (i.e. lightning), but were always quick to re-open once inclement weather passed. Aside from the main pool, there was a quiet pool around the side of the main lodge and near the Vacation Villas. It was a nice sized pool complete with bubbling "underwater springs". These were quite neat and refreshing to swim in and amongst. Both pools had nice jacuzzis - the main pool has two, as well as a kiddie splash pool for infants. The main pool also has a great view of Firerock Geyser which erupts every hour on the hour from 7am until 10pm. The resort also has a beach area from which you can watch the Electric Water Parade nightly at 9:35pm. The resort also conducts other activites down on the beach, like a water balloon toss! The marina is right by the beach. From there, guests can rent Sea-Racers, pontoon boats, Boston Whalers and also take fishing trips in Bay Lake. The fishing trip for bass, by the way, is catch and release, but we saw several anglers catching some huge fish almost daily! So, if you're a Bass Pro Shop enthusiast, check out booking a morning fishing trip and you'll have a great time. Speaking of docks, the boat launches to the Magic Kingdom came about every 5 minutes. Seriously! We never waited more than 5 minutes for a boat to arrive. One note, however, is that the buses and the boats also serve Fort Wilderness, so many times they stop there next before travelling on to their destination. Since Fort Wilderness is within walking distance of the Lodge, this doesn't add too much time to any given trip. Just be aware for those times when you need to be meeting a deadline (like dinner reservations!). The Wilderness Lodge has lots of activities for little rangers scheduled in the Cub's Den. Our son was too busy in the pool to ever get over there, but we had a list of several activities they offered. Buttons and Bells is the name of the Lodge's game room and, while not huge, it was certainly larger than the gameroom at the Boardwalk. There was a Jurassic Park III game that my son loved to play as well as air hockey. There were several racing games there as well. No real worries with inappropriate games for the kiddies here. The games operate on a card basis, too. You can purchase points that will be put on the card for your child (or yourself!) to swipe. Once the points run down, you can add more at the machine. Pretty neat and it keeps you from having to deal with quarters! For dining, the Lodge offers a few options. Roaring Forks is the counter service restaurant for the Wilderness. They serve a continental breakfast beginning at 6:00am. Regular breakfast is available at 7:00am. Whispering Canyon is a table service restaraunt that also serves breakfast beginning at 7:30am. Both of these serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. Roaring Forks has some fantastic ham and cheese, turkey and tuna sandwiches on hearty seven grain bread, with pasta salad as a side dish that I recommend. Of course, they also offer burgers and fries and pizza which they refer to as flatbread. After a few days, the menu will get limited there, but with all the counter service available in the parks, it's not a problem. Of course, you can purchase your refillable drink mugs at Roaring Forks and then use them throughout the duration of your stay. I recommend this highly! My family ate lunch at Whispering Canyon twice. Once was fantastic and once was horrible. The first time, our waitress was a lot of fun. She threw drink napkins and straws up in the air when she brought our drinks. I finished my iced tea (served in a mason jar) in about minute when she first brought it, so instead of refilling my glass, she brought out a 2 liter mason jar of iced tea and put it down on my drink napkin. I'm not kidding! It was 2 liters! It took like five lemons and twelve Splenda to get it just right, but my glass never got empty! The food was great and our waitress continued to whoop it up with us for the duration. From start to finish, we were in and out in about forty-five minutes tops. The second time we ate there, our waiter (Jeffro) was so unbelievably slow. It took over twenty minutes for him to bring our drinks and then another thirty for the appetizer to arrive. All my wife had ordered was nachos!!! From that point on we never saw Jeffro for another 30 minutes until our food arrived. Our glasses had long since been in need of a refill and once the food arrived, not all of my entree was there. I actually had to flag down a bus boy to get some help because it seemed Jeffro kept disappearing to somewhere in the back. He was about as much fun as a wet dish towel and his service was horrible. The food was still good, but it took two hours for us to eat lunch. Our reservation was for 12:10 and we left at 2:05pm. That was the only blemish during our entire vacation and we were determined not to let Jeffro ruin a perfect vacation. After all, it was just one experience of poor service from this waiter. I will most definitely go to the Whispering Canyon again the next time we stay at the Wilderness Lodge, but if Jeffro is my waiter, I'm asking for somebody else! However, the premiere dining experience at the Wilderness Lodge is to be had at Artist Point. DO NOT pass up the chance to dine here. My wife had the Copper River Salmon and it was absolutely heavenly. I'm not much of a fan of salmon, but her fish was so unbelievable, that I cancelled our reservations for the California Grill just so I could book another reservation at Artist Point and order the salmon for myself. Just a note, the Copper River Salmon is not always on the menu. This special type of salmon is usually only available from May to June but they lucked out and had it still in early July. My first meal at Artist Point consisted of the crispy venison spring rolls (fantastic!) and the grilled buffalo sirloin with sweet potato gratin. This was absolutely the best steak I've ever eaten. For desert, I highly recommend the Artist Point cobbler. It is magnificent. The second night we dined there, I chose the Penn Cove mussels for an appetizer and the Copper River salmon for an entree. Again, another magnificent meal! For desert, I had the Coffee Two Ways - Mochaccino bread pudding and vanilla latte creme brulee. It was heavenly. Even though the salmon was out-of-this world, the next time I dine at Artist Point, I'm having the spring rolls, buffalo and cobbler. That was my favorite meal there. Our room was cleaned and ready for us usually around noon. We never came back and found it unprepared. The maid service was excellent! I don't know whether it matters or not, but I did leave a tip daily. We were constantly being restocked with shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soaps. The mousekeeper also never failed to leave a towel animal in our room. This was something we began to look forward to. It was nice to be able to return from melting in the parks around mid-day to find the room ready for us to relax or nap in. The air conditioning was also spot on and kept the room cool enough to create condensation on the balcony door in the morning! Our room came with a small fridge which we kept stocked with gatorades and water. There was also an iron, ironing board, coffee maker and safe. All in all, our stay at the Wilderness Lodge was beyond wonderful. We have decided to make it our Disney home away from home every time we visit Walt Disney World. It truly was a magic experience!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: klmbutifulgem
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in June 2006. We booked a concierge honeymoon suite, so when we arrived a lady from the concierge floor was already on her way down. She met us as we walked in the doors. The lobby was magnificent. Our room was large and the bathroom was gorgeous. The service was impeccable.
