We ate dinner at the Whispering Canyons one night and we had a blast. That would be a great place to take the kids. The concierge level lobby was excellent. The snacks and drinks were wonderful. The concierge staff was amazing. The cleaning ladies even made cute animals with our washclothes and towels. The pool was beautiful. The geyser was really neat. The boats to the magic kingdom were nice, but there were also boats that went to the Contemporary, which was nice if you wanted to eat at another resort, or if you needed to get to the TTC. The buses ran pretty regularly. This was a great resort for couples and families alike. We are going back in December and are staying here again. It is totally worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: ajhappy1
Reviews.Content: We have visited Disney for the past ten years and spent 3 nights at the Polynesian and two at the Wilderness Lodge. I took my two children, ages 9 and 12. The bellman at the Polynesian was kind enough to offer to take our luggage to the Wilderness Lodge for us so we did not have to handle that ourselves. Our room was standard. After staying in the large rooms at the Poly, this was a little let down. The rooms at WL are your basic size with a refrigerator. We did have a small balcony which was nice. The children were very disappointed in the pool as the slide was very small by other pool standards and it was also filled with ducks quite often. The rooms at the Poly were loud at night, but they were here also. The toilets flushing sounds like jet engines, so beginning around 6:00am you hear one after the other over and over. We love the craziness of the Whispering Canyon Cafe and have gone several years in a row, but this year the food was poor and the atmosphere was not fun and silly, but more obnoxious and awkward. It was worth the extra $100 a night to stay at the Poly with the large rooms, cool pool, and the convenience of the monorail, however, the WL was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort choice”
Reviews.Author: lillyg
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 boys ages 5 and 2.5 )stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for 3 nights. We reserved a queen/ bunk bed room configuration with a woods view and were pleasantly upgraded to a pool/ lake view facing the Magic Kingdom. The 3 things we appreciated the most about this resort: 1) Direct boat transportation to/from the Magic Kingdom was speedy and efficient. We never waited more than 5-10 minutes for a boat. The ride was less than 15 minutes to the Kingdom, so if you're down at the dock by 8:30 you arrive with plenty of time to spare before the Park opens at 9. 2) Great private balcony view of the nightly fireworks if you get a room facing the Kingdom and the Electric Boat parade if you have a lake view. 3) Nice pool with fun water slide for the 5 year old. We visited every afternoon when it was hottest and the parks the most crowded. The grounds were well-maintained and interesting with abundant wildlife- rabbits, armadillos, water fowl. 3 minor things which could use improvement: 1) Bus transportation to the other Parks is relatively infrequent (3 times/hr) and SLOW compared to driving yourself. 2) Food quality at the Whispering Canyon was okay, but not impressive. The snack bar sandwiches/ salads on the other hand were surprisingly good. 3) Yes, the rooms are on the smaller side and rather dark with no overhead lighting. And the bathroom sink height is extraordinarily high for a smaller child. But the spot lighting above the beds,sitting table, sinks is perfectly adequate. And we brought a rolling cooler which came in handy as a stepping stool for the little ones to use at the sinks. Overall the room was comfortable and well-maintained. Maid service was good and the room was always cleaned before our return at 1 pm. We would recommend staying here if you have young children and would return here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great!!”
Reviews.Author: disneytravelfanatic
Reviews.Content: Another great! The Lobby: Breathtaking as soon as we walked through the doors the wilderness feel to it, with the air conditioning and the cleanliness not to mention no bugs!! Check in was fast and simple and the front desk staff was very nice and helpful. Rooms: Spacious and very rustic. We loved the rooms and the balcony was signifigantly larger than the one we had at the Grand floridian. The room was clean, and the bathrooms were spotless and filled with with disney Shampoos and accesories. Very easy to get to the pool,boat, and other areas of the resort. Recreation. The pool is a good size with the coolest wasteslide. Right near the water and the giesers. The marina is located next to the dock to get the boat to the MK. Dining: we did not eat at the resort instead we ate at the parks everyday. Although we did eat at the little cafe and the food was great we wouldn't expect anything less from the rest of the resturaunts there. Overall the resort was once again amazing!! Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Glenn90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge July 8-13, 2007, our family's first trip to Disney (since I was a child in the 1970's). Overall, the resort was terrific. The theming of a national park lodge a la Yellowstone was stunning. The pool was a major highlight - each afternoon after a long hot day at the parks, we and our two girls (ages 8 and 11) cooled off in the pool and waterslide. The pool is very large and has an interesting shape with lots of "areas" to hang out in, plus two hot tubs and a kiddie pool nearby. We experienced many "Disney just does things right" moments. The pool has several huge cabinets with fresh towels - always ready, you don't even need to ask for them. There is plenty of seating throughout the lobby where you can relax and enjoy the atmosphere. The "Mercantile" gift shop was huge. The room was always made up perfectly every afternoon. The geysers and mudpots really looked like Yellowstone, minus the smell! We enjoyed the boat rides to the Magic Kingdom and to the Contemporary Resort (we had 2 dinners at restaurants there). The location nearby MK is great. We had a few minor beefs: after checking in via car, our bags were placed on a luggage cart by the valet. After 90 minutes, and no sign of them in the room, the valets were confused and couldn't find them - we were told they were "delivered." Finally 15 minutes later they showed up in the room. The Whispering Canyon Cafe is a blast to eat in and the kids enjoyed our waiter's antics, but honestly the service was terrible. We were seated 40 minutes after our reservation time, after being told the wait would be 20 minutes. The waiter was u-n-b-e-l-i-e-v-a-b-l-y slow - we didn't even get drinks or glasses of water for 35 minutes after being seated. Appetizers were another 30 minutes. When dinner was served, one dinner was inexplicably missing, as was our waiter. After 5 minutes we asked a busboy to track down the missing plate. Still, the kids loved it, so I put on the "nothing is going to ruin our vacation" attitude. A warning about boat service. It's impossible to get a straight answer on when service begins and ends, so don't count on early or late rides. One morning we showed up at 7:30am for an early boat ride to the MK. A boat showed up, and the captain said the MK boat wouldn't start running until 8:30 (on an early magic hours park opening day, when MK opened at 8am!). So we rode to the Contemporary and took the monorail to the MK. Another evening, we finished a late dinner at the Contemporary, having been told the last boat left for Wilderness Lodge at 12am. We showed up at 11:40pm on the dock. No boat. We backtracked to the monorail and, on the operator's suggestion, took it to the TTC for a bus ride to Wilderness Lodge. Guess what - at the TTC, we were told bus service was discontinued at this hour. Great. Finally we flagged down a bus bound for Disney-MGM and he agreed to drop us at the lodge. All that said, we'd highly recommend Wildness Lodge. Our vacation was a great getaway and, despite a few "vacation wrinkles," we felt Disney does things first-class.

Reviews.Title: “One of WDW's Best Experiences”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: While I tend to prefer the Yacht Club for a variety of reasons, one of which is it's proximity to Epcot, the Wilderness Lodge is my number 2 pick by a long shot. It reminds me of the National Park hotels we visited when I was a kid, the Ahwahnee, the Old faithful Inn and the Grand Canyon Lodge. Except of course there is a killer pool, proximity to the Magic Kingdom and a ton of other neat stuff at the Wilderness Lodge. I like my rooms high and back here. I'd rather have a view not of the Magic Kingdom, so I seldom have a hard time getting the room I want. The restaurants are great even though we probably eat more meals at Epcot than anyplace else. I do really enjoy Artist's point and their fresh, Northwest approach to food.

Reviews.Title: “A refuge from the heat and the crowds at the rest of Disney”
Reviews.Author: nhhomebody
Reviews.Content: This resort was great! We loved the themed rooms and resort grounds. My husband and I enjoyed the boat rides at night around the lake catching the electric boat parade and the Magic Kingdom fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “Too cool”
Reviews.Author: epharmacist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Disney's Wilderness Lodge for a business conference. I was all by myself in a standard room with queen bed and bunk beds on the concierge level. Clean bath with separate shower/toilet room, and balcony with view of the tree tops. The room was comfortable, but I mostly slept while I was there. This was the coolest hotel ever. It was like I was staying at Davy Crockett's cabin. The only thing missing was my 'coon skin hat! Since I was on the concierge level, I had access to great drinks/snacks and concierge service! I asked multiple questions about the parks and they were eager to assist me. The pool outside looked like a blast even though I had no time to take a dip. Not far from the pool is the dock with boat rides directly to the Contemporary Resort (convention center) and the Magic Kingdom. The boat ride was about 15-20 minutes to the Contemporary and about 30 minutes to the Magic Kingdom. It's not everyday that I take a boat to work, so I enjoyed the cruise. Although it was bittersweet because I was traveling alone, I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. It made me smile every moment of my trip, perhaps because I'm used to staying at the Sheraton while on business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge-Great for adults and kids!”
Reviews.Author: lhcomcast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from June9-16th. It was a wonderful place to stay. The Staff treated us very well. The grounds are beautiful as well as very well kept. We stayed in room 1165,it was on the ground floor with patio access to the big pool.My boys (ages 9 and 13 )loved this. Transportation was easy from the boat to Magic Kingdom. We took buses to the other parks.The buses are to come every 20 min., it never took that long. Make your dining reservations in advance and you will not wait to eat r. We have been to Disney many times and the crowds were much lighter this trip. We will stay at this lodge in the future.Disney does it right.

Reviews.Title: “value, moderate or deluxe? my choice is value”
Reviews.Author: gcshaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from May 25 thru June 8, 2007. The rooms were average in size but very dark. We stayed on the main floor which allowed for easy access to all areas such as transportation, dining, pool and the boat to MK. The fast food court really needs a menu make over all they served for lunch and dinner were burgers, chicken strips, pizza and stale premade sandwiches and a very small variety of salads. Whispering Canjon is ok, but after a few nights it like eating left overs day after day. A feature daily menu item each evening may help to take away from the regular hum drum selections especially on a 15 day stay. As after day three we make reservations for any table service dining other the Wilderness Lodge. I have been to Disney each year for the last 4 always staying within the community. The only difference from a value resort (pop century 2005) and moderate (Port Orleans Riverside 2006) are a fridge in your room, full service dining and a few entertainment perks. From a moderate to a deluxe ( Wilderness Lodge 2007) are the size of bed from a double to a queen and a patio or balcony. So all in all if you are not spending a lot of time in the resort your best option is a value resort. If you want those couple extra perks than choose moderate as the deluxe really is not woth the huge price. Yes the size of value resorts may call for alot of walking but it is well worth the savings. As with young kids a pool is a pool as is burger is a burger. And with them in toe you are rarely in the resort other than to sleep or take a dip in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: DNLeeper
Reviews.Content: The Disney Wilderness Lodge was a great experience. It's been YEARS since I've stayed on property, but decided to do so with the addition of the three year old to the mix. The location was GREAT! The hotel is set back, lodged on a lake, a few clicks away from the Contemporary Resort. There are boats that run to the Magic Kingdom (5 minute ride) and Contemporary Resort (3 minute ride). From the Contemporary, you can catch the monorail to various locations. From the Magic Kingdom, you can catch the monorail as well. All Walt Disney World buses run from the resort to everywhere. The hotel has a great, efficient check in service. The room key acts as your room key (obviously), charge card for EVERYTHING in the park, access to the fitness club, etc. The hotel features several pools, one with water slide, two hot tubs, a beach with boat rentals, and a geyser. The three restaurants are VERY different - there is one that is "family style" which features the BBQ/Ribs thing at night, the crazy country breakfast in the morning, and a la carte features to go along with the all-you-can-stuff-in-your-mouth fare. Whatever you do, don't ask for Ketchup! The little cafe' down below (Roaring Fork) has the pizza, cheeseburgers, sandwiches, cookies, fruit, etc., and is open from 6am to midnight. The ARTIST restaurant is the upscale white tablecloth restaurant with the $30-$40/head type meal. Note - CASUAL BUSINESS ATTIRE is required for this restaurant. The food, while expensive, is a few knotches above the typical park food. We were there for a long weekend, so it was bearable - I'd hate to eat it for 7 days. There is a Cub's Den where you can drop the 4-11 years off for $11/hour. There's an arcade with video games.. Yes, you play them and charge the credits to your room key - how nice! The fitness center is VERY nice.. All Life Fitness Equipment and Cybex equipment. VERY NICE and VERY INCLUDED. The Merchantile store (gift shop) is very nice and very stocked. NOTE: There is a "pantry" in the back with medicines, snacks, grocery items, and toiletry type things. When I say BACK, I mean BACK. The staff was VERY nice and the rooms were VERY clean. I felt the rooms were a bit too small (2 Queens, Bathroom), but I wasn't really in there too much to really care. All the rooms have great flat screen LG televisions with RCA ports on the front. So, if you have a Video iPod, you can easily hook up and watch videos with the kids. Secret Tip: Call Housekeeping on the day you leave and get a Free Extended Checkout at 1:00pm or 2:00pm.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Flavor, Cozy”
Reviews.Author: kerrythomas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge May 2-9, 2007, during their off season. Low crowds, great weather, terrific price (Disney style) at $175/nite. Because Orlando was so dry, they turned the geyser off. But the waterfall still flowed and the pools were open all day. My room was a standard, with a view north across the trees to the Contemporary and Magic Kingdom. I could see the fireworks at night. Ask for an even-numbered low-number room, 4th floor or higher for this view. Spacious for one, but it probably gets a bit crowded for four. Two sinks, one toilet one shower. In-room safe, refridgerator, iron & ironing board, large hi-def tv, hi-speed data ports, standard clock radio & phone, bedside dresser, table & 2 chairs. Balcony has 2 canvas style chairs & small table. As a visually0impaired person, I don't drive. I used Disney's magical Express to get to and from the airport (MCO). They picked up my bags from luggage claim and brought them to my room for me. Upon checkout, I checked my bags with the resort airlines check-in counter, and never had to bother with them again until I arrived at my hometown airport. Great service. Use it if you can. The Whispering Canyon Cafe is anything but whispering. Many kids, who seem to be encouraged to shout out things every couple minutes. And the staff does, too. Not exactly a first class restaurant, so be forewarned abiout the noise level bleeding over into the adjacent open lobby. Informal is stressed here.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic with an entertaining dining experience.”
Reviews.Author: MMouseAlumni
Reviews.Content: We stayed May 11 and May 12, 2007 after staying 5 nights at Disney's Saratoga Springs. I had wanted to try this hotel for several years and we picked up a good rate in the low season. Check-In went well, I chose a handicap room so I could get a King size bed. The rooms had new furniture and the now expected flat screen TV for $280 a night hotels. Great: Warm pool with a slide for kids and 2 hot tubs for adults. Pool area was open 24 hours so you could enjoy after a long night in the park. Server in the all you care to eat restaurant was a lot of fun and I loved the general chaos in the restaurant. Air conditioning worked well and our room was quiet even though we were the first room #1030 from the main corridor and casual dining restaurant. Theming of resort was awesome. Nice Mickey Mouse made out of towels and left on the bed by Mousekeeping. Average: The food taste was a little bland and is not as good as many of today's popular chain restaurants like Chilis, Fridays, Outback, etc. Bus tranportation was nice, although not always very direct. Below expectations: Our exhaust vent in the bathroom was covered in a thick layer of dust bunnies. The kind that would take a year of neglect to develop. I wiped it down myself with several washcloths and called housekeeping to clean the pile of dirt off the bathroom floor. This did not ruin my stay or even 10 minutes of my day. I have only cleaned my own home twice in 3 years, but it was just gross and needed to be done. My wife was bothered by the messy pool area at 1:00 AM because the dirty towels from earlier in the day were overflowing on almost every pool chair and stacked on the towel return areas which had not been emptied. The boats to the Magic Kingdom took an excessive amount of time to make the trip to the campground and over to the Magic Kingdom during the peak time at the end of the night before the parade. We were on the boat for 40 minutes. Return trip to our resort was much faster. Overall: I would stay here if you can not afford the Grand Floridian, Contemporary or Polynesian as they offer more convenient transportation with the monorail. It was fun, comfortable and we had a very good time.

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: lbriss
Reviews.Content: Disney's wilderness is magical. What a beautiful settting. This was a first time to a disney resort, and we have to say we will be back. Everything is so clean, our room was great, and the lodge itself was very impressive. Check in was okay. When they tell you they only have dial-up internet, that is wrong. They have High speed.!!! We ate at the restaurants there, was just okay. You can do better, even at downtown disney. Very over priced food. Our daughter loved the roaring fork. Just ala cart, but kids love that!!! Overall our stay was wonderful. We checked out all the disneys properties around the boardwalk also. Those are also very nice, but not as peaceful as the Wilderness . The wilderness is great getaway for the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Rudy4U
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge April 24-27. We tried for an early check-in around 1:30 p.m. as we were all up since 3:00 a.m. that morning. We tried again at 2:00 p.m with no luck and waited until the regular check-in time at 3:00 p.m. The front desk still didn't have our room ready at check-in but gave us a room on the top floor with a view of the castle. My 3 year-old thought this was truly magical and was thrilled when she seen our view. This made the wait well worth it. This was our first visit to the Wilderness Lodge and I would go back. The hotel is quite impressive. The lobby holds a massive fireplace and gives you a warm, cozy feeling. The pool is Great! My husband, parents, and daughter really enjoyed themselves. Transportation via boat to the MK is quick and enjoyable. The only complaint we had was their selection of food options in the evening. The fireworks at The Magic Kingdom ended around 10:00 p.m. and by the time we got back to the hotel the main restaurant stopped serving at 10:00 p.m., so it was hamburgers and pizza, AGAIN, at their cafe. This wouldn't be so bad but we had that during the day at the parks. We all were tired of fast food and wanted something better. I think the main restaurant should extend their hours a bit, at least on evenings when the MK is open past 10:00 p.m. Overall, this is a fantastic place and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: netminder_60490
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite resorts. The grounds are beautiful. They give you the experience of staying at one of the grand old lodges from the national parks out west. The lodge itself is incredible and the staff is great. You will really enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: libertyproject
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a newly redone room. It was awesome!! Bunkbeds, large TV, great view of the Epcot Fireworks and of the lake. The property is just inspiring!! The kids loved every aspect of this very large hotel. In typical Disney style, the service was wonderful. The rooms are small, but comfortable, and the location is perfect for a day at the Magic Kingdom. The pool is wonderful, and so is the boat transportation and night time light show. We had just a perfect, unforgettable stay of a lifetime!!! A must experience, even if it is just a visit or single night stay, for kids 12 and under!!

Reviews.Title: “needs some improvement”
Reviews.Author: chasnative
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from Mon Apr. 16 to Friday Apr 20. Overall it was great. The pool closed for 1 day because of a sick child. But the front desk was always beyond helpful as were the bellhops. The food in the food court wasfine and the refill mugs are great if you are staying awhile. The boat ride to the MK was very convienent. Just few complaints: maid service was just OK, our party was scattered around the hotel, and the noise from the MK was so loud 1 night that it had all of the adults in our group awakw from 5 to 6 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: andrewdd
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before we stayed at the Wildnerness Lodge, and must admit being mildly concerned about the significant number of negative complaints that seem to have been lodged in the past 2-3 months. However, after having been there, I can say that this is a great place to stay, and now understand that people will complain about the littlest things. The sinks are a non-issue, the sheets are fine, and the rooms, while not giant, and hardly too small. The scenery and the pool are great, as is the food, and the ease with which you can get to the Magic Kingdom makes this the best Disney property at which to stay. My kids loved it all, and we'll definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Refurb Complete”
Reviews.Author: DisNut
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to read that some guests had not been informed about the pool work. We were told months ago and given options to change. We stuck with our original booking as our previous experience of this resort has been "Magical". The resort is wonderfully themed as a National Park Lodge and the main lobby is often descibed as an attraction in itself. The Wilderness lodge is one of the most revisited Disney resorts and having visited 6 times now I'm hooked.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: familyredeemed
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from our Spring Break in Disney. We usually stay in one of the 'Value Resorts' but this year, as Florida residents, and pass holders we were able to get a fantastic room rate. So we splurged! Our room was spacious, and the beds were very comfortable. The Health Club was well equipped. The pool area was our favorite. There was one bartender at the pool bar that went above and beyond. Her pool side cocktails were the best! Ask for Johanna if you can! The only 'problems' I could write about would be the funny smell in the halls. I could never identify it, it wasn't bad, just funny. The hotel has 2 sit down restaurants, and 1 'food court'. The food in the restaurant was just ok, and it was pricey. For what we paid, the food should have been better. The atmosphere was great, especially in the Whispering Canyon Cafe. Our kids had a blast. Their food court offered quick food for families trying to get to the theme parks. They need a little more variety, after a while the chicken strips, cheese burgers, and pizzas were tiresome. They should also have more than 2 cashiers working at a time. Sometimes the lines at the registers were longer than the rides in the parks! Transportation from a 'Deluxe' resort is considerably better than at a 'value' resort. The boats to the Magic Kingom were timely, and the walks to the bus stop in the parks were considerably shorter, and the buses came more frequent. I guess you truly do get what you pay for when it comes to convienence. Overall we loved our stay, and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Mccoyote
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there the first week of March and had a great time. Check-in was fine and quick, the guy was polite and competent. Our room was nice and spacious- I did see the odd sinks (not in my room though) and there are really odd!! So ask for a room with a king size bed; the sink is different. The pool is really nice and we even had ducks coming to our door every afternoon!! Talk about wilderness.... !! The bus service was super efficient and convenient. The boat was nice and quick too we were so close to Magic Kingdom!! I highly recommend staying on property. You get the full Disney experience and the convenience and customer service is just amazing. For those who said the halls are looong; I say yes. But there are many ways to get to one destinations; you just need to find out the best way.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Return Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: travelplannermom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 2nd stay in the Villas at the Wilderness Lodge (3/10 -- /3/15). This is a great place for families. My kids love the "Lincoln Log" look of the place, the stream flowing through the lobby, etc. It was completely booked with families on spring break while we were there, but it never seemed too crazy or overrun with people. We had a family group of 5 and stayed in a 2-bedroom villa. This was plenty of space for all of us. Master bedroom has a nice 2-person whirlpool tub. Please note (we found this out just the day before our stay!) that the main pool will be closed through the end of March. The smaller pool is still open; we enjoyed it, but it was pretty crowded. Drinks are still available at the main pool's little bar, but you have to walk over and fetch stuff and bring it back. In terms of the Disney transportation system from the Wilderness Lodge, a few things: 1. Magical Express worked great for us -- no complaints or glitches. 2. The ferries to Magic Kingdom and the other resorts took a long time. Allow yourself plenty of time to get places ! Including waiting time, it took us 30 minutes to get to the Contemporary Resort for dinner one night, and it's right next door and the ferry's first stop. 3. With the buses to the other parks (Epcot, Animal Kingdom, etc.) -- again, allow yourself plenty of time! We got there, but it always took us longer than we thought! My husband and I had a drink in the Territory Lounge one night -- pretty mellow, nice selection of single malt Scotches (according to my husband). We used the food court for breakfast -- they have some healthier options available, which was nice (cereal, fruit, skim milk, bagels). My kids went the pancakes & bacon route and enjoyed that, also. There's a few tables outside where we loved eating every morning (newspapers, including the NY Times, are available in the gift shop). I've eaten at the other moderate restaurant in the hotel (not Artist Point, the very nice restaurant), and let's just say that I chose not to return on this trip. Room was always very clean, plenty of towels & nice h20 plus toiletires, and always made up pretty early in the day. With all the kids and people, it was still quiet enough that I slept great every night. All in all, I find this hotel to be a nice retreat from a lot of the Disney hustle and bustle, with enough Disney theming present so that my kids enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for little ones”
Reviews.Author: Ponyprincess
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bedroom villa with another family. Altogether there were 4 adults and 4 children, ages infant-4 years. The Wilderness Lodge & villas are perfect for families with young children. The Lodge lobby has a stream running through it with a footbridge over the stream. Our 2 year old's favorite part of the vacation, by far, was running back and forth over this bridge. If you have kids and want a little privacy the villa set up is key. Nothing like having a door that closes between 2 sleeping areas...kid(s)can nap in one room and life can go on for the rest of the family. The villas are very quiet, as well. We never heard room noise from our neighbors or even the other family when the room's internal doors were closed. Iv'e stayed in rooms right off the lobby at the Wilderness Lodge proper, and the lobby noise is impressive and will wake up all but the heaviest sleeper starting as early as 0630! Not cool at the time, as I was on a romantic getaway with husband only. It's very nice at the villas to have a full kitchen to store milk, juice etc... or just do a night of Kraft mac-n-cheese. Also utilized room service on several ocassions which was prompt and professional. As always, room service is expensive, but the cost was worth the convenience of not having to convince 3 toddlers to behave for one more sit down meal. A one bedroom villa is perfect for a family of 4 if you have 2 children willing to share a queen sleeper sofa. A one-bedroom villa is significantly less expensive than 2 adjoining rooms at the lodge with more space and more amenities. Bad things? "magical express" luggage arrived well after 1 am--although this was within 3 hours, as we had arrived in our room about 11pm. Had to call THREE times to have crib delivered despite requesting in advance and confirming request by phone on the day prior to my arrival. It also took some doing to split the hotel bill (down the middle) between the 2 families' credit cards, but it was worked out before we left. All, in all, a perfect resort for families with young children. Reserve it, with as much square footage as you can afford. You won't be sorry...but if you're on your honeymoon, ask for a room well away from the lobby noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: brian3
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the Wilderness Lodge (03/01/07-03/04/07). Everything about the resort was great. Rooms have recently been refurbished and are tastefully done. Flat screen TVs in all the rooms, just like the Contemporary and Polynesian. I was undecided beforehand if the Wilderness Lodge would match up but it exceeded my expectations and I ended up liking it better than the other two hotels. Both the Contemporary and Polynesian have had the rooms redone also, but the Wilderness Lodge seems nicer in the common areas (lobby, hallways, etc). Transportation was also good, with a boat to the Magic Kingdom (about 5 minutes) and regular buses to the other parks/Downtown Disney. I never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a bus. All of the staff were very nice and helpful (lobby desk, housekeeping, room service, etc). Overall I was impressed and will stay their again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Disney Resort!”
Reviews.Author: momme
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the WL about 10 times and have always loved this resort. The lobby is stunning and the Pool/river area is wonderful. While the rooms are the smallest of the Deluxe resorts, it is the cheapest Deluxe with direct access to MK

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: squally172
Reviews.Content: I loved the Wilderness Lodge, but then again, I love all things Disney. The WIlderness Lodge is beautiful- it is large, expansive, and fantastic.The service is great, especially the boat ride to the Magic Kingdom. I took my husband here for his 40th birthday last year- the rooms are a big pricey, but worth it for a special occasion. The Wilderness Lodge is also great for people traveling without kids or with older kids- it tends to attract a different crowd than the kiddie-friendly value resorts. That being said, we are going to stay the Pop Century this week!!! But we will definitely miss the Wilderness Lodge. If you have the money to splurge, you won't be sorry. No, you won't see all the characters, but you can see them all morning, noon and night in the parks!! I have stayed at the Caribbean Beach, Port Orleans, Dixie Landings, All Star Sports, All Star Music, and Wilderness Lodge- hands downs- Wilderness Lodge was the BEST so far!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Fun! Love the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: kadorto
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing and just staying at this resort can be a vacation all on its own. The ambiance of the hotel captures the spirit of the northwest and through a little Disney magic you feel as if you're miles away from anything else. The rooms are nicely decorated and are very comfortable. I can easily go on and on about the resort and everything this is to do there but the bottom line is that if you want to experience Disney at its finest, look no further than the Wilderness lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but great boat ride to Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: wendaroolie
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to come back and post a rave review about Disney's Wilderness Lodge. I'm sad that I can't do that. We were at the Wilderness Lodge from Jan 28 to Feb 4, 2007. I had always wanted to stay at a Disney property but hadn't done so previously due to financial constraints, so this was our big family treat. When we checked in they had no idea that we were travelling with my parents and weren't in adjoining rooms. We have two small children, 2 and 6 months. They gave us an upgrade but it wasn't much help, we were still down a long hall and around the corner from my parents despite the booking for all six of us having been paid for with one credit card (mine). Also, the Magic Express from the airport was confusing, we almost picked up our luggage ourselves until I spotted a Disney agent lounging by a pillar and asked her. We then had to trek back across the airport and wait half an hour for a bus. Our luggage arrived at the hotel four hours later. The day after we got there, they closed the main pool with the slide, and the geyser didn't work. We did swim at the Polynesian instead one day. The bed sheets were cheap and ill fitting, the bottom sheet always comes off. The rooms are VERY small, especially with children. There was also no chair with arms so that I could breastfeed in comfort. The Roaring Forks snack bar is way too small for the daily crowds, particularly in the morning. The food is overpriced and you invariably have to stand in line to pay. Chaos. I thought there would be some perks to paying premium dollar to stay at a Disney resort, but there weren't any. Not even a single Disney character ever appeared in the lobby, and my main impression of the Wilderness Lodge is a crowded noisy lobby. To be fair, we had a very fun trip, but only because of the quick access to the parks. On the positive side, the boat to Magic Kingdom is perfect. We never had to wait more than a few minutes and it's an 8 minute ride. We didn't have to fold the stroller and my toddler loved it. True convenience, and the lake is lovely. The one and only reason I would ever return to the Wilderness Lodge is for the boat access to Magic Kingdom - particularly if my kids are still young. I'd rather stay in a high quality hotel with a great pool, nice sheets, and better access to food, and shuttle in to the parks. How disappointing to be leaving this review. I hope it helps other families with their decisions. The review reflects my true experience. Wendy

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected........”
Reviews.Author: leenie
Reviews.Content: Okay so we had a blast at Disney & Universal -loved both places. The Wilderness Lodge, however, was a bit disappointing. The lobby is beautiful, & I guess the pool area is nice, but it was sectioned off for repair work. The beach & pool bar were closed as well. Not a huge deal, but our 5 year old was so upset, & we weren't informed of the closings until about 3 weeks before our stay. We tried to get switched to another hotel, but could not. The rooms were not great, & very small. We had a junior suite, & even it was small. The couch in the extra room (more like a large closet with a small fridge & sink) was made out of some kind of "pleather". We found the furnishings to be dark & dreary, & they must not buy any light bulbs with wattage over 60. It felt like everything was cheap. I have stayed in worse hotels, but not for that price. You could stay at a Four Seasons for what we paid. Our suite also came with concierge level benefits (new), meaning we could go to the top floor for snacks, breakfast, etc. It was not worth the money. Every day in the morning they had bland oatmeal, some unsweet fruit, a few bread type items, & very watered down juices. The afternoon snacks were worse, with bowls of gummy bears & crackers. The drinks you could get were only put out at certain times, so if we wanted to get our son a juice box we had to wait until one time a day to find them. They would be taken away the rest of the day. It was almost as if the folks there didn't want you to eat much or were afraid you would take too much with you. Small plates, cups, etc. Problem is you are paying a very high price for all this. They can & should do better. The boats to Magic Kingdom were fine, no problems. Taking shuttles to other parks varied. Sometimes good, other times too long. The Roaring Forks snack bar on the lobby level was not good either. We did enjoy Whispering Canyon Cafe, though. Overall we felt like we were paying a premium just to be on a Disney property, but the hotel is not what you would get elswhere for the price. Problem is, after talking to others who have stayed at other Disney properties, it's all pretty much the same elsewhere. I don't know if I would stay at a Disney hotel again or not. It was nice to be able to buy things at the parks & have them sent to your hotel, & to have the dining plan (mediocre food, but hey, you're stuck with it at the parks). Really hate to be so negative, because we did have a great time despite of all this. Disney is great fun, but we were not wild about the WIlderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic wilderness lodge”
Reviews.Author: fromhere2there
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Orlando after about 25 hours of travel. Our Travel agent sent us Disney luggage tags. This meant that we did not have to collect our bags at Orlando airport or look for transport to our hotel. The luggage was automatically sent from the airport and arrived in our room about 2 hours after we arrived. This was fantastic, we were moved quickly to a bus awaiting to take us directly to the lodge. The lodge was like a big log cabin, very clean, and welcoming. The pool was excellent and all facilities were just great. we looked forward coming back to the Wilderness Lodge after doing the park hop. Service from all areas of the hotel was excellent. They had a comfortable little bar near the main restaurant. We ate in the artist point restaurant twice in 5 nights. The food and atmosphere was great. The Hotel catered very well for the kids, we have two boys 9 & 11. I would highly recommend it for families. We had one room with a double bed and two bunks. The rooms were not huge but they were roomy enough. Most of our time were spent at the parks. happy campers The Greentree's Brisbane, Qld, Australia

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: shmoopy
Reviews.Content: Strange hotel. The rooms are REALLY small and the sheets and blankets feel cheap (and believe me, the rates are not). Weirdest sinks I have ever seen in that they are too high and far back for small children to reach (our daughter is 5)--we called down for a stool for her to stnad on, but they told us that despite multiple request for this they cannot porvide them due to liability issues. We wound up having her spit her toothpast into a cup! And they are do far back that if an adult leans over the sink to wash her face you will hit your head on the shelf above. The boats to the Magic Kingdom are fine, but trying to get anywhere else is a major pain. We waited for a bus to Epcot for 25 minutes one night and then rode it for another 20 as a result of all the drop offfs, and wound up missing our dinner reservations. We are not outdoorsey people so the dark colors of the wilderness theme made us feel claustrophobic, but this is certainly a matter of personal preference. The cafeteria is very poorly thought out and required us to wait in long lines to merely get breakfast and then to fight for seats for our children to sit. I agree with a previous posting that the service at Disney is really going downhill.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: In the shadows of Pikes Peak
Reviews.Title: “If you don't expect good customer service or honesty, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: CO-TriGirl
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I LOVE this forum...and rely heavily on it when making my choices of accomodations. I don't sugar coat anything, because I would want you to know the truth when booking accomodations! Here goes... We were part of a grand gathering (19 total) all staying at this hotel. We were placed throughout the hotel and no where near one another. I was promised by the "manager" that they would upgrade my parents (who were the reason for the gathering) and locate them next to us on the following day. They NEVER made good any of their promises..no upgrade and no where near our room..not even on the same floor! Also, we were NEVER informed that the main pool with the waterslide was closing two days into our 10 day vacation. I feel it was not appropriate for Disney to allow guests to book advertising amenities that they did not have available! It was after discussions with lifeguards at the beach a few days later that did I find out that shuttles were availble to guests to use the Polynesian and Contemporary resort pools. Once again, exceptionally poor communication with guests..horribly bad..customer service! Lastly, the maid service was terrible until the last two days of our 10-day vacation. The did not change our sheets! It was so much fun to jump in a sand filled bed at 10pm and find out that they had not changed the sheets from the day before! Even after many requests for basic service, they made every attempt to make it known that they can accept gratuities. Even a voice mail message from the cleaning staff on the last night! Give me a break! I am becoming more and more "disenchanted" with Disney. We have experience exceptional customer service in the past three visits over three years...and this time was disappointed with the poor service at the resort as well as at the signature dining locations each night. Since we were on the dining plan, the servers automatically got an 18% tip regardless of the service. I think Disney needs to focus its attention back to customer service! I am not sure where the focus is these days..but it sure is not on customer service. Did the bad customer service ruin our trip...absolutely not! Did it cause an uncomfortable delay in our day...absolutely yes! My recommendation would be to stay at a resort off of Disney property or take an all-inclusive vacation else where! Disney used to be worth the price given its customer service and always exceeding my expectations. Next year, I will gladly spend my $5000 elsewhere! Disney just doesn't care!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST vacation ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MAVCalifornia
Reviews.Content: WOW! We had the best time at the Wilderness Lodge. We stayed from Nov.25- Dec.3, 2006. The hotel was absolutely gorgeous!!The pictures online don't even do it justice. The rooms were nice, on the small side. The beds were comfortable. The kids loved the bunk beds! The grounds surrounding the hotel were phenominal. My son (6 years old) loved the nature hikes near the hotel. We used the child care one night which was nice to have avail.(pretty expenisve, but worth it). We were pleasantly surprised at the prices of food in Disney World. We always got to Disneyland and the food prices are way more expensive then in Florida. The parks and the hotel were decorated beautifully for Christmas!!!!! It was a nice way to start off the holiday season. The pool at the Wilderness Lodge was awesome!!!!!There were lifeguards on duty most of the day. We cannot wait to go back. Without a doubt we will stay at the Wilderness Lodge again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: victoriasmom1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the WIlderness Lodge for seven days earlier this month. The hotel staff could not have been more kind or more attentive. Everyone we dealt with from check in (thanks Bridget) to check out was wonderful. I apologize for not remembering the bell person's name who helped us check out but he was terrific also. We ordered room service a few evenings and the gentlemen really went out of their way to take good care of us. We are not the neatest hotel guests so I'm afraid they had to make their way through some clutter. Our housekeeper Margurette was very sweet and did one heck of a job cleaning our room. I could go on and on. We had of couple of minor problems in our room but they were taken care of so quickly they didn't even have time to become bothersome. I broke the clothesline in the room and was embarrassed to report it but I did. Two of the sink faucets were loose and one sink basin was cracked. All three jobs were completed in record time. My daughter and I had gone to the gift shop (my husband had caught a stomach virus and was stuck in bed) and when we got back there were two of your maintenance gentleman in the our room replacing the basin. I'm sorry I didn't catch their names but they did a great job on the faucets and sink. They were both very pleasant and efficient. And last but certainly not least I want to mention the front desk and gift shop staff... Thank you Bob, Deb,Marc, and Yuki just to name a few. I have been in the hotel industry for over twenty six years. It takes alot to impress me. I was and am impressed by your WIderness Lodge staff. Keep up the good work guys and I thank you again for everything. Sincerely, Mary Wootten-Steger

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wildnerness Lodge!!”
Reviews.Author: carrieAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Jan 2007 for the second time and we were so happy. The bus service is awesome and the busses run about every 15 minutes. Also, if you are not interested in riding the bus, you can catch the boat. You can be at any park within 15 minutes. Also the rooms are beautiful and the log cabin magnificient. Everything was so clean and wonderful. We were also here in October 2006 and stayed at the Wilderness Lodge. I would not stay anywhere else on Disney Property but here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: coliseum
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a magnificent lobby and smells so good. It was decorated for Christmas when my son and I went and it was breathtaking. Our room was courtyard view with a balcony and we could see the streams, pool, and lake from our room. The room was not very roomy but it was fine with us, It had a queen bed and a bunk bed in it that my son loved playing on. The refrigerator and TV worked great. There was a sign that said something about housekeeping not coming every day (which was okay with us) but they still came every day and kept our room very clean. The pool here was probably my 6 year old son's favorite part of the trip. It is heated perfectly and was open 24 hours during our stay. The slide is so much fun that even the grown-ups were going on it again and again. The pool was always very clean and there were always tons of clean towels and chairs available. Check in went fine and my son was given a little treat bag to help him wait. There is also a little area with kid sized chairs and regular size sofas with a TV showing Disney cartoons. The rocking chairs and fireplace in the lobby are gorgeous. The front desk was always very friendly and helpful and the bell service was amazingly fast. Coming back to the hotel for breaks or at the end of the day really felt like coming home. It just felt so cozy. I may have been somewhat wide-eyed as I hadn't been to Disney since I was child 20-something years ago, but compared to other hotels where I have stayed this was defintely one of the best. I rented a car after months of struggling with the decision and am glad I did. We took the boat to Magic Kingdom and Fort Wilderness for the Hoop Dee Doo Revue and it worked perfectly. One of the captains had my son blow the horn. We used the car to get to all of the other places and to stop at the grocery store after arriving at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Love this beautiful resort, but not crazy about the boats...”
Reviews.Author: CJBSpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Wilderness Lodge 11/30/06-12/10/06. This is the second time we've stayed here, and without a doubt, the beauty of it still impresses us (esp. the lobby decked out for Christmas). We were able to be a Flag Family and had Ranger Stan bring us to the top of the lodge-what an amazing treat! Our room was a standard view, but we were able to see fireworks from the Magic Kingdom night after night. Mousekeeping was great, leaving us towel animals almost every day. Our main complaint was with the boat transportation. The buses were fine, but the boats were mediocre at best, and outright awful on two nights. Our main complaint was the boat to get from the Contemporary back to the WL in the evening. One night we waited over 45 minutes for a boat-another night it took us well over 1 1/2 hours to get a boat. Overall, it's a good deal for a deluxe resort (Disney category) and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort in Disney's Deluxe Category”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 out of 5 nights at Disney's Wilderness Lodge the week after New Years 2007. (The other two nights were at Disney's Polynesian). This is perhaps the most themed up of the deluxe resorts which makes the stay incredibly interesting. Our favourite feature was by far the expansive outdoor pool and the two hottubs...after tromping through the parks each day it was nice to come back mid-day and in the evening to a very relaxing atmosphere. NB!! The pool at WL was a very very comfortable temperature, which is important to my wife and I....which is to say we found it warm to our liking. (At Polynesian, we found the pool too cold, and we noticed not a single adult in the pool at the poly!) Snacks and cafeteria style food is convenient,reasonable and decent at Roaring Forks in the main lodge area. Our balcony overlooked the pools courtyard and was a nice spot to grab a cuppa joe inthe morning. Access to Magic Kingdom is by boat launch or drive. I recommend those who plan to stay a full week in try to obtain rooms with an annual pass discount...the savings can be substantial...more than justifying the price of the AP. We just loved the Wilderness Lodge and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort - Great Experience - Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: pmazcomm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from December 18 - December 22nd. Check in after a very long drive was great! No line but we realize most kids were still in School during this week so that was great. The lobby was wonderful and beautiful. Even though we did not celebrate Christmas it was still beautifully decorated and they had Carollers singing or music everyday. We checked into our room and it was nice. Well decorated and clean. We had a Queen bed and the two bunk beds. We got a pool view room which was great! We got to see fireworks from the Magic Kingdom every night and the lake light show at 9:30pm nightly. The pool was great and it was in the 80's so we were able to use the pool and not freeze. The hot tub was VERY HOT and great to soak your feet in after a long day at the parks. Magic Kingdom was great - we were able to take the boat to it and beat the crowds and parking. A bit long to get home at the end of the night but it was a nice ride. The fun every night was to come back to the room to see the different animal shapes the maids created everyday. One night, we came in and were so disappointed because we didn't see an animal until about a hour later, we spotted a towel animal amongst my daughter's stuffed animals! How creative. The cafe/main restaurant at the Wilderness is great. The waitresses have "attitudes" and were lots of fun. We had straws thrown at us, complaints about getting us seconds and they were hysterical when singing happy birthday to a family next to us. It's a must but make sure to make reservations in advance, we didn't and only got to breakfast on our last night. The snack shop is a quick alternative but crowded in the morning when everyone is trying to get to the parks. Prices - expensive but what else would you expect from Disney. Great customer service and attitude. My kids loved the arcade, lots of new and old games. Parking is easy for self parking - plenty of spots! Overall, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “We were not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: lv92900
Reviews.Content: We paid $400 / night to stay at Disney's Wilderness Lodge from 12/21-12/24. Check-in took a long time, although we happened to be the first and only ones in line. The front desk clerk mentioned that we were set up for bunk beds, while it was just my husband and I. She disappeared in the back (for about 10 minutes), and came back out and gave us a key to our room, presumably with no bunk beds. We got to the room. The bunk beds took up about half of it. Back to the front desk. The same clerk apologized, disappeared in back for about 15 minutes this time, and then told us we had been "upgraded" to the "concierge floor" and that she was sure we would like our room. We were a little hesitant, but were assured the room would still had the more expensive courtyard view we had reserved. The room was small and about the size of a room in a budget motel. I believe that all the rooms in the Wilderness Lodge are this size, as I've read that their rooms are the smallest of the Disney "deluxe" resorts. There was virtually no view from the balcony. Due to a high wall instead of a see-through railing on the concierge floor, the only way you can really see over the balcony is if you are tall or stand on tiptoe or something. So much for the view we expected and reserved. Our special elevator key to the concierge floor would never work in the elevator, which necessitated many trips waiting at the front desk to be rekeyed (unsuccessfully) or escorted to the elevator. There was mold under the toilet seat that housekeeping had missed. The lounge in this resort is dull, for those who are looking for a little fun with their nightcap. We did get a complimentary breakfast in the morning on the concierge floor. There was some other free food at various times during the day, but who is in their resort that much while at Disney? Yes, the lobby was grand, but I suggest you take your money to a different Disney resort. We have enjoyed both the Boardwalk and Port Orleans Riverside. I would like to add that this is a good resort for guests who don't walk to walk far to their rooms, as it is not as spread out like some of the others. As for rides, our favorites were Soarin' at Epcot, and the Rock-and-Roll Coaster at MGM.

Reviews.Title: “FUN for Family and JUST FRIENDS!”
Reviews.Author: natalie701
Reviews.Content: WOW! If you ever wanted to stay in a cabin...this is the way to go. ...Its like your own little house but BETTER. My Aunt retired from the NY police department nad All the girls got together to celebrate in an amazing place with out bothering anyone...peaceful and great activities. Great place for holidays too...you can decorate your cabin any way you want to! Hope you enjoy it as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible resort! Loved loved loved it!”
Reviews.Author: huffmanbaker
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several Disney resorts and this one is our favorite. The lodge is beautiful and recently remodeled with new carpet, beds, bedspreads, ...the works. There are large flat panel televisions in the rooms. The pool is warm. The 2 hot tubs are nice. The Whispering Canyon restaurant was very good. Transportation to the parks was good. We already have reservations to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Not So Scary Hotel Night during Halloween at Disney”
Reviews.Author: LANDAOZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Wildnerss Lodge 10/31/06 to enjoy the Halloween activities at Disney. I love this hotel. The atmosphere is very authentic, relaxing and you almost forget you are in Orlando. I enjoy the added features of the ambiance. I took advantage of the nature walks, actually saw an eagle and an armadillo on the path went horseback riding and saw deer and wildlife, enjoyed the Sleepy Hollow Hay Ride at the campgrounds and really had a great time. Room was comfortable and location was great to take the boat back and forth to Magic Kingdom and buses to other Disney attractions was convenient. Ate at the Roaring Fork which was great for breakfast, snacks and even a decent attempt at a Philly's Cheese Steak.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: disneymaniac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights, it was fabulous. we arrived there at about 6:30 AM we thought we would have to wait for our room, we were very happy to hear that it was ready so by 7 AM we were in our room napping after an all night flight. we were on the 4th floor, we had a woods view but we could still see the fireworks beyond the trees. the restaurant whispering canyon was really good, don't let the name fool you, they are far from whispering in there. we really enjoyed it. the boat to magic kingdom was great, we never waited more than 5 - 10 min. the buses were usually never a wait, if we did it was 10 min. we enjoyed the pool and beach. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wilderness Lodge ~ Boston, MA”
Reviews.Author: PumpkinPie01
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay and we both didn't want to leave. The hotel is breathtaking, everyone from checking in to checking out was fabulous!!! Our room was on the 5th floor and we couldn't have asked for a better view ~ we got our king size bed that we requested and there was plenty of room for the two of us. Rooms were nicely renovated and my husband loved the tv after a long day at the parks. Renovations were going on outside but you could hardly see the scaffolding. The pools are great, the one in the courtyard is smaller than I thought but really nice and there is another pool with a jacuzzi that was quieter. Transportation to Epcot was very easy using their bus system, we always seemed to hit it right as we never waited more than five minutes. The boat to Magic Kingdom was also good but at the end of the day it does get crowded so be prepared to wait awhile. We ate at both restaurants, The Artist Point was wonderful but not large portions and The Whispering Canyon is more geared to families but the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Wilderness--Yes!!”
Reviews.Author: BostonTom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Lodge. Requested a certain area of the hotel and they delivered extremely well. Nice to have fridge and coffeemaker. We last stayed at the Lodge in '94 and the coffee hasn't improved. (heavenly coffee??) The staff was very attentive and friendly ,rooms re-done and nicely appointed. It was unseasonably hot so we spent lots more time relaxing at the pool and beach. In the shade of the trees at the beach, one would hardly know where you were. Some of the other guests commented that the pool was better entertainment than the parks for the kids. Something to keep in mind when deciding where to hang your hat. Not an issue for us but the transportation can be somewhat spotty. Going to M.K. was o.k. but heard some complaints about returning from Epcot and Studios after the Fireworks. Great time, great hotel, but for a few more bucks,Beach Club is really pretty good too!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Hylo
Reviews.Content: Date 2.November 2006 Reviewer England I stayed at this hotel from 21st October for 10 days with children aged 11 & 14 years. It is a great location, set in extensive grounds with two swimming pools, good restaurants and helpful staff. The lobby area is spectacular, the general feel of the hotel is relaxed and comfortable. My only issue is the noise in the room through the inter connnecting door from the next room when the guests are loud. I would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Experience - loved the boats!”
Reviews.Author: 3_Kiddos_in_Tow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for 4 nights, 10/2-10/6. The first room we had was on the ground floor, and was very dark. We asked for a better location, and the following day were moved to a room on the second floor, which was much brighter and overlooked the pool. The rooms are on the small side, but with a queen bed and bunks it was workable for our family. The rooms all have a small refrigerator and a new LCD TV (great for the kids to watch Disney 24/7!) The main casual restaurant, Whispering Canyon Cafe, is good (although a bit pricey, as to be expected) but we found that the constant "antics" became irritating (example: at lunchtime, they had a couple celebrating their anniversary see how long they could kiss - in the middle of the restaurant - and they fully obliged. It became truly distasteful. Be prepared for a very corny environment (but kids like it.)) The food court, Roaring Fork, is great for breakfast /lunch and very reasonable. It stays open late for snacks (11 p.m.) and beverages (including beer, which may be a necessity after a day at the park with whining kids) until midnight. It also has an abundant selection of packaged fresh fruit (fruit salad, grapes, etc.) that you can take back to your room (to try to offset your kids' chicken nugget consumption!) The kids meals come with a drink, the entree and apple sauce - mine would not eat apple sauce, and they kindly/repeatedly allowed us to trade it out for jello. The staff at Roaring Fork was very courteous. As for recreation at the hotel, our kids loved the slide/heated pool. But most of all, they enjoyed playing around on the sandy beach (you can't swim in the lake, but they have tetherball and some playground equipment out there) and renting the "Sea Raycer" boats, which don't go as fast as a jet ski but are safe and very fun. On the topic of boats, the Wilderness Lodge is definitely the way to go if you will be at the Magic Kingdom for more than one day. The ride over takes about 10 minutes, and is so peaceful/relaxing. The lake is really pretty, and the whole experience is stress-free (compared to the buses and the monorail - where people are clamoring to board.) The buses can take FOREVER if you have more than one wheelchair (which is common.) Also, one of the bus drivers closed the door before my 3 year old was off the bus - and his leg was trapped in the door! You have to take the buses to MGM, Animal Kingdom Kingdom and Epcot, but on Magic Kingdom day the boats are a delight. We had an early (7:20) breakfast at Chef Mickey's (Contemporary) and we caught the 6:45 boat over to the Contemporary Hotel, as the sun was rising. It made our morning (despite the early hour!) Also, the hotel has a nice game room for kids, and the lobby is simply amazing. On our next visit, we will definitely stay at the Wilderness again!

Reviews.Title: “A better experience than the parks!”
Reviews.Author: artmachine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at the Wilderness Lodge and frankly enjoyed the hotel more than Magic Kingdom or Epcot. (The parks were so crowded that it tainted the experience.) But the Wilderness Lodge was great! The kind-sized bed had a very comfortable mattress and the window draperies were so effective that we didn't realize how late we'd slept the first morning. Since we were on the first floor, we sat on our patio each evening and the ducks and rabbits that live on the property would come right up to us. (The armadillo was busy hunting for bugs and went right past us.) The pool water was warm enough that you could swim at night, and we waited to see the geyser blow twice. The dinner was very good at the Whispering Pines Cafe, but the portions and prices were somewhat inflated. (Ask for ketchup!) Our a la carte breakfast at Roaring Fork Snacks was tasty and more resonably priced. We came without kids, but every kid we saw there was having a great time, especially in the Whispering Pines Cafe during ketchup requests. There's a really nice gift shop just off the lobby. The boat launch that takes you to Magic Kingdom was convenient and the buses to Epcot ran frequently. Of course the lobby is beautiful and the staff was universally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location in Disney”
Reviews.Author: jillysue20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge 9/17/06-9/21/06. I was traveling alone with a 3 year old and had decided to stay close to the Magic Kingdom. I have been to Disney many times before but had not stayed at the Wilderness Lodge. I was very happy with my choice. The hotel is easy to navigate with a tired child. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The mini fridge was very nice to have. We stayed on the 6th floor and we could clearly see the fireworks at Magic Kingdom from our balcony. We woke up in the morning to the sight of Cinderella's Castle each day! Every day we would come back to a clean room with funny towel animals left by the housekeepers. The new TVs in the rooms are awesome!! The ferry ride to Magic Kingdom was fast and fun. The bus rides to the other parks were just as quick and never crowded. This time of the year the parks are not as crowded so we could see so much more without waiting in long lines. The food is overpriced but I did the Dining Plan was very happy with that decision. Whispering Canyon Cafe is a very fun place for kids and adults. Beware if you ask for Ketchup!! I would recommend the Wilderness Lodge to families and older travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: JennShio
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband, and our 5 year old daughter stayed 6 nights at the Wilderness Lodge 9/24 â€“ 9/30/06. It was our first time at Walt Disney World and we were all very excited! We arrived around 7:15am from our redeye flight, so there was hardly anyone in the hotel. Immediately, you had a nice warm feeling about the place. The hotel lobby is amazing! We checked in with Linda. Unfortunately, Linda did not have the â€œDisneyâ€� friendliness & did just a competent job checking us in. I was very disappointed that this was our first encounter with a Disney employee. We reserved a courtyard view, but I requested if it was possible to get a view of the fireworks facing the Magic Kingdom. Linda told me that the trees are so tall now that thereâ€™s no view of the fireworks anymore. (I found out later that this is not true; you can still see the fireworks.) I inquired about being a Flag Family, but Linda informed me that there was a Flag Family every morning that week already, and that there was already a waiting list. (Although she didnâ€™t ask me if I would like to be added to the wait list. It was early in the morning so our room wasnâ€™t ready yet, but we get all our info & headed towards the Magic Kingdom. 12:30pm I call the hotel & our room isnâ€™t ready yet. 2pm Our room is ready and our luggage is in our room. We stay in Room 4151 â€“ a room with a great view of the pool and Bay Lake. The room is a nice size for all of us. Amenities included a safe, refrigerator, coffee maker, hair dryer, iron & ironing board. Having a refrigerator was great to have, but it didnâ€™t have a freezer section (to freeze the ice packs I had packed in my check in.) Toiletries included: shampoo/conditioner in 1, body soap, facial soap, lotion, and a shower cap. The large plasma TV was great, but they no longer have the bedtime stories for kids at night. The beds were very comfortable and we loved the pillows! Every night we swam in the pool, and every night we were able to watch the Electric Water Parade at 9:35pm from our balcony. Transportation was great: boats going to the Magic Kingdom came every 20 minutes, but seemed shorter than that. And it was only a 10-15 minute ride. Buses to Animal Kingdom, Epcot, MGM, and Downtown Disney were great too; the wait was never too long. We had dinner at Roaring Forks a few times; it has a great selection of sandwiches & burgers. My daughter usually got the chicken nuggets. Free condiments available are: peanut butter, jellies, honey, mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard, and lettuce & tomatoes during lunch & dinner for burgers, etc. Thereâ€™s also a microwave and toaster available for use. I brought microwavable popcorn and used it a few times for snacks. And every morning, I filled our thermoses with ice cold water from the soda fountain. The water did not taste bad at all. (Some of the water in the theme park water fountains tasted terrible.) The mercantile market is great to buy milk & a loaf of bread if you need it. And itâ€™s much cheaper to purchase these items at this store than at Roaring Forks. We visited the Contemporary, Grand Floridian, Animal Kingdom Lodge, and liked the feel of the Wilderness Lodge the best. I just wished that someone friendlier than Linda had checked us in on the first day. Her energy tainted the beginning of my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed this year...”
Reviews.Author: velveetaslingshot
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short and sweet. We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge last year and had the time of our lives. The stay was perfect in every way. This year, on the other hand, I experienced what some of the negative posters must have gone through. First, I paid extra for the "courtyard view" which they know darn well means that everyone expects to be overlooking the waterfalls, pool, and lake. Instead they had us staring, in disbelief, at a sidewalk and the side of a building. You also had to navigate a bizarre maze just to get to the elevator that takes you down to the room!!! I said "no way", and promptly asked for a new room. They obliged me, but the new room wreaked of tobacco and smelled really funky. My second beef is that EVERYTHING was being refurbished. There was literally construction everywhere inside and outside the hotel. An entire section of the hotel's "courtyard view" had a tower of scaffolding going all the way to the top. The bubbling spring inside the lobby that flows down to the pool was also entirely boxed off for construction. To not mention all of this to customers purchasing packages is inexusable and is, lets face it, a total misrepresentation of what you are purchasing. I hear everyone raving about "Disney" service, but I found this HUGE lack of consideration a more accurate picture of what Disney service really is......i.e. mediocre and extremely overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family experience”
Reviews.Author: Hamilton4
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, 2 adults, 2 children 10 & 7 recently returned from a 7 day stay at Wilderness lodge. The terrific ambience and reception at the resort is exactly as many have already mentioned.First, when booking through Disney when you arrive at the airport you are greeted by Disney reps who hustle you fairly quickly onto the Disney bus. Thats where the "experience" begins. There is a continous video running on the bus for the 30 short minutes it takes to get to the resort--Wilderness lodge was first stop, yes! Checked in early at about 2.pm and stayed on the 5th floor Courtyard view. Rooms and view were just fine. Flat screen T.V was a bonus and had plenty of Disney stations to view. The location of the resort is excellent. You can use a combination of boat, monorail, bus to get anywhere in the kingdom in an efficient manner. In terms of food, we ate at Artist Point which is both expensive but very good. Roaring Forks had a cafeteria style menu that was suitable for light lunches, breakfasts and snacks. Off site we dined at Californias which is at the top of the Contemporary and a must do. They provide expensive delicious food that when combined with a late sitting provides unparalled views of the Fireworks at night. The atmosphere is loud and gregariuos/fun. If quiet is your thing, do Artist Point. Ate at Bomas, a buffet at Animal Kingdom lodge. Great feast to be had. Good unique foods but enough of the same old, same old to keep the kids happy. Other fine restaurants are located at Epcot so make a point of having your dinner there that day. Back to the lodge, Very good fitness center and also a store in the lobby where you can buy beer/cigs if necessary. 6 packs of Bud were $11.99. For smokers, while smokes are not displayed they are in a drawer under the counter at most resort stores. I dont think you will find any in the parks, so prepare. The pool was excellent and Poolbar had a good selection of fancy drinks and beer/soft drinks. The beach is nicely groomed but you cant swim in the Lake. Rented the little speedboats which thrilled the kids. Sat them on my lap to let them "drive" for a bit. As for the Parks, you know the drill, drink lots of water and be patient. Use the fastpass and you cant lose. Disney Quest was very good for my computer savvy kids. Top notch technology. Ate at Bongos a Cuban restaurant there as well which was fun and had good food. Another themed event to attend is the Luau at the Polynesian. The show is terrific and is all you can drink of wine and beer. My fears of the waiter not making his rounds disappeared as I sat and watched him drop another, then another drink in front of me. Therefore, if desired you can get your monies worth. If you go to the Luau, make sure that everyone has there bathing suits so when you do the monorail loop to visit the Poly, Contemporary or Grand Floridian the kids can try all the different pools and of course, slides. Boardwalk is another fine stop. You might go there after visiting MGM...it is only a short boatride. A lot of action and another chance to check resorts in that area. Ate at the ESPN bar. Dont worry, it is not only for jocks. It is well themed for family. They had video games on T.V,s to play at the booths. TV,s everywhere including bathroom stalls and the best darned wings outside of Buffalo. Overall, our decision to stay at W.L was excellent. Great location, atmosphere and as compared the rest of the deluxe resorts it was the best value. Remember, days at the Parks can be long so at the end of the day you are just not at the hotel enough to justify spending more in other spots. Therefore, if you are a generally well -to- do family that enjoys some finer things but does not want to blow your brains out it makes good sense. Also, If Disney does a Dining plan again---DO IT. it is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooner's Dream”
Reviews.Author: tracieandscott
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon at the wilderness lodge. We weren't too sure at first if this was were we wanted to stay considering that most honeymooners tend to stay at the Grand Floridian. But i must say the Wilderness lodge was wonderful to us. If I had to do over I would stay there again but remember it is your honeymoon and probably would have stayed at the Grand Floridian. We had a great time. They upgraded our room as soon as we got there. The only warning I can give you is that to not expect your bags within 2-3 hours like they say. We arrived at 3 pm and utilized Disney's Magical Express. Our bags did not arrive until 11:00 that evening. so what ever clothes you need bring them with you. Except for all the liquids, like my contacts, was stuck on my check bags. Overall we had a great time at Disneyworld. We bought the bride and groom mouse ears and it seemed like everywhere we turned someone was yelling "Congratulations!" and giving us free fast passes or letting us cut in the long ride lines. It was really wonderful. Everyday we would come back to the hotel in the afternoon and have cute little towel animals. It was so cool. and then in the evening they would turn down our beds and leave us chocolates on our pillow. Oh yeah, and the first day we arrived, we received a knock at the door and in came balloons and a lovely card and picture from mickey and minnie congradulating us and it also had their autographs! Our overall stay at the wilderness lodge was a great one. The whispering canyon cafe was great we had so much fun! We are definetly going to return to the wilderness lodge next year. The food was wonderful and i definetly recommed the dining package it saved us probably 300 dollars. Hope everyone's stay was as wonderful and magical as ours!

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Madborred
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge is a great Hotel because of how comfortable it makes you feel. This is the most welcoming of all the Disney accommodations after a long day at the parks. My wife and I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from Aug 17-25 in a courtyard view room on the 6th floor. The room had been recently renovated. The bed posts are new and updated and there is a new widescreen tv in each room. I was really happy to see this because if Disney wants to call these â€œDeluxeâ€� hotels they need to keep up with the times and it is good to see that they are doing so. The hotel is beautiful.
