This was my third time there and it is still just great to sit out on the balcony and lose yourself in the surroundings. The pool area and Bay Lake is set up so picturesque, and the abundance of trees can actually fool you into thinking you are in the wilderness. Unless you go in August when it is 95 degrees. The people who work at the Lodge really do seem to go out of their way to help you. After the first day, whenever I returned for valet parking the attendants always referred to me by name. When my mother in law and brother in law checked in they both received a free upgrade from woods view to courtyard view rooms without even asking. We ate at the Whispering Canyon three nights and the Waiters and Waitresses were always friendly and very attentive. The downsides are as follows though: 1)There is no room service from 12pm-4pm. That is a huge gap in time. And if you go in the summer you might want to seek refuge in the middle of the day. 2)The pool is too small for all the people at the lodge. 3)The bus transportation is set up really bad. Sometimes they go to the campground first and the bus comes packed already. Thatâ€™s why we rented a car. All in all this is a great hotel. There is only one Disney Hotel I would prefer and that is the Dolphin. I say this because my wife and I are in our late 20s without kids and the Dolphin is more adult oriented. The Wilderness is great though if you want a comfortable place to stay that still wraps you in all that Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away form Home”
Reviews.Author: cshelkin
Reviews.Content: Okay - I have a lot to say.... We haven't been to Disney for over 20 years and decided to take our 2 1/2 year old granddaughter for her fist trip. Wilderness Lodge was a perfect spot for us. We got a great hotel deal through Expedia & great flights through United/US AIR. It was the â€œVALUEâ€� season. I compared prices to stay at Disney through the discounted broker (Expedia) with the â€œPackageâ€� you have to buy through Disney. It was a better deal for us with a largely discounted room price without having to purchase the meal deal they offer when you buy the package. We were there eight days and did not use the â€œmeal dealâ€� at all and saved money. You have to purchase the meal deal for all the days you are there. We were there 8/26 â€“ 9/3. We got to the resort at 7:00pm (after dinner and left at 8am after breakfast.) We would have had to buy the meals for the TWO days we werenâ€™t even there all day = $160.00. Just do your math to see if it works better for your family???? The atmosphere is incredibly serene, unlike the frenzied and chaotic Animal Kingdom where we had dinner reservations one night at Boma and couldnâ€™t wait until we left. I must say that buffet was so disorganized! Food at Boma was good quality â€“ but very frenzied. There are boat rentals, bike/paths, walking/running paths, and is also close to Fort Wilderness by ferry with more entertainment like the Hoop-dee-do Review Restaurant , the famous evening bbq and the lilâ€™ petting zoo. We had room 1168 (considered a lake view) and we were close to the ferry & bus transportation, pools, pool bar, and cafÃ©. We easily walked through the pool area from the cafÃ© and the short-cut was welcomed rather than taking the elevator and walking through the halls. It was a peaceful environment for a toddler that was out-of-routine, off of her napping schedule and in a strange place. This is a typical Disney atmosphere where happiness and helpfulness is contagious. The grounds were characteristically Disney, well thought out, spotless and really seemed like you were in the west with appropriate landscaping. 1.It has an expansive split-log lobby-lounge area that is warm and friendly and had soothing water trickling through to the outdoor pool ending with a geyser that shot up every hour that represented Old Faithful. This was actually helpful to know how long we were at the pool! The lobby has to be at least 7 â€“ 8 stories high with more than enough seating areas, including a cluster of extremely comfortable rockers in front of a significant fireplace. 2.Restaurants: Artist Point (dining) I would say this has unique, high quality, extraordinary food. I had a portabella mushroom soup, to die for, and an incredible vegetarian dish that was unique and tasty, unlike the usual pasta & marinara dishes that I would be offered for a veggie meal. It was filled with vegetarian pot stickers, lentils and an assortment of other leafy vegetables and beans. My husband, being a carnivore, ate a filet that melted in his mouth. Whispering Canyon was a fun filled breakfast/lunch and dinner experience for the family thatâ€™s looking for a bit more excitement, fun and games. The guests are the entertainment, so if you want to be unnoticed donâ€™t go there. They do have and all-you-can-eat option. There was so much food served that our grandaughter always ate from our portions that were more than enough for one person. Roaring Forks was our daily stop. This was a low key serve yourself, family-type environment. They have a microwave for popcorn, (we brought some from home having read a review earlier) a cupboard full of fresh fruit for sale and single serving cheerios and other breakfast treats. They serve, burgers, chicken, pizza, breakfast croissant sandwiches, bacon & eggs platters and great biscuits. I actually ordered a child size breakfast platter for myself every morning and it was more than enough. ($3.99) They also have a re-fillable mug you can purchase for $10.00 & have all the coffee, soda and fruit juice you want during your stay. This clearly paid for itself the second day! This cafÃ© is next to the pool, so we would fill-up often. Also, they have free peanut butter, jelly, honey & crackers which made breakfast, snacks and lunches easy for us some days. We all love peanut butter! We purchased bagels, whole wheat bread, (but you can easily bring a loaf of bread) some fruit and enjoyed some inexpensive meals. They also have a wonderful yogurt bar with fresh fruit to make your own yogurt parfait. They have food crafts as well. One day, my granddaughter decorating cookies with the other children. 3.Pools: They have three pools and three spas. The kiddy pool (0ne foot deep) was large and was never crowded, the larger pool (5ft.) had a bit more people, but still never felt crowded with lifeguards walking the edge and incredibly attentive. It also had a water slide with a lovely constant mist filling the area. Our favorite pool was the Hidden Springs Pool that had at the most six people at a time! It had spa like â€œbubblesâ€� in three areas. It was woodsy and very private, close to the villas. They also had great crafts for the kids and were always helpful and patient with the little ones. The pool bar was located about 30 yards from our room and I must say, I think that location was ideal for my husband. The lifeguards left at dusk but the pool was open 24 hoursâ€¦ my favorite! I was a bit concerned, but, I never heard people in the pool or at the bar when I was in our room ...on the first floor. 4.Rooms / Room Service & Housekeeping: The room we had was ...not so big, but we did have a small balcony with two chairs & a table that we could see through the trees to the evening light & music show every night. The room was kept clean and an adorable towel-sculpted animal was left for my granddaughter every other day. They do provide many pillows in the room and extra blankets and a porta-crib. We had two Q beds. Room service trays need to picked up more frequently from the hallway. They were often overlooked for hours. 5.Transportation: Location is everything! The ferry to the MK, Contemporary, Fort Wilderness & Polynesian were wonderful. It took about 8 â€“ 15 minutes and a lovely ride on the lake. The ferries were always there within 5 â€“ 10 minutes. The buses to the other parks were another story. The Animal Kingdom, water parks & Downtown Disney bus took at least 35-50 minutes to get there. There were so many stops along the way! One thing to know: if a bus isnâ€™t coming within about 15 minutes, thereâ€™s a phone that is at the stop that you can call the transportation center to find out when one will be there. I must say, however, once we got to where we were going, we forgot about the long bus rideâ€¦quickly. 6.Disney Magical Expressâ€¦ I always take a change of clothes & bathing suit, medications and toothbrush in a carry-on when I travel. Iâ€™m glad I did it this time as well -our luggage took about 3 hours, to get to our room. Having a stroller with us and other toddler needsâ€¦ it was a pleasure not to worry about the suitcases. We had a good experience. 7.Character meals: This is well worth it for lilâ€™ ones - especially Cinderellaâ€™s Royal Table. Not only was the food great, but my granddaughter saw Cinderella, Snow White, Belle, The Fairy Godmother and Princess Aurora (Sleeping Beauty)! This is much better than waiting in a line for an hour to see one character. Chef Mickeyâ€™s Buffet was paramount. The food, again, for a buffet was adequateâ€¦butâ€¦. along with Micky, Minnie, Pluto, Chip, Dale, Goofy, and Donald D visiting every table, it was well worth the smile on my g-daughterâ€™s face. Desserts to die for! 8.Laundry facilities: They do have many washers and dryers for those who would like to freshinâ€™ up. They have a change machine ($1 & $5) and soap machine. I put some powder detergent in a plastic bottle before I left and had more than enough for three washes. I threw three loads in before I went to sleep, changed it before breakfast and had it done after breakfast. 9.Sea World from Wilderness Lodge: I hired a driver for a round trip from W.L. to Sea World from Sunray Limos 1-800-204-4355. They never came. When the owner heard, he personally picked us up at the lodge and took us. We called him an hour before we were ready to leave the park and Bob, the owner, personally picked us up again and would not let us pay. I insisted he let us pay and he was just adamant about giving us this FREE service as his company made a mistake and he wanted to be sure we were satisfied and had a nice vacation. I would say that he had the â€œDisney Spiritâ€� also! Okay, so overall, I would definitely return to W.L. â€“our new home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: kkinne
Reviews.Content: From the minute that you enter the impressive lobby at Disney's Wilderness Lodge, you realize that you are in a very special place. My wife and I traveled with our young children for a quick get-away to Disney's Magic Kingdom and are so happy that we chose Wilderness Lodge for our hotel - even at the $210/night price tag. We highly recommend it. The front desk staff, decked out in traditional western outfits, greeted us with smiles and said "welcome home" and the hotel certainly makes you feel that you are home in a grand Rocky Mountain Lodge. We then heard the dinner bell at the Whispering Canyon restaurant (that overlooks the lobby) and got a real kick out of the waitress shouting (for everyone to hear) "Come and Get It" so we decided to try it. We were not disappointed. In fact, our kids rated their dinner at the Whispering Canyon as one of their highlights of the Disney trip. The wait staff is friendly and lively. The western BBQ food was incredible. We ordered the all you can eat special and they kept coming back to give us as much food as we could eat. We were the first to ask for ketchup and sat there amazed as they delivered 20 bottles of ketchup to our table. We then had to deliver the 20 bottles of ketchup to the next table who asked for it. The kids rode toy ponies around the restaurant as the adults waved their napkins in the air. Everyone was smiling and having a good time as the kids became actors in the restaurant's unique interactive dining experience. In addition to the great feeling that the hotel creates, you cannot beat the hotel's proximity to Magic Kingdom. In less than 10 minutes, you can get from the hotel's boat dock to the Magic Kingdom via a very nice ferry ride. The ferry runs frequently, so you don't have to wait long to catch it. That gave us ability to spend several hours at the Magic Kingdom in the morning, return on the boat to give the kids a chance to cool off in the pool during the hottest part of the day and then return to the Magic Kingdom at night via ferry. In addition to Whispering Canyon, the huge lobby and proximity to Magic Kingdom, the best parts of this hotel are, as follows: (a) rooms are clean and comfortable; (b) the pool area is amazing with a fun water slide; (c) the beach is beautiful with white sand and the feel of a tropical paradise; (d) staying at a Disney hotel gave us the option of early park hours so we got to a number of the attractions without any lines in the morning. If you are looking to save money during your stay at the Wilderness Lodge, you should: (a) park in the free self-park area instead of spending money on valet parking since both lots are the same distance from the hotel and it is a very quick walk to the parking lot; (b) with the heat in August, our kids were thirsty all of the time, so we repeatedly filled up our water bottles for free at the Roaring Forks Snack bar using the self-serve soda fountain; (c) we resisted the temptation to purchase Disney t-shirts and other souvenirs on Disney property. Instead, we found a nearby Wal-Mart that had a large section with Disney licensed products and paid half the price. Perhaps the best recommendation about the Wilderness Lodge came from numerous people that we met there who had stayed at other (more expensive) Disney hotels and told us that the Wilderness Lodge was the best of any of them. You can't go wrong if you choose the Wilderness Lodge for your next trip to the Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing and Serene Oasis”
Reviews.Author: coachjackets
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Wilderness Lodge and it didn't fail to meet our expectations, which are high. We were again given an ugraded room from the standard view. This time to a woodsview, last time we had a waterview of the Villas pool and in the distance through the trees, Bay Lake. They have recently been remodeling the rooms and this was needed, as the previous decor was original to the hotel. Therefore, the rooms are fresh, new, and impeccably clean. The staff leaves cute towel animals nightly for the kids and and maintain the room to exceptional standards, but are only average in terms of responding to requests (i.e. we never recieved a response from our mousekeeper after leaving notes and asking in person to get us the bedrail we requested upon check-in). Our kids throughly enjoyed the bunk beds and I loved the new flat screen tvs as part of the rehab. The rooms here are average sized, you can certainly find a larger room off grounds for less than the $220 a night, but you are paying her for the serene surrondings both in and around the lodge, not to mention the boat service to Magic Kingdom, beach front property, kids playground, awesome swimming pool w/ slide, hot tub, spraying geyser, nature trails, bikes, Watermouse personal boats, restaurants, store, arcade, firework views acroos Bay Lake, and the Cubs Den kids area. Whispering Canyon is a hoot of a restaurant, especially if you have kids in the 4-13 age bracket (or if you're still are young at heart and you know you are or you wouldn't be a Disney now would you?). For a romantic/upscale dining experience, Artist Point is not to be missed. Drop the kids off at the Cubs Den for an hour or two and have a nice dinner or at least one of their exceptional desserts with your spouse, you won't regret it. I highly recommend advance reservations for both restaurants. Roaring Forks snacks is ok, but nothing to write about. Nachos, pizza, sandwich, etc...Refillable mugs for soda for around $12, great if you drink a ton of pop otherwise skip it. The lobby here has got to be the most impressive of all in the Orlando area running neck and neck with Gaylord Palms Resort (Animal Kingdom is a close 2nd) at five stories. Tipi chandeliers, floor to ceiling totem poles, floor to ceiling fireplace, cozy rockers, and couches, even a river flowing out of the lobby out of the back of the building waterfalling toward the pool. Bus service from here is mediocre at best, but the ferry boat to Magic Kingdom is top notch. Also, hop the boat to the campground and catch the Hoop Dee Do dinner show (but call way in advance for this as it sells out quickly). While I've never used it, they do offer valet parking, as well as concierage services for guests on the 7th floor. All-in-all, for a family retreat or a romantic getaway just for the two of you, you'll be more than pleased with your stay at the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Property!”
Reviews.Author: lrnsmom
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a 5 night stay at Disney's Wilderness Lodge (August 8 - August 13). The resort is immaculate. Pictures do not do the lobby justice - it truly is amazing! We stayed on the 7th floor (concierge level). Here is what I think you will want to know: The good stuff: The Resort - beautiful down to the last detail. Very relaxing and calm atmosphere. Staff - friendly and helpful. Room - just renovated - very clean. There are refrigerators in all of the rooms. Cool flat screen televisions. Pool and outdoor areas are pretty. The "ok" stuff: Rooms are small - we were expecting this - but nonetheless - they are small! The tub & toilet area - REALLY small - room to stand in and dry off. Rooms and bathrooms are dark - there just isn't enough lighting. Plumbing - there seems to be issues with drainage and hot & cold water. The pool water was cloudy - and in the mornings there were lots of ducks swimming in the water - yeuch. Concierge level - this would have been great except they close at 10:00 pm (before most guests return from the park). When we really would have liked to have sat down for a snack and drink they were closed. Because we spent most of our time at the parks I don't feel that the concierge upgrade was worth the $100+ per night as on most days it was only available to us for breakfast. Disney Dining Plan - now that was a deal! We ate our table service meals at Boma (the best meal we had at Disney), Coral Reef, Ohana's, The Grand Floridian Cafe, and Hollywood & Vine. I highly recommend Boma and Ohana's. Coral Reef was good and geat with the aquarium view but the service wasn't up to par. Hollywood & Vine was nice because the meal came with reserved seating to see "Fantasmic" at MGM. Overall - we would visit the Wilderness Lodge again - no concierge and definitely would purchase the Dining Plan as we feel we got our $$'s worth (and it was nice not digging into our pocket's all day)! Also - one last comment - we booked through AAA - got a nice package discount (7%) and a voucher for great parking!

Reviews.Title: “better places to stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: whenarewegoingback
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Halloween of 2005 with 12 family members in 3 rooms. We are frequent Disney guests, returning each year and have stayed at the Wilderness Lodge on 2 prior occasions that were fine. During check in our rooms were not adjoining as had been requested when we booked our "magical gathering". This was remedied during check-in although not with the charm of yester-year "disney". My complaint was the bathroom of our room. It had obvious mold and very thick dust on the vent over the tub. With 2 small children I would get up about 5am to shower and get ready for the day. Found out early no hot water. Called the desk and was informed to "let it run for a few minutes" to which I replied that 1. I had and 2. I'm in a large hotel, I shouldn't have to let it run. The hot water problem lasted a total of 4 days of our stay. My other gripe is that while the water shuttle is convenient to go to the MK, the bus service was not. I would like to add it always had been prior to this visit. An elderly wheelchair bound relative was with us as we waiting for the bus in line and the bus driver curtly commented..are you getting on this bus?..which we clearly were and proceeded to state that we should have told him right away. He mumble something and just made this relative feel bad. The cafe was great for a fast breakfast or afternoon lunch and Artist Point restaurant was fantastic. The final straw was a maintance man yell at my 3 year old son not to chase the ducks as they are a protected wildlife animal. My son was 3 and I was not allowing him to run wild or leaving him unattended but this was uncalled for. I'm not sure what has happened to this property, seems customer service was not the priority and employees were on edge. I know I'll be back to Disney but won't stay at the lodge again. You would be better served to stay at a moderate priced hotel as you still need to take bus service.

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: pointe201
Reviews.Content: I was at this place last December and all I can tell you is that the other resorts are better and that the moderate resorts are better. The room was very small and the rooms looked dated.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Disney's Wildernese Lodge”
Reviews.Author: schong
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 8 to 15 at the Villas of Disney's Wildernese Lodge. Disney's Magical Express pick us up from Orlandio International Airport to our resort. It is a great service. I hope Disney continue that. And the meal plan that we enjoys everyday of our stay. I think all of Disney's resorts are beautiful and well maintain but this one is magnificent. So nice! Everything from my room, to the restaurant, to the pools. The lobby is amazing. This is the only hotel I been to that look better than the photo. Wow!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the 11th trip we have made to WDW and our 5th stay at Wilderness Lodge. Having stayed at many other locations on property (All Stars, Port Orleans, Coronado, etc.) the Wilderness Lodge is by far my family's favorite place to be. The cast members that work at the Lodge are wonderful and will do just about anything to make your stay a good one. The rooms are great, and even though some might say a bit small, you don't go to Disney World to stay in your room, do you? Yes, the remodeling is an inconvenience, especially when you are trying to find the elevator, but they are working very quickly, and when they are done, the rooms are really great! (we were the first ones to stay in our room on this trip!) The food is great at the Lodge, and Whispering Canyon is one of the most fun places to eat in all of Disney World. Definetely buy yourself a mug on your trip--they are worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but pricey”
Reviews.Author: KrisCommerce_MI
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for two nights. It was wonderful. They had a great pool, beautiful rooms, and cute kid activities. And of course the animals outside the room. We stayed before we started going to the parks and then transfered to less expensive hotel when we would be gone all day long. I don't think it is worth the money if you spend all day at parks. But definitely worth it if you are around to enjoy it most the day. The kids also seemed less interested in the animals after a couple day. So I would return, but again for only a couple nights.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Chloe7122
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the lodge after a 5 day stay. Everything was perfect. We received a free upgrade when the room of our choice was not available. We were on the 6th floor and had a terrific view. The room we had was renovated and was really great. Our room had a flat screen tv and bunk beds for the kids. Our room also included a built in fridge -- very helpful. The lobby and grounds are breathtaking. The lodge has two pools -- both fun and large enough that they didn't seem too crowded. One of our favorite perks of the hotel was the nightly water parade right at the beach. It was the perfect way to end the night. The boat transportation is the way to go to Magic Kingdom -- so easy and relaxing. The boats come regularly and were not too crowded. We could see the fireworks from Magic Kingdom from the boat docks. The staff is so friendly -- the first thing they said to us was "Welcome Home" when we arrived. It was so convenient to check-in with our airline flights right in the lobby and they transported our bags for us so we didn't have to worry about them. Overall -- the best hotel experience our family has every had! We would definetly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely themed hotel”
Reviews.Author: mckinfam
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from June 24-28 and really enjoyed our stay. The lobby is beautifully themed and I really liked to just sit there, enjoy the ambiance and people watch. The renovated room was very nice with a new plasma TV (which of course the "boys" liked). We had a woods view and I also liked relaxing on the patio. We got quick breakfasts at Roaring Forks and had an excellent dinner one night at Artist Point. I have also stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge and would have a hard time choosing which resort to stay at again. They're both pretty great.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: mamajuls
Reviews.Content: So wonderful we almost cried when we had to leave. My two kids decided that this was their favorite" Disney attraction," and they love the parks. Very cozy rooms, breathtaking lobby and grounds. Everything you need is right there in the lodge. Pools very nice. (Especially the Hidden Springs Pool if you are looking for quiet!) The details in the rooms, halls and even in the parking lot (copper arts and crafts lighting) are meticulous. We stayed in a studio in the Villas and ate breakfast every morning on our patio with wild birds and even a bunny we named Mickey who came every morning. Buses come frequently to take you to every park and a boat is availible to the Magic Kingdom. Once we parked our car (valet is availible) we never touched it until we regretably had to return home. Definately the place to stay if going to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Wild About Wilderness Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7-night stay at the Wilderness Lodge. What a beautiful place! My husband and I traveled with our 7 year old son (who celebrated his birthday while there and received a signed card from Goofy and a chocolate lollipop!) and our 9 year old nephew. The service was excellent. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The pool was awesome for all of us. Our room served our needs well. We had a corner room on the sixth floor. It was very quiet. Although the view outside our room wasn't the greatest, our view of the fireworks from Magic Kingdom was super. The transportation on the boat was an exciting way to travel to Magic Kingdom and the buses that ran to the other parks worked out well. The Mercantile is a fun gift shop. We did not eat in either of the two main restaurants, but did enjoy the Roaring Fork Snack Bar. Delicious breakfasts and sandwiches and lots of other goodies. We will certainly go back...I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel would stay here again they upgraded our room and made us feel like we were at home. It was my daughter's 5th birthday and they even sent her a card. It was awesome loved the boats too

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, despite the renovations”
Reviews.Author: WeTravel2Learn
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a 4 1/2 day trip to DW with a 17-year-old girl. We enjoyed our stay at the Wilderness Lodge, despite a few hassles. We arrived late, about 1:30 a.m., were sent to a room about as far away from the front desk as possible, and our room key did not work. We trekked back, got new keys, hiked up to the room, still did not work. On the third trip someone at the desk came with us to open the room ... only to find that it was a smoking room despite my no-smoking request. They did move us to a non-smoking room (with a better view) the next day. The only other hassle we had was that renovations are taking place right now; it seemed that the pounding sounds never stopped. I just held a pillow over my head to drown them out. All that aside, I loved the location of this lodge. We took the boat to Magic Kingdom and the bus service to and from the other parks was pretty rapid. You need patience for Disney World ... there are always lines. The bus wait was the least of our issues. The lodge is beautiful inside and we enjoyed the pool one night. Although I didn't get to physically visit the inside of the other resorts, I liked the location of this one; close to the heart of everything. The rooms were fairly clean (I found a few items on the floors near the bedside table that mousekeeping had not removed from previous guests) and we had a refrigerator which we used for the water and juices we brought with us, plus takeout desserts on nights we couldn't eat ours at table. We did not get any towels twisted into character shapes (I did leave tips every day with mousekeeping) but that was OK with us. I recommend the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit to The Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: vacation-alcoholic
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Wilderness Lodge with my husband, pregnant daughter and two grandchildren, ages 5 and 8. We all loved the Wilderness Lodge. We had a deluxe room on the first floor. It had two queen size beds, a pull out bed in a couch in another room, twin sinks outside of the toilet, shower area , a wet bar with a refrigerator under it, a small private porch through sliding doors. We had two T. V's, one in the bedroom and one in the second room. We could close doors between the rooms, even sliding doors to close off the bathroom area. We could all have our privacy when needed. There was a table big enough for four to eat on. The beds were very comfortable, the staff was very friendly and tried to make our stay as pleasant as possible. I ordered groceries on-line from Goodings grocery and they delivered them the day of our arrival. We ate all of our breakfasts and snacks and also some lunches in the room. Since the food in the parks and the hotel is pricey, that helped our budget quiet a bit. We ate at the Whispering Canyon restaurant and Roaring Forks counter service in the hotel. They both served good food, but a little on the pricey side. We found that to be true throughout the Disney World properties. The Whispering Canyon had a fun atmosphere that the kids enjoyed. They got to ride stick horses around the restaurant and sing with the staff. The staff also would joke with the customers quite a bit. My daughter asked for some mayonaise and they brought out a five gallon container full of mayonaise. Don't eat there if you are looking for a quiet meal, it's not for you! The lobby was breathtaking, be sure to spend time looking at it closely, the details are great. You can find places to sit on the upper floors surrounding the Lobby. I found a quiet place to sit by a fireplace one early morning while the rest of the family slep in. The kids loved the pool. The water slide was attractively done, going around boulders. There were two hot tubs side by side that my husband and I enjoyed one evening. The water was not too hot, which we have found to be the case at other hotels. My daughter loved the smaller quiet pool around the corner from the big pool, it was surrounded by trees and had one hot tub, but no slide. The transportation worked out very well. The buses were easy to figure out and ran every few minutes. I think the longest that we waited for a bus was about 15 minutes. We enjoyed the boat transportation to the Magic Kingdom. It was a short ride and relaxing. The boats ran pretty regularly too. We only waited a few minutes for a boat most trips that we made on them. The only down side to our trip was the credit card like keys to our room that also acted as our tickets to the parks. We had trouble using them in the fast pass machines to get a special time for the rides. Out of 5 cards, we had trouble with all of them. We had to turn them in at the front desk each day of our trip to get new cards issued when they quit working. At one park, my husband's and my card would not work to get in. We had to step out of line and have them make new cards for us right there. The problems with the cards were very time consuming and I plan to write a letter to customer relations concerning our problems with the passes. I would go to the Wilderness Lodge again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: HoneyCom
Reviews.Content: My husband a I just got back from 5 nights there, and I didn't want to leave. The building and grounds are gorgeous, and there is a geyser that goes off every hour. Our room was $310 a night, more than we usually pay, but it was worth it. The staff was efficient and friendly. My only complaint is that Disney has a lock on the food, so if you want McDonald's or Domino's Pizza, forget it. I enjoyed watching the families have such a great time in the pool. There were a zillion kids! We had ducks and rabbits outside our room patio, that was the wilderness part.

Reviews.Title: “Been to Disney 40+ and this is our favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vanderneucker
Reviews.Content: We have been to WDW 40+ times and have stayed inside at the Polynesian, Caribbean, Contemporary and Animal Kingdom Lodge. The Wilderness Lodge is our favorite. The restaurants serve a good menu, there is a takeout place that is quick and good. The boats serve the Magic Kingdom and are a much more pleasant ride than the monorail. We get a room with the bunk beds for our two teenagers and save by not having to get a second room. One tip is to get at least one annual pass, this saved us over $1000 for the week since there are special deals for pass holders. If you go to disney every year, you should really think about the annual pass. Annual pass holders who stay outside of disney get free parking which really adds up as well.

Reviews.Title: “decent place but staff were deceptive-construction noise beware!!”
Reviews.Author: bishopbeachfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed in early May, first time at Wilderness Lodge. I had done months of researching on the internet as well as making calls to disney to find a quiet hotel to stay at that wasnt going to be under major refurbishment or construction. Before I made reserv. , I spoke directly to wilderness staff on phone as well as disney and they assured me no construction going on. Staff told me I needed to book the more expensive room (courtyard) instead of standard or woodsview to ensure a more peaceful room(away from service entrances,e tc. When we checked in, something was already not right. (took 45 minutes to check me in - also had problems getting my dining plan and park tickets to me) Before I made my request known again theywanted to send me to animal kingdom lodge(overbooked here) I said no that I had 4 year old and most of our time would be spend at MK and that why we booked here. I also reminded staff that I wanted as quiet a room possible, and was there any construct going on. They said no and put us on 5th floor far right wing over pool area. A few days into our stay we started coming back to room for a much needed nap, only to find drilling, jackhammering,, buzz sawing, etc right above us. called front desk and they seemed nonchalant about situation. the elevator wouldnt go up to 6th floor for some reason so i decided to walk up the stairs to see what was going on. THE WHOLE FLOOR WAS BEING STRIPPED AND RENOVATED (MAJOR CONSTRUCTION) Needless to say i was beyond LIVID after spending a total of $4,000 for our vacation to be on a construction site. I spoke with a manager who said he would take 10% off. at first i agreed to this but when the last morning came, the one day we didnt have to get up ata 6:15 to get to park early and wanted to sleep in, we were rudely awakened at 7:20 am by electric saws and hammering. I complained again and they took 25% off. I'm still really upset bc many of the disney staff directly lied to us and apparently by the looks of things the renovations had been going on for awhile. ON a different note, pillows and beds were great (but shins were banged up from bed corners) room was a bit run down but adequate quality for what little time we spent there. 4 year old liked vintage disney shorts on tv adn he loved the pool area and watching the bunnies eat in the gardens. whispering canyon had good service and great food(super cornbread) 5 minutes or less on bus to MK- about 25 minutes by boat. Using bus to epcot was about 20 minutes bc of stop at fort wilderness and 25 minutes to MGM and AK. Had to time buses right in morning - sometimes had to wait 15 minutes, sometimes 5-10 for a bus. Longer wait when waiting for bus at the parks to return back to lodge. ROom walls were kind of thin bc we could hear baby crying next door to us and people talking. Housekeeping pretty decent-when I called and said the housekeeper didnt replinish the coffee, the sent up a whole bag instead of just one. They also left my son animal washcloths each day (and we tipped a couple of bucks each day for this). Went during grad night weekend-dont really recommend this bc we could hear fireworks at 12:00 and 3:00 am at MK. Roaring forks cafe was pretty good and mercantile was a really neat place to shop but food was pricey there. (might want to bring your own cereal or bagels and keep in room for breakfast. ) Airport check in from hotel was very swift and convenient. OVerall, if you want a quiet place to stay I don't recommend it, or if you expect better quality than a holiday or days inn I don't recommend it. Proximity to the park did make this hotel VERY appealing however if you plan on spending most of your time at the MK.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: srcondos
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several Disney resorts (Contemporary, French Quarter, Caribbean Beach & Coronado Springs) and I think the Wilderness Lodge just became our new favorite. We stayed for a long weekend at the WL on the Concierge floor and were lucky enough to be upgraded to a honeymoon suite. The Concierge floor was great - essentially there were snacks and drinks available throughout the day, which was a great treat in between comings/goings. It should be noted that some guests treat this privilege as if it is a restaurant, which is NOT meant to be. The floor was large with many areas set up for eating, resting or tv viewing. Our room was not huge, but it was clean and comfortable. One night there was a roach inside the bathroom drain trying to climb up from the drainpipe, but we flushed it back with water and had no further problem. We had a small balcony from which we could see the fireworks at the Magic Kingdom each night. The openness of the lobby can really carry up all of the noise below, so we were pleasantly surprised at how quiet our room was. The bed was comfortable enough and there were plenty of pillows for a change. Also included in the room were a small wall safe, refrigerator, its own temperature control (NOT motion detected), and a ceiling fan. The hotel itself is beautiful, very large and well done. Although the hotel was crowded, it never seemed overly so. The pool was warm and again, though crowded, not unbearably so. There is a small soft sand beach with chairs overlooking the waterway, which is near where you can catch a boat to the Magic Kingdom. We ate at the Artist Point restaurant on our last night. The food was really good, though our waiter was incredibly unattentive. Our dining experience would have been nearly 45 minutes less had he actually we remembered we existed. Hopefully you will have better luck because the food is worth checking out. As always, the best perk about staying on Disney property is the use of Disney transportation and not having to worry about driving/parking. The most we waited at the hotel was 5 minutes for a bus and 15 minutes at the park for a return bus. If you are interested in a deluxe resort, definitely give Fort Wildnerness a try. Our last experience at a deluxe resort was at the Contemporary and it was so awful we vowed not to waste our money. We are very glad we changed our mind and decided to try one more deluxe resort - we'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: howard2004
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in many years on Disney property. Arrived Friday and left Monday. What a treat. No need to rent a car, with Magical Express and the boat and buses from resort. No fighting parking lines, and sooo easy to leave resorts at end of evening. Never waited more than 15 minutes for buses. Longest wait was checking into Magical Express line to get to park (they could improve this a little). Lodge itself is beautiful as everyone says. Very relaxing, heated pool w/slide and a quiet pool near villas. Food choices good, with ability to take boat over to Contemporary for more food choices on Monorail system. We ate at self-serve for breakfast at lodge. Reasonably priced. This trip we tried the meal plan. I think we did well with it. More food than I would normally eat as it included appetizer and dessert for dinner. Room was average. Towel animals were cute. We had a horrible view of loading dock with trucks backing in and beeping in morning. We were there 3 nights and I was going to complain, but didn't feel like changing rooms after we unpacked. Our room was average on condition and cleanliness. Sink faucets had caked up soap on them and not very clean. Wallpaper peeling in bathroom. But overall fine. Overall value for being at Disney was fine. Definately cheaper to stay outside and rent a car, but for a short trip, we would never have been able to do as much in the parks without being close by and having opportunity for evening magic hours. Would definately go again, but may try Polynesian next time if price is right!

Reviews.Title: “first experience with disney and loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved every minute of our stay at the Wilderness Lodge. From the time we walked in we loved the huge lobby and the beautiful wood carvings everywhere you look. My three girls loved the hotel so much that we came back from the parks at lunch everyday and swam in the pool. The best food value is the self serve restaurant right as you come in from the pool. We ate there for lunch two days. It was great they have things like chicken and french fries, but my girls loved that they could eat a peanut butter and jelly crustable with a mickey mouse rice crispy treat, they were in heaven. Oh and get the Wilderness Lodge cup you can refill it with any beverage as long as your there, it is well worth it. The Whispering Canyon was a nice restuarant, they have a nice waiting area for the kids, it is a big square table fullof Special Wilderness Lodge Lincoln logs to play with. It is a little hectic, if you have had a long day at the parks you might want a more calm restaurant experience. The room was an average hotel room with wonderful cleaning and cute towel designs for the children. We will definetly stay on the grounds of Disney world it is so convienient, didn't drive my car once. Highly recommend Wilderness Lodge you will never forget it. One thing to add by mistake we left some of my husbands clothes in a drawer, so we called and they had them all ready for us when we came back to pick them up.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Deluxe Resort”
Reviews.Author: the3ds
Reviews.Content: As Florida residents, we are lucky to visit Disney every few months. We usually go for weekends and stay in different hotels. This last weekend, we wanted to go to the Epcot Flower & Garden Festival, so we stayed at the Wilderness Lodge. First, let me say that if you have the opportunity to be at Disney for the Flower & Garden Festival, you should not miss it. I don't have a green thumb myself, but I can live vicariously through those who do. The park is filled with beautiful flower towers, floating gardens, character topiaries and gorgeous flower "carpet" designs. It really is a sight to see. The Wilderness Lodge is jaw dropping as soon as it comes into view. I am originally from the Pacific Northwest so I think that log cabin architecture is wonderful. The Lodge itself looks like a huge log cabin with a green tin roof. When we pulled up to the front, a very helpful bellhop opened our car door, invited us into the lodge and whisked us away in the elevator while telling us all about the Lodge. Great customer service. We were lucky enough to stay in the concierge level this time and it was fun to be pampered. The rooms of the lodge are all similar, but the concierge level has a lounge that serves food and beverages pretty much all day. That was a treat. The room itself was fairly small but we never stay in our room anyway. The beds were comfortable, and the drawer and sink space was enough for our things. The best thing about the hotel is the lobby. You can stand in the middle and look straight up, 7 floors. The balconies look down to the main level and it feels like you could sit inside at one of the cozy nooks and watch the snow fall (except it's Florida!). The staff at the Lodge are very friendly and helpful. The pool is amazing, though a little crowded. It was fine for our family, and it wasn't like you were running into people, but if you want a pool to yourself or you really intend to swim, this is not the place for you. We had a sandwich at the Roaring Fork and it was the best sandwich I have had in a long time. My husband had a ham with Tillamook cheese and I had a turkey and brie. They were about 4 inches high! We got to take a boat every day to the parks which was a fun option and at about 9:35 pm, there is a light show on the lake that we could watch from our room. The landscaping on the property is beautiful, with wildflowers and pine trees, plus a river and waterfall that go right through the center. There were even rabbits eating grass on the lawns. I would not have been surprised to see a moose! Overall, this is the best Disney hotel we've stayed in and we will definitely go back. The rooms at the Disney resorts are all pretty much the same (2 beds, a shower, a television), so it's the theming and options that you pay extra for. We have paid extra for a few hotels (savannah view at the AKL, river view at the POR, but this was the only hotel that we didn't feel like what we paid for was totally above what we received). This is a great place to stay and it's the lowest priced resort in the deluxe category. If you have the money to pay for the concierge option, you should do it...it is a fun treat. We usually don't splurge for accomodations when we go on vacation, prefering only the basics (a good bed, a private shower, a place to put our clothes), so we don't go to these hotels with huge expectations. I have read reviews from other readers who play dumb games with the housekeeping staff, leaving something to see if they clean it. There are also those who expect Four Seasons treatment and are upset when Disney doesn't provide it. Disney goes to great lengths to provide a fun, safe place for families to vacation. If you look for something to complain about, you will find it, but I can't imagine why you would bother. If you have a bare-bones budget, you can stay at one of their basic hotels, if you have money to burn, you can stay at the Grand Floridian. For those of us in the middle who just want a good place to stay with a little extra theming and convenience, The Wilderness Lodge is the place for you. Yes, it's expensive if you compare it to hotels outside of the Disney property, but to save a little money, you will have to find your own way to the park, find a place to park, remember that you parked in the Bambi section, and then fight the crowds all the way out of the parks at the end of the day. We took a relaxing boat ride to and from the Lodge whenever we wanted. When we got to our room, there was a towel animal on the bed. When we checked in and out, we were told to "Have a Magical Day". It was money well spent and we would recommend the Lodge to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The lobby is jaw dropping!”
Reviews.Author: DebandJim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge in January in the main lodge. They could charge admission to view the lobby. What a place. From the classic western music playing in the background to the totem poles that reach for the sky. This place is gorgeous. The logs, the theming, everything is incredible. The main pool is beautiful with a slide for the kids winding through rocks. And then there's also a quiet pool over on the Villas side (vacation club) part of the resort if you like it a little more quiet. There's also a mini lobby over at the adjacent Villas at Wilderness Lodge with a workout facility, tables to play board games, and quiet places to sit and rock in the oak rocking chairs. I LOVE this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kgeopd
Reviews.Content: Went there at Easter it was crowded and noisy. Room was in need of painting and small...carpets were worn.Heard toilets flush all nite in addition to people taking showers. In four days could not get a chair by the pool, later found out that people who were staying at Wilderness campground and Disney Vaction resort were using the facilities also. This place was supposed to be top of the line I could have saved money and stayed at Carribean Beach or one of the other moderate hotels. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Fabulous Fun Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Allyabc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February on honeymoon for 9 nights & absolutely loved it! We received a free upgrade on our woods view room to one with a view of the villa pool & the lake, very spacious, comfortable & well equipped & very comfortable bed. Beautiful hotel with amazing theming - a wonderful retreat after the parks, getting off the ferry boat from magic kingdom in the evening and walking back through the grounds & listening to piped cicada noises was a wonderful welcome home. Easy to get links to the monorail also - just get boat next door to contemporary. The pools were superb & very attractively done, the villa pool is quieter. Views of lake & geyser wonderful - would never know you were in busy Orlando. The grounds are stunning as is the lobby area & fire/chimney, also the gorgeous bridge over stream starting in lobby. Whispering canyon a wonderful experience - ate there twice, different both times, staff great fun. Roaring Forks really handy for snacks at all hours. Artist Point nice but pricey and not as much atmosphere as the others. All the food at the hotel was good quality & great value. Staff great, free self parking, transport good but buses to Animal Kingdom & Blizzard Beach a little bit slow but no real gripes as you wait in the sunshine & enjoy a breather. We loved every minute and enjoyed the luxurious surroundings, it was a real escape and magical atmosphere. We can't get used to starting our day without "big country" music now! We'd go back in a flash & would highly recommend the hotel - we looked at quite a few of the others & whilst we were impressed, we were very happy we made the right choice. We were a bit worried about staying on park & at somewhere with heavy theming but it was very tastefully done & worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: suwanee337
Reviews.Content: Spent four wonderful nights at the Lodge. The food was great. The whispering Canyon was an great place for dinner. The staff were great. The hotel is someplace to come back to. Yes, the rooms were on the small size. The plus for our room was that we could see the fireworks each night from our balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: HWlovesmaui
Reviews.Content: We too are Disney vacation veterans - this was our first stay at the Wilderness Lodge and we just loved it. The rooms are comforatable- the beds were fantastic- and a welcome way to relax after a long day on foot at the parks. My husband and I were able to sit out on the balcony and enjoy some quiet conversation after the kids had gone to bed. The double sink vanity and the small in-room refirgerator made our family stay a little easier. The pool was warm, the kids had fun with the slide, and we adults appreciated the two bubbling hot tubs. The grounds and gardens are beautiful. My kids enjoyed the bike and boat rentals, and we enjoyed a quiet walk by the lake. Transportation to the Magic Kingdom was quick via a boat launch. We utilized the buses too, which are efficient to and from this resort. This themed hotel is well done. Although the hotel is large, it is well designed and you don't have to walk for "miles" to get around like at some of the more spread-out and sprawling Disney resorts. We hope to stay here again as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful hotel. Lovely mission style furniture. Mini-fridge in the room. Roaring Fork Snacks - Cafeteria, not bad prices and quick easy access to snacks. Humidity level in the room was just right. Balconies in the rooms. Private sand beach. Laundry facilities on property. Our room was always cleaned by the time we came back for a rest in the late afternoon. Cons: Beds were not that comfortable. Not many channels to choose from on the TV, most of them were Disney channels. Not a great location, you cannot walk to other parks and ammenities. Whispering Canyon Cafe - Restaurant, if you like having your straws and napkins thrown at you, your meal interrupted by children having races around the restaurant on wooden stick horses, a request for ketchup following by the waiter screaming at the top of their lungs and then 20 bottles of ketchup delivered by running children to your table, then this is the restaurant for you, if not the I would suggest to eat elsewhere. Pool was a little small for the size of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite WDW hotel”
Reviews.Author: Readaloud
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many WDW hotels. The Wilderness Lodge is by far our favorite! The rooms, while not huge, are very cozy. We heard little lobby noise from inside our rooms. We were there for 15 days and only stayed five nights at Wilderness Lodge. Everyone in our party kept wishing we would never have left that lovely hotel. It just can't be beat during the Christmas holidays! The pool was kept at a very pleasant temperature even in January! Everything was so clean and nice. I would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of four just returned from a week at the Lodge. We had a great room with bunks and a wooded view of the Magic Kingdom. Everything was exceptional at the lodge. The staff are very nice and helpful. Boat and bus transportation was efficient. Whispering Canyon was fun for the kids and the pin trading area is good. The pool and hot tub were big hits with us and just the overall experience of staying at such a breathtaking place so close to the kingdom made the price worth it for us. I can't imagine returning and not staying there.

Reviews.Title: “A Disney truimph!!”
Reviews.Author: dashadam
Reviews.Content: Disney have really excelled with the Wilderness Lodge and we had a sensational 3-night stay there in March-06. The hotel and grounds are amazingly well designed and the attention to detail is fantastic. The grounds and pool are truely beautiful, with lovely views onto the lake, giving the setting a really relaxing feel. The lobby is amazing to look at and really hits the mark is envoking a genuine lodge feel. While it was little corny, the geyser which erupts every hour was fun and seemed to be a hit with the kids. We had no problems with noise which I've read some people comment on. Our room overlooked the lobby and we had no problems in sleeping and didnt pick up any noise at all. I found the staff at the Wilderness Lodge to be very friendly and helpful. We received a complimentary room upgrade when we checked in (without even asking for it!!). Staff at the store and also the restraunts were also very friendly and were lovely to deal with. The room we stayed in was a little smallish given the hotel's tag as one of Disney's 'deluxe' hotel's (note we also stayed at Pop Century over the course of our stay and we believe our room at Pop Century was bigger than the one we had at Wilderness Lodge), however we were able to see the 'Wishes' fireworks display at the Magic Kingdom from our balcony which was sensational. The room was nicely appointed and housekeeping did a great job each day in cleaning and tidying the room. The hotel has three eating areas: the 'Roaring Forks' snack bar which has take-away style food, 'Whispering Canyon' cafe, and the 'Artist Point' restraunt. Most of the time we ate at the Whispering Canyon which had generally good food at fairly reasonable prices (for Disney!). The Whispering Canyon was great however the staff were sometimes very boistrous in entertaining the guests which at times became a little tiresome. After some (very) long days at the theme parks there were times when we really just wanted to have a quiet dinner and relax, and the rowdy entertainment of the serving staff was sometimes a little unwelcome. From the looks of a few of the other guests I'd say we werent the only ones who felt this way, and I think that the hotel would be well advised to tone it down a bit after say 9pm when most of the people we saw were couples who had popped the kids to bed and were looking for some quiet time... The Wilderness Lodge is very close to the Magic Kingdom, which can be accessed by either boat (our preferred way) or by bus. The Animal Kingdom, Epcot and Disney/MGM studio theme parks are all a little further away however at the most we found the bus trip took no longer than say 15 minutes. Buses run frequently and we waited at most no more than 10-15 minutes for a bus to arrive and usually 5-7 minutes. All the transportation options were really convenient and the drivers very friendly and helpful. On a spare day I took some time out to get away from the theme parks and had a look at some of the other hotels. In my opinion the Wilderness Lodge, the Animal Lodge and the Grand Floridian were the best looking of the hotels I saw.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Disney Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: julie88
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the majority of the Disney Hotels, and a few of the Delux resorts. Wilderness Lodge is my favorite. The themeing of the resort is wonderful, the staff is very accomodating (unlike previous comments). I had nothing but a pleasurable stay. I have also stayed at the Polynesian and not liked it. It is dark in there, even their newly renovated rooms. Also, I found out from staff that begining in the next couple of months they will begin rehabing the rooms--just a minor face lift. The rooms are not in desparate need of this at all. It's just an example of the quality of all of the Disney Properties. I recommend this resort highly. The boat transportation right to the Magic Kindom is excellent. I love to take the different means of transportation for the time I'm there.

Reviews.Title: “Have to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and two daughters just loved the Wilderness Lodge. Please read up on how to work it online because your stay will be much more pleasant. Booked our trip with a regular room but also asked upon arrival if an upgrade was available. So instead of a view of the roof tops for a standard reservation we had an upgrade, first overlooking the villa area, which was very nice but we wanted bunkbeds so they moved us the second day to overlooking the pool area. Beautiful view. All complimentary. Upon arriving asked to be a flag family had a wonderful morning trip to the top of the hotel with fantastic views and the honor of putting up the flags and talking to adorable Ranger Stan. Kids said it was one of the most memorable part of their trip! Had the meal plan so my husband and I one night made reservations at Artist Point and ordered a pizza in room for our daughters and left our 13 year old in charge. We had a incredible dinner and our kids had the time of their lives with dinner and a disney movie in room. We were in the hotel the whole time! Please be sure to make as many dining reservations as possible before you go. You can always cancel if you need to. But even with that said one night we were in Epcot in the rain with no reservation so I called disney dining and told them we were standing in the middle of Epcot and we needed a reservation anywhere to a sit down meal. In 5 minutes we were on our way to the Marakesh Restaurant in Moroco and had a wonderful dinner. My girls still talk about it. The best Lamb dish they ever ate!! We loved the Wilderness Lodge. It was clean,beautiful and the staff was very helpful and polite. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: alisapk
Reviews.Content: Our stay here at the Wilderness Lodge was great. It was our first time at the resort and it couldn't have been nicer! Our room was facing the lobby and got a little loud in the morning but nothing that would keep us from coming back (after all, it is Disney!). We had a room with bunk beds, which made for a little more room. The resort was beautiful and everyone was very friendly. Our mousekeeper was great and very attentive. I would,also, highly recommend either of the restaurants at the resort. Overall, it was a fantastic stay and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge was a beautiful resort. The kids loved the bunk beds but those rooms are on high demand and the resort doesn't have enough of them. They won't let you reserve the room with the bunk bed but they did allow us to change rooms after the first day when one became available. The boat and bus transportation systems worked very well and the boat captains were all very nice. We recommend the Hoop Dee Do dinner/show at the Wilderness campground in the Pioneer Hall. Our boys are ages 8 and 5 and they loved the show and the food. The snack bar/restaurant on the 1st floor of the facility worked out great for simple meals and snacks. Couldn't get in to the hotel restaurants, all booked, so no comment on those. For a nice "secret" spot at the hotel, we would get our breakfast food from the snack bar type of restaurant and take it up to the 4th floor. There is an outside sitting area in the center of the resort (across from the open lobby area) with a few tables and benches and a nice view of the lake. We would definitely go back to the Wilderness.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable fun”
Reviews.Author: danielh5
Reviews.Content: Our second stay was as good as the first. Excellent decorations make for an excellent touch. The food is ordinary and expensive, but not unusual for the Disney resorts. The cafe is great for a quick bite before a long day at the park, and lunch and dinner are acceptable too. The hotel has a huge pool with a water slide, so even when it's never too crowded. The shuttles and ferry to the parks are very convenient. Pros: Beautiful decor and excellent facilities; the scavenger hunt was great for our 4-year old. Cons: The beds are very high, and we've got some welts on our shins from some pointed corners (surprising for a kid-friendly resort). Also, the rooms in the tower which face the main atrium can be noisy at night from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive but not everything I expected”
Reviews.Author: Kayla_K
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Disney in 2 years. Last year I stayed at the Poly and I will say that it is a better hotel. However, the Wilderness Lodge was about $125 less per night this time around, so I thought we'd give it a try. I called ahead with specific room requests based on a tour book. When my husband checked in late one evening he was told we got a room upgrade which sounded good, but the walk to the room was very far. The balcony was too high for my kids (5 and 3) to see over it unless they stood on a chair. The partial lake view was very distant and to the side. We should have asked to move but by the time we unpacked and walked out the balcony it seemed like more trouble than it was worth. As the week went on though the walk to the lobby and pool aggravated me more and more. The room was quiet, smaller than the Poly, but reasonably attractive. The lobby is very nice and the restaurants seem good although we never ate there. My major complaint is the people that work at the Wilderness Lodge. At the poly they greeted us with leis and everyone seemed very nice and went out of there way to say hello. At the Wilderness Lodge they didn't seem as friendly and the concierge at the front desk was especially disappointing. I asked for a print out of my dinner reservations and I noticed the one for a certain day was missing. I inquired about that and was flatly told I don't have any. When I explained I had the reservation number he told me that would help, come back downstairs. Well, I already told you about the walk, so I asked if I could call Disney Dining instead. Well, I did and waited on hold forever (that is sometimes a problem when you call on weekends) so frustrated I called the front desk. I explained the concierge told me he could help with the reservation # and to connect me, but instead I got an attitude. The person told me they can't help and I should call Disney Dining, which I explained had already put me on hold forever. A couple other times I called concierge. One time in response to a message asking if I got everything I needed from my visit to their desk. When I tried to call then, and another time, I felt like I was getting the 3rd degree trying to explain why I should speak to concierge when I wasn't on a concierge level. I think they didn't understand I wanted the front desk concierge and not the "special service" but who feels like explaining yourself this much? Throughout the stay, I felt I was getting Holiday Inn service and not Disney, and my husband said he felt the same way during his conversations. I think the attractiveness of the lobby, the convenience of the boat to MK, and the pool all make this place worth considering. But, carefully study the map of the complex before agreeing to check in and try to check in early. That way, if you have a distant room closer ones are available. Also make sure you ask for a balcony you can see through, like the ones overlooking the pool. If the Poly and Wilderness are relatively close in price go to the Poly.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: SleepSeekingMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness for the first half of our Disney vacation early February 2006. It was wonderful all around! The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. The property feels brand new. We got a room with a bunk bed, but not a good view. We were on the fifth floor and I'm not sure what we were looking at from our balcony. But the bunk bed thrill for our kids was worth the poor view. The transportation to and from the theme parks was amazingly efficient. Almost every time we went out for the bus or boat, one pulled within a minute! We took the Disney dining plan and LOVED it! I'm a bargain hunter and found the plan to be a great deal and lots of fun because we could choose wherever we wanted to eat and enjoy without thinking about the budget! It was hard to leave and go to a non-Disney condo property. I missed the magic of Disney that you feel every minute when staying on the grounds!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Vacation”
Reviews.Author: haneya
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous disney vacation in November with a group of 14 people (ages 18months to 68). I have been to disney more than 20 times and this was one of my favorite resorts. The lobby was magnificent and the service was great. The ferry to the magic kingdom was wonderful. The rooms are in no way large but you can request bunk beds for the kids which was a big hit and the maid left notes and animals made of towels for the kids too. You can see the water light show from the beach of the hotel which was neat. The kids loved to pool and it had a fun water slide. The whispering canyon restaurant had an amazing all you can eat dinner of ribs, chicken, corn on the cob etc and the atmosphere was so sun. All in all, I would say this hotel is just as good if not better than most of the other deluxe hotels (grand floridian excluded of course). I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of electric water parade”
Reviews.Author: doyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lodge January 27 thru February 4th. We checked in with no problem but when we got to our room it smelled like an ashtray. We also were put on the 6th floor with a balcony that you could not see out of unless you stood up and no bunk beds which we requested. I went down to the front desk and they took care of our problem right away. We were put on the 5th floor with bunk beds and a great view of the pool and electric water parade. Our kids loved the hotel and had a great time. The housekeeping was great as they did tricks with our kids stuffed animals. One day we came back and the animals were hanging down the bunk beds tied to sheets it was really cute and the kids loved it. If you stay at this hotel like we did just make sure you ask for a room with a view as the first room we had the balcony you could not see over. The staff was very friendly and we were lucky enough to be the flag family which took us to the top of the roof with a very nice gentleman named Stan. He talked to our kids and they had a great time raising the flags and saying the Pledge of Allegiance. The view was wonderful from the roof and we took many wonderful pictures. This was a wonderful vacation and we are planning to come back in two years. We probably will not stay at the Wilderness Lodge only because this is our second visit and we would like to try the Polynesian which we stayed at on our honeymoon many many years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Lily223
Reviews.Content: My family visited Disney World Jan. 22-27. We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge with our 6 and 7 years olds. We loved it. The hotel is beautifully decorated and very clean. Check in was a breeze and they upgraded us without us asking them to. The hotel pool was very warm, has a water slide and is very well supervised with lifeguards constantly on "patrol". It is definitely a nice touch that the Lodge has boat service to the Magic Kingdom, Contemporary and Ft. Wilderness. The Roaring Forks Cafe located in the hotel had great food and not too expensive (but really, can we even talk about money - it's disney world!!). Everything in the hotel is relatively close together so not too much walking after a long day at the parks. My only complaint was that the beds were very uncomfortable - but my husband and I have a hard time sleeping anywhere. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Puts you in the Disney Spirit”
Reviews.Author: loloa312
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here at the wilderness lodge, they had plenty of food options, the pool was fantastic. The rooms were fun and nicely sized. Even compared to some of the other Disney resorts, I think this is one of the more fun ones. We spent the majority of our time, (when not in the parks) at the pool. great choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free upgrades, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mich1073
Reviews.Content: Wonderful value for FL residents, since we went during the FL special rates and only paid around 100 a night for 5 days. We were upgraded to the top floor which gave free food, wine, beer, and flat panel plasma tvs to watch on that floor. Even had games and other kids toys. It was a great value and the free upgrade was WONDERFUL! Even saved quite a bit of money due to all the free food and drinks that were given to us. Disney knows how to treat people. Super nice pools and food was good but slightly overpriced. We went off property to eat most of the time anyway.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Wilderness Lodge on January 15-22,2006. Our whole experience with Disney and the Lodge was very positive. We had an early flight and used the Magical Express to take us to the hotel. We were on a bus and pulling out of the airport within 15 minutes. When we arrived at the Lodge, I couldn't believe my eyes! I had looked at all the pictures of the Lodge beforehand, but they just don't do the lobby justice. It was breathtaking. We had to wait in line for about 5-10 minutes to get checked-in. We asked when we checked in for a room with bunk beds. Not only were they able to accomadate our request, they also had a room available right away. We were very surprised since it was 10:30 in the morning! Our room was on the 4th floor all the way in the back. We had a great view of the pool as well as the lake. The room was a little small, but for our needs, it was perfect. Within an hour of getting to our room, our luggage had arrived. The beds and furniture were comfortable. They do provide plenty of pillows and extra blankets. Our housekeeper did an excellent job everyday. She left towel creatures for the kids on two different occasions. My only complaint about the room is that whenever someone flushed a toilet in a room above us, we could hear it. That can be a little annoying when you are trying to get to sleep! We were very pleased with the transportation that was provided by Disney. The boats were great and we never waited more than 10 minutes for a boat. However, if you are going to any of the parks other than the MK, your best bet is to take a bus. We tried taking the boat one day to the Contemporary and then getting the Monarail to Epcot. It was a long process, about 40 minutes. The bus only took 15-20 to get to Epcot. We did eat breakfast in the Whispering Canyon several times. The breakfast skillet is wonderful! I am still craving the biscuits and gravy! We did pack cereal bars and snacks that we could eat in the room. This really helped with the cost of food. The Roaring Forks was being refurshibed when we were there. They did have a small selection of items. We would definitely stay at the Wilderness Lodge again. Everything met and exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty setting”
Reviews.Author: hal9341
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Wilderness Lodge. This hotel was not quite up to my expectations. Having billed itself as a 5-star luxury hotel I was expecting a nicer room, and better eating facilities. I realise that this is Disney, and it's catering primarily to families, but for the prices I had hoped for more. For instance the room was basically the same as what I've seen in other less pricey Disney resorts. The breakfast in the Whispering Canyon Cafe was passable, but really nothing special. The staff are all "in character" and shout a lot. If you ask for ketchup they holler it out and then every bottle in the restaurant, literally arrives at your table. This might be fun if your 8 years old, but as two adults trying to enjoy some romance we could have done without it. On the plus side it does have a good pool area, and the lobby is fantastic. I guess if you have small kids, and a lot of money this is a good choice, but otherwise I'd say stay in a cheaper Disney hotel. If you're a couple I'd say perhaps opt for a non-disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Wilderness Lodge Tips”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Wilderness Lodge a handful of times, each time, an absolutely wonderful experience. The atmosphere- perfect for those who love rustic/comfortable/cozy places. The resort itself- GORGEOUS. The cast members I met, outstanding, especially at the front desk, restaurants, and Mercantile, all very friendly and helpful. The rooms are on the smaller side, but seriously, how much time will you be spending in the room? There are boat rentals, bike/walking/running paths, itâ€™s situated by Fort Wilderness (several ways to entertain yourself over there), a great pool and pool barâ€¦ oh, and there are those Walt Disney World parks located close byâ€¦ No, thereâ€™s no monorail stop that will get you to the Magic Kingdom here, but, there is a boat and bus that will take you to it. There is also a bussing system that will get you to the remaining theme parks, water parks, and Down Town Disney. Restaurants, great (especially Whispering Canyon. If you fear being in the spot light, do NOT go here. But itâ€™s a GREAT time. Artist Point, delicious and elegant). So, I thought it was time that I pass a long the things Iâ€™ve learned. Â· There are TWO courtyards at the Wilderness Lodge, main pool courtyard and villa view courtyard. Make sure you are aware of this if you book a court yard view because you could get either. Both are nice, I would recommend REQUESTING a higher floorâ€¦ Do not be upset if you go to your room and it is a view not of the main pool, but itâ€™s a first floor villa view. This is still considered court yard. Â· Disney Magical Expressâ€¦ sometimes, not so magicalâ€¦ I recommend taking the shuttle service, but if arriving in the evening, grab your luggage at the airport on your way to the hotel. Wait time for your luggage as of now, 2-3 hours, give or take. During the day, who cares, let someone else get it to your roomâ€¦ but if youâ€™re coming in late, very inconvenient. If you donâ€™t grab your luggage, make sure you have a separate bag to take to the hotel with PJâ€™s, toiletries, medications, and what not. Other than that, this is a great service to get you and your luggage to and from the airport and hotel. Â· Bunk Bedsâ€¦ ok, you request bunk beds, you check inâ€¦ and you donâ€™t have a room with bunk bedsâ€¦ Itâ€™s happened to me once. All I can recommend, donâ€™t tell the kids about the bunk beds. If your request is met at check in, let this remain a surprise. Â· Connecting vs. Adjoining Rooms: If you make a request for either room type make sure you understand the difference, connecting rooms are the rooms with the door in between, adjoining rooms mean that there is no door in between, but the rooms are next to each other. Â· Dining Reservations: If you make dining reservations at other resorts or theme parks give yourself lots of time to get there if you are depending on Disney transportation, at least 45 minutes to an hour. No resort buses go directly to another resort, so you will have to catch a connecting bus at one of the parks or Down Town Disney to get to another Disney resort. Â· Disney Dining Plan: Itâ€™s GREATâ€¦ if you like lots of food. The plan is based on a coupon type system connected to your reservation which includes one snack, one counter service, and one table service per day (more expensive places will cost you two of your coupons, but, itâ€™s worth it if you look at the receipts).
