This plan goes by how many nights you will be staying at the resort. Very, very good. Ok, in conclusion, I believe the most important thing Iâ€™ve learned while staying at WDW resorts: NOTHING IS GURANTEED. Even though you may say it a billion times when making reservations, it is NOT GUARANTEED (bed types, smoking/non, connecting, adjoining, floor, anything, NOT GUARANTEED. Unless it is something for medical purposes, just make this obvious when making reservation). However, still make the requests for the room you want and they will do their best to meet those requests with what is available. Trust meâ€¦ Iâ€™ve learned from experience. Once all of this stuff is out of the way, donâ€™t worry about itâ€¦ youâ€™re going to have an absolutely wonderful time eating and playing in the parksâ€¦ like I said, AMAZING resortâ€¦ I will always, always return to the Wilderness Lodge. Hope this has been helpful :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service, relaxing resort!”
Reviews.Author: tripbuddy123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just a few days, but we were welcomed warmly and treated respectfully throughout our stay. Our room was quiet, even though it was located several floors above a busy, loud restaurant. The balcony was a peaceful place to unwind and drink a cup of coffee. Our mousekeeper did a great job in the little time she was in our room. Can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sad to Say....”
Reviews.Author: grumpymakesmehappy
Reviews.Content: Let me first say, I love the Wilderness Lodge. It is a very warm and inviting hotel. It is truly beautiful. We have stayed at the Lodge before and never had a bad word to say about it. However, after this visit, I have a few complaints. Our housekeeping was horrible. I'm sorry I have to put it that way but there's no way around it. Our maid refused to clean our room. Our sink was never cleaned. Our sheets were not changed daily. The trash was not picked up off our floor and our room was not even remotely straightened. I was also less than impressed with our room location. We payed for a courtyard view and even though we got it to some extent, we had a first floor room that looked at a side walk and trees. I wish I would have simply booked a woods view at a cheaper rate. Like I stated earlier, we have stayed here before and always booked courtyard view. I was really let down by our service this time and have decided not to book the Lodge anymore. I think it's time to move on.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: nolan1951
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Wilderness Lodge. We checked-in on Sunday, Dec. 18 and checked-out on Sunday, Dec. 25, 2005. The Christmas Season made our stay even more spectacular with the TAKE YOUR BREATH AWAY Christmas tree that makes you look straight up to the 6th floor as you enter. We upgraded to the Concierge level and were a little dissapointed with the food & drink offerings (compared to the Animal Kingdom Lodge & the Polynesian), but the price was much less than the other two resorts for the concierge service. The Concierge Lounge is locked down in the afternoon and at night, making it impossible to get coffee or anything else during the lock down. The offerings are much less extensive, but the Concierge Staff more than made up for the lack of offerings. In particular, Jeff, one of the Concierge Cast Members went out of his way to make our stay memorable. He even got us dinner reservations at the "Flying Fish" for Christmas Eve, with only 24 hrs. notice. All in all we loved the resort. Our room, faced the pool and the geyser as well as a view of the lake. The room was beatifully decorated with a very woodsy feel. Housekeeping did an excellent job, even leaving us towel animals each day. Great resort feel at a great price, especially for a Deluxe Resort. An added benefit, was the boat transportation to the Magic Kingdom, which was a nice change from taking the bus every day. Try it, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynpotter
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice resort. Very family friendly. The fireplace in the lobby is a relaxing place to sit. Just about everything was great! The only problem is transportation to anywhere but Magic Kindom takes a while. It is well worth the $$

Reviews.Title: “Wolf in sheeps clothing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked the wilderness lodge back in May, two rooms one king and one double.....Had been before and stayed in the villas, always great...good standard of accom. Arrived late on the 16th of December to be told that rooms were not ready, not king and not double. When I asked why having booked so long ago I was told that there were no guarantees relating to the type of room and also that my rate band (the lowest) had very little muscle attached to it so there was no likelyhood of upgrade or alternative. To be frank I was disgusted....the rate I assumed was low due to the early booking....and no mention of the "no guarantee" policy was made at the time of booking . This is a "deluxe" resort and as such you would expect clear and fast rules on booking and accommodation types. Our jetlagged red eyes and twitchy appearance did bring a sort of solution, we were told that another room combination (double and King) had been found...however the king was a ground floor disabled room...but the rooms were a superior "courtyard" view... It was late so we settled for that arrangement. The ground floor turned ut to be below the lobby level, the courtyard view was of a path leading from the villas to the pool and the disabled bathroom was little more that a tiled space with a plastic seat and a hose!. This implies no disrespect to those who need the facility, but it fell far short of the deluxe tag we were sold. In fact the rooms were of a standard close to the Eurodisney Cheyenne which is distinctly 3 star! The public areas in this resort are indeed magnificent, but the rooms are no better than any 3 star place in the orlando area so if its deluxe you are looking for try the Ritz Carlton....of for value at the price try the Suites at the caribe Royale...we moved there after one night and were highly satisfied. Review posted in the Caribe Royale listing.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for the first time the first week of December. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. It is truly a magnificent place. We had booked two standard rooms but were upgraded to two Woods view rooms on the 6th floor. We had a terrific view of the lake and the beautiful grounds below. The hotel employees were exceptional as was the housekeeping staff. The guest rooms are spotless. The beds were the most comforatable queen size beds that I have ever slept in in any hotel as were the pillows. All linens were sparkling clean. The housekeepers made us little animals out of washcloths complete with eyes, nose and tails and left them on our beds.We always were given plenty of fresh towels. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful. The atmosphere is very serene so it is a nice place to return after a day of park hopping. We ate at Roaring forks every morning for breakfast. It is a counter service restaurant but they manage to pack so much food into a small place that there is a wide variety for everyone. Artist Point is absolutely superb for fine dining. Try the frisee salad and the salmon. The pool area is beautiful --- you will find a duck or two swimming with you from time to time. We saw rabbits on the grounds and even an eagle flying overhead. The hot tubs are great. The only disappointment was that Silver Creek Falls were being repaired so the water falls were not runnng and the creek that runs through the lobby was not filled with water. The bus service was excellent. We never waited longer than 5 minutes for a bus from our hotel or from the parks for that matter. The Mercantile gift shop is great--they sell very nice merchandise and they also sell food and toiletries. There is a nice game room for the kids. They do have laundry facilities with 6 or 8 washers and 10 or so dryers. The change machine and soap machine is right there too. The best thing about this hotel is that everything is conveniently located. We went from 6th floor to the lobby (elevators ran extemely fast) and everything we needed was right there. Unlike some of the moderate resorts we have stayed in like Port Orleans and Carribean beach where we had to walk to many different buildings to buy food or find a bus stop. There is also boat service to Magic Kingdom. We went over to the Yachtclub for dinner at the Yachtsman Steakhouse (which was also superb!!!) but I wasn't very impressed with the Yachtclub. It's lobby was so small and the hotel just seemed stuffy. I did not get the feeling I got when I walked into the lobby of the Wilderness Lodge. I would highly recommend this hotel and I will certainly stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Disney's Wilderness Lodge 4 times and I absolutely love it. The lobby is amazing with a giant fire place. The grounds having running streams and a lot of great places to take pictures. The restaurants have great food. The cafe is perfect in the mornings and if you get their traveler mug you can fill it for free. I've used mine all 4 times. The pool is one of the best with a festive water slide and a gentle stream emptying into one side. They have two hot tubs not to mention a seperate pool for those staying in a villa. I would recommend this hotel to everyone but especially people traveling with families. Kids and teens will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed with WL”
Reviews.Author: sightseeing 63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day/4 night stay at WL. We were very excited about our stay at this hotel. We had heard many good things. Well... when we checked in at the front desk, we were told they were completely booked. I had booked our vacation through a travel agent(one who only does Disney travel.) The CM told us at check-in that there were no special room requests assoc.with our reservation. I had specfically told our TA (twice) our room requests. This was not the hotel's fault, I realize. The only thing they had available was the first floor. My 4 year old called it the "dungeon." It is below the lobby! We could have up graded to conceirge for another $105 a night(they had one room available.) We had orignally paid for a courtyard view. We (according to the CM) were given a LAKE view in room 1168. It did look out to the LAKE (somewhere), however, you had to look through the 6 ft. tall bushes and over the soild wall on the patio to see what looked like it might be a LAKE. We didn't even go out on our patio. It was ridiculous to even call it a LAKE view. I wish I had brought my hedge clippers, so I could have really seen the LAKE. The beds were very worn and everything was very dingy. The lobby was nice and food at the Whispering Canyon Cafe was good.We will not stay here again but only possibly to visit the Cafe again. This hotel is not worth the money. We were not impressed!!!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED the LODGE”
Reviews.Author: Happycamper794
Reviews.Content: Incredible... My boyfriend and I visited the lodge on November 27th - 29th, 2005 and we will never stay anywhere else when we go to Disney. The staff was fantastic, check-in was incredibly fast - we were able to arrange for ticket pick-up at the Magic Kingdom - as our room wasn't ready yet (we were VERY early). Room was a great size, we had a room with two queens I believe - the mattresses were great, room very clean and an AMAZING VIEW! We had room 6125 - you can see the water pageant at night, geyser go off during the day and it was so high up it was very quiet. Transportation was great - boats were very convenient (and fun too) & we never waited longer than 5-10 minutes for a bus (the bus port is very easy to get to from anywhere in the lodge) We made dinner arrangements at the California Grill at the Contemporary Resort & found out that there is a boat that goes directly to the Contemporary from the Lodge! (The California Grill is wonderful by the way - book late in the evening so you can see the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom) We loved the Roaring Forks Cafe - it's very reasonable, and a great place to stop and grab grub for breakfast and lunch (we would grab breakfast and eat it while we were waiting for the bus or boat - so convenient) Long story short - it was wonderful, we loved it and will return many many times

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a wonderful vacation at The Wilderness Lodge.The staff at check in were very nice, although we did not get the bunk beds we asked for. They did arrange for us to switch rooms the following day. The lobby is beautiful and the Lodge itself has a easy layout to get around. We had a room on the first floor and it was very nice for our children to be able watch the ducks and bunnies right outside the patio in the morning!! It was also great to be near the Roaring Forks Cafe for easy access to our morning coffee!! The Pool was also terrific,great toddler pool as well. It was also nice to have the swim vests available there as well. We loved the Whispering Canyon!! We went with our children who loved it and also went back just the two of us and they were able to give us a nice quiet table closer to Artist Point. Call Ahead for Reservations!!

Reviews.Title: “Not alot for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Villas at Wilderness Lodge (these are in buildings adjacent to the lodge and have the benefit of kitchenettes). The Hotel itself is beautiful, centered around a magnificent lobby, and the grounds are nice. However, the rooms are not "deluxe" -- the mattress was so-so and housekeeping completely failed to clean up the room on the second day. Plus the hotel was absolutely full so it was not as easy as I expected to get the attention of key staff, like the consierge. On a positive note, we loved the restaurants. We ate at the higher end Artist Pointe and the Whispering Canyon cafe. The cafe, in particular, was great for kids and had excellent barbecue. But remember to book way ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Fifth Time -- still a magical place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge is a beautiful place. We have stayed here five times since 1996, three times in the Villas and twice in the Hotel and we have LOVED every experience. It is loud? Yes -- Whispering Canyon makes the Lobby loud and the night we ate there we had no less than 10 birthdays, which drastically slowed down service. However, you are paying for the ambience! We ate at Artist Pointe and it was WONDERFUL! FANTASTIC! Yes, it is expensive, but it is a four diamond, top-of-the-line restaurant. For those that complain abou the hotel not being on the Monorail - that is the whole point -- to be in the Wilderness. For those who complain about the cost of the food -- Disney does provide MANY different restaurants to choose from . . Don't stay at a Deluxe Resort and expect Value prices. We have stayed at the Animal Kingdom, eaten at the Boardwalk, Yacht Club and Contemporary. Although each is beautiful and wonderful in their own way, the Wilderness Lodge will always be our home.

Reviews.Title: “"Beautifully themed"”
Reviews.Author: classiccatgal
Reviews.Content: We returned from a five-night stay at the wilderness lodge 3 weeks ago. We have also stayed at the yacht club, beach club and polynesian. The yellowstone nat'l park theming is awesome(so detailed everywhere you look). The refillable mugs were great as were the restaurants. Artist point was very good-the portabella soup was the best! Roaring Fork cafe had pretty good food for a quick bite and Whispering Canyon cafe has good food, but don't go there expecting a quiet, peaceful meal. We rented a pontoon boat and a surrey bike at the Teton boat and bike rental-both were fun and enjoyable. Also saw the guyser go off. We thought that was really cool. Never got in the pool, but thought it looked kind of small, but any pool looks small compared to stormalong bay at the yacht and beach club. The bus system was very effecient while we were there. The only negative thing we didn't care for was the boat launch to Magic Kingdom-we thought it was pretty slow and on top of that it goes to Fort Wilderness first. But on the way back from Magic Kingdom we got dropped off first, which was better. All in all a very nice resort wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, but are trying to stay at a different resort on each trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with some mishaps”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct.29-Nov.4,2005. This was our first trip to WDW with our 4 yr old. After an exhausting trip, upon arrival, our luggage arrived about 3 hrs later (thru Disney's Magical Express). Our most important piece of luggage arrived 7 hours later (around 1:30AM!!!) The management was apologetic, though and offered to buy our daughter pajamas to use that night. Our room was a bit cramped, facing the pool area, which was noisy at night (pool was open daily till midnight). Toiletries were scarce, towels weren't the luxurious kind. We expected a bit more for the price of the room. Staff was friendly, but this was inconsistent. Some were indifferent. The boat to Magic Kingdom was convenient, but the hotel was not part of the monorail system. Buses were adequate. The food at the restaurants weren't especially good. The hotel itself has a good theme. We'd rather try other places next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Introduction to WDW.”
Reviews.Author: exec1107
Reviews.Content: Stayed w/my family (wife and 4-yr-old son) from Nov 1 - Nov 6 2005. A very enjoyable experience. Hotel lobby is truly remarkable - like an old Western lodge. Requested a room with bunk bed. My son would rank "sleeping in the high bed" right up there with the Buzz Lightyear ride at Magic Kingdom. Pool was made to look like a mountain spring-fed pool. It has a small water slide just right for kids under 10. Room was a bit small, but comfortable. Lodge staff was generally eager to please and helpful. I got the feeling that a few of the registration desk folk were new and not too with it. [When I asked about my room after check in time, I was told it was not ready. I asked "Is there NO room with the amentities I requested that's ready? It's after 3:00 PM". "Yes", the clerk said, "but they are assigned to guests who are checking in later today." "I am a guest who would like to check in NOW." Then the light went on, and we got our room.] Did not eat at the Wispering Canyon, but the Artist Point restaurant was quite good, though pricy. Very convenient to Magic Kingdom by boat (takes 20 minutes), but more peaceful/scenic than the bus. Lots of children. Would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT be back to the Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Tr0picalTraveler
Reviews.Content: This resort is advertised as a Deluxe Resort. I have been to many of the Deluxe Resorts at WDW and this should not be in that category. I was totally expecting to love it with all the great reviews but it was a bad choice. I love the idea of the theme and the lobby was great but the service was poor at best. The Whispering Canyon was bad food but sort of a fun atmosphere until they started to embarrass me and my family to get laughs from other customers. The pool was small and not as fun as other resorts we had been to. It has been a long time since I have been in a room that was that small and the noise from the lobby never seemed to stop. They say how nice it is to be close to the Magic Kingdom but talk about waiting forever for a boat and the boat ride itself took quite a while. I got so sick of that boat and my kid asked if we had to go on the boat again!!! Also the warm cozy feel of the place (that it does well) was a bad mix with the warm humid weather of Florida. Who the heck wants to come out of the heat to a fire in a fireplace? Next time I am staying at a real Deluxe at a monorail resort. I read so many reviews about the resorts and there always seem to be so many fans of the Wilderness Lodge. I think it is one of the most overrated places in WDW. I wish I could have had a better report for this resort but I have to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Wilderness Lodge, and again our stay was wonderful. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, and this time we were upgraded to courtyard view for no additional charge. Our window overlooked the stream leading to the pool and we could see the Electrical Water Parade from the balcony. The food was wonderful, we ate at Whispering Canyon twice and everything was delicious. Maid service was excellent, bell services were very prompt. There is nothing I can think of that wasn't top notch about the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Michigan Mom of three
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our three children (ages 5,6 and 8) just returned from a 4 night stay at the Wilderness Lodge. The lobby is really beautiful. Our kids were in awe when we walked in---everything is quite mammoth in size. We had a big problem with our reservation---not the room part--but our 3 day park hopper tickets seemed to be missing in action. I was going to write a long missive on all the steps we had to go through to solve our problem but let me sum it up by saying no one at the resort went out of their way to help us. Our problem was finally solved when we contacted a guest relations "expert" at the general Disney reservations number. We had connecting rooms which were clean and on the small side (but I was already expecting that from reading previous reviews). The rooms didn't seem particularily dark like I had read before, but the hallways sure were. It's like walking along the hallways of a dungeon! The housekeeping staff was great! My kids really looked forward to the "towel creations" they left for us every day. The transportation to the MK via the boat was fun. You can see the Electric Water Pageant at night from the boat dock. As far as the restaurants go: Roaring Forks is a good, quick spot to grab something to eat. Yes, it's kind of expensive for the food that you get but we appreciated the quick dining---especially at breakfast. We also went to Whispering Canyon for lunch and while my husband and I enjoyed our food, our kids certainly did not like eating here. They couldn't understand why the waitress kept yelling, threw their straws at them and tried to take their sweaters. We kept saying, "It's like a show--it's just a joke" but everyday after that they kept asking "We don't have to go back there again, do we?" We also ate at Artist's Point for dinner which again was quite pricey but the food quality was superb and the atmosphere was quiet but not stuffy---the kids enjoyed their meals there, too. Just some extra things that we did that you may want to consider: I took my two daughters to the My Disney Girl Princess Tea at the Grand Floridian---it was just truly wonderful! Very expensive---prepare for a sticker shock---but it was the ultimate Disney Princess experience----everything about it was top-notch. We also happened to stumble upon a great way to see the Fantasmic show at MGM. We called Disney dining reservations looking for somewhere to eat at MGM and the agent suggested eating at Hollywood and Vine using the "voucher package". Basically, you end up eating at a weird time (our lunch/dinner was at 3:30 p.m.) and then the restaurant gives you a voucher that you use to get into a special entrance to see Fantasmic. We arrived about 45 minutes before the show started and we sat five rows from the front. We eliminated getting to the outdoor auditorium 1 1/2 to 2 hours early (as the guide books suggest to get a seat) and we ended up with really great seats in addition. Aside from the problems we had with our tickets, the resort is very nice. Generally, everyone was quite friendly. We hope to go to Disney World again in the next year and we would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the second part of our honeymoon at the Wilderness Lodge and loved it! We had booked in for 5 night in the honeymoon suite which was the only disappointing part of the trip - it is small, looks over the parking lot and is situated right next to the restaurant on the 7th flr concierge level. Not so much fun that first morning. (We had spent a few nights here the year before and had a better (and cheaper) room on a lower floor overlooking the courtyard / pool area -if you can, go for this option). We spoke to concierge that morning (Jack helped us out - that guy is a star) and subsequently moved our bags to a storage room pending a guests departure from our new room, and off we went to Epcot. About 5 mins later whilst waiting for the bus to arrive an out-of-breath Jack appeared at the bus stop to tell us he wangled it so that we had the Presedential Suite for our stay! We were bolwed over at the service we received - it was perfect timing, honeymoon and all. The hotel itself is gorgeous (and i've stayed at many hotels over the years) - not dated like I read in a previous review. If this were a review on the Polynesian then I would agree, but the appearance and repair of the Lodge is A+. It is v.close to the Magic Kingdom (handy boat transport from teh hotels dock) and a bus trip to to other parks. Staff are great all around and helpful as usual - even helping us to locate the 'hidden mickeys' in the hotel! We found that the folks in concierge couldn't do enough for us. The cleaning ladies left us little 'towel animals' every night without fail and always left the room spotless with nice minty chocs on the pillow :-D Food? The all you can eat buffet is spot on in the hotels restaurant, but not as good as that in the Polynesian's 'Ohana' restaurant, where you can eat great food and if timed right, go enjoy the fireworks from the hotels beach area whilst sipping on a 'zombie' or 'backscratcher' etc. The proximity of both hotels to each other means you are better taking a $5 cab ride home instead of wrestling with the masses on the way back from the MK post fireworks display.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been alot better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 16 year old son and a friend the same age, and I stayed 7 nights at the Wilderness Lodge in June. We arrived late at night and were very tired. Checking in was somewhat slow considering we were the only ones there at that time. Our room was on the sixth floor, which was great, but it was a very LONG walk from the elevator everytime we went out and back. The hotel main floor is beautiful and the corridors are nicely decorated, but the room was very disappointing! Granted you don't expect to spend alot of time in your room at Disney, but it was very crowded with just four of us in there. The bathroom was very small and dark, and the sink area was done in black so it also was very dark and small. Everything looked very dated and worn. The balcony had a nice view, but was also very small, and you had to stand to see off of it. The pool area was beautiful, but very small, crowded, and obviously designed just for small children, so we used the pool at the Villas which was another longer walk, very plain, plus there is no amenities there for food or drinks! The Whispering Canyon Restaurant was "cute" the first couple of times you were there, but then got on our nerves that you couldn't enjoy your meal without wondering when you were going to be singled out by the wait staff to be made a spectacle of in front of everyone. Early mornings or after a long day out is not the time to be harrassed by waiters who want to poke fun at customers. Didn't like that at all!!! Not a good variety of food either. Roaring Falls offered food that was just ok, and it was crowded, dark, and expensive for burger-type food or cold cereal. The best deal there was the refillable mugs! The travel to the Magice Kingdom, etc. was convienent. We never had to wait very long for a bus, and the boat rides were timely and relaxing. We had to find out from someone at the pool about getting the special passes for the two teens to stay at the MK after hours. This was the best $12 apiece we spent on the trip! They loved it! The park at night is pretty neat and they got to ride the best rides without waiting in long lines!! Really good deal!! Overall we weren't very impressed with the hotel other than it really is a beautiful place to look at. Because we had two teens, we really wished that the pool area was larger and more fun for them. They definately need to do something different with the food situation and update the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “wilderness lodge fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 day vacation with my wife at the wilderness lodge in disney September 17-23. I have never written a hotel review but after spending 6 days here i needed to. This resort was beautiful from the first step into the hotel i was taken back. We arrived at 11:00 and our room wasnt ready yet so we went right to our first park on our return about 6:00 we were given our room key and our bags were already in our room. Room on a scale from 1-10 was a 7 not very big at all we had a king bed non smoking room on the 1st floor which is actually below the main floor. Our room was on the outside facing the disney vacation club which was nice and quiet away from the pool which is in the middle of the hotel. The service was fantastic all over the hotel from the bar to the restaurant to the front desk. I did read negative comments about the buses and ill tell you we never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus or a boat the entire trip. I became sick while i was in disney and i called the front desk who sent a van to take me to a doctor and to pharmacy that was great what service. I will be returning to disney every year and i will be staying at the lodge again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Place to Pretend....”
Reviews.Author: ohfortuna
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. The lobby and atrium are amazing - I have never been to any of the national Park Lodges - but found it easy to pretend I was in one. Disney dots the i's and crosses the t's. The rooms are on the small side but well appointed. We have also stayed at the Contemporary and the Polynesian - This the best "immagineered" of the three. Rent the water sprites on property and zip over to the Seven Seas Lagoon at the Magic Kingdom - Lots of Fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Setting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Wilderness Lodge! It had the out-of-this-world setting we were looking for, and we were pleasantly surprised by the room we were given. Without a call-ahead, we were given a room on the sixth floor with a pool view off of the balcony, and as far away from the lobby as you could ask for. I was a little worried that I had not called ahead, because of some previous reviews (i.e. Whispering Canyon Cafe's noise levels) but it was not a problem, because the restaurant was muted at best...we only heard it as we passed through the lobby. I guess if you are in a room adjacent to the lobby it could be an issue. The room was also large and clean, and the mini-fridge was delivered promptly with a quick call to housekeeping. Now only one complaint...housekeeping. We left a nice tip on our first and second days in hopes of receiving the famed "little creatures made out of handtowels" and got nada. Very disappointed about that, but otherwise, housekeeping was very conscientious of our "do not disturb" sign when it was up, amd even left a message telling us to call for a special cleaning if needed when we were ready. Nice. Another favorite part of the Wilderness Lodge was the boat ride over to the Magic Kingdom or the Contemporary (depends on where you are going). It was very relaxing and a great touch. The kids loved it too. I definitely would stay at the Wilderness Lodge again. It was not crowded (though we DID stay in the off season 10/1-10/6) and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lodge in Feb, 2005. We've been visiting the WDW resort consecutively for the last 4 years and tried different resorts. The one thing that stands out of this hotel is that it's a HOTEL. Not a MOTEL. We've stayed at the Caribbean Beach and didn't like the walk to the main building just to get beverages, or go to the pool. At the Wilderness Lodge you are staying in a hotel. You take the elevator up & down to your room. The grounds are beautiful! We had a woods view room with a balcony which was very refreshing after a long day in the park. In the evening we could see the Castle from our room along with the fireworks which my daughter loved. As far as tranportation we had no problems. There is the boat launch that can take you to the Magic Kingdom which is very relaxing and I believe the boats come every 20 minutes. There are buses that take you to Epcot, MGM and Downtown. Its not a far walk to the boat or to the buses. Dining is great as well, especially for kids you have to visit the Whispering Canyon. The staff interacts with the kids which is quite amusing. My daughter really enjoyed it, its not over priced probably average. Artist point is more pricey and there is also a cafe for fast food. Cleanliness: Our room was clean, no complaints whatsover. Activites: Plenty of things to do. Boat rentals, bike rentals, arcade, walking trails, etc. We rented a bike and rode to the Ft. Wilderness Campground. We also rented a boat. I would most definately recommend staying in this hotel especially if you want everything under one roof and not have to leave your "motel room" to go to the main building for something to eat. The other resorts are nice but don't compare to the Wilderness Lodge. Every other resort is similiar to a motel. We've enjoyed it so much that we are going agin in Feb. 2006. I have high standards when it comes to lodging and am very picky. I would not think twice about staying here. Everyone has their own views, mine was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay inside Disney World”
Reviews.Author: hliss
Reviews.Content: Even my husband, who is no fan of Disney, loved this resort. It is pricey, but at off season times and with a AAA discount we could splurge for a night. Given the price you would expect something more upscale, but that is not found in Disney - resorts are pricey based on their convenience to the parks. So a "deluxe" resort is simply one with a few extras and easier ability to get to a park. If you want fancy/upscale check out the Ritz Carlton or Peabody outside of Disney. I have heard that the Dolphin and Swan are slightly nicer than the typical Disney resorts and are still on Disney property, but I don't think they're that upscale, either. Disney's focus is on families and children, so don't expect luxury. That said, the Wilderness Lodge is a nice place to stay regardless of whether or not you have kids. It is good for people who want to have the sense that they are staying inside the Magic Kingdom. Yes, it is a hokey Disney theme, but Disney is good at making fun, hokey themes. The rooms are solidly 3 star - beds are reasonably comfortable, and bathrooms well-maintained and conveniently set up (i.e., 2 sinks located outside the toilet/shower room so that several family members can get ready at one time), and rooms are not big but adequate for short stays. Despite overlooking the pool area, our room was quite quiet, and I believe that is due to the soundproofing used for the outside door (there was some outer hallway noise, so that door is not that soundproofed). One of the best features of this resort is that it is an easy and quick boat trip to the Magic Kingdom, which makes life so much less stressful if you intend to go to that park. There is also an electric light parade out on the water at night in front of the hotel. We took a (free) boat out to the Wilderness campground to check out the petting zoo and horses, which might be something fun to do with kids. There is a small beachfront on the lake, children's playground, and watersport rentals. The pool area looked nice, and included a children's pool separate from the main pool (but they were in close proximity), however it was smaller than I would have expected of a resort of this size. I did like that the resort was not as sprawling as some of the other resorts. Our room was pretty distant from the lobby, but it never took more than 5 minutes to get there, and other than the villas the rooms are all contained within one building - in some of the resorts the separate buildings are so spread out that it is either a 15-20 minute walk or a tram ride to get to the main lobby. There are a lot of nice public areas in which to hang out, and we spent some time lounging by a fireplace in a 3rd floor nook. We did not try the restaurants, but did go to the gift shop which had some reasonably (for Disney) priced provisions (cereal, snacks, sodas, etc.) if you need to stock up. Staff were universally friendly and helpful. Overall we highly recommend the lodge and intend to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the wonderful wilderness lodge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 7 night stay at the Wilderness Lodge with 3 kids(7 months, 3 and 5 years old). Where do I start? Our room was great! It was very clean with a view of the courtyard. We had a room with bunkbed which was a huge hit with my kids. We had requested early maid service, so each day when we returned from the parks at 1pm, our room was clean. The grounds and lobby are gorgeous and reminiscent of Old Faithful Inn at Yellowstone. We enjoyed the pool. The water was warm, but it is Florida in the summer. We all enjoyed the pool waterslide. We ate at the Whispering Canyon Cafe at the Lodge. It was great fun. If planning on eating there, just remeber it is loud! Also, I highly recommend the meal plan. It definitely saved us hundreds of dollars and we were able to try new resturants. After staying at monorail resorts on previous visits, I was a bit disappointed with the ferry service to MK. It was hit or miss. The travel time would be 10 minutes to 30 minutes depending on the time of day. We will defintely return to Wilderness Lodge on our next Disney vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Wilderness Lodge”
Reviews.Author: wintersummer
Reviews.Content: We really like the Wilderness Lodge. OK, the decor is a rip-off from National Park Lodges and you know you're not really in a National Park Lodge, but this is Disneyworld. You have to just go with the show. You step in and there's western music playing in the background...from cowboy movies! Restaurants are great...one is for fine dining and other is for rip-roaring fun with your kids. We don't have children but always go to watch the little ones have so much fun. The only downside is we prefer to be closer to Epcot and you have to use the bus system to get to Epcot from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Resort At A High Price”
Reviews.Author: mbkb1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Disney's Wilderness Lodge Villas. I am writing the review about the Lodge itself, along with the Villas, since we mostly utilized the amenities of the main Lodge. Surroundings: First, to be fair, I knew going into this that Disney is pretty much a "manufactured" environment. In some cases, this can lend to the "magic" of the experience. But in the case of the Lodge, it was too much, and bordered on creepy. Everywhere you go at WL you are subjected to man-made and orchestrated environment. From the canned "adventurous" music playing continually poolside, to the recorded sounds of crickets at night. I suppose I am more of a naturalist..I grew up in upstate NY in the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains. I love nature, but not necessarily the manufactured kind. Everything from the "geyser" to the "spring" that feeds the pool is faux. And looks it. I can, however, see how young children could find the esthetics appealing. Our children, ages 14, 12 and 3 found it intriguing. The lobby of the Lodge is beautiful with towering timber columns, totem poles and grand arts and crafts style chandeliers/seating. The Lodge was consistently cool and refreshing temperature wise. Staff: The staff at WL was essentially hit or miss. We found the valets to be friendly and very helpful. The concierge was unavailable on numerous occasions, so the desk clerks filled in. On one occasion, a female clerk looked at me like I was from Mars when I inquired if there was a place to shop like Kohls or Target nearby. (Off Disney property.) She finally begrudgingly tossed directions to an outlet mall my way. Perhaps she never ventures away from the Lodge? The other irritating moment was at the Whispering Canyon Cafe when at breakfast the staff shrieks at the top of their lungs "KETCHUUUP!!!!" if you should happen to ask for that particular condiment. They are attempting to rouse their captive audience in a down-home "YEE-HAWW!" manner, but it comes across as loud and obnoxious during times when the restaurant is nearly empty. Dinner was a whole other experience. Bring your valium. Now, don't get me wrong, I love to have fun...But after a long day in 96 degree heat and humidity at the parks, the last thing I wanted was to be subjected to loud, crass "shows" but the restauraunt staff that implored us to stand up and do the hokey pokey, form a train, etc. numerous times during our meal "or else." Add to that waiters who slam their tray tables on the ground as they walk by (to mimic horse's hooves?) and more shrieks of KETTCHUUPP!!, etc. (Annoying to the point where other diners were "sneaking" condiments to other tables in order to avoid the yelling.) and you have a recipe for a splitting headache. Heh. And bring your wallet. Entrees average about $20/pp. Pool/Beach: The pools were crowded, but nice. The water temp probably hovered around 90 or more. Not too refreshing. But there was an outdoor shower with cool water available. (It was a lifesaver.) The beach is a strip of sand with lounges, but there is no swimming allowed in the lake. Bacteria counts too high? I had no idea the lake would be off limits. Pity. The boat rides to the Magic Kingdom were slow enough to see the sights along shore (other resorts, etc.) but quick enough to get you to the MK in a timely fashion. Villas: We found the 2 bedroom villa to be spacious and quiet. However, there was a layer of dust on everything and the carpet was dingy/dirty. The tap water smells strongly of sulfur, and was even BROWN when I turned on the jacuzzi jets. ICK. Taking a shower, it was evident Disney resorts do not have soft water. Nor do they have decent water pressure. The water flow from the shower was little more than a drizzle. The kitchen was well equipped with dishes, utensils, even a dishwasher. But bring your bottled water fro drinking/making coffee. There are also washer/dryer units in each 2 br Villa. Bathtowels are small, so consider bringing a beach towel or 2. Adequate? Yes. Worth $500 a night? NO. I can't help but wonder if the economy and moderate resorts might present a better value. This is the gist of my review. Our experience was not "bad" per se..But I expected more from an alleged "high end" resort, and for the price we paid. I suppose being so close to the Magic Kingdom was our payoff. If we ever go to Disney again, I'm thinking we'll check out one of the other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Disney World”
Reviews.Author: brandaniell
Reviews.Content: We just returned from first trip to WDW. We weren't sure what to expect, but I have to say, we were throughly impressed. From the minute we arrived to Orlando, we were given clear instructions on what to do , and the people were so friendly (Not like in LA), which was extremely impressive. We took the Magic Express Bus (Disney's Bus) to the Wilderness Lodge, which was a nice experience. The Check in process was easy, and we were upgraded to a room with a pool view and bunk beds, which our 2 boys loved. The hotel was just fabulous. The pool was wonderful, but it get's extremely crowded, with everyone trying to cool down from the horrible August heat. We took the boat to the Magic Kingdom, and the longest we ever had to wait for Bus transportation was 5 minutes. We were on the Disney Dining Plan, which I recommend. We easily ate about $700 worth of food and snacks in 8 days, and all we payed was $400. All the restaurants were great, and we came home with snacks remaining on our plan. Overall, we were extremely impressed with the Wilderness Lodge and we will make it our hotel of choice each time we return to Disney. If you are looking for a clean hotel, good location and friendly service, than this is the place for you. Brandon and Daniella's mom

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the lodge for one night while our townhouse rental was being painted. I agree with the other review, yes the lobby is nice, but the rooms, boy oh boy. The comforter was thin and dingy, not luxurious at all. The bathroom was tiny and the bath was more deserving of a 2* hotel and the room smelled musty. When I went onto the balcony all I could hear was pnuematic drilling (I was not notified when I booked that there was any construction going on). Oh and one more thing was that the pool was dirty!!! I had previously booked into one of the allstar resorts (I left as soon as I saw the rooms). From my experience I would never recommend staying at any of the disney resorts as the rooms fall very short, however the resorts themselves offer a lot. So now we just eat at the restaurants and enjoy the resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerVAVA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from WL. We loved it! We loved to coziness of the lodge, although it was quite large! Somehow it still seemed small enough and cozy for the five of us. We had a deluxe room which slept five. Our view was gorgeous of the lake/pool. My only negatives were the Roaring Forks cafe can get quite crowded and lines long. Bathrooms are small -- but who care really. Do you really spend a lot of time in the bathroom? We had a problem with our shower once and upon reporting the problem it was fixed within an hours time. We saw other resorts on the WDW transportation stops...but am certain this is our resort of choice for future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Best Deluxe Disney Resort on the property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First let me state, that I am a very picky traveler with high expectations of resorts. The Wilderness Lodge overly exceeded my expectations. My family of 6 just returned from the Disney Wilderness Lodge last week and had one of our most memorable vacations at Disney. We decided to try a 2 bedroom villa and we could not have been more pleased with our decision. We have been going to Disney for years and have stayed at the Contemporary, Grand Floridian, Port Orleans-French Quarter, Old Key West and Coronado Springs but the Villas at the Wilderness Lodge outshines them all. The lobby is breathtaking and amenities are outstanding. Upon check in we were greeted by a very friendly valet ("Welcome Home") who took all 13 of our oversized bags happily from us and placed them in storage as our room was not available when we checked in. At check in, the front desk person was very pleasant, smiling and helpful to us. As we arrived early, our room was not ready but we were given a number to call to find out when it would be ready and that we could keep our luggage in storage while we were in the parks. The front desk attendant went over our complete package for us in great detail and offered lots of information about the parks and activities and even wanted to re-print my husband's room card as his name was spelled incorrectly. This was no problem to us at all but she wanted to make sure everything was just right for us. We wanted to go out into the parks after check in but needed some items from our luggage and the valet could not have been more helpful in getting our luggage out of storage for us. At 3:00 pm we called to check on our room and it was ready and we were able to go ahead and have items we purchased sent over to the hotel. The only problem we encountered was when we returned to the hotel late that evening from the parks we needed to have our luggage brought up to the room. There was only one valet working at that hour (11:30 pm) so it did take a little longer than we would have liked to get our bags as we were ready for bed. But we completely understood as there was only one person to do the job. We called again and our bags were brought up and the valet was very apologetic for the delay. Our room, where do I start. It was fabulous! We had more than enough room for my husband and I and our four children. There was a very cozy kitchen with dining bar and table, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, toaster and nice dinnerware. All that we could want. We also had a washer and dryer (with detergent included) that came in very handy. The master bedroom was huge with a very comfortable kingsize bed, armoire with tv, balcony overlooking the woods with a bathroom that was wonderful. A jacuzzi tub with a window that opened up to the bedroom with seperate vanity and huge closet, the shower (big enough for 2) and toilet and seperate sink were connected to the other part of the bathroom by a door which came in handy while one of our children wanted to take a shower or use the restroom while I was getting ready at the other sink. The living area had another balcony, a comfy pullout queen sofa with an armoire and tv that connected to another bedroom with two very comfortable queen size beds with another tv armoire and large bathroom with seperate vanity from tub/shower and large closet. It was like being at home. The decor of the room was very tasteful, new and cozy. We loved staying in the room as much as going to the parks. We spent a day at Blizzard Beach and decided that our pool resort was better because there were no lines or crowds and we decided to leave and go to the resort pool. Ended up wishing we had spent the entire day there. The restaurants at the resort are wonderful to. Had an incredible dinner at the Whispering Canyon Cafe and good lunches and breakfast in the Raging Fork near the pool area. We could have spent an entire day just enjoying the Wilderness Lodge and all of the amenities there. There are loads of hidden Mickey's to look for in the lobby, a huge store with great stuff, a warm spring that runs from the lobby to a waterfall that flows into the pool. We checked out and then stayed at the parks until late and came back for our luggage. When we left late that night there were crews with cherry pickers dusting the huge totem poles in the lobby and cleaning crews cleaning everywhere. You will not find a cleaner resort anywhere. Our room was also very clean each day and well stocked with towels and soaps. Our maid even took the time to make Mickey and Minnie out of towels dressed in our bathing suits we had laid out. The kids loved it, even our older kids (15 and 12). If I had to say it has a downside it would be that the boatride to Magic Kingdom can take longer than the monorail and there is one stop for Fort Wilderness on the way. But I have stayed at both the Contemporary and the Grand Floridian with the monorail and I can say that I would be willing to take a longer boat ride for a stay at the Wilderness Lodge. It is perfect for families and definately makes for a memorable Disney experience! We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy resort, but have a few complaints”
Reviews.Author: lacie
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just had our 2nd trip to Disney this past week. We stayed in Disney's Caribbean Beach Resort last year & loved it. We decided to pick 2 Disney Resort's this year, one being Port Orleans French Quarter and the er Wilderness Lodge. We spent our 1st four days was at POFQ & we loved everything there. We were very pleased with the food, housekeeping, the pool, etc. The last three night's were at Wilderness Lodge. When we first arrived on the property of this resort, we were amazed at how large it was. The lobby in itself is massive and beautiful too. But, my first complaint was on the service at the front desk. The gentlemen who checked us in was rather unfriendly and seemed to not even want to be there. He informed us our room wasn't ready and gave us a number to call to check to see if it was ready. We spent some time looking around inside and outside. Both being wonderful I might add. Everything is beautiful, the landscaping, the lake, the pool, etc. When we finished we decided to check the number and they said our room was ready. It was close to the store that is by the lobby. We weren't happy at all with the location. It wasn't at all what we requested 2 or 3 times before we left home. Also, we walked into this room and it hadn't even been cleaned. The beds were all messed up, there was mold on the ceiling and it had a terrible view. We asked specifically for a woods view on a high floor and bunk beds for the kids. We went to tell front desk about our situation with the room (getting the same guy I might add) and he wasn't a bit helpful. He gave us another room, on the same floor, no bunkbeds and it had been cleaned but they didn't clean it well. We weren't going to be happy until we got what we were paying for. Port Orleans French Quarter is a moderate resort and we had no complaints at all there. This time I went nicely to a lady that was at check-in. I told her of our situation and she was very pleasant & to us to hold on just a moment. She came back and upgraded us to the sixth floor w/a pool view, courtyard view and lake view. It was fantastic. But, the only downfall-we didn't get the bunk beds we requested. Other than that everything was perfect w/our room. The food court at Wilderness Lodge doesn't compare to the food court at POFQ. There is much more of a selection at POFQ. I will say we were a bit surprised at some of the comparisons between the moderate resorts and the deluxe. You would think that in a deluxe resort you would get everything you pay for, but we were a bit shocked.

Reviews.Title: “Are you people crazy??!!”
Reviews.Author: lwuko
Reviews.Content: Ok, the lobby of the lodge is breathtaking. Artist point and wispering canyon are top notch for dining. But the guestrooms are filthy! These rooms are in bad shape. We are a family of four, with a 4 and 5 year old. We had a wonderful vacation, except for our room. What a disappoitment. We will return to Disney, but will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...lacking in detail”
Reviews.Author: ahuizote
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a trip to Orlando and divided our stay between the wilderness lodge and the animal kingdom lodge. My brother in law is a castmember for the Disney company and therefore gets 50% off hotel rate. Paying $300 a night ($150 for us!!) I expected more from the room; the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling, the bathroom fixtures were old and falling apart and the overall feel of the room was nothing more than a big hotel chain. Notice my comment is only for the room, the rest of the hotel grounds are great, Disney does really try to bring the Disney experience to the hotel. We have no kids, so if you want a more adult oriented hotel, I would definetely go for the animal kigdom lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluecuzco
Reviews.Content: The achitecture was modled after the old faithful inn (yellowstone). There's a "hot spring" in the lobby the flows into a stream that feeds into the pool. I was swimming once and a family of ducks joined us. If you're planning to stay at a hotel in the price range, you should definitley look into the wilderness lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: pezaddict231
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wilderness Lodge from June 18, 2005 - June 25, 2005. We were received a free upgrade from a standard room to a courtyard view king bedroom. The view was amazing. We could see Bay lake from our bed, not to mention the geyser erupting. We also had a great view of the pools and a wooded area. The rooms were very clean and roomy. The entire hotel is stunning, and the theme is exquisitely executed. You really feel like you are in one of those great lodges of the west. It is even more beautiful in person. The transportation is convenient. There is a boat to Magic Kingdom (which drops you off right at the entrance, not the Trans. and ticket center like the buses do) and the Contemporary and buses everywhere else. We never waited long for a bus either. Artist Point is excellent. The Duck Confit salad was possibly the best thing I ate all week, and we went to many restaurants. The food at Roaring Forks is also good as is the room service. I have never stayed on Disney property before but after staying here I would never stay off-property again. It costs a little more but it is well worth it. We were able to sleep in everyday and take advantage of the extra magic hours in the evening and see everything we wanted to see. I highly recommend this hotel. The pool area is stunning, there is a water slide that is very fast and fun, the whole lodge is so welcoming, not stuffy like some of the other deluxe resorts seem to be. You will not regret staying here. I can't wait to plan my next Disney vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Wilderness Lodge from June 22 to June 28, 2005. Had a courtyard view room on the 4th floor. Beautiful, beautiful hotel. Very clean and quiet room. Great view. Hotel staff MOST accommodating and very responsive. Very friendly and helpful. Whispering Canyon Cafe - very good food and VERY FUN staff. Your meal is a party. Roaring Forks fast food is hot, tasty and convenient. Swimming pool and slide are very nice. Had an absolutely wonderful stay here and would definitely stay here again. Very highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the west in Central Florida!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got home from our yearly vacation to Disney and the Wilderness Lodge. We've stayed at the WL the 4 times in the last 6 years. I thought it would be a great idea to post a comment from a young adults point of view. The hotel is great for not only children but teens too. If you are considering the WL and have 2 teens, a boy and girl especially, the hotel offers rooms with a queen bed and bunk beds so there are no sleeping arguments. You have to ask for the bunk bed rooms when you arrive. The hotel may not place you in that room the first day you are there but normally will the second day. The main pool with the water slide is typically filled with children but the pool by the villas is more quiet alternative. The main pool offers free towels, bar, and hair wraps-$1.50 per inch plus the cost of beads. Another great teen attraction are the small speed boats that you can rent at the docks. The great thing about the boats is you have to be 16 with a drivers licence to drive the boats so kids arent out on the lake doing irresponsible things You can also drive the boats near the Magic Kingdom and the surrounding hotels. The boats for an hr are about $35 but they also offer a family pkg for your week stay for around $230. Whispering Canyon is a great restaurant for children of all ages. I had fun there at age 20, but my cousins also did at 10 and 13. The unlimited skillet meals-breakfast and dinner are wonderful and fulfilling and milkshakes have free refills!! Our server made all of us hats out of bandana napkins and was very out spoken/going. Some of the servers are more outgoing than others just to let you know. For teens and older teens the boats to the magic kindom and the buses are great forms of transportation if you want to leave the park early while the rest of the family stay at the park. Needless to say, this hotel is a wonderful place to stay. The four times we've stayed there we have never had a problem. It's a great hotel if its sunny and if its raining because its all inclosed so you don't have to walk outside like you would at other resorts. The cast memebers are always have smiles on their faces are are willing to help. I hope this helps..enjoy your stay!!! and the gift shop and pin station are great too!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Fantastic Lodge. We love every minute of it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge this past weekend. 6/18 and 6/19. My wife suprised me for our Anniversery and had me drive past all those other hotels.....and then upon arriving towards the Wilderness Lodge she said......Honey we are staying here!!!!!!!!! The Wilderness Lodge boasts the best location to all Disney Parks, clean and very large pools and spa's and the best staff in Orlando. They all made us feel at home from the time that we arrrived to the time that we had to leave. We are looking to our next Disney vacation..........with our whole family, so they too can experience all the fun. It really was a truly magical time. Thanks so much. Michael and Sherry Kovalchik

Reviews.Title: “Must be a top 10 nationwide, not just WDW.”
Reviews.Author: razord
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 glorious days at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. After reading posts here, and other sites and reading the "official" and "unofficial" Disney Guides, this hotel really seemed to add up. I was not disappointed, in fact it exceeded every expectation I had. Everything to from the fact that our room was ready early in the day (without our requesting it) to the way we were treated by every staff member, even to the food served in the lodge at "Whispering Canyon Cafe," I don't think it could be much better. The pool was always sparkling, the grounds looked like they were combed about twice a day for anything that didn't belong, and the views were unmatched. During our stay, we had dinner at the Contemporary, breakfast at the Grand Floridian (both character meals) and took in the "spirit of aloha" show at the Polynesian. We arrive early or stayed late at each to try and get the feel of these other resorts for future reference. Nothing truly compared. The Contemporary came closest to being as open, well groomed and will proably get one visit from us in December as a test. The Grand Floridian seemed way too stuffy, including the staff who seemed to be doing us a favor by answering our questions. The Polynesian, while apparently having the best beach at WDW just seemed old. I can't really put into words the entire experience. My wife and I are 42 and we traveled with a 7 year old and a 2 year old. Every person at the WL treated us as if they had been waiting just for us. By the way, the water taxi from WL to the Magic Kingdom and Contemporary were wonderful places for a sunset cruise, or viewing the Magic Kingdom Fireworks show. Probably the best vacation I have had in 10+ years and it was the hotel that really put it over the top.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: scruffygirl
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this was an AWESOME experience. I'm a huge Disney World fan but here it was my 10th trip to the resort and I had never stayed on the property before - now I don't think I will ever stay off property. We stayed in a Deluxe Room (used to be called a junior suite.) This was a great budget-minded option for 5 adults staying in a Deluxe resort. The pullout couch was the most comfortable I've ever slept on - it felt like a real bed. I thought the decorating and theming in the room was very nice. We were lucky enough to have a corner room at the end of the wing near the lake and pool, so it was very quiet as there wasn't a lot of traffic going through our particular area. The Whispering Canyon and Roaring Fork were great and reasonably priced places to eat. The pool at the resort was really nice- the water was comfortably warm so you didn't get that stinging freezing feeling you usually get when you first step into the water. check-in/out fast super speedy - It was very convenient that we could check in for our American Airlines flight AND check in our luggage right there at the hotel. Transportation was fair, but it all depends on luck and how long it's been since the bus you want last came to pick up a group of people. Sometimes we waited 15-20 minutes, sometimes we got right on. On one occassion we waited 45 minutes to get a bus to Typhoon Lagoon, but I'll chalk that up to an isolated incident. Overall everyone was very pleased with the entire stay. SOOO glad I changed my mind at the last minute to book WL and not the contemporary!

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: thebebita
Reviews.Content: This was truly a magical vacation. We are seasonal pass-holders and were able to obtain a discount to Wilderness Lodge. I had no idea this would be as fantastic a place as it was. It exceeded my expectations. Firstly, the lobby is exceptional...more impressive, to me, than the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Further, there were plenty of activities for the kids and family. We took a boat ride and saw Magic Kingdom and the other resorts. We also rented the surrey bicycles to Fort Wilderness. I would advise you take separate bikes, not the surrey bikes. Fort Wilderness was about a mile away and had $3 pony rides for the little ones, plus a petting zoo. I enjoyed a message. The staff was phenomenal and extremely helpful. We didn't get to do everything. Out of our 4 day stay we only went to the theme park once because there was so much to do. I highly recommend this lodge to anyone wanting to have a great time at Disney. I plan on returning in the fall. The rooms had a great view and the ambiance was far more relaxed than the Grand Floridian. Go, go, go!!!

Reviews.Title: “love it love it love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: RBNY
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several of the Disney resorts of similar class... this has to be tops so far... beautiful property... great pools... very Disney... the kids were in heaven.... awesome location.... its one of the few Disney properties that has boat service to the Magic Kingdom... which, if you been to Disney and gone through the process of loading the kids in the car... driving to the park, parking god knows how far from the entrance... unloading the kids... reloading them in the tram... unloading again... etc etc etc - if you done this before you'll understand how much easier it is to walk up to the boat roll your stoller (we had a double stroller) on.. and rolling off at the park entrance!!! can't beat it... downside - small rooms - but that seems to be a consistent issue with Disney R.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second vacation trip to the Wilderness Lodge in the Magic Kingdom. We enjoyed the convenient access by boat to the Magic Kingdom and also bus service to MGM, Animal Kingdom and EPCOT. The children ages five and seven loved eating at the Whispering Canyon Dining room for breakfast and dinner. The waiters in the restaurant had activities planned to make the dining experience fun for the kids. One of our children celebrated her birthday at Chef Mickey's at the Contemporary resort which is also accessible by boat, she enjoyed meeting the characters and everyone sang "Happy Birthday" to her and she was given a small cake and a special place mat. It was really an exciting evening for all of us. We also had breakfast at the Grand Floridian with Disney Characters and the children enjoyed meeting more characters. Guests staying at hotels on Disney property are given the benefit of using the parks after hours. The park is closed to all ticket holders who are not staying on Disney property. We enjoyed the extra hours and the short lines for all the attractions. Disney resorts are great bargains considering all the conveniences and having access to spa's, golf courses, several pools, beaches, fishing, and boat rentals and excellent restaurants in the hotels. We had a wonderful time and we feel Disney Hotels are convenient and have many amenities. We will definitely plan another vacation to a Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Its Disney and it was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Executivetravel
Reviews.Content: First if you go to disney world planning is important, plan your character dining , book in advance, we arrive very first day of the new magical experience transportation, we did not recieve our passes or instructions for our luggage, but do disney credit they did fix everything upon arrival at the airport. Disney transport is perfect always there and always on time, you DONT need a car. I know this is designed to keep you on disney property and spend all your money and that worked fine for us. The wilderness lodge is perfect for its purpose, to sleep and maybe catch the NEWS, be warned however the resort has NO INTERNET. If you want to get the emails you cant. I was unhappy at first, but its not such a bad idea to go without. The room was fine the staff are great. We got a welcome kit and a printout of the reservations I had made at the restaurants. I urge you to take the meal plan, its a little complex to work out but its well worth it, this will save you money. We travelled with a four year old, al the staff were great and lived up to expectations. There may have been gliches at times, but they all seemed interested to help.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful wilderness lodge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved everything! It was the best hotel ever. The employees were nice and helpful. My Dad accidentally left the clothes in the washer, while doing laundry at 2:00a.m. We didn't realize the problem until two days after we left Florida. When we called, they located our clothes, dried them and shipped them to us in Ohio. They had many nice eateries. We really liked the Roaring Forks Cafe. It was fun to eat there because the waiters were so crazy. It was an awesome vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: denvrgal
Reviews.Content: We loved the Wilderness Lodge. We stayed here for 2 nights the weekend after Thanksgiving 2004 before meeting up at another location for a large family reunion. We were lucky to get a room with bunk beds so our kids didn't have to sleep together. We thought that although the room was small, it was comfortable and we really weren't in the room much anyway. Although it was cool at night, the kids loved the pool and everything was very nicely done. We loved taking the ferry to the Magic Kingdom - a nice change of pace although we just missed the one before us so it was a 20 minute wait to get the next one. The bus to Animal Kingdom was fine too - coming home the line for our bus was short but some of the other resorts were long and I am sure they had to wait several bus rides to get on. The bottom line is it really takes a while to get anywhere at WDW so plan accordingly. The only thing I didn't like about Wilderness Lodge was the loud more casual restaruant in the lobby with the obnoxious waiters that are intentionally rude to you & its suppsed to be funny. On any other day, I would have found this amusing but after a long hot day in the parks, waiting until 8pm for a table to eat, a headache and just plain ol' tired, it wasn't funny and it actually made my 5 yr old cry because the waitress was rude to me and it frigthened her more than any ride in the park did. The food was ok though. All in all, a good experience and I would stay here again, especially if I was guaranteed bunk beds for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge -- mostly good but some problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (two adults and a five year old) stayed at Wilderness Resort the first week of May. We got one of the Disney packages arranged through a travel agent, so we were not there on any kind of a "deal". This may have colored my thoughts because I felt that we were paying top dollar for this resort. The good: The lobby, pool, dock, grounds, etc. were very nice. You could buy a handful of food to feed the ducks by the dock. The ferry to Magic Kingdom was fantastic. We took the ferry over to Wilderness Campground to visit the petting zoo and go fishing. THe cleaning staff left various animals make out of towels, much the the delight of my son. The pool was nice although a little crowded. The hot tub was just the right temperature. The bell staff was helpful. The Cub Club did a nice job babysitting while we had one adults only dinner. We did not rent a car, but relied on Disney transportation. The bad: we had reserved a non-smoking room, but were told at check in that none was available. They switched us to a nonsmoking room the next night, but it overlooked a loading area so we were awakened at about 2:00am and 4:00 am every night by the sound of truck back up warning signals. We tried to get a different room, but were told that none were available. The Whispering Canyon was fun . . . once. Even my 5 year old thought it was a bit over the top. The food was mediocre. The service was fair. The waitstaff antics were intimidating to some of the children. I'm glad we stayed there, but for the money, I'd probably go back to Animal Kingdom or stay off grounds the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: law5276
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our stay at Disney's Wilderness lodge, needless to say we were very disapointed. The entire resort needs to be updated, it definetly shows it's age. There had been a flood in the room across from ours, so the smell of mildew was terrible.We asked to be changed, but the resort was booked.Our standard view room was terrible.,we had a great view of the generator. The balcony was small, dirty and dingy. The pool is way too small for this resort. About the only good thing I could say of the resort is the ferry to the Magic Kingdom, it was very convienent. I would not recommend this resort to anyone. If you're looking for deluxe resort accomadations at an affordable price go to the Animal Kingdom Lodge. It's the newest deluxe resort, and it's gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel like Florida”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful resort!!! I really felt like I was out west somewhere. Everyone at the resort was friendly and helpful. Upon check in, our room was upgraded because we had requested bunk beds for our six year old son. We had a spectacular view of the lake, pool and hotel grounds. Our room was kept clean every day by our wonderful housekeeper. The room did show signs of wear, but when you consider that it is a Disney resort with tons of kids in and out every day, it was acceptable. I loved the music that played throughout the resort. The Roaring Fork, which I nicknamed "The Raging Mama," was perfect for breakfast and snacks. We did not rent a car and had no problem with transportation. We did it all...boat, bus, monorail...and so convenient. I think this is the best resort at Disney for the $$$. We'll be back. Our son is still talking about the place three months later. He was extremely impressed with the hotel lobby and the stream that ran through it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit to Disney”
Reviews.Author: OHCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Agree with the positive comments in the other reviews. The staff was great and we enjoyed being so close to MK with small kids. Really allowed us to get the most out of the park passes. Would recommend calling the hotel directly a couple of days prior to arrival to insure they undertand your room preferences. The only downside was the bus service - was poor for a great hotel. Overall, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, relaxing setting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from six nights at the Wilderness Lodge and were extremely happy. The architecture is breathtaking and fascinating. We found the staff to be helpful and friendly. Yes, the rooms are somewhat on the smaller size given the price range, but the view of pool, lake, and woods more than made up for this. Our beds had very comfortable mattresses and we slept well each night. I think this pool is one of Disney's loveliest. I do wish there had been more lounge chairs, however, and an awning for the strong Floridian sun is definitely needed. We were satisfied with both bus and boat transportation to the theme parks. We did dine one time at the Whispering Canyons cafe; it is a rollicking boisterous time, but the food was just ordinary. We were happy that the gift shop sold some food items which could be stored in a complimentary refrigerator (ask for this; it isn't advertised). The hotel is great for kids too; my girls loved it and want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on Our First Disney Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned for staying here April 11-16 and loved it! I used this site a great deal before we left, so here is my payback info post for others! We have 3 young boys (8,6,2) so the theming was PERFECT for our family, and the WL did a perfect job with the theming. All the staff were helpful, friendly and eager to please. I will skip the many special Lodge details (others have covered extensively), except for a few specific things. First, try and be a Flag family it was "magical" moment for our son. Secondly, the rooms are somewhat small, but the balcony adds enough room so that you can get some needed alone space or send the kids out there to eat. Overall, the room condition was okay/good, about the level of a Marriott Courtyard, but the lobby and pool and grounds AWESOME, and make up for lack of luxury. We didn't eat much at the WL, but the snack bar was convenient and not very pricey at all, plus you can take your food and eat at the nice tables right outside. The one place we did stop in for dinner one night at the lounge/bar outside Artist Point, and it was a really good idea. They have a big TV, couches and lots of tables, was kid friendly and EMPTY! the food chioces were minimal, but we the Wings were great, and the boys loved the cheese pizzas. Also, take advantage of the food section in the back of the Lobby gift shop--their selection was excellent and all the rooms have refrigerators, so we were able to get 1/2 gallon of milk, some adult bevs and a gallon of water to use throughout the week. I was surprised that the tap water in the hotel was as bad as it was (and i am not a water snob)--sulfur city man! The boat service to the Magic Kingdon was OUTSTANDING.
