We maybe waited 5 mins at the most on either end. It really made our trip! It enabled us to "pop over" most nights for a few hours, which was great because it wasn't crowded then. The ride operators were calling us to come and ride b/c they had no one on, and then let you ride as many times as you wanted! Imagine sitting on thunder Mountain Railroad 4 times straight! Also, come back during the Wishes show and you will enjoy the fireworks over the water--really beautiful! However, as good as the boats were (and take advantage of the boat to the Contemporary to the Monorail--also very easy fast and convenient) I was really disappointed in the shuttle bus service--it was horrible! After hustling your family to get up and out to make it out of the room and go to MGM, Blizzard beach or Animal Kingdom early, it really stunk to wait between 35-45 minutes for a bus. And coming back was even worse! Forget making any early morning Magic Hours unless you plan to be at the bus stop at 7:30! By the end, I was ready to just pay for a taxi, and would have if we wanted to go back to MGM our last day. My only last tip is if you have kids and they love to swim like mine, plan to have a day of just hotel and swim time. I didn't anticipate how big of a draw this would be (we have a great pool at home...and we were at Disney World!) and should have. It is a wonderful pool and slide! We ended up not using our last Park Hopper day because they really just wanted to hang out and swim. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Really great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great, the pool was nice and overall it was a greata place to stay. And if anyother people had probelm with service it probally because you are rude and expect to much, Disney is known for its service and they will give you the best if you treat them nicely no one wants to serve and Uptight person who is so critcal they do not enjoy the things offered to them. The location is great if you want to go to the wishes fire works at the magic kingdom because of the quick boat ride. The food was good and the layout of the rooms was excellent with the bunk beds. I do recommend this hotel, and if you want good service do not be rude because when I read there review I can tell if the person writing is rude and uptight and there was one person who I would serve badly if I was a hotel employe, there are only human so do not be to critcal.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids ages 9 and 11 and I arrived at Midnight on Sunday evening and we were helped out immediately with our rooms. The lobby service was excellent. The inside lobby is unbelievable. The woodwork and detailing is very cool. It is like being in a log cabin home. Our room was very nice, we had a dresser for clothes. A courtyard view on the 3rd floor looked out over the pool area. It was very quiet in the evenings. We had a queen bed and bunkbeds for the kids. It was nice to not have them fight over who slept where, they alternated the top and bottom bunks each night. The kids also loved the fact that the pool was open until midnight so they could swim after spending all day in the sun at the parks. We ate quite a bit at the Roaring Fork Cafe. The food is about the same price as any of your chain type restaraunts for pricing. The snacks are rather spendy, but what isn't spendy at Disney. I would recommend buying a water bottle and filling it rather than purchasing a new one for $2.00 every time you need water. The transportation to the parks was pretty quick. No longer than 1/2 hour to get on the bus and make the one stop at the Wilderness Campground just a mile away on the way to the parks. The ferry ride to Magic Kingdom was a plus as it only takes about 20 minutes and you very rarely have to wait. You might be able to save some time by driving to the parks, but the busses drop you off right at the doors and you do not have to hunt for your vehicle late in the evenings when there are thousands of people leaving the park at the same time. Our last day we ate at the Whispering Canyon restaurant and my kids thought it was the best day of food we had. We ordered the all you can eat breakfast skillet which includes scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, biscuts and gravy and homestyle waffles. All for only $10.00 per adult and $6.00 for the kids. It was a blast. Make sure to ask for the ketchup. You will be surprised at the service you get. All in all it was a very positive stay at the Wilderness Lodge. I would recommend this hotel to those who are considering it.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Suggestions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'll forego the accolades and praise heaped upon Wilderness Lodge in lieu of some tips that could make your visit more enjoyable. Suffice to say, all of the reviews heralding or lamenting the lodge's feature are well deserved: It's a beautiful property with a wonderful theme, the pool, restaurants and amenities are first class and the well appointed rooms are spotless. On the down side: The rooms are small compared to other deluxe Disney resorts, it's not a particularly good value, transportation is confounding for a resort so centrally located and there isn't enough seating poolside. Save tables, chairs and chaise loungers by the pool early in the morning because they're all taken by 10AM and there's not enough of them to go around for a resort that typically has over 2000 guests at a time registered. We went down at 8AM and left items of little importance on the furniture: several pool towels folded into a Disney Marketplace bag, a few soda bottles filled with tap water, the USA Today delivered outside our room and a couple of T-Shirts we travel with for just this purpose. So while everybody else was sitting three to a lounger and waiting to vulture abandoned chairs by 1PM; we sauntered up and made ourselves at home in the best location. Watch out for the wooden bed frames. The queen beds are about a foot higher from the floor than typical home bedding and the sturdy frames are an appealing target for shins and feet. With confined quarters, dim lighting and oversided bedspreads camouflaging the frame corners; we banged against the frames at least four times a day. Don't settle for the first room available or what the front desk wants to assign; it doesn't hurt to get picky and that pays off at Wilderness Lodge. My family made reservations and handled check-in; I said request the highest floor available with a room as far from the lobby as possible and was rewarded with a quiet room and spectacular view from the private balcony. The majority of rooms at the lodge are Courtyard view with very few Woods view and even fewer Standard view rooms. The north wing has Woods view rooms along it's left corridor; the right corridor and entire South wing are considered Courtyard view. Beware of the South wing lower floors close to or overlooking the lobby and Standard view rooms; they've got poor balconies and an uninspiring view. The fourth and fifth floor public areas are a treasure chest of hidden delights: At the front of the lodge overlooking the lobby is a great lounge on the fourth floor with a fireplace, sofas and large card tables. Towards the parking lot above the main entrance is another small lounge and walkout to a rooftop patio. The fifth floor has an outdoor balcony with a commanding view of the lake and property just above the fourth floor card lounge. At the corner of the North wing near the elevators are big picture windows with a good view of the nightly Magic Kingdom fireworks. You can't walk around the entire lobby above the fourth floor, the sixth floor is concierge level and a special card is required to access the limited number of rooms on the seventh floor. Take boat transportation whenever available. It's not only a relaxing, pleasant journey with some interesting sites; but the bus transportation takes a long time, the arrivals are frequently few and far between and there's other resorts involved. Getting to the Magic Kingdom by boat is direct and might even be a quicker transfer by monorail to the TTC and points beyond depending on the time of day. But the trip from Downtown Disney late at night is aggravating and there's no alternate route available from alot of Disney World locations.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge is that... "a lodge"”
Reviews.Author: needavacation2005
Reviews.Content: We booked the Wilderness Lodge three months prior to our trip. Close running hotels were the Polynesian and the Beach Club. Having never been to a Disney Resort, we paid the premium hoping this resort was comparable to higher priced lines. Pro's- It is a beautiful lobby, ferry ride to Contemporary and Magic Kingdom are a plus. The buses were much better than expected. Key card that also serves as park hopper ticket was convenient. Hotel was clean. Con's- the rugs, rooms need updating. The bathroom countertop is black, nothing fancy. The toilet is loud, public restroom style. The toiletries are cheap. No dressers to put clothes away. Restaurants way overpriced for cafeteria style grub food. Upon our booking, we had asked for early check-in, and bunk beds with rails for our two small children. Not only was our room not available until late-late, we were given a room with two queen beds, no rails. The beds are higher than average which made it unsafe for the toddlers to sleep. When we complained at that late hour, the manager was not even remorseful and said our only choice was to change rooms the next day. She didnt even care that the Cookies and Milk I ordered for the children never arrived. On day two, although we were promised our room to be ready, the front desk promised late checkout for the prior guests. At 4pm, our room was still not ready. It took two cleaning persons, with us standing in the room to get it right. The only service friendly person I care to mention at this resort was our Housekeeper who was amazing understanding with our troubles, and charmed our children. She was quite personable and really enjoys making the guests feel welcome. We did make it to the Spirit to Aloha dinner at the Polynesian. This hotel seems more our style as we'll plan accordingly next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but avoid the atrium rooms!”
Reviews.Author: great3pets
Reviews.Content: My husband , three-year old daughter and I spent 3 days at WL the week before Christmas. (the decorations were lovely- that week really IS the best time to visit!) The entrance lobby is spectacular, but we stayed in a room that faced the inner atrium. The aforementioned Whispering Canyon kept me awake at night and up early in the morning!! The sound rises up all 7 stories of the lobby atrium- plus on the other end of the room, the sounds of the transfer buses rattled continually thru the window. There are inner hallways that probably have less noise, be sure to inquire about room selection! Otherwise, the ferry to Magic Kingdom was a great way to access that crowded park. I recommend WL for that reason alone! My daughter loved the pools- which I believe were heated at that time of year. We did not go to any of the restaurants- ended up eating at the parks mostly. Parking was pretty easy- but we were there at the low season......

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best family resort on the Disney property. We didn't even go to the Disney parks this time but absolutely loved staying at the Wilderness Lodge. We were able to see the light parade and the fireworks from the resort. Everyone had fun. We are looking forward to returning. . . .soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: PITAGirl
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at Disney's Coronado, but after reading some of the reviews, I decided to upgrade to Disney's wilderness Lodge. It was great. We felt like we were in a lodge in Montana-even saw a bald eagle! One of the reasons I chose this hotel was the comments about the transportation. You can take a boat directly to Magic Kingdom (never waited more than 10 minutes), or over to the Contemporary, where you can get the monorail to just about anywhere. Or, there are buses outside. Our room was nice, not the Ritz, but clean. I had asked about a refrigerator when I booked, and they said all of the rooms have them-not true, so be sure to ask again upon check in. The food was good at the everyday restaurant. We did splurge one night at Artist Pointe, the more upscale restaurant and the food and service was FABULOUS. (Ask for Sylvia, she is just charming!) The quick serve restaurant gets very bogged down 1/2 hour before the first boat leaves, so try to get there a little earlier. My mother had a sandwich there and said it was blah. I also asked for a room that faced the fireworks at Magic Kingdom. Having a 3 year old in tow made it hard to attend at the park. So, we just sat on our balcony and watched from the 3rd floor! We did not see the cute animals made from washcloths as other reviews stated, but so what! I would definitely go back. The hotel was really the highlight of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Going Back!”
Reviews.Author: guuggysdad
Reviews.Content: The Wilderness Lodge was very nice. I agree that the standard rooms are a little small (we had a 1st floor std courtside w/ a king bed) but they are nicely done and very clean. I disagree that they're over-priced. The atmosphere is great and the grounds are very clean. There are several restaurants in the hotel as well as a snack area downstairs and a pool-side bar. There are two hot tubs by the main pool (hot and hotter!). I feel that I paid for these types of extras, not the room. I don't go to Disney for the room. If I were going to a more remote location with fewer amenities and options, I may go for a more upscale room. It's like booking a cruise. You sleep and shower in the room... That's it! The salmon at Artist Point is EXCELLENT! PERIOD! In fact, we had dinner there on a Friday night, and then ate at the California atop the Contemporary the next night. Artist Point food was better (and chaeper!). Like I said, we'll be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took our three kids to Wilderness Lodge in late February. Since we only had a single day there, we flew around like the Griswolds, soaking up everything we could. (We probably annoyed the more "sophisticated" guests who had been there all week.) All in all, we had a fabulous time and would go back. Here's a breakdown of our experience: 1. The entrance is spectacular. Friendly bellboys gave us a warm welcome outside, and the lobby was breathtaking. While I was checking in, the girls were looking for the "hidden Mickeys" in the lobby. We arrived at 10:30 a.m. (way before check-in), but they let us have our room early. 2. The room itself is the only average thing about WL. It's clean but small and didn't include a fridge or microwave. The view on floors 3 to 5 seems to the best. On 2 you can't see much, and on 6 your balcony has a wall instead of metal bars. We would recommend the fifth floor overlooking either the woods or the courtyard. (We got a free upgrade to the courtyard just by asking.) 3. The pool and geyser area is beautiful and wonderful. The twisting slide was a big hit with our girls, and the hot tubs were very pleasant. It's a great themed setting, even better than more expensive hotels like the Contemporary in our opinion. 4. The transportion was just fine. We could catch a ferry to the Magic Kingdom or Fort Wilderness easily. In the evening, we went to Fort Wilderness for the free Chip n Dale campfire (at 8 p.m.). Then we returned in time to see the boat parade from the beach at WL. (The girls fell asleep, however, so we watched from the balcony.) 5. The dining was fine. Whispering Canyon wasn't quite as fun as we had imagined, but the servers were pleasant and the food was very good, just expensive. We enjoyed a full day at WL and checked out the next morning before going to the Magic Kingdom. Since we were going to be at the Kingdom all day, we didn't see the use in spending another $300/night, so we made the easy move to the $100/night All-Star Movies instead. (If you ask, they will transfer your luggage for you.) It was a way to treat ourselves to a wonderful hotel for one night, and we treasure the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: vacationer24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge over the President's day weekend. The hotel was beautiful and very clean. We loved the lobby and the kid-friendly feel. The ferry to the Magic Kingdom was extremely convenient as we never waited more than 10 minutes for the boat. The snack bar has great biscuit sandwiches for a quick breakfast and they are so big that 2 people can split one. One word of advice: We loved our room and it fit our family of 4 perfectly -but the bunk beds did not rest against the wall. If you have a small child sleeping on the lower bunk, request 2 siderails upon check-in so that your child won't fall out of bed. Our 3 year old fell out of bed at 12:30 at night - and we had to wait for at least 30 minutes for the siderails to arrive. If you are wondering if it is worth the money to stay on Disney property, do not hesitate to make a reservation. This was by far the best Disney vacation our family has ever had and never again will I stay off the grounds. My children, ages 3 and 13, loved everything about staying in Disney, from the parks staying open late for resort guests to the bedtime stories on the television in our room. It is Mickey Mouse 24/7, and I wouldn't have it any other way.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Keesar
Reviews.Content: When we arrived late one evening at the Wilderness Lodge, I joking asked the desk clerk if we had a good room. She was surprised by my question and did not answer. Later, we saw why. We were given a room by an elevator and 25 yards from a busy quick meal location. Needless to say, the outside noises served as an early alarm clock the following morning starting before 7 a.m. However, staff cheerfully gave us an outstanding room for the duration of our 5 day stay during the President's week in February. The location of the Wilderness Lodge is excellent as we took full advantage of the ferry boats that took us to the Contemporary Hotel and the Magic Kingdom. Service was prompt and continued 45 minutes after the Magic Kingdom closed. One night, the Magic Kingdom was open until 3 and the service continued. The Lodge was clean and room service excellent. Food in the restaurants was excellent. I must warn you. The Whispering Canyon restaurant is quite active and loud due to the high energy level of the servers. It may not be the best choice in the early morning after a long night out. The grounds are well maintained. We had no difficulties getting pool chairs in the afternoon despite the nice weather. The exercise facilities were excellent. We were very pleased with our stay once we were able to change rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a cool hotel. It does have a wilderness setting. The pools were heated and we were there in February, so that was nice. The ferry to the Magic Kingdom was fun for the kids. We had a Grand Gathering vacation, and had adjoining rooms as well as family a couple of rooms down. It was nice to be accomodated in this respect. Disney definately knows how to take care of their guests. The restaurant, Whispering Canyon was a riot, and the kids as well as the adults had a great time. Don't forget to ask for ketchup and a bigger spoon. All in all it was a great part of our vacation to Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “poor guest relations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: our stay in Dec. 04 was poor.supposd to have connecting rooms but the rooms were not as promised when they moved us our new room had 1 queen bed & 1 bunk bed we were supposed to have 2 queen beds.Hotel staff did not know the boat transportation start times, getting AAA travel checks cashed at service desk was difficult, the information board in the lobby was incorrect with the magic kingdom fireworks but the part that upset us most was that 1 of our family is ill and has time specific care which we were told would be no problem untill we came to the last day we were told the room was not available to us past 3 pm unless we would agree to pay a full day rate for the extra hour of time. I would not stay here if you have any certain health issues they go back on the promises the make once you are at the resort and the seem very unaware of whats going on and when.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Be More Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Chuck_n_Julie
Reviews.Content: If I could give it a 10, I would. Fantastic. Magical. I could go on and on, but suffice to say, it far exceeded our expectations. Service, cleanliness, staff, food, detail. Wow.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Wilderness Lodge!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've been to Disney 8 times in the last 15 years, 7 times staying on Disney property. We're going next week and will stay at the Wilderness Lodge for the 3rd time. We love it, the grounds, the staff, the ambience. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Beautiful hotel with top notch service. The boat ride to Magic Kingdom was fun and so easy to use. It was very accomodating to our family. Our room was great. (We could easily view the fireworks nightly from our woods view room on the thrid floor) I would love to stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “So fun!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Fort Wilderness Lodge last spring on our anniversary and had the best time. We were in a room overlooking the pool, and the lagoon - and could see the Electric Light Parade every evening. Several Disney World hotels are beautiful (Grand Floridian, and Animal Kingdom Lodge in particular) - but for the combination of beauty, theming, transportation and kid appeal - you can't beat Fort Wilderness. The lobby is stunning, relaxing from the moment you enter - sky high ceilings, totem poles everywhere and music that puts you right in the Disney mood. The three restaurants offer something for everyone...At Whispering Canyon if you tell them it's your little one's (or husband's) birthday - they will dress 'em up in cowboy attire and let them race around the dining room on a wooden horse --- PLUS you get a cupcake oozing with gummy worms to cap off your birthday celebration. Artist's Point is gourmet dining, featuring applewood smoked salmon, artisanal cheeses, wines from the pacific northwest and romantic ambience - so delicious and relaxing...There is a cafeteria style place with a nice array of faster service items perfect for a meal on the go. Fort Wilderness offers boat service both to Magic Kingdom and Fort Wilderness Campgrounds (if you're a fan of Hoop De Do!) as well as to the Contemporary (for the great character breakfast). The other parks are accessible by bus - with fairly regular service...A nice place to begin and end your Disney day - or to just take a quick break to right in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has all the amenities of a deluxe resort, for a moderate resort price. Wonderful ambience, the decor and theming is fantastic. The huge stone fireplace in the lobby is amazing. Very friendly staff, and housekeeping was excellent. The room sizes are a bit small for deluxes, but since you don't spend much time in your hotel room at Disney, it doesn't really matter. Some rooms have bunk beds, which are great for the kids. The restaurants are very good, especially Whispering Canyon Cafe which seems to really cater to kids. The boat ride right from the hotel dock to the Magic Kingdom is beautiful, and you can also jump the monorail by taking the boat to the Contemporary Hotel just next door, and go where you need to. Bus transportation was fine as well. The pool is a bit small, but certainly fun...and the erupting geyser near the pool was always fun to watch. Best of all, if you get a room by the courtyard, you can watch the Electrical Water Parade every evening right from your balcony, or from down at the beach. Last but not least...request to be the "Flag Family" at check-in...it was fantastic (won't go into detail so as not to spoil the surprise)!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, view, and the food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best hotels at the Walt Disney World Resort, but what hotel isn't great at Disney? From my view as a thirteen year old, the Wilderness Lodge is friendly to all ages. The Whisper Canyon was friendly and it had excellent food. We stayed in the villas and loved our room. My parents had their own bedroom and I slept in the living room on the pull out couch. We had a kitchen table, a kitchen area where we cooked all of our food, and the bathroom was open and very big. My only complaint was that we ordered food to be stocked in our room for when we arrived, but the food wasn't going to be delivered until a half an hour after we arrived. My parent had to go down to the store to get the food so it wasn't a huge problem though. The location was decent. We could get to Magic Kingdom by boat, and all the other parks by bus or car.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel although for being so new, the rooms didn't seem amazing. We had just stayed at Caribbean Beach Resort which is another Disney resort which is much less, and found the room itself to be similar to this one. The main areas were well themed and it was a joy just to walk around. Took a few nature trails, very pleasant. Pool was heated and jacuzzis were comfortable, there were 2 at the main area, one hotter than the other. It shared a bus with Fort Wilderness to the parks. Considering you can shuttle anywhere you like for free and parking is free I love staying on site, saves time. Paid 121 per night with a special promotion. It's only a 15 minute boat ride to the Magic Kingdom which was our main attraction. We had a view of the lake, beautiful, but the sliding glass door needed a bit of work to close it. You could see fireworks from the balcony. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: GardenLady
Reviews.Content: We thought Disney's Wilderness Lodge would be much nicer for the cost of the room. Our room was small with a very large bed that had posts at the foot of the bed that were in the way. We were not there with children but we could see how they could get hurt on those things. We had to remember they were there and walk around them. Also, one of the towel racks just fell off the wall and the shower head broke after the third day we were there. JUNKY, not high quality. Add to all of this that the shower curtain was full of mold on the day we checked in and had to be immediately replaced. What's wrong with this picture? Isn't Disney resorts supposed to be the best? The food at Artist Point was expensive and not very good either. We ordered salmon and asked to it to be cooked medium and they served it raw. We sent it back and then they overcooked it. It took them over an hour to serve us the food and it still wasn't cooked right! We won't be going back. Try a different resort if your going to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 4 night stay at the Wilderness Lodge. In my opinion, its ok but doesn't live up to the hype. Our two main problems were the transportation around the parks, and the noise levels inside the hotel. I guess it depends on where your room is. We requested a Woods View, which is one upgrade from a standard. Our room was in the main building, on the sixth floor. The floors open to the lobby below. There's a restaurant located off one side of the lobby called Whispering Canyon. Well, it was anything but Whispering. The restaurant is open from about 7:30 am 'till 11 pm. There's a constant din from there. They have childrens' games, singing, etc., and the noise carried right up to our sixth floor room. I know it sounds incredible, but believe me, its true! The restaurant itself is not enclosed by windows, walls, etc., so its essentially a part of the lobby. I mean, the noise was incredible! We wanted to sleep in to about 9-10 am (we were on vacation), but were awakened every morning by the clamor from that place. I've read excellent things about this hotel and was very disappointed in our experience. I suppose if we were located in another section it would have been better, however, they were filled up and couldn't transfer us. The room itself was so small as to be a joke. There was barely enough room for 2 queen beds, and just a small tv amoire with three small drawers and a tiny three drawer chest, plus a hobbit-hole closet. All that for four people. The transportation from this hotel was inadequate, to say the least. They have a system of busses and boats, but it seemed we always needed to take at least two busses or bus/boat to get to where we were going. Coming back was worse--it took 1.5 hours to get from MGM back to the Wilderness Lodge! We got so frustrated with the transportation system we ended up using (and paying!) for taxis just to get around without spending all day to do it. I found the service and attitude of the hotel to be indifferent and lacking. It took 50 minutes to check us in, and there was no line, no one in front or behind us. Not even an apology for the excessive wait. If it took 50 minutes to check everyone in, and there was a line, some people would spend their entire vacation waiting in line. To top it off, we had housekeeping knocking on our door every morning at 8 am, despite the DND sign. Apparently they didn't think the sign applied to them. The lobby was decorated nicely for Christmas, however, I wouldn't plan a vacation stay around that. There are definitely other places in DisneyWorld for about the same price that are more convenient and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “In Love”
Reviews.Author: Laurie H
Reviews.Content: Love the theming, the rooms, the restaurants, the pool, the view, the boats to MK, the ambiance, the huge X-mas tree in the lobby, the staff, the sound of the geyser and bubbling fountains. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Magical at Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Ej412
Reviews.Content: Any vacation to Disney World is filled with tired kids parents alike. What a treat to retreat to the Wilderness Lodge. It is a wonderful boat ride to the Magic Kingdom, which the kids loved. It is truly beautiful. THe staff was wonderful. The pool was a bit crazy-hard to keep track of 3 kids the way it is set up. The rooms were perfect. We had bunk beds and a comfty queen. We had a family reuinion which I set up through Travelocity. Recommended 3 rooms right next to eachother, and actully got it! There were rocking chairs in the hallway overlooking the lodge, so we could chat out there after dinner. We have stayed at many Disney resorts. THis one is terrific. I did see some crabby vacationers-you see that everywhere. If you are looking for a dreamy place for you kids to enjoy Disney-this is it! Forget about the money once you check in. It's Disney World-Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth it and Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerTX
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 days at the Wilderness Lodge for Thanksgiving and was very disappointed at the quality of rooms and service of the hotel. The rooms are not very big and the bathrooms were old, in need of updating and had some small bugs in one room. Staff was seemed overworked and not very frieldly as if they were doing you a favor by speaking to you. Whispering Canyon Cafe is very over rated, expensive and quality of food not worth the money. Our waiter seemed to want to be anywhere but dealing with guests and children. Best thing about the hotel was the pool and hot tub, but that ended up being closed one night b/c of an electrical malfunction.... My recommendation is to save the $$ and take a tour.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: butsey
Reviews.Content: Just returned on Saturday vacationed w/my daughter and her family, We were on the 4th floor they were a few doors away. Wilderness Lodge was not my choice I would have picked somewhere else to go (Beach Club or Grand Floridian) were my choices but my daughter picked this hotel for our grandson. It was a great choice! The beds were the best I have ever slept in so were the pillows. It is not for everyone but if you are going w/children it's great. The rooms were immaculate they even left little animals made from washcloths. The service was great every call to the front desk ended w/Have a magical day!!! We are not Disney World people we like to go tropical beaches and do nothing but this was absolutely great going w/our grandson he loved it and so did we. Of course I need another vacation to recover from this one but I am so glad we did it.

Reviews.Title: “Disney geeks loved it”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Audrey
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have annual passes to Disney World and he surprised me with two nights at the Wilderness Lodge for my birthday in mid-October. It was such a pleasant stay. We had a room on the 5th floor toward the end of the hallway and it had a wonderful view of the pool, the lake and beyond. We were up early and watched the sunrise both mornings. The room was very comfortable and we really enjoyed staying there. It's just enough away from the hustle and bustle that you do feel that you are on vacation! Maybe a few more minutes to take a boat or bus than to be on the monorail line but I would definitely say it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge Needs Some Renovations!!”
Reviews.Author: NonGratis
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day trip to Disney World and stayed at the Wilderness Lodge. My husband & I stayed there back in 1997 before we were married and it was the most beautiful resort I had ever stayed in. Coming back 7 years later, I have to say I was a bit dissapointed. Still has the gorgeous, cozy lobby, but our room was no better than your standard motel room. The knobs on the bathroom sinks looks old & cruddy and had pieces missing, the shower curtain had a mold spot on it and one of the rings was broken, the sinks looked like they were 20 years old, and some of the tiles in the shower were moldy. Our room was really small, too. They used to have lush landscaping out by the waterfall area, but not anymore. Just not what I remembered from our last trip to the lodge! The only luxury thing about this hotel is the lobby. We waited 35 minutes for a bus to Epcot before giving up and taking a boat to the Magic Kingdom. I love the boat service - we never waited more than 10 minutes. Roaring Forks is outrageously overpriced. It cost me over $10 for a cup of tea, 2 tiny boxes of cereal and a cup of milk. I will definitely come back to this resort once it has undergone some updated renovations. Next trip we will stay at the Grand Floridian or the Animal Kingdom Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jp68
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Disney as a family. We have gone when my children were 3 and 5, 5 and 7 and now when they are 7 and 9. We have stayed at the contemporary, the caribbean beach resort and now the wilderness lodge. We arrived early and got to choose from several available rooms in the courtyard view category room that we had booked. Our room was on the 4th floor with absolutley stunning views of the pool and bay lake. We were able to see the electric water pageant from our balcony perfectly, and even had a decent glimpse of the magic kingdom fireworks at night. The lobby is the most architecturally beautiful one that I have ever seen. You really feel as if you are in a national park somewhere, not on disney property. The rooms are smaller than the other deluxe hotels, but are more than adequate. The resort has a boat launch to the magic kingdom and we never had a wait. We also enjoyed the whispering canyon cafe with the kids! It was a blast! The pool was also beautiful and we got to rent a canopy boat and cruise the lake. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I will never stay anywhere else on Disney property again!! Just Go!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great public areas, poor bedroom”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The public areas of the hotel are good, great pool and magnificent lobby. The bedrooms let the hotel down and are not what you would expect from what Disney calls a "Luxury resort". For a start the rooms are small and cramped. There was no bedside table on my side of the bed and I had to drag over one of the chairs to use. The rooms are little better than a motel. The bathroom is also small and cramped and the toiletries are nothing great. Service in the hotel wasn't particularly great either. If you want to stop on Disney property then this hotel is probably an okay choice, but you will get a much better standard of accomodation for your money if you go off-site.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge for 3 nights beginning Sept 29, 2004. This hotel is magnificent. Our accomodations were rescheduled due to Hurricane Jeanne. Our room had plenty of space for 3 adults and one child. The bathrooms were clean, towels neat, bed tidy. We had a woods view which was awesome. We felt as if we were in the Western part of the US. We had a private balcony, double sink, hair dryer, color tv and two chairs and table to relax in the room. The lobby was breathtaking! The totem polls, plenty of sitting areas and the bubbling brook/stream from inside the lobby which dumps into the pool is beautiful. I will be back with my family! This was my first stay inside the theme park and I will never stay outside the Disney resorts again! The maids were timely and the bell & concierge staff was friendly and helpful with questions about getting transportation to and from the hotel. The ferry boat ride was fabulous during the day. The night ferry boat ride was spectacular because the captain stopped for all of us to enjoy the fire works! Disney ROCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely themed”
Reviews.Author: Outstanding-raters
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lodge for one week in August and had a great time. It was our first trip to Mickey's world so before going I poured over this web site and books to decide where to stay. Despite what previous reviewers have said about their favorite hotels, WDW uses formulas, they are basically very similar. The key to happiness in Mickey's world is to remember that all of the hotels are illusions-the Grand Floridian is a pretend upscale hotel, the Wilderness lodge is a pretend woodsy lodge, etc-so there are not huge differences across the hotels within category-base the decision on where you (or your kids) think it would be most fun to pretend to be-tropics, africa, etc. None, for instance, are as upscale as you might expect given the cost-none triple sheet, for instance-- if you want the real upscale hotel simulated by the Grand Floridian you should try the JW Marriott a few miles away-For theme-ing though, the onsite hotels are great-- the Wilderness, Animal, Polynesian, etc. . We stayed for half the trip here and half off site. We visited almost all the on site hotels. On site advantages include wonderfully themed lobbies (rooms tend to be ho hum) earlier openings to the parks, free delivery service of purchases to the hotel, easy mobility between parks and hotels (none of the buses. boats, monorails take much time), high kid-friendliness, wonderful pools. Also, if you purchase a plastic drink cup at the start of your visit in the hotel, you can have free (soft drinks/coffee/cocoa) refills (at your particular lodge-not others) for the duration. On the minus side, the WDW is designed to ensure that all your money stays with Disney-you are sort of trapped-staff do not happily inform you about resources/stores/services outside WDW (bring your own liquor). And, if you are used to the JW or Ritz, this is not that. At the Wilderness, the food selection was limited and, except for the cafe, was hardy. We found that the delux hotels tended to have a cafe, an expensive restaurant and a more relaxed restaurant specializing in food matched to theme one price "all you can eat" sort of fare (not great if you tend to split entres, as we do). The pool was wonderful but we also pool hopped (not endorsed by WDW) and found some of the others to be even better. Some of the moderately priced hotels (not deluxe) had better food selection and food courts-better for small eaters. Another key is to BARTER ALWAYS-when you make the reservation and once you arrive (do you have anything nicer for that price?)-even later if you want to move up (we'd like to move to the court yard pool view?). Look at a guide book for hints about the best rooms in a given hotel. When you arrive, ask if they can move you up (or over) Depending upon who you get and how patient they are, you can end up with a highly desirable view at a lower price. We ended up with a nice view but, in reality, we only looked at the view a few times the entire week-how much was that worth? Also, try to book tickets before you go-once you are on property they've gottha and discounts are scarce.-unless you are computer equipped.

Reviews.Title: “loved it went back got married there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my now wife went to the wilderness lodge back in 1999 and then we went back and got married there in 2003.We have been going to Disney for the past nine years and have stayed in quite a few of the disney hotels,we can say without a doubt this is by far the best.From the time you walk into the lobby and have your breath taken away to the way you are treated like royalty by the staff there is nothing you can fault about the lodge,and if you ever stay in any of the value or moderate hotels you see the diference in the service.Me and my wife loved it so much we went there in 2003 and got married they couldn't have treated us better we will defintely be going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wilderness Lodge - a slight disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the resort for three nights in late August. I agree with one traveller's comment that this resort needs some renovation. Our woodsview room was on the 4th floor. When we first arrived, we noticed some old face clothes/towels were left on the bathroom floor. The carpet was not well cleaned or vacuumed. We had to call the maintenance department several times to fix our T.V. (no sound) and hair dryer (due to loose parts). Even the laundry facility was unavailable at times due to repairs needed to be done. I ordered a mini-fridge for my room on the first night, but it never showed up. My worst experience was the 45 minutes that it took for me to get registered when I arrived, as well as the regular noise that my family heard from the supposedly "Whispering Canyons" Restaurant downstairs. The only good aspects that we enjoyed were: the swimming pool (with its fun slide), the free parking, the fireworks at the Magic Kingdom we could see from our room, and the decor in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: cpisarski
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a six night stay at the Wilderness Lodge. I can honestly say this is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at. The theming was amazing, and the lobby was incredible. I could stare at it all day. When we arrived I didnt like our original room (only because it was on the first floor). The people at the front desk took care of it within minutes and we were in a room on the 5th floor with a woods view. The view was lovely, and it was very quite on this side of the lodge. The lodge is busy at all hours. You will always find people sitting in the lobby relaxing or out in the pools. The pool areas were so beautiful, the water runs from the lobby out to the pool. It is lovely to look at. The hot tubs were large and worked very well. Our room was kept very clean, and the air conditioning was perfect. Florida is horribly hot in August, but our room always felt cool and comfortable. Housekeeping keeps the room clean and even leaves little towels in the shape of animals in the room for you. The light fixtures, walls, carpeting, restuarants etc...all have a wonderful wilderness theme. We rented a boat a bay lake and drove around and admired the lodge from the lake. We had such a wonderful stay. There is constant transportation to the parks from the lodge, so it is easy to get around. This resort is amazing for children too. There is so much for them to do. The whispering canyon restaurant is very kid friendly. I do not have children yet, but will bring them here one day. This resort can be enjoyed by couples or families! It is one of Disney's best! I can not wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at The Wilderness Lodge Aug. 7-14th 2004. We found it to be very friendly, warm and welcoming as well as clean. It was very much worth the money. We paid extra to have concierge service, it is worth it if you plan on eating at all times they have food out which is around morning, mid afternoon and a late afternoon dinner. They don't provide whole meals but definately enough if you want a light dinner or snack. They also turn down your bed for you, as well as clean and keep you fully stocked with towels. We were there at the time Hurricane Charley passed through. The staff kept us informed as to the current weather conditions and such so that way we were not in the dark. We were on the 7th floor and felt very safe. Overall this hotel is incredible and when I return to DisneyWorld I will definately be back to the Wilderness Lodge. If you have specific questions please feel free to email me, I know what its like to not know what your getting into with a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: quakerquisp
Reviews.Content: Here is the deal, this resort was fantastic just got back august 7 stayed 7 nights. The hotel is beautiful from start to finish the lobby is breathtaking, the pool was great and the rooms were comfy and clean what more do you need complaints of it being in need of maintenance is silly any hotel you stay at needs some repair, but the way the staff makes you feel out weighs the wallpaper that might be peeling. The "Welcome Home" greeeting you receive every night puts a smile on your face. If transportation is an issue rent a car we did you are in disney spend the money. My recommendation utilize the roaring forks cafe. One last thing if you want a full balcony they seem to be facing the pool the others were partial. Go you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “In need of better maintenance”
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the hotel. Found it to be the most poorly maintained of all the Disney properties that we have stayed at. We were on the 6th floor. Room furniture was pretty scuffed, some bathtub tiles were moldy, top railing on bunk bed was loose!!, etc. Overall feeling of "not very clean". This goes for the outside areas of the hotel as well. The hotel just appears to be in need of refurbishment. Overall it just felt shabby for what is supposed to be a top of the line Disney property. After going to Animal Kingdom last year, which we found spectacular, this one we were disappointed with.

Reviews.Title: “Our best stay at a Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Wilderness Lodge for our honeymoon. It was the most fantastic vacation hotel we have ever stayed at. We have been to Disney more times than I can count, and have stayed at all the moderate resorts. That is usually all the level of service I require: a clean bed, nice ambience, quiet area, and fun pool. But the WL takes it a step further. We were given a room on the 5th floor overlooking the pool and lake. It was very quiet, relaxing, clean and, yes, romantic. We sat on the balcony during the rainy hours and just listened to the rain fall. You will find a few complaints on here about the lodge but we didn't experience any of that. I agree sometimes the transportation can be difficult. But, there is always more than one way to skin a cat. If you have a car, drive sometimes! I almost always drive to Downtown Disney or other resorts for dinner. It is usually faster and more convenient. The boat ride to the Magic Kingdom and Contemporary also are speedy and convenient. The Whispering Canyon is the best value for your money for breakfast. You get more than you can eat, great entertainment, immediate service. OK, so if I have to have one complaint, I will make it a minor one. The parking lot is too large, with many of the close spaces reserved for valet. But, of course, if you have no plans on even seeing a car during your stay, it really doesn't matter. If you want to have an unbelievable time at Disney and want a little more in your resort, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful experience from the moment we arrived until checkout. We stayed five nights during July 2004. Upon arrival we were greeted with a warm "Welcome Home" from the bell staff then proceeded to check-in. The specific room we had requested was unavailable, but they had upgraded us to a courtyard/lake view room anyway. The room was very comfortable for family of four (two small children) and decorated in the style of the entire hotel a rustic western lodge theme. Staying at the hotel was a vacation on its own. The kids loved the water slide at the pool and the hourly geyser eruption, I think they had as much fun at the hotel swimming, boating (water mouse), and biking (surrey bikes), as they did at the Magic Kingdom. Even the lobby kept them entertained (eg: bridge over brook in lobby, railroad handcar to climb on, t.v. with cartoons 24 hours a day, lincoln logs table at restaurant entrance). Whispering Canyon is a blast for dinner and the food was great. The Roaring Forks(counter service) was an easy, affordable and comfortable place to get snacks and meals on the go (gets a little busy first thing in the morning though). The main lodge lobby is breathtaking and it was alot of fun just to explore and find quiet areas to hang out after a long tiring day around "the World". We stayed at the Beach Club last summer and loved it there (very convenient location if visiting Epcot) and were worried that we would not enjoy any other disney resort as much. We decided to try Wilderness Lodge this year because we were planning to go only to the Magic Kingdom and wanted to be close by. Now I think we will probably never stay anywhere besides the Wilderness Lodge when going to Disney World. Transportation to and from Magic Kingdom was easy via boat and other areas were accessible via bus. Fort Wilderness has alot to offer also and is easy to get to via boat, bus or even bike rental. They have a petting zoo, nightly marshmallow roast/outdoor movie and it's also the location of the HoopDeeDoo Revue dinner show. I can't say enough good things about this Hotel experience, it's a very laid back, relaxing environment (soothing "wilderness music" plays throughout), top notch resort. We're already planning our next trip and can't wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for relaxing after a day in the parks”
Reviews.Author: lbbbb
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Wilderness Lodge twice. The first time was November 2001 and the second was September 2003. We love this hotel! Last September we requested a room over the lobby so that first thing each morning we stepped out of our room to hear all the wonderful sounds and smells coming from the lobby. At night we could see the fire works at MK from our balcony. Our room was kept very clean and my boys got a surprise each day with either a towel animal or their own stuffed animals arranged in amusing groupings. My boys love the pool at the Wilderness Lodge and could stay around the pool each and every day if we let them. The service as been impecable both visits and the longest we've every waited for a bus was 20 minutes for a bus to Epcot on a busy night. Other than that we have found the bus waits to generally be less than 10 minutes. The boat to MK and the Contemporary hotel is relaxing and scenic and we've never waited for more than 5 minutes for a boat. We've eaten at Whispering Canyon and Roaring Forks several times and enjoy both. This is a great hotel if you want to feel like your away from all the hustle and bustle of the parks at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Get Sick”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Donâ€™t stay at a Walt Disney World resort if there is even the slightest possibility you could get sick. On the last evening of our weeklong stay at the Wilderness Lodge, I came down with a bad case of food poisoning. No doubt from the food at the hotel and Walt Disney World. Unable to leave at the scheduled checkout time, the hotel charged me for a full day (over $200 U.S.) even though we were out of the room by 4:30 p.m. When I asked for a refund, the refused saying they needed a stool sample to refund my money. If you do go to Walt Disney World DO NOT STAY at their resorts!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there June 22-27th. We spent the bucks and upgraded ourselves to the concierge level and it was well worth it! This hotel is majestic! The service was excellent,we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wilderness Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week in August of 2003. From the moment you walk in.. this hotel screams of warmth, charm, and relaxation. The staff was wonderful and the grounds are nice too. The pool area isn't too big but if your doing Disney and the other theme parks then you won't be spending too much time at your hotel anyway. The rooms I would say are above average but nothing to brag about. I was blown away by the coziness and charm when I first walked in. The lobby and the decor of the hotel is very nice. I would definately stay at this hotel again. There are shuttles running all the time to any of the major theme parks and they are FREE! lol The arcade in this hotel was a fun feature and I was really happy they had a little store.. I would give this hotel 4 1/2 stars out of 5. It's a beautiful place! If your looking for something with more activities and you don't plan on going to the theme parks.. I also would recommend the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress... I stayed there for five days and never left the property.. there are so many things to do! Check it out too.. PS I am very picky.. so trust me.. You'll love it here! =c)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the finest resort at Disney. We have stayed at several, but this was our first time here and it was wonderful. Get a room facing the pool. I could go on and on about how wonderful it is, but you need to experience this one for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: Shalloola
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Wilderness Lodge a couple of years ago. It was our family's first Disney vacation and it was spectacular! Upon first arriving, the exterior of the Lodge is lovely and the lobby is breathtaking with it's floor to ceiling fireplace and wooden planks and carvings (find the hidden mickey's). The hotel staff were incredibly accomodating and friendly and our kids (3,4) had a great time. The rooms were impeccably kept and the washclothes made into animals and such (angels, dogs, rabbits, etc) and left on the pillows were a special touch (great cleaning staff). The children were amazed with all there was to see and do on the resort grounds (as were we). If I had to mention anything that was on the "down-side" it would have to be the transportation by bus. It's not as convenient as having the mono-rail at your front door, but it was still very much "on-time" and seemed to run quite often. It's not really much of a "down-side" issue. The Lodge is a beautiful hotel and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best there is!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This summer will be my family's eighth year in a row to visit Walt Disney World. For all of those years we have only stayed in the Wilderness Lodge. The moment you walk into the breathtaking lobby filled with comfort, warmth, and of course magic, you will know that this is the right hotel. When you sit to eat and laugh at the Whispering Canyon Cafe, you will always leave happy and full. The guest rooms are spacious and nicely appointed. The views of the pool are excellent! Transportation to anywhere in Disney is convenient and easy. There is one problem. If you stay in the Wilderness Lodge, you may not want to leave it to go to the parks. It is an attraction in itslef. The pool area and the boats are always fun to have. If you are going to stay in Disney World, and your budget permits it, stay at the Wilderness Lodge! I guarantee you will absolutely love it. Hope to see you there!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first stay (May 23-27, 2004) on Disney property and we loved this hotel...Everything was very well maintained and clean, staff very helpful and the grounds are beautiful. My 5 year old daughter actually cried on our last night there, she wanted to move in and stay forever! Last trip we stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Orlando..would pick this Lodge over the Ritz any day!! The bunkbeds were great and dining options very flexible.

Reviews.Title: “Still the one!”
Reviews.Author: Mary97370
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a six night stay at WDW (May 8-14). I first stayed at this hotel just months after it opened. It's as impressive now as it was then. The front desk clerk was cheerful and accomodating even though the hotel was full. The rooms were very clean and in good shape with the exception of some wear on the table. The maids left animals on the bed made from the washclothes. Disney transportation worked great.

Reviews.Title: “Should be #1 on this list!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay and what more can be said about this awesome resort. No other hotel can match the true theme of a northern lodge as well as the excellent quality you get from a Disney hotel. Everything was super clean, the grounds were immaculate, service excellent, food (although pricey) was consistently great, and the beds were super comfortable. Stayed in many on and off property hotels and this one has always been #1 for our family. Do yourself the favor, pay a little more for this resort and you and your family will definitely not be sorry!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 5/7-5/15/2004”
Reviews.Author: bitirish
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Wilderness Lodge and have to say we had a wonderful time. I read alot before I went and yes the rooms are smaller than Port Orleans, but the atmosphere was fantastic! We stayted in room 2110 and were close to everything.. the lobby, the pool, the store and even the buses.. I loved that you could hope on a boat and be at Magic Kingdom's gates.. no other transportation to take but your own two feet.. that was great. We also visted Fort Wilderness which was only a boat ride away. I have to say that this hotel has been one of the best that I have visited... there was only a couple things wrong.. there was just a bit of wall paper coming off (hardly noticeable) and one of the sinks were not working, but was fixed upon request. My 7 yr old want to go back to the Wilderness Lodge Next time and I agree!!

Reviews.Title: “Lack of food options :(”
Reviews.Author: caddi123
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, great view. Dining options were not as good though. One restuarant closed for awhile in between meals which meant you had to eat pizza or hot dogs, etc. at the fast food place. Room service shut down also during day! Nothing to eat for my son who stayed at the room because of illness! For the prices they charge they should offer better than that. Probably won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Disney does it again. Takes you into another world....this time into a real lodge. Just like if you were up north and not in florida. I was blown away by the lobby which is HUGE. The decor inside and out. The pool area is also nice...but the rooms,WOW. The space in each room is great. The decor is again...very Lodge type. Your only a small boat ride to the Magic Kigndom or take a bus to any of the other parks. Food is great. They have a 24 hour cafe with GREAT and very cheap foods. Chicken fingers, hot dogs, deli sandwiches, and other fast foods which taste great after a long day at a park. Service is perfect and all employees (aka cast members) treat you as a special guest! Worth the money to stay....all views again are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, lots of little kids”
Reviews.Author: swatts1
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at the WL in October in two rooms. The rooms are very nice, though small. They are certainly well kept and had a small balcony. The hotel is lovely, especially the lobby. Due to the size of the lobby it can be a bit loud if there are many guests. The grounds were very nice also. My main complaint was with transportation. Boat transportation to and from the Magic Kingdom was very difficult and took FOREVER. Luckily we had a rental car! I found this hotel to be too remote. They need a walking path to the Contemporary so people don't have to line up for the slow ferries. I've been to Disney 20 times and always stay on property, but probably wouldn't stay here again due to the remoteness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drysdaleo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Disney hotels and Wilderness Lodge was great overall. Last week of January, we had a 1 bedroom suite which was clean. The lobby is one of the best they have. If you have small kids, take them to the Whispeing Canyon to eat - good food good time. Very quiet - you don't feel like you are 100 yards from the castle. The best was the nightly electric parade on the lake. Nice family place.

Reviews.Title: “wilderness lodge is beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wilderness Lodge, and it was an absolutely wonderful expierience! The staff was very nice, the hotel was beautiful, the room was great; it was an all around great time. It is so close to Disney, unlike some of the other hotels. The view was amazing from the dock, it looked like you were in another state. I highly recommend staying at the Wilderness Lodge!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. From the moment you step into the lobby you feel the amazing atmosphere this theming creates. The rooms are small, but nice and comfortable, and the pool is realy different from any pool I had seen before. The view fron the pool area is absolutely amazing. If you are planning to go to Disney, be assured this is one of the best hotels in the Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “Leaking roof 2 - and laundry room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I too stayed at the Wilderness Lodge in early December 2003. It was good to see that another guest experienced the leaking roof - it really was good to walk under an internal watrfall!. The wet floors were like an ice rink if caught at the wrong time - and battling with the closed doors from the outside was worse than sitting in the barge on splash mountain. Also during my stay I attempted to do some laundry in the laundry room. I was amazed that there were only four usable washing machines to cope with a hotel that had over 728 rooms (not counting the people who came in from the Wilderness Villas to use the amenities). The confrontations between guests fighting for the machines was amusing, but I could understand the frustration. I too experienced dusty rooms - I do not blame the house keeping staff, but rather the cut backs that were noticed both in the hotel and in the Parks. The staff in the hotel were very polite, and did all they could to ensure that everyone had a good holiday, and despite all of the above, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Leaking Roofs & Peeling Wall Paper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived 4th dec 2003 for 14 nights & what a start. It took 1 hour to check in & on reaching one of the rooms the key wouldn't open the door so back we went for another key. The peeling wall paper in both rooms is not in keeping with a delux resort. A strange brown stain on one of the walls & gathering dust over the 14 days this was really impressive. But the best was still to come when it rained not only was the waterfall impresive on the outside the one coming through the roof was just about as good & the doors tied together with towels,plastic tape &other means along with towels around the doors to stop water from gaining entry as well as the guests was a really nice touch ! The lobby maybe impressive but the rest needs alot more work.This is my 17th visit & must be the worst Disney must do better.

Reviews.Title: “All We Needed Was Snow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. This was our first trip in 20 years to WDW, and our first with our children (8 & 9). From the moment we walked into the lobby of the Lodge, we were all overwhelmed by the atmosphere and beauty of this resort. The lobby itself is simply incredible - soaring ceilings with tall log supports, totem poles, comfortable & cozy furniture, one of a kind fireplace - I could go on and on. Of course, Disney's service was superior; the staff seemed to know how not to intrude on your experience, yet be available for any need to be met.The accomodations were typical Disney - small and functional. But the decor fit in with the lodge feel of the resort, and the balcony view over Otter Pond was pleasant. The rooms could have been a little larger for my taste, but we spent so little time there that it was not inconvenient. I really would like to try a suite, next time.The special charm of Wilderness Lodge is what really sells the resort. I've never enjoyed myself in a hotel as much as I did there. Hanging out in the lobby, shopping at the Mercantile, or having a rowdy time in the Canyon (don't pass up the shakes!), all made the experience captivating. We highly recommend the experience.
